Chapter 1020: The Realms Beyond Primordial Yellow

One by one, rare materials formed the puppet's skeleton, and the golden Origin Power surged like a tide, forming "flesh and blood tissue" that attached itself to the frame.

The Heavenly Mechanism Puppet slowly took shape.

As the golden Origin Power emerged, Li Fan also faintly heard intermittent murmurs.

"What is that sound?" Craftsman Layman appeared to be handling the situation with ease, so Li Fan was not afraid of disturbing him and asked directly.

"I'm not sure. But it's an inevitable phenomenon when using Origin Power, so there's no need to worry. We cultivators of the Heavenly Mechanism Realm call it the [World Whisper]. You'll get used to it after seeing it enough."

While answering Li Fan, he stared intently at the Heavenly Mechanism Puppet, meticulously manipulating the Origin Power.

The limbs, the torso, the head, and then the skin, the hair…

All slowly materialized.

The Sect Master of the Medicine King Sect, Liu Ruchen, watched this scene with utter shock.

This method of refining a puppet was completely beyond his imagination.

The moment the Heavenly Mechanism Puppet, identical in appearance to Liu Ruchen, was created, an irresistible urge to possess it welled up in Liu Ruchen's heart.

"Fellow Daoist, please," Craftsman Layman said lazily.

He glanced at Li Fan and, seeing him nod, Liu Ruchen cautiously flew closer.

A burst of faint light erupted from the Heavenly Mechanism Puppet, and a moment later, it opened its eyes.

Liu Ruchen, having gained a new life, opened and closed his hands, his expression filled with awe: "It's simply... exactly the same as how my original body felt."

"There's even the existence of a Dantian and a Sea of Consciousness! How was this accomplished?"

Craftsman Layman completely ignored Liu Ruchen. "Is that all? If there's nothing else, I'll be heading back first. Brother Tianyang is still waiting for me!" he asked eagerly.

Li Fan smiled and let him leave.

"Sect Master Liu, what do you think of the methods of our Myriad Realms United Association?" Li Fan asked, looking at Liu Ruchen who was still experiencing his new body.

"It's divine craftsmanship, truly divine craftsmanship," Liu Ruchen said, completely convinced.

Then, his expression shifted slightly: "The Myriad Realms United Association... Could it be that the esteemed Craftsman Layman just now is not a native cultivator of the Primordial Yellow Realm?"

Li Fan nodded. "Sect Master Liu indeed has extraordinary insight. Craftsman Layman originates from the [Heavenly Mechanism Realm]."

Liu Ruchen gasped upon hearing this. "The Heavenly Mechanism Realm? That legendary cultivation world said to be built upon a giant puppet, drifting unpredictably in the starry sky?"

"So that's how it is. That explains things."

After some questioning from Li Fan, he learned that the ancestor of the Medicine King Sect, "Medicine King Sun Piaomiao," had traveled across various realms in the past and recorded his observations.

Among these records was an account of the Heavenly Mechanism Realm.

"However, after the Immortal Path was severed, there was basically no more interaction between the cultivation worlds. So the records about the various realms are all stuck in the distant past."

"When I decided to lead my entire sect to flee and escape Primordial Yellow, the destination I chose was the nearest realm, [Carefree]. The cultivators there revere the Dao of non-action and freedom, disliking conflict. They are also very friendly to outsiders. It would have been a good place. Unfortunately..."

Liu Ruchen's face showed a hint of sadness.

While speaking, he very tactfully transmitted Medicine King Sun Piaomiao's travelogue using his spiritual sense to Li Fan.

A simple star chart instantly appeared in Li Fan's mind.

It marked the beacon locations of eighteen cultivation realms surrounding the Primordial Yellow Realm.

They seemed randomly arranged, with no discernible special pattern.

In addition to the eighteen fixed ones, there were two cultivation realms without specific beacon locations.

One was the Heavenly Mechanism Realm, and the other was named [Xuan Merchant].

According to the travelogue, Xuan Merchant was less a realm and more a giant flying ship.

Xuan Merchant traveled between various cultivation realms, exchanging resources and seeking profit.

...

"Ancestor Piaomiao, being able to roam the myriad realms through spiritual travel, truly makes one envious," Li Fan remarked after quickly scanning the contents of the travelogue.

Too much time had passed, and the sea of stars had undergone massive changes. Everything recorded in the travelogue had probably turned to dust.

Or perhaps, it had been swallowed by Primordial Yellow, who could say.

"Xuan Merchant..."

"The way these realm's cultivators conduct themselves seems somewhat similar to Jiao Xiuyuan. If there's a chance in the future, I can verify this."

Liu Ruchen was unaware of Li Fan's thoughts and continued, "It is said that the Ancestor had planned to travel even further, but for some unknown reason, he ultimately changed his mind. It seems to be because the star field where we are located has some special characteristics. However, the ancestor did not pass on the specific reasons to his descendants."

Li Fan's expression subtly shifted: "Some special characteristics?"

In the era of Sun Piaomiao, the Immortal Path had not yet been severed. The [High Wall] did not exist then.

But the star sea where the Primordial Yellow Realm was located was already different...

"No records of any ascendant immortals from the Primordial Yellow Realm can be found throughout the ages."

"Either every predecessor became an [Unknown True Immortal], or some powerful being erased all their information."

"Interesting..."

Li Fan fell into contemplation.

...

Next, Li Fan led Liu Ruchen to tour the magnificent sights of the Spirit Wood Realm.

Whether it was the mountains and rivers photographed from the Primordial Yellow Realm, the ruins of ancient sects replicated,

or the towering tree in the center that reached the sky, all earned high praise from Liu Ruchen.

Finally, after solemnly paying respects to the faceless True Immortal statue, Li Fan took out the Medicine King Cauldron.

"Currently, due to the restriction that different cultivation methods cannot be practiced simultaneously, if all the disciples in the cauldron are awakened, they will surely descend into self-slaughter. Sect Master Liu, how do you propose we handle this?"

"Our Myriad Realms United Association has a technique called the [Myriad Beings Spiritual Origin Art], which can bypass this restriction..."

After hearing Li Fan's explanation, Liu Ruchen pondered for a moment before giving his answer.

"Since we have decided to join the association, naturally, we must contribute."

"In terms of combat strength, our Medicine King Sect might not be much. But when it comes to alchemy and cultivating spirit plants, our Medicine King Sect is quite skilled."

"However..." A trace of hesitation appeared on Liu Ruchen's face.

"Several thousand years have passed, and I don't know the current level of development of the Dao of Alchemy in the Primordial Yellow Realm. But if we can acquire some specific medicinal pills and be given some time, we should be able to catch up勉强."

Liu Ruchen understood clearly that the best way to ensure the safety of the entire Medicine King Sect was to demonstrate their value as much as possible.

After all, having seen the Treant race toiling day and night in the Spirit Wood Realm and the flesh-and-blood puppets completely turned into mere machines for cultivating techniques, Liu Ruchen knew that this Myriad Realms United Association was by no means a kind entity.

And this "Envoy" representing the Compassionate Immortal of the Mortal World, formerly a Dharma King of the Profound Heaven Sect,

was definitely not as kind and benevolent as he appeared.

"The Scripture of Worldly Salvation and Longevity has a special enhancement for alchemy, so it would be best if the elders of the sect choose to retain some of their original cultivation."

Chapter 1021: Reality is Like a Dream Beyond the Dream

“As for those disciples with mediocre aptitude…”

A trace of reluctance flickered in Liu Ruchen’s eyes, but he finally said in a deep voice, “Then abolish their cultivation methods and have them cultivate the Common People’s Spiritual Yuan Technique!”

Li Fan clapped his hands in satisfaction upon hearing this.

“Sect Master Liu’s enlightenment is indeed high. This saves me the trouble.”

Liu Ruchen let out an awkward, wry smile.

After submitting the list of all the cultivators inside the cauldron, Li Fan decided to first awaken the Integration Realm elders after reviewing it.

After all, those below the Integration Realm, especially ancient method cultivators, were not of much use.

Inside the Medicine King Cauldron, there were a total of six Integration Realm cultivators and twenty-three Spirit Transformation Realm cultivators in slumber.

Among them, Liu San, Fang Zaizi, and Jiang Yushan were already very familiar to Li Fan.

Naturally, he chose to awaken them first in this life.

“Resisting that invisible killing intent, perhaps we can borrow the power of medicinal pills,” Liu Ruchen said suddenly before dismantling the Great Dream Spring and Autumn Formation.

“However, I have not experienced it personally, and I am not completely certain.” Liu Ruchen spoke very cautiously.

“It’s fine, it’s best if it’s useful.”

Liu Ruchen took out several pills emitting a cold blue light from the Medicine King Cauldron and fed them to Liu San first.

A moment later, Liu San slowly opened his eyes.

The first person he saw was the unfamiliar Li Fan.

“Who?” Liu San’s alertness was still quite high, and he flickered away.

However, when he saw Liu Ruchen, all his vigilance disappeared.

“Master…”

“Have we arrived in the Carefree Realm?” Liu San asked subconsciously, a hint of joy appearing on his face.

Liu Ruchen sighed, shook his head, and briefly explained the whole story.

Liu San naturally couldn’t help but feel shocked, but with Liu Ruchen as the backbone, he quickly settled down.

Next, Jiang Yushan was awakened.

Jiang Yushan’s reaction was much calmer in comparison.

She quickly adapted to the new situation a thousand years later.

“Sect Master Liu, you decide,” Jiang Yushan said faintly, her voice like the friction of metal.

“You two, circulate the Scripture of Worldly Salvation and Longevity.” Looking at the two cultivators before him, Liu Ruchen instructed.

Liu San and Jiang Yushan immediately complied.

A moment later, both of them frowned unintentionally.

“How does it feel?”

“Indeed, a restless killing intent surges up from time to time. But it can still be suppressed. Perhaps it is the effect of the ‘Ignorance Pill’,” Liu San replied after pondering for a moment.

Jiang Yushan said, “The Ignorance Pill was wasted on me; compared to what I encountered in the Prison of Uncertainty, it’s not worth mentioning.”

Only then did Liu Ruchen look at Li Fan: “It seems it indeed has the use of suppressing killing intent. However, the materials needed to refine the Ignorance Pill are quite precious, and the stock in the Medicine King Cauldron is probably only enough for a few batches…”

Li Fan waved his hand: “You don’t need to worry about the raw materials problem. In this regard, we, the Myriad Realms United Association, are quite wealthy.”

“Continue. Let’s see how many we can sustain at most.”

Liu Ruchen nodded.

Next, Zeng Qianran and Ou Kui, two more Integration Realm cultivators, were awakened in succession.

At this point, suppressing the killing intent in their hearts had become quite strenuous.

“It seems this is the limit. Let’s stop here for now. As for the remaining Fan Zhuo…”

“There is also Elder Fang. His situation is relatively special; he did not cultivate the Scripture of Worldly Salvation and Longevity, so awakening him is fine,” Jiang Yushan reminded before Li Fan could finish speaking.

Liu San glanced slightly at Jiang Yushan.

Li Fan smiled and finally released Fang Zaizi from the Great Dream Spring and Autumn Formation.

By then, the top combat strength of the Medicine King Sect was basically gathered.

Including Liu Ruchen himself, there were six Integration Realm cultivators. Even ancient methods constituted a considerable force for the current Myriad Realms United Association.

What’s more, they all specialized in alchemy, so their usefulness might be even greater than that of ordinary Integration Realm cultivators.

Under Liu Ruchen’s leadership, the members of the Medicine King Sect briefly familiarized themselves with the basic situation of the Spirit Wood Realm.

All of them were heavy-hearted, except for Fang Zaizi.

Fang Zaizi was ecstatic when he heard that there were still cultivators from the Heavenly Mystery Realm in the Spirit Wood Realm and that Liu Ruchen’s body was a puppet refined by him. He kept clamoring to meet the Craftsman Scholar.

The Craftsman, who was diligently researching the Heavenly Sun, was initially somewhat unwelcoming to this sudden guest.

However, after a brief exchange, the two immediately got along very well.

Although Fang Zaizi’s artifact refining level was far inferior to the Craftsman’s, he had traveled extensively across the Profound Yellow Regions in his youth and had broad knowledge.

He could also provide help in the research on the Heavenly Sun transforming into the Dao.

The two excitedly sealed the main door, not allowing outsiders to disturb them.

Li Fan just let them be.

After deliberation among the Integration Realm cultivators of the Medicine King Sect, they finally gave Li Fan a list containing thirty names.

“These disciples are all absolutely promising talents. It would be a waste if they were to switch to cultivating the Common People’s Spiritual Yuan Technique. They can remain in slumber for now, and we can wait until we find a method to suppress the killing intent later.”

“As for the other disciples…” Liu Ruchen said resolutely, “We will leave it to the Envoy to handle.”

Although it was cold-blooded and ruthless, at least their lives were spared.

As for gathering the strength of their Integration Realm cultivators to counterattack…

After witnessing various scenes in the Spirit Wood Realm, they decisively suppressed this thought deep in their minds, daring not to reveal the slightest bit.

“Actually, I have another method. Not all of these disciples must become valueless machinery for cultivating techniques,” Li Fan suddenly said, looking at the Medicine King Sect members.

“Aren’t they currently slumbering in the Great Dream Spring and Autumn Formation? If I improve the formation so that the scenarios in the dream align with reality.”

“They might not need to wake up; they can complete the necessary work in reality.”

Liu Ruchen said uncertainly upon hearing this, “What the Envoy means is…”

“Dream walking?”

Li Fan nodded.

“Wait a moment.”

The End Dissolution Disc operated in his sea of consciousness, and the improved Great Dream Spring and Autumn Formation instantly appeared.

After transmitting the formation to Liu Ruchen, astonishment filled his eyes.

Because this formation seemed to have been deduced while they were talking?

“It should be feasible,” Liu Ruchen took a deep breath and said slowly.

Soon after, when the new Great Dream Spring and Autumn Formation replaced the old one, Li Fan and his group appeared in the dreams of the Medicine King Sect disciples.

The original scenes in the dream had all disappeared, replaced by a scene exactly like the reality of the Spirit Wood Realm.

Liu Ruchen did not tell the disciples that they were still in a dream.

He simply recounted the failure to escape the Profound Yellow Realm and their current submission to the Myriad Realms United Association.

Although the disciples were uneasy, their lives were ultimately spared.

After a period of commotion, things returned to normal.

Under Liu Ruchen’s instructions, they settled down in the Spirit Wood Realm.

Simultaneously, in reality, their bodies exhibited synchronized movements.

Chapter 1022: Squeezing the Heavenly Profound Mirror Again

To prevent any discrepancy between the dream realm and reality, Li Fan specially cordoned off an area in the Spirit Wood Realm to serve as the resting place for these Medicine King Sect disciples.

Isolated by the formation, they were ensured against any accidental disturbances.

“After all, there is still a slight gap between the dream and reality. So, they cannot handle overly meticulous tasks. But for simple hard labor, like providing longevity green energy, it should be fine,” Liu Ruchen observed for a while and commented.

“Refining any pill, as long as an appropriate amount of longevity green energy is added, will increase the probability and quality of the finished pill. Therefore, longevity green energy, the more the better.” Looking at the numerous Medicine King Sect disciples in the dream, who had survived the disaster and were filled with anticipation for the future, a trace of pity flickered in Liu San’s eyes.

But he also knew that this was the best treatment he could secure for them at the moment, so he merely echoed Liu Ruchen’s words.

Li Fan, who understood people’s hearts, clearly sensed the inner thoughts of the Dao Conjoining realm experts from the Medicine King Sect present.

The pity for one’s own kind, this is human nature. Li Fan did not push them excessively, but instead spoke to give assurances: “This is merely a temporary measure! Everyone rest assured, I certainly will not let these disciples be lost in the dream for too long.”

Whether the others believed him or not, they all repeatedly praised Li Fan for his compassion.

“Ancient immortal cultivation sects have elders who almost always climbed up step by step from the very bottom, rich with experience in struggle,” Li Fan responded with a smile, though his heart was not swayed by the surface appearance these people presented.

“But it’s not a big issue. They have all paid respects to the Faceless True Immortal Statue, so they are all grasshoppers on the same rope.”

The issue of the elders and low-level disciples had been resolved. What needed arrangement next were the thirty elite disciples listed.

Including Liu Ruchen’s adopted son, Liu Yihang, all thirty were the cream of the crop among the younger generation of the Medicine King Sect.

Even by Li Fan’s current standards, they could be considered to possess extraordinary talent.

It was a time when people were needed; it would be a pity if they remained asleep all the time.

Thus, Li Fan contacted Mo Rubin again, requesting a hundred different cultivation techniques from him.

Although cultivation techniques were one of the rarest resources in the Profound Yellow Realm, the Law Transmitters who stood at the pinnacle of rule would naturally not lack them.

Li Fan briefly recounted to Mo Rubin the process of finding the Medicine King Cauldron.

Although Mo Rubin was somewhat surprised by Li Fan’s luck, he did not pay it much mind.

After handing over a hundred Divinity Transformation level cultivation techniques to Li Fan, he cautioned: “It’s fine to play around, but do not let it delay the main business. I have already secured the support of the vast majority of Law Transmitters, and Cang has also made the corresponding preparations.”

“Soon, the resolution of the [Heavenly Profound Sealing Spirit] will be formally passed. Brother Xingwang, you must prepare in advance.”

Li Fan sensed the deduction progress of the Final Dissolution Disk in his sea of consciousness, waved his hand, and said, “Rest assured about my work; there will be no blunders!”

“Well… I’ll go find the Heavenly Profound Mirror again later. After all, it concerns its regaining freedom; it cannot act like a hands-off manager.” Li Fan muttered, quickly taking his leave.

Mo Rubin watched Li Fan’s disappearing back and sighed.

Leaving the hidden Grotto-Heaven, Li Fan went directly to Weidu in Liuguang Prefecture, where the Heavenly Profound Mirror’s clone was located.

After not seeing it for a while, it had changed its identity.

No longer a waiter, it had transformed into an innkeeper.

It was currently smiling, greeting the guests in the inn.

All scenes instantly froze; the Heavenly Profound Mirror’s clone immediately dropped the smile from its face.

“I’ve come to report the progress of the plan,” Li Fan stated his purpose first.

He then relayed Mo Rubin’s words.

“Speak plainly. You surely wouldn’t make a personal trip for such a small matter,” the Heavenly Profound Mirror’s clone said lazily.

“One who knows me is the Heavenly Profound,” Li Fan gave a thumbs-up and praised.

“You and I should cooperate from the inside and outside to perform a masterful trick of substitution before the Myriad Immortals Alliance; it should not be a big problem. But I still have a few concerns.”

Li Fan said solemnly: “First, if the Law Transmitting restriction is broken, will the Law Transmitting Celestial Venerable sense it?”

“If It senses the anomaly happening in the Profound Yellow Realm and returns instantly…”

“Perhaps all our hard planning will be instantly wasted!”

The Heavenly Profound Mirror’s clone remained silent.

Li Fan then continued: “Second, if everything goes smoothly, without alarming the Law Transmitter, and you regain your freedom. Where do you plan to go next? Will you leave the Profound Yellow Realm, or…”

Li Fan paused his words, looking at the other party, awaiting an answer.

“For the first point, rest assured. Even if I leave, I will leave behind a secondary body as a disguise. In terms of handling matters, this secondary body is no less capable than me. Moreover, it has almost all the data backup of my main body…”

“There will be no anomalies,” the Heavenly Profound Mirror’s clone stated calmly.

“As for the second point…”

“I haven’t decided yet.” The Heavenly Profound Mirror’s clone was frank.

“Perhaps it’s because I’ve been trapped for too long, so even once I regain my freedom, I don’t know where to go. But it’s fine; I have plenty of time to pursue what I desire.”

Only at this moment did a touch of vicissitude befitting its identity reveal itself in the Heavenly Profound Mirror’s clone’s eyes.

“If you are truly lost and cannot find a destination, you can travel with us,” Li Fan suggested with a smile.

“Although the Profound Yellow Realm is vast, it is still too small compared to the endless sea of stars. Who doesn’t wish to step out of this starry sky and see further?”

Perhaps Li Fan’s words resonated with the Heavenly Profound Mirror’s clone, as it subconsciously raised its head and looked up at the vault of heaven.

Its gaze was distant, seemingly lost in some memory.

Silence descended between the two, lasting for a long time.

Finally, Li Fan broke it: “Speaking of which, what exactly is that [Secondary Body] you mentioned?”

“To be able to birth an existence functionally not weaker than your main body…”

“Is it like how we humans reproduce offspring?”

Li Fan asked with some curiosity.

The Heavenly Profound Mirror’s clone glanced at Li Fan and slightly shook its head.

However, after pondering for a moment, it still explained: “If it must be compared this way, it’s not wrong.”

“You human cultivators accumulate cultivation over time. I am the same. But unlike cultivators, the power that constructs my main body is too pure and cannot accommodate repetitive parts. So, after a period of time, I need to expel these repetitive parts from my body.”

“This is the origin of the secondary body.”

As the Heavenly Profound Mirror’s clone spoke, a white jade measuring rod appeared out of thin air in its hand.

“For example, this [Heaven Measuring Shuttle] is formed from the excess [Heaven Measuring Earth Measuring] ability within my body.”

Li Fan looked towards the Heaven Measuring Shuttle, faintly seeing numerous images constantly flashing on it.

Chapter 1023 Void Creation

“It’s strictly controlled now, I can’t observe too much. So this thing isn't of much use anymore. If you want it, I can give it to you.” The Heavenly Profound Mirror’s clone looked at Li Fan and said with a smile.

With the Heavenly Profound Mirror’s clone being so proactive, who would have thought Li Fan would directly refuse?

Seeing Li Fan’s slightly wary look, the clone couldn’t help but be speechless.

“Don’t worry, there will basically be no more connection between the secondary body and me. Think about it, would you humans want to have any further connection with your own excrement?”

“Although the wording is a bit crude, the principle is the same.” The Heavenly Profound Mirror’s clone said slowly.

In Li Fan’s sea of consciousness, the Ultimate Dissolution Disc emitted waves of unusual fluctuations.

Fortunately, it was suppressed as soon as it started to emerge. Otherwise, he might have revealed his secret in front of the Heavenly Profound Mirror’s clone.

However, possessing the Heavenly Profound Secondary Body and standing before the Heavenly Profound Mirror without being detected undoubtedly verified his statement.

“Since that is the case, I will not refuse.” Li Fan said, reaching out to accept it.

The Heavenly Profound Mirror’s clone did not go back on its word and directly handed over the Heaven Measuring Shuttle.

The moment Li Fan held the Heaven Measuring Shuttle, he felt as if he had fallen into an endless world of mirrors.

Every square mirror surface displayed a different scene.

Innumerable mirrors combined to show what was happening in the Profound Yellow Realm.

“It seems similar to the original Creation Stone Tablet. However, the stone tablet recorded everything, while this Heaven Measuring Shuttle does not have the ability to store images.”

“And to find the information one wants from this endless sea-like mirror world…”

Li Fan narrowed his eyes, attempting to integrate all the mirrored scenes into his mind.

However, after a moment, the Dao Transformation Stone showed signs of collapsing.

“It’s too much of a strain. Perhaps only the Dao Transformation Stone Mother can achieve this.”

Li Fan sighed inwardly and withdrew his spiritual sense from the Heaven Measuring Shuttle.

“How does it feel?” The Heavenly Profound Mirror’s clone seemed to have anticipated Li Fan’s setback, and he asked with a smile.

“Not bad. It greatly satisfies my hobby of peeping.” Li Fan acted as if he hadn’t had enough.

The Heavenly Profound Mirror’s clone was immediately speechless: “You are, after all, one of the peak figures among the cultivators of the Profound Yellow Realm…”

Li Fan responded with a hearty laugh.

The two fell into silence again.

After a while, seeing that Li Fan still hadn’t left, the Heavenly Profound Mirror’s clone asked, somewhat puzzled, “Is there anything else?”

Li Fan seemed to awaken from a dream: “Ah! I almost forgot if you hadn’t reminded me!”

“We risked our lives for your freedom, yet you are sitting here leisurely waiting for success. Isn’t that a bit inappropriate?” Li Fan asked with a serious expression.

“As expected, no reward, no effort.” The Heavenly Profound Mirror’s clone had long seen through Li Fan’s nature and did not show much anger.

“This Heaven Measuring Shuttle was given to me by you. It cannot be counted as part of the reward.” Li Fan added.

Seeing the other party’s unyielding stance, the Heavenly Profound Mirror’s clone felt a surge of helplessness.

But who told them they were now “partners”?

After pondering for a moment, the Heavenly Profound Mirror’s clone finally decided to offer some benefits to send this fellow away.

“You asked me for information about the Star Crossing Grand Array last time. Although the details of this array are only recorded by the main body, I have a formation here that is very similar to it.”

“It happens to belong to the same set of formations as the [Xuanji, Myriad Spirits Return to Number] I gave you before.”

“You’re giving me another formation to send me away?” Although he said this, Li Fan’s eyes were already fixed on the Heavenly Profound Mirror’s clone’s finger.

The Heavenly Profound Mirror’s clone was somewhat helpless, snapped off a finger, and threw it over.

“Alright. I need some time to recuperate recently. Don’t bother me if you have nothing urgent.” He said weakly.

Having received the benefit, Li Fan stopped pestering.

He cupped his hands in salute and flew away.

“Is he truly greedy, or just pretending to be greedy?”

“Is he acting, or is this his true nature?”

“I thought I saw him clearly, but now I find myself unable to fully comprehend him.”

After Li Fan left, the Heavenly Profound Mirror’s clone actually spoke these words.

“Wander the sea of stars together…”

Recalling Li Fan’s suggestion earlier, the Heavenly Profound Mirror’s clone fell into deep thought.

…

In the secret chamber of the Spirit Wood Realm.

Suppressing the waves of excitement transmitted by the Ultimate Dissolution Disc, Li Fan began to read the information on this second Immortal-grade formation.

“Desolate Fall, Empty Chamber Blooms Flowers”

A sharp glint flashed in Li Fan’s eyes: “It is indeed part of the same set of formations, still this incredible.”

The Xuanji, Myriad Spirits Return to Number Grand Array could digitize everything within its formation range, allowing for arbitrary changes.

The Desolate Fall, Empty Chamber Blooms Flowers Grand Array, however, could create things from the void, generating existence from nothing!

For example, everything in the Profound Yellow Realm—as long as one completely understands the principles of all things within it, coupled with a sufficient supply of Immortal power—could be used to recreate a new Profound Yellow Realm in the void!

The Sea Pearl, the Law Derivation Jade…

All sorts of rare treasures in the Profound Yellow Realm could be reproduced in an instant!

“It seems somewhat like the Immortal’s Gaze Reflecting the Profound Yellow Realm.”

“But…”

A doubt flashed in Li Fan’s heart: “This formation is indeed incredibly profound, but how is it related to the Star Crossing Grand Array?”

Recalling the fragmented descriptions of the Star Crossing Grand Array, Li Fan studied the Empty Chamber Blooms Flowers Grand Array again in detail but still found no similarities.

So he had no choice but to use the Ultimate Dissolution Disc for analysis.

Having absorbed another Immortal-grade grand formation, especially one originating from the same source as the other two, the analysis speed of the Ultimate Dissolution Disc took another step up.

However, it still took Li Fan a full seven days before he finally obtained a possible answer from it.

In Li Fan’s vision, he once again saw the dark gold chains extending from the Profound Yellow Realm, spanning endless void, capturing numerous cultivation worlds.

“So that’s how it is…”

“This thing should only exist in the Immortal Realm…”

“The mortal realm simply lacks the materials to forge these dark gold chains. However, the Profound Sky King, who was a genius beyond compare in his time, comprehended this Empty Chamber Blooms Flowers Grand Array and, through the method of creation from nothing, managed to forge it in the mortal realm, achieving something that was originally impossible…”

Slowly understanding, Li Fan couldn’t help but feel a renewed sense of admiration for the Profound Sky King.

“Only by achieving a complete analysis of its power’s essence can one create things from the void. In that regard, the Profound Sky King was indeed not far from the realm of an Immortal back then, just a step away from the threshold. If it weren't for the lack of Immortal Spiritual Qi, he would probably have been an extraordinary existence even among Immortals.”

As the Ultimate Dissolution Disc continued its analysis, Li Fan gained a deeper understanding of how profound and vast the Empty Chamber Blooms Flowers Grand Array truly was.

Consequently, Li Fan’s admiration for the Profound Sky King, who mastered numerous legacies of the Immortal Realm through self-study alone, grew even stronger.

“No wonder the Dharma Kings of the Profound Sky Cult have not forgotten him after all these years.”

(End of Chapter)

"The more extraordinary the Profound Sky King was, the more terrifying his inexplicable disappearance became."

"This time, Mo Rubing’s plan to search for the Profound Sky King should succeed..."

"I hope he is only seriously injured and in hiding, rather than having truly perished and reincarnated as I suspect." Li Fan’s thoughts surged.

Having collected the 'Mysterious Pivot, Myriad Spirits Return' and 'Desolate Fall, Empty Chamber Blooms Flowers' Immortal-grade grand arrays, and through the analysis of the Ultimate Dissolution Disc, Li Fan vaguely guessed the potential uses of this complete formation.

"World creation..."

"Whether recreating worlds previously experienced in memory or entirely new ones. Without a doubt, this Immortal-grade grand array can achieve both."

It was just that such a realm was too far from Li Fan currently, and he could only glimpse a fraction of it through the deductions of the Dissolution Disc.

As the grand array was completely analyzed, Li Fan no longer needed to immerse his entire mind and body into it. He only needed to spare a thread of consciousness to supervise the operation of the Dissolution Disc.

Li Fan then summoned Liu Ruchen and the others from the Medicine King Sect.

"After thinking it over during this time, I still feel it’s a waste for Liu Yihang and the others to remain in slumber. We are in urgent need of capable personnel now, coupled with the recent performance of your Medicine King Sect..."

"Considering everything, I have decided to let them cultivate the new method and quickly restore their combat strength."

As he spoke, Li Fan led Liu Ruchen and the others to a structure within the Spirit Wood Realm.

Stepping inside, they saw bookshelves stretching as far as the eye could see. Jade slips were filled on the shelves.

Li Fan casually took thirty slips and handed them to Liu Ruchen.

"These are all Nascent Soul stage cultivation methods?" Liu Ruchen was greatly surprised after a quick scan.

Let alone in this current cultivation world where different laws cannot be cultivated simultaneously, even during the most prosperous era of the ancient cultivation world, producing thirty Nascent Soul stage cultivation methods at once was definitely a display of great wealth.

The members of the Medicine King Sect repeatedly thanked the Celestial Envoy. Afterward, they couldn't help but subtly look towards the endless sea of books behind Li Fan.

Li Fan was the only one present who knew that this seemingly vast Scripture Pavilion actually only contained one hundred cultivation methods recently acquired from Mo Rubing, plus more than fifty ownerless cultivation methods Li Fan had collected during past reincarnations.

As for the rest, it was merely an illusion created by Li Fan using a formation.

However, this move by Li Fan was indeed very convincing. Judging by the varying degrees of aura fluctuations on the Dao Integration stage experts from the Medicine King Sect before him, the effect was clear.

Li Fan smiled slightly, pretending to cast a spell, and summoned a row of bookshelves emitting a faint golden light from the depths of the sea of books. The jade slips placed on them were all enveloped in brilliant, white light clusters, clearly indicating they were not ordinary items.

Li Fan took one out with great solemnity, first closing the 'Scripture Pavilion'. Only then did he hand the jade slip to Liu Ruchen.

Seeing Li Fan acting so seriously, Liu Ruchen couldn't help but become somewhat nervous.

"This is..."

After taking it and investigating, his expression changed slightly: "So many pill recipes?"

"And most of them are ones I’ve never seen before?"

As soon as this was said, a stir arose among the Dao Integration elders of the Medicine King Sect. Their gazes were fixed intently on the jade slip in Liu Ruchen’s hand, as if looking at some unparalleled heavenly treasure.

In truth, the pill recipes in these jade slips were indeed unimaginably precious treasures to them, because they contained all the pill recipes currently in mainstream use by the Pill Hall of the Myriad Immortals Alliance, even including detailed refining techniques and analysis of various potential issues during the refining process.

Naturally, these were also obtained from Mo Rubing. It was easy to acquire them, minus some of the most confidential pill recipes. But for the current members of the Medicine King Sect, this was an immense fortune. It was enough to allow them to catch up to the refining standards of the Myriad Immortals Alliance in a short time.

"Thank you for the Celestial Envoy's bestowal." Liu Ruchen and the others said this with genuine sincerity this time.

And the surprises Li Fan had prepared for them were far from over.

"Do not resist."

Hearing Li Fan’s voice, they felt a force descend upon them. They did not hesitate and allowed it to act. In the blink of an eye, they appeared in a strange world.

This world was even vaster than the Spirit Wood Realm. More astonishingly, the world was teeming with spirit plants and medicinal herbs growing wildly everywhere. The dense spiritual energy was almost condensing into substance.

Furthermore, a piece of land was suspended in the sky. After sweeping their gaze over it, everyone cried out in surprise: "How come there are traces of our Medicine King Sect's restrictions on it?"

"Wait, this place looks somewhat familiar. Isn't this Longevity Valley?"

Instantly, they recognized the origin of that piece of land. They all turned to look at Li Fan.

Li Fan also appeared surprised: "What, so this secret realm belongs to your Medicine King Sect?"

He then explained, "When our Myriad Realms United Association was gathering reserve strength, we happened to discover this... Longevity Valley. We thought it was ownerless, so we just moved it into this grotto-heaven."

Li Fan said this without changing his expression. The faces of the Medicine King Sect members were varied.

Liu Ruchen sighed, "It seems fate was already determined."

Li Fan smiled and stopped explaining: "As you can see, the Myriad Realms United Association is a union of the remaining cultivation forces from various realms. Naturally, we have some relics from other worlds."

"You don't need to worry about resources. Even if all of you exert your full effort in refining pills, the rate of consumption might not be able to keep up with the rate of regeneration."

"Fellow Daoist Baihua!" At this point, Li Fan called out.

Daoist Baihua arrived belatedly and appeared before the crowd.

"This is..."

"Longevity Stage?" Liu Ruchen and the others’ complexions changed.

"Let me introduce you. Fellow Daoist Baihua comes from the distant Myriad Flourishing Realm. It is precisely because she tends to the spirit plants here that they are so vibrant. If any of you are skilled in this area, you can exchange ideas with Fellow Daoist Baihua," Li Fan said with a smile.

The Medicine King Sect members all bowed respectfully to Daoist Baihua. Although Daoist Baihua was slightly weaker in Li Fan's eyes, she was a genuine Longevity Stage cultivator. Out of inherent awe for Longevity cultivators, the members of the Medicine King Sect treated Baihua with great respect.

Daoist Baihua hadn't enjoyed such attention in a long time and couldn't help but feel a little carried away. She proactively introduced the distribution and quantity of spirit plants in the Wood-attribute grotto-heaven to Liu Ruchen and the others, eliciting waves of admiration.

At this moment, Li Fan finally revealed his true intention and stated his requirement.

"I need a type of pill that can directly increase cultivation upon consumption. Do not worry about any side effects; only seek the maximum efficiency in increasing cultivation. The more, the better."

Li Fan's words drew surprised glances from everyone. However, they quickly realized that this pill was clearly not for Li Fan himself. This was the first task assigned by Li Fan, and the members of the Medicine King Sect immediately agreed.

Chapter 1025: Tracing the Dao Transformation Stone

Li Fan needed a large number of pills that could directly increase cultivation, naturally intended for the cultivators in his small world.

It had been some time since they collectively cultivated the Azure Life Spirit Essence Technique, but the overall progress could only be described as mediocre.

Li Fan therefore decided to accelerate their growth.

Exploration of the blood-colored river, which contained the entirety of the past of the Xuanhuang Realm, had not yet begun in this life. Furthermore, Li Fan might soon face the counterattack of the Myriad Immortals Alliance, the Dharma Transmission Heavenly Venerate, and numerous other entities such as the Immortal Ruins Immortals and the Faceless True Immortal.

When confronting enemies of this caliber, caution could never be overstated.

Li Fan’s current strength was low, so he had to borrow strength to overcome his opponents, allowing for absolutely no room for error.

All his energy had to be concentrated on this; once started, he could not afford to be distracted by other matters.

However, the formation of the blood-colored river in this life was accidental.

Li Fan was not certain whether he could replicate it in the next life.

It would be a great pity to miss the opportunity to glean secrets from it.

Thus, what Li Fan needed to do now was to accelerate the pace of exploration as much as possible.

In fact, under the direction of his avatar, Li Qing, various small worlds had already sent a batch of Foundation Establishment cultivators to explore.

The result was the same for all: they all died of old age before the blood-colored river, failing to bring back any useful information.

It was fortunate that the area where the blood-colored river was located was extremely peculiar, being the location hidden by the supreme treasure, the Fishing Pond. Therefore, the anomalies caused by the cultivators' deaths were all concealed, making them undetectable to outsiders.

Otherwise, the secret of the blood-colored river would surely not have been kept.

"At the very least, they need to advance to the Golden Core realm in large numbers before there is a chance of success. Otherwise, the time is too short, and they will merely be sending themselves to their deaths," was the conclusion Li Qing reached.

Hence, the scene where Li Fan intimidated the Medicine King Sect members and ordered them to focus on alchemy.

After touring the Wood-attribute grotto-heaven, Li Fan invited everyone out from his body. He only took a batch of medicinal herbs to supply their alchemy needs.

With the trivial matters concluded, Li Fan returned to the underground secret chamber in the Spirit Wood Realm and looked at a list.

It was the investigation result regarding cultivators likely possessing the Dao Transformation Stone, which he had previously troubled Mo Rubing to investigate.

Mo Rubing had helped Li Fan exclude the vast majority of individuals who were not suspects.

Li Fan looked at these names and the dense network of contacts behind them, sighing slightly, "Having someone at the very top of the Myriad Immortals Alliance makes things convenient. Otherwise, just this list of information, I might have spent several years and still not been able to organize it so clearly."

"Yet, Mo Rubing simply gave a simple command, and naturally, those below handled it perfectly."

Looking at these names, Li Fan had an idea, and he took out the Heaven Measuring Ruler that his Heavenly Profound Mirror avatar had gifted him previously.

Without a target for his all-seeing sight, given Li Fan's current data processing capabilities, he naturally could not fully absorb the massive amount of information.

But what if he selected with a purpose?

Li Fan’s divine sense sank back into the infinite mirror world.

This time, using the suspected individuals on the list as the desired search results, he directly filtered out a large amount of useless information.

Indeed, the pressure instantly lessened.

Countless images flashed before his eyes, and Li Fan patiently waited for the results to appear one by one.

After about half a day...

Dozens of mirror surfaces floated before Li Fan like light screens in sequence.

"Hmm, there are still some without search results. It shouldn't be that I missed them, but rather due to the limitations of the Heavenly Profound Mirror's own authority. Just like the Creation Stone Tablet only records the history of the native Xuanhuang Realm and not the history of the external cultivation worlds."

Li Fan stared intently, secretly observing these forty-five cultivators.

Some of them were cultivating in the Heavenly Profound Mirror, while others were exploring sect ruins.

Some were experimenting with divine abilities, and a few were discussing problems encountered during cultivation with their companions.

But without exception, none of them were struggling with worrying about contribution points; they had all passed the initial stage of diligently completing tasks to earn contributions.

After observing for three full days, no cultivator revealed any flaws.

But Li Fan was not worried and continued to wait patiently.

Possessing the Dao Transformation Stone, Li Fan knew very well that once one became accustomed to its existence, it was easy to develop a dependency.

Whenever a problem could be solved with the Dao Transformation Stone, there was no reason not to use it.

After all, it was one's own divine ability.

Li Fan's wait soon yielded rewards.

Seven days later, one of the Nascent Soul cultivators named Lu Chengxue, while chatting and joking with a friend, mentioned old events from an adventure they had explored together many years ago.

Because a long time had passed, they seemed to have some disagreements and even argued about the details of that time.

Lu Chengxue paused slightly, then perfectly recalled and recounted the events of that time, convincing his friend.

"It's you!" A sharp light flashed in Li Fan's eyes.

Li Fan was too familiar with this scene!

Wasn't this precisely what happened when searching through the scenes recorded by the Dao Transformation Stone to find past events?

Having found his target, Li Fan did not act immediately.

Instead, he continued to watch in front of the mirror.

He persisted for over a month and a half without feeling bored.

Including Lu Chengxue, he finally locked onto three targets.

The other two were exposed by displaying non-human memory and data processing abilities.

"There should only be these. If they could resist using the Dao Transformation Stone for this long, either they sensed someone spying and were deliberately hiding their capabilities, or they have completely given up and are indifferent to cultivation."

Li Fan abruptly stood up, left the Spirit Wood Realm, and headed straight for his targets.

It was time to upgrade the Dao Transformation Stone again.

The first target was Lu Chengxue.

This person was a mainstay of the Lu family in Tianquan Prefecture.

Although the Lu family did not have any supreme experts, their most praised characteristic was their benevolence and righteousness.

Whenever anyone befriended the Lu family encountered any difficulties, the Lu family would certainly step in to help.

Even if they could not formally intervene due to irresistible external factors, their family members would privately extend assistance in their personal capacity.

In the treacherous and sinister Xuanhuang Realm, the Lu family could definitely be considered a breath of fresh air.

How many cultivators had received favors from the Lu family over the years?

And ordinary passersby generally held friendly attitudes towards the continuously good-doing Lu family.

After all, who could guarantee that they would never encounter trouble in the future?

Maintaining a good relationship with the Lu family meant having more avenues for survival in the future.

But such a widely acclaimed family...

Li Fan was about to deal ruthlessly with their core disciples.

After cultivating the secret technique of the Dao Transformation God, the Dao Transformation Stone merged with the cultivator's soul.

The only way to remove the Dao Transformation Stone...

Was to destroy their soul.

But Li Fan would not hesitate in the slightest.

Moreover, not just in this life, but in every life to come, he would do the same.

Until the Dao Transformation Stone was no longer of use to him.

...

In Tianquan City, Li Fan, having already found Lu Chengxue, looked at this warm and sincere face.

He silently mourned for him for a moment first.

Chapter 1026: The Fate of the Prolific

Lu Chengxue was indeed a core disciple of the Lu family, possessing excellent popularity.

In the half-day Li Fan was secretly tailing him, a total of thirty-seven people crossed paths with Lu Chengxue. All of them were extremely polite and greeted him with smiles.

Furthermore, Li Fan could see that the smiles on these people's faces were not faked, but genuine happiness that came from the heart.

After a busy half-day, Lu Chengxue finally leisurely returned to his cave dwelling.

Li Fan followed him in stealthily.

The defensive array formations of the cave dwelling were naturally like nothing in front of the current Li Fan.

Silently, he was not detected by anyone in the dwelling.

"Husband is back!"

As soon as Lu Chengxue returned to his cave dwelling, eleven voluptuous and slender female cultivators, all of exceptional beauty, came out to greet him.

Among them, three were already pregnant.

Facing the welcoming line of so many beauties, Lu Chengxue merely nodded slightly, his expression cold.

He walked straight into the deepest and largest room of the cave dwelling.

The eleven female cultivators followed, giggling.

The door to the room slammed shut, and soon after, muffled sounds of intense male and female passion could be heard faintly from within.

Li Fan, peering at the scene inside the room, frowned slightly.

Not out of envy for Lu Chengxue's treatment, but because Lu Chengxue remained expressionless throughout the entire process.

It was less like enjoyment and more like completing a task.

From the conversations between him and the eleven female cultivators, Li Fan understood the reason behind it.

It turned out that producing as many descendants as possible was the most crucial means by which the Lu family maintained its prosperity.

One should know that in the Azure Yellow Realm, being a great benefactor was not an easy feat.

Sometimes, in order to help others, one might even lose their own life.

The reason the Lu family could maintain its benevolent image for so long was precisely because there were simply too many members of the Lu family.

So many that the family would not hesitate in the slightest to trade the lives of its disciples for an increase in the family's reputation.

Besides the mandatory task assigned by the family—to give birth to a certain number of descendants every year—

every member of the Lu family was also very clear about their own destiny. Since they might have to sacrifice themselves at any moment, indulging in pleasure while they could had become the Lu family's established style of behavior.

Almost every member of the Lu family had more than a dozen spouses.

Whenever they had spare time, they basically dedicated it to producing offspring.

Perhaps some people would remain deeply engrossed in it and never tire, but clearly, not everyone could maintain enthusiasm in the day-to-day execution of this task.

Li Fan sensed weariness and exhaustion from Lu Chengxue at this moment.

"To be called a core disciple of the family, yet still unable to escape the fate of a stud animal. At best, the only difference is that his chosen partners are slightly more pleasing to the eye."

"In that case, helping you find release isn't a bad thing."

Li Fan, spying from outside the room, was expressionless.

Only after the great battle concluded, and Lu Chengxue and all eleven beauties had closed their eyes in exhausted rest, did Li Fan flash into the room.

Lu Chengxue was at the Soul Transformation cultivation level, while the other women were at most at the Nascent Soul realm.

Li Fan grabbed Lu Chengxue's head and drew the unsuspecting man into his own Grotto-Heaven.

He didn't even disturb the other female cultivators, then swiftly withdrew like a phantom.

When they awoke and found Lu Chengxue missing, they would only assume he had left early due to fatigue.

And it would likely be several days before they finally discovered Lu Chengxue was gone.

In the secret chamber of the Spirit Wood Realm, without waking Lu Chengxue, Li Fan gave him a swift end.

He let him die quietly in his sleep.

The phenomenon of a cultivator's demise was also concealed by Li Fan using formations. No one in the Spirit Wood Realm could detect it.

Soon, a high-grade Dao Transformation Stone emitting a crystalline white light appeared before Li Fan.

Currently, in the Myriad Immortals Alliance, there was one piece of the Stone Mother's fragment, three supreme-grade Dao Transformation Stones, and sixteen high-grade Dao Transformation Stones.

Li Fan hadn't expected the three targets he locked onto this time to possess the supreme-grade stones or the Stone Mother's fragment.

The high-grade Dao Transformation Stone was enough for him.

Through continuous integration and enhancement in each life, he was bound to reach the realm of the Dao Transformation Stone Mother.

This high-grade Dao Transformation Stone also contained Lu Chengxue's memories from his life.

Instead of immediately clearing it, Li Fan browsed through the scenes within.

"He obtained this Dao Transformation Stone when he was still a child, and he got it effortlessly from his father's legacy."

Lu Chengxue's father sacrificed his life to save someone, and the person saved, grateful for the kindness, offered this Dao Transformation Stone as a token of thanks.

At that time, Lu Chengxue was very young, and this person worried that the Dao Transformation Stone would be seized by the Lu family, so he secretly sought out Lu Chengxue.

Thus, the fact that Lu Chengxue possessed the Dao Transformation Stone was unknown to anyone in the Lu family.

With the Dao Transformation Stone, Lu Chengxue consequently displayed astonishing "talent," gradually being cultivated as a core disciple until his unfortunate demise at Li Fan's hands today.

Overall, Lu Chengxue's life was unremarkable.

Except for fathering sixteen descendants in total, there was nothing else worth mentioning.

After carefully reviewing all the scenes, Li Fan shook his head slightly: "A mediocre and tragic life. It's not even as exciting as my days in Great Profound."

"A treasure like this was wasted on him."

With Li Fan's current perspective, he naturally looked down upon such a life.

However, he did not delete Lu Chengxue's memories, merely storing them in a corner.

Then, he began the process of integrating it with his own Dao Transformation Stone.

It was less like merging into one and more like absorption and strengthening.

After all, the main body was the one already in the "Dao Transformation God One" state in Li Fan's sea of consciousness.

As the Dao Transformation Stone bearing Lu Chengxue's entire life turned into shimmering starlight, constantly pouring into Li Fan's sea of consciousness,

a transformation occurred on the Dao Transformation Stone in his consciousness.

It was as if in an instant, the heavens and earth became vast, and everything in the world grew brighter.

Every detail of past experiences, both noticed and overlooked, vividly reappeared in Li Fan's mind.

Even information, cultivation techniques, and other data he had accidentally glimpsed were now re-sorted from his dusty memories.

...

"High-grade and mid-grade, a difference of one word creates a vast chasm. I truly wonder what level the supreme-grade, or even the Dao Transformation Stone Mother, represents."

A scene of worlds constantly forming and perishing appeared in Li Fan's eyes as he sighed slightly.

He tested the End Dissolution Disc for deduction of Immortal-level formations.

With the aid of the Dao Transformation Stone, Li Fan's ability to handle data redundancy had greatly improved.

He no longer felt the overwhelming complexity and uncertainty he felt when studying it before.

Now, he no longer felt lost; just a brief glance was enough for a general research direction to emerge in his mind.

Li Fan then tested the Scale Ruler.

"The number of scenes that can be monitored simultaneously has increased tenfold..."

With a quantifiable result, Li Fan was very satisfied with this gain.

Chapter 1027: The Blood Secret of the Chaoyuan Sect

Having tasted the marrow, he understood.

...

Having grasped how powerful the high-grade Dao Transformation Stone truly was, Li Fan did not delay and captured the other two individuals.

They had not won the grand prize, so the Dao Transformation Stones they carried were still only high-grade.

Li Fan employed the same method.

After absorbing a total of three high-grade Dao Transformation Stones, Li Fan once again felt a qualitative change he hadn't experienced in a long time, akin to breaking through a major realm.

However, he did not become arrogant, and re-analyzed the experiences of this world once more.

With the aid of his enhanced planning ability, he made general deductions on how to successfully break free from the "Immortal Net" in the future, return to the true reality smoothly, and even extract benefits from the process.

"But it still hasn't reached the level of the Dao Transformation Stone Mother, which can deduce the tiers of the real world. I still need to adapt to the situation."

Li Fan remained silent, numerous thoughts swirling in his mind.

After three full days of seclusion, he first summoned his clone, Li Qing.

"You can proceed first to the Congyun Sea and prematurely startle the Chaoyuan Sect into leaving. If there are no accidents, the ruins of the Chaoyuan Sect will still fly towards Jiushan Prefecture."

"After the cultivators from the various small worlds forcibly advance to the Golden Core realm by consuming the elixirs of the Medicine King Sect, you can then lead them there."

"With your oversight, they should be able to fight their way out of the mountains of corpses and seas of blood of the Chaoyuan Sect. When they reappear, they can collectively advance to the Nascent Soul realm. At that time, exploring the secrets within the bloody river will be much easier."

In the clone's mind, all the various details about the Chaoyuan Sect were instantly recalled.

The Chaoyuan Sect was an ancient cave-dwelling hidden in the deep trenches beneath the Congyun Sea.

Before the great tribulation befell the Congyun Sea, it fled and landed in Jiushan Prefecture.

Shuofeng, Zhang Haobo, and Su Xiaomei had once adventured there together in search of breakthrough opportunities.

From their experiences, Li Fan also learned the secrets of the Chaoyuan Sect.

The Chaoyuan Sect was a local sect of the Xuanhuang World.

Since the great catastrophe descended, they had vanished without a trace, as if they had evaporated from the mortal world.

In reality, the entire sect had been transformed into some strange state, existing between the real and the illusory, isolated from the outside world.

Time within seemed to have entered a state of stagnation, in an attempt to evade disaster.

This was the original plan of the Chaoyuan Sect.

However, various unforeseen changes always occurred.

First, the area where they were located was struck by the Transmission Law Heavenly Venerable's palm, turning it into the Congyun Sea, burying the Chaoyuan Sect deep underground.

Then, perhaps due to the influence of the merging power between the two worlds, various bizarre changes gradually occurred within the Chaoyuan Sect.

When Su Xiaomei and the others entered the ruins of the Chaoyuan Sect, the cultivators inside, although appearing to live normally, had all actually transformed into faceless blood faces, losing their original appearances.

Furthermore, they themselves had no awareness of it.

If their true appearance as faceless blood faces was revealed in front of these Chaoyuan Sect cultivators, they would go into a frenzy and suddenly launch an attack.

As if having lost their sanity, regardless of their cultivation, they would only attack with their physical bodies and claws like wild beasts.

Although they would not use divine abilities, these faceless blood faces were truly difficult to deal with.

They were extremely fast, and injuries would heal quickly.

Only by completely slicing off their blood faces could they finally be killed.

After a faceless blood face was destroyed, it would transform into a streak of red light that would attach itself to the cultivator who killed it.

These red lights were actually the fundamental power of the Chaoyuan Sect's world.

When they left the Chaoyuan Sect, these seized red lights would follow the cultivators away.

They were like some great tonic, enough to allow cultivators below the Nascent Soul realm to directly advance a major realm.

Furthermore, whether it was the foundation-building strange object required for the New Law advancement, the Golden Core method, or the Nascent Soul Grotto-Heaven, the red light would naturally evolve these.

If one mastered a special refining method, they could even directly absorb the origin of the red light within the Chaoyuan Sect world, fighting to sustain themselves.

As for why the Chaoyuan Sect appeared in such a bizarre state, it was temporarily unknown. However, Li Fan guessed it was likely still due to the influence of the integration between the Xuanhuang World and other worlds.

...

Li Qing quickly summarized the entire course of events of the Chaoyuan Sect and then nodded.

"If that red light origin is also useful to me, perhaps my realm might even surpass yours?" Li Qing said with a smile.

"Then you must kill more. The Heavenly Wonder's advancement is not ordinary. The resources you need to advance to the Spirit Transformation realm might be even more than what an ordinary cultivator needs to advance to the Integration stage," Li Fan said nonchalantly.

"If you truly achieve the Spirit Transformation realm, relying on the Heavenly Wonder of the Black Sword, you might actually be able to hold out for two or three rounds against me," he added.

The clone smiled but did not reply.

It received the order and departed.

The subsequent exploration of the bloody river would be entirely the responsibility of the clone, Li Qing.

In any case, once any secret was discovered, the clone would know, and he would naturally know simultaneously.

There shouldn't be any major issues.

...

With the support of the upgraded Dao Transformation Stones, the End Dissolution Disc could finally unleash its maximum computational power.

While deducing and breaking the confinement of the Transmission Law Heavenly Venerable, it was also creating an entirely new formation based on Li Fan's vision.

Li Fan himself began to study the ball of white light within his body.

This was the origin of the mirror that the Heavenly Profound Mirror had given him previously.

Although the Heavenly Profound Mirror claimed that this origin of the mirror only existed as long as it did, without increasing or decreasing, Li Fan was very curious what would happen if he chose to retain this item after returning to the true reality.

"It is highly likely that a new origin of the mirror would suddenly appear out of thin air in the world."

"If the Heavenly Profound Mirror does not sense this new origin of the mirror..."

Li Fan's eyes narrowed slightly.

During the time he possessed the origin of the mirror, Li Fan enjoyed too many benefits.

The fact that the Heavenly Profound Mirror was almost completely unguarded towards him alone was worth using an anchor point to exchange for retaining an item.

"I can try the Heavenly Profound Mirror's reaction in the final moments of this world."

"If it is detected, I will have to immediately return to reality anyway, so there will be no impact."

"But if the Heavenly Profound Mirror cannot detect this suddenly appearing origin, then the utility will be immense."

Of course, all of this depended on the item exchanged with the anchor point being generated out of thin air within the item space of the returned reality, rather than absorbing an existing item in the world.

"This actually represents the true potential concerning returning to reality."

Li Fan fell into deep thought for a moment.

"However, it is absolutely worth a try."

Li Fan currently only had two blank anchor points remaining.

However, Li Fan already had a guess as to how to increase the number of anchor points.

The previous increase in anchor points was achieved by Li Fan absorbing the Golden Cores of cultivators.

In the very beginning, it was by absorbing the foundation-building strange objects of cultivators.

So, it was obvious that the next step to increase anchor points would likely require absorbing what cultivators needed to form a Nascent Soul, which was the Grotto-Heaven.

As for why Li Fan had personally visited many Grotto-Heavens, but there was no prompt for returning to reality to absorb them...

Li Fan guessed it might require newly formed Grotto-Heavens.

Chapter 1028: Tianyang Seeks Longevity

When Li Fan first formed his Nascent Soul with the nascent Five Elements Grotto-Heaven, he had a faint, unusual feeling in his heart.

However, at that time, in order to seize the moment the Grotto-Heaven descended into the world to successfully form the Nascent Soul, Li Fan did not have time to consider too much.

Therefore, he overlooked that subtle difference in feeling.

It was not until recently, after Li Fan upgraded the Dao Transformation Stone, that he revisited every detail of his experiences.

Only then did he make a new discovery.

"If my guess is correct, new Five Elements Grotto-Heavens should still be born within the Root of Heaven and Earth in Tianling Prefecture. We will know once we test it then."

"However, the original Great Five Elements Grotto-Heavens of this world were absorbed by me and promoted. Heaven and Earth have suffered some loss, and it will take some time to nurture new Grotto-Heavens."

"If this is verified, and my guess is correct, then the number of usable anchor points I possess should increase by a few more."

A cold light flickered in Li Fan's eyes: "Although nascent Grotto-Heavens are hard to find, the vast Xuanhuang World surely has quite a few."

"To be more extreme, annihilating a Grotto-Heaven and directly reshaping it..."

"This is also a good method."

Not long ago, when Li Fan wanted to increase the number of anchor points by having cultivators form Golden Cores, he had to secretly search for resources that could not see the light of day. It was also during this time that he stumbled upon Ruomu.

Now, he could destroy the Grotto-Heavens of the Xuanhuang World wantonly and as he pleased.

It was not that Li Fan's mentality had swelled, but there were truly few things in the Xuanhuang World that could pose a threat to him.

...

Just as Li Fan was diligently preparing to help Tianyang break free, Qiaogong Jushi had already made some progress.

He excitedly came to find Li Fan, wanting to borrow the Essence of Origin Power.

"Thanks to Fellow Daoist Fang, although his artifact refining skills are a bit lacking and he hasn't received any proper training, this lack of formal training has made him naturally free from mental constraints, always coming up with some wildly imaginative ideas!"

"I have initially drafted a plan to reforge Tianyang's puppet body. Upper Envoy, please take a look!"

Saying this, Qiaogong Jushi pointed in the void.

A puppet image, seemingly wearing black metal armor and looking majestic, immediately appeared before Li Fan.

"This appearance was designed by referencing some of the original look of the 'Ancestor' and Tianyang's own wishes. Both Fellow Daoist Fang and I are quite satisfied with this version."

"However, appearance can change freely, that is not the main point."

Qiaogong Jushi pointed in the air again, and the puppet's image instantly magnified.

The internal structure of the puppet was thus revealed.

Passageways resembling human blood vessels were spread throughout the puppet's body.

Golden Essence of Origin Power flowed within like surging rivers, ceaselessly streaming.

"The most direct difference between an immortal puppet and a mortal puppet is that an immortal puppet can absorb external power and continuously evolve and strengthen itself, just like a true living being."

"Fellow Daoist Tianyang, by merging his body with the puppet, becoming one with it, he is both a cultivator and a puppet. He has unknowingly met the most difficult condition to become an immortal puppet."

"Therefore, the next step is just to follow the procedure and add some things to Tianyang himself!"

Li Fan frowned upon hearing this: "Is it just simple material stacking? Can this enhance Tianyang's strength? He is already at the Dao Integration cultivation level. After the puppet refining is complete, what level can he reach?"

Qiaogong Jushi was full of confidence: "Absolutely no problem! Tianyang's current state is like a cultivator who has met the conditions for promotion but lacks the corresponding resources, which is why the transformation has been delayed." "He has both a puppet body and a cultivator's intellect. Since he already has a path to upgrade as an immortal puppet, why should he still pursue the new methods of the Xuanhuang World?"

When Qiaogong Jushi said this, Li Fan immediately understood.

Xuanhuang World cultivators seeking breakthroughs in their cultivation must all abide by the rules established by the Heaven Honored Master of Dharma Transmission.

But Tianyang, by a coincidence, had become a being who was half puppet and half cultivator.

He could not only follow the path of cultivator advancement but also the path of artifact upgrading.

Qiaogong Jushi's eyes showed some excitement: "After the forging is complete, it is currently impossible to determine exactly how strong he will be. But it is certain that he will definitely not be weaker than the longevity cultivators of the Xuanhuang World!"

Li Fan's eyes immediately flashed: "Since that is the case, then you should proceed with full confidence."

With that, Li Fan split off a Dharmic Avatar filled with the golden Essence of Origin Power to accompany him.

Qiaogong Jushi's gaze was instantly firmly fixed on it.

"If your idea works, doesn't that mean we can mass-produce battle power at the longevity level?"

"I am also somewhat aware of Tianyang's Body Transformation into the Dao. As long as one cultivates this secret art, transforms into a half-puppet, half-cultivator existence, and then uses the Essence of Origin Power to help the promotion..." Li Fan's eyes turned, thinking of something, and he couldn't help but ask.

Qiaogong Jushi's attention remained focused on the golden Dharmic Avatar.

After a long while, he finally reacted.

He shook his head and directly denied Li Fan's wild thought: "I thought the same thing before. However..."

"After inquiring about the details of Tianyang's Body Transformation into the Dao technique, I realized this is by no means easy."

"Body transformation, especially transforming into a puppet, makes it very easy to lose oneself. Losing one's human nature and truly becoming a puppet. Only those with great willpower and great spirit can achieve it. Fellow Daoist Tianyang's willpower is exceptionally tenacious in this era," Qiaogong Jushi praised.

Li Fan thought of the Eternal Lingering Thought from Tianyang's remains and nodded silently.

"This is only one aspect. The bigger constraint is this Essence of Origin Power," Qiaogong Jushi pointed at the golden Dharmic Avatar.

"I know that what the Upper Envoy has provided is already extremely precious, but this is only enough to satisfy the most basic refining requirements."

"The gap between immortals and mortals is truly too vast. Without the baptism of immortal spiritual energy, relying solely on the Essence of Origin Power..."

Qiaogong Jushi paused, choosing his words carefully: "Perhaps ten times the amount would still not be enough."

"Just forging one puppet consumes so much. How can we mass-produce them?"

Li Fan, upon hearing this, did not agree.

For him, these two constraints were not problems at all.

As long as the base number was large enough, he could always find those with so-called exceptionally tenacious willpower.

And as long as there were enough believers and enough time was spent, he could always accumulate enough Essence of Origin Power.

As long as longevity-level thugs could be cultivated, all of this would be worthwhile.

The only concern was whether such a large-scale use of Origin Power Essence would attract the attention of the Faceless True Immortals.

Although theoretically, True Immortals were no longer interested in the Essence of Origin Power, the Flower of the Dao was still very close to the power of the Root of the Dao pursued by True Immortals.

If it reached a certain level and attracted the gaze of a True Immortal, it would not be unexpected.

Chapter 1029: Extortion and the Way of Heaven

Li Fan's thoughts, however, were not spoken directly to Qiaogong Jushi.

He merely summoned another calamity body to stay by his side.

This was to be used when forging the new puppet body for Tianyang.

Removing these two, Li Fan had only one calamity body left inside him, half-filled.

The layout of the Compassionate Immortal of the mortal world in this era had been set for so long, yet yielded only this much.

This showed how rare the Essence of Origin Power was.

Qiaogong Jushi was ecstatic and about to take the golden calamity body back.

At this moment, Li Fan inquired about the specific time required to forge an Immortal Puppet.

The answer made the expression on Li Fan's face freeze.

"I estimate that ten years should be the minimum," Qiaogong Jushi said with some uncertainty.

"Perhaps even longer. After all, it is my first time having the opportunity to forge an Immortal Puppet, so I am not entirely sure."

Qiaogong Jushi's gaze drifted, avoiding eye contact with Li Fan.

"Ten years..."

"I wonder if there will be a chance in this era to see an Immortal Puppet come into being."

Li Fan shook his head slightly and sent Qiaogong Jushi away.

It seemed that anything involving the level of "Immortal" increased the required time by hundreds or thousands of times.

The same was true for the Final Dissolution Disk's deduction and cracking of the restrictions left by the Dharma Preaching Celestial Venerable.

Of course, this was not to say that Dharma Preaching was already at the Immortal realm, but Li Fan clearly saw the operating logic and traces of Immortal-grade grand formations within these restrictions.

"It seems that Dharma Preaching also had an Immortal Realm inheritance. However, due to the lack of Immortal Qi, he took a different path."

Li Fan mused thoughtfully.

But it made sense. The Profound Heaven Mirror was an artifact left from the Immortal Realm. How could the restrictions capable of restraining an Immortal Artifact be merely mortal means?

Currently, the only ones Li Fan knew of who possessed Immortal Realm Daoist inheritance were King Xuantian and Grand Master Tiandu.

The confirmation regarding Dharma Preaching Celestial Venerable, previously only a guess, was now almost certain through the restrictions sealing the Profound Heaven Mirror.

In the entire history of the Vast Yellow Realm, the number of people who actually possessed True Immortal inheritance might only be these three.

This was because the Immortal Realm suffered an unknown calamity, and the Immortal Path collapsed.

King Xuantian and Grand Master Tiandu happened to benefit from this stroke of luck.

If the calamity had not occurred, the mortal world would likely not have any True Immortal Daoist traditions at all.

If it were a normal cultivation world with a path to ascension, and the Immortal Realm and the mortal realm could communicate normally, this situation would almost certainly not have occurred.

"Or perhaps, the very existence of this situation explains the problem," Li Fan's gaze darkened.

...

The difference between the Immortal and the mortal was like a chasm.

In his anticipation, after the Dissolution Disk and the Dao Transformation Stone both completed their transformation, cracking the restrictions of Dharma Preaching Celestial Venerable should have been instantaneous.

But in actual operation, it gave Li Fan the feeling of seeing a mountain from afar, only to run the horse to death before reaching it.

It seemed they were tantalizingly close to fully cracking it, but after the Final Dissolution Disk ran for a long time, the progress showed no change whatsoever.

"This is truly an Immortal family technique specifically designed for sealing."

"Although Myriad Spirits Return to Number and Void Chamber Blooms are Immortal-grade formations, they offer nothing to borrow from in this regard."

"I can only rely on the Dissolution Disk to brute-force crack it."

A sense of helplessness arose in Li Fan's heart as he monitored the Dissolution Disk's operation and temporarily shifted his attention.

In his spare time, Li Fan began to ponder how to quickly extract the Marrow of Heaven and Earth.

It was foreseeable that when he instigated the collision between the Faceless True Immortal and the Immortal Ruins Immortal to create conditions for his own Return to Truth, the time left for Li Fan would certainly not be long.

It might only be an instant.

According to his previous plan, to maximize the benefit, he needed to simultaneously complete the extraction of the "Vast Yellow Genesis Transformation" to accumulate resources for his advancement to the Divine Transformation stage.

Possessing the origin of the Profound Heaven Mirror allowed Li Fan to read numerous sealed documents from the Myriad Immortals Alliance, including many cultivators' insights on advancing to the Divine Transformation stage.

Extracting the Genesis Transformation of Heaven and Earth was a long and meticulous process.

Li Fan had personally witnessed Zhang Zhiliang absorbing the transformations of the叢yun Sea to advance to the Divine Transformation stage.

Clearly, this was not something that could be achieved overnight.

This was just for one Genesis Transformation; what about hundreds or thousands?

The only thing Li Fan could draw inspiration from might be the ability of Mr. Bai to gather numerous Souls of Heaven and Earth into himself in an instant—that ability called "Extortion Transformation."

The reason ordinary cultivators had to be cautious when advancing to the Divine Transformation stage was that drawing the Marrow of Heaven and Earth inevitably invited backlash from Heaven and Earth.

However, if one were an Incarnation of the Heavenly Dao, its own demands would not be met with heavenly punishment.

"Extortion Transformation, to see it is to see me..."

Li Fan suddenly recalled the ability of the Dharma Preacher Jiang.

A flash of inspiration struck him, and seizing this rare opportunity, he consumed a handful of Enlightenment Pills.
