He saw Jia Yiyuan arrive at a cave dwelling in Jiushan Prefecture and sit cross-legged in a secret chamber.

His expression was solemn, and he murmured to himself.

Then, an invisible fluctuation was generated out of thin air, tearing open a rift in space. Jia Yiyuan strode into it.

The sensing instantly became much weaker.

He could only see vague shadows and hear intermittent voices.

"I don't know how Senior Zhou's identity was exposed; go investigate."

"That shop seems to have some peculiarities."

"Recently, Senior Zhou has saved dozens more people and brought them in. I didn't expect that after so many years, the Myriad Immortals Alliance still hasn't given up on pursuing us."

"Unprovoked disaster? What's the use of saying this now? No matter what, we are now locked in an irreconcilable feud with the Myriad Immortals Alliance!"

The tone carried bone-chilling hatred, drawing murmurs of agreement.

"Such disregard for the lives of our fellow cultivators, treating them like mere grass, to be easily eliminated. They don't care about truth or falsehood at all... Those people are simply not worthy of the title of Dharma Preacher!"

"Exactly! Only someone like Senior Zhou is a true Dharma Preacher!"

...

"Dharma Preacher Zhou?" The information coming from the statue surprised Li Fan.

In the information given by Mo Rubin back then, there didn't seem to be anyone named Zhou among the Dharma Preachers in power in the Myriad Immortals Alliance.

"No wonder Senior Zhou chose to part ways with them back then because she couldn't stand their actions."

"Alas, if she hadn't left the Immortal Alliance back then, perhaps she could have argued reasonably and changed the alliance's massacre orders."

Many voices discussed in succession, and Li Fan eavesdropped, learning the whole story.

It turned out that five hundred years ago, this Dharma Preacher Zhou voluntarily left the Dharma Preacher Council because her ideology clashed with that of the Dharma Preachers in power in the Immortal Alliance, such as Jiang.

Although she left the highest echelons of power in the Immortal Alliance, she was still a Dharma Preacher.

She still possessed resources that ordinary people could hardly imagine.

The place where these survivors were hiding was Dharma Preacher Zhou's private small world.

"No wonder the Myriad Immortals Alliance is pursuing so fiercely, searching almost every inch of land, yet still failing to find any trace of those survivors."

"A Dharma Preacher's private world, even if they want to investigate, they are powerless, right?"

Li Fan pondered for a moment, choosing not to startle the snake directly.

Although he had found clues to the survivors, the involvement of a being at the level of a Dharma Preacher made Li Fan cautious.

After suffering a hidden loss from Mo Rubin, Li Fan deeply understood that no one surviving in the Profound Yellow World for a thousand years was easy to deal with.

Not to mention Dharma Preachers, who stood at the pinnacle of the Immortal Alliance's power.

"However, if she is truly as she appears to be..."

"Then perhaps our positions are aligned. I can try to make private contact first."

Based on the investigation results over the past five years, Li Fan was almost certain that Mo Rubin had escaped with the Celestial Profound Mirror that day.

This was not only because of the extremely bloody retaliation from the Myriad Immortals Alliance afterward but also because the Celestial Profound Mirror had encountered many problems over the past five years.

Initially, the transaction module malfunctioned for no reason, leading to anomalies in the transaction amounts for millions of cultivators.

When cultivators sought explanations to no avail, the Myriad Immortals Alliance directly announced the closure of the Celestial Profound Mirror's transaction module.

Recently, news has been circulating among the common people. It is said that the cultivator living spaces in the Celestial Profound Mirror are about to be abolished.

This caused panic among the cultivators of the Myriad Immortals Alliance, who frantically snatched up vacant cave dwellings in various prefectures.

The price of cave dwellings in ordinary prefectures almost doubled within three months, even in a remote corner like Congyun Sea.

Not to mention the four central prefectures.

Although the Immortal Alliance officially issued a denial soon after, the alliance had also issued a similar announcement when the Celestial Profound Mirror's transaction function was previously closed.

This resulted in the rumor seeming more like a confirmation.

The price of cave dwellings soared higher and higher, seemingly without end.

"The clone of the Celestial Profound Mirror once said that after it escaped, it would leave a sub-body that could replace the main body in completing most tasks."

"Now it seems that it still cannot compare to a true immortal artifact. As time goes by, various problems will emerge."

Li Fan mused to himself.

"Or perhaps, something has happened to the main body of the Celestial Profound Mirror? Which then affected this copy?"

Li Fan quickly dismissed this speculation.

Because the Ultimate Dissociation Dish in his sea of consciousness was completely unaffected.

"Mo Rubin and the Celestial Profound Mirror seem to have evaporated from the Profound Yellow World over the past five years, leaving not a single trace."

"Not only me, but the Myriad Immortals Alliance is also investigating their whereabouts."

"Yet, they still leave no trace."

A trace of doubt arose in Li Fan's heart.

He even began to suspect if they had already left the Profound Yellow World.

"Their goal is to find the Profound Heaven King."

"If they are already in the Profound Heaven King's hiding place, perhaps that would make sense."

"The Profound Heaven King has been missing for so many years without being discovered. If he is truly still alive, he must be in an extremely hidden location."

The Dao Transformation Stone crystal in Li Fan's mind operated rapidly, synthesizing the various clues gathered over the past five years.

He tried to find some trace.

"Anything that exists must leave a trace. I don't believe you can hide forever."

"If all else fails..."

A fierce glint flashed in Li Fan's eyes.

The illusion of the Book of Tribulation Crossing slowly materialized in the void before him as his thoughts flowed.

Beyond countless shifting silhouettes, tiny, multicolored light clusters floated.

Within the light clusters, yellow, unknown substances seemed to flow slowly.

The Book of Tribulation Crossing seemed to sense the danger, and its speed of flipping and changing reached its extreme.

"Little friend, let's talk properly. Why the killing intent again?"

A paper figure suddenly floated out of the Book of Tribulation Crossing. It glanced cautiously at those multicolored light clusters and slowly persuaded.

Li Fan smiled slightly, ignoring him.

The paper figure sighed with a bitter expression, seemingly having become accustomed to it.

(End of Chapter)

Chapter 1050: Grand Master of Enlightenment

The paper figure suddenly appeared when Li Fan tried to use the multicolored luminous flow, which contained gray mold spots, to erode the Book of Tribulation Crossing.

According to the paper figure itself, this was a kind of early warning mechanism.

The Sect of Tribulation Crossing did not intend to completely ignore the outside world after transforming into paper figures.

The paper figures monitored the Yellow and Black realms, and when the perceived external threat level reached a certain degree, the early warning mechanism would be activated.

The more severe the crisis, the more paper figures would awaken.

The gray mold spots released by Li Fan were still sealed by the multicolored divine light, so the slight leakage of aura only managed to awaken one paper figure.

However, after this paper figure figured out the current situation of the Book of Tribulation Crossing and the Yellow and Black realms, whether it woke up other sleeping paper figures...

From the many chaotic fluctuations transmitted from the Book of Tribulation Crossing previously, the answer was affirmative.

There seemed to be some kind of restriction. After the paper figures of the Sect of Tribulation Crossing discussed for a while, the vast majority chose to return to sleep.

Only the paper figure named Danxuan was left to be fully responsible for communicating with Li Fan.

Shouldering the survival of the entire Sect of Tribulation Crossing, Danxuan's identity must be very unusual.

However, no matter how many strategies he deployed, facing Li Fan's actions of threatening world destruction at every turn, he could only repeatedly suffer setbacks and compromise time and again.

Because Danxuan saw that every time Li Fan's murderous intent surfaced, it was not an act.

It was genuine indifference to his own life and the lives of all beings in the Yellow and Black realms, intending to drag everything down with him.

Facing this unreasonable "madman," Danxuan was completely helpless.

At this moment, sensing the dangerous thoughts reappearing in Li Fan, he hurriedly reappeared to persuade him.

"Asking you to help find someone, and you keep making excuses. It seems your Sect of Tribulation Crossing doesn't really care about the Yellow and Black realms either," Li Fan sneered.

The paper figure Danxuan's conflicted expression was almost squeezed together: "Little friend, I have said this many times. It is not that we are unwilling, but that we are unable. We also did not expect that during our slumber, the Yellow and Black realms would expand to this extent."

"There are too many blind spots. The overall monitoring system of the Book of Tribulation Crossing has also been affected. If we specify checking a certain paper figure, we can do it. But to survey the entire situation..."

Danxuan slightly shook his body: "Unless we replenish the paper figures for those newly appearing domains."

Facing Danxuan's evasion, Li Fan showed an appearance of complete disbelief.

"Little friend wants revenge against the Dharma King Mo and the Profound Heaven Mirror. I can understand your eagerness."

"However, I fear no one in this world knows the terror of the Profound Heaven Sect better than the elders of our Ten Immortal Dao Sects. If it hadn't been for the help of the Grand Master Tiandu back then, we wouldn't have had any chance of winning at all."

"The orthodox lineage inherited from the Immortal Realm is not something our native cultivation methods in the Yellow and Black realms can compare with."

Danxuan seemed to recall the might of the Profound Heaven Sect back then, and his paper figure body trembled slightly.

"Losing to them..."

"It's not unjust. Little friend need not dwell on it too much. Of course, if you insist on revenge..."

Danxuan paused, and still gave the suggestion he had repeated several times: "Why not invite the Grand Master Tiandu to take action? The Grand Master will definitely be very interested in the remnants of the Profound Heaven Sect."

Danxuan's tone was still sincere, as if he were genuinely looking out for Li Fan.

"I can sense that the Grand Master is still in seclusion and cultivation within the Yellow and Black realms. At his level, ten thousand years is merely the blink of an eye. I was fortunate enough to receive direct instruction in immortal arts from the Grand Master back then, and I can barely be considered to have a word in front of him. If little friend is willing..."

Danxuan spoke with subtle guidance.

"Someone who treasures trash like your Sect of Tribulation Crossing can't be that powerful," Li Fan defeated Danxuan with a single sentence, causing him to lose his composure instantly.

However, he possessed profound self-cultivation and quickly recovered.

Not taking Li Fan's contemptuous devaluation to heart, he continued to persuade.

"Our lack of skill and failure to inherit the Grand Master's divine might is normal. But the fact that the Grand Master could fight the Profound Heaven King to a draw is enough to illustrate his strength."

Li Fan continued to mock: "The clues I found indicate that the Grand Master Tiandu was seriously injured after that battle and has been hiding ever since, licking his wounds? Hasn't recovered yet?"

"Every period, the Origin Dao State of the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance is swallowed for ten years. That is his doing."

Danxuan was first slightly stunned: "It's already been ten years?"

Then he repeatedly shook his head and explained: "I don't know where little friend got his information, but it is so ridiculously wrong. The Grand Master's seclusion is not because of injury, but because of enlightenment!"

"Enlightenment?" Li Fan's eyes narrowed.

"Exactly. The closer one gets to the Immortal Ruins above the head, the slower the flow of time becomes. Back then, the Grand Master told us this was a spatial-temporal anomaly caused by an immortal's enlightenment. If one's aptitude is sufficient, one can use this spatial-temporal anomaly to trace back the immortal's realization," Danxuan's tone held a hint of wistfulness.

"However, none of the cultivators in our Ten Immortal Dao Sects could meet the requirements for this resonant enlightenment. Only the Grand Master..."

"The so-called lost ten years in the Origin Dao State is the manifestation of the time flow being slowed down to its extreme. That should be the unintentional external influence the Grand Master emitted during his process of enlightenment. Before we fell asleep back then, the influence of the Grand Master's enlightenment domain was less than a year. It seems the Grand Master has made progress in his enlightenment over the years."

Li Fan first digested the contents of Danxuan's words, then coldly sneered: "If the Grand Master is so powerful, why didn't you seek him out when the Yellow and Black realm was facing impending disaster? Instead, some fled, and some hid like cowards?"

Danxuan was instantly rendered speechless, as if his neck had been gripped.

After a long while, he spoke faintly: "Perhaps the Grand Master doesn't care about our life or death. We did try to contact him, but there was no response at all."

"No response back then, but there is now? And you keep urging me to go find him..."

"You truly have evil intentions," the killing intent that had originally subsided in Li Fan's eyes reappeared.

Danxuan repeatedly cried out injustice: "This time is different from that time! After waking up, wanting to contact the Grand Master immediately, isn't that a very normal reaction?"

"Noisy!"

Li Fan's patience was exhausted. Under the coercion of the Wordless Formula, Danxuan retreated back into the Book of Tribulation Crossing.

"If little friend changes his mind, just call me later. I will absolutely not harm you! The Grand Master has a benevolent heart..."

Danxuan's words were cut short abruptly.

Li Fan re-suppressed the Book of Tribulation Crossing and fell into thought.

"Interesting. Back then, after the battle between the Profound Heaven King and the Grand Master Tiandu, the Profound Heaven Sect and the Ten Immortal Dao Sects each insisted on their own version of events."

"Both believed the other was seriously injured, while they themselves had achieved a breakthrough in the great battle."

Chapter 1051: The Sacrifice of the Profound Heaven King

“But this might not be contradictory. Both half-immortal bodies gained inspiration for breakthroughs during their confrontation with each other…”

“Both had the hope of truly shedding their mortal shackles and achieving the status of an immortal.”

“Grand Master Tiandu was imitating the Immortals of the Immortal Ruins, resonating and gaining enlightenment.”

“As for the Profound Heaven King…”

Li Fan’s mind recalled the fragmented memories from the Dharma King of the Profound Heaven Sect.

“He encountered an unforeseen mishap during his breakthrough process.”

Regarding the sudden overthrow of the Profound Heaven Sect by the Ten Immortal Dao Sects back then, Li Fan had once inquired with Danxuan.

However, this old fellow was vague.

He claimed not to know the details, only that they haphazardly won the final victory in the war.

Just as the Profound Heaven Sect’s defeat seemed inexplicable.

“Danxuan must be concealing something. But what is certain is that the downfall of the Profound Heaven Sect back then involved a third force, besides the Profound Heaven Sect and the Ten Immortal Dao Sects.”

“Inciting the Ten Immortal Dao Sects to rebel, leveraging the Profound Heaven King’s intention to clear out internal spies to push things along, brought about this great battle.”

“The ultimate winner appears to be the Ten Immortal Dao Sects, who gained dominance over the cultivation world of the Profound Yellow Realm. But perhaps the Profound Heaven King was their true target.”

Li Fan’s thoughts churned.

Connecting this with Mo Rubin’s apprehension towards the Faceless True Immortal stone statue, a bold speculation suddenly arose in Li Fan’s mind.

“Could it be the work of fanatical believers of the Faceless True Immortal?”

“The Profound Heaven King, on the verge of becoming an Immortal, was their sacrifice to the Faceless True Immortal…”

In the years of using the Faceless True Immortal statue to spread the ‘Red Dust Compassionate Immortal’, Li Fan had witnessed firsthand how the faith of those cultivators grew from nothing to firm belief.

Essence of Origin Force could work wonders, realizing the dreams of many cultivators.

Even in the Federation of All Realms, which Li Fan casually created without much effort, there were those truly seduced by the power of a True Immortal and offered their absolute loyalty.

Not to mention when the ancient Profound Heaven Sect was filled with Faceless True Immortal statues everywhere.

Even if the Profound Heaven King later discovered something was wrong and removed the statues from the main altar of the Profound Heaven Sect, how could the statues in the hearts of the cultivators be completely cleansed?

Following a half-immortal whose path to ascension was uncertain, or following a true Immortal, perhaps even an existence at the level of the ‘Nameless True Immortal’…

For the vast majority of cultivators, they would likely choose the latter.

“This is why Mo Rubin lost trust in me after seeing the statue I displayed.”

Having reconstructed the possible truth, Li Fan continued to deduce the whereabouts of the Profound Heaven King.

“There are two possibilities. One is that he was already considered a ripe fruit and devoured by the Faceless True Immortal, disappearing completely from the world. The power of the Faceless True Immortal still lingers in the Profound Yellow Realm in the hope that another fruit will appear.”

“The second is that the Faceless True Immortal’s devouring failed. The Profound Heaven King narrowly escaped death. Those fanatical believers were then annihilated by the enraged True Immortal, vanishing without a trace, unknown to anyone.”

“The second possibility is slightly more likely. After all, in the current Profound Yellow Realm, apart from my lineage, no other orthodox path of the Faceless True Immortal can be found. If the sacrifice had truly succeeded back then, and they had tasted the rewards granted by the Faceless True Immortal descending, they wouldn't have stopped there.”

A faint light flickered in Li Fan’s eyes.

“The reason Mo Rubin is so insistent on rescuing the Profound Heaven Mirror, even going so far as to cooperate with my act, is probably because he is long convinced that the Profound Heaven King is not dead, and the Profound Heaven Mirror must know his whereabouts.”

“So that’s it.”

“Ever since that day they disappeared from the headquarters of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, they have not appeared in the Profound Yellow Realm. The paper figures of the Tribulation Crossing Sect have not seen them, nor have they shown up anywhere the Profound Heaven Mirror exists.”

“They directly left the spatial realm of the Profound Heaven Mirror and appeared in another location.”

“…”

“It seems I need to find a way to meet with the Transmitter Zhou.”

Li Fan’s focus returned to the white jade statue he had crafted.

Recording the sounds and vague images transmitted by the statue, he compared them with the cultivator files in the Profound Heaven Mirror, attempting to find a breakthrough.

Most of the cultivators identified were nominally dead, listed on the wanted list of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

But after more than ten days of continuous monitoring by Li Fan, he actually found one individual who was not wanted by the Alliance and still maintained his identity as a cultivator within the established system.

“Such audacity, isn't he afraid of implicating his family…”

Li Fan thought to himself, but after reviewing the biographical file of this cultivator, he discovered that this cultivator named You Chisong…

might have done this intentionally.

You Chisong, a Nascent Soul cultivator.

Eldest legitimate son of the You family in Tianchen Prefecture.

Ten years ago, he had the opportunity to advance to the Soul Transformation stage.

However, his father gave the only piece of information about the ‘Change of Heaven and Earth’s Birth’ heard within the family to You Chisong’s younger brother, You Chipai.

Shattering You Chisong’s hope of reaching Soul Transformation.

This action even received the support of the vast majority of the You family.

Simply because You Chipai’s aptitude was far superior to You Chisong’s.

It took You Chisong nearly a hundred years to form a Nascent Soul, even with ample resources.

But You Chipai only took over thirty years.

The gap was too large; even You Chisong’s mother could only sigh helplessly in comfort.

But You Chisong refused to accept it!

Because this information about the Change of Heaven and Earth’s Birth was first discovered and reported by him to the family.

It should have been his prize, yet it was snatched away and given to his younger brother!

Resentment grew in You Chisong’s heart.

And the bloody purge by the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance provided him with an opportunity for revenge against his family.

By chance, he happened to encounter the Transmitter Zhou saving people.

Seeing these “rebels” instantly, the strategy of mutual destruction flashed in his mind.

He immediately knelt down and begged to join.

The Transmitter Zhou, seeing You Chisong’s sincerity, brought him into her private small world.

Originally, You Chisong intended to solidify his identity as a rebel and then proactively report himself to the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

However, as he interacted more with the Transmitter Zhou and learned about her deeds, and through daily life with his companions around him, You Chisong’s mindset gradually changed.

Compared to the great mission of rectifying and purifying the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and returning the Transmitter to her original intention, the trivial matter concerning one Soul Transformation cultivator in his family was insignificant.

He had been blinded by hatred before.

But now, You Chisong had a more noble goal.

To restore a bright and clear world to the Profound Yellow Realm!

…

Li Fan combined the conversations he had heard from You Chisong over the past few days with his biographical information, easily deducing his change of heart.

(End of Chapter)

Chapter 1052: Opportunities in the Nether Prison

In the private small world of Transmitter Zhou, almost everyone was someone whose entire clan had been slaughtered. Individuals like You Chisong, whose family was still intact, were extremely rare.

Although they were all aware of You Chisong’s background and knew that he seemingly wished to drag his entire family down with him in death, because the matter concerned the life and death safety of everyone present, the followers of Transmitter Zhou remained somewhat guarded toward You Chisong.

This included, but was not limited to: constantly monitoring You Chisong and never allowing him to be alone. You Chisong did not know the secret method for opening the private small world's passage; every time he entered or exited, someone else accompanied him. He was not allowed to participate in critical missions, only assigned to start with the most unimportant tasks...

Despite enduring such discriminatory treatment, You Chisong harbored no complaints. He was diligent and willing to work hard without complaint.

Everyone witnessed his performance, and slowly, their attitude toward him began to improve.

One day, he finally had the opportunity to participate in a real mission for the organization.

“The objective of this mission is to infiltrate the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance’s [Nether Prison] and rescue a senior who is suppressed at the very bottom level.”

“This senior was once a member of the Transmitters. However, due to an uncompromising and righteous nature, he offended many other Transmitters. At the same time that Senior Zhou left the Transmitter Council five hundred years ago, he was taken advantage of and thrown into the Nether Prison.”

“The Immortal Alliance’s Nether Prison is located in the rift space among the Central Four States. It suppresses the most vicious criminals from the entire history of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance. They are usually kept alive and merely suppressed because they possess some kind of special value to the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.”

“[Nether Prison] is heavily guarded, but Senior Zhou has already arranged for an inside agent. We only need to impersonate cultivators from the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance headquarters and present the transfer order to take the target out.”

“Many functions of the Profound Heaven Mirror are damaged, and the connection between the [Nether Prison] and the Immortal Alliance headquarters has also been affected. We must seize this rare opportunity before the new contact and verification methods are established.”

...

When the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance summoned a prisoner from the [Nether Prison], they usually used three small teams of ten cultivators, traveling together in formation.

You Chisong was selected as a member of the execution team this time. He was taught the necessary points for maintaining his disguise and the real restraint formation used for escorting prisoners.

After more than half a day, they looked quite convincing.

“The situation in the Nether Prison is special. Senior Zhou cannot go there conveniently, so this time it has to be up to us.”

“The mission is difficult and carries the possibility of failure. Everyone must be prepared to sacrifice at any moment. If things are accidentally exposed, to prevent soul searching, everyone must immediately release the restrictions within their divine souls. It is better to have both form and spirit utterly destroyed than to let the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance gain even a shred of information!”

“If anyone has reservations or is unwilling, you may withdraw now.”

After a long pause, no one spoke.

Thus, the preliminary plan was established.

After the mission began, they would leave the small world. They would not carry any items with personal identification, so Li Fan would lose his sensory link to these people.

However, since the beginning of the surveillance, Li Fan had infiltrated the You family and stolen a drop of You Chisong's essence blood.

By relying on bloodline sensation, Li Fan was still able to faintly lock onto You Chisong's location.

He quietly followed behind them.

The team of thirty cultivators were all dressed in black clothing that Li Fan was extremely familiar with. Even the aura they emitted was as cold and murderous as that of the orthodox black-clothed cultivators of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

“Transmitter Zhou truly has some means.”

Tracking them all the way, they arrived above a deep valley at the junction of the Central Four States of the Immortal Alliance.

White clouds swirled, obscuring the bottom of the valley.

The leading black-clothed cultivator took out a jade seal and projected a white light, illuminating the deep valley.

The sea of clouds immediately parted, and the team of cultivators entered without hesitation, one after another.

Li Fan did not follow them in, observing only from a distance.

From the bottom of the valley, from the supposed Nether Prison, Li Fan faintly sensed an aura of danger.

His goal was not to break into the prison. He only needed to wait outside for them to complete the mission.

The execution of the mission appeared to be exceptionally smooth. After a short time, the sealed sea of clouds opened again.

The team of thirty flew out, with a white-haired old man locked in the center.

Initially, things seemed relatively normal.

Later, their escape speed increased significantly.

“Once we leave the influence range of the rift, immediately open the passage to the small world!” the leading black-clothed cultivator transmitted, forcefully suppressing the excitement in his heart.

The white-haired Transmitter they rescued, however, seemed to display no emotional fluctuations regarding his own liberation. He simply kept his eyes tightly shut, ignoring everything external.

The situation was urgent, and the group had no time to explain. They merely took the white-haired old man and fled wildly.

When they finally retreated to a safe location, they were about to cast the spell to open the passage to the small world.

“Who is that?”

Just then, the leading cultivator’s gaze swept toward Li Fan’s position and he roared.

Simultaneously, a beam of white sword light shot out, instantly slashing toward Li Fan.

His companions also reacted immediately, unleashing their full power in an instant, auras overflowing, and all manner of magical arts and techniques bombarding Li Fan.

However, to their horror, all the attacks vanished as if sinking into the sea upon approaching the enemy, disappearing without a ripple.

“Just what kind of person are you?” the leading black-clothed cultivator asked with a solemn expression.

Li Fan slowly revealed his figure, ignoring him. Instead, he looked directly at the white-haired old man and said loudly, “Senior, do not be deceived by these people. They are pretending to be members of Transmitter Zhou’s group, putting on this act to rescue you from the Nether Prison. It is all to gain your trust.”

“The real Transmitter Zhou is dead!”

Hearing Li Fan’s words, the bodies of the dozens of people escorting the white-haired old man trembled violently. Their disguised murderous aura dissipated, replaced instead by panic and confusion.

“You...” The leading cultivator also found it difficult to hide his shock.

However, he quickly recovered and hurriedly tried to explain to the white-haired old man. “Senior, do not be misled by this person! I have Senior Zhou’s token here!” As he spoke, he took out a red string knot to prove his identity.

Faced with a confrontation between two opposing groups, the white-haired old man, who had been observing silently, finally opened his eyes.

He first glanced at the red string knot and snorted coldly, “What token...”

“This clumsy trick, it’s not the first time you’ve used it. Do you think I would fall for it?”

“If this was truly instructed by Zhou, why didn’t she come here herself?”

The leading black-clothed cultivator was instantly struck dumb, unexpectedly realizing the white-haired old man thought this way.

The white-haired old man then scrutinized Li Fan for a moment, then shook his head slightly, “You brat, looking at you, you don’t seem like a good person.”

“Zhou would absolutely never take someone like you as a subordinate...”

The white-haired old man pondered for a moment, “Are both sides fake?”

Chapter 1053: The Law Transmitters Meet

"Correct, there is finally some progress."

"Not only is the act becoming more realistic, but the stratagem finally has a bit of substance," the white-haired old man commented.

The leading black-clothed cultivator became anxious: "Senior, you have truly misunderstood!"

He quickly ordered his companions to release the formation restraining the white-haired old man: "Senior, you are now free. You can't still be acting now, can you?"

The white-haired old man narrowed his eyes slightly: "I personally forged the Underworld Prison back in the day. If I truly wanted to leave, how could that place possibly confine me?"

"Not even understanding this basic point..."

The white-haired old man’s expression showed even less belief.

"I told you they were all frauds. Senior, you should come with me instead. I am alone; even if I wanted to cause trouble, I am no match for you, Senior," Li Fan watched the situation unfold and said with a smile.

However, though he spoke this way, he showed no intention of approaching to welcome the white-haired old man over.

"You brat..." The white-haired old man couldn't quite figure out this young man before him.

A mission that had been proceeding exceptionally smoothly had stalled here in an unexpected manner.

Every second they stayed longer carried the risk of being discovered by the Myriad Immortal Alliance.

The leading cultivator became increasingly anxious out of helplessness.

Gritting his teeth, he had already formed the intention to act first, control the white-haired old man, and forcibly take him away.

Just then, a crisp sigh suddenly sounded above everyone's heads.

"Old man Wei, you are still as self-righteous as ever."

The moment the voice appeared, the black-clothed cultivators showed joy: "Senior Zhou!"

And the white-haired old man, the Law Transmitter Wei, had a sudden change in his aura.

His previously turbid eyes instantly burst with a sharp glint, looking straight upward.

A woman in simple white clothing with a delicate and beautiful face had appeared silently at some unknown time.

Law Transmitter Wei scrutinized her carefully and was slightly stunned: "It really is you..."

He looked at the group of black-clothed cultivators before him, and his expression became somewhat strange: "So, what these little fellows said is true?"

Law Transmitter Zhou sighed again.

"When you overthink conspiracies and tricks, everything looks fake."

"Many things have happened in the Myriad Immortal Alliance recently. I suspected that the Law Transmitter Council had become corrupted, so I intended to invite you out."

"However, if I showed up in person, I would surely see that smug look on your face. So, I sent these little fellows to make the approach."

"I didn't expect..."

Law Transmitter Zhou's tone was somewhat peculiar, weak, and listless.

Upon hearing this, the expression on the white-haired old man's face froze for a moment.

But soon, he let out a loud laugh, dissolving the awkwardness.

To divert attention, he immediately fixed his gaze on Li Fan.

"Since you are real, then what is the situation with this brat?"

Li Fan's expression was calm and unafraid, he cupped his hands: "Greetings to both Seniors."

"This farce was only to meet you both."

Wei and Zhou exchanged glances, their faces revealing playful expressions.

"People from the Myriad Immortal Alliance will be here soon. Let's change locations."

Law Transmitter Zhou swept her hand through the air, opening a spatial passage, and led the group of black-clothed cultivators to fly into it.

The white-haired old man looked back at Li Fan: "Brat, do you have the guts to follow?"

Li Fan pondered for a moment, then followed them into the small world together.

"Huh? This place is..."

When he clearly saw the surroundings, Li Fan almost thought he had fallen into some kind of illusion again. Because the architectural style in this small world was extremely similar to the world he lived in before he transmigrated.

Skyscrapers towered over one another.

In the dark night, a light drizzle fell from the sky.

The many neon lights on the exterior walls of the buildings dotted the city under the night, making it look bizarrely colorful.

This somewhat distant yet very familiar scene caused Li Fan to be momentarily stunned.

Not only him.

Law Transmitter Wei also seemed slightly unaccustomed to it.

"How is it? Quite beautiful, isn't it? I went to the Land of No Worries for a vacation before and thought this kind of scenery was quite nice. So, I copied it over."

Law Transmitter Zhou's voice slowly came.

Li Fan followed the sound and saw that she had changed her clothes.

A crisp white shirt and tight-fitting long pants.

She was even wearing a pair of black-rimmed glasses on her face.

She didn't look like a Law Transmitter, but rather like a modern urban beauty.

"Your taste..."

"Is still as unreasonable as ever," Law Transmitter Wei shook his head slightly, not agreeing.

"You are still so stubbornly traditional, it’s annoying," Law Transmitter Zhou also mocked.

"I actually think it's quite good. Especially this outfit, it suits you very well, Senior," Li Fan interjected at this moment.

The gazes of the two Law Transmitters fell upon Li Fan simultaneously.

"Hee hee hee, the taste of young people is so much better than that of certain old fogeys. This is also why I like collecting young people," Law Transmitter Zhou said with a smile while sizing up Li Fan.

"Brat, whatever your purpose is, it's best to state it directly. My patience as an old man is very limited," Law Transmitter Wei’s expression was not as pleasant.

However, Li Fan could see that Wei’s anger was merely feigned.

The three of them were now on the top floor of the tallest building in the city. Through the massive glass curtain wall, the bustling city under the night could all be seen.

The entire floor, besides the central office desk and sofa, was covered with a red carpet and had no other decorative items.

Li Fan sat casually on the sofa, as if he were in his own home.

Then he began to explain the reason for seeking out Law Transmitter Zhou: "I want to know what exactly happened at the Myriad Immortal Alliance headquarters five years ago."

"And where the real Heavenly Profound Mirror is now."

Law Transmitter Wei, having been imprisoned for many years, did not grasp the situation immediately.

As for Law Transmitter Zhou, the indifferent expression on her face slowly disappeared. She carefully examined Li Fan, seeming to be guessing his origins.

"Appearing before me inexplicably, and immediately asking about such confidential matters."

"Little fellow, where does your confidence come from?"

Zhou's tone gradually shifted from languid to icy: "Only Nascent Soul cultivation. Even if the Grotto-Heaven you devoured is a bit grander, you are still ultimately only in the Nascent Soul stage."

"You dare speak to me like that?"

Li Fan remained unfazed: "I always speak to you Law Transmitters in this manner. You didn't attack directly, but instead tested me with words. Doesn't that indicate the source of my confidence?"

The atmosphere instantly became tense again.

However, it was broken by Law Transmitter Zhou's charming smile, instantly melting the ice.

"You are correct."

"It has been a long time since I've met such an excellent young man. Why don't you come and be one of my collectibles?"

"If you are willing, any secret you wish to know, I can tell you."

Law Transmitter Zhou's tone returned to its previous languidness.

Chapter 1054: The Shocking Truth

"Collectibles..."

Li Fan thought of the cultivators who had been saved by Law Transmitter Zhou.

In their eyes, Law Transmitter Zhou was a true savior. The higher-ups of the Immortal Alliance had problems, requiring order to be restored and the universe to be remade. Law Transmitter Zhou was undoubtedly the leader.

However, these passionate cultivators would probably never have imagined...

In Law Transmitter Zhou's eyes, they were less like companions with whom she could work and more like collectibles.

But Li Fan was not too surprised.

After learning about the many deeds of the Law Transmitters from Mo Ruben, Li Fan no longer held any hope for this group.

Perhaps what Law Transmitter Zhou meant by the "Law Transmitter Council degenerating" was merely a difference in ideology.

Li Fan collected his thoughts and said proudly, "To take me as a collectible..."

"Forget you, even a Law Transmitter might not be qualified!"

At these words, Law Transmitter Zhou and Wei instantly changed their expressions.

Although they had separated from the Law Transmitter Council, in their hearts, the status of the Heavenly Venerable Law Transmitter was unshakeable.

Threads of killing intent instantly locked onto Li Fan.

But soon, as a faint, ethereal image of a faceless stone statue appeared above Li Fan's head, the killing intent in the eyes of the two Law Transmitters turned to shock.

"Xuantian Sect?!"

They naturally knew the origin of this statue. Law Transmitter Zhou immediately looked at Li Fan and exclaimed in a low voice.

Although Law Transmitter Wei did not show excessive distress, his face also became solemn. His aura instantly became as deep as the abyss and as vast as the sea, slightly revealing the true power belonging to a Law Transmitter.

"No, no." Seeing that the other party was treating him as a great enemy, Li Fan immediately shook his head and denied it.

"I am not a heretic of the Xuantian Sect. It's just that we worship the same master," Li Fan said faintly.

The two Law Transmitters were immediately somewhat stunned.

Li Fan recounted the story he had concocted: "When the immortal path collapsed back then, it was thanks to the master's intervention that the Xuantian Sect had the opportunity to rise later. It is hateful that the heretics of the Xuantian Sect were so fickle and dared to betray the master!"

"Without the master's support, the Xuantian Sect was indeed destroyed not long after. But some remnants survived..."

"To deal with traitors, one must pursue them relentlessly. For ten thousand years, we have never given up hunting down the remnants of the Xuantian Sect. Now, only the last few targets remain..." Li Fan's eyes showed a look of vicissitude as he sighed slightly.

This speech made the two Law Transmitters somewhat hesitant.

They could vaguely discern that the young man before them was at most about thirty-four years old.

But what he mentioned—the collapse of the immortal path and the Xuantian Sect—was an era much older than the rule of the Ten Sects of the Immortal Dao.

This was definitely not something an ordinary young cultivator could know.

Even the significance of this made the two Law Transmitters dare not be negligent.

After a brief exchange of glances, Law Transmitter Zhou finally spoke and asked, "Since your mission is to hunt down the remnants of the Xuantian Sect, why are you interested in what happened at the headquarters of our Myriad Immortal Alliance?"

"Could it be..."

Li Fan's heart stirred, and he immediately showed a look of surprise, "What, you don't know yet? The culprit behind that anomaly was a surviving Dharma King of the Xuantian Sect from back then!"

"Oh? That is somewhat different from what I know..." Law Transmitter Zhou's face showed a slight surprise. "Right. That Dharma King's ability is to completely possess and transform into another person..." Li Fan suddenly seemed to recall something and quickly reminded them.

The expression on Law Transmitter Zhou's face instantly became somewhat dramatic.

After a moment of silence, she murmured to herself, "If that is truly the case, then it makes sense. They had no reason to do this. Now it seems they were likely possessed or had their bodies taken over."

"To be able to break through the protective measures left to us by the old man, the Heavenly Venerable. The heretics of the Xuantian Sect are truly incredible."

Law Transmitter Wei looked profound and interjected, "Possessed by the heretics of the Xuantian Sect? Perhaps this is an opportunity for us."

"Alright, I have already told you what I know. Do you still intend to hide it? In capturing the remnants of the Xuantian Sect, I think our positions are consistent. There should be room for mutual cooperation," Li Fan frowned slightly, his tone showing a hint of impatience.

Such impetuousness suited his young appearance.

Law Transmitter Zhou did not mind and proceeded to tell Li Fan what had happened at the Myriad Immortal Alliance headquarters.

"At that time, it was the time for the laying of the foundation for the previously agreed-upon [Xuantian Spirit Sealing] Formation."

"This formation can be used to completely control the Heavenly Profound Mirror and is crucial for the Myriad Immortal Alliance. Therefore, more than half of the Law Transmitters attended that day. The Mirror Master lineage also sent several representatives to participate."

After briefly explaining the difference in origin between the Law Transmitters and the Mirror Masters, Law Transmitter Zhou continued, "The location for the foundation laying ceremony of the formation was within the Immortal Alliance headquarters. This matter was extremely secret, so apart from these people, only the formation masters responsible for the operation of the formation were present."

"The rest of the defense forces waited outside the secret realm."

"They were all core members of the Immortal Alliance, and originally, there should have been no incidents."

"But..."

Law Transmitter Zhou's face showed solemnity, "Just as the Xuantian Spirit Sealing Formation was about to take shape, someone in the Law Transmitter Council suddenly attacked the other Law Transmitters."

"The few Mirror Masters who attended also suddenly made their move."

"You must know that among us Law Transmitters, apart from Jiang, our strengths are all comparable. Taking the unprepared by surprise, several Law Transmitters were controlled."

"The chaos of the battle quickly alerted the defense forces outside the secret realm, but facing an internal conflict among the Law Transmitters, they were momentarily stunned. They didn't know who to listen to."

"Helping either side was not appropriate, so the vast majority of them remained in place, waiting to see the outcome of the struggle."

"The Law Transmitters unleashed their full power in battle, and the fighting became increasingly dangerous. Even the space of the Heavenly Profound Mirror本体, where the Immortal Alliance headquarters was located, faintly bore the strain of that power."

"The chaos lasted for nearly half a day. Finally, five people led by Law Transmitter Chen achieved victory."

Law Transmitter Zhou named the five people one by one.

What shocked Li Fan deeply was that Law Transmitter Feng was among these five people!

"What is going on?"

Law Transmitter Feng was the young Law Transmitter possessed by Mo Ruben.

"Could it be..."

Li Fan's thoughts spun rapidly, and a terrifying idea instantly surfaced in his mind.

"No wonder I could barely find any trace of Mo Ruben and the others throughout the Yellow World."

"He didn't flee in panic at all..."

"Instead, he replaced the rightful occupants and took direct control of the Myriad Immortal Alliance!"

Chapter 1055: Jointly Executing the Evil Cultists

Even though he had been tricked by Mo Ruben before and witnessed the formidable power of the Xuantian Sect Law King.

Li Fan never expected that he could achieve so much in just a few years!

"If my guess is correct, then his cultivation technique must be capable of possessing more than one cultivator's body at the same time."

"That Law Transmitter Chen might also be him."

Li Fan was deeply shaken.

At the same time, a doubt immediately arose in his mind: "Since he is the victor..."

"The disappearance of Shuofeng and the entire family of Xuansu Shang could still be explained as a way to confuse the line of sight and disrupt my judgment. But what about the Heavenly Profound Mirror? So many functions were directly shut down, which should mean the main body has left, right?"

With these questions, Li Fan quickly asked Law Transmitter Zhou about the abnormality of the Heavenly Profound Mirror.

The answer she gave made Li Fan suddenly enlightened.

"There is nothing wrong with the Heavenly Profound Mirror itself, but it seems they need to borrow its power to secretly plot something."

"So most of the mirror's computing power was drawn away. Consequently, functions like real-time trading were forced to stop."

Law Transmitter Zhou's face showed a hidden trace of anger: "I was wondering what important matter could be worth violating the Heavenly Venerable's teaching to maintain stability. Now it seems it's the Xuantian Sect evil cultists causing trouble!"

"The Heavenly Profound Mirror was originally the treasured artifact of the Xuantian Sect. Although our Myriad Immortal Alliance has controlled it for so many years, we have never been able to fully subdue it. If it falls back into the hands of the Xuantian Sect..." Law Transmitter Zhou's expression became increasingly ugly as she thought about it.

"No, I must go back immediately!"

Law Transmitter Zhou suddenly stood up, about to leave, but was coldly stopped by Law Transmitter Wei.

"Xuantian Sect remnants? Words are not evidence. Now they hold the dominant power, centered around the five victors, controlling the other Law Transmitters..."

"Now we are the 'rebels'."

"Where did all the cultivators in this world come from? Weren't all opposing forces purged from top to bottom?"

"Their current level of control is probably even stronger than before," Law Transmitter Wei analyzed calmly.

Hearing this, Law Transmitter Zhou slowly regained some composure.

"I was too rash."

"I didn't expect that it wasn't the Law Transmitters who defected at all. Instead, someone took advantage of the weakness..."

After a long pause, Law Transmitter Zhou said resentfully, "What about Jiang? How could he stand by and let this happen? Seeing the situation getting out of control, he should have informed the Heavenly Venerable earlier!"

Law Transmitter Wei sneered: "Out of control? This is only in the eyes of those of us who know the inside story."

"For the vast majority of people, the current situation of the Myriad Immortal Alliance is still very good. That person, Jiang..."

"He's stubborn. Unless there's an unsolvable crisis that threatens the Yellow World, he won't inform the Heavenly Venerable!"

The white-haired Law Transmitter's tone carried much dissatisfaction.

Li Fan's expression also became serious, and he said, "The methods of the Xuantian Sect evil cultists are somewhat beyond my expectations." "Originally, I thought he was just taking advantage of the chaos to seize some benefits in the Immortal Alliance headquarters. Now it seems this villain has grander ambitions! It's no wonder he could escape our pursuit for ten thousand years; he truly has some ability."

"Facing such a tricky enemy, I think we can cooperate."

The two Law Transmitters both looked toward Li Fan.

"Our organization is named the 'United Council of Ten Thousand Realms.' It is a collection of surviving cultivators from all immortal cultivation worlds who worship the Master in this pitch-black star sea."

"We had no objection to your Myriad Immortal Alliance and the Five Elders Council occupying the main world. The numerous inhabitants of the minor worlds in the Yellow World are enough for us to report to the Master. However, traitors cannot go unpunished," Li Fan said with a firm tone.

"Neither of you want to see the foundation laid by the Law Transmitter Heavenly Venerable fall into the hands of evil cultists, do you?"

The two Law Transmitters looked at each other and then nodded slightly.

"To set things right, our current strength is indeed a bit weak. We just don't know how strong your United Council of Ten Thousand Realms is?" Law Transmitter Wei asked tentatively.

Li Fan showed a look of pride: "Our organization is composed of elites from the surviving immortal cultivation worlds. We have two battle strengths at or near the Longevity Realm, and several at the Dao Integration Realm. Someone like me is just an ordinary member in the organization."

The two Law Transmitters were deeply shaken, but at the same time, there was a hint of disbelief in their eyes.

"Of course, the organization will not deploy its full strength to punish traitors. Only the department I belong to will be responsible. But you can rest assured, we can definitely bring at least one Longevity Realm expert." Li Fan said with conviction.

"How many Law Transmitters can you contact on your side?" Before waiting for their response, Li Fan changed the subject and asked.

Law Transmitter Zhou replied after a moment of thought: "Over the years, due to various reasons, four Law Transmitters have left the Law Transmitter Council. Besides the two of us, the whereabouts of the other two are unknown. Finding them will probably take some effort."

Li Fan frowned upon hearing this.

"And after several rounds of purges, our remaining strength within the Immortal Alliance has been reduced to the extreme. Now we are just lying low in secret," Law Transmitter Zhou delivered another piece of bad news.

"Our Law Transmitter Council has become like this, and the Mirror Holder faction is even worse off. Led by Mirror Holder Cang, almost all of them have sided with the Xuantian Sect remnants," Law Transmitter Zhou fell silent after finishing her statement.

The white-haired Wei offered an opinion: "But we are not completely without a chance of winning."

"Currently, there seem to be two ways to turn the tide. The first is to somehow make contact with the faction of the 'Illusionary Sage.' They are one of the Heavenly Venerable's last resorts and might be able to deliver a decisive blow."

"However, the Illusionary Sages are all hidden within the Museum of Divine Treasures. The passage into the Immortal Alliance headquarters is likely strictly sealed now, so finding them might be difficult."

Law Transmitter Zhou nodded: "For the past two years, none of my people have been able to enter or leave the Immortal Alliance headquarters freely. Everyone must undergo strict inspection and be led by designated personnel."

"Then there is the second method. Directly find Jiang," Law Transmitter Wei said slowly.

"Although Jiang stays in his own Ruin World for most of the time and generally doesn't pay much attention to anything unless it concerns the safety of the Immortal Alliance, but..."

A slight smile appeared in the white-haired old man's eyes: "If a world-ending crisis occurs in the Yellow World, he will definitely step in to resolve it."

"Ensuring the safety and stability of the Yellow World is the mission the Heavenly Venerable left him before departing."

Chapter 1056 The Oath of the Law Transmitters

"World-ending? Isn't that a bit too extreme?" Li Fan's expression was somewhat taken aback. "Among the Dark Star Sea right now, only this pure land of the Yellow World remains relatively safe..."

Before he could finish speaking, Law Transmitter Wei waved his hand to interrupt him: "Heh heh, young friend misunderstands. It's not about actually destroying the Yellow World, but merely fabricating a catastrophe that ordinary cultivators cannot handle and must be personally resolved by Jiang."

"As long as Jiang is attracted over, then the two of us can persuade him to investigate the current ruling council of five," Law Transmitter Wei said slowly.

A sinister glint flashed in the white-haired old man's eyes: "The evildoers of the Profound Heaven Sect, no matter how well they disguise themselves, absolutely cannot withstand the scrutiny of the Oath of the Law Transmitters!"

"The Oath of the Law Transmitters?" This was the first time Li Fan had heard this name, and he immediately asked with curiosity.

"This is the Great Oath that every one of us had to swear when we joined the Law Transmitters. In the name of the Heavenly Venerable of Law Transmission, facing countless comrades who have already sacrificed or are about to sacrifice, we look directly into our hearts and confront our own divine souls."

"In that era, facing the fierce encirclement and killing by the Ten Sects of the Immortal Dao, not everyone could maintain their original intent."

"And in order to identify the vermin within the ranks of the Law Transmitters, the scrutiny of the Oath of the Law Transmitters is indispensable! If a Law Transmitter betrays the original oath, the other ten Law Transmitters can gather to forcibly activate the oath scrutiny."

"Whether there is betrayal or not will be laid bare under the illumination and questioning of the light of the heart!" Law Transmitter Wei said proudly.

"It's just a pity that since the Immortal Alliance was established and everything stabilized, the scrutiny of the Oath of the Law Transmitters has not been truly implemented for many years. Everyone tacitly agreed to avoid discussing it, as if it never existed," Law Transmitter Zhou interrupted Wei's speech coldly at that moment.

For a moment, the expression on Wei's face became somewhat awkward.

"However, as long as we can gather ten Law Transmitters, we can definitely expose the conspiracy of the Profound Heaven Sect! Jiang's identity is special; one person is equivalent to five Law Transmitters. Coupled with the two of us, it means we only need to find the support of three others!" The white-haired Wei quickly changed the subject.

"With Jiang's prestige, if he steps forward, this won't be difficult!"

Li Fan nodded: "Our United Council of Ten Thousand Realms has many surviving cultivators from other cultivation worlds. The calamities that descended upon their worlds were all different. To create a disaster that can alarm Jiang..."

"It's not a big problem!" Li Fan said with certainty.

"Then the only thing that remains uncertain now... is what you said about Chen and the others being possessed by the evildoers of the Profound Heaven Sect."

Li Fan had thought the negotiation was about to conclude, but unexpectedly, the two Law Transmitters suddenly brought the topic back to the very beginning.

Law Transmitter Zhou's tone became lazy again, the urgency to save the Immortal Alliance instantly disappearing.

"Speculation is just speculation. If we can investigate the highest ruling organization of the Immortal Alliance without substantial evidence, how chaotic will the Immortal Alliance become in the future?"

"Your United Council of Ten Thousand Realms has been hunting down the remnants of the Profound Heaven Sect for so long, you must understand them well. Can you find key evidence?" Law Transmitter Zhou asked.

Li Fan fell silent for a moment, then slowly said: "This Mo Ru-bin is insidious and cunning. Many previous secret methods for identifying members of the Profound Heaven Sect are ineffective on him. However..."

He paused, full of confidence: "The Dharma Kings of the Profound Heaven Sect all cultivate the Immortal Realm techniques originally passed down by the Profound Heaven King. They form their own lineage and are connected by the same energy. After achieving cultivation, they can sense each other."

"Based on this principle, one can create a miniature puppet that automatically runs the cultivation technique of the Profound Heaven Sect Dharma King. When holding this object, whenever a member of the Profound Heaven Sect appears nearby, it will naturally generate a sense..."

Saying this, Li Fan smiled and took out a palm-sized, crystal-clear little person, as white as jade, and showed it to the two Law Transmitters.

Zhou and Wei took the miniature puppet and, after examining it, both showed looks of astonishment.

Because this little jade person was clearly like a living being, with its internal technique circulating on its own.

They could even feel its constantly fluctuating life aura!

This level of artifact refining technique...

The Immortal Alliance was inferior!

Thus, their trust in Li Fan's words increased. "I will gift this puppet to you. I believe with your means, you should be able to conduct the final verification. I hope it can be done as soon as possible."

"The evildoers of the Profound Heaven Sect have secretly controlled the Immortal Alliance for five years. Controlling such vast resources, whatever they are plotting in secret is extremely dangerous," Li Fan said solemnly.

"I also need to return to report this discovery, hoping to attract more attention from the organization."

With that, Li Fan cupped his hands and prepared to take his leave.

The two Law Transmitters did not detain him.

Li Fan only left behind a round disk engraved with "Ten Thousand Realms" as a future contact method, and then hurriedly left the private small world of Law Transmitter Zhou.

Zhou toyed with the Ten Thousand Realms disk, his eyes showing a strange light.

His divine sense penetrated the disk, as if entering a starry sky. However, most of it was shrouded in a yellow mist, allowing only a vague glimpse of distorted, concealed light.

Only one light spot representing Li Fan shone clearly, allowing normal communication.

Zhou was deep in thought.

Each light spot in the starry sky represented a cultivator from the United Council of Ten Thousand Realms, and they could all be communicated with through this disk.

However, only Li Fan currently had permission to be contacted; the others were obscured by some kind of power.

Contact required their consent.

Zhou showed the Ten Thousand Realms disk to Law Transmitter Wei.

A moment later, the white-haired Wei sighed, "This United Council of Ten Thousand Realms seems to be real after all."

"This kind of technology is not something any random force can possess. And this puppet..."

"This Huang, that fellow, is truly derelict in his duty. Such an organization emerged in the Yellow World without us having any information about it."

Wei's face was somewhat grim.

Zhou remained noncommittal: "We'll see when we meet their so-called Longevity Realm experts. The rest are minor details. Only the Longevity Realm..."

"Cannot be fabricated and is the best indicator of an organization's foundation."

A hint of longing appeared in Wei's eyes: "The Longevity Realm... If it weren't for the restrictions of the Law Transmitter identity, I might have had a chance back then. Unfortunately..."

Zhou gave him a sidelong glance: "Are you even deceiving me now?"

Wei just shook his head slightly without arguing.

After a while, he suddenly said, "Right, thoroughly investigate those young ones who carried out the mission this time."

"He is so clear about your actions; there must be an insider."

Chapter 1057: Heavenly Sun Immortal Battle Puppet

“Do I need you to remind me? Those few youngsters were locked up as soon as they returned. However, no results have been extracted yet,” Zhou said lightly.

……

Li Fan emerged from the minor world of the Law Transmitter Zhou, appearing near the border of Tianquan Prefecture.

He glanced towards the direction of the幽狱 (You Yu - Dark Prison) not far away, but Li Fan eventually withdrew his gaze slowly.

“There will be a chance to go down and see. No rush now.”

Then, he sped towards the Spiritual Wood Realm.

“Junior Brother, is no one following us?”

After flying for a while, Li Fan suddenly asked in his mind.

A layer of transparent armor instantly appeared on his body, angular and completely enveloping Li Fan's physique.

Tianyang’s voice came from the armor: “Senior Brother, rest assured, the two tracking divine senses have been severed by me. Moreover, I have given them a small warning.”

Compared to five years ago, Tianyang’s voice was much more lively. The aftereffects of transforming into a puppet had been completely removed, making him no different from a normal cultivator.

And all of this was due to the change brought about by this immortal-grade [Battle Puppet].

This battle puppet, or battle armor, was precisely the confidence Li Fan had to dare to enter the meeting alone and face the two Law Transmitters this time.

After being tricked by Mo Ruxin, Li Fan was deeply stimulated.

Thus, he passed this pressure onto everyone in the Spiritual Wood Realm.

Not only did the ingenious craftsman scholar perform exceptionally well, completing the crafting of an immortal-grade puppet in just five years, but the Medicine King Sect also achieved significant results, making Li Fan very satisfied. However, this part will be briefly set aside for now.

After completely transforming, Tianyang’s strength underwent earth-shattering changes.

Even if Li Fan used all his strength, he couldn’t even break its defense. His divine abilities, such as Thread-Drawing Life-Slicing, Five Elements Annihilation Sword, and others, could not shake Tianyang in the slightest. Even divine sense attacks were like mud sinking into the sea, unable to stir up any ripples.

Only the imitation of the Chaotic Word Formula could bring trouble to Tianyang, but that was the extent of it.

Driven by the essence of origin power, a force transcending the mundane, Tianyang’s current strength was definitely not weaker than the newly established Longevity Realm experts in the Yellow World.

Perhaps his offensive means were somewhat lacking, but this immortal-grade puppet body was here. Even if defeated, it could only be suppressed and could not be destroyed.

With the Tianyang puppet, comparable to a Longevity Realm expert, serving as protective armor, Li Fan naturally did not take the two Law Transmitters seriously.

If it hadn't been for the unexpected discovery that Mo Ruxin was secretly controlling the entire Myriad Immortals Alliance, Li Fan would have planned to directly capture and subdue these two Law Transmitters.

The protection brought by Tianyang was all-encompassing. It wasn't just physical defense; even soul attacks needed to first disintegrate Tianyang’s soul will before Li Fan could be harmed.

How powerful was Tianyang’s will? In the Foundation Establishment stage, he could crystallize his existence for thousands of years, transforming into an eternal remnant thought. After becoming an immortal-grade puppet, it was further sublimated, making even Li Fan feel inadequate.

In short, under the protection of Tianyang’s armor, Li Fan felt an unprecedented sense of security. Even if he were to face Mo Ruxin directly at this moment, he would be full of confidence and fearless.

Tianyang brought Li Fan back to the Spiritual Wood Realm quickly.

Five years had passed, and the Spiritual Wood Realm had changed greatly again.

The minor worlds that were originally connected to the Spiritual Wood Realm through spatial tunnels, such as the Boundary Leaving World, the Empire, and the Beast Species World, had begun to slowly merge with the Spiritual Wood Realm.

Li Fan, by feigning the Heavenly Dao, gained insight into the method of world devouring and fusion after observing the Yellow World merging and splicing with other cultivation worlds.

However, with his current strength, achieving the level of the Yellow World was still somewhat difficult. He could only take an alternative path through the method of array refinement.

From a macroscopic perspective, the current Spiritual Wood Realm looked like a deformed monster with many minor worlds grafted onto it. However, beauty was never what Li Fan focused on; utility was enough. Moreover, this was Li Fan's first attempt. With practice, he believed his technique for "creating" and merging worlds would improve over time.

Besides the changes in the Spiritual Wood Realm itself, the Myriad Worlds United Association had also been subdivided into several different departments according to their functions. It truly looked like a well-established entity, no longer just an empty framework.

The [Pill Refinement] department, with the former members of the Medicine King Sect and others as its backbone.

The [Artifact Refining] department, led by the ingenious craftsman scholar, Fang Zaixian, and numerous apprentices.

The [Exploration] department, guided by the clone Li Qing, with elite death warriors selected from various minor worlds as its core strength.

And the [Understanding the Dao] department, mainly composed of young cultivators with outstanding talent like those from the Mountain and River Pavilion.

……

The scale was established, the momentum magnificent.

Li Fan did not alert them and went directly to a later-excavated vast space next to the underground secret chamber. Only he currently knew about this space, which was protected on all sides by seven-colored divine light.

Li Fan named this unformed department [World Destruction]. As its name suggested, the cultivators in this department would need to research various methods capable of destroying the Yellow World in the future.

Since this was quite astonishing, even though the cultivators in the United Association were absolutely submissive to Li Fan, he temporarily kept the existence of this department unknown to them.

“It seems I only need to find those equally extreme individuals.”

“The Yellow World is so vast; if I really search, there should be some.”

As Li Fan pondered this, he looked at the things wrapped in seven-colored light clusters within the [World Destruction] space.

Most of them were gray mold spots cultivated over the past five years, prepared for unforeseen circumstances. But there were also some new items.

Li Fan reached out, and a ball of seemingly faded seven-colored light weakly flew into his hand.

“The Heaven-Smiting Arrow…”

“By feigning the Heavenly Dao and being able to clearly see the strange power, I can finally replicate it.”

The Heaven-Smiting Arrow was the ultimate tool used by the cultivators of the Heavenly Alliance in previous cycles to resist the net of heaven. It used the destructive power of the strange phenomenon to cause localized destruction to the net of heaven. In the current era, without the Heavenly Profound Mirror replacing the net of heaven, the performance of the Heaven-Smiting Arrow resulted in the widespread outbreak of strange phenomena and the loss of control of the Yellow World’s Heavenly Dao.

The strange power of the Heaven-Smiting Arrow was not generated by Li Fan himself. Instead, he personally went to the areas where the strange phenomena erupted and collected it bit by bit himself. Then he wrapped and sealed it with the seven-colored divine light. One used, one less.

However, judging by the current frequency of strange phenomenon outbreaks in the Yellow World, there was no need to worry about running out for the time being.

Besides the Heaven-Smiting Arrow, the other major killing weapon in the [World Destruction] space was the Chaotic Word Formula.

Borrowing the experience from the automatic detonation in the 115th cycle and gaining improvement ideas from the ingenious craftsman scholar, the Chaotic Word Formula was engraved inside the puppet’s body and possessed a degree of intelligence. It could detonate the Chaotic Word Formula at a designated location and time according to Li Fan's requirements. Moreover, what was even more ingenious was that this puppet inherently possessed the function of interfering with karma, making it extremely difficult to pinpoint the mastermind behind the scenes through deduction.

Chapter 1058: Mutated Spiritual Qi

However, based on past experience, activating the Chaotic Word Formula in the Yellow World would inevitably attract the attention of the Dharma Transmission Celestial Venerable, summoning him back from the void.

With the Yellow World personally suppressed by the Dharma Transmission Celestial Venerable, it was almost impossible for any major trouble to arise. All sorts of demons and monsters would have to temporarily avoid his formidable power, so Li Fan generally would not consider this method.

In this seven-colored space, besides the two creations mentioned above, there was a third, relatively mature world-destruction plan.

That was to launch reinforced, miniature flying bodies toward the Immortal Ruins. These flying bodies were modeled after the principles of the Tianyang body transforming into a puppet, appearing as if they were alive.

Besides the part flying toward the Immortal Ruins to attract the attention of the immortals within, there was another half of the individual entities existing within the Yellow World. Once they entered the Immortal Ruins, their gaze, like human prying eyes, would alert the immortals of the Immortal Ruins. Then, following the connection between the flying bodies, they would traverse the void and lock onto the Yellow World, achieving the effect of destroying the world in an instant, just as Li Fan had unintentionally done before.

Beyond these three, all others were still under research and development, feasible in theory but not yet truly tested.

For instance, within the space of the Root of Heaven and Earth in Tianling Prefecture, cutting apart all those crisscrossing lines representing the principles of the Yellow World’s heaven and earth, destroying the foundation of the Yellow World, causing the world itself to naturally decay.

Or, for example, mass-producing magical artifacts imbued with the Divine Ability of the False Heaven's Dao and spreading them throughout the Yellow World. This would inevitably cause chaos in the operation of heaven and earth, filling it with erroneous Heavenly Dao instructions, potentially even overriding the original mechanisms of heaven and earth that truly needed to be executed. This would result in worldwide upheaval, and the Yellow World should subsequently undergo a degree of self-adjustment, perhaps even triggering dramatic changes like the "Dharma cannot be cultivated concurrently."

...

Li Fan currently still possessed the origin of the Tianxuan Mirror, and with the highest level of authority, he could eagerly peruse the sealed archives of the Myriad Immortals Alliance.

The myriad hardships and calamities that had occurred on the Yellow World's land in the past had long been forgotten due to the influence of the power of the Wuyou Celestial Venerable. Only Li Fan picked them up again and regarded them as treasures.

The various world-destruction measures in the World Destruction space were currently Li Fan's only key to contend with the strength of the Longevity Realm and even higher powers. As the sole surviving pure land in the Uttermost Darkness Star Sea, the existence of the Yellow World was a prerequisite for cultivators to survive.

Mastering the methods of world destruction meant holding the bargaining chip to negotiate with everyone in the Yellow World. Not only would it be of great use in this era, but as long as Li Fan had not left the Yellow World, this place remained of utmost importance to him.

Therefore, Li Fan simply split off a Saint Embryo and then used the Faceless True Immortal Statue to bestow cultivation, forcefully raising the Saint Embryo to the Golden Core realm. This was enough to support its research work in the World Destruction space.

After carefully reinforcing the seven-colored divine light seal around it, Li Fan quietly left the place and arrived in the Imperial Minor World.

Due to the fusion with the Spirit Wood World, the world itself underwent some subtle changes. A large number of exotic beasts in the Empire died because they could not adapt to this drastic change in heaven and earth. The remaining ones were listless, taking nearly two to three years to slowly regain their spirit.

Now, in the center of the Empire, where the original royal castle was located, a vaulted building had been added. That was the testing ground established by the Myriad Worlds United Association in the Empire.

The Dao Yi Insects capable of synthesizing spiritual qi, after three generations of continuous improvements, now had an efficiency in generating spiritual qi that was nearly doubled. Moreover, the probability of occasional mutations causing the Heaven and Earth Furnace to fail had been significantly reduced. Now, one Heaven and Earth Furnace could stably and continuously release spiritual qi for a hundred years, basically meeting the needs of the Myriad Worlds United Association.

Five years had passed, and the overall concentration of spiritual qi in the merged Spirit Wood World was no less than that of the Yellow World. Of course, this was partly due to the vastness of the Yellow World.

The focus of the work for the Empire's Xiao Qing, Xiao Hong, and others had shifted to coordinating the fusion of the Imperial Minor World and the Spirit Wood World. As for the Empress, Li Fan had given her another task.

In the dome laboratory, the Empress was intently staring at the dense swarm of Dao Yi Insects in the space before her, which resembled black mist, not even noticing Li Fan's silent arrival.

Li Fan glanced at the experimental records.

"Ancestor Dao Yi Insect Variant, Seventy-Sixth Test."

"After fusing with the splitting fungus, although the lifespan of this variant has been greatly shortened, its reproductive efficiency has increased by more than a hundredfold."

"According to calculations, under sufficient resources, one Dao Yi Insect can proliferate its population to the level of hundreds of millions in just seven days."

"Key record information: The spiritual qi produced by this type of Dao Yi Insect can still be absorbed by cultivators, and they will not feel any abnormality initially. However, if the amount absorbed exceeds half of the spiritual power stored in their body, it will have a subtle, pervasive effect on the cultivator. The cultivator will become more irritable and aggressive."

"More crucially, they will develop a certain dependency on the mutated spiritual qi, feeling that the normal spiritual qi is not 'pure' enough."

...

Li Fan looked at the detailed experimental information recorded by the Empress and nodded with satisfaction. The Imperial bloodline, after all, originated from Xu Ke’s Saint Embryo transforming the blood, a lineage carried forward. The Empress had perfectly inherited Xu Ke's talent. Many experimental projects she had led over the past five years had seen good breakthroughs, especially the research on Dao Yi Insect variants.

The spiritual qi produced by the Dao Yi Insects would undergo many subtle changes in these variants. The one that now made cultivators more irritable was just one of them. Previously, there were others that could make cultivators lazy and lose their drive, or spiritual qi concentrations that were too high, leading to a "spiritual intoxication" effect upon absorption. If absorption continued, it could even cause irreversible, destructive damage to the cultivator's own consciousness.

There were countless such variations. Although these mutated spiritual qi could not destroy the Yellow World, they could, to some extent, modify the cultivators, causing cultivators in a certain area to uniformly develop a fixed personality.

Li Fan was genuinely interested in this path. After sealing the data of this new variant and over a hundred sample insects into his own grotto-heaven, Li Fan woke up the Empress, who was still engrossed in her research.

"Greetings, Envoy!" A hint of nervousness flashed in the Empress's eyes as she quickly bowed in salute.

"What is the progress on searching for the Holy Emperor?" Li Fan asked.

"Half of the minor worlds have been cleared. We have not yet found any trace of the Holy Emperor. We estimate it will take another five years at most to explore all the remaining worlds and finally pinpoint the Holy Emperor's hiding place," the Empress replied truthfully.

Chapter 1059: A Heavenly King Like a Minion

"If we are lucky, we might even find the Holy Emperor tomorrow," the Empress's tone carried a hint of excitement.
