"After finding the Holy Emperor, do not make any rash contact. The Holy Emperor's sudden departure back then likely has a hidden reason. Report to the Federation first, and then I will make the final decision," Li Fan said in a deep voice.

The Empress nodded, indicating she understood.

During these five years, Li Fan had shared the information of all explored grotto-heavens and minor worlds in the Yellow World with the Empire.

Through a certain type of strange beast capable of freely traversing space, the Empire had screened all these minor worlds. The purpose was to pinpoint Xu Ke's hiding place.

In the 115th generation, before the Heavenly Dao Bai finally fought against the Transmission Law Celestial Venerable.

The figure carrying a coffin who appeared beside the Heavenly Dao Bai was probably Xu Ke.

As for what was inside the coffin, why he suddenly left the empire he single-handedly created, and why he even abandoned his beloved pets...

All these questions could be answered once he was found.

However, Li Fan was actually not overly concerned about this. It was merely a means to placate the people of the Empire.

After revealing the news concerning Xu Ke, the Empire became truly convinced and their work efficiency more than doubled. Furthermore, Li Fan did not need to supervise or urge them.

After giving his instructions, Li Fan arrived at the deepest part of the Dome Laboratory.

In the darkness, red threads drifted about like swimming snakes.

This was the red rope that Mister Bai had left in the Empire for Xu Ke to use as self-defense.

Just a single strand had killed a top-tier expert of the Demon Race, almost comparable to the full-power strike of a newly-formed Longevity cultivator today.

Out of caution and apprehension towards Mister Bai, Li Fan did not directly interact with it in this lifetime.

Instead, he had the Empire and others conduct research on it directly.

On the surface, the red rope appeared to be a form of the Way of the Sword. However, after years of continuous experimentation, the Empire discovered that the red rope was more like a living thing, possessing its own spirituality.

To operate it did not require spiritual energy, but rather the essence, spirit, and vitality of a living being—this profound and mysterious substance. Or, simply put, the lifespan of a living being.

Furthermore, ordinary living beings were not favored by this red rope. It only showed interest in devouring those who were outstanding and thriving within their species.

After being nourished with a large number of strange beasts, the red rope, which was originally only an extremely fine strand, had grown into the shape of a thin snake within the Dome Laboratory. Even protected by several layers of formations, it inspired awe and fear just by looking at it.

With his clone having built its foundation with the Black Sword Heaven's Marvel, Li Fan was quite familiar with the Way of the Sword in the Yellow World.

After careful study, Li Fan discovered that the red rope contained not just the Way of the Sword, but more so the **Way of Balance**.

To injure others, one must pay a price. Thus, one must first injure oneself.

In the eyes of Heaven and Earth, all living beings are equal.

A mortal and a cultivator who has reached the Dao Integration stage are no different.

Therefore, wielding this sharp sword, one could slay a Dao Integration cultivator with a mortal body.

This was a classic ancient theory, with similar records appearing in many ancient texts Li Fan had seen.

Mister Bai was the last Celestial Venerable of Longevity practicing the ancient methods in the Yellow World, so it was not surprising that the divine abilities he imparted possessed such characteristics.

However, with the change of eras, even in the eyes of Heaven and Earth, the statuses between living beings are no longer the same. The higher a cultivator’s cultivation, the greater their weight in the world, and the more they are resented by Heaven and Earth.

For ordinary people to achieve a "one-for-one exchange" was now impossible.

Consequently, the actual effectiveness of this red rope had been discounted.

Li Fan calculated that the power unleashed by a single strand of the red rope was enough to destroy the body of a cultivator at the Spirit Transformation stage. However, those practicing the new method have their bodies connected to Heaven and Earth and would not perish from this, only sustaining severe injuries. As for those at the Dao Integration stage, they could easily block the attack of the red rope.

But this was only the smallest measurable unit of the red rope. If all the power of the red rope, which was now as thick as a bowl, were released... even Li Fan was not confident he could preserve his life against it without the protection of the Celestial Sun Immortal Puppet.

Currently, the red rope seemed to have reached its limit and was unwilling to consume more.

Li Fan gazed at the red rope swimming in the darkness and fell into deep thought.

"The essence of the red rope is to use the power of the Yellow World's Heavenly Dao against the enemy. It is not misuse, but an exchange within the scope permitted by the rules."

"Using the power of the red rope will still consume the cultivator's own lifespan."

"But by sacrificing only a little lifespan, one can defeat or even kill a Spirit Transformation cultivator..."

"If this spreads, those willing to do so will flock to it."

"Perhaps it can serve as the signboard of the Myriad Worlds Federation."

"Call it..."

"The Sword Wielder."

Li Fan's eyes shone brightly. He ordered someone to extract nearly a hundred strands from the red rope and seal them separately using the Seven-Colored Divine Light.

"As long as one joins the Myriad Worlds Federation, they can wield this sword to slay Spirit Transformation cultivators."

"Who would dare say our Federation has no foundation?"

"Moreover, slaying newly-formed cultivators aligns with the will of Heaven, so there is no worry about attracting backlash from Heaven and Earth due to excessive killing."

"Truly marvelous!"

Even after a portion was drawn out, the remaining free-floating red rope did not resume feeding. It seemed the total amount of the red rope in the Yellow World was fixed; some needed to be consumed before it could regenerate.

Although the red rope was profound, Li Fan would not use it himself. He would only give it to members of the Myriad Worlds Federation as a defensive magic treasure.

"Coincidentally, some of the death row soldiers sent to explore the blood-colored river have successfully returned. I can grant them this magic treasure first, and then formally teach them immortal techniques, as a form of encouragement," Li Fan thought, leaving the Empire's minor world area.

He arrived in the **Seeking Depths** area.

On countless empty pedestals, the first monument had quietly descended.

The stone tablet was inscribed with the name and appearance of the cultivator who retrieved a piece of lost history from the blood-colored river. Furthermore, the influence of that piece of history could be viewed through this stone tablet.

The first discovery was actually a scene of little consequence.

The time point was approximately before the immortal path was severed.

Visitors from other cultivation worlds arrived in a grand procession aboard more than ten immortal boats.

Various sects of the Yellow World had dispatched welcoming teams and held a grand exchange conference.

It was bustling and full of vitality, completely different from the lifeless Yellow World of today.

Every cultivator who saw this scene could not help but feel a faint sense of loss and sadness.

There was a very interesting detail in this scene. Li Fan actually saw the figure of the Profound Heaven King, Xuanyuan Hong, during this exchange event. However, at that time, he was merely one of the many cultivators responsible for hosting, standing like a minion, watching the senior cultivators with a nervous and excited expression.

It was probably unimaginable to everyone present that this inconspicuous minor cultivator would later become the last ascender of the Yellow World and take on the heavy responsibility of saving the world.

Chapter 1060: The Counterattack Finally Begins

Li Fan’s gaze remained focused on the phantom of the Profound Heaven King.

Xuanyuan Hong at this point in time did not show much difference compared to other ordinary cultivators.

If Li Fan had not already learned about the Profound Heaven King through the fragmented memories of Ji Yuzhen, he would not have believed that such a seemingly ordinary person would become the protagonist of an era in the future. His influence on the Yellow World would even persist to this day.

The scene recorded on the stone tablet did not last long.

In the midst of a joyous gathering where hosts and guests were equally delighted, it suddenly vanished.

Although this first image obtained from the river of blood was of little value, it undoubtedly marked a good beginning, leading to a breakthrough in the work of the World Alliance's [Seeking the Deep] department.

It is said that the beginning is the hardest part; with the first success, the second and third are bound to follow soon.

Li Fan’s true body, as the Superior Envoy, did not personally issue the commendation. Instead, he handed the red string to his clone, Li Qing, who then bestowed it upon the recipient.

In front of all the cultivators in the Seeking the Deep department, the man named Ji Ling accepted the reward of the red string with a flushed face.

Because he had consumed a significant amount of lifespan exploring the river of blood, Ji Ling, though only twenty-three years old, already looked like a middle-aged man in his forties or fifties.

However, after cultivating the true Nascent Soul stage technique taught by Li Qing, he would have the opportunity to advance from the Nascent Soul realm and thus gain more lifespan.

At this moment, with surging emotions, Ji Ling stood before the stone tablet engraved with his name and shared his experience of exploring the river of blood with the nearly a thousand cultivators of the Seeking the Deep department gathered below.

Watching those who were originally born into nobler statuses and possessed higher cultivation levels now listening intently to his lecture filled Ji Ling with an indescribable sense of accomplishment.

“If not for the boundless compassion of the True Immortal, how could I, a mere mortal, have such fortune?”

Ji Ling was filled with infinite emotion, and his faith in the Compassionate Immortal was further elevated.

Li Fan, hidden in the shadows, witnessed this scene entirely, smiling faintly.

...

After the World Alliance was set on the right track, it developed rapidly at an unimaginable pace.

The Messenger Zhou also did not make Li Fan wait long; news soon arrived.

“It has been verified. Among the current five highest-ranking Messengers of the Immortal Alliance, three are prodigies who cultivate the techniques of the Profound Heaven Sect!” Zhou gritted his teeth.

“As for the remaining Chen and Shang, even if they haven't been possessed by a fiend of the Profound Heaven Sect, their minds must have been completely bewitched by them. They deserve to die!”

“We can begin our operation!”

Messenger Zhou immediately invited Li Fan to meet and discuss the details.

Having waited for a long time, Li Fan readily agreed.

With a thought, Tianyang transformed from his armor form back into the appearance of a cultivator.

He retained the appearance of a child in his early teens from his life before, making no other changes to his exterior.

When the two returned to Messenger Zhou’s private small world, both messengers’ gazes fell upon Tianyang simultaneously.

“Who is this…”

At Li Fan’s signal, Tianyang did not suppress his aura but intentionally radiated the might of a Longevity realm combatant outwards. This obvious display allowed the two messengers to immediately recognize Tianyang's extraordinariness.

They dared not show any disdain because of his child-like appearance.

Let alone experts in the Longevity realm, even among the Messengers themselves, there were many with peculiar habits.

“This is Elder Tian of our World Alliance, responsible for assisting with matters related to apprehending the remnants of the Profound Heaven Sect, Mo Rubing, and others,” Li Fan introduced with a serious expression.

Tianyang, possessing the demeanor of a Longevity realm expert, merely snorted in response, not even glancing directly at Messengers Zhou and Wei.

Although Tianyang displayed the strength of the Longevity realm, Zhou and Wei had once stood at the pinnacle of power in the Myriad Immortals Alliance, or rather, the Yellow World. Being treated with such disrespect inevitably caused them some displeasure.

While they dared not show it outwardly, they exchanged a look and hatched a plan.

“We can use this opportunity to test the other party’s strength.”

“Indeed. Mere prestige is not enough to truly confirm the status of a Longevity realm expert.”

Zhou and Wei exchanged glances, and then Zhou proposed, “Recently, we have been very fortunate to find news of another companion who left the Messenger Council. Perhaps we can persuade him to act with us.”

“Indeed, this person’s temperament is quite strange. When he loses control, he recognizes no one, not even Jiang. Relying on just the two of us, we might not be able to persuade him. If Senior Tian would assist…”

Li Fan instantly understood the subtle intentions of these two.

However, he could also understand. For those who considered themselves thoroughly familiar with the Yellow World, the sudden appearance of a Longevity realm expert they had never heard of before was difficult to accept immediately.

Li Fan pretended to consult Tianyang, then nodded in agreement.

Without delay, Zhou and Wei immediately led the way to find the third Messenger.

On the way, they provided Li Fan with a detailed introduction: “This person is named Huang. He was born deformed, with two heads and four arms. He was abandoned by his own parents on the roadside and was about to starve to death when he fortunately encountered the Heavenly Venerable Messenger. From then on, he became one of the most loyal Messengers.”

“He cultivates the special technique taught by the Heavenly Venerable, subtly tempering his physical body to its extreme. When fighting, he can tear apart ordinary Dao Harmonization experts with sheer brute strength alone.”

“Moreover, this person’s frenzy is actually a façade. At all times, Huang remains in a state of absolute, rational calm. The reason for this disguise is actually a strategy to make others lose the will to fight before the battle even begins.”

“However, the facts prove this method is indeed effective. Over the years, members of the Messenger Council generally avoid provoking him. Even when he seeks them out, most just hold their breath and endure it.”

...

It seemed that Zhou and Wei were also somewhat intimidated by Huang, as their description was exceptionally detailed.

Time passed amidst their conversation, and they drew nearer to their destination.

Upon reaching Quyang Prefecture, the surrounding air gradually grew hot.

Fire-attribute energies roamed unpredictably in the air, bursting forth sporadically. Occasionally, giant fireballs suddenly descended from the sky, smashing onto the ground with a roar, stirring up towering waves of lava.

“Where is this…”

“The Ten Thousand Mile Flame Burning Beach?”

During the 114th era, he had helped construct the Heavenly Profound Spirit Locking Array in the [Spirit Transformation Gorge] deep within this area.

“Could it be…”

Recalling the ominous green river in the Spirit Transformation Gorge, capable of suppressing spiritual energy activity, a guess surfaced in Li Fan’s mind.

And the reality matched his guess.

Passing through the Ten Thousand Mile Flame Burning Beach, the three arrived above the Spirit Transformation Gorge.

The Immortal Alliance cultivators mining Spirit Transformation Stones in this area were completely unaware of their arrival.

(End of Chapter)

Chapter 1061: Suppressing the Desolate with Three Parts of Strength

"The Desolate is slumbering in the Spirit Transformation Green River, at the deepest part of the Spirit Transformation Gorge."

"The Spirit Transformation Stones capable of suppressing spiritual energy fluctuations here are condensed from the water of the Spirit Transformation Green River over accumulated time."

"If the Spirit Transformation Stones have such effects, the Spirit Transformation Green River is even more terrifying. Even an Integration cultivator risks drowning if they stay in it for too long."

"But this place is an unparalleled cultivation holy land for the Desolate. Only when all spiritual energy fluctuations are suppressed to the extreme can he concentrate on tempering his physical body."

Zhou’s expression was solemn. He spread out a protective shield and led the group to dive into the Spirit Transformation Green River.

They descended continuously deeper.

Unlike ordinary rivers, which become darker the deeper they go, the water of the Spirit Transformation Green River seemed to be its own light source. No matter how long they submerged, the surroundings remained an unchanging, unsettling, eerie green.

The deep green water acted as an isolation zone, gradually shielding even Li Fan's divine sense, which was stronger than ordinary people's.

However, Li Fan was somewhat relieved after Li Fan inquired with Tianyang and learned that his puppet body materials and the essence of the source power were completely unaffected by the water of this Spirit Transformation River.

Wшw ⊙⊙￠ ○

Seemingly sensing Li Fan’s unease, Tianyang proactively laid a layer of protective power over Li Fan.

These slight energy fluctuations attracted the attention of the two Law Transmitters.

"Senior Tian indeed possesses remarkable means!"

This area was one of the major secret locations of the Immortal Alliance, so they were certainly not visiting for the first time and had long mastered methods to barely move in the water of the Spirit Transformation Green River.

But for this Elder Tian from the Myriad Realms Federation to appear completely unaffected by this place…

Their assessment of Tianyang’s strength rose slightly again.

"We've arrived..."

Looking at a whirlpool below, the Law Transmitter Zhou said softly.

Li Fan looked over and saw what seemed to be a gaunt figure hidden within the whirlpool.

The whirlpool sustained itself for a moment but suddenly calmed down. Then, the direction of the vortex reversed, violently spewing out the Spirit Transformation River water upwards.

Li Fan then realized that the whirlpool was generated by the thin figure’s inhalation and exhalation of the river water!

"Is this the Desolate?"

Almost reduced to a skeleton, the Desolate’s appearance seemed completely unrelated to a powerful physical body.

But the faint dark gold color of his skin, conspicuous even in the deep green of the riverbed, hinted at the extraordinary nature of his body.

"The Desolate is currently sleeping. If we wake him abruptly, we will inevitably face his stormy attacks," Zhou said, looking at Tianyang.

Li Fan's heart moved. Tianyang showed a look of arrogance and flew forward, slapping the Desolate on the head.

The eyelids of Law Transmitters Zhou and Wei twitched.

They instinctively pulled Li Fan and moved a short distance straight up.

After a moment of silence, a terrifying aura, like a volcanic eruption, suddenly emerged from the depths of the riverbed.

The Desolate opened his eyes in his sleep, ruthless and brutal, like a beast from the primordial age.

He instantly locked onto the small body of Tianyang.

Wisps of golden light emerged from his eyes. The Desolate looked at Tianyang standing quietly before him and raised his hand high.

Boom!

The calm and silent Spirit Transformation Green River suddenly surged.

The river water instantly became turbulent. Li Fan and the other two watching on the side could only barely maintain their stance in the rushing current.

However...

The Desolate's palm, about to descend with destructive power, was firmly grasped by a tender hand.

It could not move an inch further.

"Hmm?"

The Desolate’s expression changed drastically.

He attempted to break free from his firmly locked right hand.

But even though he unleashed all his strength, he still could not escape. His body instantly shrank; the Desolate transformed from a gaunt middle-aged man into a starved-looking young child.

Having escaped Tianyang's control, he rapidly retreated.

"Who exactly are you?"

Having been defeated by a stranger in his absolute domain of self-confidence, the shock in the Desolate’s heart was immense.

He did not display the madness rumored of him but cautiously observed Tianyang.

"Haha, Desolate, I never thought I would see the day you got embarrassed!"

The voice of Law Transmitter Wei came from above. The Desolate then noticed the three watching: Li Fan and the two others.

"No need to be surprised, Desolate. This is Senior Tian from the Myriad Realms Federation. His strength has reached the Longevity Realm. It is normal for you to be defeated," Zhou explained with undisguised smiles.

"Myriad Realms Federation? What is that?!" The Desolate had no pleasant expression for these two former colleagues.

"How long have I been asleep?"

"Only fifteen years?" The Desolate seemed somewhat surprised and uncertain.

"I should be asking you. You claim to monitor the Profound Yellow, yet you know nothing about such a powerful hidden force as the Myriad Realms Federation within the Profound Yellow Realm?" Zhou transmitted privately.

He then related everything that had recently happened in the Immortal Alliance.

"Remnants of the Profound Heaven caused trouble, possessed a Law Transmitter, seized the nest, and gained control of the Myriad Immortal Alliance?"

Hearing of such a change, the Desolate did not appear particularly enraged.

Instead, he calmly began to ponder.

He continuously inquired about various details from Law Transmitter Zhou.

"How much have you found out about the background of this Myriad Realms Federation?"

"Nothing... Don't look at me like that. This federation seems to have appeared out of thin air; there's no way to trace its origins or background. It doesn't match any recorded hidden powerhouses. If the Profound Yellow Realm wasn't the only cultivation world left in this sea of stars, I would really suspect they are from another cultivation world."

...

The three Law Transmitters quickly exchanged information.

Afterward, they all looked towards Li Fan and Tianyang.

"Thanks to Senior Tian's action, otherwise, given the Desolate's morning temper, he would have certainly caused a scene and attracted the attention of the cultivators in the Spirit Transformation Gorge above. Perhaps Chen would have noticed something," Wei said with a hint of relief, cupping his hands.

The Desolate looked displeased, while Zhou wore a jovial expression.

"Your strength is great."

"I only used three parts of my strength to suppress you,"

Without instructions from Li Fan, Tianyang saw the Desolate's unwillingness to concede and spoke to soothe him.

The Desolate's face grew even grimier.

Because he knew that a powerhouse like Tianyang had no need to exaggerate.

"Three parts of strength..." The Desolate instantly felt a sense of powerlessness mixed with hope.

He had been continuously tempering his body day and night for thousands of years, following the method of the Heavenly Venerable.

He faintly felt that he had reached some kind of limit.

Because he was a Law Transmitter, he could no longer defy the principles of heaven and earth.

His path of cultivation seemed to end here.

But the appearance of this Senior Tian seemed to offer him a glimmer of hope.

The Desolate had always been straightforward. In front of everyone, he directly asked for guidance.

(End of Chapter)

Chapter 1062: The Rehearsal for World Destruction

With Li Fan’s permission, Tianyang’s body underwent an instant transformation.

A faint cyan light enveloped him, and his outer skin took on a metallic texture.

Tianyang spoke slowly in a voice that was half mechanical, half childlike. "A body of flesh and blood has an inherent disadvantage. How can it compare to a body of metal and stone?"

"Like me, all sorts of rare treasures in the world can be turned into nourishment to strengthen the body."

"The theoretical upper limit of the Great Dao's strength is the limit of my body!"

As Tianyang spoke, he slowly clenched his fist, as if an infinite suction force was generated from his palm.

Deep within the Spirit Transformation River, a massive vortex instantly formed. The immense power it generated made it almost impossible for Li Fan and the three Law Transmitters, including the Desolate, to maintain a stable posture amidst the turbulent currents.

After gathering his power, Tianyang slowly threw a punch towards the Desolate.

The faces of the three Law Transmitters all changed color.

However, the Desolate was locked by the force of the punch and could not move an inch.

Just as Tianyang's slow punch was about to hit him head-on, a burst of golden light suddenly erupted from the Desolate's two heads and four eyes. The sound of his bones shattering like a torrential rain echoed out, and his originally withered body instantly swelled up like a balloon.

With muscles as sharp and angular as if carved by a knife all over his body, the Desolate roared, raising all four hands to guard his front, attempting to block Tianyang's small fist.

A muffled sound like a thunderclap rang out.

The two fists met, and they were locked in a stalemate.

A moment later, Tianyang slowly retracted his fist. "This time, I used five-tenths of my strength. But it is far from my limit."

"However, it should be your limit."

With those words, the Desolate's entire body collapsed like soft mud.

After a brief shock, the Law Transmitters Zhou and Wei saw that the Desolate was not in mortal danger.

It was merely due to excessive exhaustion.

The defeated Desolate did not become enraged or resentful. Instead, he began to ponder the words Tianyang had spoken.

"To replace flesh and blood with a body of metal and stone?"

In truth, he had considered this path before.

However, since he was a human cultivator, he ultimately had reservations about abandoning his flesh and blood to become an existence akin to a mechanical puppet.

The most crucial point was that there was no precedent to follow.

Once the transformation was complete, there would be absolutely no turning back. If the power of the metal and stone body ultimately proved inferior to the flesh and blood body, would he not become a laughingstock among all Law Transmitters?

But the appearance of Senior Tian today offered him a brand new path that seemed to have infinite potential.

"Perhaps I can use this to break the shackles of the Heavenly Venerable and become the only existence with the power of eternal life among the Law Transmitters." A dangerous thought emerged from the depths of the Desolate's heart. Once it appeared, it began to erode the Desolate's mind uncontrollably.

Li Fan, observing the subtle changes in the Desolate's expression from not far away, knew that the seed had been planted. He couldn't help but smile inwardly.

Without essence of origin power, it was fundamentally impossible to reach Tianyang's current strength purely through the transformation of a metal and stone body. Once the Desolate began this irreversible attempt but repeatedly hit walls and fell into despair,

At that time, he would inevitably seek Tianyang's help at all costs. Being indebted to another, Li Fan would have ten thousand ways to control this person.

Using the power from that recent punch, Tianyang quietly absorbed a large amount of Spirit Transformation River water.

Seeing that the objective had been achieved, Li Fan had Tianyang revert to his original form and return to his side.

The two Law Transmitters also quickly stepped forward to heal the Desolate.

"This place is not suitable for staying long. Let's return first to discuss matters."

The group then quietly flew out of the Spirit Transformation Ravine.

The disturbance in the Spirit Transformation River caused by the previous fight had finally attracted the attention of the cultivators guarding the Spirit Transformation Ravine.

However, after investigating, they found no cause.

According to the 万仙盟's (Myriad Immortals Alliance's) principle of not causing trouble for themselves, they did not choose to report the matter.

In the private small world of Law Transmitter Zhou.

Tianyang's action this time, crushing Law Transmitter the Desolate, undeniably confirmed his strength at the eternal life realm.

Thus, everyone began to formally discuss the next step of the plan.

Still on the top floor of a high-rise building in the Neon Light Sea.

The Desolate's injuries had already healed during the journey back. One of his heads had its eyes closed, while the other secretly observed Tianyang behind Li Fan.

Tianyang was also pretending to be asleep with his eyes closed.

Li Fan, Zhou, and Wei discussed the matters.

"With the Desolate's participation, the possibility of persuading Jiang to convene the [Oath of Law Transmitters] is almost one hundred percent."

"We just need to lure him out according to the plan."

Li Fan interjected at the right moment, "According to the evaluation of the elders of the Federation, combined with the current situation of the Xuanhuang Realm, a proposal has been finalized."

"We need to create enough momentum, and this trouble must be something that Law Transmitter Jiang of the Myriad Immortals Alliance cannot resolve. But it cannot truly destroy the Xuanhuang Realm..."

Li Fan paused, revealing a mysterious smile. "Gentlemen, behold this plan. How is it?"

He tapped the empty air with his index finger, and a small golden light sphere floated closer.

After checking the contents of the light sphere, a trace of surprise flashed in the eyes of Law Transmitters Zhou and Wei.

"Good." After a discussion, the two nodded.

"Excellent. In that case, our Myriad Worlds Federation can officially begin preparations. However, the performance needs to be realistic, and we will need the cooperation of you two."

"Rest assured. Although we were expelled from the Council of Law Transmitters, we have been deeply rooted for many years and still have some control over the various regions of the Immortal Alliance. We will certainly have no problem assisting your Federation in carrying out this great play of world destruction," Law Transmitter Zhou said in a deep voice.

After further detailed discussion, Li Fan and Tianyang left the place.

Returning to the Spirit Wood Realm, Tianyang poured out the Spirit Transformation River water he had collected. Experts like the Master of Ingenuity were tasked with studying it to see if replication and mass production were possible.

Li Fan, on the other hand, entered the [World Destruction] space and took out one of the experimental subjects.

Although it was a performance intended to attract Law Transmitter Jiang, in Li Fan's view, this time was a rehearsal for the final destruction of this world.

"The various arrangements can be put in place in advance through these Law Transmitters during this opportunity. Law Transmitters are intrinsically linked to the Law Transmitting Heavenly Venerable. By then, even if the Faceless True Immortal and the Immortal Ruins Immortal can vaguely sense someone plotting behind the scenes, their first thought will be to blame the Law Transmitters."

"With the current strength of the Law Transmitters, even if they cannot directly contend with True Immortals yet, they should be able to hold out for a moment..."

Thinking this, Li Fan activated the full-load soul-burning state.

He began creating the necessary props for world destruction with maximum efficiency.

Slowly, the World Destruction space, which had seemed somewhat empty, gradually became filled.

Three months of preparation time passed in a flash.

Under the conspiracy between Li Fan and the three Law Transmitters, unusual incidents began to subtly emerge in the various regions of the Myriad Immortals Alliance.

Chapter 1063: Dao Yi Devours Heaven and Earth

In Shilin Prefecture, the first change noticed by the cultivators was that the spiritual energy between heaven and earth seemed to have become thinner.

This was no small matter. After receiving feedback from the cultivators, Shilin Immortal City immediately sent people to investigate.

According to the measurements, this was not the illusion of everyone.

It was that the spiritual energy concentration of the entire Shilin Prefecture had indeed decreased compared to before.

Although the degree of this decrease was not large, it still caused panic among the cultivators of Shilin Prefecture.

Furthermore, because this unusual phenomenon seemed to occur only within the borders of Shilin Prefecture, and there were no precedents to draw upon, the cultivators of Shilin Prefecture could only investigate the cause themselves first.

The result was astonishing.

In the Hundred Stone Grotto-Heaven of Shilin Prefecture, which was a huge underground cavern at the border of the prefecture, a type of black worm had unexpectedly appeared at some point.

These worms were dense, occupying almost the entire underground cavern.

They greedily devoured and absorbed the spiritual energy between heaven and earth, multiplying and proliferating at a terrifying speed.

The sight of the black worms filling their vision sent a chill down the hearts of almost all the cultivators who witnessed it.

After finding the cause of the anomaly, the cultivators of Shilin Prefecture quickly responded.

They organized cultivators to go to the Hundred Stone Grotto-Heaven to carry out a large-scale extermination of these black worms.

Initially, they thought that with the power of cultivators to move mountains and overturn seas, eliminating these worms would be easy.

However, the severity of the situation far exceeded the imagination of the cultivators in Shilin Prefecture.

First, the vitality of these black worms was unbelievably tenacious.

They fed on spiritual energy, so after a cultivator’s spiritual power attack struck them, a portion would be devoured, weakening the attack slightly.

This also meant that the more black worms there were, the stronger their "resistance" to spiritual power techniques became.

Given the density of the black worms in the underground Hundred Stone Grotto-Heaven, even a Nascent Soul cultivator’s attack would be ineffective. Instead, they might be surrounded and have their spiritual energy completely drained, leading to a tragic death.

And how many Soul Transformation cultivators were there in Shilin Prefecture? Faced with the vast ocean of underground black worms, a dozen or twenty Soul Transformation cultivators were like a drop in the ocean.

Logically, this situation should have required a Dao Integration cultivator to resolve.

However, unfortunately, the Dao Integration cultivator stationed in Shilin Prefecture had left Shilin Prefecture for some unknown reason some time ago and had not returned.

The communications sent to him also met with silence, receiving no reply.

Therefore, the worm extermination operation in Shilin Prefecture quickly fell into a predicament shortly after it began.

The only thing that slightly reassured the cultivators of Shilin Prefecture was that these black worms seemed to have no intention of leaving the underground or expanding outwards.

But having such terrifying creatures living underground made anyone feel uneasy and unable to eat or sleep well.

The Shilin Immortal City, in its helplessness, could only choose to request aid from the Immortal Alliance headquarters.

Deep within the underground Hundred Stone Grotto-Heaven.

The projection of Transmitter Zhou observed the black worms crawling all over the walls of the cavern, a flash of fear in her eyes.

She had witnessed firsthand how these things had multiplied from just one to their current state.

Initially, she hadn't taken Li Fan's words about them being "a little bit harmful" very seriously.

But now, she was avoiding them for fear of being contaminated and dared not come here in person.

"Fellow Daoist, are you sure this thing won't get out of control?" she asked with a grim expression.

Li Fan, however, stroked the Dao Yi Insect Mother lying in his hand and smiled, "Relax. The Profound Yellow World is our shared home. How could our association rashly use this without absolute certainty?"

"All the black worms are born from this Dao Yi Insect Mother in my hand. Their lives are all linked to the Insect Mother. As long as it is killed, this plague will collapse on its own."

As if sensing the killing intent in Li Fan's heart, the plump Insect Mother rolled over in place and nervously nudged against Li Fan's hand with its body.

Transmitter Zhou stared at the Insect Mother for a long time before nodding slightly.

"It is estimated that within a month, the spiritual energy concentration in Shilin Prefecture will drop to its extreme. The resulting spiritual energy vacuum will cause a massive spiritual energy storm to sweep across the surrounding prefectures. At that time, we will lift the [Spirit Sealing Barrier]."

"At that time, following these storms, the black worms will spread throughout the entire Profound Yellow World in a very short time."

In front of Li Fan, an illusory light projection simulating this disaster appeared.

"It is estimated that the entire process will not exceed seven days."

"By the time the Myriad Immortals Alliance reports through the layers, makes decisions through the layers, and then makes a decision... everything will be too late."

"At that time, the cultivators of the Profound Yellow World will face an era of Dharma decline that arrives suddenly."

Li Fan explained the entire plan to Transmitter Zhou with some excitement.

Transmitter Zhou narrowed her eyes, and for some reason, a ominous premonition suddenly arose in her heart.

However, such a massive organization as the Myriad Worlds Association would surely not allow the Profound Yellow World to truly be destroyed. It must be under control.

Transmitter Zhou felt slightly relieved.

"Although these black worms are terrifying, they can at most only catch people off guard. Once the cultivators of the Myriad Immortals Alliance react collectively, it will not be too difficult to exterminate these black worms."

Li Fan knew she was telling the truth, and he smiled slightly, "What we need is just this window of opportunity."

"If it were just a worm plague, Transmitter Jiang would certainly not show up in person."

"But if the spiritual energy mutates after it recovers, threatening the lives of all cultivators, he will probably have to show himself."

Transmitter Zhou nodded, "That kind of spiritual energy does indeed have the effect of disturbing the mind. Even with my disposition, after absorbing some of it, it is difficult to suppress the urge to fiercely fight with荒."

"If it spreads throughout the Profound Yellow World..."

Transmitter Zhou seemed to already see a scene of widespread bloodshed.

"With two kinds of small worms, such a great threat can be posed to the world... Your Myriad Worlds Association..." Transmitter Zhou’s projection stared at Li Fan, her expression complex.

"Threat? Not at all, not at all," Li Fan decisively denied.

"Once Jiang appears, I will activate the pre-arranged clues to lure him here. At that time, it will be up to you."

"As for the spiritual energy issue in the Profound Yellow World, there is no need to worry."

"After the black worms die, the spiritual energy they devoured will be returned to heaven and earth. Everything will return to the starting point," Li Fan said lightly.

Transmitter Zhou had verified this matter, so she had no objections.

However, what she did not know was that Li Fan had concealed many things beyond the publicly known information.

For example, there were actually two Dao Yi Insect Mothers.

Only when both died simultaneously would this mutated Dao Yi insect race perish.

For example, while the vast majority of spiritual energy devoured by the dead Dao Yi worms would indeed be returned, a small portion would be transferred to the Insect Mother as nourishment.

And another example...

Spiritual energy to the Profound Yellow World was like blood to the human body.

If the blood in the body was entirely replaced in a short period, what changes would occur in the Profound Yellow World was truly hard to say.

(End of Chapter)

Chapter 1064: The Golden Sword of the Immortal Alliance Emerges

Li Fan had only confirmed through several observations using the [False Heaven’s Dao] that the spiritual energy replenishing heaven and earth would, to some extent, influence the Profound Yellow World in return.

For example, if the spiritual energy carried the attribute of "slaughter," it might cause the Profound Yellow Heaven’s Dao to encourage cultivators to kill.

If the spiritual energy carried the attribute of "chaos," it was highly likely to cause the laws of the Profound Yellow World to become unpredictable and extremely bizarre.

"Before I transmigrated, I heard urban legends about how people’s personalities gradually changed to resemble the original owner of an organ after a transplant."

"The Heaven's Dao is like a person. The Heavenly Physician truly did not deceive me!"

In Li Fan’s World-Destroying Space, more than ten varieties of mutated Dao Yi Insects were sealed. The unique spiritual energy attributes released by each type would allow Li Fan to modify the Profound Yellow World to some degree according to his own design after the spiritual disaster.

Moreover, this process, from beginning to end, did not require the help of Transmitter Zhou and the others.

With his own strength alone, he could accomplish this. In every subsequent reincarnation cycle, he could easily complete this replication.

The so-called cooperation with the transmitters in this life was merely to spread the arrangements that triggered the doomsday calamity throughout the Profound Yellow World in advance.

It had nothing to do with this spiritual disaster.

Transmitter Zhou and Wei, although they appeared to be the planners of the spiritual disaster, were in fact already caught within Li Fan's World-Destroying Scheme.

...

The situation in Shilin Prefecture was proceeding exactly as Li Fan had predicted.

When the Immortal Alliance Headquarters received the distress call from Shilin Immortal City, out of habitual arrogance, they did not take it very seriously. After all, it was merely a mere insect plague. A cultivator at the Dao Integration stage could easily suppress and resolve it. Compared to the various emergencies reported from other prefectures, this truly was not a major issue.

Thus, after an assessment, the Immortal Alliance Headquarters decided to proceed according to the usual handling process for general affairs.

First, they would dispatch a special envoy to Shilin Prefecture to verify the authenticity of the matter.

Then, they would dispatch the corresponding Dao Integration cultivators to resolve this minor trouble.

It was only after the Immortal Alliance special envoy arrived in Shilin Prefecture and personally witnessed the horror of the insect plague, hastily returning, that the Immortal Alliance Headquarters’ level of concern increased based on the firsthand information brought back by the envoy. However, the increase was not very significant.

After much deliberation and sending inquiries to various Dao Integration cultivators about their availability, they finally decided on Jin Jian Immortal Venerable as the person to manage the disaster.

When Jin Jian Immortal Venerable released his myriad golden swords, his spiritual power was restrained, injuring opponents only with the sharpness of the blades. This was perfectly suited for dealing with these black worms.

After receiving the appointment from the Immortal Alliance, Jin Jian Immortal Venerable readily agreed.

However, Jin Jian Immortal Venerable also had a condition: he was participating in a very important exchange conference and could not disengage. He would only have time about seven days later.

The Immortal Alliance Headquarters re-evaluated this sudden situation.

All attendees unanimously agreed that the insect plague would not undergo any particularly significant changes in a mere seven days. Waiting was acceptable. After all, it was uncertain if other Dao Integration Immortal Venerables could be as efficient as Jin Jian Immortal Venerable. Furthermore, every Dao Integration Immortal Venerable was extremely busy; even if they switched to someone else, it might not be possible to free up time.

In reality, there were quite a few Dao Integration cultivators within the Immortal Alliance Headquarters who were currently free. However, such unpleasant tasks were generally defaulted to be handled by Dao Integration cultivators "outside." Intentionally assigning a difficult task to keep headquarters cultivators away for a period was often seen as a precursor to some form of provocation or conspiracy and was rarely employed. Everyone in the Immortal Alliance Headquarters saw each other daily and mostly adhered to the philosophy of peace and harmony leading to prosperity.

In short, due to various customary reasons, when Jin Jian Immortal Venerable proudly bid farewell to the two transmitters and officially set off for Shilin Prefecture to deal with the insect plague, nearly half a month had passed since the plague broke out.

Following custom, after arriving in Shilin Prefecture, Jin Jian Immortal Venerable did not immediately rush to the site of the insect plague. Instead, he participated in the enthusiastic welcoming ceremony held by the cultivators of Shilin Prefecture. The banquet was joyous and very successful.

The next day, Jin Jian Immortal Venerable customarily rested for a day.

Only on the third day did he, accompanied by others, reach the Hundred Stone Grotto Heaven, which was swarming with black worms.

Upon personally seeing the dense, overwhelming mass of black worms in the underground cavern, even the previously confident Dao Integration Immortal Venerables felt a jolt in their hearts. However, being an established Immortal Venerable, he did not reveal his emotions. He immediately summoned his myriad golden swords and began the slaughter of these black worms.

After taking action, Jin Jian felt somewhat reassured. Under the sharpness of his blades, these black worms, which possessed strong resistance to spiritual energy techniques, were like mere paper. A large number died instantly, and in a short while, the cavern before him was cleared.

Seeing the delighted and adoring looks of the people of Shilin Prefecture, Jin Jian Immortal Venerable became somewhat smug.

"How large is this underground Grotto Heaven?" he asked casually, intending to press on and resolve this troublesome matter as quickly as possible.

To his surprise, the answer from the people of Shilin Prefecture caught him off guard.

"We don't know? What do you mean?" Jin Jian Immortal Venerable’s expression turned grim.

The explanation from the cultivators of Shilin Prefecture made Jin Jian Immortal Venerable gasp in cold air. It turned out that the so-called Hundred Stone Grotto Heaven was a massive underground cavern in the border area of Shilin Prefecture. The cavern contained countless intersecting paths and branches. At regular intervals, it opened up into a wide underground hall. These halls were filled with strangely shaped rocks, growing wildly from the ceiling downwards and outwards from the walls. Their forms, resembling humans or beasts, were unsettling. Many cultivators had become lost within it and never returned. The true extent of this Hundred Stone Grotto Heaven remained completely unexplored to this day. Some cultivators speculated that it was excavated by an ancient exotic beast named the Gui Yuan Toad. Although no cultivator had seen such an exotic beast for thousands of years, perhaps one or two Gui Yuan Toads still survived in the depths of this endless underground maze. The entire underground area of Shilin Prefecture might have been hollowed out.

"Why didn't you mention something this important earlier?" The thought of potentially facing black worms numbering in the expanse of the entire prefecture made Jin Jian Immortal Venerable’s face darken.

"Ah? When we reported to the Immortal Alliance Headquarters, we informed them completely about this matter," the cultivators of Shilin Prefecture replied innocently to Jin Jian Immortal Venerable's questioning.

Jin Jian Immortal Venerable’s face was ashen. Deeply feeling the seriousness of the situation, he stopped wasting words and charged into the depths of the cave with his sword.

...

Because their swarm was being massacred on a large scale, the Dao Yi Insect Mother seemed somewhat irritated. She rolled her round body slightly. However, it was merely irritation. This degree of population reduction was not even as fast as the natural rate of death within the swarm itself. Even three more Jin Jian Immortal Venerables could not pose any threat to the Dao Yi swarm.

Chapter 1065: The World-Ending Black Tide Rises

Ultimately, it was the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance that had misjudged the number of Dao Yi Insects possibly existing beneath Shilin Prefecture.

The underground cave system wound and turned, not only covering an area almost equivalent to the entirety of Shilin Prefecture, but also constantly expanding deeper underground. Even Li Fan, who now controlled the entire swarm, had yet to fully grasp how vast this Hundred Stone Grotto-Heaven of Shilin Prefecture truly was. Thanks to such a massive breeding base, the Dao Yi Insects could multiply so rapidly, capable of devouring all the spiritual energy in a prefecture in less than a month.

"Paper may be thin and breakable with a flick of a finger, but when stacked high, it can withstand armies!"

"How can you possibly kill them all by yourself?"

Feeling the Dao Yi Insect swarm’s numbers not only remain undiminished but actually increase despite the slaughter by Jin Jian Immortal Venerable, Li Fan revealed an inexplicable smile.

...

"Hoo... hoo..."

Looking at another cleared underground cavern, Jin Jian Immortal Venerable finally felt a trace of fatigue. During this time, he had not stopped for a moment. Myriad golden swords swept across, illuminating one dark subterranean cave after another, leaving behind ground covered with the corpses of black insects. How many black insects had he slaughtered? One billion? Ten billion?

Even with the spiritual power reserves of a Dao Integration Immortal Venerable, he was now almost completely drained. However, perhaps because he was so deep underground, the spiritual energy here was extremely sparse, making it impossible to absorb for replenishment. Helpless, Jin Jian Immortal Venerable had to rely on absorbing the spirit stones stored within his body to slowly recover.

"It has been many years since I've been this wretched," the sitting Jin Jian Immortal Venerable couldn't help but sigh. Memories of exploring the ruins of his sect with companions when he was still a Foundation Establishment cultivator surfaced in his mind.

Suddenly, he inexplicably stood up, his expression becoming solemn. He finally realized what that strange feeling in his heart had been since he entered this Hundred Stone Grotto-Heaven. It was a spiritual intuition warning him, something that hadn't appeared in a long time. Three hundred years ago, it was precisely relying on this keen intuition that he became the sole survivor of that exploration team. But after surviving that disaster, things had gone smoothly, and he hadn't encountered any misfortunes, causing him to almost forget this sense of crisis. Until today, after so many years, this premonition of danger reappeared!

"This..." Jin Jian Immortal Venerable’s heart thumped uncontrollably. His thoughts raced, and he immediately made a decision. Disregarding rest, his figure transformed into a golden light, charging madly toward the depths of the underground cave. He needed to first see how vast this Hundred Stone Grotto-Heaven truly was!

Three days later.

Jin Jian Immortal Venerable's face was ashen. With his speed of flight, three days was enough time to circle the territory of the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance several times, yet he still hadn't finished exploring the Hundred Stone Grotto-Heaven. It was like an abyss or the sea, bottomless, as if there were no end.

Jin Jian Immortal Venerable shuddered, and the terrifying image of countless black insects densely filling the caves, surging outwards like a monstrous tide, immediately flooded his mind.

"Disaster has struck, disaster has struck."

"No, I must report this situation to the Alliance Headquarters immediately." Jin Jian Immortal Venerable hurriedly took out his communication spirit talisman, intending to contact the Alliance Headquarters. However, perhaps due to being too deep underground, the connection could not be established.

Jin Jian Immortal Venerable's ominous feeling intensified. He increased his speed to the maximum, trying to leave this underground cave system. But for some reason, those black insects, which had merely been lying quietly absorbing spiritual energy, suddenly rushed towards him as if driven mad, attempting to stop him from advancing further.

At this moment, Jin Jian Immortal Venerable finally understood what it meant to find it difficult to move even an inch. He held nothing back, unsheathing all the golden swords refined within his body, letting them swirl around him, grinding all the black insects blocking his path into dust.

Jin Jian Immortal Venerable, with an indomitable spirit, quickly returned from underground. The difference between the black insects before and after strengthened his certainty that there was a conspiracy at work behind this. If this wasn't stopped quickly, the ramifications would likely affect not just Shilin Prefecture, but perhaps the entire Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance, even the Xuanhuang World!

"Who is plotting such a rebellious act!" Jin Jian Immortal Venerable was both shocked and enraged, his speed increasing further.

When he finally broke through the heavy blockade of black insects and saw daylight again, he paused, having an intuition just as he was about to report urgently to the Alliance Headquarters. Jin Jian Immortal Venerable looked up at the sky and extended his left hand.

"Is... the wind rising?"

A faint breeze inexplicably swept across the world. Then the breeze gradually grew stronger, escalating fiercely. The whistling sound roared like thunder. The sky, which had been clear and sunny moments before, was instantly obscured by layers of dark clouds. Under the shadow, all the cultivators in Shilin Prefecture felt a sense of impending doom.

"Whoosh!"

A demonic wind blew past, so fierce that it made it difficult for Jin Jian Immortal Venerable to maintain his stance. Although the demonic wind vanished in an instant, the meaning behind it sent an icy chill through the Dao Integration Immortal Venerable’s heart.

He seemed to hear subtle, dense sounds of wind near his ear, yet he sensed no actual wind. Just as he was puzzled, countless flying insects, resembling black tidal waves, suddenly appeared from below. They caught the wind and surged out from the Hundred Stone Grotto-Heaven, soaring to the nine heavens like world-ending dark clouds, spreading unstoppably towards the various prefectures of the Xuanhuang World.

Before the incalculable tide of black insects, Jin Jian’s protective spiritual energy was as precarious as a fragile sapling in a storm. Filled with horror, Jin Jian Immortal Venerable lost all thought of stopping the disaster, focusing solely on ensuring his own safety.

The black insects in the underground cave seemed endless. In Jin Jian’s sight, no other scene could be seen. Submerged in the nightmare of the black tide, moving or even breathing became an impossible fantasy. Even though he wasn't the direct target, merely being crushed underfoot during their migration, the boundless sea of black insects gradually caused the Dao Integration Immortal Venerable to lose consciousness.

"It's over..." In the moment before he lost consciousness, the first thing that surfaced in Jin Jian Immortal Venerable's mind was not the danger to his own life, but the inevitable accountability from the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance after the insect plague was eventually dealt with.

"Damn it, I should never have agreed to this cursed errand."

His figure gradually faded, finally transforming into a golden long sword seemingly composed of countless small swords, which clattered to the ground. Indeed, the strength of the black insects was enough to exhaust a Dao Integration cultivator and cause temporary unconsciousness, but not enough to kill them.

But...

Li Fan's figure emerged from the black tide. He picked up the golden long sword, a smile playing on his lips. Then, he casually placed tens of thousands of formation restrictions on it.

Chapter 1066: The Insects Are Dead, But Their Malignancy Lingers

Centered around Shizhou, a terrifying spiritual energy storm suddenly swept across the entire Xuanhuang continent.

The wind roared and echoed. Even the various Heavenly Cities of the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance, which had always floated in the sky as if they would never fall, trembled to varying degrees under the influence of the hurricane.

The fierce wind was secondary.

What horrified the Alliance cultivators was the countless black insects, like dark clouds, emerging from an unknown source.

They blotted out the sun and covered Xuanhuang.

Before the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance could react, the insect plague had spread to every corner of their territory.

In just half a day, the spiritual energy concentration of the Xuanhuang Realm plummeted.

At this critical juncture, the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance finally erupted with the dynamism expected of one of the two main rulers of the Xuanhuang Realm.

All Dao Integration cultivators within the Alliance, regardless of what they were engaged in, were ordered to leave and participate in exterminating the black insects. Those below the Dao Integration stage who were confident in their strength could also join the fight, with rewards promised later.

If their strength or cultivation level was insufficient, they could take refuge in the Heavenly Cities, Grotto-heavens, or the Heavenly Profound Mirror during this period, waiting for the disaster to pass.

Following the Alliance's decree, the situation across the various prefectures changed instantly.

The mutated Dao One insects, besides being able to devour spiritual energy and rapidly reproduce in large numbers, possessed no other special offensive or defensive means.

After losing some personnel, the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance quickly found the most effective way to deal with the black insects.

Using a special technique, they forcibly controlled the insect swarms with their immense divine sense, causing them to kill each other and rapidly deplete their numbers internally.

By employing this method, just two Dao Integration cultivators could clear the insect plague in a prefecture within a short time.

After the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance disseminated this secret technique, named "Insect Lord," the raging insect plague showed signs of collapse in an instant.

...

Deep within the Hundred Stone Grotto-heaven, Li Fan, through his connection with the Dao One Insect Mother, recorded every cultivator who performed outstandingly during this insect plague, cross-referencing them with the data in the Heavenly Profound Mirror.

"These are the true high-level combat forces of the Alliance. As long as these people remain standing, the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance will not face any significant danger."

"But if these people were to be eliminated first, the lack of core strength would instantly put the Alliance in an embarrassing situation where they have no usable personnel. At that point, even a very small disaster could cause a massive impact."

After contemplating for a moment, Li Fan's thoughts returned to reality.

Feeling the continuously decreasing number of insects, he couldn't help but frown.

The response method of using "Insect Lord" to manipulate and turn the insect swarms against themselves was somewhat beyond his expectations.

Originally, the Insect Mother held absolute control over the insect broodlings. The simple life form of the Dao One insects meant that ordinary control methods were completely ineffective against them.

However, this Insect Lord secret technique stripped away the Insect Mother's control by masquerading as an Insect Emperor.

"Insect Lord..."

With access to the Heavenly Profound Mirror, Li Fan easily learned about this secret technique. In his view, this method seemed to originate from the same source as the Beast Taming Sect's "Beast Taming Reincarnation."

"Could it be that Di San Mo intervened?"

The new Dao One insects were not yet fully established. If the insect plague ended now, it might fail to achieve the goal of luring out the transmission caster Jiang.

"Then it's time to activate the backup plan."

Li Fan pondered for a moment, and two Dao One Insect Mothers appeared in his palm.

Due to the mass death of the insect swarm, their bodies were no longer as plump as they were initially. They appeared somewhat listless and stared at each other with a mixture of vigilance and greed.

This was the instinct to survive by devouring their own kind in a time of crisis.

Looking at these two small insects that had stirred up turmoil in Xuanhuang, Li Fan's gaze remained completely unperturbed.

With a slight exertion of force, he instantly crushed them both.

Following Li Fan's action, the sky of the entire Xuanhuang Realm changed.

The black insects that had previously filled the firmament, constantly emitting faint sounds, suddenly fell silent.

Then... they fell from the sky like a torrential rain.

The Alliance cultivators struggling to exterminate the black insects were momentarily stunned.

They instinctively drew in the dead insects to examine them and found that it was not a disguise.

Seeing this, some breathed a sigh of relief, remarking that the disaster had come and gone quickly.

However, some cultivators with sensitive spiritual perception felt a growing sense of unease.

They quickly reported the situation to the Alliance headquarters.

In an instant, all the black insects ravaging the Xuanhuang land died, leaving behind only piles of corpses covering the ground.

If these insect corpses were not dealt with quickly, they might cause unforeseen trouble.

After deliberation, the Alliance soon issued an order.

They announced that cultivators who had been hiding from the disaster could safely come out and assist in cleaning up the environment.

It was not mandatory, but substantial contribution points were offered as reward.

Thus, many cultivators could not resist the temptation and left their safe zones.

They looked at the corpses of black insects strewn across the entire Xuanhuang land, and their scalps tingled.

The bodies of the black insects were almost entirely composed of the special energy they had devoured and transformed.

This energy was similar to spiritual energy but could not be absorbed or utilized by cultivators.

When countless black insects died simultaneously, as their corpses naturally decomposed, this special energy rapidly spread through the air.

In just half a day, the quantitative change led to a qualitative transformation.

"Ugh..."

The foul odor permeating the air caused the cultivators within it to feel nauseated, with an uncontrollable urge to vomit.

"Everyone, hold your breath and isolate yourselves! This insect stench is poisonous!"

Nausea was the least of it. When some cultivators directly fainted after staying in the stench-filled environment for too long...

The real trouble began.

With a bang, the body of the unconscious cultivator exploded into dust.

Although they quickly regenerated from their Grotto-heavens, the air, now mixed with the cultivator's flesh and blood, became even more unbearable.

Furthermore, this peculiar fishy stench, whenever it interacted with the world's spiritual energy, would follow the spiritual energy fluctuations and enter the cultivators' bodies.

Not all cultivators possessed the nearly inexhaustible spiritual energy resources of Li Fan's Five Elements Great Grotto-heaven.

Ordinary cultivators still needed to draw spiritual energy from the heavens and earth.

Due to the previous insect plague, the spiritual energy concentration of the Xuanhuang Realm had dropped to an extremely low level.

Before it could recover, it was now contaminated by the insect stench and the smell of blood.

This situation reached its peak as the black insect corpses completely degraded.

In the foul environment, even Nascent Soul cultivators could not stay for long.

Only those at Soul Transformation or higher could maintain normal activity by relying on their own powerful foundations.

Even so, after spending time in the foul external environment, they would experience varying degrees of nausea psychologically.

"Why has our good Xuanhuang Realm suddenly become like this?"

Countless cultivators lamented from the bottom of their hearts.

Chapter 1067: Spawning from Grievances and Injustice

Chapter 1067: Spawning from Grievances and Injustice

This stench was an intangible thing.

It was even harder to deal with than the tangible black insects.

At least for more than ten days, the Myriad Immortal Alliance had failed to come up with a suitable solution.

Some living beings simply could not endure the stench and, in agonizing wails, their bodies exploded.

Contributing their power to this extreme environment.

This vicious cycle led to the situation where, after so many days, there was no sign of improvement in the stench of the Xuanhuang Realm.

All the cultivators hid within the cities where protective formations were active, not daring to go out.

They looked at the unnaturally colored air outside with worried expressions.

...

On Li Fan's side, he received an inquiry from the transmission practitioner Zhou.

"Fellow Daoist, what are you doing?"

"Didn't we agree to pretend to destroy the world? Why did you turn the Xuanhuang Realm into such a foul mess?"

Zhou seemed to be in a bad mood.

Li Fan responded calmly, "No need to worry. This is a stalling tactic. At most, within three months, this strange spiritual energy will gradually dissipate and return to normal through the natural flow of the world's spiritual energy."

"I know, but this smell is too disgusting. I feel it will leave an indelible psychological shadow on our Xuanhuang Realm cultivators."

"It's alright, they won't care about these minor matters soon," Li Fan smiled.

"Oh? Has the second stage of the plan already begun?" Zhou was drawn to the main topic.

"Just wait and see."

The conversation between the two gradually subsided.

...

Just as Li Fan had anticipated, even if nothing was done, this stench would naturally disappear within three months.

Instead of exhausting efforts to study methods to eliminate this stench, with uncertain results, it was better to wait patiently.

This was the decision made by the Immortal Alliance after comprehensive consideration.

Of course, in order to completely resolve this inexplicable disaster, the Immortal Alliance did not relax patrols throughout the realm.

Day and night, Nascent Soul cultivators were dispatched to collect data on environmental changes.

Seeing that everything was slowly improving, and even the rate of spiritual energy concentration recovery was far exceeding expectations, the Immortal Alliance gradually felt relieved.

However, in corners that no one currently knew about.

Large numbers of new Dao Yi Insects were rapidly multiplying, using the corpses of the previously dead black insects.

These Dao Yi Insects did not devour spiritual energy.

Instead, they expelled spiritual energy outwards.

The rapid spiritual energy recovery of the Xuanhuang Realm was naturally their contribution.

Under Li Fan's deliberate manipulation, they hid themselves within various underground spiritual veins.

They merged the spiritual energy they released with the spiritual energy naturally generated by the world's operation, making it impossible to distinguish.

The change occurred slowly like this.

Three months later, all the foul odors had disappeared. The cultivators, who had been cooped up for a long time, finally came outdoors.

They breathed in the fresh, beautiful spiritual energy to their hearts' content.

"I never thought before how wonderful the natural spiritual energy of the heavens and earth truly is."

"Haha, indestructible and unbreaking. Witnessing this disaster, I have had some realizations, and I am not far from a breakthrough!"

"On such a fine day, I should go out for a stroll with friends!"

...

The Immortal Alliance did not stop the cultivators from relaxing.

On the surface, this insect plague seemed to have completely passed.

Thus, the main focus of the Immortal Alliance shifted to investigating the origin of the insect plague.

Shi Lin Prefecture, the epicenter of the incident, had half of its cultivators stripped of their positions due to improper handling that led to the spread of the plague.

Even several scapegoats had their cultivation bases crippled and were thrown into the Gloomy Prison.

The severity of the punitive measures was extremely rare.

As for the Golden Sword Immortal Venerable, who mysteriously disappeared during the insect plague, he became the primary suspect.

Clearly, the insect plague could not threaten the life of a Dao Integration cultivator. Thus, the Golden Sword Immortal Venerable, who was neither seen alive nor found dead, appeared particularly suspicious.

As the first Dao Integration cultivator to encounter the insect plague, if he had reported the situation to the Immortal Alliance in a timely manner, it would never have escalated to such an unmanageable state.

The Immortal Alliance suffered heavy losses in this insect plague.

Someone had to step forward to take responsibility.

The missing Golden Sword Immortal Venerable thus became the object of everyone's unspoken accusation.

"Failure to execute is insufficient to appease the public's indignation!"

Some cultivators expressed themselves with unusually severe wording.

However, after all, he was a Dao Integration Immortal Venerable, a massive asset to the Myriad Immortal Alliance. He could not be easily executed.

So, in the end, the Myriad Immortal Alliance still issued a warrant for the arrest of the Golden Sword Immortal Venerable, ordering him to surrender as soon as possible to seek leniency.

A kill order was not issued.

As soon as the news broke, the Immortal Alliance was shaken.

The Golden Sword Immortal Venerable suddenly seemed to become the originator of the insect plague, the target of universal condemnation.

Everyone wished they could eat his flesh raw.

"Kill! Kill! Kill!"

Unexplainably, a sense of malice arose from within the cultivators' hearts.

But at that time, the cultivators attributed this to their indignation towards whoever caused the insect plague.

It wasn't until half a month later that a shocking case occurred.

In Tian Chen Prefecture, a tragedy struck the You family.

In a single night, all more than a hundred members of the family were wiped out.

They were all slaughtered.

After an investigation, people were astonished to discover that the perpetrator was the eldest son of the You family, You Chisong!

He must have encountered some opportunity, as the records showed he was only at the Nascent Soul stage, yet he was able to silently kill the Spirit Transformation cultivators in his family.

Furthermore, he could conceal the heavenly dao's perception.

It was only after three days, when the concealment failed, and the omens of cultivator deaths erupted simultaneously, that people learned of the tragedy.

The peaceful Myriad Immortal Alliance had witnessed such a terrifying and bloody act of aggression.

And the perpetrator was a member of the family himself.

The Immortal Alliance took the matter very seriously and immediately launched an investigation.

Various rumors about the You family began to spread widely among the populace.

As the eldest son, he had made significant contributions to the development and growth of the family.

But because his aptitude was insufficient, he was forced to give up his discovery of the change in the genesis of heaven and earth to someone else.

In a fit of rage, he slaughtered all his family members!

...

The You family massacre became the most hotly debated topic among the general cultivators.

Although slaughtering one's relatives was certainly inhuman and should have drawn universal condemnation, surprisingly, some discordant voices emerged from the public.

"In my opinion, he deserved it!"

"That's right. Destroying someone's Dao path is equivalent to killing their parents! What kinship? The moment they seized the change in the genesis of heaven and earth, they ceased to be relatives!"

"If it were me, I would have done the same!"

"Kill kill kill kill kill kill kill!"

...

Initially, these were minority views.

But somehow, as the discussion surrounding the incident grew, more and more people began to express support for this view.

The two sides' viewpoints were almost completely opposed and irreconcilable.

Friction was inevitable in their confrontations.

However, such arguments were common, and the Myriad Immortal Alliance initially paid them no mind.

But no one expected that after the first bloody conflict erupted, it was like a chain reaction.

Large-scale bloody conflicts began to erupt across various parts of the Immortal Alliance one after another.

(End of Chapter)

Chapter 1068: Rebirth Determines the Crisis

Initially, the Myriad Immortal Alliance still had some restraining effect on these gradually irrational cultivators, and the Immortal Cities within each Prefecture were relatively safe.

But as both sides became bloodthirsty, even the Alliance's prohibitions became less effective.

Cultivators would engage in life-and-death battles within the cities at the slightest disagreement.

At first, the punitive formations within the cities were still effective. The towering statues of Dharma Transmission would descend with white light, eliminating cultivators who violated the laws.

However, as the number of cultivators engaging in deathmatches increased, even the Myriad Immortal Alliance could not help but feel significant apprehension, only selectively activating the grand formations within the cities.

This principle of not punishing the masses undoubtedly fueled the cultivators' frenzied fighting.

Under the fanatical atmosphere, even the cultivators in the Profound Yellow Realm who had relatively peaceful dispositions slowly began to change, starting to participate in the mutual slaughter.

The mutual slaughter of cultivators was not only reflected in real-life situations but also in animosities formed in the Heavenly Profound Mirror, which could potentially trigger deadly incidents.

A mysterious figure named "Heavenly God's Eye" gradually gained fame among the cultivators from some unknown time.

This person's origin was unknown, but their divine abilities were vast. As long as one revealed a secret about themselves to him, he could provide the true identity of the cultivator behind the Heavenly Profound Mirror account that one wished to track!

At first, cultivators were skeptical.

But practice makes perfect.

The hundreds of cultivators who were suddenly sought out by their enemies and died tragically served as the best proof of Heavenly God's Eye's power!

It was worth noting that arguments leading to grudges over trivial matters were common in the Heavenly Profound Mirror in the past. However, since all information in the Heavenly Profound Mirror was strictly confidential, it was impossible to learn about the grievances; one could only exchange harsh words from afar.

Now, the appearance of Heavenly God's Eye changed everything!

Had one offended someone with careless words in the past? Did one not want to be suddenly hunted down without preparation?

Then, wouldn't it be best to strike first?!

Under Heavenly God's Eye's secret instigation, the frequency of vengeful killings within the Myriad Immortal Alliance rose again.

The strange phenomenon of cultivators falling from the sky had become commonplace.

The world-destroying plan was progressing quite smoothly, but Li Fan's mood was not as good.

In the Hundred Stone Grotto-Heaven of Stone Lin Prefecture, two figures who looked extremely similar stood before a small Heavenly Profound Mirror.

One of them was Li Fan's main body. The other was a pseudo-Immortal puppet body that Li Fan had ordered the Artisan Monk to forge for him during this period.

Without using essence of origin power, the puppet body's strength did not reach the level of longevity comparable to Tianyang.

However, Li Fan was not concerned about the puppet's actual combat power but rather its characteristic of being able to perfectly merge with a cultivator.

At this moment, the Mirror Origin gifted by the Heavenly Profound Mirror had been transferred into the pseudo-Immortal puppet. Furthermore, to deal with the Dharma Transmitter Jiang who was about to arrive, the consciousness implanted in the Immortal Puppet had also been modified. In its perception, it was truly a member of the vast Myriad Worlds Joint Association, responsible for hunting down the remnants of the Profound Heaven Sect. It had no memories of "Returning to Truth" or other secrets of Li Fan's main body.

The puppet Li Fan was naturally the suddenly rising and famous "Heavenly God's Eye."

Using the authority of the Mirror Origin, he greatly accelerated the process of cultivators slaughtering each other, while also obtaining many secret pieces of information from the cultivators' hearts. Although some seemed utterly worthless, as long as they were collected, they might be useful in some future cycle of reincarnation.

At this moment, the puppet Li Fan was diligently playing the role of Heavenly God's Eye. Li Fan's main body stood nearby, frowning slightly.

"To this extent, have Mo Rubin and the Heavenly Profound Mirror not made a move?"

"Only the holder of the Mirror Origin can read the encrypted information of the Heavenly Profound Mirror. Mo Rubin should have realized long ago that the recent series of world-destroying events were orchestrated by me."

"But I haven't detected anyone tracing this line..."

"Mo Rubin and the Heavenly Profound Mirror act this way, and even the Myriad Immortal Alliance does. Mo Rubin hasn't shared information with the Myriad Immortal Alliance."

"Are they completely ignoring me?"

"Or perhaps they are busy with more important matters?"
