"Above Golden Core are the four realms of Nascent Soul, Spirit Transformation, Dao Integration, and Longevity." Li Fan kindly filled him in on the basic common knowledge of the cultivation world.

"No... that’s impossible, right? Mr. Bai clearly said he was a mortal before." Xu Ke opened his mouth, somewhat disbelieving.

"Hmph, how can the cultivation speed of a Fate manifestation be imagined by you mortals? Instant Spirit Transformation is also an easy matter. However, since I am in the shadows, I cannot be so conspicuous. Otherwise, the abnormality will definitely be detected." Li Fan said with some regret.

"But even so, my cultivation speed is still not something you can compare to."

Before the words fell, Xu Ke sensed a change in Li Fan's aura.

"You actually broke through to the Qi Refining stage?" He was dumbfounded and began to believe the other party’s words somewhat.

Li Fan couldn't be bothered to pay attention to him and simply ordered, "Go find something for me to eat. I am hungry."

Xu Ke scurried off towards the mountain forest of the Beast Taming Sect. Li Fan continued to cultivate and circulate the Profound Bird clan’s innate ability, [Fate is With Me].

With many experiences in cultivation, it was now smooth sailing.

Furthermore, after refining the Spirit Wood Realm and completely controlling the Heavenly Dao of a realm, Li Fan had his own unique understanding of absorbing heavenly fortune and transforming fate. Moreover, after observing for this period, Li Fan discovered that the Profound Yellow Heavenly Dao in this era was not yet filled with the hatred and vigilance towards cultivators like it would be in later generations.

The resistance to operating the [False Error Heavenly Dao] innate ability was almost negligible, posing little risk.

If it weren't for just being born and his body being too frail, Li Fan could have directly broken through to the Golden Core stage in one go.

Fortunately, the physique of a demonic beast is indeed powerful; as long as there is enough food, growth happens in the blink of an eye.

So, Li Fan and Xu Ke secretly wandered through the mountain forest of the Beast Taming Sect, directly seizing and devouring anything good they saw.

The defensive formations protecting the spirit fields and precious medicines were utterly simplistic in Li Fan's eyes, broken in an instant.

"Lord Profound Bird, aren't we eating a bit too much?" Li Fan enjoyed eating, but Xu Ke was greatly frightened.

In less than a month, the two of them had plundered all the high-value treasures in the Beast Taming Sect's mountain forest.

The sect had vaguely sensed that something was wrong and had already dispatched several elders to investigate.

Fortunately, no flaws had been exposed for the time being.

Even so, the young Xu Ke had never done such things before; he was on edge all day but dared not voice any objection to Li Fan's actions.

"Muddled. Am I not doing this to save the Profound Yellow Realm? What is this small amount of resources? The greatest contribution is following the dragon! Once the world is saved, the Beast Taming Sect will be the greatest hero. The rewards will be tens of thousands of times greater then!" Li Fan slapped Xu Ke with a claw.

"Is... is that so?" Xu Ke was unconvinced.

Li Fan continued to lurk within the Beast Taming Sect, using its resources to strengthen himself. His strength advanced rapidly, and he was soon on the verge of the Nascent Soul stage.

During this period, a cultivator named Song Yang also coveted the Fate Profound Bird and once tried to secretly follow him.

However, Li Fan directly operated the Fate innate ability and changed his fortune.

His two-headed black snake spirit pet suddenly lost control, rose up, and devoured Song Yang. Afterward, the black snake was slain by the combined efforts of the Beast Taming Sect disciples.

The only threat vanished.

Time flowed, and soon it was the day Mr. Bai was scheduled to visit the Beast Taming Sect.

Li Fan acted mysteriously as usual.

"I have a premonition, Mr. Bai is coming," he transmitted one day.

"What? Mr. Bai is coming to the Beast Taming Sect? Is he coming to see me and Senior Brother Lu Ya?" Xu Ke suddenly looked up, full of surprise.

"Hmph, the little fellow is quite self-absorbed. Mr. Bai travels to save the world; he doesn't have time to waste on you, kid." Li Fan mercilessly struck him down.

"Oh." Xu Ke looked dejected upon hearing this.

But he soon perked up, looking eagerly at the sky, waiting for Mr. Bai to descend.

Li Fan also narrowed his eyes.

"It has only been a little over two months since his descent. No matter how fast his strength grows, he shouldn't be able to interfere with the subsequent battle... or rather, the massacre."

"So the key to breaking the situation should still be the trip to the Southern Nether Sacred Mountain next. However, perhaps I can do something," Li Fan mused as he looked down at Xu Ke beneath him.

As in the previous experiences, half a day later, Mr. Bai arrived as scheduled.

The Beast Taming Sect's guardian Azure Dragon sensed the aura of the uninvited guest and instantly revealed itself, blocking Mr. Bai's path.

(End of Chapter)

Chapter 1079: The Truth of the Misunderstanding

"Is this the way the Beast Taming Sect treats guests?" Mr. Bai's pleasant voice echoed through the heavens and earth.

There was no hint of anger, but it made the guardian Azure Dragon feel an immense threat, and it glared with furious eyes.

Acting on its instinct for self-preservation, just as the Azure Dragon was about to attack, at that critical moment, a figure suddenly soared up from the ground.

"Ahhhhhh!"

Accompanied by a miserable cry, a path led straight to Mr. Bai.

The grave and tense atmosphere was instantly broken.

Innumerable gazes in the world instantly focused on that small figure.

"It's Xu Ke..." Mr. Bai smiled.

Xu Ke scratched the back of his head, feeling uneasy.

But he still followed what Li Fan had taught him and asked shyly, "Mr. Bai, why are you here? Are you here to see me?"

Before Mr. Bai could answer, a blue light instantly shot from the horizon, blocking the space between him and Xu Ke.

"Brother Lu Ya!" Seeing an old acquaintance again, Xu Ke became very excited.

Mr. Bai looked at Lu Ya, whose face was full of vigilance, and a trace of helplessness flashed in his eyes: "Lu Ya, long time no see."

Lu Ya said, "What is your business here?"

His tone was cold, full of wariness.

Mr. Bai didn't take offense and slowly said, "I mean no harm on this trip. I just came to find the Beast Taming Sect; I need their help with something."

Hearing this, Lu Ya pondered uncertainly.

Just then, an old voice sounded, "Since you have traveled far, you are a guest. It is our Beast Taming Sect's lack of proper hospitality."

An old man with white hair and white eyebrows appeared instantly.

"The Great Elder?" Lu Ya was shocked.

Di San Mo nodded in acknowledgment. Then he looked at Mr. Bai: "Esteemed guest, please follow me. If there is anything the Beast Taming Sect can help with, we will certainly cooperate."

This very polite attitude made Lu Ya somewhat confused and difficult to accept.

However, he still respected his elders and did not retort on the spot.

"Then I thank you in advance." Since one does not strike a smiling face, Mr. Bai also retracted the aura he was emitting.

He followed Di San Mo and disappeared.

"Huh? Why did he leave?" Xu Ke was momentarily annoyed, having thought Mr. Bai would take him along.

"I told you not to get too close to Mr. Bai! And you just rushed up to him foolishly at the first meeting!" Lu Ya gently patted Xu Ke's head and admonished him.

"He is not at all like he usually appears in front of us." Lu Ya looked toward the distance of the Beast Taming Sect, his face gloomy.

"Brother Lu Ya, why are you saying that! Mr. Bai is truly a good person!" Xu Ke was a bit confused, but he said it very seriously.

"You... alas..." Lu Ya sighed deeply. "Forget it, now that things have come to this, I won't hide it from you anymore."

"After Ningyuan City was razed to the ground, under Mr. Bai's..."

"Under his command, we called upon the populace to save themselves and helped transfer all the injured to the small, broken temple." "But, that day..."

Lu Ya fell into a memory, his expression somewhat dazed.

"Suddenly, someone among the injured had a sudden severe worsening of their condition and was clearly about to collapse. Mr. Bai happened to be absent, and our skill level was completely insufficient to save him..."

"So we could only split up and search the city for Mr. Bai."

Xu Ke suddenly spoke up at this moment, "Yes, I remember that. Not long after, your attitude toward Mr. Bai completely changed, Brother Lu Ya. Why exactly?"

Lu Ya took a deep breath: "At that time, I searched everywhere for Mr. Bai in vain. I suddenly remembered that when I was gravely ill before, Mr. Bai took me to his home for treatment. I vaguely recalled that there seemed to be a basement in his house."

"I thought, maybe he was in the basement at that time. After some effort, I finally found the entrance to the basement near Mr. Bai's house. Just as I was about to call out to inquire, I faintly smelled a scent of blood wafting out from within. I thought Mr. Bai was injured, so without another thought, I rushed in. And then I saw..."

"What did you see?" Xu Ke was completely captivated by Lu Ya's description.

"Corpses. A basement full of shattered corpses. And he was holding a sharp knife, dismembering the corpses and carrying out some evil ritual. Do you remember Doggy used to have a few brothers? Their dog bodies were all forcibly sewn together." Lu Ya asked.

Xu Ke nodded.

"At that time, those few of them disappeared mysteriously. I asked Mr. Bai, and he said he hadn't seen any trace of them. But..."

Lu Ya ground his teeth: "I clearly saw them among those few corpses in the basement!"

"This..." Xu Ke's eyes widened; he simply couldn't believe any of this.

Lu Ya continued: "The scene in that basement was simply like hell. Even recalling it now, I still feel chills all over. Not only was the smell of blood overwhelmingly intense, but the ground was stained black and red with blood. And at the very back of the basement stood an extremely bizarre, faceless statue!"

"Even though I only glanced at it then, it constantly reappears in my nightmares. If you hadn't seen it with your own eyes, you could never imagine how evil it was!"

"He seemed very shocked by my abrupt intrusion. But I immediately reacted, fearing he would kill me to silence me. Without another word, I scrambled out of the secret room and fled back to the small temple like a madman, wanting to expose Mr. Bai's true face. But he always disguised himself too well! Absolutely no one believed me!"

Lu Ya sighed deeply.

"If I had stayed by his side, I would certainly have been in danger of being harmed. I could only flee! Unfortunately, no matter what I said, only you were willing to flee with me."

"Fortunately, we met Master on the way, and we finally settled down here in the Beast Taming Sect. But I never expected that he would be like a lingering spirit and follow us here."

Xu Ke looked at Lu Ya's deeply furrowed brow, feeling very conflicted in his heart.

"Perhaps there's some misunderstanding in this?" Xu Ke still tried to persuade him.

"Misunderstanding? What misunderstanding could there be?" Lu Ya snorted coldly.

"You have seen him in person now. Facing the Integration Realm guardian Azure Dragon, he remained completely composed. One can imagine how terrifying his current strength is! To cultivate to this level in such a short time. Unless it was gained by exchanging for the power of those evil sacrifices, I cannot think of any other way he could have achieved it!"

"Furthermore..."

Lu Ya paused: "I also investigated that bizarre faceless statue."

"It is the evil god worshipped by the ancient evil cult, the Profound Heaven Sect! The remnants of the Profound Heaven Sect are enemies to be struck down by all cultivators of our generation!"

Xu Ke didn't know what the Profound Heaven Sect was.

But he knew the reason why Mr. Bai cultivated so quickly.

However, the words were on the tip of his tongue, but he suddenly remembered Li Fan's instruction, "Heaven's secrets must never be revealed," so he could only swallow them back.

(End of Chapter)

Chapter 1080: True Immortal Realm-Splitting Power

Seeing Lu Ya completely convinced by his conclusion, Xu Ke hesitated for a moment before slowly saying, "I once heard someone say that sometimes even seeing something with your own eyes doesn't necessarily reveal the truth."

"And, when judging a person's character, don't look at what they say, but rather what they do."

"Although I don't know what the situation in that basement was, Mr. Bai has always been extremely kind to us. Without his help, we might have starved to death long ago. Therefore, I am always willing to believe that Mr. Bai is truly a very good person."

Xu Ke spoke slowly as he organized his words. These somewhat learned words took a long time to finish.

Lu Ya let out a cold laugh and patted Xu Ke's head, "You kid, you've read a few books and now you're lecturing me? And you have quite a few arguments."

"Don't worry, I'm not an unreasonable person. I know what's what. It's just that..." As Lu Ya spoke, the strangely eerie faceless statue reappeared in his mind, and his heart couldn't help but feel heavy again.

Afterward, Lu Ya chatted with Xu Ke for a while longer. After seemingly receiving a telepathic message from someone, he hastily departed.

"Lord Xuan Niao, how did I do?" At this moment, Xu Ke asked Li Fan in his mind for credit.

"It was only average. You need to work harder in the future," Li Fan replied very plainly, causing Xu Ke to feel a bit dejected.

"It seems the remaining power of the Faceless True Immortal in this era is much stronger than it will be thousands of years from now. Lu Ya was only exposed to it once, yet he already had its aura clinging to him, falling into the True Immortal's web, making it difficult to escape."

As the agent of the current era's Faceless True Immortal, perhaps no one in this world understood the nature of its power better than Li Fan.

In the illusionary realm he experienced before, Li Fan wasn't qualified to perceive this. But now, he could instantly see the fundamental reason why Lu Ya's attitude towards Mr. Bai had changed so drastically—it was due to the influence of the Faceless True Immortal's statue.

Living beings instinctively fear unknown, powerful beings.

Like a butterfly caught in a spider's web, unable to break free, it senses the predator's approach and becomes fearful of its future fate, even before seeing the predator arrive.

This is the state Lu Ya is in now.

However, subconsciously, he linked the faceless True Immortal statue with Mr. Bai. It was less about running away or distancing himself from Mr. Bai, and more about avoiding the control of the Faceless True Immortal.

Unfortunately, just like the real Li Fan, ordinary methods were completely unable to break free.

As for whether Mr. Bai truly has a connection with the Faceless True Immortal...

Li Fan did not detect any aura of the Faceless True Immortal on Mr. Bai during their brief encounter. Of course, it was also possible that Mr. Bai's power was too great, and he was concealing it well.

While pondering, Li Fan saw Xu Ke, who was still feeling down, and then scratched his hair, "Your state of mind still needs strengthening. If you can't handle this minor setback, how will you follow me to save the world in the future?"

"Lord Xuan Niao, I'm not even ten years old yet. Do I really have to be the one to save the world?" Xu Ke said with a little face screwed up in distress.

"Who told you that you have a connection with me," Li Fan said earnestly.

"Alright, be ready. Next, the Beast Taming Sect should give you a task," Li Fan prophesied again.

Having demonstrated foresight multiple times, Xu Ke had become extremely convinced of Li Fan.

As expected, Li Fan's prediction was correct this time as well.

Three days later, Lu Ya brought Xu Ke to a small wooden house outside the Demon Suppressing Pagoda of the Beast Taming Sect.

On the table in the wooden house, there was a wooden carving and a wooden box.

"This wooden carving is a gift left for you by Mr. Bai," Lu Ya said with a complicated expression.

Something seemed to have happened to him over these three days. His tone towards Mr. Bai had become much more polite, but Li Fan keenly sensed that the influence of the Faceless True Immortal seemed to have deepened in him instead.

"Wow!" Xu Ke, not yet old enough to realize this, excitedly ran to the table and snatched up the wooden carving.

"Huh? This looks like me?!" Xu Ke examined it carefully from all angles and said with some surprise.

Not caring about what use the wooden carving had, as long as it was a gift from Mr. Bai, Xu Ke was content. He was about to carefully put it away, but after hearing Li Fan's telepathic message, he first hid it in his chest.

"This wooden carving is a good thing," Li Fan stared intently, sensing the power of the laws condensed upon it.

When Mr. Bai makes a move, it naturally won't be an ordinary item.

This small wooden carving of Xu Ke represented retaliation.

As long as the attack did not exceed the upper limit the wooden carving could withstand, it would be absorbed and then reflected back.

It was quite similar to the divine ability displayed after Shuo Feng comprehended the wonder of the Wood Sword Heaven previously.

"Even a full-force strike from a Harmonization Realm expert can be perfectly reflected by this wooden carving. Although the number of times is limited, it is absolutely a life-saving treasure," Li Fan exclaimed at Mr. Bai's generosity while studying the principles of heaven and earth within the carving.

As expected, Xu Ke received the task of delivering the red wooden box to the Emperor One Beast at the Southern Nether Sacred Beast Mountain.

"This wooden box contains the head of the Emperor Two Fierce. If my guess is correct, Mr. Bai personally slew it. The Emperor Two Fierce roamed freely, causing trouble, and refused to return to the demon race. Although Mr. Bai appears to have killed it, he actually returned it to the Emperor One."

"Using this favor to exchange for the method of demon beasts devouring the void to reproduce, which is used to cultivate the Realm-Splitting Whale."

Li Fan explained the entire sequence of events.

"Mr. Bai is an incarnation of the Heavenly Dao, yet he still cannot grasp the specific evolutionary direction of the demon beasts and has to seek out the Emperor One Beast."

"It seems that the demon beasts of the Profound Yellow Realm might not be native products, but outsiders."

"The Emperor One sensed that the great calamity of the Profound Yellow Realm was approaching, and it seems there was no possibility of survival. Thus, it wanted to split the realm and leave..."

An image of a towering white mountain, seemingly at the end of the world, appeared before Li Fan's eyes.

"Southern Nether Mountain, according to the Emperor One, is the edge of the heavens and the corner of the sea, the end of the world."

"The countless free-floating energies of the Profound Yellow Realm converge here. If a special method were used to detonate them, it might instantly erupt with extremely terrifying power, approaching that of a True Immortal."

"Thus crossing the high wall and leaving the Utter Darkness Star Sea."

In the present era, a thousand years later, Southern Nether Mountain has become the Realm-Splitting Great Vortex. The wound in the world has not healed for thousands of years, which shows how terrifying the energy fluctuation was when Southern Nether Mountain split the realm.

"The principle is the same as the Heavenly Sword Sect's Realm-Splitting Divine Weapon. However, both were merely theories. Whether they succeeded or failed, whether they successfully escaped the Utter Darkness Star Sea, or turned into nothingness..."

"No one knows."

Chapter 1081: The Only Sanctuary

Neither the Heavenly Sword Sect nor the departing beast clan of Di Yi had any further news heard from them in the Profound Yellow Realm in the days to come.

In Li Fan's view, this was the escape method he would consider the least. The high wall separated the outside of the Star Sea. Leaving the high wall meant completely losing contact with the Profound Yellow Realm. Thus, whether the escape was successful or not could never be confirmed. Moreover, under the massive energy fluctuations of the Realm Split, failure would likely mean there wouldn't even be a chance to truly return. Neither his main body nor his avatars could “try out” the true feasibility of splitting the realm. Therefore, Li Fan had always been lukewarm about this method.

"Leaving by splitting the realm is undoubtedly the path of the thorough escape faction. The trial set by the Grand Heavenly Venerate of the Profound Yellow Realm could never support such a plan."

"If I were the Heavenly Venerate of the Profound Yellow Realm, and a group of people in my world were preparing to defect, what would I do?"

On the way to Southern Nether Mountain with Xu Ke, Li Fan pondered carefully. The encounters along the way were similar to the illusions he had experienced several times before. However, this time, with the wooden sculpture of Mr. Bai protecting him, the journey was uneventful and very smooth.

Also led by the human form split from Di Yi, they toured the Ten Thousand Beast Assembly of the beast clan. Amidst the surging cheers of the beasts proclaiming "eternal support for Lord Di Yi," the assembly concluded.

At Li Fan's reminder, Xu Ke then handed over the wooden box containing Di Erli. Di Yi's reaction and performance showed no deviation. After uttering a string of obscure words, he split out a gray sphere and handed it to Xu Ke.

"You may go now," Di Yi immediately issued the order to leave.

"Wait a moment." At this time, Xu Ke suddenly spoke again.

"Hmm?" The beast Di Yi seemed surprised. Nevertheless, he patiently waited for Xu Ke to finish.

"Senior, how many of the beasts present do you think sincerely wish to leave with you?"

"Because of a vague calamity, one that currently has no signs, you would abandon the paradise of the Profound Yellow Realm?"

Di Yi's human form frowned, "I don't need their sincerity. I just need them to follow orders."

"If they really refuse to obey, I'll just swallow them all!"

Xu Ke smiled, appearing old and wise, "Earlier, Senior said that infinite futures hold infinite possibilities. Then why are you so certain that the Profound Yellow Realm is doomed in this great calamity and that fleeing is the only path to survival?"

"Is there no possibility that the Profound Yellow Realm truly survives, and remains the only safe place in all spacetime?"

"Shouldn't you do something for this slight possibility?"

Xu Ke's eyes were full of wisdom, as if lit with a light, staring intently at Di Yi. These words were clearly not something Xu Ke of this age could say. And the silly bird sleeping soundly on his head... could certainly not have conceived of them.

"So, this is his intention?" Di Yi naturally knew who had sent Xu Ke here. Thus, he began to seriously consider the words just spoken.

Seeing this, Xu Ke pressed his advantage, "Since Di San Mo could split from the beast group back then and choose to stand with humans."

"Then today, it is also natural that a portion can split between leaving and staying, remaining in the Profound Yellow Realm."

"This is actually unstoppable. However, with your words, it becomes more formal."

The beast Di Yi glanced out the window at the various beasts with mixed expressions, lost in thought.

"Interesting."

"Then wait a bit longer before you go." Saying this, Di Yi's human form slowly vanished into thin air.

Xu Ke and Li Fan looked at the assembly hall, which had not yet completely dispersed. Di Yi suddenly called back over thirty beasts, including Chi Jiutou. He said something, and the beasts first showed looks of fear, then disbelief, and finally ecstatic joy. Li Fan felt Di Yi's gaze on him from afar, but it quickly shifted away.

Seven days later. Above Southern Nether Mountain.

"What, you want us to listen to this little brat?" Chi Jiutou, who had already transformed into human form, looked at the tiny Xu Ke with dissatisfaction.

The group was massive, totaling over three thousand transformed beasts. At this moment, they all radiated fierce killing intent and glared menacingly at Xu Ke.

Xu Ke swallowed, but finally, encouraged by Li Fan, he nodded seriously, "Although Senior Di Yi agreed to your request to remain in the Profound Yellow Realm, the sole condition is that you must obey my orders."

"Of course, I won't make unreasonable demands, but I'm just afraid you'll cause trouble in our human cultivators' territory, so you must exercise more restraint." As Xu Ke spoke, he took out a round disk from his embrace.

As soon as the disk appeared, the many beasts who had been openly showing aggression immediately settled down. At least, they appeared to on the surface.

"Fine, you have the Beast Reincarnation Wheel, so you call the shots." Chi Jiutou said with a forced, insincere smile. "But little brat, we can follow your orders. But there must be a time limit, right? We can't be your slaves for our entire lives?"

"Hahaha, I don't think you need to worry about that. This little brat can live at most a few thousand years, while we beasts can live comfortably for tens of thousands of years!"

"Then we must watch this little brat closely. Don't let him die too early!"

...

Many among the beast group made lighthearted remarks. Xu Ke’s face remained tight, unaffected by their teasing. After making a ruckus for a while, seeing that Xu Ke never became flustered, the beasts quieted down and peacefully continued their journey.

In reality, the beast group following the migration was far larger than the over three thousand visible on the surface. Each type of beast basically brought their entire families, carrying those unwilling to flee the Profound Yellow Realm in magical artifacts resembling Grotto-Heavens. Along the way, more beasts who received the news and also wanted to stay in the Profound Yellow Realm kept arriving to join them.

As they neared the Beast Taming Sect, the group had swelled to ten thousand strong. They moved in a vast, imposing torrent of beastly aura. If it weren't for the Beast Reincarnation Wheel bestowed by the beast Di Yi suppressing their aura, and Mr. Bai's wooden sculpture occasionally invoking heavenly power to conceal them, they would have surely caused panic among the passing cultivators. Even so, when they finally reached the mountain gate of the Beast Taming Sect, such a terrifying beast army caused the bewildered sect to panic immensely.

"Enemy attack! Enemy attack!" A tragic alarm instantly echoed throughout the entire sect. Countless cultivators, along with their natal spirit beasts, rushed over from all parts of the mountain gate.

"Truly weak, so weak!"

"I never thought our Azure Dragon lineage would become so frail after being raised by humans!"

"Hmph, if I hadn't seen it with my own eyes, I wouldn't have believed that beasts would genuinely submit to humans!"

"There are so many of us, perhaps we should..."

Xu Ke broke out in a cold sweat as he watched the atmosphere in the beast group subtly turn sour.

Chapter 1082 Unifying the Beast Taming Sect

Xu Ke gripped the Beast Reincarnation Wheel in his hand, not daring to relax his concentration for a moment.

After a while, the restless group of demonic beasts finally calmed down. It wasn't due to Xu Ke's efforts, but because Di San Mo appeared.

It was interesting. During the Sacred Beast Assembly at South Nether Mountain, whenever Di San Mo was mentioned, these demonic beasts would sneer, calling him a disgrace to the demon race, one that every beast should execute. Yet, when Di San Mo truly appeared at this moment, the demonic beasts present became deathly silent, none daring to utter a loud word.

Xu Ke voiced his confusion in his heart.

"Lord Xuan Niao, why do I feel that in the eyes of these creatures, Third Grandpa seems even more terrifying than Di Yi?"

Li Fan smiled and said, "Di Yi, as the Emperor of the demonic beasts, must consider the entire demon beast race and maintain appropriate rewards and punishments. Under normal circumstances, as long as one does not provoke him, there is no danger. But this Di San Mo before us has clearly defected from the demonic beasts and sided with humans."

"A traitor to the demon race, not only is he still alive, but he even helped human cultivators establish the Beast Taming Sect..."

"Guess who has killed more demonic beasts over the years, Di Yi or Di San Mo?"

Xu Ke immediately fell into deep thought. Then, he glanced at the white-haired old man who looked benevolent and couldn't help but shiver.

With Di San Mo personally stepping forward to suppress them, this group of demonic beasts naturally became outwardly obedient.

However, Di San Mo did not push them too hard, forcing them all to join the Beast Taming Sect and be enslaved by human cultivators.

Instead, he cordoned off a large area within the territory of the Beast Taming Sect, temporarily for these demonic beasts to reside.

Although it was a bit cramped, their survival was not an issue.

After listening to Xu Ke explain the whole story, Di San Mo asked, "What was the reason for your words to Di Yi?"

Xu Ke was already prepared and replied calmly, "Senior Di Yi said that a great calamity is approaching the Profound Yellow Realm, so he plans to split the realm and leave. But he can escape, while we cannot. To face this calamity, we must unite all forces that can be united. With the strength of this group of demonic beasts joining us, at least the possibility of our Beast Taming Sect surviving the calamity will be much greater."

Di San Mo pondered in silence.

These words did not sound like something a child would come up with. However, Di San Mo had lived too long and no longer measured a person's wisdom solely by their youth.

After a period of silence, he said faintly, "Since you brought this trouble upon yourself, you shall handle it entirely. In the future, if any of these beasts cause trouble and break the sect's rules, I will hold you accountable."

With that, Di San Mo also tossed over a round disc.

It was not very different from the one Di Yi bestowed upon Xu Ke.

Only the patterns of demonic beasts carved on it were richer and more vivid.

"This is..."

"The sect's ultimate treasure, the Beast Reincarnation Wheel?" Xu Ke quickly recognized the treasure Di San Mo handed him and instinctively held it tightly.

Before he could say anything more, Di San Mo's figure had already disappeared.

"This treasure, he just gave it to me so easily?" Xu Ke was utterly bewildered, feeling it was incredibly unreal.

Li Fan secretly compared the two different Beast Reincarnation Wheels.

The one gifted by Di Yi, although the demonic beast patterns only included the species that migrated with Xu Ke, had a stronger suppressive power over the demonic beasts. Even the strongest among them, the Scarlet Nine-Headed Serpent comparable to a human cultivator in the Longevity Realm, had its life and death at the whim of the Beast Reincarnation Wheel's holder. This was determined by the characteristic that all demonic beasts in the Profound Yellow Realm originated from Di Yi's differentiation.

As for the Beast Reincarnation Wheel of Di San Mo, it seemed to encompass all demonic beasts in the world except for the Beast Emperors. However, its control over the demonic beasts was relatively weaker. After all, a wise person or a prophet could only offer specific advice but could not decide the direction of choice.

"I wonder if the memories of cultivation techniques and divine abilities will still be lost after coming out of the trial illusion realm of the Profound Yellow Great Heavenly Venerate."

"If the technology of these two Beast Reincarnation Wheels can be absorbed and transformed, perhaps the Empire can truly cultivate beasts that have reverted to their ancestral forms."

In the Imperial Small World, there had always been such a conjecture.

Exotic beasts evolved from demonic beasts, and all demonic beasts shared a common ancestor. Therefore, in reality, every exotic beast contained complete information about the demonic beast bloodline.

The refinement of the Fusion Beast resembling Di Yi was based on this conjecture.

However, too little information about ancient demonic beasts was available, making targeted reversion experiments impossible. Otherwise, recreating the era when ancient demonic beasts ran rampant might not be difficult.

"Regardless, I should record them properly first."

The information contained within the two Beast Reincarnation Wheels was too vast. Even with Li Fan's current abilities, fully mastering it was strenuous. Moreover, perhaps because they were not native products of the Profound Yellow Realm, the information on the Beast Reincarnation Wheels in the illusion realm seemed to be missing compared to the real objects.

But this did not prevent Li Fan from monopolizing both Beast Reincarnation Wheels at all times.

Subsequently, the plot direction of [The Transformation of the Beast Taming Sect] began to deviate from the past.

Xu Ke no longer received the mission to go to the Divine Brush Sect to find the Realm-Splitting Whale. Instead, he focused on handling the group of demonic beasts within the sect.

"Unite all forces that can be united" should be the test content for this second act.

When a calamity descends, as the Profound Yellow Great Heavenly Venerate, one naturally needs to demonstrate an extraordinary ability for overall planning and coordination. The forces within the Profound Yellow Realm are numerous and each has its own agenda. But ultimately, they all belong to the human race.

The conflicts and disputes among them are certainly not as great as those between humans and demonic beasts.

At least, this is what needed to be displayed on the surface.

If he could handle the relationship between this group of demonic beasts and the Beast Taming Sect well, he would likely pass this trial.

"Don't try to suppress them with the Beast Reincarnation Wheel the moment you encounter difficulties. You must persuade the beasts with reason..."

"If one day the Beast Reincarnation Wheel fails, how will you respond?"

"In ancient times in the Profound Yellow Realm, there was a Sage Emperor who, despite having no strength to even tie up a chicken, spoke sincerely and treated others with sincerity. Everyone who conversed with him felt like basking in a spring breeze. Superiors and subordinates alike admired and revered him."

Li Fan studied the Beast Reincarnation Wheels while cultivating to increase his own strength.

At the same time, he also guided Xu Ke on how to handle and command that group of demonic beasts.

Compared to humans, demonic beasts often had fewer complexities in their minds, appearing even simpler.

Under the personal guidance of Grand Tutor Li, Xu Ke only used the power of the Beast Reincarnation Wheel three times over the years. In the vast majority of cases, he resolved various crises purely through words and actions.

Finally, he gradually gained the trust of all the demonic beasts.

Eventually, the great calamity of "Different Techniques Cannot Be Cultivated Together" finally descended.

Because everyone in the Beast Taming Sect only cultivated one set of techniques, they could not last long and soon showed signs of collapse.

"Such a terrifying calamity, 'Different Techniques Cannot Be Cultivated Together'..."

Xu Ke's expression turned grim.

Chapter 1083: Sword Trial of Mr. Bai

However, the experiences over the years had already matured his state of mind, and he quickly calmed down.

He methodically commanded the demonic beasts under his control to suppress and subdue the out-of-control disciples of the Beast Taming Sect.

“Hahaha, I’ve long disliked them. Now I finally have a chance to take revenge openly.”

“It’s time to stretch our limbs. Being cooped up on this small hill for so many years, I was almost getting sick.”

“Brothers, put some strength into it, so we aren’t looked down upon!”

...

In an instant, the tens of thousands of demonic beasts that had been lying dormant in the Beast Taming Sect surged out like dragons emerging from the sea, shrouding the entire territory like dark clouds.

The terrifying demonic wind and killing intent even temporarily suppressed the threat of the great calamity.

“Not good, those demonic beasts have rebelled!”

“I told you so, those not of our kind will always have different hearts. Not subduing them with the True Art of Beast Taming has indeed left endless trouble! Damn the Sect Master for not listening to me!”

“My life is over!”

Under the calamity of ‘Different Techniques Cannot Be Cultivated Together,’ the Beast Taming Sect, already struggling to protect itself, was naturally no match for these demonic beasts that had conserved their strength for many years.

It only took three days for them to be completely suppressed.

Although the force used in the process might have been a bit heavy, with Xu Ke present, the demonic beasts did not take the lives of the human cultivators.

“Boss, what should we do next?” Chi Jiutou asked with a somewhat serious expression.

The calamity of ‘Different Techniques Cannot Be Cultivated Together’ also had a certain impact on the demonic beast population.

The inherited cultivation methods within each lineage were often limited to just one set.

However, the demonic beast community had a strict hierarchy, allowing them to maintain stability for the time being.

“I didn’t expect Lord Di Yi’s prophecy to be true. If I had known earlier, I should have left with them back then,” You Xuanhuang sighed mournfully.

“Given the current situation, there are only two strategies. First, to defy the principle that different techniques cannot be cultivated together. Second, if that is not possible, then we must adapt to the changes in the world,” Xu Ke responded calmly and unhurriedly.

“Since different techniques cannot be cultivated together, then let everyone cultivate different techniques! Our Beast Taming Sect doesn’t have enough cultivation methods…”

“Then we’ll go borrow some from the surrounding sects,” Xu Ke’s expression turned stern.

The surrounding demonic beasts were first stunned upon hearing this, not understanding what he meant. But they quickly reacted and were overjoyed.

After all, plundering was the inherent nature of demonic beasts.

“Lord Xuan Niao, do we really have to do this?” Internally, Xu Ke was not as resolute as he appeared on the surface. He was still somewhat conflicted and reluctant.

“Don’t be soft-hearted. With the great calamity descending, perhaps less than one in ten Xuanhuang cultivators will survive. Since you are now the nominal leader of the Beast Taming Sect, you are naturally responsible for their survival.”

“It’s better for others to die than for us to die,” Li Fan’s tone was icy cold.

A deathly silence followed.

After a long time, Xu Ke finally made up his mind: “I understand.”

He raised his head, his eyes filled with determination.

Half a day later, under Xu Ke’s command, the demonic beast army swept through the surroundings with overwhelming force.

Destroying sects and collecting supplies and cultivation methods.

They bypassed the sects with strong power, only targeting the easier ones, striving for quick victories.

The ten thousand demonic beasts moved as one.

At the outbreak of the calamity of ‘Different Techniques Cannot Be Cultivated Together,’ they were an absolutely unstoppable force.

In just over half a month, they had destroyed over a hundred sects, large and small.

In the past, such a beast disaster would have surely attracted the attention of the Ten Great Immortal Sects, leading to a joint encirclement by countless human cultivators.

But now, the Ten Great Immortal Sects were all preoccupied with their own survival and had no spare energy to worry about the affairs of other sects.

All the cultivation methods plundered by the demonic beasts were uniformly handed over to Xu Ke.

Seeing that enough had been collected, Xu Ke immediately ordered a halt.

After decisively killing several manic demonic beasts that disobeyed orders, Xu Ke issued the order to retreat.

“Are we going to flee too?” “Retreat? To where?”

The cultivators of the Beast Taming Sect, including all the demonic beasts, were somewhat confused.

It was only after Xu Ke explained that everyone suddenly realized.

It turned out that Xu Ke had been far-sighted. Ever since returning from the Southern Nether Sacred Beast Mountain years ago, he had sent people to investigate hidden small worlds where they could establish a foothold.

“The calamity of the Xuanhuang World will likely continue for thousands of years. If we want to preserve ourselves, we can only temporarily retreat into a small world and slowly plan for revival,” Xu Ke sighed deeply.

During this period, everyone had witnessed the tragic scenes of external sects slaughtering each other.

In comparison, the death toll in the Beast Taming Sect was pitifully small.

And this was all thanks to Xu Ke’s foresight.

“I originally thought that after Lord Di San Mo mysteriously disappeared, our future was uncertain. I didn’t expect Boss Shensuan to be in no way inferior to Lord Di San Mo.”

“Nonsense, otherwise why would Di San Mo and Di Yi easily hand over the Beast Reincarnation Wheels to the Boss?”

“I told you long ago, following the Boss, there’s meat to eat.”

This operation by Xu Ke finally won over everyone from top to bottom, leaving no dissent.

Afterward, under Xu Ke’s command, they quickly migrated as a whole towards the unknown small world.

Just before leaving the Xuanhuang World, Xu Ke and Li Fan took one last look at this world: “We will return someday.”

Then their figures slowly vanished from the world.

At the same time, the scene in the Fallen Immortal Realm began to freeze.

The surroundings abruptly changed from bright to completely dark.

“I wonder if this counts as passing the trial of the Xuanhuang Great Heavenly Venerable?” Li Fan was actually unsure in his heart.

However, coordinating the harmonious coexistence of human and demonic beast populations, and using all means necessary to maintain the group's survival when calamity strikes—these were the most perfect methods Li Fan could think of at that moment. If he hadn't had several prior experiences, even with extensive contemplation, Li Fan likely wouldn’t have devised such a method in a short time.

The trial illusion seemed to be evaluating Li Fan’s actions. The waiting time was longer than in the first scene.

Fortunately...

Streams of white light suddenly appeared from the darkness.

After a dizzying spin, a new scene was generated!

Li Fan successfully passed the trial and arrived at the third scene: the Heavenly Sword Sect refining swords!

“What will this trial test?”

Li Fan had not experienced the scene of the Heavenly Sword Sect refining swords many times, so he was not entirely confident. However, during his years in the Beast Taming Sect, Li Fan had made ample preparations. He had been silently following the established plot, reasonably playing the role he had possessed.

Until the cultivator impersonated by Mr. Bai came to challenge them!

None of the Heavenly Sword Sect disciples were a match for Mr. Bai.

As everyone was shocked and fearful, Li Fan walked out with his head held high.

“I wish to experience the Senior’s profound skills!”

Li Fan cupped his hands in greeting.

“May I ask the Senior to see how my swordsmanship is?”

Li Fan said loudly, casually breaking a branch from a nearby tree. It was exactly the same action Mr. Bai had performed before!

This action caused an uproar among the Heavenly Sword Sect disciples.

And for the first time, Mr. Bai’s eyes showed a flicker of interest.

Chapter 1084: The Sword of Life Prevails

“Who is that? He is only in the Golden Core realm, yet he dares to be so arrogant? Didn’t you see Senior Brother Hua, who is at the late Nascent Soul stage, lose in one move just now?”

“Inner Sect disciple Ji Zhaoxuan! He is usually taciturn and unremarkable. I didn’t expect him to step forward at this moment!”

“Good! Worthy of being a disciple of our Heavenly Sword Sect. Even knowing he is outmatched, he still dares to draw his sword! Just for this, he is one of the best among the inner sect disciples!”

...

The surrounding Heavenly Sword Sect disciples chattered, some showing disdain, some admiration, and some worship.

Li Fan paid no heed to the surrounding voices, merely looking directly at Mr. Bai: “Senior’s strength is certainly far beyond mine. However, if we are only comparing our understanding of the Way of the Sword, I’m afraid you may not be stronger than me.”

Li Fan was full of confidence, but Mr. Bai smiled slightly without refuting.

“So, in today’s match, we will only compete on whose understanding of the Way of the Sword is superior, not on the difference in strength!”

As soon as these words were uttered, everyone present froze.

“Does this mean he wants the other party to maintain his cultivation realm at the Golden Core stage for the contest?”

“Can it be done like this?”

“Bah! Shameless!”

“But I think this is acceptable. After all, this guest’s cultivation is unfathomable. If he were to use his full power, perhaps only the Eldest Senior Brother could defeat him.”

Facing Li Fan’s somewhat rude request, Mr. Bai did not mind. He nodded and said with a smile, “Rest assured, I never bully the young.”

With that, the unfathomable aura that he had been emitting instantly calmed down, becoming the same as the late Golden Core cultivation level of the Ji Zhaoxuan Li Fan was inhabiting.

Li Fan cupped his hands, his expression solemn: “Since that is the case…”

“Behold my sword!”

Before the words “Behold my sword” were fully spoken, Li Fan had actually already made his move.

By the time the spectators heard Li Fan’s shout, a phantom image of a giant sword had already descended between heaven and earth, its tip pointing directly at the top of Mr. Bai’s head.

Around the giant sword, there seemed to be countless different divine swords of all shapes and sizes inserted. The giant sword was like the emperor of swords, drawing forth torrents of sword energy and intertwining rays of light.

On the ground, all the watching disciples of the Heavenly Sword Sect involuntarily controlled their innate swords the moment the giant sword appeared. They flew out in succession, hovering in the air, their blades humming softly, as if paying respects.

Not only that, but the entire Heavenly Sword Sect was trembling slightly, as if something deep within the sect was awakening.

This earth-shattering spectacle naturally and instantly attracted the attention of all the cultivators in the Heavenly Sword Sect. Countless figures rushed over.

And when a drunken cultivator holding a wine gourd arrived, everyone present let out a simultaneous gasp: “It’s the Eldest Senior Brother?!”

“The Eldest Senior Brother is here!”

Situ Yao of the Heavenly Sword Sect, unlike his usual playful demeanor, looked grave as he stared at Li Fan and Mr. Bai who were competing.

However, the changes outside the field seemed to have absolutely no effect on the two of them.

The moment the phantom of the giant sword appeared accompanied by ten thousand swords, a flicker of astonishment crossed Mr. Bai’s eyes.

Because he sensed that the wooden sword in his hand had suddenly become much lighter, as if… the Way of the Sword condensed on the wooden sword had instantly transferred to the other party!

“A counterfeit Heavenly Dao, combined with my understanding of the wonder of the Wooden Sword Heaven. Taking him by surprise, it is enough to instantly seize control of the Profound Yellow Way of the Sword!”

“However, Mr. Bai is after all an incarnation of the Profound Yellow Heavenly Dao, so this method of a counterfeit Heavenly Dao can only be used once, not again.”

“So, there is only one chance!”

Li Fan’s heart was unprecedentedly calm.

Under his control, the phantom of the giant sword materialized, and the surrounding ten thousand swords also manifested. They descended like a torrential downpour, suddenly appearing. Countless sharp swords tore through space, forming a terrifying storm that swept outwards.

The watching crowd turned pale and retreated backward. But quite a few Nascent Soul, and even Spirit Transformation cultivators, were knocked about and lost control of their figures by the sudden storm of ten thousand swords. Not to mention the disciples with lower cultivation.

“What a joke, can a Golden Core realm cultivator use this?”

“Could it be that Ji Zhaoxuan has been hiding his cultivation level all along?”

“Monsters, we are fortunate enough to witness a duel between two monsters today!”

The rampaging sword energy obscured the vision of most people. But the experts at the Dao Integration realm and above still stared intently at the center of the storm.

They watched in horror as Mr. Bai, facing this world-destroying ultimate move, actually neither dodged nor retreated. The countless sharp swords roared and struck his body.

But strangely, these swords could not inflict any damage on Mr. Bai. Instead, they vanished silently, like a stone sinking into the sea or snow melting in water. Only the wooden sword in Mr. Bai’s hand seemed to have become lively again.

The storm of ten thousand swords was endless and showed no signs of subsiding for the time being. Li Fan, however, had quietly disappeared within the storm.

Mr. Bai had no intention of counterattacking, just stood quietly in the center of the storm.

“The Sword of Profound Yellow…”

“I did not expect that someone in this world could master it to this extent. Remarkable!” Mr. Bai praised sincerely.

“It’s a pity that these alone cannot defeat me.”

Mr. Bai’s words echoed in the storm of ten thousand swords. His gaze drifted, trying to lock onto Li Fan’s position. However, Li Fan had now merged his body with the sword, dissolving into the myriad ways of the sword. Even as an incarnation of the Heavenly Dao, Mr. Bai could not find Li Fan for a time.

The ten thousand swords roared, finally entering the most violent moment before subsiding. In the instant countless sword lights bloomed together, a seemingly ordinary wooden sword, hidden among them, quietly flew towards Mr. Bai, moving forward relentlessly and with a sense of utter resolve!

At first, it was like an ordinary sword move. But as the wooden sword’s speed increased, its momentum grew stronger and stronger, like raging flames spreading across the sky, or a meteor illuminating the darkness. Compared to it, all the other sharp swords in the storm seemed dim and lusterless.

“This is…” At this moment, Situ Yao and the elders of the Heavenly Sword Sect watching all showed shock and regret.

Because this was the strongest sword, unleashed by sacrificing one's own life. It was also the final sword.

The Sword of Life!

Mr. Bai naturally saw the true nature of this sword. He could not help but hesitate.

It was just a match, there was really no need to sacrifice the young man’s life for victory. Moreover… his comprehension of the Way of the Sword was indeed rare in the world, not inferior to his own. At this critical juncture, the more talents the Profound Yellow World had, the better. It would be a terrible waste for such a person to die just like that.

In a flash of thought, Mr. Bai made his decision.

“I concede.”

The moment the words were spoken, he lifted his cultivation restriction. He used the power of the Longevity Realm to forcefully reverse the process of Li Fan burning his life.

However… Li Fan had absolutely no intention of stopping. Even though his sword momentum was completely lost, his speed did not decrease. Finally, the wooden sword in his hand still lightly pierced Mr. Bai’s body.

Chapter 1085: The Trail of Ancient Immortal Artifacts

A spent arrow cannot pierce thin silk.

Under the pressure of the Longevity Realm, Li Fan's strike probably couldn't even injure an ordinary mortal, let alone Mr. Bai.

However, even though not even a trace of a white mark was left, this sword strike ultimately pierced Mr. Bai's body.

This was because Li Fan disregarded his own life.

This was because of Mr. Bai's appreciation for talent and pity.

As the saying goes, a gentleman can be guided by righteousness!

This sword strike was the answer Li Fan had pondered during these years in the second act of the Immortal Deposition Realm.

The first act tested benevolence.

The second act tested wisdom.

And this third act should test martial prowess!

Mr. Bai suppressed the Heavenly Sword Sect with his sword. If Li Fan could defeat him, or rather, gain his recognition in the duel, he would likely pass the third act's trial.

And Li Fan had now achieved that.

"I yield."

Although the process of burning his life force had been reversed by Mr. Bai, unleashing the Sword of Life had still severely depleted Li Fan's vital energy.

At this moment, his face was pale, as if he could stop breathing at any moment.

He coughed continuously and cupped his hands towards Mr. Bai.

Mr. Bai looked at Li Fan with a complex expression.

"Why?" he asked.

Li Fan said lightly, "I am different from you. You always overthink things. As for me, I will stop at nothing to achieve my goal! Even if it means sacrificing my life!"

The scenery of the surrounding Heavenly Sword Sect gradually faded.

Only Mr. Bai's figure remained clear.

Li Fan continued, "So, the things you can do, I might not be able to do."

"But the things you cannot do, I might be able to."

It sounded like a tongue-twister, but Mr. Bai understood what Li Fan meant.

"Sometimes, to survive, one must be ruthless."

After saying this, Li Fan's body also slowly became transparent.

Finally, he completely vanished.

Only Mr. Bai remained in that space-time.

He frowned deeply, seemingly facing a decision that was extremely difficult to make.

After an unknown period, he suddenly broke into a smile.

"That's right. I always have too many reservations."

"Perhaps, being like him is the only way to ultimately fight for a glimmer of survival..."

Mr. Bai's figure, along with his voice, gradually quieted down.

...

In the darkness, Li Fan did not know how long he waited.

A familiar sense of dizziness swept over him, and the scene before his eyes suddenly brightened again.

Looking around, he had not returned to the real world.

Instead, he found himself in a new environment.

"My guess was indeed correct."

"Although it wasn't glorious, I ultimately defeated Mr. Bai and passed the test of martial prowess."

"Ignoring the process, only validating the result."

Li Fan felt a bit joyful in his heart.

"Now, let me see what the test for this fourth act will be."

As this thought arose, countless pieces of information instantly flooded into Li Fan's mind.

His expression immediately froze.

"How can this be?"

Even with Li Fan's composure, he was momentarily stunned.

He quickly cast the Water Mirror Technique and looked at himself in the mirror.

The flawless, peerless countenance brought a feeling of spring breeze and inherent respect.

Li Fan was too familiar with this face. He had even competed against it not long ago.

It was Mr. Bai!

"In this fourth act, I have actually possessed Mr. Bai directly?"

Li Fan was greatly shaken.

He felt both surprise and vigilance.

The joy was that by taking Mr. Bai's body, he could experience being the Profound Yellow Great Celestial Venerable ahead of time, which would undoubtedly benefit him immensely in all aspects of cultivation from now on.

The vigilance was that the event of Mr. Bai's rebirth through possession might happen again.

A moment later, Li Fan calmed his mind and began to sort through the information in his head.

Unfortunately, because this was only a trial.

Mr. Bai's memories in his mind were incomplete.

There were only intermittent fragments, along with the "main quest" involved in this trial.

"At this moment, having passed the recognition of the Heavenly Dao, I have officially become the Profound Yellow Great Celestial Venerable."

"The mission objective is..."

"Find the immortal artifacts left behind in various parts of the Profound Yellow World, and escape the Profound Yellow World?"

Li Fan's expression immediately became incredibly strange.

This was completely contrary to the actions of Mr. Bai he knew, causing Li Fan to confirm it several times.

"Huh? No."

"This is not a trial of the Immortal Deposition Realm. It is..."

"The mission that Mr. Bai shouldered at this point in time!"

After a while, Li Fan suddenly realized.

After becoming the Profound Yellow Great Celestial Venerable, Mr. Bai faintly sensed the urging of the Profound Yellow World's Heavenly Dao consciousness.

The calamity was descending and was unavoidable.

It was better to abandon the world's physical body and depart early.

"The Profound Yellow World is no longer a good place. Evils wreak havoc within, and the Immortal Ruins eye it covetously from the outside."

"It is better to cross the Immortal Wall and re-establish a world in the outside realm."

...

Li Fan frowned, slowly piecing together the fragmented memory information.

"The Immortal Wall is hard to cross. Even the Profound Yellow Great Celestial Venerable finds it insufficient."

"However, before the Immortal Path was completely severed, the Upper Realm occasionally bestowed immortal artifacts. Some of these artifacts are still sealed in the treasure vaults of sects, while others are buried deep underground, unknown to anyone."

"But all of them cannot escape the control of the Profound Yellow World's Heavenly Dao consciousness."

"As long as these immortal artifacts are gathered, using them as sacrifices, even without completely destroying them, they will possess enough power to cross the Immortal Wall."

A look that completely contradicted his physical demeanor instantly appeared on Li Fan's face.

"Immortal artifacts? At least ten immortal artifacts?"

According to the information transmitted by the Profound Yellow World's Heavenly Dao consciousness, each of these immortal artifacts possessed power no less than the Heaven Profound Mirror.

If he could collect them all and make them his own...

Li Fan's mind immediately began to wander.

It was worth noting that throughout his countless reincarnations, besides the Heaven Profound Mirror and the Fishing Pond, he had never seen any other immortal artifacts.

Now, it was as if he had been struck by a great gift package, instantly learning the whereabouts of over ten immortal artifacts. How could his heart not be stirred!

"Wait, in real history, all these immortal artifacts disappeared?"

However, Li Fan quickly reacted.

He immediately recalled an ancient anecdote he had collected earlier.

When the great calamity descended, because of the inability to cultivate different paths simultaneously, the various sects were already in chaos.

The inexplicable disappearance of the immortal artifacts stored in the sects further accelerated the demise of the immortal cultivation sects.

"Could it be that all those mysteriously disappeared immortal artifacts back then were secretly taken by Mr. Bai?"

Li Fan's expression became somewhat strange.

He began to re-examine the information in his mind regarding these immortal artifacts.

These immortal artifacts were bestowed by the Upper Realm when the Immortal Path was not yet severed.

At that time, the great sects of the Profound Yellow World were not the Ten Immortal Sects that came later, but had long since vanished into the long river of history.

For example, the Samsara Sect, the Desolate God Sect, and so on.

And the immortal artifacts held by them were divided among the Ten Immortal Sects.

However, immortal artifacts have spirits, and they cannot be used by direct disciples of the sect. Therefore, even if the Ten Immortal Sects managed to snatch the vast majority of the immortal artifacts, they could not use them at all.

Brothers, please don't give me monthly passes this month. I've been slacking on updates, and I feel undeserving. Please vote for "Ring of Destiny" instead.

Chapter 1086 Tianshu Sect Secret Vault

Given the greedy nature of cultivators of the Profound Yellow World, even if the immortal artifacts could not be used, they would never willingly hand them over to others. Instead, they would seal them in the deepest part of the sect’s treasure vault and guard them closely, hoping for a day when they could awaken the power of these immortal artifacts.

“Let’s see where the closest immortal artifact is…”

“Desolate God Seal, Tianshu Sect.”

The Desolate God Seal was the supreme treasure of the long-extinct Desolate God Sect. Its controller could communicate with the Immortal Realm and summon ancient Desolate Gods to appear. In the memories of the Profound Yellow World that Mr. Bai had inherited, Li Fan saw the terrifying scene of a Desolate God descending in the past. A giant golden eyeball suddenly appeared in a massive vortex in the sky. Under the gaze of the Desolate God, the land of the Profound Yellow World cracked inch by inch, then turned into nothingness. It was somewhat akin to the power displayed by the Immortals of the Immortal Ruins when they could extinguish worlds with a single glance.

The Desolate God Sect had once summoned twelve different Desolate Gods, eliminating countless hostile sects and dominating the Primordial Profound Yellow World. It was a pity that later, fewer and fewer Desolate Gods responded, until finally, there was no reply at all. Without the deterrent of the Desolate Gods descending, the Desolate God Sect was soon besieged by its enemies and tragically wiped out.

As for the Tianshu Sect, it was one of the Ten Great Immortal Sects of the past. However, very little information remained for later generations. Li Fan only vaguely knew that this sect was the most closely related Daoist sect to the Great Master Tiandu. The disciples of the sect often considered themselves the true inheritors of the Immortal Path and were very arrogant.

After roughly understanding the relevant information, Li Fan, who was now the Great Heavenly Venerable of the Profound Yellow World, moved his mind, instantly arriving within the key area of the Tianshu Sect—the Tianshu Courtyard. He had actually traversed hundreds of thousands of miles in the blink of an eye, ignoring all the formations and restrictions of the Tianshu Sect, and arrived directly in the innermost secret area.

“Is this the power of the Great Heavenly Venerable of the Profound Yellow World?”

Li Fan looked at his hands, feeling a surge of emotion. He felt that the spiritual power within his body was almost endless; even if he cast any divine ability, it would not diminish in the slightest. Moreover, once a divine ability manifested in the Profound Yellow World, it would naturally be amplified to the limit that the heavens and earth could achieve. Any technique in this world that originated from the Profound Yellow World could be seen through instantly and posed no threat to him.

“This is even better than my control over the Spirit Wood Realm!”

“After all, one is voluntary cooperation, and the other is forced coercion.”

With a slight sigh, Li Fan slowly familiarized himself with the authority of the Great Heavenly Venerable of the Profound Yellow World. Then, he strolled through the Tianshu Courtyard, heading towards a hall-like structure in the deepest center. That area was enveloped by a strange energy, making it the only “blind spot” for the Heavenly Venerable of the Profound Yellow World within the entire Tianshu Sect. The cultivators of the Tianshu Sect guarding the hall could not see Li Fan’s existence at all, even when he walked right past them.

“This is…”

In front of the hall, Li Fan paused slightly. He sensed a type of power that felt somewhat familiar. It was not familiar to this body of Mr. Bai, but to Li Fan’s original self.

“Great Master Tiandu.”

An instinctive disgust suddenly rose in his heart, much like the feeling of finding cockroaches in one’s kitchen. Li Fan frowned immediately. However, he soon calmed his mind. His figure flowed like water, passing through the invisible protective shield and entering the interior of the hall.

Inside the hall, two stone statues were enshrined: one large and one small. The large stone statue had its eyes closed and lowered, its expression solemn. The small stone statue was a young attendant standing respectfully behind it.

“This large stone statue is the figure who preached the Dao on his own in Tiandu. However, according to the information I collected earlier, the attendant standing behind the figure is likely the true Great Master Tiandu.” Li Fan’s gaze fell upon the statue of the young attendant.

In a daze, he seemed to travel through countless spaces and arrive at a magnificent capital city floating in the sky. His spirit jolted, and the illusion vanished. Looking at the statue of the young attendant again, he felt a slight stinging in his eyes.

“Hmph.” Li Fan snorted coldly, forcefully suppressing the urge to smash the statue to pieces. He looked around for the hidden vault.

It didn’t take much effort to find a hidden restriction behind the two statues. After breaking the restriction, Li Fan was able to enter the Tianshu Sect’s treasure vault. Contrary to the expectation of a scene filled with dazzling treasures, the Tianshu Sect’s treasure vault was, one might even say, somewhat rudimentary, leading Li Fan to almost suspect he had gone to the wrong place.

On a purplish-red long table, a stone seal, a wooden box, and a scroll were placed in order. Nothing else was there. That stone seal was naturally Li Fan’s goal this time—the immortal artifact Desolate God Seal. Even though it was still sealed, Li Fan could vaguely sense a terrifying, ancient, primordial aura emanating from it. The wooden box and the scroll next to it, being placed alongside the immortal artifact Desolate God Seal, was enough to prove their extraordinary nature.

If it were Mr. Bai, he would naturally have only taken the Desolate God Seal and quickly left. But how could Li Fan leave empty-handed from a mountain of treasures? Even if this was the illusionary realm of the Immortal Ruins and he couldn't bring the treasures back to the real world, it was good to broaden his knowledge and feast his eyes.

Li Fan first carefully examined the wooden box. He keenly perceived that there seemed to be something alive imprisoned inside the wooden box. It was vibrating slightly and constantly with extremely small frequency and amplitude. Each vibration inadvertently dispersed an aura that even Li Fan, now the Great Heavenly Venerable of the Profound Yellow World, found faintly dangerous. Even more bizarrely, the creature inside the wooden box seemed to sense Li Fan’s presence outside. The vibrations grew more urgent, seeming to entice and urge Li Fan to open the box.

Indistinct rustling sounds vaguely emerged in his ears, and various illusions simultaneously appeared before his eyes. Li Fan pondered for a long time, but ultimately suppressed the impulse in his mind with immense willpower. It was at this moment that Li Fan realized, with shock, that the Profound Yellow Immortal Heart Incantation, which would automatically operate as soon as self-awareness awakened in the Immortal Ruins illusionary realm, had inexplicably failed at some point!

Without the blessing of the Immortal Heart Incantation, resisting the temptation relied solely on Li Fan’s own willpower. Fortunately, he had experienced many reincarnations, possessed extensive knowledge, and had an extraordinary will. Otherwise, he might have lost control on the spot and opened the wooden box.

Li Fan forcefully shifted his gaze to the scroll. The illusory sounds and visions from the wooden box instantly diminished. “This wooden box is a bit sinister. I wonder if it still exists in the Profound Yellow World now.”

In stark contrast to the strangeness of the wooden box, the scroll radiated an aura of absolute holiness and true Daoist orthodoxy. Not only was there no warning, but a sense of closeness spontaneously arose.

“Hmm? Have I seen this scroll somewhere before?” Li Fan searched through Mr. Bai’s incomplete memories. Fortunately, he had some luck, and a slightly fuzzy image instantly flashed in his mind.

Chapter 1087 Edict from the Immortal Realm

Countless sacred golden lights shot out from the rift, painting the entire world with a golden edge.

Heavenly flowers rained down, and auspicious clouds filled the sky.

A somewhat blurry figure rose from the ground and slowly flew towards the rift.

The silhouette of the figure radiated seven-colored light, dazzling and magnificent.

As the figure ascended into the rift, a misty rain also descended from it.

Drip by drip, it nourished all things.

Under the nourishment of the immortal spirit rain, almost instantly, the entire Profound Yellow World underwent a change almost visible to the naked eye.

The world became more vibrant and full of vitality.

The living beings on the earth, irrigated by the immortal spirit rain, became wiser and more talented.

The joyous consciousness of countless masses spread between heaven and earth.

Even the world itself was transformed!

...

"This is..."

"Ascension?"

A word that is ancient and never forgotten by cultivators instantly appeared in Li Fan's mind.

The era when the path to immortality was not yet severed was too long ago.

So much so that now, one could only catch a glimpse of the prosperity of the ancient great age of cultivation in the lines of ancient texts.

And now, Li Fan was fortunate enough to witness the scene of cultivators ascending from the Profound Yellow World with his own eyes!

His mind was shaken, and he was deeply drawn in.

"So, the ascension of cultivators brings unimaginable benefits to the entire world as well."

"The more cultivators ascend, the stronger the foundation of the cultivation world they belong to."

"It seems that quite a few cultivators from the Profound Yellow World have ascended in the past. No wonder..."

The phenomenon of cultivator ascension lasted for the time it takes to drink a cup of tea.

The rift in the sky slowly closed, and the golden light gradually disappeared.

At the last moment, a scroll floated down from it.

It unfurled in the wind, revealing itself against the sky.

"Profound Yellow World... After cultivating for eight hundred and sixty-five years, one has achieved great success and attained the Dao to ascend."

"Hereby issued an immortal edict to commemorate this achievement."

"The path to immortality is arduous; let the sparks never be extinguished. Let those who follow strive for it."

...

The writing on the scroll was blurry, especially the name of the ascended one, which was missing.

But it generally described the past life of the cultivator who ascended to immortality, and the encouragement from the Immortal Realm to the cultivators of the lower Profound Yellow World.

"This scroll is the Immortal Edict sent down from the Immortal Realm back then?"

Li Fan stared intently at the seemingly ordinary scroll, his heart churning.

"But this form of the Immortal Edict looks a bit familiar?"

"It's almost exactly the same as the strange phenomenon that appears after cultivators fall nowadays. So it wasn't the Heavenly Dao acting on a whim, but rather had an early prototype."

"It's just that one is an award from the upper realm, and the other is the Profound Yellow Heavenly Dao mocking cultivators."

Li Fan shook his head slightly.

"However, judging by the wording of this Immortal Edict, the Immortal Realm is very welcoming and even encourages cultivators to ascend."

"The immortal spirit rain that descends during ascension might be a form of reward."

"And at some point, something happened in the Immortal Realm. Not only did the path to immortality break, but even True Immortals had to flee in all directions..."

Li Fan narrowed his eyes.

After a long while, he collected his thoughts.

He looked back at the Immortal Edict before him.

"Should I take it or not?" A difficult question was immediately placed before Li Fan.

"Even if I fail, I can start over in the next life."

"As long as I can see the Immortal Edict for myself, it will be worth the trip."

Without much hesitation, Li Fan reached out his hand, mobilizing infinite divine power, and instantly broke the restrictions covering the two treasures.

However, when he tried to subdue them, a little trouble arose.

The Desolate God Token and the Immortal Edict were both items from the Immortal Realm.

They were not ordinary items that could be easily obtained.

With Li Fan's current strength as the Profound Yellow Heavenly Venerable, if he only took one of them, it would be relatively stable and would not alert the cultivators of the Heavenly Pivot Sect.

But if he tried to forcibly take both at the same time, it would be a bit straining and inevitably cause a larger commotion.

The first to sense the abnormality was the third party in the secret vault, that wooden box.

Seemingly sensing that its two long-time neighbors had escaped, the unknown entity sealed within the wooden box immediately became restless.

It emitted rapid, faint sounds.

Countless illusions surged forth, appearing constantly before Li Fan's eyes.

Li Fan's action of collecting the two treasures paused slightly.

"Insolent child, how dare you!"

An angry shout then rang out like a clap of thunder.

Immediately after, five powerful Everlasting Realm auras suddenly appeared, locking onto Li Fan from a distance and rapidly approaching the secret vault.

"This is a bit troublesome."

Li Fan felt a bit helpless.

However, after a moment, he completed the collection of the scroll and the Desolate God Seal.

Looking at the five Everlasting cultivators who had already rushed into the Heavenly Pivot Courtyard, he shook his head slightly.

Then, under everyone's gaze, his figure disappeared.

After several consecutive teleports, he traveled from the Heavenly Pivot Sect to the southwestern border of the Profound Yellow World before he managed to shake off the pursuit of the five Everlasting cultivators from the Heavenly Pivot Courtyard.

It was not that Li Fan was no match for these Everlasting cultivators, but fighting with them was meaningless.

Li Fan looked at the two treasures he had plundered.

He temporarily set aside the Desolate God Seal and slowly unrolled the Immortal Edict first.

"What a pity..."

After seeing the contents of the scroll, Li Fan sighed.

It turned out that this scroll was exactly the same as the memory in the Profound Yellow World Heavenly Dao!

Incomplete and blurry!

"It exceeds the limit that the Profound Yellow Heavenly Venerable can trace back."

"So, this Desolate God Seal is only superficial and cannot truly display the might of an immortal artifact."

Li Fan felt a sense of disappointment.

"Never mind, it's not easy to learn so much information about immortal artifacts at once."

"The theft of the Heavenly Pivot Sect's treasury is such a shameful matter that they will certainly not publicize it themselves and will only investigate privately. It will probably take some time for the other sects of the Ten Immortal Dao Sects to find out about this. I need to hurry."

Li Fan flickered and arrived at the next hiding place of an immortal artifact.

This time, having learned from the previous lesson, Li Fan did not dwell on the other treasures in the treasury.

He acted quickly and stole the immortal artifacts one by one.

In the end, it only took three days to successfully collect all the immortal artifacts stored in the Profound Yellow Heavenly Dao's memory.

It could be said that there was no difficulty at all; any normal cultivator possessing Mr. Bai could easily accomplish it.

"Strange, then what is the test for becoming the Profound Yellow Great Heavenly Venerable testing?"

Li Fan looked at the thirteen immortal artifacts of various shapes before him and fell into deep thought.

At the same time, urged by the Profound Yellow World Heavenly Dao in his mind, Li Fan also received the next stage of the "main quest."

"Profound Yellow power, detonate the immortal artifacts. With immortal power upon you, leap over the immortal wall, and be free from all constraints forever..."

Feeling the anticipation and joy in his heart, Li Fan's breathing also quickened slightly.

Chapter 1088 Void Outside Profound Yellow

Although the Profound Yellow World was much stronger than an ordinary immortal cultivation world, it might not be able to withstand the rampant immortal spirit power that dispersed when the immortal artifacts were detonated.

Moreover, if the detonation occurred within the Profound Yellow World, it would inevitably alert the old monsters hidden within.

After calming down from his excitement, Li Fan quickly realized this point.

"So, I need to go outside the world?"

Li Fan subconsciously looked up at the sky.

The consciousness of the Profound Yellow Heavenly Dao, which kept urging him in his mind, seemed to confirm his thoughts.

But Li Fan had some doubts: up to this point, he still couldn't figure out where the difficulty of this Profound Yellow Great Heavenly Venerable trial lay.

Compared to the first three acts, this fourth act, likely the final one, seemed to present no difficulties so far.

Everything could be done step by step, and anyone could reach Li Fan's current progress.

Next, traversing the void and moving away from the Profound Yellow World to detonate the immortal artifacts should not be too difficult, especially with the blessing of the Profound Yellow Heavenly Venerable's body.

"As for detonating the immortal artifacts and gaining the power to transcend the immortal wall, if I truly choose to leave, I might lose the qualification to become the Profound Yellow Heavenly Venerable. Only by following what Mr. Bai truly chose in history—disobeying the will of the Profound Yellow Heavenly Dao and remaining in the Profound Yellow World—can I truly succeed as the Profound Yellow Great Heavenly Venerable..."

"But, is it really that simple?"

This was the Immortal Falling Illusionary Realm. Even if I chose to detonate the immortal artifacts and leap over the wall, so what?

Beyond the wall was a forbidden zone where even the power of the Profound Yellow Heavenly Venerable had never reached—a completely unknown existence. It was almost certain that outside the wall, just as the immortal scroll decree stated, the Immortal Falling Realm could not evolve.

Upon returning to the real world, I would still be in the Profound Yellow World.

Any person with a rational mind would not choose to leave the Profound Yellow World, right?

Then what was the meaning of this trial?

With these questions in mind, Li Fan quietly flew out of the Profound Yellow World.

Compared to a few thousand years later, the allure of the Immortal Ruins was not as strong at this time.

With Mr. Bai's strength far surpassing that of ordinary longevity cultivators, resisting the Immortal Ruins and traversing the void was indeed not a particularly difficult matter.
