He sped rapidly through the void, the image of the Profound Yellow World behind him growing smaller and smaller.

Eventually, it was completely swallowed by the darkness.

All around was absolute blackness.

Only the pulling force faintly emanating from the Immortal Ruins reminded Li Fan that this was not his illusion.

"This is the Utmost Darkness Star Sea..."

Bone-chilling loneliness and cold gradually crept into his heart.

Looking around, there was no difference whatsoever.

No matter how fast Li Fan flew, the scenery around him did not change at all.

This almost made Li Fan doubt whether he was actually flying or just spinning in place.

"Without a beacon, or a void latitude and longitude locator, flying through the starry sky solely by physical body is indeed somewhat unrealistic."

Li Fan silently calculated the time in his mind.

After flying at full strength for three full days, feeling that the distance was sufficient, Li Fan finally stopped.

In the endless darkness, only Li Fan existed alone.

He took out the thirteen immortal artifacts he had collected.

Although his strength had decreased after leaving the support of the world itself, destroying and detonating the immortal artifacts was still barely achievable.

Spiritual power surged madly within his body, first pouring into the Barren God Seal.

It was like numerous heavy hammers violently striking it.

Boom! Boom! Boom!

Rampant energy erupted in the void, but it did not travel far before being swallowed by the endless darkness.

Not even a ripple was created.

Li Fan persisted, and cracks appeared on the already not-so-sturdy surface of the Barren God Seal.

Threads of immortal spirit power flowed out from it.

Li Fan's spirit jolted, and he quickly guided them into his own body.

They were clearly distinct from his own spiritual power and could not be absorbed.

However, with the boost of this power, Li Fan clearly felt changes occurring within him.

The most direct point was...

The entire Utmost Darkness Star Sea seemed to brighten slightly.

His vision appeared to gradually adapt to the darkness.

He could faintly see the small dot representing the Profound Yellow World far behind him.

"Is this the precursor to 'leaping over the immortal wall'?"

Even in the Immortal Falling Illusionary Realm, Li Fan felt a strange excitement in his heart.

He immediately continued without rest, increasing his output.

Soon, the Barren God Seal was completely destroyed.

After completely absorbing the immortal spirit power contained within it, Li Fan began to wield his spiritual power hammers against the second immortal artifact.

The immortal artifact was named the Great Sun Golden Bell.

After Li Fan lifted the restriction on it, the Great Sun Golden Bell instantly emitted scorching, dazzling light, just like the sun in the sky, illuminating a large area of the dark starry sky around him.

Fortunately, there was no terrifying scene where some giant terrifying creature in the darkness was staring intently at Li Fan.

Under the illumination of the light, Li Fan found that the surroundings were indeed just emptiness.

Li Fan followed the same procedure, beginning to destroy the Great Sun Golden Bell.

A venomous cry echoed in Li Fan's ears, lingering for a long time.

Li Fan paid no heed, without the slightest hesitation.

As the Great Sun Golden Bell disappeared from this world, the immortal spirit power within Li Fan grew stronger again.

Next was the third immortal artifact, the Yin-Yang Hooked Sword.

...

After destroying nine out of the thirteen artifacts in total.

As the Profound Yellow Heavenly Dao in his mind reacted with extreme excitement, Li Fan knew it was enough.

At this moment, the star sea in his eyes was no longer pitch black.

Instead, it presented a bizarre, ever-changing array of colors. The colors, appearing and vanishing like an aurora, were all being distorted towards the direction of the Immortal Ruins.

While visually entering a brand new world, his body also felt significantly lighter.

It was like floating on water; with just a slight push, he could leap out of the water.

Immersed in this unprecedented novel experience, Li Fan shook his head and sighed after a long time: "It's a pity, everything is an illusion."

"The task is complete; it's time to go back."

The moment this decision formed in his mind, the surrounding scene instantly froze.

Then, Li Fan keenly noticed that although nothing appeared to have changed, something subtly different seemed to have occurred.

"Hmm? Could it be that this completes the Profound Yellow Heavenly Venerable's trial?"

"This is too easy."

"Wait, something's not right?!"

Li Fan's gaze immediately turned towards the remaining four immortal artifacts.

Among them, there was the Great Sun Golden Bell, which he had clearly already destroyed before!

"What is going on?"

Li Fan narrowed his eyes, wanting to retrieve those four immortal artifacts.

But he was stunned to find that they were merely phantoms.

"Could it be..."

A guess that seemed unbelievable to him surfaced in Li Fan's mind.

"Have I returned to reality?"

Chapter 1089: Now Leaping Over the High Wall

"Impossible. The immense immortal spiritual power gathered in my body is clearly not an illusion."

Li Fan's thoughts raced, and he quickly used the Water Mirror Technique to examine himself.

He discovered that just as he had guessed, his face was no longer that of Mr. Bai, but his own appearance!

"This..."

Li Fan was suddenly filled with shock.

"How could this be?"

"The immortal spiritual power obtained from destroying immortal artifacts in the Immortal Falling Mirror actually manifested for real..."

Just as he was feeling confused, the face of Mr. Bai that suddenly appeared in his mind struck him like lightning, clearing the fog.

Li Fan stood frozen in place.

"So that's how it is."

That's right, although everything Li Fan had experienced in the Immortal Falling Realm just now was fake.

In actual history, Mr. Bai had indeed collected and destroyed many immortal artifacts, thereby obtaining the power to cross the high wall.

"Mr. Bai ultimately chose not to leave the Profound Yellow Realm. Therefore..."

A sharp glint instantly appeared in Li Fan's eyes.

His heart couldn't help but beat violently: "That immense immortal spiritual power from back then was preserved intact!"

"It was stored in the Immortal Falling Realm! In this final trial scene to become the Grand Heavenly Venerable of Profound Yellow!"

"..."

Li Fan felt the boundless power surrounding his body.

At this moment, he understood.

He had to make the same choice that Mr. Bai made back then.

Either inherit this immortal spiritual power and leap over the high wall, becoming carefree forever.

Or choose to give it up and remain in the Profound Yellow Realm, serving as the Grand Heavenly Venerable of Profound Yellow.

Although he didn't know the reason why Mr. Bai chose to stay back then.

Li Fan was not as noble as Mr. Bai.

If he had the chance to leave, why would he choose to be bound by the Profound Yellow Realm?

Without a second thought, Li Fan was about to decide to inherit the immortal spiritual power.

But at the last moment, he suddenly changed his mind.

"Outside the high wall, outside the high wall..."

"Is it truly safe outside the high wall?"

A huge question mark couldn't help but appear in Li Fan's mind.

His current true body's strength was only comparable to an ordinary Nascent Soul stage cultivator who had reached the Dao Integration.

In the Profound Yellow Realm, relying on the Spiritual Wood Realm and the strength of Tian Yang and others, he could barely protect himself.

But outside the Profound Yellow Realm, outside the high wall...

The danger level would likely be far greater than when he first arrived in the Profound Yellow Realm as a mortal.

It was important to remember that true immortals existed outside the high wall.

The power fluctuation that erupted instantly when crossing the high wall might attract their gaze.

Especially in this era, Li Fan was still within the net of the Faceless True Immortal.

A Nascent Soul stage cultivator, no matter how much they struggled, might not attract the attention of a true immortal. But if a mote of dust at the Nascent Soul stage instantly became an immortal...

At that time, Li Fan might not even have time to react before being captured and studied by the Faceless True Immortal.

Li Fan pondered for a long time, finally letting out a long sigh.

He completely suppressed the stirring desire.

The opportunity for transcendence, which he had pursued through hundreds of cycles of reincarnation, was right before Li Fan's eyes.

But when there was a real chance to escape, Li Fan shrank back.

The fundamental reason was that Li Fan's current strength was still too weak.

And he knew absolutely nothing about what lay outside the high wall.

It wasn't that he couldn't leave now, but the risk of leaving was too great.

It was so great that even the real Li Fan would not dare to try it easily.

"Wait a little longer, wait a little longer."

"It's not time yet."

"For others, this opportunity to leave the Dark Star Sea, once missed, will never come again."

"But I am different."

"Since I already know about the existence of this massive immortal spiritual power, I can come and take it whenever I need it."

After some rational analysis, Li Fan's state of mind finally returned to that of a calm, waveless ancient well.

Since he had temporarily given up the plan to cross the high wall, another question now faced Li Fan.

Should he inherit the position of Grand Heavenly Venerable of Profound Yellow?

Without much thought, Li Fan made a decisive choice.

If in ancient times, the Grand Heavenly Venerable of Profound Yellow could hold absolute authority.

But times had changed now.

There might not be many benefits, but the obligations and responsibilities he would have to bear were visibly enormous.

To correct the chaos, deal with the Legacy Transmitters, and restore the normal order of the Profound Yellow Realm.

To save the Profound Yellow Realm from the fate of being swallowed by the Immortal Ruins...

Li Fan had no interest in being a savior.

He also had no real sense of belonging to the Profound Yellow Realm.

Now that he had found a way to cross the high wall, the next thing he needed to do was quickly increase his strength, or plan and attempt to see if this method was truly effective and without danger.

As for this Grand Heavenly Venerable of Profound Yellow, whoever wants it can have it.

He, Li Fan, certainly wouldn't join in that excitement.

Since this trial was established by Mr. Bai, Li Fan believed that it would certainly not force a cultivator to make a choice.

As expected, when Li Fan expressed in his heart the idea of giving up both choices.

After a long silence, the surrounding scene began to shake violently.

Like boiling water, it shattered with a crash.

After a slight dizziness, Li Fan finally returned to reality.

"Seems like it has a bit of a temper."

Li Fan muttered to himself.

Recalling his experience in the Immortal Falling Realm this time, it was a pity that, like before, he only had vague general memories.

Any part related to specific divine abilities or secret arts could not be recalled at all.

"If I became the Grand Heavenly Venerable of Profound Yellow, perhaps I would inherit the history within the Immortal Falling Realm."

"But..."

"The loss outweighs the gain. Especially since this era has already fallen into the net of true immortals."

Li Fan calmed his thoughts.

After a long while, he checked the time.

He was startled to find that this journey into the Immortal Falling Realm had lasted for over a year.

It seemed that the time flow ratio of this trial illusion was different from that of ordinary Immortal Falling Illusions; it was closer to reality.

Li Fan gained some insight in his heart.

"This trial illusion was not created casually. It probably requires a certain amount of energy to sustain."

"Although Mo Rubin entered the trial illusion more than a year before me, I have already experienced it beforehand and am familiar with the plot. His actions might not be as quick as mine."

"It's possible he is still in the illusion."

Thinking this, Li Fan began to check what had happened over the past year.

The Legacy Transmitter Zhou, unable to contact Li Fan for a long time, guessed that Li Fan had successfully entered the trial illusion.

He sent several messages intermittently, asking how much of the scene Li Fan experienced he could reveal after leaving the illusion.

The rest were about various matters concerning the remnants of the Profound Heaven Sect.

Although Legacy Transmitters Chen and the others passed the Legacy Transmitter's Oath, everyone knew clearly that they were no longer suitable for the highest management positions in the Myriad Immortal Alliance.

After a new vote by the Legacy Transmitters, they ultimately compromised and left voluntarily.

Chapter 1090: Xu Ke After a Thousand Years

However, what surprised Li Fan was that these few who successfully passed the Legacy Transmitter's Oath were not dismissed from the core of the Myriad Immortal Alliance's power, even though they were no longer in charge.

Instead, they were granted the authority of supervision, serving as a supplement to the Legacy Transmitter Council.

It seemed that after this incident, Jiang had realized the problems within the Legacy Transmitters. If there were no checks and balances, problems would surely arise in the future.

"I wonder if Mo Rubin can ultimately pass the trial of the Profound Heaven Venerable."

"It doesn't matter if I reveal some details of the trial illusion to the Myriad Immortal Alliance. They have already grasped the method to enter it now, and with the Alliance's resources, they will eventually find suitable candidates to enter the illusion."

Thinking this, Li Fan transmitted the general situation of the illusion's first act, [Ning Yuan Obtaining the Longevity Fruit], to Legacy Transmitter Zhou.

However, he did not mention that he had successfully passed the trial. Instead, he fabricated a scenario based on the most likely plot development route from his first entry.

When obtaining the Longevity Fruit, he was severely injured by Steward Song. Although he barely managed to keep his life under the protection of Senior Brother Zhang, he fell into a coma, muddled day and night. It wasn't until one night that he was inexplicably possessed and lost consciousness.

Not long after, Legacy Transmitter Zhou solemnly replied, "The information provided by fellow Daoist is crucial and will be of great help to our future exploration of the illusion."

As a token of gratitude, Legacy Transmitter Zhou, on behalf of the Legacy Transmitter Council, bestowed upon Li Fan a nominal position as a Senior Elder of the Myriad Immortal Alliance.

It held no real authority, but he could enter and exit the Alliance Headquarters at any time, and his clearance level was only slightly lower than that of the Legacy Transmitters.

"However, Fellow Daoist cannot actually hold this Senior Elder position. After all, in the eyes of the other unaware Legacy Transmitters, you have already been executed by Jiang for false accusation," Legacy Transmitter Zhou reminded him.

This so-called Senior Elder position was clearly intended to win over the [Myriad Worlds Federation] behind Li Fan.

In the incident of the Profound Heaven Sect's possession, the Myriad Worlds Federation had already demonstrated sufficiently powerful strength.

It even held secrets that the Myriad Immortal Alliance could not ascertain.

Using a nominal position to deepen the cooperative relationship between the two sides was absolutely worthwhile.

However, the Myriad Immortal Alliance probably never imagined that the so-called Myriad Worlds Federation was actually just Li Fan's absolute domain.

During the more than a year Li Fan spent in secluded cultivation and disappearance, everything within the Federation had proceeded in an orderly manner, continuing to develop steadily according to the established tone, and reports were regularly compiled and sent to Li Fan.

After reviewing all this news.

What attracted Li Fan's attention the most was the report submitted by the Empire.

The location of the small world where Xu Ke was situated had finally been determined!

An old man with a weathered face, carrying a coffin on his back.

It was exactly the same as the one Li Fan had seen before.

Although the Imperial Daughter was very excited to find her ancestor, she did not let excitement cloud her judgment and acted rashly against Li Fan's orders to meet Xu Ke.

"Then let me go meet him," Li Fan mused.

"I am still quite interested in Mr. Bai's subsequent moves."

"Qinghui Prefecture."

Li Fan headed straight for the target location.

"Although transforming into seven-colored divine light is very fast, it is still far inferior to the Profound Heaven Venerable's ability to arrive in a single thought."

Although he had only temporarily borrowed Mr. Bai's body in the trial illusion, the vast contrast after Li Fan returned to reality still left him feeling a little disappointed.

He even harbored a faint sense of regret.

The moment this emotion arose, Li Fan's mind sharpened.

He immediately activated the Profound Yellow Immortal Heart Incantation, wanting to eliminate it.

But the method, which had always worked without fail, surprisingly failed at this moment.

"Hmph."

"There is nothing in this Profound Yellow Realm worth my regret. Even an immortal artifact that transcends the mundane, I can discard it like old rags!"

"A mere Profound Heaven Venerable, trying to disturb my mind?"

The moment he thought of Huan Zhen, all the things he had lost could be regained.

In an instant, all the slight disharmonious emotions in Li Fan's heart vanished.

"The Profound Yellow Immortal Heart Incantation is the reason I was different from other cultivators from the moment I entered the Fallen Immortal Realm."

"When it was still the Profound Yellow Heart Refining Incantation, it probably became my special identifier recognized by the Fallen Immortal Realm."

"It directly went on strike when it involved the Profound Heaven Venerable. It seems that things of unknown origin can never be completely trusted."

"In the end, one must rely on oneself for everything."

A shadow flickered in Li Fan's eyes.

"Profound Yellow Heart Refining Incantation..."

Prior to this, Li Fan had never considered sharing this method with others.

However, this minor accident now served as a reminder.

"Passing it on to a suitable person to encourage him to inherit the Great Profound Yellow Heavenly Venerable, or to inherit the Immortal Spirit Qi and bravely venture beyond the high walls, are both good ideas."

Faces flashed rapidly before Li Fan's eyes.

While considering suitable candidates, Li Fan also arrived at Xu Ke's hiding place.

"This place..."

"It seems to be formed from the remains of some monstrous beast, just like in Jiushan Prefecture."

At the entrance to the small world, Li Fan keenly sensed some familiar aura.

In the trial illusion, he had lived alongside monstrous beasts for over ten years, forming an instinctual bond. Even though he had returned to reality, he could still recognize the residual beast auras here.

"This is the growth of perception."

In an instant, he deciphered the formation restrictions at the entrance of the small world.

Li Fan quietly entered.

The Empire's intelligence was accurate; this small world was a desolate Gobi landscape.

As far as the eye could see, everything was a dull gray.

A towering stone mountain not far away, seemingly connecting heaven and earth, was probably the only significant feature of the small world.

Li Fan was immediately drawn to it.

Xu Ke was at the very top of this stone mountain.

Li Fan attempted to fly towards it but was stunned to find that he could not fly.

This was not due to Li Fan's strength, but rather the special rule restrictions of this small world.

Forcibly flying was not impossible, but one had to be prepared to face the backlash of the small world's Heavenly Dao.

Li Fan did not want to make the atmosphere so tense right at the beginning.

So he looked up, his gaze piercing through thousands of miles of distance, landing directly on Xu Ke at the mountain peak.

The white-haired old man also felt something and cast his gaze over.

Their eyes met.

The next moment, Li Fan stomped his foot.

Instead of flying, he directly tore space apart and appeared beside Xu Ke.

His expression was composed, leaving behind only two spatial rifts at the starting and ending points that lingered for a long time.

"Fellow Daoist Xu Ke?"

Li Fan was direct, immediately stating the white-haired old man's identity.

To Li Fan's surprise, Xu Ke was not at all taken aback by his sudden appearance. Instead, he directly asked, "You recognized me from the Fallen Immortal Realm?"

Li Fan's gaze sharpened at this.

His move of seizing the initiative, which had always worked reliably, failed this time.

Chapter 1091: The Gentleman Wishes to Save the World

After a moment of contemplation, Li Fan chose not to continue being mysterious. Instead, he nodded and said, "Correct. Fellow Daoist, how did you calculate that?"

Xu Ke chuckled in his somewhat deep voice, "For someone who opposes the world, besides in the Fallen Immortal Realm, where else in the Xuanhuang World would my information exist?"

Li Fan was slightly startled, "Opposing the world? What does that mean?"

Now it was Xu Ke's turn to be puzzled. "You don't know what kind of thing I am sitting on?"

Li Fan shook his head frankly.

"Then why are you looking for me?" Xu Ke stared intently at Li Fan, his expression unreadable.

"I seek Fellow Daoist for two reasons. First, to help the descendants of the Empire fulfill their lifelong wishes."

"The second is to understand the various arrangements left behind by the late Gentleman Bai. After understanding what he did, I was deeply moved by his great righteousness. However, the information I obtained in the Fallen Immortal Realm was incomplete, consisting only of fragmented memories from different periods. Therefore, after quite some effort, I finally found your hiding place. I hope you can help me resolve my doubts," Li Fan said with a sincere cupped-hand salute.

It seemed that hearing Li Fan's attitude towards Gentleman Bai, Xu Ke's expression immediately softened considerably.

"The Empire?" His eyes narrowed, seeming to fall into reminiscence.

"It is the lineage that you left in the world where Chi Jiu Tou perished back then," Li Fan reminded him.

"Ah..." Xu Ke then remembered.

"Xiao Qing, Xiao Hong..." He showed an expression of longing.

"The two are still alive. However, that Celestial Fate Black Bird perished while searching for your traces," Li Fan said, handing over an object.

It was the last black bird feather left by Xiao Hei in the Beast Seed Realm.

Xu Ke took the pitch-black feather, his hands trembling slightly. A trace of grief flashed in his eyes. After a long time, he slowly said, "I let it down."

"May I have this item?" Xu Ke asked.

"It is merely returning an object to its rightful owner. If Xiao Hei knew that the black bird feather he left behind would eventually return to you, he could rest in peace," Li Fan sighed.

"Thank you," Xu Ke solemnly tucked the black bird feather into his embrace.

On the towering stone mountain, an absolute silence fell once more.

At the apex of this desolate world, it seemed even the wind did not exist.

There was only the eternal, dead silence that had been passed down since eternity.

Li Fan was not in a hurry; he simply accompanied Xu Ke in experiencing the desolation of the heavens, waiting patiently.

After a long while, Xu Ke finally spoke again.

Due to the effect of the combination of moves earlier, his attitude towards Li Fan had changed significantly.

"How much do you know currently?" Xu Ke asked.

"Back then, you and Xiao Hei journeyed to the Southern Nether Sacred Beast Mountain under the orders of the Beast Taming Sect from Gentleman Bai. Including the subsequent series of actions, it was all for the ultimate cultivation of the Splitting Whale, which could multiply infinitely and open up void space. This was so that the mortals from various small worlds, who were forced to migrate due to the emergence of the Immortal-Mortal Miasma, could stay as far away from Xuanhuang as possible."

"And the so-called Immortal-Mortal Miasma was also a product of Gentleman Bai defying logic. He, as the Great Heavenly Venerable of Xuanhuang, ultimately ended his own life because of it..."

Li Fan recounted, word by word, the conclusions he had pieced together and deduced from the Fallen Immortal Realm and the real world.

"You really know quite a lot." "You have put in the effort."

"In this world, how many people still remember Gentleman Bai?" Xu Ke actually bowed to Li Fan to show his respect.

"However, there are many things I do not understand and cannot let go of. I request Fellow Daoist to clarify them for me. Otherwise, I fear I will be restless and unable to sleep in the future," Li Fan said solemnly.

"Gentleman Bai was the Great Heavenly Venerable of Xuanhuang, the strongest in the Xuanhuang World at that time. Why did he choose to sacrifice himself and use a method like the Immortal-Mortal Miasma to protect mortals?"

"Do you think the Immortal-Mortal Miasma was useful? If the Xuanhuang World had never produced the Immortal-Mortal Miasma from the very beginning, how would history have developed?" Xu Ke countered.

Li Fan pondered for a moment, then slowly said, "Without the Immortal-Mortal Miasma, the calamity of not being able to cultivate the same path still existed. In the end, cultivators would still fall into a desperate situation of mutual suspicion and slaughter. In this process..."

"When the city gate catches fire, the fish in the moat suffer. In the cultivation wasteland, where would mortals have a place to stay? If even one in ten thousand survived, it would be a blessing. Being infected by the Immortal-Mortal Miasma and then forced to migrate to small worlds—although many people would die in the process—it is negligible compared to the fate they would face if they remained in the Xuanhuang World," Xu Ke helped Li Fan articulate.

Hearing this, Li Fan slowly nodded in agreement.

"So, Gentleman Bai foresaw the fate of the Xuanhuang World for the next several thousand years right at the beginning of the great calamity?" Li Fan asked again.

"That was not a difficult thing for Gentleman Bai," Xu Ke said as a matter of course.

"Since that is the case..." Li Fan's tone and expression suddenly changed.

"The great calamity of not being able to cultivate the same path was entirely caused by the Transmission Law Heavenly Venerable spreading the new law. As long as this culprit was killed, it might not have been impossible to set things right! Why did Gentleman Bai choose to retreat without a fight?"

"He didn't even care about his own life, yet he lacked the courage to fight the Transmission Law?" Li Fan's voice carried a deep resentment.

"The Immortal Road ahead cannot be trodden, and the Transmission Law Heavenly Venerable is above," Xu Ke sighed slightly after a moment of silence, uttering these words that Gentleman Bai had once lamented.

Then he explained, "Not to mention whether Gentleman Bai was an opponent of the Transmission Law Heavenly Venerable who had already reversed logic at that time."

"In fact, in Gentleman Bai's deductions, even killing the Transmission Law would not stop the great calamity from descending upon the Xuanhuang World."

"Ningyuan City, the underground secret room, have you ever seen the beast-seed monster that was a fusion of man and dog?"

"I have seen it."

"That beast-seed had the body of a human and the limbs of a dog. Gentleman Bai once tried to save their lives. He collected suitable human limbs, intending to remove their dog limbs and reattach the human ones."

"However, because the dog limbs had long since merged with their bodies through daily life, all of Gentleman Bai's repeated attempts failed without exception."

"Most of them died directly during the transfer surgery. And even those that seemed successful rarely lived for more than a month after the operation, all perishing due to the frantic draining of life force."

"No matter how hard Gentleman Bai tried, the result remained the same."

Xu Ke explained very calmly.

Li Fan slowly began to understand.

"You mean the Xuanhuang World faced the same situation?"

Xu Ke sighed, "Spilled water cannot be recovered."

"The changes inflicted upon the Xuanhuang World by the Transmission Law have already occurred."

"The effort required to reverse it will likely be ten times, even a hundred times, more."

"So it wasn't that Gentleman Bai was inferior to the Transmission Law Heavenly Venerate, but merely that Gentleman Bai achieved enlightenment later than the Transmission Law Heavenly Venerate."

"Conversely, if Gentleman Bai had changed the Xuanhuang World first, perhaps the Transmission Law Heavenly Venerate would have been helpless as well."

"It's just a pity that there are no ifs."

The aged Xu Ke's tone carried a deep sense of regret.

Li Fan fell silent for a long time, finally responding with a sigh.

"I see."

"But..."

Li Fan frowned. "Did Gentleman Bai devote his life to the Dao just for this simple reason?"

"The birth of the Immortal-Mortal Miasma could naturally preserve the lives of the mortals in the Xuanhuang World for a time. But fundamentally, it was only a delaying tactic."

"In the end, mortals would still be regarded as livestock by the cultivators, and the Xuanhuang World would still be in imminent danger. Since Gentleman Bai could deduce the situation thousands of years in the future, he surely wouldn't have failed to see this."

"Given his character, how could he have left so hastily without any preparation for this?"

Li Fan persistently tried to pry more secrets from Xu Ke, because he always felt that there must be something hidden behind Gentleman Bai's demise.

Unexpectedly, Xu Ke just smiled and shook his head. "You, like me, thought Gentleman Bai was an omnipotent sage. But in reality, in his own words..."

"He was just an ordinary person who couldn't bear to see others suffer."

"From his initial helplessness in the face of the tragic deaths of Miss Liu'er and the innocent people of Ningyuan City, to the setbacks he suffered while trying to reverse destiny. Gentleman Bai's entire life was spent in a state of 'incompetence.' Therefore, he never thought he had the ability to save everything. All he could do was try his utmost effort."

"And he truly has already given too much."

Xu Ke fell silent again. "Do you know what is in the coffin behind me?"

Li Fan looked behind Xu Ke.

Upon closer inspection now, he noticed that the pale coffin was faintly connected to the towering mountain behind him.

Or rather...

Li Fan narrowed his eyes, observed for a while longer, and suddenly realized.

The scene of the entire small world instantly inverted in his eyes.

The ground was above, and the sky was below.

The towering mountain on the coffin seemed to be supporting the entire sky.

Or rather, the weight of the entire world was pressing down on the coffin.

And from this coffin, Li Fan sensed an extremely familiar aura.

It was an aura that no Xuanhuang cultivator would find unfamiliar.

Recalling that Xu Ke had introduced himself earlier as "one who is an enemy to the world,"

"This... could it be?" Li Fan was startled. He abruptly looked up at Xu Ke.

Xu Ke's expression remained unchanged, maintaining only a faint smile.

"Gentleman Bai was favored by the Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao, almost equivalent to an incarnation of the Heavenly Dao."

"Not only did he achieve the Eternal Heavenly Venerate realm in one step, possessing the body of a mortal, but he also shouldered the mission of the Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao to abandon the world and leave."

"But in the end, Gentleman Bai chose not to leave. Afterward, he even cleanly became a member of the New Law and participated in defying the natural order of heaven and earth. This was nothing short of complete betrayal to the Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao."

"The deeper the favor of the Heavenly Dao, the greater the backlash suffered upon betrayal. This is also one of the reasons why Gentleman Bai was killed by his own creation that defied the natural order. Because before that, he had already become extremely weak."

Xu Ke patted the coffin behind him. "In fact, given the extent of Gentleman Bai's favor from Heaven at that time, it was fundamentally impossible for him to perform the reversal of the natural order. It is likely that before the reversal could be completed, he would have perished due to the Heavenly Dao's backlash."

"So..."

"Before the reversal, Gentleman Bai first stripped away the Heavenly Favor. Then he suppressed it."

As if sensing Xu Ke's words, the coffin behind him suddenly emitted a muffled banging sound.

His head spun, and a face somewhat similar to Gentleman Bai's, though appearing rather pale, suddenly appeared before Li Fan's eyes.

He used extremely seductive words to persuade Li Fan to help open the coffin.

Once successful, upon returning to the Xuanhuang World, he would surely receive rewards a hundred or a thousand times greater.

If it were an ordinary cultivator, perhaps they would have been persuaded instantly, becoming a tool for its escape and fighting against Xu Ke.

But who was Li Fan?

Not to mention the fortitude of his own will, the mere thread of caution he maintained towards Gentleman Bai guaranteed that he would not be swayed by this seemingly somewhat eerie Gentleman Bai.

With a cold snort, the scene before him tore apart.

Li Fan awoke from the illusion to find Xu Ke observing him coldly, seemingly ready to strike at any moment if the words were not right.

However, after seeing that Li Fan was not affected by the illusion, the killing intent in his eyes faded.

"Sealed Heavenly Favor? What exactly is that thing?" Li Fan put on an appearance of lingering fear.

"It is the self-awareness of the Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao that was attached to Gentleman Bai, which Gentleman Bai stripped away. After being sealed and suppressed for so many years, it has gradually become somewhat extreme. If it were released and allowed to return to the main Xuanhuang World..." Xu Ke's expression was very solemn.

"Perhaps a disaster ten times more terrifying than 'The Law Cannot Be Cultivated Simultaneously' would descend instantly. This is why, over the years, even when Little Black perished back then, I dared not leave this place for a single step. The matter is of utmost importance and must not be lost."

"An extreme Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao?" A flash of strange light briefly crossed the depths of Li Fan's eyes.

"Yes. I can feel that during these years of sealing, the Heavenly Dao consciousness inside has become increasingly bizarre. I truly worry that I might one day be unable to hold on." Xu Ke's eyes revealed a deep anxiety.

"Recently, I have also been secretly looking for a suitable successor. But I haven't found anyone I can be truly at ease with. Today, Daoist friend has stumbled upon this place by chance..."

Xu Ke's tone suddenly shifted. "Could it be that fate has its own arrangements?"

"I observe that Daoist friend's temperament and character are absolutely top-notch." He looked at Li Fan sincerely and spoke very earnestly.

Li Fan pondered, not immediately responding.

"Of course, the mission of suppressing the Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao is too lonely and dangerous. If Daoist friend is unwilling, I can understand. But I have one request..." Xu Ke said.

"Please speak, Daoist friend." Li Fan's expression became solemn.

"If one day, I am controlled by the Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao in this coffin and lose my self-awareness, I ask Daoist friend to strike and kill me." Xu Ke said very solemnly.

Looking at the gaze of the aged Xu Ke, Li Fan nodded. "Alright, I promise you."

"Furthermore, you don't need to worry about finding a successor."

Xu Ke's expression was slightly stunned.

"Speaking of which, you might not believe it. I am not alone; I am a member of the 'Alliance of Myriad Worlds.'"

Chapter 1093 News of the Xuanfa King

“In our Alliance, there are countless young talents. Finding a suitable successor is definitely not a difficult matter,” Li Fan said with full confidence.

“This concerns the safety of all cultivators in the Xuanhuang World. The Alliance naturally will not stand idly by. Since Daoist friend is inconvenient to leave, after I return, I will arrange for them to come over. Daoist friend can examine them personally.”

“I believe with Daoist friend’s discerning eye, you will surely find someone you are pleased with,” Li Fan said righteously.

“This…” Xu Ke seemed somewhat incredulous.

After a while, he hurriedly said, feeling at a loss, “In that case, I thank Daoist friend in advance.”

“Oh, right. Xiao Qing, Xiao Hong, and your descendants, as well as the Imperial Daughter of the Empire, miss you very much. I wonder if you are willing to see them?” Li Fan did not presume but actively inquired.

A trace of sadness flashed across Xu Ke’s face.

However, he nodded eventually.

Before leaving this desolate small world, during the conversation with Xu Ke, Li Fan gained a more detailed understanding of the events of the past.

Even before deciding to invert the principles and create the Immortal-Mortal Miasma, Mr. Bai had traveled through the major sects of the Xuanhuang World and made extensive preparations.

For instance, within almost every sect, he had found individuals of significant standing.

This ensured that as soon as the plan to erupt the Immortal-Mortal Miasma and migrate mortals to the small world grotto-heavens was proposed, it would be quickly accepted by the major sects.

As well as the Immortal-Sealing Grand Array that sealed the mortal small worlds, and even the Boundary-Tearing Whales outside the Grand Array…

The final realization of all this bore the traces of Mr. Bai’s prior arrangements.

It was just that Xu Ke did not know much about this.

Back then, upon hearing the tragic news of Lu Ya, he rushed over, and the last mission he received before Lu Ya’s death was to guard the detached Xuanhuang Heavenly Favor.

…

“The Heavenly Dao of a world has its own mechanisms for operation.”

“Just as when the Li World small world faced an annihilation crisis, the consciousness of the Heavenly Dao naturally sought individuals who might escape, descending upon Su Yuqing.”

“The Xuanhuang World also selected Mr. Bai. It’s just that between the Heavenly Dao and the mortals of Xuanhuang, Mr. Bai still chose the latter.”

“He turned around and sealed the Heavenly Dao consciousness that possessed him…”

“And looking at the performance of the Xuanhuang World Heavenly Dao since then, it has almost always been at a disadvantage in battles with cultivators. There have been no countermeasures like ‘Methods Cannot Be Cultivated Together.’ Its remaining Heavenly Dao strength must have been affected to some extent.”

Li Fan suddenly recalled Ruomu.

Similarly harmed severely by humans, Ruomu transformed from a divine tree that nurtured all beings in the world into a terrifying entity that captured cultivators to form cores.

This was the power of resentment.

Having suffered betrayal by those most favored and being sealed for nearly ten thousand years, one could imagine what the Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao sealed within the coffin behind Xu Ke had become.

“Another killing move. But it’s not suitable to be used in this era. It only adds variables.”

“I can still alter the fate of the remaining Xuanhuang World Heavenly Dao. If the Heavenly Dao goes mad, my divine abilities might also become ineffective.”

Pondering all this, Li Fan returned to the Spirit Wood World.

After conveying the news about Xu Ke to Xiao Qing and the others of the Empire, they were naturally overjoyed. They then expressed immense gratitude to Li Fan.

Under Li Fan’s reminders about what could and could not be said, the people of the Empire eagerly rushed to see Xu Ke.

Accompanying them were aspiring young individuals selected from various small worlds.

Li Fan only conducted a rough screening; the final decision was left to Xu Ke himself.

After finishing his tasks, Li Fan arrived at the location of the ‘Seeking the Obscure.’

More than a year had passed, and more than ten monuments had been erected.

Most contained insignificant details from dusty history.

However, the latest discovery from the Blood-Colored River aroused Li Fan’s interest.

The time point seemed to be after countless years of fighting, when the chaos gradually subsided. It was during the period when civilization was slowly reviving in the cultivation wasteland. In the scene, a man wearing ragged clothes but emanating a strong killing aura looked alertly at the old man who suddenly appeared before him.

The man in the image naturally did not recognize this old man.

But Li Fan, outside the image, was extremely familiar with him.

It was the Celestial Doctor!

Without any idle talk, the Celestial Doctor instantly made a move and subdued the man radiating killing aura.

And it seemed he was reading the memories of the man with the killing aura from these years.

“So much time has passed this time?”

“It seems next time I should try to stay further away from the Immortal Ruins.”

The Celestial Doctor sighed and muttered to himself.

Then he slapped the man with the killing aura to death and vanished from the spot.

…

The image abruptly stopped.

But the information contained within it was quite substantial.

At the very least, it confirmed one thing: thousands of years ago, the Celestial Doctor already possessed the strength to resist the suction of the Immortal Ruins and traverse the void.

Moreover, he had traveled back and forth more than once.

During this process, he was inevitably affected by the time dilation of the Immortal Ruins. When he reappeared, a very long time had already passed in the Xuanhuang World.

“It seems that the sudden disappearance and reappearance of certain people are very likely influenced by the time difference of the Immortal Ruins.”

“So that means…”

The guess he had previously planned to verify in his next life suddenly resurfaced in his mind.

Li Fan’s expression became serious again.

“The Law Preacher and the Celestial Doctor were frequently active in the Xuanhuang World. The information contained in the Blood-Colored River is very valuable.”

He issued generous rewards again, boosting the morale of his subordinates.

A few days later, Li Fan unexpectedly received news about Mo Rubing from the Law Preacher Zhou.

“He showed himself?”

“And he hasn’t advanced to the Xuanhuang Great Celestial Venerable?”

Li Fan frowned slightly.

“Could it be a feint? Given how cautious and prudent he is, even if his plan failed, he wouldn’t reveal his whereabouts so easily.”

Law Preacher Zhou, however, was quite confident: “The place where he appeared is one of the secret locations of the Immortal Alliance.”

“It looks like there are no other cultivators present, but in reality, we have already implemented covert surveillance on him.”

“Furthermore, Mo Rubing did not appear in his true form. We tracked the fluctuations backward based on the altered imprint he left on Law Preacher Chen, which is how we ultimately discovered and locked onto him.”

“So I’m more inclined to believe that he miscalculated this time.”

Law Preacher Zhou deeply resented this Xuanhuang Heavenly Sect King who had repeatedly toyed with the members of the Immortal Alliance.

He solemnly stated, “This time, our Myriad Immortal Alliance elites will be deployed in full force, and we must capture him. I wonder if Daoist friend is interested in cooperating with us again?”

Li Fan immediately agreed: “I will go and seek instruction and give you an answer right away.”

After waiting a moment, Li Fan proactively sent a message: “The Alliance Elder has agreed.”

“And this time, we will also use our newly developed technology to assist in the capture!”

Chapter 1094: The Vengeful Retaliation Array

Chapter 1094: The Vengeful Retaliation Array

Law Preacher Zhou was very pleased to see Li Fan agree so readily: "Good, then we will meet here."

After speaking, he transmitted the location coordinates.

After hanging up the communication, Li Fan began to prepare.

The "newly developed technology" he mentioned earlier was not just empty talk. It was the result of the deduction of the Dissolution Disk over the past year.

Since mastering the two immortal-grade grand arrays, Xuanji, Myriad Spirits Returning to the Number, and Desolation Fall, Flower Born from Empty Chamber, and devouring the nine newly born sub-disks to achieve metamorphosis, the array parsing ability of the Dissolution Disk had been increasing at an unimaginable speed.

Every moment, it seemed as if an endless stream of brand new arrays was being deduced by it.

The Dissolution Disk was like the Array Derivation Jade, wanting to deduce all the arrays in the world!

Even without the deliberate manipulation of Li Fan, its master, it had accumulated an extremely vast array database in one year.

With the addition of some conditions and a brief search, Li Fan found what he wanted.

An array named in the style of an immortal-grade array, titled: Retaliation, Revenge Will Be Exacted.

The function of the array could be glimpsed from its name.

When kept running, it could automatically search for objects around the array that held a grudge against it and mark them for tracking.

The coverage area was about the size of one prefecture of the Myriad Immortal Alliance. Once locked onto by the Retaliation Array, as long as one did not leave the array's range, they would always be tracked.

The array had specificity, meaning one array could only designate one object of enmity.

Li Fan experimented for a while. The locking method of the Retaliation Array was completely beyond his current understanding, subtly approaching the level of "Immortal."

But the performance of Mo Rubing last time was truly terrifying.

So, just an array was not enough!

Li Fan took out another small jade bottle.

Inside the bottle were three pills.

They moved rapidly within the bottle without any discernible pattern, their trajectories chaotic yet revealing something miraculous.

"Soul Separation Pill."

"After swallowing, to outsiders, the spirit will appear to be detached and extremely chaotic. But in reality, one can still maintain control over the body. It is effective against spirit possession. Mo Rubing's spirit possession technique is similar to Law Preacher Jiang's conversion of me."

"But how can one possess or influence a mass of chaos?"

A cold light flashed in Li Fan's eyes: "Even if it cannot completely stop it, it can at least greatly slow down his possession process."

"Three pills per set. The Medicine King Sect refined over two hundred sets in the first batch..."

...

With everything prepared, Li Fan brought Tianyang to the agreed-upon location.

Naturally, he also changed his original appearance.

Law Preacher Zhou was already waiting, accompanied by thirty-seven others.

They were roughly divided into three camps. The largest group was a team of expressionless black-clothed cultivators with grim and murderous auras.

Compared to those Li Fan had seen before, their eyes were utterly vacant.

They were less like cultivators and more like puppets without their own thoughts, only capable of completing commands received.

The remaining two camps consisted of two Law Preachers standing with Law Preacher Zhou, and a third that was rather peculiar.

They did not resemble humans, being short, only about the height of a seven or eight-year-old child.

They had no heads, with their facial features squeezed onto their chests.

They were entirely black, appearing somewhat comical and ferocious.

"To enter the forbidden land this time, we also need guides from the You Clan." Law Preacher Zhou looked at Tianyang, who stood silently behind Li Fan with his eyes closed. After a slight bow, she spoke to Li Fan.

"You Clan?" Li Fan looked at the strange group with interest.

"Let's talk as we walk. Here are the precautions for entering."

At Law Preacher Zhou's signal, the You Clan members gathered, held hands, and began to perform a strange dance.

Like some kind of ritual, as they hummed in unison, a faint, obscure atmosphere of seclusion silently descended above them.

Of course, this was only Li Fan's perception. In reality, whether observed with the naked eye or divine sense, there was no actual change ahead.

"Let's go in first."

However, the subsequent actions of the group proved Li Fan's premonition correct.

When the Myriad Immortal Alliance cultivators flew towards the area above the You Clan members, they seemed to be suddenly swallowed by darkness.

They vanished into thin air.

The Alliance cultivators entered in a continuous stream, and Li Fan finally followed them in.

Light was stripped away from the world.

The surroundings were a thorough, endless gloom.

This was slightly different from the pitch-black starry sea outside the Xuanhuang Realm.

The darkness of the starry sea gave a feeling of stillness, nothingness, and immensity.

But here...

It felt cramped, damp, and dim, as if something was stirring in the darkness, ready to suddenly erupt and devour people at any moment.

The Myriad Immortal Alliance cultivators who had entered earlier seemed to have collectively disappeared.

In the gloom of the forbidden land, it seemed only he remained.

Li Fan subconsciously attempted to observe his surroundings with his divine sense, only to find that his divine sense was useless here.

Once separated from his body, it felt as if it was enveloped by endless darkness, unable to perceive anything else.

Li Fan then tried to illuminate the surroundings with light, but he still failed.

Light, too, seemed unable to survive in this forbidden land.

Just then, without any warning, a hand suddenly rested on Li Fan's shoulder.

His hairs stood on end, and Li Fan was instantly ready to counterattack.

However, through physical contact, divine sense could be transmitted between them.

Li Fan then "heard" the other person's words.

He first introduced himself.

Law Preacher, Yan.

Then he explained to Li Fan: "In this gloomy forbidden land, both divine sense and sound are useless. Only by establishing physical contact, like with the You Clan members, can we communicate with each other."

"We entered together and haven't dispersed. Everyone should be around here. Let's gather first."

Li Fan nodded slightly.

This gloomy forbidden land was indeed somewhat bizarre. Even the connection between him and Tianyang was severed.

Fortunately, Tianyang had not gone far, and Li Fan found him again without much effort.

With a thought from Li Fan, unnoticed by others, Tianyang quietly transformed into Immortal Puppet Armor and attached itself to his body.

"The Retaliation Array is also greatly weakened here. Its perception range is only about three feet around me?"

Li Fan couldn't help but be inwardly startled.

This was an existence infinitely close to a true immortal-grade array.

"I didn't expect such a perilous place to exist in the Xuanhuang Realm. Why did Mo Rubing run here again?"

Just like the You Clan members holding hands before entering, the Myriad Immortal Alliance cultivators and Li Fan also managed to gather through this method.

After taking stock of the members, they found that three were missing. The group did not go to search for these three.

Instead, they immediately issued a kill order for them.

Together, they headed toward the depths of the gloom.

(End of Chapter)

Chapter 1095: The Gloom Devouring Dharma King

"From now on, we are one entity."

"If anyone discovers those three who fell behind and tries to return, report it immediately. Then, everyone will strike them down together."

"Remember, do not trust anyone who returns from the gloom. Even if they were once your closest companion."

As they moved forward closely together, the cultivators of the Myriad Immortal Alliance reaffirmed the prohibition.

At the same time, through communication with the transmitting cultivator Zhou, Li Fan also learned the origin of this desolate place of gloom.

Due to the existence of the Immortal Ruins, the Xuanhuang Realm was constantly being affected by an extremely powerful suction force.

Under normal circumstances, if this was not stopped, everything in the Xuanhuang Realm would slowly fall into the Immortal Ruins.

This was what the cultivators of the Myriad Immortal Alliance had previously believed.

However, the discovery of the desolate place of gloom shattered this understanding.

The desolate place of gloom was a collection of worldly matter that deviated from the direction of the Immortal Ruins.

Although it was still a part of the Xuanhuang Realm, it possessed its own unique rules here.

Besides what was mentioned before—that spiritual sense and sound could not leave the body—lost cultivators would have their minds seized by unknown existences in the gloom, transforming them into different beings, yet the individual themselves would be unaware of it.

"This... seems somewhat similar to Mo Rubing's method of seizing a body?" Li Fan's heart stirred.

"Indeed. But it's only a similarity in characteristics. It doesn't prove anything."

The transmitting cultivator Zhou seemed intentionally to avoid this topic, continuing, "Since this place was discovered, the Immortal Alliance has placed great importance on it. Because of the gloom's characteristic of deviating from the Immortal Ruins, perhaps by studying it, we can find a way to escape the Immortal Ruins. However, until now, only the most core transmitting cultivators knew about this."

"That Xuan Tian Sect Dharma King previously occupied the bodies of Chen and several others, so he also learned of this place's existence."

"The You Clan members do not live in the desolate place of gloom; rather, they were the first to discover how to open it and master the method of utilizing the power of gloom. We only discovered this secret during the process of conquering the small world where the You Clan members resided and fighting against them."

"The power of gloom? Could it be that it is completely different from the power of Immortal Spirit?" Li Fan asked thoughtfully.

"Not exactly. After years of observation, we found that the power of gloom also possesses some characteristics of the power of Immortal Spirit. But..." Transmitting cultivator Zhou paused, seemingly searching for the appropriate descriptive language.

"The power of Immortal Spirit and the power of gloom are like a person and their shadow."

"Originally, these two should have been inseparable and merged. But due to the existence of the Immortal Ruins, the power of gloom was forcibly separated from it."

Upon hearing this, Li Fan vaguely began to understand.

It was like a centrifuge separating different components from a liquid.

Because of its characteristic of deviating from the Immortal Ruins, as the entire Xuanhuang Realm gradually fell into the Immortal Ruins, the powers of gloom all converged in the opposite direction.

"The suction force of the Immortal Ruins is due to the existence of the 'Hunger' Character Seal."

"Then what exactly is this power of gloom that can withstand the power of the True Immortal Character Seal?"

Li Fan was somewhat puzzled.

"We have already explored the entire desolate place of gloom previously. So, when Mo Rubing infiltrated and caused an anomaly this time, we were able to detect it immediately."

"If you observe carefully, you should also be able to perceive it," Transmitting cultivator Zhou reminded him.

"Oh?"

Upon hearing this, Li Fan frowned and sensed the surrounding gloom.

After a while...

"You mean this regular pulsation, like water waves?" Li Fan asked.

"Correct. At the source of this pulsation, we discovered Mo Rubing's aura. However..."

Transmitting cultivator Zhou's tone became somewhat uncertain, "He has been here for about ten days, but he hasn't changed his position. It looks like he is heavily injured and unconscious."

"Could it be a trap?" Li Fan couldn't help but ask.

"No," Transmitting cultivator Zhou stated decisively.

"Even if it's a trap... we have so many people here this time. We don't fear a mere Ancient Law Longevity Realm cultivator like him."

Seeing Transmitting cultivator Zhou's confidence, Li Fan did not argue further.

With no one speaking, the surroundings once again fell into a terrifying silence.

"Be on high alert, we are almost there."

After an unknown amount of time, Transmitting cultivator Zhou's prompt arrived.

Locking onto the direction from which the pulsation originated, the cultivators of the Myriad Immortal Alliance followed the instructions and formed a circle, completely surrounding Mo Rubing, who was hidden in the gloom.

They waited for a single command to attack him together.

At the same time, Li Fan also received constant reminders from the Ya Zi Formation.

"Is it really Mo Rubing?"

Li Fan couldn't help but feel a bit surprised.

"Strange..."

Although suspicion still lingered in his heart, Li Fan did not act rashly. He merely followed the movements of the Myriad Immortal Alliance cultivators, gradually narrowing the hunting circle.

Everyone held their breath and waited, but Mo Rubing showed no reaction at all. It seemed as if he hadn't noticed the approaching enemies around him at all. This continued until the Myriad Immortal Alliance cultivators finally reached him.

...

"Alert level lowered."

"He seems to be dead."

Transmitting cultivator Zhou's voice carried a hint of disbelief.

"Hmm?"

A chill suddenly rose in Li Fan's heart. Following the bodies of the Myriad Immortal Alliance cultivators, he arrived at the very center. The moment he touched Mo Rubing's body, his spiritual sense perceived his current true appearance.

Mo Rubing's face was gone. There was only a mass of gloom constantly coalescing and dispersing above his head.

This sight was incredibly bizarre, but what made Li Fan even more horrified was Mo Rubing's body. Half of it was still human flesh, but the other half seemed to have been occupied by the gloom here, constantly fluctuating between darkness and solidity.

Under the probing of the black-clad death warriors of the Immortal Alliance, it was confirmed that the gloom swallowing half of Mo Rubing's body was not an illusion, but real flesh disappearing and reappearing in constant change.

When the gloom appeared and was touched, what was felt was nothingness. But after a short while, when the half-flesh reappeared, the gloom suddenly vanished. Along with it, the hand of the death warrior that reached into the gloom also disappeared. The gloom seemed capable of spreading through contact; the black-clad death warrior was engulfed by the gloom rising on his own hand without making the slightest sound.

Fortunately, Transmitting cultivator Zhou acted decisively, immediately severing the connection with the death warrior and ordering everyone to kill him immediately. This prevented the gloom from spreading among the Myriad Immortal Alliance cultivators.

"Fellow Daoist, what are your thoughts?" Transmitting cultivator Zhou asked with a heavy tone.

Li Fan was silent for a long time, then slowly said, "The gloom on Mo Rubing's corpse seems different from that in the desolate place of gloom."

"The gloom on the corpse is contagious, while the gloom in the surrounding environment is not."

"Before we fully understand the reality of this situation, it's best not to touch it."

(End of Chapter)

Chapter 1096: The Legend of Creation

"Although this power of gloom might help us escape the Immortal Ruins, that should only be the case if we can safely control it."

"Otherwise..."

Li Fan's expression turned serious: "If the world is eroded by this gloom, the outcome might not be much better than falling into the Immortal Ruins."

As the two were speaking, as if receiving some kind of nourishment, the gloom occupying half of Mo Rubing's body suddenly expanded again.

It almost completely engulfed the entire corpse.

Strangely, however, the rhythmic pulse constantly emanating from him had not stopped at all.

It was even clearer than before.

Like the throbbing of a heart, it echoed in this desolate place of gloom, causing an ominous premonition to gradually arise in Li Fan's heart.

Several Transmitting cultivators in the group also sensed that something seemed wrong.

They quickly gave the order to temporarily distance themselves.

After retreating some distance, the intense unease in Li Fan's heart slowly subsided.

"My suggestion is to completely seal off this desolate place. Until we fully understand the true nature of the power of gloom, we should not approach Mo Rubing's corpse rashly."

"When I return, I will also immediately report this discovery to the association. If there is any news, I will inform you at the first opportunity."

Seeing Li Fan being so cautious, Transmitting cultivator Zhou nodded in agreement, but in his heart, he felt somewhat dismissive.

"Daoist Friend need not be overly nervous. No matter what, the characteristic of this power of gloom being contrary to the Immortal Ruins will not change. This means they will not invade the Profound Yellow World."

Seeing this, Li Fan shook his head and didn't say much more.

With Mo Rubing dead, Li Fan had no reason to linger there.

Although the journey of revenge ended anticlimactically, the discovery of this power of gloom was of great significance.

After bidding farewell to the people of the Myriad Immortal Alliance, Li Fan quickly assembled the members of various departments of the federation and recounted his experience in the desolate place of gloom.

"The power of gloom..."

It was Daoist Baihua who spoke first.

As someone who had survived since the ancient times, although Baihua's strength was not great, he was indeed knowledgeable.

"I seem to have heard a Daoist Friend from those years mention something similar."

"He once personally witnessed from afar his homeland falling into the Immortal Ruins, the dreamlike scene of all things disintegrating and forming a strange, twisted halo of light."

"According to his description, just as the cultivation world completely disappeared into the Immortal Ruins, a large amount of matter seemed to surge out in the opposite direction."

"It was imperceptible to the naked eye or divine sense; he was just unfortunately grazed by it and was immediately severely injured. Even after he healed, he became neither human nor ghost."

Looking at the terrifying image of a cultivator with writhing black holes all over his face, drawn by Daoist Baihua, everyone’s expression could not help but become solemn.

And Qiaogong Jushi also seemed to recall something: "When the power of the Immortal Ruins first enveloped the [Ancestor], we were actually quite confident about overcoming the calamity."

"Because based on the strength of the Ancestor's remaining body at that time, it should have been enough to resist the attraction of the Immortal Ruins. But later, the attraction of the Immortal Ruins grew stronger on one hand..."

Qiaogong Jushi showed a look of sudden realization: "The fundamental reason was that the Ancestor's strength was gradually weakening! It was as if some crucial element was continuously draining away, causing the Ancestor's body to slowly decay."

"At that time, all the elders were completely bewildered. In the end, they could only attribute it to the immense power of the Immortal Ruins."

"Now it seems that what disappeared was very likely this power of gloom as well."

After hearing the words of the two, Li Fan pondered thoughtfully: "You mean that the power of gloom is actually a part of the cultivation system of cultivators. It's just that because it is naturally opposite in nature to the suction of the Immortal Ruins, it was forcibly stripped away during the process of approaching the Immortal Ruins."

"In other cultivation worlds, the power of gloom would have detached as a result. But in the Profound Yellow World, due to some unknown reason, all of it gathered in one place, still bound to the Profound Yellow World."

"If one day the Profound Yellow World can break free from the Immortal Ruins, the power of gloom should return to all things in the Profound Yellow World."

After hearing Li Fan's analysis, both Qiaogong Jushi and Daoist Baihua nodded.

At this moment, Liu Ruchen of the Medicine King Sect suddenly spoke: "Although I have never seen this so-called power of gloom with my own eyes, I once read a legend in an ancient book."

"It is a legend passed down among various human races, concerning the origin of humanity."

"In the beginning, there were no humans in the world, nor were there various cultivation worlds. In absolute nothingness, a few powerful beings drifted about. Later, one of them, feeling bored, used himself as raw material to create and open up world after world."

"Slowly, the nothingness gradually became full. And the other existences were gradually attracted by these bizarre and wonderful worlds, and they all followed suit, creating various different races based on themselves as prototypes."

"And the ancestor of humanity was the one who first created all the worlds."

The crowd had clearly never heard this legend before and listened with great interest.

"Although the world became much livelier, these powerful beings soon discovered an anomaly. Because all the beings they created could not be immortal and indestructible like themselves; they had a limitation called a lifespan."

"The liveliness was temporary; the world would soon return to silence. Occasional creation was for the sake of personal interest, but continuing to create like this became a burden."

"So the powerful beings gradually lost interest in the lives they had created."

"But there was one who was different. He was unwilling to see his creations vanish like that, so he actually defeated his companion and extracted power from him, granting it to all creations in the world."

"Thus, the beings of the world gained the ability to reproduce."

Liu Ruchen stopped abruptly here.

The crowd was listening with great interest and signaled him with their eyes to continue.

Liu Ruchen shrugged: "There's nothing more after that."

"It's nothing more than words about thanking the gods for the grace of creation."

"The reason I connect it to the power of gloom is that perhaps we can draw inspiration from it to study what effect the loss or acquisition of the power of gloom has on us cultivators."

"If the power of gloom originally existed within us, but was only precipitated out with the appearance of the Immortal Ruins, doesn't that mean that we are currently..."

"Incomplete?"

"Compared to cultivators before the appearance of the Immortal Ruins, what is the difference between us?"

Qiaogong Jushi's expression changed slightly upon hearing this.

"I was wondering why my comprehension and creativity have seemed far inferior since the calamity of the Immortal Ruins?"

"Could this be the reason?"

Chapter 1097: A Search for Gloom in Another Realm

“You mean you’ve become dumber?” Daoist Baihua stared blankly at Qiaogong Jushi.

“Probably…”

Before Qiaogong could finish speaking, Baihua Taoist interrupted, “Compared to the beginning, I don’t see any obvious changes in myself. Could this be a problem with you personally?”

Qiaogong fell silent upon hearing this.

“Speculating is useless. Why don’t we go and test it out ourselves?” Fang Zaiji’s eyes flashed with eagerness.

The crowd chimed in with their opinions.

Ultimately, Li Fan made the final decision: “The return of the power of gloom is not as simple as we imagine.”

“If it were just simple absorption, I fear it would be like Mo Ruxin, being corroded by it instead.”

“Furthermore, the Gloom Forbidden Zone is currently controlled by the Myriad Immortals Alliance. If we want to enter and research it…”

“They probably won’t permit it.”

Liu Ruchen said, “Didn’t the emissary mention that the Myriad Immortals Alliance only gained access to the Gloom Forbidden Zone through a ritual performed by those [Yōu] people?”

“Does anyone remember the specifics of that ritual? If we imitate it, perhaps we can sneak in covertly.”

“After all, the Gloom Forbidden Zone is utterly dark. As long as we are careful, we won’t be detected by them.”

Fang Zaiji readily agreed upon hearing this, “Sect Master has a wonderful suggestion! We definitely should try it!”

Li Fan pondered for a moment and then used the Water Mirror Technique to reproduce the rather peculiar ritual footage.

The syllables and tones of the chanting were perfectly restored.

After selecting more than ten young cultivators to learn it, as expected, the ritual failed.

“Must it really be those Yōu people?” Fang Zaiji cursed inwardly.

The members of the association also shook their heads, feeling a sense of pity.

“Yōu people, huh…”

Li Fan had already grasped the basic information of all the small worlds in the Yellow Profound Realm.

However, there was no mention of the Yōu people in this information, suggesting that the Myriad Immortals Alliance had deliberately concealed it.

“It doesn’t matter, we just need to eliminate them one by one.”

During the search for Xu Ke, preliminary inquiries had already been made in the vast majority of small worlds.

Completing the rest would not take much time.

With a command from Li Fan, countless inconspicuous exotic beasts swarmed towards the entrances of various small worlds.

After only half a month, news arrived.

In the last image transmitted before being destroyed, traces of what seemed to be the [Yōu] people were discovered.

There must be people from the Myriad Immortals Alliance guarding that small world.

Li Fan personally led Tianyang to infiltrate it.

He was quite interested in that power of gloom.

Not only because it was related to the possibility of breaking free from the Immortal Ruins, but also because of its connection to the so-called [completeness].

Li Fan had always harbored doubts about the demise of Mo Ruxin.

That treacherous Heavenly Profound Sect Dharma King, who had tricked him time and again, had died so inexplicably in the gloom.

This was hard for Li Fan to believe.

Especially the reason why he would enter the Gloom Forbidden Zone.

Mo Ruxin’s goal had likely remained unchanged from the beginning.

Find the Heavenly Profound King and leave the Dark Star Sea.

Even if he didn’t pass the illusionary trial of the Grand Celestial Venerable of the Profound Heaven, he must have found some clues within it.

“Could it be that the Heavenly Profound King is hiding in the Gloom Forbidden Zone?”

“Or perhaps his mysterious disappearance back then was also related to the power of gloom?”

With these doubts, Li Fan found the hidden Yōu people underground.

To Li Fan’s surprise, there were no garrison troops from the Myriad Immortals Alliance in this small world.

The number of these Yōu people was also very small, less than a hundred.

Unlike the strong and healthy people Li Fan had seen before, they were all emaciated, as if they were at risk of sudden death at any moment.

After making some inquiries, Li Fan vaguely understood.

This group of Yōu people had fled from their original homeland.

The Myriad Immortals Alliance had captured their people, and they had escaped with their lives, finding this hiding place.

“This is even better.”

Li Fan no longer hesitated. With a full burst of power, coordinated with Tianyang, he intended to suppress this group of Yōu people into his own Cave Heaven.

However, something Li Fan hadn’t expected happened.

When facing Li Fan’s attack, these Yōu people, who seemed to possess no extraordinary aura, unleashed a very strange power.

The elder of the group remained calm despite the shock.

He began chanting loudly, and a strange wave instantly enveloped everyone.

Right before Li Fan’s eyes, he instantly lost track of them.

It wasn't an illusion technique; the attack genuinely missed.

“Hmm? Interesting.”

At that moment, Li Fan clearly felt the fluctuation of the power of gloom.

“The monk can run, but the temple cannot.”

When entering this small world, Li Fan had already completely sealed off the entrances and exits with a formation.

No one could leave this world without his permission!

His spiritual sense swept around, searching the entire small world, but he still could not find the hidden Yōu people.

Li Fan resorted to indiscriminate attacks.

Black light filled with destructive power descended from the sky, bombarding every inch of the ground.

Countless lives were affected.

Li Fan remained impassive, clearing every part of this small world.

Under this wide-ranging, indiscriminate cleansing, the group of Yōu people finally revealed a flaw.

Sensing that something was blocking his Great Five Elements Annihilation Sword, Li Fan’s eyes flashed.

He instantly sealed off that area layer by layer with a formation.

Forced out, the Yōu people finally revealed themselves.

They huddled together, looking up at Li Fan in the sky.

Their eyes held fear and hostility.

The elder in the lead could no longer restrain himself and spoke, “Immortal, why must you kill us all?”

“In the exploration of the sacred land, the number of our kin you captured before should surely be enough.”

“I think you have misunderstood. I am not a member of the Myriad Immortals Alliance. On the contrary, I share an irreconcilable hatred with the Myriad Immortals Alliance, just like you.” Li Fan said in a loud voice.

“Otherwise, with your meager strength, could you possibly survive under my hand?”

With that, Li Fan immediately activated the Soul Burning Technique to its fullest.

The five great Cave Heavens appeared demonic under the blood-red light.

Combined with the enhancement from the Tianyang Immortal Puppet, the strength Li Fan displayed at this moment was comparable to that of an Immortal Realm cultivator.

The small world itself could not contain it, causing streams of black spatial cracks to appear.

The heavens and earth trembled and gradually began to disintegrate.

The mere aura emanating from him caused an apocalyptic scene.

This struck extreme terror into the Yōu people below.

“The Myriad Immortals Alliance is currently exploring your sacred land. I wish to take the opportunity to assassinate them covertly.”

“Are you willing to lend this Venerable a helping hand?”

Li Fan asked coldly.

There was no second option. Coupled with their hatred for the Myriad Immortals Alliance, the Yōu people below quickly chose to submit.

When bringing them back to the Spirit Wood Realm as usual to pay homage to the Faceless True Immortal, these Yōu people suddenly collapsed to the ground, trembling as if they had seen something terrifying.

Chapter 1098: The Ebbing Tide of Gloom

Seeing the abnormality of this group of You people before him, Li Fan remained composed. Ignoring the extreme terror they displayed, he forced them to complete the oath of joining the alliance before the statue of the Faceless True Immortal.

Only after they finally calmed down did Li Fan press them for the reason behind their fear.

The leader of the You people trembled, and it took a long time before he could explain, "We have never been fortunate enough to see the True Immortal statue before. But the moment we saw it, our tribesmen instinctively felt boundless fear."

"We have lived in darkness for many years, and our bodies have adapted to that unique environment. We can barely last for a while under normal sunlight, but in front of the True Immortal statue..."

"It was like a light source thousands of times brighter than the great sun in the sky suddenly appearing in complete darkness."

The You leader's words were intermittent, but Li Fan understood his meaning. Just as a mortal feels fear when standing at the edge of an abyss, the You people felt extreme terror when seeing the statue of the Faceless True Immortal, as if facing a fatal threat.

However, the Net of True Immortals was formless and intangible. Even Li Fan, unless he was acting as the agent of the Faceless True Immortal in the Xuanhuang Realm, would probably not have noticed its existence. In contrast, these You people, even the newly born children among them, all felt the power of the True Immortal without exception.

"It seems it has everything to do with the power of gloom they command."

Next, Li Fan learned about their understanding of gloom from the You leader. The You people were originally human. In the ancient legends passed down in their tribe, the world they lived in in ancient times still had blue skies, white clouds, and bright sunshine. But one day, after the sun set, it never rose again. People begged desperately in the darkness, but the miracle never came. The vast majority of people disappeared forever in the darkness. The survivors, without exception, were all favored by the power of gloom. Under the erosion and transformation of the power of gloom, their bodies gradually changed, becoming terrifying figures with no heads, their facial features crowded on their chests.

In truth, the You people did not understand the essence of the power of gloom. They merely treated it as their only lifeline, worshipping and praying to the terrifying evil god that brought about the demise of the normal world. And this power of gloom seemed to understand their words, actually responding and allowing them to use it. The You people did not think they had mastered the power of gloom, but rather considered it a gift from the great God of Gloom.

...

What the You leader said was different from the introduction given by Zhou, the propagator of the teachings. The You people were clearly natives of the Gloom Realm, yet Zhou, the propagator, claimed they were just a special group that discovered and utilized the power of the Gloom Realm. On such a minor matter, Zhou likely had no reason to deceive him.

"It seems the process by which the Myriad Immortals Alliance discovered the Gloom Realm was not as simple as he glossed over." A cold light flashed in Li Fan's eyes.

Next, he pondered the manifestations of the power of gloom. "Praying, and then waiting for a response?"

"No wonder opening the passage to the Gloom Realm also involved a ritual of song and dance." Li Fan’s eyes flickered. Li Fan was not unfamiliar with a power that could resonate with the inner feelings of a cultivator. The golden essence of origin power was the residual power abandoned by True Immortals in the process of pursuing the root of the Dao—an existence called the Flower of Dao. "If they can sense each other, perhaps there should be a connection between these two."

According to the You leader's introduction, although the power of gloom only materialized in their homeland, it was actually omnipresent throughout the entire Xuanhuang Realm. It just hadn't condensed into a specific form, making it difficult for ordinary people to perceive. However, by praying and calling out through special methods, one could bypass the barriers between small worlds and summon its power.
