Under Li Fan's observation, the You leader prayed devoutly, murmuring incantations. He launched an attack toward a fierce beast resembling a lion-tiger beast in front of him. This lion-tiger beast was a new breed recently cultivated by the Empire, its flesh as hard as steel. Even a full-force blow from an ordinary Foundation Establishment cultivator could barely scratch it.

But an extremely bizarre scene occurred. Without any warning, the once majestic lion-tiger beast suddenly collapsed on the ground, its four limbs limp. Its eyes were filled with terror, struggling powerlessly to get up. But beneath it, it was as if there was an invisible mire, with countless hands constantly pulling it down. Under Li Fan's gaze, this lion-tiger beast was slowly swallowed by gloom, leaving no bones behind.

From beginning to end, Li Fan did not "see" the existence of gloom. Yet, the lion-tiger beast truly vanished right before his eyes. Li Fan carefully examined the ground where the gloom had descended; there was no residual power.

"It comes and goes without a trace, impossible to guard against." Li Fan stroked his chin, falling into deep thought.

The group of You people then collectively closed their eyes and prayed devoutly again.

"It seems only they can generate a response from the gloom through this kind of prayer. Ordinary humans, no matter how similar their appearance, cannot invoke the power of gloom."

"This is easy to understand. Only by joining our Myriad Realms Federation, passing the oath before the True Immortal Statue, and joining the Net of True Immortals, can their prayers be sensed by me. It's likely that the power of gloom also has such an invisible net." Li Fan pondered to himself, "So the key is how to join this net without being swallowed by the gloom."

In the Gloom Realm, the bizarre appearance of Mo Rubin's remains was still vivid in his memory. Simply making physical contact with it resulted in such an outcome. It was hard to imagine how one could survive if their body and soul were fully immersed in the gloom.

Subsequently, the attempts by Li Fan's subordinates, under his command, to imitate communication with the gloom also confirmed his guess. They vanished silently, swallowed by the gloom—gone without a trace, neither dead nor alive.

And in a short time, frequently invoking the power of gloom seemed to cause some subtle changes. As the master of the Spirit Wood Realm, Li Fan vaguely felt the entire world darken for a fleeting moment. After confirming with the You leader, Li Fan knew this was not his illusion. The gloom indeed had a tendency to flow toward this place.

Li Fan decisively halted the experiments for the time being. He then questioned the various members of the You tribe for a long time, finally getting a general understanding of the current situation of the power of gloom in the Xuanhuang Realm. It was like an ocean of gloom gathered on the "back" of Xuanhuang. Although its position was fixed by some mysterious power, the all-pervasive nature of gloom meant that it would sometimes invade Xuanhuang, and various small worlds, along any possible "fissure." It would infiltrate and eventually return to the Gloom Realm, cycling repeatedly to form something akin to a "tide."

Chapter 1099: Stealing Gloom to Seek Life

“The more frequently one begs the power of gloom, the more fissures are created. The possibility of gloom invading becomes stronger.”

Li Fan calmly analyzed the characteristics of the power of gloom.

One could imagine that if the mysterious power fixing the ocean of gloom did not exist, the Xuanhuang Realm would probably have already been riddled with holes by this gloomy tide.

“The existence of the Immortal Ruins creates the ocean of gloom. Then what is it that erases this crisis from awareness while the world is oblivious?”

Recalling Mo Rubing’s desperate action to enter the Gloom Realm, Li Fan was almost certain that something related to King Xuantian must exist there.

Perhaps his residual power.

Or perhaps…

Himself.

From the You tribe, he selected three younger descendants and had them separately teach the rituals for communicating with the power of gloom.

Li Fan, along with the You tribe leader and a dozen sturdy tribesmen, left the Spirit Wood Realm.

Since the existence of the gloomy tide would cause the invasion of the power of gloom, Li Fan naturally would not conduct the rituals in his own domain.

Fortunately, he knew of quite a few ownerless small worlds.

After about half a day, Li Fan chose a suitable one and infiltrated it.

This small world had no ground.

There were only continuous underground caves. The only source of light was the occasional light moss growing on the cave walls.

It was relatively suitable for the You tribesmen to inhabit.

At Fang Zaizhi’s urging, the You tribe leader began the ritual to open the passage to the Gloom Realm.

Afterward, Li Fan commanded the leader to guide the way.

Li Fan himself, along with Tianyang, Qiaogong Jushi, Liu Ruchen, and Fang Zaizhi, held hands tightly and followed closely behind.

They once again entered the boundless gloomy world.

Li Fan had already adapted considerably.

However, the tension and fear emanating from Qiaogong and the others were palpable.

Even though they had heard about it beforehand and were psychologically prepared, experiencing it firsthand made it difficult to shake off these emotions.

The connected group communicated using their spiritual sense.

“Can you sense the presence of people from the Myriad Immortal Alliance here?”

Li Fan asked the You tribe leader.

He, however, gave a negative reply.

“The power of gloom is too deep. Even we who live here long cannot clearly see things around us. Moreover, it has been a long time since I returned home. Esteemed Envoy, please allow me some time to re-adapt…”

Upon hearing this, Li Fan stared at him vigilantly.

Fortunately, it was just his overthinking.

After a while, the You tribe leader finally managed to roughly discern their bearings.

“Follow me. Our former dwelling is not far from here. If people from the Myriad Immortal Alliance have set up a base here, they would surely choose that location.”

They traveled in the darkness for an unknown amount of time before the You tribe leader suddenly stopped.

“There are indeed people here, quite a few. Because of them, the Sea of Gloom is being disturbed, emitting chaotic fluctuations,” he explained to Li Fan and the others, his voice filled with hatred.

Only then did Li Fan notice.

That inexplicable vibration he felt from Mo Rubing’s corpse the last time he entered seemed to have vanished.

And above the gloom, it was impossible to determine their location.

“It seems we can only look for clues from this Myriad Immortal Alliance outpost.”

Li Fan thought to himself.

“Can you figure out how many people are inside?”

The You tribe leader sensed for a moment. “There should be around five. As for their strength, it’s about the same as this one…”

He was referring to Liu Ruchen among the group.

“You can actually discern our strength?” Fang Zaizhi was a little curious.

“Out there, of course not. But here in the Sea of Gloom, it is an easy matter for us You tribesmen,” the You tribe leader said with a hint of arrogance.

“It’s like how objects of different weights cause different ripples when placed in water. He probably distinguished them by that point,” Qiaogong Jushi explained, looking out into the endless gloom around them.

Fang Zaizhi then understood.

“Can you see what the people from the Myriad Immortal Alliance are doing here?” Li Fan asked with a frown.

“We need to get a little closer.”

After a moment of thought, Li Fan agreed to his request: “Don’t push yourself. It is not the time to have a direct conflict with the Myriad Immortal Alliance yet.”

Having fought the Myriad Immortal Alliance before, the You tribe leader naturally understood the terrifying strength of their opponents.

Acknowledging the request, he began to cautiously approach the location ahead.

“This is…”

“How dare they!”

The You tribe leader’s emotions suddenly fluctuated greatly.

It was fortunate they were in the Sea of Gloom, otherwise, the people from the Myriad Immortal Alliance would have discovered them.

The You tribe leader shared the scene he sensed with the others.

Several white figures were gathered in a circle.

In their center, there seemed to be a small vortex formed by the power of gloom.

This vortex was very small, less than the size of a palm.

Its appearance was also rather peculiar, with the center of the vortex pointing upward, the opposite of what one usually sees.

However, the several Dao Confluence cultivators from the Myriad Immortal Alliance guarding it seemed extremely tense.

“What is this?” Fang Zaizhi asked in confusion.

“They are stealing the great power of gloom!” the You tribe leader ground out through gritted teeth.

Li Fan and the others were all startled upon hearing this.

“Even with the limitations imposed by the Sea of Gloom itself, it cannot stop these despicable thieves!” The You tribe leader wished he could rush over immediately to stop the Myriad Immortal Alliance’s actions.

Fortunately, he still possessed some reason and only spoke of it, not actually taking action.

“What do you all think?”

Looking at the scene in his mind, Li Fan asked the others.

“The power of gloom is separating from the Immortal Ruins. Clearly, the Myriad Immortal Alliance is not satisfied with just the small amount seeping out during the tidal periods; they want to extract the power of gloom on a large scale.”

“It seems they ultimately could not resist the temptation to escape the Immortal Ruins,” Liu Ruchen commented slightly upon receiving Li Fan’s shared intelligence.

“We just don’t know what method they are using to create this vortex. Surely they aren’t using a small world specifically to attract the power of gloom…” Fang Zaizhi said casually.

As soon as he finished speaking, he froze.

“It’s not impossible. It’s just a small world without much special value. If they can channel such a massive amount of the power of gloom here, it would be worth destroying it.” Qiaogong Jushi stated firmly.

“Esteemed Envoy, perhaps we could emulate the Myriad Immortal Alliance.” He even suggested that Li Fan do the same.

“I have a premonition that if this power of gloom is combined with essence of the source energy and used on immortal puppets, we might be able to advance further and forge true immortal puppets,” Qiaogong Jushi’s tone held a hint of fanaticism.

Although Li Fan had the same thought, he did not immediately agree.

Instead, he asked the You tribe leader whether he could sense any residual corpses of cultivators who had perished nearby.

“Eh? If you hadn’t mentioned it, I almost didn’t notice.”

“But this doesn’t seem like a corpse.”

“It looks more like an empty shell.”

“Even if it were our own tribesmen who died in the Sea of Gloom, it wouldn't be like this.”

“Too light, too light.”

After the You tribe leader’s explanation, Li Fan immediately understood.

He was still judging based on the fluctuations caused by being in the Sea of Gloom.

Mo Rubing’s corpse did not conform to the normal signs of a usual living being dying.

“Either it is just an empty shell serving as a smokescreen, or…”

“This person was deeply favored by the Gloom, and after his death, the vast majority of his spirituality instantly returned to the Sea of Gloom. Only the decaying parts were left behind to slowly dissolve into the Gloom.” The You tribe leader suddenly offered another possibility.

“However, even the most powerful priest in our tribe’s history did not reach a state like this after death. So, I am more inclined to believe that what we are seeing is merely an empty shell.”

Upon hearing this, Li Fan’s eyes flickered.

Hearing the You tribe leader’s words just now, he couldn’t help but be astonished. But if the Gloom power here was linked to Xuan Tian Wang, then the abnormality of Mo Rubing’s death could be explained.

“Still, we cannot afford to be careless. The Xuan Tian Cult is bizarre and full of endless tricks. We still need to guard against it cautiously.”

“Regardless of whether he is truly dead or not, my plan will not change because of it.”

With a thought flashing through his mind, Li Fan inquired further about the details of Mo Rubing’s corpse.

The location where Li Fan had seen him not long ago was clearly not here.

He hadn’t expected the Myriad Immortal Alliance to find a method to resist the Gloom infection in such a short time and transfer him here.

“If it were truly just a worthless empty shell, the Myriad Immortal Alliance wouldn't have gone to such great lengths to transfer it. In my opinion, the vortex the Myriad Immortal Alliance is using to steal the Gloom is likely stabilized precisely because of Mo Rubing’s corpse.” Qiaogong Jushi offered his insight.

“This Gloom power is somewhat similar in nature to the essence of the source energy. Under normal circumstances, with the vast scale of the Sea of Gloom, if such a small vent appeared, it would certainly form an unimaginable energy vortex. But this place is a bit too calm.”

Qiaogong Jushi spoke with certainty, causing the You tribe leader to be momentarily stunned.

He observed carefully again for a long time before saying with some surprise, “Esteemed Envoy, what this Immortal Master says is correct! The normally violent Gloom power has actually stabilized after being filtered and affected by that empty shell!”

“It can even soothe the Gloom… what is this…” The You tribe leader’s tone was astonished, uncertain, and doubtful.

Li Fan immediately fell into deep thought.

If the Gloom Realm was indeed connected to Xuan Tian Wang, then what might attract his special attention, besides his former companions from the Xuan Tian Cult,

was probably the statue of the Faceless True Immortal.

But it was not yet certain how much of a stir the True Immortal statue would cause if it appeared in the Gloom Realm. Therefore, Li Fan needed to consider carefully whether or not to proceed with that.

The main task of this trip was still to use this opportunity to study the mysterious Gloom power, and to inquire about Mo Rubing’s whereabouts.

“Can we approach this area and secretly open a gap connecting to a small world?” Li Fan asked. “With the effect of Mo Rubing’s corpse, the fluctuation caused should not be too large.”

The You tribe leader considered for a moment and gave an affirmative answer.

“But it is best not to induce too much Gloom power, otherwise two vortices of equal size might gradually approach each other due to their mutual interaction, forming one large whole.”

“Yes, we are only drawing a little for research purposes. We won't be too greedy.”

With Li Fan making the final decision, the group immediately took action.

Under the leadership of their chieftain, the You tribe members secretly opened another spatial passage, almost right next to the Myriad Immortal Alliance’s outpost.

This place was originally their homeland, and with Li Fan and the others using their respective divine abilities to conceal the fluctuations,

the process went quite smoothly, and they were not discovered by the Myriad Immortal Alliance personnel from beginning to end.

Of course, this might also be because the alliance members had concentrated all their attention on guarding that giant vortex.

“It is truly marvelous, the surging Sea of Gloom has become so gentle here.” Witnessing this miraculous scene firsthand, the You tribe leader couldn't help but exclaim in admiration.

And on the other side of the passage, in the underground world,

the Gloom power released from the cage immediately reverted to its original nature.

At a terrifying speed, it surged rapidly in all directions, devouring everything.

The last light in the underground world quickly vanished completely.

Countless living beings died quietly, without understanding why.

Fortunately, the scale of this underground small world was not too large.

After the Gloom power quickly filled it, it began to flow back towards the Gloom Realm.

It was truly like the rise and fall of a tide.

At the entrance connecting the underground world to the Profound Yellow Realm, Li Fan keenly detected the permeation of the Gloom.

However, they had not yet opened the passage, so this process was extremely slow.

“If we have to use this passage for both entering and exiting, then before long, the overflowing Gloom will be noticed by the Myriad Immortal Alliance,” Liu Ruchen said with a frown.

“I will think of a way,” Qiaogong Jushi volunteered. “The essence of the source energy and the Gloom power are incompatible. Perhaps we can build a buffer zone here. Of course, this might require a large amount of essence of the source energy.”

As Qiaogong Jushi spoke, he couldn't help but look at Li Fan.

Li Fan was completely unmoved by the remnants of this True Immortal power. He had accumulated quite a substantial amount during this time, and it had no particular use.

However, he pretended to ponder for a long time before reluctantly agreeing.

Qiaogong Jushi was overjoyed upon seeing this and immediately began to act, summoning his beloved creation to help.

A female immortal puppet of unparalleled beauty was completely obedient to Qiaogong.

It used the same technology as the Tianyang Immortal Puppet, but it was unknown where Qiaogong found the consciousness and personality for the immortal puppet.

It was only when Qiaogong was building the "buffer zone" that he boasted, casually revealing her origin.

“When [Ancestor] collapsed, I barely managed to survive the calamity and escape my homeland. But some folks were not as lucky as me. Their bodies were destroyed in the disaster, and only their consciousness backups were preserved, which I carried with me.”

“Don’t let her obedient appearance fool you now; she used to scold me quite a bit! Hahaha!”

“Back when we were in the Celestial Spirit Cult, I also prepared a puppet body for her. But it was too rigid, and I didn't like it. I lost interest after playing with it for a short while and destroyed it.”

“Unlike this current one, she is lively and almost indistinguishable from a real person.”

Chapter 1101: Secretly Calculating the True Immortal

“Oh, right. I also saved the memories from when her original body was destroyed, and added them when creating her new body…”

“You guys should have seen the expression on her face when she first woke up.”

The more Qiaogong Jushi spoke, the more excited he became.

As the buffer zone of Origin Energy Essence was gradually completed, the surroundings became brighter. This allowed him to clearly see the gazes of the people around him directed at him.

This made him even more smug.

“I should have thought of this sooner. Since you can replicate and back up your own consciousness, it shouldn’t be a problem to preserve consciousness backups of other cultivators from the Tianji Realm.” Li Fan suddenly appeared, and his cold tone instantly stiffened Qiaogong Jushi.

“The cultivators of the Tianji Realm are all absolute geniuses in artifact refining. Our association is in great need of such people; how could you be selfish?” Li Fan’s gaze was unfriendly.

Qiaogong Jushi could only manage an awkward smile.

“How many consciousness backups do you have from your side? Hand them all over, and I will let bygones be bygones. Otherwise…”

Qiaogong Jushi felt waves of killing intent emanating from Li Fan and his heart skipped a beat.

He even felt as if his neck was tightly gripped by a pair of invisible giant hands, making it almost impossible to breathe.

Moreover, this feeling of being choked intensified.

He was like an insect caught in a net, completely unable to break free, only able to wait for death in vain.

Qiaogong Jushi knew this was the power of the Crimson Dust Compassion Immortal.

After reciting the oath to join the association, he had already fallen into the net of the True Immortal.

Unless he could surpass in strength, Li Fan, as the envoy, could annihilate him with a mere thought through this connection alone.

Fortunately, Li Fan did not truly intend to kill him here.

Just as Qiaogong’s consciousness was about to blur, the suffocating sensation instantly vanished.

Regaining his life, Qiaogong gasped heavily, wiped the cold sweat from his forehead, and hurriedly explained, “Only the core members of the Elder Council.”

“I was in a rush when I escaped, so I only managed to take this much.”

“The power of gloom is mysterious. We can release them later to study it together,” Li Fan said indifferently.

Qiaogong Jushi could only agree.

Having been frightened once by Li Fan, Qiaogong was much more obedient afterward.

Three days later, the golden buffer zone was completed.

Looking at the dense darkness not far away, completely blocked outside, everyone couldn't help but marvel again at the divine power of the Crimson Dust Compassion Immortal.

Although the power of gloom was strong, it could not contend with a True Immortal.

Even with the buffer measures in place, there was still a risk of this power of gloom running out of control.

Li Fan had no intention of bringing it back to the Spiritual Wood Realm for research.

Instead, he opened up another research area in this underground world.

The four elders from the Tianji Realm were also released by Qiaogong.

It was then that Li Fan realized that the peerlessly beautiful female immortal puppet from before was actually Shangguan Tuo, the chief elder of the Tianji Realm that Qiaogong had mentioned earlier.

Shangguan Tuo had once tried to completely control the [Ancestor] by taking a risk and merging her divine soul with the broken core of the [Ancestor]. Before this, she had naturally prepared a consciousness backup.

However, her reckless action nearly led to the collapse of the entire Tianji Realm, resulting in grave sins.

Thus, the members of the Elder Council at that time rejected the proposal to reawaken Shangguan Tuo.

They only deeply hid her consciousness backup.

It was finally taken out by Qiaogong before the Tianji Realm was destroyed.

What Li Fan did not expect was that Shangguan Tuo was actually Qiaogong’s mentor.

Qiaogong Jushi looked at the gazes of the others, showing no sign of abnormality in his expression.

And the remaining three elders of the Tianji Realm remained silent regarding Qiaogong’s act of betraying his master and ancestors.

After Li Fan inquired if Shangguan Tuo wished to seek freedom, he received a negative answer.

This made Li Fan somewhat curious.

His eyes flicked towards Qiaogong, who immediately shuddered and quickly explained.

“This actually has little to do with me.”

“After all, they are only consciousness backups. To avoid a situation where two ‘mes’ kill each other, their subjective initiative has been suppressed. They cannot be considered completely equivalent to their real personalities. Only the Great Elder knows how to lift the restrictions.”

“This is also a protective measure implemented by our Tianji Realm to prevent anyone from widely using consciousness backups to endanger world security.”

“As for myself, the Tianji Realm is gone, so naturally, I have fewer scruples.”

Qiaogong Jushi’s tone betrayed an undisguised pride.

“So, they are considered second-class citizens in the Tianji Realm, and thus must obey you, the first-class citizen?” Fang Zaizhi asked, stroking his chin.

Qiaogong nodded.

However, upon seeing Li Fan’s expression, he immediately patted his chest and guaranteed, “Envoy, please rest assured. Although they consider their status lower than mine, their talent for research is no different from my original self. Working together, I believe researching the uses of this power of gloom will not be difficult.”

“It’s up to you then.”

Li Fan couldn't be bothered with the messy affairs of the Tianji Realm.

As long as they could be used by him, that was enough.

After giving instructions, Li Fan returned alone to the underground world.

Alone, immersed in gloom.

Li Fan felt no fear in his heart, just quietly sensing his surroundings.

“Just as I thought. In the gloom, even the influence of the Faceless True Immortal is greatly weakened.”

“Although I cannot completely escape it yet, for me, it is practically a sanctuary.”

“Deep in the Ghost Realm, I can activate the Return to Truth and go back anytime.”

Thinking of this, the threat that had long weighed heavily on Li Fan’s heart finally lessened considerably.

“But simply escaping is useless.”

“So much has been prepared in this world. Regarding retreating safely during the clash between the Faceless True Immortal and the Immortal Ruins Immortals, I am already quite confident.”

“How should I choose?”

Li Fan, rarely calm in this life, pondered alone.

The gloom acted like a protective umbrella isolating everything, allowing Li Fan an unprecedented sense of relaxation.

“The power of the Faceless True Immortal remains in the Xuanhuang Realm. It doesn't mean I can avoid it just by not provoking it.”

“Once a certain level is reached, it is bound to attract Its attention. This is an unchangeable fact.”

“Unless I can find a way to escape the Xuanhuang Realm safely.”

“But outside the high wall, True Immortals still exist.”

“Unavoidable…”

A sharp glint flashed in Li Fan’s eyes.

“When facing a True Immortal, sometimes being weak oneself is an advantage.”

“One can observe properly while being overlooked by the opponent.”

Li Fan looked again at the deep gloom surrounding him.

“Like this darkness. If there is an entity in the darkness staring at me, and its strength is far weaker than mine, posing no threat to me at all…”

“How could I possibly detect it?”

Chapter 1102: The Convergence of Many Essences

The research conducted by the people of the Celestial Mystery Realm on the power of gloom did not go as smoothly as imagined.

It was understandable, after all, it was a power level comparable to the essence of Origin power. No matter how much of a genius one was, researching it from nothing would inevitably require a great deal of time. Fortunately, Qiao Gong Jushi and the others were research fanatics; ever since the research began, they had been completely immersed in it without distraction.

All Li Fan needed to do was wait patiently and then reap the rewards.

During this period, Li Fan had already quietly begun plotting against the two Immortals.

In the Spirit Wood Realm, within an underground secret chamber.

Over a hundred strangely shaped puppets stood silently motionless.

Li Fan was personally engraving formations onto them with a solemn expression.

“Bait puppets, seventy-two groups with two in each. One puppet from each group will fly into the Immortal Ruins, while the other will be placed in various corners of the Xuanhuang Realm’s earth veins. When the seventy-two bait puppets fly toward the Immortal Ruins, the grand formation on them will activate, attracting the attention of the Immortals in the Immortal Ruins.”

“This formation was deduced by the Dissolution Disc and is infinitely close to the level of an Immortal-grade grand formation. It is called the [Bewildering Blossoms]. Upon suddenly sensing a threat while in seclusion, they will inevitably react instinctively, tracing back to the Xuanhuang Realm.”

“Near the bait puppets remaining in the Xuanhuang Realm, I will set up a warning network using the essence of the Faceless True Immortal’s Origin power. Once the power of the Immortals from the Immortal Ruins triggers it, it will draw the attention of the Faceless True Immortal.”

“If nothing unexpected happens…”

“Once these two unimaginable forces collide, the Xuanhuang Realm will likely be instantly annihilated. Therefore, my deception of the Heavenly Dao and the extraction of the Xuanhuang Realm’s impending changes must be prepared in advance.”

The Dao Transformation Stone in his mind emitted a flashing blue light.

The enhanced deduction ability of the sublimated Dao Transformation Stone had been greatly strengthened. This tactic of driving a wolf to devour a tiger involved every aspect. Even with countless threads and frequent variables, the Dao Transformation Stone did not bear too much burden.

Of course, this was only because, in the deductions, the Faceless True Immortal and the Immortal Ruins Immortals only possessed the abilities preset by Li Fan.

Li Fan was self-aware enough to know that with his current strength, attempting to deduce the actions of True Immortals was akin to a daydream. What he could do was seek a sliver of victory based on the reality he had already experienced.

“The Immortal Ruins Immortal shakes the True Immortal net.”

“I will take this opportunity to activate Return to Truth and escape the confines in one fell swoop.”

“Of course, this is the most ideal state. As the saying goes, plan for defeat before victory. I must also consider that if my plan fails, and the power gap between the Immortal Ruins Immortal and the Faceless True Immortal is too large to shake the restraint of the True Immortal net…”

“Then I must immediately return to the depths of the Nether Realm and activate Return to Truth to escape the crisis.”

“Now I have mastered several things that can at least slightly influence True Immortals, so delaying them for a moment should be achievable.”

Li Fan examined himself beyond his divine soul.

The silver light protection gifted by the Heavenly Doctor, the golden essence of Origin power, and the seven-colored divine light wrapped in gray mold spots…

Various different powers maintained a delicate balance.

Perhaps only someone like Li Fan could maintain such complete composure under these circumstances, even feeling a subtle sense of peace.

“Borrowing strength to strike, maneuvering freely. At its core, my own strength is still too weak. However, the threshold to Immortality is not easily crossed, is it?”

“Geniuses like King Xuan Tian, Transmission Master, and Heavenly Doctor are all blocked outside, unable to make progress.”

“Let alone me? If I didn’t possess Return to Truth, I would have likely given up on this seemingly unrealistic fantasy long ago,” Li Fan mused with a slight self-mockery.

“But since I have the good fortune to encounter the wondrous object of Return to Truth, no one can stop my path to Ascension…” A cold glint flashed in his eyes.

Li Fan knew that whether it was [Chaos], [Hunger], or [Nothingness], what he had seen were not the original versions.

They were clumsy imitations by later generations. Therefore, Li Fan had never given up on deeply studying these three True Immortal seal characters for a long time.

Even if it was a copy of a copy, the more similar the imitation, the stronger the power.

Even Immortals could gain enlightenment from one of these characters. It could be said that Li Fan could spend his entire life studying any one of these three without fully grasping it.

Li Fan’s comprehension was limited, but he could rely on external aids.

Besides the peerless natural talent of his clone, Li Qing, the geniuses of the Xuanhuang Realm who had been tricked and turned in recent times within the Mountain and River Pavilion had also become Li Fan’s sustenance.

The Heaven and Earth Mutual Exchange Talent obtained from Senior Sister Zhao, the cultivation method of the Xuan Tian Sect, could harmonize the talents and comprehension of any object.

After clone Li Qing achieved minor success, she began scouting for suitable targets.

She announced publicly that she was sending them out to carry out secret missions for the Compassionate Immortal of the Mortal World, but in reality, they had already been secretly controlled to extract their innate talents.

Of course, due to the mutual exchange and harmonization, these geniuses also gained half of Li Qing’s talent enhancement.

Li Qing’s talent was not weaker than theirs, so the geniuses of the Mountain and River Pavilion, including Shang Tianci, did not notice anything unusual. They were merely astonished by the marvelous nature of the [Building a Foundation with Myself] technique.

After gaining the talent enhancements of over a dozen geniuses, clone Li Qing’s comprehension reached an astonishing level.

She even became aware of the fact that Li Fan’s main body had erased some of her memories.

But she was only a clone, and there was no distinction between her and the main body. She resolutely carried out the task of comprehending the True Immortal seal characters.

The three True Immortal seal characters constantly floated in her mind, as if alive.

Li Qing seemed to see a blurry figure transforming into characters through the Dao.

“Inscription of the Dao…”

“An existence even more powerful than the Faceless True Immortal. Perhaps that is my ultimate goal.”

…

Just as Li Fan was secretly preparing for this world’s ultimate plan, the Heavenly Venerable of Reversing Life and Death, who had emerged earlier, finally demonstrated the influence she had on the Xuanhuang Realm.

People discovered that ever since this Heavenly Venerable descended, cultivators of the Xuanhuang Realm had ceased to produce new offspring.

Or rather, the entire human race was like this.

At first, people couldn’t be sure if it was the influence of this Heavenly Venerable.

But when a cultivator who had previously perished returned in a way no one had ever imagined, everyone instantly connected everything.

The Lancang River, the largest river on the southwestern border of the Myriad Immortal Alliance.

A cultivator named Chang Ji suddenly emerged naked from the river one day.

This unusual scene naturally attracted onlookers.

But Chang Ji didn’t care at all; instead, he looked at his body with ecstatic joy and disbelief, muttering to himself, “I’m alive again?”

“Reversing life and death, reversing life and death, the Heavenly Venerable truly did not deceive me!”

Chapter 1103: The River of Rebirth in Xuanhuang

Ignoring the strange looks from the crowd, Chang Ji respectfully performed a grand bow toward the sky.

Then, he transformed into a streak of light and flew away.

The words he spoke before leaving immediately attracted the attention of observant cultivators.

After some investigation, people finally discovered that this Chang Ji should have completely perished a year ago.

During an exploration of the ruins of a wild sect, he unfortunately triggered a defensive formation and was instantly reduced to ashes, leaving no remains.

More than ten companions who were present at the time could testify; this was beyond doubt!

And now, this Chang Ji had actually been resurrected!

The location of his resurrection was precisely the largest river closest to his place of demise!

This somewhat terrifying discovery swiftly spread throughout the entire Myriad Immortal Alliance.

Soon, Chang Ji's friends from before his death flocked to him, wanting to confirm the truth of his reappearance.

Chang Ji himself did not deny it; instead, he generously admitted that he had been resurrected.

"All thanks to the divine power of the Heavenly Venerable!" He did not forget to say with great piety in front of everyone.

In the past within the Myriad Immortal Alliance, when cultivators spoke of the Heavenly Venerable, they invariably referred to the Dharma Preaching Heavenly Venerable.

But now, spoken from Chang Ji’s mouth, everyone knew he was referring to the Longevity Heavenly Venerable who had silently reversed life and death.

Seeing that his relatives and friends were still somewhat doubtful, Chang Ji directly invited them into his Heavenly Profound Mirror space.

As everyone knew, the Heavenly Profound Mirror space was bound to the cultivator and could only be opened by the cultivator themselves.

With the Heavenly Profound Mirror as proof, everyone finally completely believed Chang Ji's true identity.

He had returned from the dead, and this was certainly not an isolated case.

This shocking news quickly became widely known.

In the following days, the appearance of more and more resurrected cultivators served as further verification of its truth.

After summarization, it was found that resurrected cultivators within the Myriad Immortal Alliance reappeared without exception from the largest river closest to their place of death.

In the Alliance territory, there were a total of fifty-four rivers of rebirth.

As for the Five Elders Council side, there seemed to be a corresponding fifty-four rivers as well.

These one hundred and eight rivers together constituted the rivers of rebirth in the Xuanhuang Realm.

The length of time it took for cultivators to resurrect seemed related to their strength when they died.

The stronger the cultivation realm, the longer the time required for resurrection.

The first batch of resurrected cultivators were, without exception, only at the Foundation Establishment stage or below.

As for how long it would take for cultivators of higher realms to resurrect, that required further gradual verification.

After resurrection, they always appeared naked. Items carried on their person before death, even those hidden within the soul, would not reappear with them. However, having their lives back was already a great fortune. No one paid much attention to these external possessions.

Resurrected cultivators seemed to possess the same age as they did before death.

However, after detailed measurement, it was discovered that the resurrected body seemed to be one year younger than before its demise.

It wasn't just cultivators; any living being within the Xuanhuang Realm would resurrect from the river water upon death.

Thus, people often witnessed the strange sight of creatures continuously emerging from the rebirth rivers and coming ashore.

The river water seemed to possess a miraculous power protecting the newly resurrected beings, preventing them from drowning immediately upon reappearance.

But this power quickly vanished after leaving the river of rebirth. Even if they re-entered the river, its trace could no longer be found.

...

The various wonders surrounding returning from the dead became the most heated topic of discussion among the cultivators of the Myriad Immortal Alliance.

Some were fortunate, believing that they finally no longer had to worry about perishing in the future.

But some cultivators began to worry that if no new life were born, the future of the Xuanhuang Realm might be grim.

Fortunately, a discovery quickly alleviated these concerns.

In certain states of the Myriad Immortal Alliance, new life was still being born since the Heavenly Venerable reversed the principle of life and death. However, the numbers were extremely small, totaling less than fifty across the entire Myriad Immortal Alliance in a year.

But at least the gestation of life had not completely stopped.

And even if life would not completely cease henceforth, an annual increase of fifty cultivators was not a major issue for the Xuanhuang Realm.

Soon, the cultivators' attention shifted to other critical questions.

For instance, after dying once, could one resurrect again? How long would the second resurrection take? Was there truly no limit to the number of times?

Since age decreased by one year with each death, was there an upper limit to this?

...

That supremely mysterious Heavenly Venerable never made an appearance to offer any explanation.

All of this had to be explored by the cultivators themselves.

These would become the mandatory rules moving forward, so cultivators naturally attached great importance to them.

Soon, under the command of certain entities, some cultivators who had recently been resurrected were compelled to sacrifice their lives once more to explore the mysteries of rebirth.

Fortunately, knowing they could return from the dead and having been promised generous rewards, these cultivators used as test subjects did not voice much complaint.

They had already died once anyway.

After death, they had no conscious awareness.

They simply closed their eyes and opened them to become a hero again.

Moreover, they could receive rewards they could never earn in a lifetime of living—why not embrace it?

The secret of rebirth would likely take some time to be deciphered.

Li Fan, upon hearing the news, personally went to investigate near one of the rivers of rebirth for a long time.

Ultimately, he could not discern any clues.

"Compared to the Underworld Palace of Rebirth I experienced previously, the way of reversing life and death in this life is clearly more perfect."

"To actually nurture life out of thin air from the river..."

"Truly inconceivable."

The principle of reversing life and death had completely merged with the Heavenly Dao of Xuanhuang, making it impossible to distinguish separately anymore.

Even Li Fan, who was proficient in formations, could not glimpse any trace of the [Grand Formation of Reversing Life and Death] he had seen before.

Fearing that this inexplicably appearing Heavenly Venerable might affect his grand plan, Li Fan quietly contacted the Messenger Zhou, attempting to glean some insider information from her.

To his disappointment, Messenger Zhou still gave the same answer that she knew nothing about it.

"As far as I know, your Myriad Immortal Alliance has an organization called the Heavenly Oversight Department, specifically responsible for monitoring the principles of the Xuanhuang Heaven and Earth. This Heavenly Venerable has succeeded in reversing principles for so long, yet you insist you are completely unaware... Fellow Daoist Zhou, that is somewhat hard to believe?" Li Fan questioned with a displeased tone.

Messenger Zhou smiled faintly, "Your intelligence network in the Myriad Worlds Federation is indeed well-informed."

"You can even uncover a secret existence like the Alliance's Heavenly Oversight Department. However, I am not trying to deceive you; I truly do not know about this."

The smile on Zhou's face gradually faded, and her expression became serious.

"Generally speaking, when a cultivator who has achieved Unity with the Dao attempts to reverse principles, it is a gradual process."

"During this process, the traces of distortion and change in the principles of Heaven and Earth are quite obvious, which is why the Heavenly Oversight Department could monitor the impending emergence of the Longevity Heavenly Venerable."

"But this Rebirth Heavenly Venerable is different."

"The speed of his appearance..."

"Was a bit too fast."

Chapter 1104: The Natures of Heaven and Man are Fundamentally Different

"From the moment the traces of the reversal of the principles of Heaven and Earth appeared, to the success of reversing the principles and attaining Longevity, the entire process took no more than ten years."

"Under normal circumstances, a cultivator who has achieved Unity with the Dao hasn't even completed the first step of reversing principles, yet this person has already finished the promotion."

"I almost suspect that this Rebirth Heavenly Venerable might be a survivor from the outside world, someone who was already a great cultivator on the verge of the Longevity Realm, which is why they could advance so smoothly." The tone of Messenger Zhou held a hint of alarm.

"An outsider?" Upon hearing this, Li Fan also inexplicably fell into deep thought.

"However, fortunately, this Heavenly Venerable seems to have no intention of intervening in the disputes of the Profound Yellow World. Neither we nor the Five Elders Association has been actively approached by Him. As for the impact of reversing life and death, we are still assessing it. But it can be foreseen that both sides may become increasingly cautious about launching wars in the future." Messenger Zhou spoke with some emotion.

Li Fan nodded in agreement.

Even though reversing life and death means infinite resurrection, seemingly implying endless manpower.

The key issue is that resurrection requires time.

And the rate at which the Profound Yellow World nurtures new life has been weakened to the extreme. If a significant number of casualties occur, there will be a long window period before a slow recovery can be made. Moreover, as the number of resurrections increases, the time required for revival is likely to become longer and longer. In the short term, there won't be any major issues. But what if this continues in the long run...

Li Fan suddenly spoke up, "Fellow Daoist Zhou, you don't need to worry too much. If I remember correctly, doesn't your Myriad Immortals Alliance have many cultivators suppressed and eternally asleep? You can release them in a critical moment to help out."

What Li Fan said referred to the cultivators suppressed within the Eternal Immortal Wall by the Myriad Immortals Alliance, including those whose bodies were previously taken over by the millions of gods and demons summoned by his [Three Disasters Hundred Calamities Bright God Method]. Although they had essentially lost their self-awareness and were only empty shells, they could still be used as cannon fodder to some extent.

Messenger Zhou gazed at Li Fan for a moment and did not reply. She concluded the conversation with a polite smile.

"I always have a feeling that the identity of this Rebirth Heavenly Venerable..."

"Perhaps we can test and verify it together in the next life. Let's not add variables in this life."

Li Fan's eyes flickered, and he returned to his preparations.

...

Time flew by, and in the blink of an eye, twenty-four years had anchored.

By the shore of the Sea of Dense Clouds, Li Fan quietly appeared and looked up.

"Because I previously falsely proclaimed the will of Heaven, it angered the consciousness of the Heavenly Dao. The calamity of the Burning Sea of Red Flames in this life has not only advanced by three years, but the intensity of the Red Flames has also increased further."

He narrowed his eyes, looking at that scarlet figure that seemed to dance with the wind. It was still a blurred human form, but unlike the previous sight of aloof independence, holding a single flame. In this life, the Red Flame sat cross-legged on a cloud of fire, its eyes filled with killing intent, gazing down upon the sentient beings of the Dense Clouds. Entwined around its body was a creature resembling a swimming dragon, also staring down at the Sea of Dense Clouds like a hunter observing its prey.

Suddenly, as if sensing Li Fan's gaze, they both sharply turned their attention toward the direction where Li Fan was.

But Li Fan was enveloped by an array, so naturally, they could not discover him.

"It's a brand new form I haven't seen before. It seems that due to my gradual arrangements over the years, the Heavenly Dao of the Profound Yellow World has become uneasy and vigilant." Li Fan showed a smile in his eyes.

"But it's a pity. As long as I don't make a move, no one in this world can predict what I am plotting."

"Your resistance is all in vain." Li Fan did not stop the process of the Burning Sea of Red Flames; he simply observed from the sidelines. In this life, he had no intention of luring out Mo Sha. As the strongest among the spirit of Heaven and Earth, once Mo Sha appeared, it would inevitably attract the attention of the Longevity Heavenly Venerables of this world. Even though Li Fan no longer feared them now, the preparations for world destruction he was making were things that could not see the light of day. To avoid affecting his plan of inciting the tiger to swallow the wolf, maintaining a low profile for now was paramount.

The reason Li Fan came to the Sea of Dense Clouds today was to observe the specific changes that would occur during the self-purification process of the Profound Yellow World. Having thoroughly read Tian Yi's "Record of Mending the Heavens," Li Fan now had a completely new understanding of the occurrence of the Burning Sea of Red Flames.

The Sea of Dense Clouds originated from the Heavenly Law Realm and did not belong to the main body of the Profound Yellow World. During the process of mutual integration between the two realms, various "rejection" reactions were bound to occur, with the various bizarre phenomena frequently appearing across the Sea of Dense Clouds being representative. The seemingly world-destroying action of the Red Flames was actually to better facilitate the fusion of the Sea of Dense Clouds with the Profound Yellow World.

"The same event, when viewed from a human perspective versus the perspective of the Heavenly Dao, is seen completely differently. There is no right or wrong."

As the mutated Red Flames slowly accumulated power, a layer of sealing force began to appear around the entire border of the Sea of Dense Clouds, attempting to prevent sentient beings from escaping.

And in the final moment before this cage of heaven and earth was about to take full effect, Li Fan saw a group of people hurrying towards the shore on a boat from the sea. After finally reaching the shore, they hurriedly abandoned the boat and fled. The person leading them was actually someone Li Fan was acquainted with: Zhang Haobo!

In this life, Li Fan had no interaction with him. But relying on his own vague premonition and personal destiny, he managed to lead his friends and relatives to escape before the great calamity arrived.

"Haobo, didn't we have a good life on Liuli Island? Why did we have to leave our homes and come to this unfamiliar continent?"

"Yeah, Boss. Although I definitely trust you and will always follow you, I honestly don't fully understand."

...

Facing the doubts of those around him, Zhang Haobo's expression did not fluctuate much. He simply unfolded a map, identified their location, and methodically directed everyone to continue moving forward. As they walked, he said, "Haven't you noticed that a few people seem to be missing from the island recently? Ever since those Immortal Masters from the Myriad Immortals Alliance visited last time."

"It's not just our island; other islands, including the Immortal Masters themselves, are quietly withdrawing from the Sea of Dense Clouds."

"It's obvious that some major change is about to happen." Zhang Haobo analyzed calmly. "Instead of staying in the Sea of Dense Clouds to wait for death, it's better to come here and make a living."

The others, upon hearing this, still looked incredulous. Some even couldn't help but retort, "But isn't it said now that under the power of the Heavenly Venerables, everyone can be resurrected after death? Since we can resurrect, what is there to be afraid of?"

Zhang Haobo snorted coldly and offered no explanation.

"Those willing to follow me, keep following. Those who are not willing, the boat is still by the sea; you can return on your own at any time." He said coldly.

Hearing this, everyone immediately fell silent, daring not to say another word.

Chapter 1105: The Cycle of Birth and Death in Xuanhuang

Despite their doubts, they still greatly trusted Zhang Haobo, who had repeatedly led them through deadly perils amidst towering waves.

Not a single person chose to turn back; all obediently continued to follow, embarking on the unknown journey.

Observing this group slowly moving away in secret, Li Fan also fell into deep thought.

"Even among a group of mortals, there will be those like Zhang Haobo who sense something before a great calamity arrives."

"Let alone the countless cultivators in the Xuanhuang Realm."

"It seems I might have been overly optimistic. Although all the arrangements were sufficiently secretive, it cannot be guaranteed that no people of destiny will discover anomalies due to various coincidences."

"If one wishes to conceal something, the best method is to draw people's attention to something else."

Li Fan's eyes flickered, and an idea instantly formed in his mind.

However, for now, he would quietly watch the grand spectacle of Chi Yan burning the sea.

Not long after Zhang Haobo and the others departed.

Chi Yan, who had been sitting cross-legged, finally made its move.

The fire dragon entwined around its body revealed an excited gaze and instantly transformed into countless scarlet flames, furiously rushing towards every corner of the Sea of Dense Clouds.

The seawater heated up at an incredibly fast rate, and fear spread among the beings still remaining in the Sea of Dense Clouds.

Faced with a desperate situation, some cultivators rose up to fight back.

But how could those at the highest level of the Soul Transformation Realm contend with the enhanced Chi Yan?

Li Fan's attention was not on the rapidly perishing lives.

Instead, he silently observed the changes in the world itself.

"New birth from destruction."

"Revival from decay."

Chi Yan burning the sea lasted for three full months.

The ocean dried up, turning the land red for a thousand miles, and the vast sea transformed into a deep valley.

But Li Fan, who watched these scenes from beginning to end, faintly perceived a hidden vitality within them.

"This is the Cycle of Birth and Death in Xuanhuang."

"By comprehending this, I can now advance to the Soul Transformation Realm at any time. Moreover, just like with the Five Elements Great Cavern in the Nascent Soul Realm, once I advance, I will absolutely be the strongest among Soul Transformation cultivators."

"It's just a pity..."

"My ambition does not stop here."

Li Fan took a deep breath and forcibly suppressed the restless spiritual energy within his body.

"How can the birth and death changes in localized areas of the Xuanhuang Realm compare to the instinctive stress reaction of the entire world during an extinction-level crisis?"

Li Fan recalled the insights he had gained from studying the Heaven Mending Record over the years.

The world is like a person.

When facing a life-or-death crisis, people often unleash power beyond their limits.

The world is the same.

The moment an extinction crisis descends, the Heavenly Dao of the Xuanhuang Realm will undergo all sorts of profound and mysterious self-evolution in an instant to seek a sliver of survival.

The changes born at that time will far surpass those during normal, stable operation.

"If successful, my strength after advancing to Soul Transformation will be even higher than estimated."

"So..."

"No one can stop me!"

Li Fan's eyes were indifferent as he turned and left.

...

The Spirit Wood Realm.

Ou Daozi was carefully examining the remains before him.

"Incredible, incredible."

"Is this truly fabricated by Your Excellency? If you hadn't told me personally, I would almost believe this is the remains of an Immortal."

"After all, the feeling it gives me is almost exactly the same as when Shang Tian was present."

A corpse emitting a faint golden light lay flat in the air. In the illumination of the golden light, the face could not be clearly seen.

However, the sacred aura it emanated filled Ou Daozi with awe and greed.

After hearing Ou Daozi's conclusion, Li Fan nodded with satisfaction.

This forged immortal remains was the foundation upon which he would stir up trouble in the Xuanhuang Realm.

The corpse was purchased at great expense, being the remains of a Dao Conjoining cultivator from several thousand years ago, preserved remarkably well.

It was then meticulously treated with essence of golden primal force to imbue it with an aura of power surpassing the mortal realm.

Furthermore, to make the disguise more realistic.

Li Fan extracted some abilities from the strange treasures he had previously obtained from the fishing pond and placed them on the corpse.

For example, once a cultivator approached the remains, their various emotions would be infinitely amplified, causing them to almost lose rationality.

Moreover, when attacked, the remains would actively flee through the air.

When someone touched the remains, the pure, mutated spiritual energy hidden within would violently pour into their body, instantly boosting their cultivation.

...

All of this was done to make it as realistic as possible.

"Even the Longevity Heavenly Venerable will surely be interested in the legendary remains of a True Immortal."

"Then let's make the commotion bigger."

On this so-called True Immortal remains, besides these concrete benefits, Li Fan had secretly made some arrangements.

He guaranteed that the person who finally obtained it would receive a big surprise.

The concealment provided by the power of the Faceless True Immortal prevented cultivators skilled in deduction from tracing the origin of the remains.

After making the final finishing touches, two pitch-black puppets walked in and carried the "True Immortal remains" away.

To execute Li Fan's mission.

From appearance to disappearance, they were silent.

Even if Li Fan were not the one directing them, it would be difficult to detect their movements.

These two puppets were the fruits of the labor of Master Qiaogong of the Heavenly Secret Realm and the others over the past few years.

As expected of the most gifted group in the Heavenly Secret Realm, after relentless research, although they still hadn't fully grasped the nature of the power of gloom, they had no obstacles in achieving a certain level of application.

The pitch-black puppets perfectly embodied the characteristics of the power of gloom.

They could disappear and appear from the "cracks" of the world, just like gloom.

Divine sense could not lock onto or detect them.

They also had a strong suppressive effect on spiritual energy.

Attacks using ordinary means could hardly inflict damage upon them.

The only drawback was that the destructive power of the puppets was limited; they could only perform clandestine infiltration tasks.

Furthermore, the characteristic of gloom being separate from the Immortal Ruins meant that these puppets could not operate in the field for extended periods.

After a while, they had to return to the Nether World to replenish their power of gloom.

Regardless, Li Fan was quite satisfied with these pitch-black puppets.

Assigning tasks to them meant there would almost be no flaws exposed.

After sending Ou Daozi away, Li Fan came alone to a sealed space.

On the light screen, faces of young children constantly flashed.

Accompanying the images was a long list below, detailing their personalities.

"There are countless mortals in the small worlds, but finding someone with the innocent heart and absolute sincerity like Mr. Bai is still somewhat difficult."

"Especially since the power of the Rebirth Heavenly Venerable has already affected many small worlds."

"In the past few years, the number of newborns has noticeably decreased."

"There's no choice but to take a step back and aim for the next best thing."

"If innate attainment is not possible, then influence them through later education."

Chapter 1106: Mortals Go Mad for True Immortals

The collection of data on these children was naturally for the purpose of finding a successor to the Xuanhuang Great Heavenly Venerable.

Now that Li Fan knew all the answers to the trials, as long as he could find individuals whose temperament and personality roughly matched, the probability of successfully succeeding was quite high.

There was no need to be overly demanding about completing it in this lifetime. He could first select several suitable candidates, and in the next life, select them out for special training.

Just as Li Fan was conducting various tests on these children through the Illusory Dream Technique, the grand drama he had arranged to muddy the waters of the Xuanhuang Realm slowly began to unfold.

First, a rumor spread like wildfire.

Ou Shangtian, who had once caused a huge sensation, leading almost the entire Myriad Immortals Alliance to hunt him down, possessed two heaven-defying abilities: the [Kun Qian Bone Hand] and the [Book of Ten Thousand Deaths]. This was because, in his youth, he had come into contact with the remains of a True Immortal.

The [Kun Qian Bone Hand] could reverse the cosmos, allowing an item to revert to its state from a period in the past.

The [Book of Ten Thousand Deaths] could predict myriad ways of one's own death. When used properly, it could turn misfortune into fortune and ward off evil.

As for the name Ou Shangtian, the Alliance cultivators had almost forgotten it. However, mentioning these two terrifying abilities instantly stirred up memories among the cultivators. Back then, when Ou Shangtian’s cultivation was below Nascent Soul, he managed to hold out for nearly half a year against the pursuit of countless cultivators, proving the power of the [Kun Qian Bone Hand] and the [Book of Ten Thousand Deaths] through actual action.

And these two powerful extraordinary abilities were merely byproducts of the True Immortal remains? Then, if one could obtain the entirety of these so-called True Immortal remains, what kind of fortune would await?

The moment they heard this rumor, almost every cultivator’s mind conjured up the same thought. But the concept of a True Immortal was ethereal and illusory. Most people treated it as an old tale and didn't take it seriously.

However, strangely, as time passed, the rumor did not die down. Instead, it showed a tendency to intensify. Any discerning person could see that someone was fanning the flames from behind the scenes. Just as they were preparing to investigate the mastermind, something entirely unexpected happened.

One evening, a solitary, elegant white figure suddenly appeared above the Xuanhuang Heavenly Curtain. With his appearance, the entire Xuanhuang Realm subtly trembled for an instant. All cultivators who looked up at this figure felt an indescribable sensation surge through their hearts.

The figure only lasted for a few breaths before abruptly vanishing. But combined with the previous sensational rumors, four words instantly popped into the cultivators’ minds: "True Immortal Remains!" The extraordinary phenomenon that enveloped the entire heavenly curtain, and the slight tremor of the Xuanhuang Realm accompanying the white figure's appearance—these two things could not be faked!

"Even if it's not a True Immortal, it must be an extraordinary figure!"

While people were debating and speculating about the true identity of the white figure, in Tianling Prefecture, endless black mire suddenly surged out from deep within a remote mountain, threatening to swallow everything around it. The moment cultivators saw this black viscous substance, they knew it was the creation of the Heaven and Earth Spirit, the [Black Mire].

Faced with this impending disaster of extinction, the cultivators were not frightened but overjoyed; they advanced instead of fleeing. Most charged fearlessly toward the black mire. After all, under the power of the Heavenly Venerable, everyone could be resurrected upon death, so there was nothing to fear. Conversely, if one could happen to slay this Heaven and Earth Spirit, it would truly be a step toward ascending to the heavens! Although the Heaven and Earth Spirit with the power of the Dao Integration stage was strong, a swarm of ants could indeed kill an elephant! A considerable number of cultivators held this notion. Under their fierce struggle, the outward expansion of the black mire was actually contained.

Just as the cultivators were overjoyed, thinking the black mire had weakened, a figure shimmering with brilliant golden light suddenly flew out from the black swamp. Before anyone could react, it sliced through the sky and disappeared without a trace. After the golden figure departed, the agitated black mire inexplicably retreated deep underground.

“That was…”

“True Immortal Remains?”

From the stunned crowd, someone suddenly shouted in a trembling voice.

Boom!

After a moment of silence, the crowd erupted into an uproar. Because from that fleeting glimpse, the figure was indeed extremely similar to the one that had appeared on the heavenly curtain not long ago! Moreover, it could suppress the Dao Integration-level black mire merely by its aura...

After a brief pause, the cultivators present reacted and rushed toward the direction where the golden light had vanished. Only a few cultivators, after hesitating for a moment, still launched an attack toward the black mire that had retreated into the depths of the mountain. However, it was regrettable that the returning black mire was much more ferocious and tyrannical than before, seemingly even having a significant increase in strength. All these cultivators perished without exception.

But even facing total annihilation, the cultivators’ greed could not be stopped. After all, everyone could be revived! Thus, cultivators who heard the news rushed to their deaths incessantly…

The appearance of the black mire and the True Immortal Remains quickly spread throughout the entire Myriad Immortals Alliance. The fact that it could cause the violent agitation of a Heaven and Earth Spirit meant that the golden figure gradually attracted the attention of more and more cultivators. Subsequently, wherever the True Immortal Remains went, without exception, Heaven and Earth Spirits inexplicably appeared, seemingly attempting to suppress the remains.

They never knew that the Xuanhuang Realm hid so many Heaven and Earth Spirits. At one time, the cultivators were stunned by this grand spectacle. News of a new Heaven and Earth Spirit emerging could be heard almost every few days. And those cultivators in the Myriad Immortals Alliance who had long been stuck at the Nascent Soul stage all fell into a frenzy. They could no longer sit still and went to hunt the Heaven and Earth Spirits they desired.

More cultivators, however, kept their focus fixed on the True Immortal Remains. The desire of cultivators for the True Immortal Remains reached its peak after a certain event occurred.

A mortal named Zhang Haobo, after having the good fortune to touch the True Immortal Remains that suddenly descended before him, instantly leaped from being a mere mortal to the peak of Golden Core! The marvelous item that allowed him to lay his foundation was surprisingly a bone-like artifact! It was a pity that the True Immortal Remains only stayed by his side for a moment before suddenly disappearing and fleeing again. Otherwise, if Zhang Haobo had advanced to the Deity Transformation stage in an instant, it might not have been impossible!

After investigating Zhang Haobo’s background, the cultivators ruled out the possibility that he was faking the event. After all, the nearly one hundred mortals who were beside him and witnessed the miracle firsthand—none of their memories had any issues!

“The True Immortal Remains should be searching for a fated person.”

“That Ou Shangtian was like this, and so is this Zhang Haobo! But their fortune was insufficient, and they were not ultimately chosen by the True Immortal Remains.”

“However, if one could ultimately obtain it…”

Chapter 1107: A Scheme to Throw Heaven and Earth into Chaos

The True Immortal held an excessively fatal attraction for cultivators.

Since the Immortal Path was severed, achieving immortality had become an unattainable dream for cultivators.

But now, the remains of a True Immortal had suddenly appeared.

Moreover, various signs indicated that these True Immortal Remains were very likely real!

At this point, regardless of any lingering doubts, the choice made by the cultivators was to first secure these remains.

Even if they were not the remains of a True Immortal, judging by the extraordinary phenomena they caused, the benefits gained would not be small!

Thus, the cultivators of the Myriad Immortals Alliance left the Sky City where they resided, searching everywhere for traces of the True Immortal Remains.

Many cultivators from the Five Elders Association, who were shopping in Jiushan Prefecture, also traveled thousands of miles to join the excitement.

With the establishment and development of the Jiushan Free Trade Zone, the Myriad Immortals Alliance and the Five Elders Association had maintained peace for a long time.

The relationship between the two sides had further eased. As long as an application was made, cultivators from both sides could visit the other for tourism.

It seemed they intended to prove through this method that their side was more suitable for the survival of cultivators.

However, there was no news of anyone actually changing their allegiance.

The exchange between the two sides remained at the most superficial level.

The cultivators of the Myriad Immortals Alliance were still largely wary of these members of the Five Elders Association.

While searching for the True Immortal Remains in groups, they deliberately kept their distance as a precaution.

“Do you think these True Immortal Remains are a trick by the Five Elders Association, intentionally trying to sow chaos among us? We've all been focused on business, and our vigilance towards the Five Elders Association has waned year by year. Alas, this is not a good thing.”

“Indeed, it’s entirely possible they might suddenly attack again one day! The Five Elders Association is not something good!”

“What are you thinking? Are the spontaneously appearing Heaven and Earth Essences also the work of the Five Elders Association? This is on our Myriad Immortals Alliance's territory. We ourselves don't even know about the existence of these Heaven and Earth Essences. If the Five Elders Association could know about them so clearly, then we should just surrender early!”

...

The occasional appearance of cultivators from the Five Elders Association did not stop the Myriad Immortals Alliance from pursuing the True Immortal Remains.

With the emergence of a second fortunate individual, their desire grew even stronger.

The second cultivator fortunate enough to have close contact with the True Immortal Remains was named Xue Mu.

He was a Foundation Establishment formation master.

In truth, he never truly touched the True Immortal Remains; he was only blocked by the golden light circling around them.

But the moment the golden light entered his body, countless incredible and bizarre formations instantly appeared in Xue Mu’s mind.

The sheer volume of data almost burst his sea of consciousness.

At the brink of life and death, Xue Mu subconsciously released his hand. The True Immortal Remains then fled again.

However, Xue Mu, having missed a massive opportunity, was not regretful. Instead, after being stunned for a long time, his face broke into ecstatic joy, and he laughed loudly toward the sky.

Later, people learned that in that seemingly brief instant, he had obtained at least a hundred formations from the True Immortal Remains.

Moreover, what was more important was that the level of these formations generally surpassed the current level of formations in the Xuanhuang Realm by several tiers.

It was likely that even the strongest formation currently held by the Myriad Immortals Alliance was far inferior to any single one in his mind!

Although his strength did not increase, for the formation master Xue Mu, this harvest was far more significant than raising his cultivation by several major realms!

Soon, Xue Mu was taken away by people sent from the headquarters of the Myriad Immortals Alliance’s Formation Hall.

Not long after, internal news confirmed the advanced nature of the formations he had acquired in his sea of consciousness.

Besides true Immortals, what other existence could possess such ability? This undoubtedly cemented the rumors about the True Immortal Remains.

After the news spread, some within the Myriad Immortals Alliance could finally no longer sit still.

In the Spirit Wood Realm, Li Fan connected the communication with the Emissary Zhou.

“The matter of the True Immortal Remains has caused quite a stir recently. What is Daoist Friend’s view on this?”

Li Fan soon replied, decisively: “It is baseless, purely a rumor! Daoist Friend Zhou must not believe it!”

“Are you so certain?” This time it was Emissary Zhou who became suspicious.

Li Fan sneered: “The Immortal Path has been severed for so many years, and none of our colleagues from the various realms have ever seen the remains of a True Immortal.”

“Xuanhuang Realm...”

“It’s the same there. How could it be such a coincidence that one suddenly appeared without any warning? And the news spread to everyone instantly. I suspect someone is secretly pulling the strings behind this!” Li Fan said with conviction.

“But the Heaven and Earth Essences that appeared are indeed genuine. Two people in the Immortal Alliance have even successfully advanced to the Dao Union realm because of them. I truly cannot imagine what force in the Xuanhuang Realm could casually offer so many Dao Union resources as bait?” Emissary Zhou did not believe Li Fan’s words and instead retorted.

Li Fan seemed to be stumped by this.

After a long silence, he sighed: “The more it is like this, the more it shows the other party has a grand design! Your Myriad Immortals Alliance has reaped immense rewards, while we are living in fear.”

Hearing this, Emissary Zhou suddenly asked: “It really wasn't your doing?”

“What kind of talk is that! Our Myriad Realms Federation has been dormant for many years, how could we suddenly cause such a commotion?” Li Fan’s tone showed some displeasure.

“In my opinion, it might actually be the enemies of your Myriad Immortals Alliance. After ruling the Xuanhuang Realm for thousands of years, don't you have any mortal enemies?”

“Huh?!” Li Fan’s words seemed to trigger a realization.

Emissary Zhou was momentarily stunned, and after a brief silence, she hurriedly disconnected the communication.

At this moment, an enigmatic expression appeared on Li Fan’s face.

Without needing further explanation, all this turmoil was naturally the result of Li Fan’s actions.

Utilizing the dark power of the pitch-black puppets, the True Immortal Remains were able to move back and forth between various locations, appearing and disappearing unpredictably, evading the pursuit of countless cultivators.

And by secretly manipulating the Heavenly Dao Edicts, Li Fan directed the Heaven and Earth Essences to reveal themselves one after another, making the entire spectacle even more realistic.

As for the two beneficiaries of this incident, Zhang Haobo and Xue Mu, although they had no connection to him in this life, they were acquaintances from past reincarnations.

Li Fan didn't mind lending a hand as a favor.

However, as he spread false divine decrees everywhere, the tolerance and vigilance of the Xuanhuang Realm were nearing their limit.

He would probably have to lie low for a while next.

“The stage is set; I'm not afraid they won't enter the game. Such a chaotic situation should conceal my true intentions,” Li Fan chuckled deeply.

“However, Emissary Zhou’s final reaction was a bit strange. Did she recall something?”

“Could it be that the Myriad Immortals Alliance truly has an adversary willing to use several Dao Union advancement resources as bait?”

Li Fan frowned as he considered this.

The Xuanhuang Realm, even after thousands of years of

attraction and consumption, had become far larger than other normal cultivation realms.

However, Li Fan could not conceive where a power that could make the Myriad Immortals Alliance

extremely wary would be hidden.

At that time, the Heavenly Mystic Mirror had been sublimated and transformed, thoroughly

sweeping across the entire Xuanhuang Realm.

Not only were the information of almost all subordinate grotto-heavens and small worlds basically

investigated, but even the world rifts deep within the white fog had been explored to a

great extent.

"Unless it's another special hidden area like the Nether Realm."

"It can only be said that it is worthy of being the last surviving gathering place of the cultivators of the Uttermost Dark Star Sea; you never know when a strong individual might suddenly appear."

"However, since it did not survive the Cataclysm of the Xuanhuang Realm, even if it's strong, its strength is limited."

After a period of analysis, Li Fan's heart settled a bit.

"Speaking of which, the history of the Myriad Immortals Alliance's sudden rise from the wasteland of cultivation is indeed a bit peculiar when I think about it now."

After the great catastrophe of the Xuanhuang Realm, cultivators fell into a dark age of mutual suspicion and slaughter.

Eventually, civilization shattered, and there were no longer any groups in the world. Only solitary cultivators, wary and full of killing intent like wild beasts, remained. These were the so-called wastelands of cultivation.

All records that could be accessed now had a consistent narrative regarding what happened in the Xuanhuang Realm afterward.

The long-lost Dharma Revelation Heavenly Venerable returned and re-established civilization on the ruined land.

So, the question arises.

Whether it was from the [Era] illusion experienced in the Divine Treasure Museum, or from the historical fragments unearthed from the blood-colored river by [Seeking the Profound] in the Spirit Wood Realm, the cultivators living during that period could be described with the four words "fierce, brutal."

Having survived the battle royale, their state of mind, methods, and strength were naturally beyond question.

Facing a suddenly appearing Dharma Revelation who claimed to unify the Xuanhuang Realm, how would such a group react?

And where were those people now? Neither the Myriad Immortals Alliance nor the Five Elders Council seemed to have any trace of them.

"I remember that the Myriad Dharma Chamber of Commerce in Nine Mountains State was passed down from that period. Unfortunately, it has now been razed to the ground; otherwise, perhaps I could have inquired about some information."

Li Fan made a mental note to deal with this matter in the next life and shifted his attention back to the "True Immortal Remains."

After receiving Li Fan's reminder, the Myriad Immortals Alliance indeed became much more vigilant.

They directly chose to collectively capture the revealed Heaven and Earth Essences.

As for their final allocation, it had already been discussed and agreed upon in advance, with the aim of quickly absorbing these "decoys" without injury and converting them into their own combat power.

With the official intervention of the Myriad Immortals Alliance, the various disturbances caused by the appearance of the Heaven and Earth Essences quickly subsided.

However, the Myriad Immortals Alliance's attitude toward the True Immortal Remains was very cautious.

They pursued it, but they did not allow cultivators to kill each other over it. The final victor would depend on individual fortune.

At the same time, to quickly quell this disturbance, many Dharma Revelation cultivators, who had always stayed out of worldly affairs, unprecedentedly made their move. It seemed that after the Mo Rubin incident, their style of action had also changed accordingly.

After the Myriad Immortals Alliance entered the game, Li Fan clearly felt that it had become much more strenuous to control the dark puppets and lead the dog.

The Myriad Immortals Alliance had a strong control over the territory within their domain.

The True Immortal Remains would be discovered shortly after the puppet appeared, forcing them to relocate again.

As the frequency of relocation increased, the drawback of the dark puppets being unable to fight for extended periods became apparent.

Fortunately, Li Fan ordered Qiao Gong and others to rush the creation of more puppets and use them in rotation, which barely maintained the elusive nature of the True Immortal Remains.
