However, Li Fan also vaguely sensed that the Myriad Immortals Alliance seemed to have become aware that the "True Immortal Remains" were being transferred through dark energy. The time required for tracking was becoming progressively shorter.

"It seems this play won't last much longer."

"But it doesn't matter, my goal has been achieved. I will wait for the final curtain call to give everyone in the Xuanhuang Realm a surprise."

Scanning the specific situation of his various arrangements, Li Fan revealed a benevolent smile.

"Little friend, why must you do this?"

Three figures suddenly floated out, circling Li Fan.

They had distressed expressions and sallow complexions.

They all stared at Li Fan, not speaking, only sighing.

These were the paper figures that had awakened from the Book of Crossing Tribulations.

Ever since Li Fan began his preparations for the Cataclysm, even though all arrangements were carried out through clones and puppets, these paper figures from the Tribulation Crossing Sect had sensed the crisis through some unknown method.

From the initial one, two more paper figures had consecutively awakened.

Furthermore, they could vaguely sense Li Fan's thoughts of destruction in his mind. Whenever Li Fan rehearsed or deduced future scenarios, these fellows would pester him incessantly to persuade him.

Li Fan naturally ignored them, maintaining a cold demeanor.

After failing to persuade him, the three paper figures from the Tribulation Crossing Sect simply gave up. They just clung to Li Fan with distressed faces.

At first, Li Fan thought they were just fuming in helplessness. But later, he discovered that when surrounded by these miserable-looking paper figures, he himself would be infected by their emotions.

No matter what he had been thinking before, how passionate he was, or what extreme ideas he held, they would eventually all turn into extreme negativity and emptiness.

If Li Fan had not been protected by the [Xuanhuang Immortal Heart Spell], he would have almost been influenced and changed by them.

The paper figures from the Tribulation Crossing Sect could only sense the general situation. As for the specific measures Li Fan had been taking during this period, they did not have the ability to know them remotely.

Li Fan did not reveal that he was completely unaffected.

Instead, he cooperated with them and acted out a scene.

The gloomy expression on his face slowly disappeared, replaced by a sense of emptiness where nothing seemed worth the effort.

His mind also gradually emptied everything, no longer thinking about preparations related to the Cataclysm.

The figures of the three paper figures from the Tribulation Crossing Sect also changed. They did not directly return to the Book of Crossing Tribulations but became like stern old scholars.

Sitting upright, they began to tell Li Fan about the various catastrophes that the Xuanhuang Realm had experienced in the past.

Their names were also very interesting.

They were all named after catastrophes that had appeared in history.

For instance, one of them was named [Starfall].

This referred to a strange star that had fallen to the Xuanhuang Realm from the starry sky before the immortal path was severed.

The energy emanating from the strange star had temporarily caused the spiritual power of all cultivators in the Xuanhuang Realm to be greatly affected, with their strength significantly declining regardless of their cultivation level.

A Golden Core cultivator stumbled and broke his leg.

An Nascent Soul cultivator, flying mid-air, lost control of his spiritual energy and died on the spot.

A Soul Transformation cultivator, due to intensely fierce combat with another, suffered a sudden heart attack and perished…

These were peculiar instances that occurred during that time.

Later, this minor catastrophe eventually dissipated as the peculiar energy surrounding that strange star gradually vanished on its own.

In this current era, it had long been forgotten and no longer existed in any historical records.

Only the Tribulation Crossing Sect, through their unique cultivation methods, had recorded it.

"A power that could affect the entirety of the Xuanhuang cultivation world is undoubtedly on the level of Immortals. It's a pity that the strange star was merely a passing traveler for the Xuanhuang Realm. It never reappeared after that."

Li Fan couldn't help but feel a touch of regret.

Otherwise, imagining cultivators he knew having to live like mortals was quite an interesting thought.

The paper figures of the Tribulation Crossing Sect were not telling Li Fan about the past calamities of the Xuanhuang Realm out of idleness.

They clearly had another purpose.

As scenes of cruel calamities after calamities appeared in Li Fan's mind, these tribulations eventually faded, and the tormented Xuanhuang Realm finally regained new life.

He couldn't help but feel a sense of relief, a "survivor's guilt" that they had made it through.

Towards the current peaceful and stable state of the Xuanhuang Realm, he couldn't help but have a newfound appreciation and a sense of cherish for this hard-won peace.

Of course, the effects of this brainwashing all quickly faded with the circulation of the Xuanhuang Immortal Heart Mantra.

But Li Fan was still acting his part with great earnestness, displaying just the right expressions on his face.

Finally, seeing their methods taking effect, the three paper figures honestly returned to the Book of Crossing Tribulations.

"The tricks of the Tribulation Crossing Sect often involve manipulating people's hearts. The malevolence of this sect is evident."

"It's a pity they encountered me. Hmph…"

Ever since Li Fan had liberated the Book of Crossing Tribulations from the forbidden formation that transmitted knowledge, they had implicitly latched onto him.

Like lingering ghosts, following him around.

Although with Li Fan's current mastery of formations, he could completely re-seal them by force.

However, Li Fan did not do so.

Because being pestered by these paper figures from the Tribulation Crossing Sect was not without its benefits.

Li Fan narrowed his eyes and gazed into the distance at the Xuanhuang Realm.

He could vaguely see countless scattered specks of paper figures throughout the Xuanhuang Realm.

When his consciousness focused on one of them, that paper figure inexplicably opened its eyes.

Li Fan, through the paper figure's eyes, was able to see the scene it was observing.

However, it was as if there was a layer of frosted glass, not very clear. The sounds were also intermittent.

This connection was forcibly broken after not long.

"It seems my authority is still not quite enough," Li Fan sneered inwardly.

The benefit of accepting the brainwashing from the Tribulation Crossing Sect paper figures was the gradual acquisition of control over the [All-Seeing Divine Eye].

It seemed that the process of accepting the ideals of the Tribulation Crossing Sect was also the process of joining and becoming a part of it.

But it was clear that Li Fan only intended to enjoy the benefits and not join this Tribulation Crossing Sect.

"Only when one's strength is sufficient can no disaster harm them in the slightest."

"What kind of skill is it to cower like a turtle?"

"What's the use of constantly evading? When the Immortal of the Immortal Ruins destroyed the world with a single glance, they still disappeared without even a struggle."

Knowing how the Tribulation Crossing Sect would act when a true catastrophe arrived, Li Fan was thoroughly contemptuous of their philosophy.

However, he did not underestimate them.

Instead, he acted with great seriousness to deceive them.

Just as Li Fan was dealing with the Tribulation Crossing Sect, the grand play of the True Immortal's remains was about to reach its climax. The Myriad Immortal Alliance, which had been tracking the remains for a long time, had finally deciphered the pattern and method of its appearance. This time, they dispatched a full ten Unity Realm cultivators to intercept it, determined to capture this so-called True Immortal's remains that had caused such a stir. This operation even had the assistance of three Dharma Transmitters. Faced with such a massive force, the dark puppet clearly struggled to cope. Finally, under Li Fan's command, its body dissolved, channeling all of its remaining dark power into the True Immortal's remains. Thus, with its power replenished, the True Immortal's remains, under the watchful eyes of all and within the encirclement of the Myriad Immortal Alliance, disappeared once more! However, this time, it did not escape far. The Myriad Immortal Alliance cultivators who were tracking it soon discovered its traces. Unlike its previous elusiveness, it was now fleeing using normal cultivator's flight methods. "It seems he's finally done playing this game of hide-and-seek!" a Unity Realm cultivator exclaimed, a hint of anger in his tone. Anyone who had been led around by a set of remains for so long was bound to feel frustrated. "Chase quickly! Be careful, don't be careless!" "Hmm, look at the direction he's flying…" "Not good, he's about to enter the Devouring Yuan White Mist!" "No matter, I have the Universal Sage True Boat with me. Continue the pursuit!" a Dharma Transmitter named Wei, who was leading the team, said coldly. He released a flying ship, and the Unity Realm cultivators boarded it before tightly pursuing the True Immortal's remains. Some of them had clearly entered the white mist before. There were no ripples of emotion in their eyes; they calmly locked onto the position of the True Immortal's remains ahead. "This is a bit strange. He was always active outside before, why would he suddenly lead us into the white mist?" "Could it be a trap?" They exchanged glances. However, with their combined strength, they could retreat safely even if they encountered a Longevity Realm cultivator. Thus, they didn't have too many qualms. Without much hesitation, they quickly reached a consensus to continue the pursuit and see what trick this True Immortal's remains was up to. Inside the white mist, time flowed by unnoticed. The unusual aura exuded by the True Immortal's remains was also quite obvious, as if it were afraid the Myriad Immortal Alliance behind it would lose track. As it flew, it would even proactively slow down, maintaining a fixed distance between them. Moreover, the True Immortal's remains seemed to be very familiar with this white mist, changing direction from time to time. It clearly had a definite destination. This bizarre scene caused the expressions of the Myriad Immortal Alliance cultivators inside the Universal Sage True Boat to become grim. Dharma Transmitter Wei, after pondering for a moment, ultimately decided to continue following behind and investigate. After all, as a Dharma Transmitter, he would not perish. And even if this True Immortal's remains had some scheme, if it could be uncovered at the cost of one life, it would be well worth it. As for the Unity Realm cultivators beside him… Dharma Transmitter Wei's heart remained unfazed. The True Immortal's remains and the Universal Sage True Boat flew side-by-side through the white mist. After an unknown period, the scene before them suddenly changed. Upon seeing what lay ahead, the cultivators on the ship, including the few Dharma Transmitters, all showed expressions of horror and their minds were deeply shaken. An endless ocean, dotted with countless corpses.

These corpses were all encased in pale blue transparent ice crystals.

Through the ice crystals, one could faintly see the final expressions on the faces of these corpses when they were alive.

Anger, fear, confusion…

Lifelike, as if they were still alive.

Dense ice crystal coffins filled the entire field of vision, covering the entire black ocean.

Let alone the few Unity Realm cultivators, even the three Dharma Transmitters leading the group felt a chill run down their spines and were rendered speechless after witnessing the scene before them.

Stunned by this scene, by the time they recovered, the remains of the True Immortal that had lured them here had already vanished without a trace!

"What… what kind of hellish place is this?!"

After a deathly silence, one of the Unity Realm cultivators in the group, named Zhu Gongchuan, couldn't help but ask.

Fearing of disturbing the slumbering cultivators here, Zhu Gongchuan's voice was very soft. And one could faintly detect the fear deep within his heart.

He wasn't unfamiliar with seeing dead people.

But such a large number of corpses, all gathered in one place, still preserving their lifelike expressions…

The shock brought by this scene was far beyond what words could describe.

No one answered Zhu Gongchuan's question.

The group quietly flew over the sea of death for a full half-day, still without finding an end.

"Preliminary estimates suggest there are over two billion corpses here… I'm afraid the total number of cultivators and mortals currently living in the Outer Regions of the Myriad Immortal Alliance is far less than that. Exactly…"

"These people are not from the Profound Yellow Realm. Or rather, the vast majority are not from the Profound Yellow Realm," Dharma Transmitter Wei said slowly.

"Judging by their clothing styles, these people should all be from different cultivation realms. For some unknown reason, they have all been frozen here."

"So many corpses, hidden within our Myriad Immortal Alliance territory. And yet, for such a long time, we have been completely unaware of this." Another Dharma Transmitter, Chu, also looked extremely displeased.

"What is the purpose of the True Immortal's remains luring us here? Could it be that it wants to turn us into this as well?"

"No. We've been here for such a long time, and we haven't been attacked."

…

The group discussed in hushed tones, but had no clue as to the ultimate purpose of the True Immortal's remains.

"Let's search a bit longer."

So they flew over the sea of death for a long time.

Finally, Dharma Transmitter Wei discovered a clue: "These countless frozen corpses seem to form a massive formation."

"A formation?"

Everyone looked at each other at the words, then carefully looked around again.

"Such a large-scale formation must have world-destroying power. Could it be that the Five Elder Council secretly set this up over the years to destroy our Myriad Immortal Alliance?"

Not everyone present was proficient in formations. After failing to figure it out, they couldn't help but let their minds wander.

"This formation is extremely complex. We've only glimpsed a corner and haven't seen the whole picture, so we can't deduce its true purpose. The priority now is to notify the headquarters of the Immortal Alliance of our discovery. Staying here for too long makes me feel uneasy," Dharma Transmitter Chu said in a deep voice.

"Fortunately, this formation is not targeting us outsiders. It's neither an entrapment nor a killing formation. As long as we find the formation's core, we should be able to leave," Dharma Transmitter Wei also concluded.

With the two Dharma Transmitters reaching a conclusion, everyone secretly breathed a sigh of relief.

After circling within the formation for several days, the group finally found the formation's core. Passing through the core, they thought they would leave this bizarre region, but to their surprise, they did not return to the white mist.

Instead, they appeared over another strange ocean.

Unlike the dead, frozen black sea before, here the salty sea breeze was refreshing, and the calls of birds could be heard constantly.

Fish could be seen leaping out of the water or swimming in the sea.

It was full of vitality and refreshing. After a brief moment of astonishment, they quickly scanned their surroundings and found no danger.

The Unity Realm cultivators felt a little reassured.

But the three leading Dharma Transmitters had unprecedentedly solemn expressions.

Dharma Transmitter Wei frowned, gazing at the sky, and muttered to himself, "Different worlds, two sides of the same coin."

"One is life, the other is death."

Dharma Transmitter Chu interrupted him: "No, death is the source of life, and life is the gathering of death. This is…"

The two looked at each other with expressions of horror.

"Reversing life and death?"

Both of them, with great tacit understanding, did not speak these four words aloud.

Instead, they communicated via telepathic transmission.

"So, this is the dojo of that Rebirth Heavenly Venerate?"

"I was wondering why He was able to reverse the principles of heaven and earth and achieve Heavenly Venerate status so quickly. It turns out He had long been hidden in this white mist, using the formation as a foundation to study the principles of life and death with extreme clarity!"

"What is the relationship between those True Immortal remains and Rebirth Heavenly Venerate?"

The mystery was solved, and new doubts arose in their hearts.

"Judging from the current situation, they shouldn't be working together."

"We discovered the location of this dojo long ago, so we deliberately lured us here to probe the background of Rebirth Heavenly Venerate?"

The two fell into deep thought.

After a long period of contemplation, they did not arrive at a definitive conclusion.

"If we find the formation's core of the living world, we should be able to leave from here." Unable to find an answer, and having searched this dojo without finding any information related to the true identity of Rebirth Heavenly Venerate, the three Dharma Transmitters decided to return for now and plan long-term.

However, just as they were preparing to leave, Dharma Transmitter Wei's body paused slightly, as if he had thought of something.

"Reversing life and death, reversing life and death…"

"The great formation is complete, but those who have already died have not awakened. What has truly revived is the [world]?"

"So, Rebirth Heavenly Venerate's true purpose is…"

Dharma Transmitter Wei looked as if he had been struck by lightning, his face turning ashen.

"Go!" he commanded decisively.

However, it seemed as if his thoughts had been sensed.

A figure, seemingly made of white mist, quietly appeared and blocked their path.

Facing this sudden appearance of an enemy, and the high possibility that it was the elusive Rebirth Heavenly Venerate, everyone became extremely tense.

Battle was about to erupt.

Dharma Transmitter Wei stared at the figure before him for a moment, and after a while, disbelief flashed in his eyes.

"It's…"

Before he could finish speaking, the white mist figure suddenly opened its eyes.

Endless white mist surged from its body, covering the sky and overwhelming everything.

In an instant, it swallowed the entire Myriad Immortal Alliance group.

Ten Unity Realm cultivators, three Dharma Transmitters.

Such a massive force, at this moment, had no power to resist, and in the blink of an eye, they all disappeared into the white mist.

CHAPTER 1111: Stealthily Setting a Trap

In the Profound Yellow Realm, at the Myriad Immortal Alliance.

All the floating immortal cities simultaneously sounded urgent bells.

The cultivators of the Immortal Alliance stopped their actions and froze in place.

After a moment of stunned silence, they finally recalled the meaning of the bell.

This was the Myriad Immortal Alliance's highest level of alert.

It was only activated when the Immortal Alliance faced a crisis of survival.

After a brief silence, a clamor erupted.

People were panicked and at a loss.

Li Fan, who was in the Spirit Wood Realm, also heard the bell immediately.

At first, he thought his world-ending plans had been discovered.

However, Li Fan quickly realized that the sudden ringing of the bells was likely related to the events occurring within the Life and Death Array.

When the recorded images from the True Immortal's remains subarray were transmitted, they confirmed his suspicion.

The footage finally stopped as Dharma Transmitter Wei and his group disappeared into the white mist.

Subsequently, the recording array was also destroyed by the surging, boundless white mist.

Li Fan repeatedly reviewed the footage, a hint of solemnity flashing in his eyes. "The Myriad Immortal Alliance is reacting so strongly, has..."

"Have those three Dharma Transmitters died?"

Li Fan's heart was filled with surprise and uncertainty.

He knew that each Dharma Transmitter had the protection of a Dharma Heavenly Venerate.

As long as this protective power remained, they were virtually invincible in the Profound Yellow Realm.

Although they were restricted and unable to ascend to the Longevity Realm because of it, they were almost equivalent to Longevity Realm cultivators.

Yet, they were so easily defeated by the newly ascended Longevity Heavenly Venerate, Rebirth Heavenly Venerate.

"To be able to instantly kill a Dharma Transmitter?"

"If these three Dharma Transmitters have truly died like this, then Rebirth's strength is..."

Li Fan's eyes narrowed slightly.

A trace of doubt then flashed through his mind.

"If they are truly so powerful, then what reason could there be for them to kill three Dharma Transmitters?"

"They clearly just stumbled upon it, with no malicious intent or disrespect shown."

Li Fan slowly reviewed the recorded footage of the array once more.

He finally discovered something amiss.

"It seems that at the moment before they departed, Rebirth had no intention of appearing."

"However, Dharma Transmitter Wei seemed to have discovered something, which led to Rebirth's appearance."

"So, it was a silencing?"

Li Fan's expression became peculiar.

Killing to silence seemed beneath a Rebirth Heavenly Venerate.

Yet, it was precisely what had happened.

There was only one explanation: if what Dharma Transmitter Wei had discovered was leaked, it would have an incalculable impact on them.

To avoid any variables, Rebirth had chosen to eliminate them.

"Dharma Transmitter Wei, before his death, should have been contemplating reversing the Life and Death Array."

Following this line of thought, Li Fan projected himself into the scenario. With his current understanding of array formations, he quickly grasped the core of the matter.

"Just as I suspected, the ultimate goal of reversing life and death is not to reverse the life and death of cultivators."

"The resurrection of cultivators is merely a consequence of the changes in the world's principles during this process."

"This Heavenly Venerate's true objective in reversing life and death is the [World]."

A brilliant light erupted in Li Fan's eyes.

"To cover up this objective, they must eliminate the Myriad Immortal Alliance group."

"This indicates that the target they wish to resurrect is not the [Profound Yellow Realm]. Instead, it is one of the many immortal cultivation worlds that have been devoured by the Profound Yellow Realm over the years."

"Interesting. Is this a longing for their homeland?"

After reorganizing the sequence of events, Li Fan nodded slightly. "No wonder this person has been acting discreetly all these years, never revealing themselves to the public. This move can be considered as a return from the dead. Once successful, their homeland world might indeed be revived."

"However, the fate of the Profound Yellow Realm itself is uncertain."

"If this is leaked, it will undoubtedly face fierce resistance from the native cultivators of the Profound Yellow Realm."

"So, like me, they are doing something clandestine."

A smile curved Li Fan's lips.

"But all plans are destined to fall through."

The smile instantly vanished.

Li Fan's attention returned to the True Immortal's remains.

By this time, it had returned to the Profound Yellow Realm.

As the direct instigator of the fall of the three Dharma Transmitters, it was immediately pursued by the Myriad Immortal Alliance upon its appearance.

This time, the Myriad Immortal Alliance was truly serious.

After all, during the previous incident of Mo Ru Bin's possession, no Dharma Transmitters had perished.

With three falling at once, the shock to the Dharma Transmitter Council was immense.

Over a dozen Dharma Transmitters appeared, locking onto the True Immortal's remains at the center.

And within the crowd, Li Fan even spotted the director of the Divine Treasury Museum, the beast-type Emperor Sanshou.

Compared to his appearance in the Immortal Extermination Realm, he appeared even more aged.

However, he didn't seem particularly concerned about the Myriad Immortal Alliance's pursuit.

His expression was blank, his eyes lightly closed.

Clearly, his attendance this time was merely a formality.

Besides them, Li Fan finally saw the lineage of the Mirror Holders.

They were all clad in dark green Daoist robes, with mirror-like markings etched on their foreheads.

The three true powers controlling the Myriad Immortal Alliance had converged here, indicating the significant impact of the three Dharma Transmitters' demise.

Under the influence of these powers, Li Fan felt his control over the True Immortal's remains weakening.

Just as he was preparing to detonate the remains, and open a passage between the Profound Yellow Realm and the Netherworld, creating a Nether Sea tide, something unexpected happened.

The core of the Myriad Immortal Alliance, which had been poised for action, seemed to have suddenly received some news.

First, there was confusion and disbelief.

Then, very quickly and without hesitation, they acted in unison.

Their figures blurred, and they completely ignored the perpetrator, preparing to leave the area!

Li Fan even saw Emperor Sanshou, who had previously kept his eyes closed, suddenly open them, as if something had arrived and captured his attention.

Li Fan, miles away in the Spirit Wood Realm, suddenly felt a sense of foreboding.

Years of experience led him to make a swift decision.

He severed his connection with the True Immortal's remains and detonated it.

The moment the body of the True Immortal's remains shattered, a figure of white mist quietly appeared beside it.

Its appearance was completely unexpected and incredibly swift.

But ultimately, it was a step too late.

Boundless darkness surged from the cracks of the True Immortal's remains.

It collided with the white mist that emerged from the white mist figure's body.

The Nether Dark tide that Li Fan had expected did not arrive.

The white mist acted like waterproof sandbags, or like an unyielding dam by the sea.

It firmly blocked the Nether Dark tide, which was capable of causing a catastrophe.

...

In the Spirit Wood Realm, a cold expression flashed across Li Fan's face.

"What does this mean?"

"Have the two sides cooperated?"

"To find me, they are willing to disregard the demise of even Dharma Transmitters?"

After a brief moment of confusion, a strong sense of crisis arose.

"What could cause the people of the Myriad Immortal Alliance to react so quickly and uniformly? In this world, there is only..."

"The Dharma Transmitter!"

Li Fan's thoughts raced.

"It's understandable that the fall of a Dharma Transmitter would alert the Dharma Transmitter.

"But why would it choose to cooperate with Reincarnation?"

Li Fan frowned deeply.

With the Dharma Transmitter's power, upon seeing Reincarnation, it would surely discern its origins at a glance.

Reincarnation attempted to possess a borrowed corpse and revive a devoured world; while previous intelligence indicated that the Dharma Transmitter cared deeply for the Profound Azure World...

Their stances were almost completely opposed.

Yet, from the current situation, they seemed to have reached some kind of agreement in such a short time.

"Is it anger from being toyed with? Or is there some other deeper reason?"

The joint entry of two Longevity Celestial Venerables was something Li Fan had not anticipated.

He decisively severed his connection with the puppets currently carrying out missions in the Profound Azure World.

The last command he issued was for the puppets to self-destruct.

Simultaneously, he used formations to seal the entrance from the Spirit Wood Realm to the Profound Azure World. As for the underground world, he also temporarily closed the passage connecting to the Netherworld.

He decided to lie low for the time being.

Although Li Fan could forcefully activate his world-ending preparations at this moment, first, under the Dharma Transmitter's gaze, the bait puppets flying towards the Immortal Ruins, drawing the attention of the immortals within, might not even be able to smoothly leave the Profound Azure World.

Even though the bait puppets were covered by Nether Dark power and formations, the Dharma Transmitter was not to be underestimated.

Li Fan had no confidence in completing this task under its watchful eye.

Despite encountering an unforeseen variable, Li Fan was not panicked.

"I still have plenty of time. I refuse to believe that these two can keep watching forever."

"There's no such thing as guarding against a thief for a thousand days."

"Moreover, in their eyes, I am at most a petty rogue who wants to instigate infighting and profit from it."

"It's impossible for them to guess my true plan of ending the world."

"As long as I can find an opportunity..."

Thinking this, Li Fan slowly calmed down.

He then suddenly recalled the scene he had last seen through the remains of the True Immortal.

"Reincarnation Celestial Venerable, encased in white mist. It could actually contend with the tide formed by Nether Dark power..."

"It definitely possesses the strength to threaten the existence of the Profound Azure World. Perhaps this is one of the reasons why the Dharma Transmitter chose to cooperate with it."

Li Fan suddenly thought of another point.

"The white mist barrier began appearing in the Profound Azure World after the great calamity descended. On the surface, it spans the heavens and earth, dividing the regions. In reality, it acts as an adhesive, merging the Profound Azure World with the devoured worlds."

"And the white mist is subtly related to that Reincarnation Celestial Venerable. Looking at it this way, the Dharma Transmitter and Reincarnation likely knew each other before, which is why they could reach an agreement so quickly."

As for Reincarnation's true identity, Li Fan had a few suspects.

The Heavenly Doctor was one of them.

From another cultivation world, viewing worlds as human bodies, reversing their life and death.

No matter how one looked at it, he fit this description.

Moreover, Reincarnation Celestial Venerable achieved enlightenment faster in this life than in previous lives, likely because Li Fan inherited the "Book of Mending Heavens" and resolved the worries of the people of Cloud Water Celestial Palace for him.

Considering the previous interactions of the Heavenly Doctor with people like Heavenly Extermination and Heavenly Decree, it was almost certain that Reincarnation Celestial Venerable was related to the Heavenly Doctor. Even if not the Heavenly Doctor himself, the connection was undoubtedly profound.

The Heavenly Doctor was elusive, like a dragon that only shows its head but not its tail.

Like the Dharma Transmitter, he traversed the void alone, searching for surviving fragments of cultivation worlds in the Star Sea of Utmost Darkness to strengthen the Profound Azure World.

Since their last meeting, he had not contacted Li Fan.

Li Fan, of course, would not proactively contact the Heavenly Doctor.

He even used the power of the Faceless True Immortal to conceal himself from the other's perception.

"At my current level of strength, no matter what I want to do, it's almost inevitable that I'll encounter people at the level of the Dharma Transmitter and the Heavenly Doctor."

"This is because the Profound Azure World is left with only a small corner."

"Although I still know very little about them, fortunately..."

"They know even less about me."

Li Fan's gaze was distant: "There is indeed a gap in strength, but I dared to scheme against a True Immortal, so why would I fear them?"

"It's just a matter of enduring for now."

...

Although the Spirit Wood Realm was completely sealed, Li Fan was still fully aware of what was happening in the Profound Azure World.

Firstly, through the origin of the Heavenly Profound Mirror, he could observe the various idle conversations of the cultivators.

Secondly, naturally, he gathered intelligence through the Dharma Transmitter Zhou.

"Fellow Daoist Zhou, has something major happened in the Myriad Immortal Alliance? That highest-level warning bell, and I couldn't reach you before..."

The Dharma Transmitter Zhou's tone carried a sense of powerlessness: "A fellow Dharma Transmitter has fallen."

Li Fan feigned extreme shock and then quickly pressed for details.

The Dharma Transmitter Zhou briefly recounted the reason for the incident.

"I knew from the start that these remains of a True Immortal were a trap. But I never expected that the power behind it could harm a Dharma Transmitter?" Li Fan exclaimed in disbelief.

"Has the culprit behind the scenes been caught? Are there any clues?" Li Fan also casually asked.

The Dharma Transmitter Zhou shook his head and did not provide a detailed answer.

Li Fan did not press further, but instead said with a serious expression: "I will also report this matter to the United Association. If there are any discoveries, I will inform you immediately."

"Then I thank you in advance." The Dharma Transmitter Zhou seemed to have little hope for Li Fan's side and responded perfunctorily.

After disconnecting the communication, Li Fan began to ponder possible scapegoats.

However, after much thought, in the vast Profound Azure World, there were very few who had the strength to accomplish what Li Fan had done.

"The remaining few who meet the criteria, such as the Five Elders Council or the Grand Origin Sect, trying to frame them is not an easy task. If I'm too clever, I might accidentally reveal myself."

Li Fan sighed inwardly, summing up the lesson: "I don't have enough aliases."

"If I had another identity at this time, I could frame myself and clear my name."

"I should pay attention to this in the future."

Even Li Fan, who considered himself wise, faced with the current situation, had no better method than patiently waiting for the storm to pass.

The main reason was his inadvertent fall into the True Immortal's trap in this life, preventing him from immediately returning to his true form.

Therefore, he felt hesitant and constrained in everything he did.

However, hiding in the depths of the Netherworld and hastily returning to his true form was not what Li Fan desired.

...

"Circumstances often dictate one's actions. No matter how much one maneuvers, there are times when the room for maneuver is lost."

Chapter 1113: Hiding Alone in the Nether Prison

But Li Fan was still very confident that Transmission Law and Rebirth could not find him.

Let alone the immensely complicated concealment formations on the True Immortal puppet, which even surpassed the Great Array of Reversing Life and Death.

This era's Frozen Sea of Death was a place no one had ever been to before.

Yet the True Immortal's remains could pinpoint its location with such accuracy.

This alone was enough to make Rebirth suspicious.

"Logically, he should be targeting those old acquaintances who might have existed over the years."

"Even if he wanted to investigate me, he wouldn't know where to start."

"The only loophole is that the method of transferring the True Immortal puppet was through the power of darkness."

"And in the Netherworld, besides the Myriad Immortal Alliance, only I, from the United Council of Myriad Realms, have ever been there..."

Thinking of this, Li Fan's heart tightened.

At the level of a Heaven Honored Master of Transmission Law, one no longer needed evidence to "deduce."

A mere possibility was enough for him to make a decision.

"Since I've just reviewed it, there are very few forces in the entire Xuanhuang Realm capable of this. Then, thinking from their perspective, as long as they are all eliminated, potential risks can be prevented before they arise..."

"Although it seems unreasonable, this is the way of a hegemon."

As his thoughts raced, Li Fan's heart skipped a beat.

He made a decision almost immediately.

In the Spiritual Wood Realm, all defensive formations were activated to full power.

The cultivators of the United Council of Myriad Realms were all prepared for battle at any moment.

He summoned all the key figures, including the Heavenly Mechanism Realm, the Medicine King Sect, and the Empire's Small World, and explained the severity of the crisis.

Qiaogong, Liu Ruchen, and the others all turned pale slightly.

"Isn't this too unreasonable? Just because we have the strength to kill a Transmission Master, and they can't find the killer, they want to destroy us all?"

"Is Your Excellency being too pessimistic? The Myriad Immortal Alliance, I don't think they would be so reckless, would they?"

The crowd buzzed with discussion, but upon seeing Li Fan's increasingly grim expression, they all fell silent instantly.

"By seeking the protection of the Red Dust Compassionate Immortal, I have almost confirmed this matter."

"There is no need to doubt. You all make your preparations in advance. There is no room for compromise in this battle."

Li Fan said coldly.

Hearing this, everyone's faces turned ashen.

"The only chance of survival is if our strength to resist is powerful enough."

"They are coming to conquer us for revenge for the three Transmission Masters. However, if we can bring them not only the downfall of the three Transmission Masters..."

"They will have reservations instead," Li Fan continued to motivate them.

"Although the Myriad Immortal Alliance is powerful, they cannot possibly mobilize their entire alliance to attack us."

"Coupled with our advantageous terrain. The Spiritual Wood Realm is as solid as gold, covered by countless formations, and protected by the Heavenly Mechanism Realm's barriers."

"Finally, we can also mobilize the power of the Netherworld and, by surprise, attack the enemy with a tide of darkness..."

Li Fan said with full confidence: "As long as we can withstand the initial, most ferocious waves of attack, we should be able to overcome this crisis."

Although Li Fan said this, there was still no optimism on their faces.

Everyone left with heavy hearts to prepare for battle.

The Spiritual Wood Realm was completely sealed off. Even if they had the idea of escape, they could not get out.

There was only a fight to the death.

And on Li Fan's side...

In an underground secret chamber.

A Saint Fetus, identical to Li Fan, was rapidly taking shape.

With the divine power of the Red Dust Compassionate Immortal, the Saint Fetus was forcibly elevated to the Nascent Soul realm.

The Saint Fetus then left the secret chamber and put on the Heavenly Sun Battle Armor.

As for Li Fan himself...

He took nothing with him and quietly left the Spiritual Wood Realm, unnoticed by anyone. If he knew the Myriad Immortal Alliance would attack the Spiritual Wood Realm, why would his main body stay to fight them to the death?

To Li Fan, what United Council of Myriad Realms, what Spiritual Wood Realm, what Heavenly Mechanism and Medicine King...

were all external possessions, disposable at any time.

Only his own safety was the most important thing.

As long as he preserved his life and weathered this storm, when Transmission Law and Rebirth relaxed their vigilance in the future, he would deploy the World-Destroying Array.

Once everything was restored, what was lost would eventually return to his hands.

With Li Fan's current stealth abilities, after leaving the Spiritual Wood Realm and traveling at full speed, no one discovered his trace from beginning to end.

And he had already decided on his hiding place for the upcoming period.

"As the saying goes, 'under the lamp is the darkest place.' The most dangerous place is the safest place."

Not long after, he had arrived at his destination.

It was the Myriad Immortal Alliance's Nether Prison, the place from which he had previously extracted the Transmission Master Wei Zhong!

"Heh heh, is this considered walking into a trap myself?"

Li Fan chuckled to himself.

"However, this so-called Nether Prison net cannot stop me."

After careful observation, Li Fan had already deciphered the formation covering the entrance to the Nether Prison.

Transforming into a wisp of dark shadow, he quietly flew inside.

The scene before him suddenly became dim.

It was somewhat similar to the appearance of the Netherworld.

There was no sky or earth; all that met the eye was endless darkness.

But compared to the utter blackness of the Netherworld, there was still a sliver of light here.

At least one could vaguely discern the direction of travel with their divine sense, without being completely lost.

In the endless dark space, stood tall prison posts.

Each post seemed to hold a prisoner suppressed within.

And on the surface of the posts, scenes of various horrific punishments were constantly shifting.

As for the jailers of this Nether Prison, they were monstrous creatures composed of black mist-like unknown substances floating in the area.

There were thousands of them, several times more than the tall posts in the space.

They let out roars from time to time and flew into the posts where prisoners were confined.

Before long, faint screams of agony echoed from within the prison cells.

After torturing for a long time, these black mist monsters would leave from the posts with satisfaction.

Similar scenes continued to unfold in the Nether Prison, as if without end.

...

Li Fan looked at this scene, which resembled purgatory, but his expression did not change in the slightest.

After observing the composition of these prison posts, he determined that they were constructed from some kind of formation.

His eyes flickered, and he almost instantly broke it.

Then, he chose an empty one and voluntarily entered it himself.

"Not bad."

After entering the black post, Li Fan looked around and found that compared to the outside, the inside of the cage was actually brighter.

However, formation attacks would descend at any time as a means of punishment.

Naturally, they could not harm Li Fan.

"They probably searched the entire Xuanhuang Realm and wouldn't have thought I was hiding here."

"And when they forget about me, that will be my time to leave."

Li Fan settled into the Nether Prison as if he had returned home.

To him, the Spiritual Wood Realm and the Nether Prison were essentially no different.

Chapter 1114: The Spiritual Wood War Begins

In the Nether Prison, time seemed to lose all meaning.

Every day, one was faced with unchanging gloom and the sounds of suffering and wailing that seemed to never cease.

The intelligence of these black mist jailers appeared to be rather low. Towards Li Fan, the suddenly present prisoner, they merely let out cackling laughter and then mechanically activated the formations within the prison posts, attempting to torment Li Fan.

Naturally, all of Li Fan’s efforts were easily thwarted.

However, he cooperatively simulated his own screams, deceiving these black mist jailers into leaving with satisfaction.

In addition to these frequently appearing low-level jailers, occasional patrol cultivators from the Myriad Immortals Alliance could be seen in the Nether Prison.

A total of three, patrolling in shifts. They often treated their duty of inspecting the Nether Prison as a mere formality. After all, the Nether Prison had been peaceful for thousands of years with no incidents ever occurring.

However, after a period of observation, Li Fan had also realized that the area he was currently hiding in was merely the outermost layer of the Nether Prison. The Myriad Immortals Alliance did not place much importance on the prisoners confined here. Li Fan even personally witnessed a neighbor of his, who could no longer withstand the torment of the formations and had their soul scattered. For a long time afterward, no one came to check on them.

It was only when the black mist jailers conducted their routine patrols that they discovered the situation. They then activated a purification formation and cleaned the black pillar, awaiting the arrival of the next prisoner.

The state of affairs in the Nether Prison, however, satisfied Li Fan greatly.

The probability of being discovered was very small, and no one usually bothered him.

While enjoying the peace and quiet, Li Fan was making preparations for his final world-ending plan, and through the Holy Infant, he observed the situation in the Spiritual Wood Realm.

For a considerable period after Li Fan issued the order for all-out preparedness and then fled, the outside world remained calm. There was no sign whatsoever that the Myriad Immortals Alliance was about to launch a war.

This led everyone to harbor doubts, questioning Li Fan's judgment.

However, due to the power of the Crimson Dust Compassionate Immortal, they dared not express their doubts.

But Li Fan knew that this was merely the calm before the storm.

As it turned out, Li Fan's prediction was correct.

On this day, the sealing formation at the entrance of the Spiritual Wood Realm, which had been silent, suddenly showed traces of subtle fluctuations.

The Holy Embryo Li Fan was the first to discover the anomaly.

After concentrating his divine sense and observing for a moment, Li Fan let out a cold snort, "They do have some skills. It seems they have thoroughly studied the formations I gave to the Myriad Immortals Alliance. Compared to before, their formation level has improved by at least a hundred years. It's a pity..."

"They are still more than a generation behind me!"

"With their tortoise-like speed, it will likely take them at least three months to break through the formations, and that's assuming I don't repair them. However, looking at it from another angle, the Myriad Immortals Alliance may not have that patience. If they can't break the formation, they will likely resort to a direct assault..."

Li Fan did not believe that a mere formation could withstand the assault of the Myriad Immortals Alliance army.

"Why not create a loophole and let a batch of them in first, then catch them in a trap!" Li Fan's thoughts raced, and he had already devised a plan.

Although the main body had already fled for safety, Li Fan had no intention of completely abandoning resistance in the face of the Myriad Immortals Alliance's aggression.

After all, accumulating the wealth and resources of the Spiritual Wood Realm in this lifetime had been a difficult task, consuming a great deal of effort and energy.

Now that the Myriad Immortals Alliance had come, he certainly had to resist.

"It's a good opportunity to test the mettle of the Myriad Immortals Alliance."

"To see if they are worthy of the title of one of the two dominant organizations of the Xuanhuang Realm."

The Holy Embryo Li Fan notified the people of the Spiritual Wood Realm to prepare for battle. At the same time, he cooperated with the Myriad Immortals Alliance's formation-breaking efforts, gradually loosening the formation's defenses.

It appeared as if the formation had truly been broken.

As the loopholes widened, and a slight fissure appeared at the entrance passage to the Spiritual Wood Realm.

The first wave of attacking troops from the Myriad Immortals Alliance instantly entered the Spiritual Wood Realm through these fissures.

The moment they met, both sides were slightly stunned.

On the Myriad Immortals Alliance's side, they were surprised that the people of the Spiritual Wood Realm seemed to have discovered their minor actions long ago and were already in battle formation.

As for Li Fan's side, he was surprised that the so-called vanguard of the Myriad Immortals Alliance was not some elite suicide squad.

Instead, it was hundreds of cold, gleaming arrows.

"Sky Patrol Arrows?!" Li Fan was somewhat surprised.

The Sky Patrol Arrows were a great weapon developed by the Myriad Immortals Alliance in this era. They were extremely fast, capable of traversing an entire province in a matter of breaths. Their power was also astonishing, almost equivalent to the attack of an ordinary Dao Integration cultivator.

This was not the most terrifying aspect. The true power of the Sky Patrol Arrows lay in their ability to form a special formation amongst themselves, creating a vast net that could even distort and influence the laws of heaven and earth.

Previously, when the Myriad Immortals Alliance was fighting the Five Elders Association, they used the Sky Patrol Arrows to interfere with the universal laws of heaven and earth over a large area, preventing the Longevity Heavenly Venerable of the Five Elders Association from intervening in the battle.

"It seems the Myriad Immortals Alliance intends to employ a decapitation strategy. One hundred and sixty-eight Sky Patrol Arrows. Against an ordinary small world, this move would likely completely annihilate its fighting force. However..."

Li Fan let out a cold laugh and reacted with incredible speed.

First, he used the great formation enveloping the Spiritual Wood Realm to interfere with these Sky Patrol Arrows, preventing them from completing their formation. Then, he dispatched the Heavenly Sun, with absolute crushing power, to collect and suppress these Sky Patrol Arrows one by one before they could scatter and cause destruction.

Although the Sky Patrol Arrows were fast, the Heavenly Sun was faster!

The Heavenly Sun transformed into a streak of azure light, weaving back and forth across the sky.

In the blink of an eye, all of them were brought under control.

"Take a few to study. Let's see if this thing can be used for our benefit," the Holy Embryo Li Fan said to the Skilled Craftsman Layman.

The Skilled Craftsman excitedly took the Sky Patrol Arrows and immediately set about dismantling and studying them.

On the Myriad Immortals Alliance's side, the mysterious disappearance of hundreds of Sky Patrol Arrows seemed to have caught them off guard.

After a moment of stunned silence, they delayed launching the next wave of attacks.

Seeing this, Li Fan's eyes gleamed, and he pretended to activate the sealing formation repairing the entrance.

ωwш◆◆c○

As the formation fissures, which had been "hard-won," began to slowly heal, the Myriad Immortals Alliance truly lost its patience and soon launched another attack.

This time, passing through the entrance fissures and appearing before the people of the Spiritual Wood Realm was a troop of cultivators all clad in golden armor.

Under the golden radiance, their features could not be seen. Their exact positions even seemed impossible to pinpoint. Upon arriving in the Spiritual Wood Realm, the golden-armored cultivators quickly dispersed.

Their speed was incredibly fast, even a few points faster than the Sky Patrol Arrows.

What was most troublesome was that they left behind afterimages along their flight paths.

The disappearance of hundreds of Sky Patrol Arrows seemed to have caught them off guard.

After a moment of stunned silence, they delayed launching the next wave of attacks.

Seeing this, Li Fan's eyes gleamed, and he pretended to activate the sealing formation repairing the entrance.

As the formation fissures, which had been "hard-won," began to slowly heal, the Myriad Immortals Alliance truly lost its patience and soon launched another attack.

This time, passing through the entrance fissures and appearing before the people of the Spiritual Wood Realm was a troop of cultivators all clad in golden armor.

Under the golden radiance, their features could not be seen. Their exact positions even seemed impossible to pinpoint. Upon arriving in the Spiritual Wood Realm, the golden-armored cultivators quickly dispersed.

Their speed was incredibly fast, even a few points faster than the Sky Patrol Arrows.

What was most troublesome was that they left behind afterimages along their flight paths.

Whether by sight or by divine sense, these golden phantoms seemed no different from genuine cultivators.

It was impossible to tell which was real.

Thus, in just a moment, the entire sky of the Spiritual Wood Realm was filled with the figures of those golden-armored cultivators.

Their assigned mission seemed to be more than just simple attacks; it was to provide specific intelligence about the Spiritual Wood Realm to the main force that would follow.

"What do you think of this golden armor?" Li Fan asked Fang Zaiji in a casual tone.

Fang Zaiji narrowed his eyes and observed for a short while before replying with a hint of arrogance, "It's just a slightly more advanced illusion technique. I thought your Myriad Immortals Alliance had truly researched armor capable of infinite self-replication!"

"With a few probes, we can break through the illusion and find the real ones!" Fang Zaiji said confidently.

"It seems that with the technological support from the Heavenly Mechanism Realm, the Spiritual Wood Realm's artifact refining has already surpassed the Myriad Immortals Alliance." Li Fan, having received a satisfactory answer, waved his hand, indicating that Fang Zaiji did not need to test it.

Suddenly, a giant parabolic light sphere enveloped the entire Spiritual Wood Realm.

Dense, shifting metallic patterns covered the surface of the light sphere.

At Li Fan's command, countless dark cannon muzzles instantly formed.

"Boom!"

The muzzles locked onto the golden-armored cultivators dancing in the sky.

Then, innumerable black light beams erupted fiercely from them!

Against the black light emanating a destructive aura, the golden-armored cultivators could not resist at all. In an instant, they were torn to shreds and vanished completely into the air.

With just one volly, more than half of the golden phantoms were annihilated.

This terrifying sight caused the movements of the remaining golden-armored cultivators to halt for a moment.

As they stood stunned, another barrage of cannon fire arrived instantaneously.

In front of the black death light, the golden armor was as fragile as paper.

All the golden phantoms in the Spiritual Wood Realm were completely eliminated.

"With the Heavenly Mechanism Fortress and the Heaven-Splitting Cannons, which were imitated from the Myriad Immortals Alliance, there's no need to bother with any flashy illusion techniques. No matter how many there are, they can all be destroyed."

"This is what they call overwhelming force." Li Fan thought to himself.

He then checked the energy reserves of the Heavenly Mechanism Fortress.

The Heavenly Mechanism Fortress was integrated with the Spiritual Wood Realm. The countless living corpses on the plaza constantly circulating the 'Cultivation of All Living Beings' technique, and the vast number of cultivators in the various smaller worlds, were ceaselessly providing it with source energy. After this period of accumulation, it had reached an astonishingly high level.

Li Fan estimated that the volly of cannon fire just unleashed could be sustained continuously for seven days and seven nights without running out.

"Bring on whatever else you have," Li Fan said, his gaze devoid of emotion as he looked towards the flickering entrance fissure.

Having lost two vanguard units in succession, the Myriad Immortals Alliance seemed to have become much more cautious.

This time, after not much deliberation, they finally dispatched their true elite forces.

Before their figures even appeared, a surging, killing aura was sensed from afar.

The rift suddenly widened considerably, and Li Fan's heart skipped a beat. He immediately activated the defensive functions of the Heavenly Mechanism Fortress.

Instantly, the parabolic light barrier shook violently, with wave-like patterns flowing continuously within it. It took a long time to neutralize the strange impact.

After Li Fan checked, his eyelids twitched.

The reserves of the Heavenly Mechanism Fortress, which had seemed so ample moments ago, had been depleted by one-sixth in this brief period!

And the Myriad Immortals Alliance forces that launched the attack had not even appeared yet!

"What is that!?" Li Fan narrowed his eyes.

The subordinates of the Spiritual Wood Realm also sensed something, their expressions becoming tense and uneasy.

"Envoy, be careful. The enemy has likely arrived," Liu Ruchen suddenly warned in a deep voice.

Before his words had even finished, the light barrier of the Heavenly Mechanism Fortress shook violently again.

This time, the amplitude was even more intense than before, and the light barrier dimmed considerably. Clearly, it had once again blocked an attack from this unknown enemy for the Spiritual Wood Realm.

Li Fan knew that without the Heavenly Mechanism Fortress, the Spiritual Wood Realm would likely be riddled with holes by now.

However, the enemy had launched two attacks, and the people of the Spiritual Wood Realm still had no idea what kind of entity it was.

"As expected of a massive organization that rules half the land of the Xuanhuang Realm. It truly possesses trump cards that I, through countless reincarnations, have never discovered." Li Fan was not alarmed by this tricky enemy; instead, he was delighted.

He felt that with this discovery, even if the entire Spiritual Wood Realm were destroyed, it would have been somewhat worthwhile.

However, the Spiritual Wood Realm had gathered the remnants of various ancient immortal cultivation realms, and it wouldn't be so easily destroyed.

While everyone was bewildered and unable to grasp the situation, Bai Hua Daoist, after careful observation, discovered something.

"This method of attack... I think I've heard a friend mention it before."

"A ferocious beast that hides in the void, feeding on immortal cultivation continents. Ordinary people cannot see its true form, and each of its claws possesses the power to destroy worlds..."

"If I'm not mistaken, it should be a Void Great Beast called [Annihilation]."

"In reality, it's not a true life form, but rather the autonomous operation of a certain rule in the star sea." Bai Hua Daoist quickly explained to everyone.

"The world of my friend encountered an attack from such a terrifying existence when it drifted through the void during the descent of a great calamity."

"The method of dealing with it is also very simple. Annihilation is only interested in immortal cultivation realms with life. Barren lands devoid of life do not even enter its observation."

"I just didn't expect that this beast, which only acts according to rules, could be controlled and used for combat by the Myriad Immortals Alliance?"

Having developed a hint of contempt for the Myriad Immortals Alliance due to their two previous easy failures, Bai Hua Daoist's eyes immediately became extremely serious.

Upon hearing this, everyone's eyes lit up.

Then, they all looked at Li Fan.

Concealing the life aura of the entire world was not a difficult task for Li Fan.

After a moment of contemplation, the light barrier of the Heavenly Mechanism Fortress, whose energy reserves had dwindled to one-third under the continuous attacks of the Annihilation beast, emitted a soft, silvery glow.

Under the combined effect of the Heavenly Mechanism Fortress and the great array of the Spiritual Wood Realm, the life aura of the entire world finally faded before the protective measures were completely breached.

Everyone held their breath and waited.

After all, it was difficult to deal with a monster like Annihilation, whose normal form was invisible yet whose strength was ferocious.

Fortunately, Bai Hua Daoist's guess was correct.

Having lost its ability to sense life auras, the terrifying giant beast seemed to have lost its target and ceased its attacks.

It subsided and withdrew.

The third confrontation resulted in a hard-won victory for the Spiritual Wood Realm.

Chapter 1116: Strategic Transfer

To call it a hard-won victory was an understatement, as the Spiritual Wood Realm had suffered no significant losses in these three confrontations. It was merely a small depletion of energy reserves. If the Myriad Immortal Alliance were to retreat now, or be deterred by the strength displayed by the Spiritual Wood Realm and pause their assault, the Spiritual Wood Realm could quickly replenish its energy. However, it was clear that the Myriad Immortal Alliance would not be so easily scared off.

The Annihilation beast, having lost its target, wandered aimlessly for a while. Then, as if sniffing the enticing scent of the Profound Yellow Realm from the spatial passage, it changed its objective. The spatial rift widened again, and the aura that made Li Fan’s heart pound vanished instantly. Before the people of the Spiritual Wood Realm could even celebrate, the entire realm began to shake violently without any warning.

“What is this…” As the master of the Spiritual Wood Realm, Li Fan, who was in the Nether Prison, was the first to sense the anomaly. “The fixed position of the Spiritual Wood Realm within the Profound Yellow Great World is changing!” “Are they trying to cut off the roots and burn the fuel, to directly destroy the smaller world instead of facing it head-on?”

Previously, the Myriad Immortal Alliance had forcibly relocated the Five Elements Great Grotto-Heaven, located in the Heavenly Spirit State, to the central region. In reality, the current scale of the Spiritual Wood Realm was not even as large as the Five Elements Grotto-Heaven. Even with the reinforcement from Li Fan’s array refinement, it was unlikely to withstand the Myriad Immortal Alliance’s brute force relocation. Moreover, even though his main body was far from the battlefield, through his Holy Infant and clones, Li Fan could sense the tremors of the world and had already discerned the method the Myriad Immortal Alliance was using to relocate worlds.

“The Floating Starry Sky Grand Array!” A glint flashed in Li Fan’s eyes. This magnificent grand array, created by King Xuan Tian and used by the Profound Yellow Realm to capture other cultivation realms, had been coveted by Li Fan for a long time. However, even though his Ultimate Dissolution Disc was almost sublimated to the level of an immortal artifact, he was still powerless against this Starry Sky Grand Array and could not forcefully deduce it. It seemed that besides the array formations, there were other unknown factors involved. Previously, when Li Fan inquired the Heavenly Profound Mirror about the details of this grand array, it had repeatedly evaded the question, offering other grand arrays to appease him. As a result, Li Fan had never seen the true form of this array. He never expected to encounter it today, during the siege of the Spiritual Wood Realm.

In his main body’s sea of consciousness, the Dissolution Disc emitted a faint, excited white light, rapidly changing and flickering. “A glimpse of the whole through a small crack. But the Dissolution Disc can reverse-engineer the entire grand array from this portion.” “Indeed, as opponents of the Myriad Immortal Alliance, one encounters more of their trump cards.” Li Fan was very satisfied with the results of this probing.

As the fixed position of the Spiritual Wood Realm gradually shifted, the preliminary deduction from Li Fan’s Dissolution Disc yielded results. “The Heavenly Profound Mirror did not lie, the grand array is indeed severely damaged.” “What the Myriad Immortal Alliance is currently using is the ability of the Floating Starry Sky Grand Array to traverse the starry sea and lock onto and pull worlds.” “Judging from the speed at which the Spiritual Wood Realm is being dragged, the grand array’s power is less than one ten-thousandth of its intact state. But it is still effortless to absorb the entire Spiritual Wood Realm.” “No, no…” “Something is still missing.”

A situation that had never occurred before. The deduction of the Dissolution Disc had interrupted itself. With the Dissolution Disc’s understanding of array formations, no matter how it calculated, it could not construct an array with the same functionality as the ancient Floating Starry Sky Grand Array. This further confirmed Li Fan’s previous conjecture. The “Floating Starry Sky Grand Array” was indeed not a simple array formation. “No wonder, despite having the inheritance of the art, it hasn’t been successfully restored after all these years. And also having to painstakingly scour the remnants of worlds in the void oneself,” Li Fan mused thoughtfully. Although he could not see the grand array’s complete form, what the Myriad Immortal Alliance was using was also a flawed power.

Under Li Fan’s instructions, the panicked and bewildered people of the Spiritual Wood Realm quickly took action. As an array formation materialized on the land of the Spiritual Wood Realm, an invisible fluctuation enveloped the entire small world. The Spiritual Wood Realm, which was being rapidly dragged along, instantly seemed to have its connection severed. The shaking gradually lessened and finally stopped at an unknown location. Li Fan immediately checked the current location of the Spiritual Wood Realm. It had moved from the eastern part of the Myriad Immortal Alliance to the south. It was alarmingly close to the world-rending vortex. “Are they planning to use the natural power of the world rift to directly shatter the world? The Myriad Immortal Alliance truly has a cunning plan.” The Spiritual Wood Realm’s ability to dissolve the power of the Floating Starry Sky had far exceeded the Myriad Immortal Alliance's expectations. There seemed to be internal disagreements, and they did not continue their attack. However, Li Fan could vaguely sense that more Immortal Alliance cultivators were emerging from the surrounding void, surrounding the Spiritual Wood Realm.

Daoist Bai Hua, King of Medicine, and others also noticed the current situation, their expressions turning grim. “This is what is called a cornered beast’s struggle.” “It seems my consideration in this life was not thorough enough. Perhaps when I establish the Spiritual Wood Realm as a base again next time, I can incorporate the ability for the entire small world to teleport instantly.” “Before today, it would have been somewhat difficult to achieve this. But now, with the Myriad Immortal Alliance’s demonstration, hmph…” Li Fan sneered inwardly. Every blade forged against him would be returned a hundredfold.

“Envoy, I believe we cannot just sit here and wait to die,” Liu Ru Chen said solemnly at this moment. “Although the Spiritual Wood Realm’s various defensive measures are perfect, it cannot withstand the unending depletion by the Myriad Immortal Alliance. Perhaps a desperate struggle to break out might offer a sliver of hope.” “The Medicine King’s True Cauldron has been modified over the years, and its internal capacity has increased severalfold. It should be able to carry most people together,” Fang Zai Ji added.

Liu Ru Chen’s opinion was recognized by the vast majority of people. They all looked towards the Holy Infant Li Fan. “Preserve the people and lose the land, the people and land are both preserved; preserve the land and lose the people, the people and land are both lost.” “In that case, everyone prepare for the transfer,” Li Fan nodded, agreeing to everyone’s plan. The crowd immediately received their orders and dispersed. Some were responsible for monitoring the entrance of the spatial passage, preparing for possible surprise attacks from the Myriad Immortal Alliance. Another group was quickly transferring the supplies and population of the United Worlds Federation.

In fact, if the Spiritual Wood Realm’s anchored position had not shifted, Li Fan would have prepared a plan for sacrificing a part to save the whole. That was to transfer to connected small worlds like the Empire or the Leaving Realm. Then destroy the spatial passage. Although it could not completely prevent the Myriad Immortal Alliance’s tracking, it could delay them for a few days. Unfortunately, during the recent transfer, the Spiritual Wood Realm’s own position shifted, causing the passages to all connected affiliated small worlds to be severed. Now, the only possible way to retreat was to force a bloody path through the Myriad Immortal Alliance’s encirclement.

"Our branch at the Bloody River hasn't been discovered yet," Li Fan said to Liu Ruchen, Daoist Baihua, and other core members of the United Worlds Federation. "If we're lucky enough to escape, we can rendezvous there. The special nature of the Bloody River's power should effectively isolate us from the Myriad Immortal Alliance's tracking." Li Fan had already devised a plan for what to do after they got out.

Li Fan had a vague idea of how the Spiritual Wood Realm's location had been exposed. However, now was not the time for reckoning. He didn't utter any cold words about preferring death to surrender. With the power of Faceless True Immortal binding them, even if they wanted to surrender, they likely wouldn't be able to.

As the people of the Spiritual Wood Realm prepared for a desperate escape, the Sacred Embryo Li Fan quietly approached the statue of Faceless True Immortal. The statue was merely a vessel. The True Immortal's power had already revived through the increasingly vast network of Federation members. "But undoubtedly, compared to other ordinary members, He would place more importance on His own statue."

"In fact, I could choose to throw out the statue and let the Myriad Immortal Alliance face the True Immortal's power directly. However..." "This trick can only be used once. I'm still counting on Him to contend with the immortals of the Immortal Ruins later." Under the solemn gaze of the Sacred Embryo Li Fan, the Faceless statue gradually became transparent. Then, it vanished.

In the Nether Prison. Li Fan watched the statue materialize out of thin air before him, expressionless. Where the True Immortal's network covered, True Immortal power could naturally flow freely. The cultivation and knowledge he had previously bestowed upon the Federation members were also imparted through this method. However, this was his first time attempting to transfer a physical object.

"If I truly chose to completely pledge allegiance to Faceless True Immortal, dedicating myself wholeheartedly, and become a true envoy of the True Immortal. With the immense power of the True Immortal, perhaps the entire Spiritual Wood Realm could be transferred with a single thought," Li Fan mused, gazing at the statue.

The Nether Prison remained unchanged by the arrival of the True Immortal statue. Li Fan, hidden within, put the statue away and refocused his attention on the Spiritual Wood Realm. The Federation members were hurriedly preparing for evacuation. The Sacred Embryo Li Fan, meanwhile, was calmly setting up a formation.

Sensing the figure appearing behind him, Li Fan's movements paused slightly. "Esteemed Emissary... must it be this way?" The one who arrived was Lin Ling, the spirit of the giant tree in the Spiritual Wood Realm. "Once this formation is activated, everything in the Spiritual Wood Realm will likely turn to dust," Lin Ling said, her face pale as she looked at the faint silver lines appearing on the ground.

Li Fan smiled. "We are undertaking a strategic transfer. How can such fertile land as the Spiritual Wood Realm be easily handed over to the Myriad Immortal Alliance? Of course, we must destroy it. As for you..." "You haven't been paying attention lately. Your array mastery has improved considerably. You can actually discern the purpose of the formation I'm setting up?" Li Fan's gaze swept over Lin Ling.

Lin Ling pursed her lips. "I don't have that skill. It's just that I am one with the Spiritual Wood, and facing a life-or-death crisis, I have some sense of it." "Will we not return someday? Even if we temporarily cede this place to the Myriad Immortal Alliance, what does it matter? I believe that under the Esteemed Emissary's leadership, that day will not be too far off." Who would have thought that the once naive and ignorant tree spirit would utter such gentle words of persuasion?

The Sacred Embryo's formation-setting movements involuntarily paused. After a moment of silence, Li Fan asked, "The Myriad Immortal Alliance was able to pinpoint the Spiritual Wood Realm's location so quickly. It must be that there's a traitor among us. Do you have any leads?"

Lin Ling's body trembled, and she exclaimed, "It wasn't me!" Li Fan glanced at her. "If it were you, would you still be standing here speaking with me so safely?" Lin Ling immediately felt relieved, exhaling a weak sigh as if her strength had been drained. After witnessing the Spiritual Wood Realm's growth from nothing and Li Fan's various means over the years, she harbored no thoughts of betrayal. Compared to Li Fan, the people from the Xuanhuang Realm outside seemed much simpler. Offending the Myriad Immortal Alliance might not lead to death. But offending Li Fan...

Lin Ling wiped the sweat from her forehead. After thinking for a moment, she quickly replied, "Actually, it's not necessarily that a traitor has appeared in our Federation. Although the entrance to the Spiritual Wood Realm is hidden, it cannot be concealed from everyone in the world." "At the very least, I know of someone who is very clear about it. And..." Lin Ling cautiously studied Li Fan before softly saying, "It seems he has some past grievances with you, Esteemed Emissary."

Li Fan's eyes narrowed. "Are you referring to the Earth Vein Ancient Tree?" Lin Ling nodded. "When I was on good terms with him before, he saw the process of me frequently entering and leaving the Spiritual Wood Realm. Although we lost contact later, the location of our Spiritual Wood Realm never changed. And wherever the Earth Veins reached, his gaze could see..." "Even more crucially, I could vaguely sense Earth Vein Ancient Tree's gaze before. But since the Myriad Immortal Alliance attacked us, his prying gaze has never reappeared. It's as if he's guilty of something. I ask you, if it wasn't him who leaked the information, given that we have grievances with him, shouldn't he be gloating at our demise right now?" Lin Ling analyzed with sound reasoning.

Upon hearing this, Li Fan nodded slightly. "You've done well. We'll leave the Spiritual Wood Realm as it is for now." The Sacred Embryo Li Fan halted his formation progress. "One should be looked at with new eyes after being apart for three days. If you could have warned me earlier, that would have been even better." Looking at Lin Ling, Li Fan encouraged her. Lin Ling's face flushed with excitement.

After sending Lin Ling away to prepare for escape, Li Fan gazed outwards from the Spiritual Wood Realm. "Heh, just like his ancestor, they are both so vengeful." "What a coincidence, so am I." Li Fan acknowledged Lin Ling's deduction. After all, the entrance to the Spiritual Wood Realm was extremely hidden, and only a few knew about it. After ruling out everyone else, the target could be quickly identified. As for the possibility that Lin Ling was the mole and her entire deduction was fabricated to clear her name... Li Fan trusted his own judgment. And he trusted his insight into people.

"Earth Vein Ancient Tree..." "Relying on his integration with the Earth Veins, he dares to act so presumptuously. Humph." In an instant, Li Fan had already devised a method to deal with him. "Ru Mu is quite fond of these offspring who remained on the ground back then. If I can present him with a grand gift, perhaps our relationship can be improved." However, punishing the Earth Vein Ancient Tree would have to wait for the next life. Li Fan put this grievance aside for now, waiting until the people of the Spiritual Wood Realm were sufficiently prepared. He then summoned Liu Ruchen and the others again.

"After we break out, you will follow behind Tianyang." "Form this formation." Li Fan solemnly imparted the formation to the people of the Spiritual Wood Realm.

Even though it was a formation Li Fan had just deduced, it was tailor-made for the people of the Spiritual Wood Realm. With the Tianyang Immortal Puppet as the core, relying on its Longevity Realm defensive capabilities, it would maximize the combat power of everyone else.

This formation also had an effect similar to soul burning, capable of fully stimulating the potential of the cultivators within the formation for a short period. This came at the cost of burning their divine souls.

Before the formation gathered to retreat, the Holy Embryo Li Fan cast one last glance at the Spiritual Wood Realm.

"Next life, it will be better."

Without the slightest hesitation, he led the others and rushed out of the Spiritual Wood Realm.

They had originally expected to encounter the heavy encirclement of the Myriad Immortals Alliance. However, to Li Fan and the others' surprise, outside the void of the Spiritual Wood Realm, there was nothing!

But strangely, the feeling of being constantly monitored that had been lingering in everyone's hearts still remained!

"Be careful!" Daoist Baihua was the first to exclaim. Her face was pale, and cold sweat was flowing from her forehead. Even when facing Li Fan's pressure before, she had never been so flustered or lost her composure.

Because the feeling she had sensed from Li Fan back then was simply killing intent. But now…

"Pure malice…"

Liu Ruchen and the others from the Medicine King Sect also prepared for a fierce battle.

Although the front appeared empty, with no one defending, they all stopped their charge in unison.

This included Li Fan, who was leading them.

Because their intuition told them that if they charged forward, they would die.

As if targeted by a natural predator, their bodies stiffened, and they dared not move rashly.

Just then, Tianyang's voice reached Li Fan's ears.

"Ahead. Longevity Realm. Strange."

Concise, grave.

Fallen into the Holy Embryo Li Fan's ears, it was like a thunderclap.

"Longevity Realm?"

"Has a Dharma Preacher arrived?"

His heart felt as if it were being tightly clenched, and even the aura of Li Fan's True Body, hidden in the Nether Prison, became somewhat chaotic.

"That's right. The Myriad Immortals Alliance already knew of the existence of a Longevity Realm cultivator in the United Realms. After the initial probes, they naturally wouldn't send more to die pointlessly, but would directly use decisive force to settle it."

"But…"

"To avenge a few Dharma Preachers, is He going to make a move personally? Isn't that beneath Him?"

Li Fan was clearly caught off guard by the appearance of the Dharma Preacher Heavenly Venerate.

But then, a multitude of doubts arose in his mind.

From the Dharma Preacher Heavenly Venerate's previous attitude towards His Dharma Preachers, it was clear that He treated them as mere tools. Perhaps He had some special regard for Dharma Preacher Jiang, but other Dharma Preachers might not have been any different from ordinary cultivators in the Profound Yellow Realm in His eyes.

Would the Dharma Preacher Heavenly Venerate personally appear to conquer for the sake of a mere three Dharma Preachers?

Li Fan did not believe it.

Moreover, Li Fan had also experienced the vast power of the Dharma Preacher Heavenly Venerate before. His aura was sacred, vast, and unfathomable.

It definitely had nothing to do with the "malice" that now surrounded them!

"If it's not a Dharma Preacher, then who could it be?"

There were only a few Longevity Heavenly Venerates in the Profound Yellow Realm.
