Excluding the five Heavenly Venerates of the Five Elders Association, it couldn't be Wangsheng, who had just attained the Dao.

As his thoughts raced, a name, long suppressed in the depths of his memory, almost forgotten, instantly appeared in Li Fan's mind.

Eastern Pole Heavenly Venerate!

Regarding Eastern Pole Heavenly Venerate, records could only be found in a few sentences throughout the entire Myriad Immortals Alliance's scriptures.

His life seemed to have been deliberately erased. The only thing known was that the "Body Cleansing Spirit Pool," which the Myriad Immortals Alliance now used to remove immortal-mortal miasma from mortal bodies, was invented by Him.

Other than that, there was nothing else.

A generation's Longevity Heavenly Venerate, and besides the Dharma Preacher, the only Heavenly Venerate in the Myriad Immortals Alliance.

To be treated like this was truly bizarre and unimaginable.

If it wasn't by His own request, then what happened to Him was very interesting.

Furthermore, the Longevity Heavenly Venerates of the Profound Yellow Realm were all named after their paradoxical Dao.

Only this Eastern Pole seemed to be just His name.

… In a moment, countless thoughts flashed through Li Fan's mind.

And the surrounding malevolent thoughts, which were watching them menacingly, also attacked the people of the Spiritual Wood Realm.

The power of a Heavenly Venerate was truly different from ordinary cultivators.

The Tianyang Immortal Puppet's body, which had originally emanated a pure white light, suddenly seemed to be tainted with a hint of ominous aura. The light flickered, and Tianyang's expression became serious, as if struggling against that aura. Black spots appeared on the puppet's body, here and there.

The attack of the malevolent aura bypassed the protection of Li Fan's formation and simultaneously struck everyone in the Spiritual Wood Realm.

Not everyone had the capital to contend with a Longevity Heavenly Venerate.

In the blink of an eye, they were corrupted.

And Li Fan witnessed the fate of those completely infected by the malevolent aura.

Their pupils disappeared, and their eye sockets became pitch black.

At the same time, they instantly attacked their companions beside them, having completely lost their will.

Almost instantly, the Spiritual Wood Realm's team fell into chaos, showing signs of imminent defeat.

And the enemy hiding in the darkness still had not revealed themselves.

"Is this the true combat power of a Longevity Heavenly Venerate?"

"Defeat is acceptable. But not even seeing His true form…"

In the midst of the chaos, Li Fan's expression remained unmoved as he looked at Tianyang.

A dazzling crimson light suddenly surged from within Tianyang.

Like the great sun in the sky, it illuminated the surrounding dark space.

"Tianyang's life…"

"Is not inferior to anyone!"

The body of the Tianyang Immortal Puppet instantly expanded by hundreds of millions of times, like a flame giant that created heaven and earth, standing in the dark void.

Circles of crimson flames erupted from his body, continuously spreading outwards.

Seeking to incinerate the entire space.

Under the scorching of the Tianyang flames, the allied forces of the Spiritual Wood Realm were unharmed.

Those cultivators corrupted by the malevolent aura turned into black ashes amidst piercing, bone-chilling screams.

And the culprit who had been hiding in the darkness was finally forced to reveal its form!

The scene before him caused the Holy Embryo Li Fan's eyes to narrow slightly.

A tall, naked man stood in mid-air.

His black hair reached his ankles, and his body was covered in black, evil-looking patterns emitting a malevolent aura.

And behind the naked man, countless threads could be vaguely seen, appearing from the void and deeply embedded within the man's body.

The naked man's eyes were entirely black, and his expression was blank. He was just like those cultivators who had lost their minds.

"Longevity Heavenly Venerate, a puppet on strings…"

This bizarre scene sent an irrepressible chill through the hearts of everyone in the Spiritual Wood Realm.

Li Fan, on the other hand, gasped.

"This is…"

"The Eastern Pole Heavenly Venerate, who mysteriously disappeared, has actually become like this?"

"Although not dead, it would be better to be dead…"

"Who did this?"

"The Dharma Preachers of the Myriad Immortals Alliance definitely don't have this ability."

"The only possibility is the Dharma Preacher!"

In the Nether Prison, Li Fan's True Body subconsciously clenched his fists.

The naked man with black hair was almost certainly the Eastern Pole Heavenly Venerate, who had mysteriously disappeared.

But how could a Longevity Heavenly Venerate be turned into a mere puppet on strings without instilling dread in everyone's hearts?

"No wonder almost no information can be found about the Eastern Pole. Even Mo Ruibin, who had possessed a Dharma Preacher and inherited all their memories, or the Heavenly Profound Mirror, couldn't find anything."

"No wonder the cultivators of the Myriad Immortals Alliance all retreated when the Heavenly Venerates made their move. Such a secret is too horrifying. If they hadn't left, they would have likely been silenced."

Despite being controlled, the Eastern Pole seemed to retain some instinct.

Facing the crimson flames erupting from Tianyang, who possessed the battle power of a Longevity realm cultivator, his long black hair behind him suddenly grew longer. It transformed into numerous dark beasts that extinguished the flames.

Tianyang did not hesitate. With a spatial fluctuation, he instantly appeared beside the Eastern Pole.

In the presence of the Heaven-Opening Giant's physique, the Eastern Pole appeared as insignificant as an ant.

The crimson flames burning on Tianyang's body were so intense that they distorted the surrounding space. However, the Eastern Pole seemed completely unaffected.

It was as if he existed independently of the space itself.

His lips parted slightly, and he seemed to utter something. Instantly, without any warning, a large chunk of Tianyang's body caved in. The puppet's body swayed violently.

Tianyang let out a roar and his body reverted to its original shape.

Then, with a bang, he dissolved into countless sparks, scattering towards the black-haired Eastern Pole.

The crimson flames were like dragons, burning everything.

The countless black hairs that had separated from the Eastern Pole also ignited, with the flames spreading towards his main body.

Just then, the Eastern Pole's pitch-black eyes shifted slightly.

The black hair monsters, which had already turned to ash, reappeared from within the flames.

No matter how many times Tianyang's crimson flames burned them, they could always revive.

If even his transformed black hair could not be completely harmed, how could his main body be?

Although Tianyang roared with unwillingness, he could not change this fact.

"Tianyang has the power of a Longevity realm cultivator, but it was forcibly reshaped using Origin Essence. He does not possess the true divine abilities of a Longevity realm cultivator. Facing Dao Convergence cultivators, it's naturally without pressure. But against a true Longevity Heavenly Venerate..."

"He is no match," Li Fan shook his head inwardly.

"Moreover, this Eastern Pole Heavenly Venerate doesn't seem weak either. The pressure he gives me is even greater than that of senior sister Zhao."

During the battle between the two Longevity realm cultivators, Li Fan vaguely sensed the traces of the workings of the principles of heaven and earth.

This was especially strong when those black hair monsters revived from the flames.

"Is this the principle that the Eastern Pole defies?"

After contemplating, Li Fan vaguely thought of something.

"The principle of reversing the development and changes of things?"

"Is this why the Dharma Preacher inflicted such severe harm on the Eastern Pole?"

"If the Eastern Pole had completely achieved enlightenment, he might have directly reversed the rules established by the Profound Yellow World's Dharma Preachers..."

With Li Fan's repeated experiences of peeking into the Heavenly Dao, his sensitivity to the principles of heaven and earth was almost on par with any Dao Convergence cultivator.

Observing so closely at such proximity, his deductions should not be flawed.

"To be able to create the 'Purifying Body Spiritual Pond' for mortals, this Eastern Pole must have been a figure like Mr. Bai. It's a pity..."

"Not only forgotten by the world, but he himself lives a life worse than death, becoming the final puppet trump card of the Myriad Immortals Alliance," Li Fan shook his head slightly.

"This is the fate of the weak. But it will never be my destination."

"Dharma Preacher Heavenly Venerate..."

"Hmph."

The battle between Tianyang and the Eastern Pole was beyond the abilities of everyone in the Spiritual Wood Realm to interfere.

Even if they wanted to help, they were powerless.

Even with their combined efforts, amplified by Li Fan's formations, it was the same. Before they could even approach the battlefield, the residual power of the fight caused their spiritual energy to boil and their breaths to become chaotic.

"Is this the Longevity realm?"

Everyone's faces were complex.

A hint of despair welled up in the depths of their eyes.

The Sacred Embryo Li Fan had no emotional fluctuations, making accurate judgments.

"Although Tianyang can still hold on for now, the outcome is already decided."

"It seems there's no escape. However, witnessing the Myriad Immortals Alliance's deepest secret is definitely worth it."

"I just don't know who behind the scenes is manipulating the Eastern Pole. Is it the Dharma Preacher Jiang? Or that Di Sanmo?"

Tianyang, who was gradually falling into a losing position, after receiving Li Fan's reminder,

turned to attack the thousands of invisible threads behind the Eastern Pole.

He was trying to uncover information about the manipulator behind it.

However, it was a shame that the power of these invisible threads was clearly superior to that of the Eastern Pole, a Longevity Heavenly Venerate.

How could Tianyang possibly probe their secrets?

In vain, Tianyang let out another unwilling roar.

...

In the Nether Prison.

Sensing that the Sacred Embryo had completely lost contact,

Li Fan's True Body, who had been leisurely enjoying himself, suddenly became heavy-hearted.

The annihilation of the Spiritual Wood Realm demonstrated the vast gap in high-end combat power in the Profound Yellow World.

But what concerned Li Fan even more was the hidden information behind it.

"To be able to turn a not-weak Longevity realm cultivator into this state..."

"My previous estimate of the Dharma Preacher's strength was already infinitely high, the highest possible. But now, it seems the Dharma Preacher's strength is even more terrifying than I imagined."

"Even if he hasn't ascended to immortality, he must be infinitely close."

"He can no longer be evaluated by the realm of 'Longevity'."

"If he were in the Profound Yellow World..."

Li Fan's brows furrowed: "Even in the contest between the two true immortals, he might have the ability to save the Profound Yellow World."

"Hmm... this possibility cannot be ruled out."

"It seems that my world-ending plan for this life will have to be postponed for a while."

"Fortunately, time passes quickly here in the Nether Prison."

Li Fan's complex emotions finally calmed down.

While reviewing the experiences of this life, Li Fan prepared for his final plan.

Time flew by, and it was unknown how long had passed.

The arrival of a new prisoner in the Nether Prison startled Li Fan from his seclusion.

His arms were severed, and he had only one eye left.

The newcomer looked incredibly miserable, with disheveled hair and a face covered in dried blood.

It was an old acquaintance of Li Fan's.

Kou Hong.

His inseparable brother, Dao Xuanzi, was nowhere to be seen for some reason.

Even while being escorted, Kou Hong showed no signs of yielding.

He cursed incessantly, venting his hatred for the Myriad Immortals Alliance.

Li Fan listened for a long time before finally understanding.

It turned out that after the headquarters of the Myriad Worlds United Association in the Spiritual Wood Realm was uprooted, the scattered members of the United Association were also mercilessly hunted.

Time passes quickly here in the Nether Prison.

Strictly speaking, Kou Hong and Dao Xuanzi were not members of the Myriad Worlds United Association. They were merely members of the association's predecessor, the Cong Yun Mutual Aid Society. After the Cong Yun Mutual Aid Society was annihilated by the Transmitters, they lost contact with Li Fan. It was their firm belief in the Merciful Immortal of the Mortal World that allowed them to vaguely sense the existence of the United Association. Now that the United Association had been destroyed, as long as they themselves did not speak of it, their past great kindness from the United Association would not be exposed.

However, these two were truly passionate individuals. Upon hearing the Myriad Immortals Alliance's announcement to eradicate the United Association, they were not only unafraid but also did not conceal their past. Instead, they did their utmost to assassinate cultivators belonging to the Myriad Immortals Alliance. Although they knew that under the divine power of the Heavenly Venerate of Rebirth, cultivators would be resurrected, they were determined to do so in order to repay Li Fan for his past kindness.

In this lifetime, they had both received guidance from Li Fan. Dao Xuanzi founded his core with the Cang Hai Pearl, and Kou Hong founded his core with the Ten Thousand Mountains Cauldron. Their progress had been rapid over the years, and they had already reached the middle stage of Golden Core cultivation. But in the face of a behemoth like the Myriad Immortals Alliance, they were merely ants. After killing only a dozen or so insignificant Immortal Alliance cultivators, they were soon surrounded by the Myriad Immortals Alliance's Guardian Hall cultivators.

Dao Xuanzi, unwilling to be a prisoner, laughed and self-destructed. Kou Hong also intended to follow Dao Xuanzi to his death, but he was stopped by the Immortal Alliance cultivators. After his arms were severed and one eye was destroyed, he was sent to the Nether Prison by the Myriad Immortals Alliance to be eternally suppressed.

"You can only show off your sharp tongue while you still can. I hope you'll remain this tough after suffering the torment of the formations here," the Myriad Immortals Alliance cultivator escorting him said with a cold smile, unfazed by Kou Hong's continuous curses.

Kou Hong continued to curse incessantly.

Kou Hong's subsequent behavior even exceeded Li Fan's expectations. Li Fan was all too familiar with the power of the formations within the high pillars of the Nether Prison. Ordinary people facing such endless torment could not endure for long before instinctively crying out for mercy. Yet, this Kou Hong, even when repeatedly tortured to the brink of death and his consciousness blurred, still uttered faint curses.

"This is partly due to the brainwashing of the Faceless True Immortal, but it also has to do with Kou Hong's own firm will. Once he decides on something, he must see it through, even if it means death, without regret."

When Li Fan first met them, all they had to do was join the Myriad Immortals Alliance and toil for over a decade to earn a cultivation technique to advance to Golden Core. But they refused, preferring to risk their lives exploring sect ruins. Later, after finding a Nascent Soul true technique, the two who were like brothers fought to the death for a sliver of opportunity to achieve the Dao. And in this life, after Li Fan saved their lives from the mutated Immortal-Mortal Miasma, they joined the Mutual Aid Society and became devout seekers of the Merciful Immortal of the Mortal World.

... These instances all perfectly illustrated their character.

"He is a malleable talent, capable of being of use to me. At the very least, he should be more handy to use than those so-called geniuses," Li Fan said, looking at Kou Hong, who lay unconscious not far away with a determined expression. A hint of approval flashed in his eyes.

At the impending destruction of the Spiritual Wood Realm in this lifetime, as Li Fan led the members of the United Association in their escape, he had observed everyone's performance. The prodigies of the River and Mountain Xuan Sect, who had been swayed by Shang Tianci, even though they had pledged oaths before the statue of the Faceless True Immortal, showed no intention of perishing with the United Association at the critical moment. Instead, they displayed regret and emotions of wanting to escape or surrender. In terms of loyalty alone, they were far inferior to Kou Hong.

With this thought, a faint beam of light penetrated the prison pillar and flew towards the unconscious Kou Hong. Kou Hong's ferocious expression immediately softened. When Kou Hong awoke and sensed what had appeared in his mind, a strange light flashed in his eyes. However, he still pretended to be defiant, denouncing the shameless acts of the Myriad Immortals Alliance, while simultaneously studying the knowledge he had just acquired.

"This is..."

"A detailed explanation of formations?"

"And it's the formation that constitutes this Nether Prison cage?"

"How could it appear in my mind?"

After a long while, Kou Hong's mind was greatly shaken. He suppressed the urge to look around. "If this detailed formation explanation is true, then escaping from here would be as easy as flipping my palm."

Having experienced so much, Kou Hong was much more composed than in the past. He did not blindly trust it but instead began to study the contents of the detailed formation explanation. Although he had only casually studied formations before, this detailed explanation was profound yet easy to understand, and coupled with Kou Hong's decent aptitude, seven days later, Kou Hong had barely grasped the basics.

At the same time, a doubt flashed through his mind: "Could this be a trap?" "This is clearly where the Myriad Immortals Alliance detains major criminals. How could the guarding formation be so simple? As a beginner, I can break it after only a few days of study?"

Kou Hong subtly attempted to break the formation. At this moment, his body was extremely weak, and the spiritual energy within him was heavily suppressed and could not be utilized. Yet, Kou Hong, by exerting all his strength to create spiritual energy fluctuations, managed to create a slight impact on the prison formation. The change this brought about was that when the Nether Prison jailer once again activated the formation to torture Kou Hong, the pain Kou Hong felt was reduced!

"It's actually real?" Kou Hong, enduring the pain, was overjoyed. But he quickly calmed down and began to ponder the origin of the detailed formation explanation in his mind. "The Myriad Immortals Alliance doesn't need to play games with me, a mere Golden Core cultivator." "And the level of expertise displayed in this detailed formation explanation far surpasses that of the Myriad Immortals Alliance..."

A divine name suddenly appeared in Kou Hong's mind. "Merciful Immortal of the Mortal World."

At the same time, a warm current surged from within Kou Hong, flowing through his limbs and bones. It instantly broke through the Myriad Immortals Alliance's restrictions, nourishing and repairing Kou Hong's damaged body while rapidly increasing his cultivation. Sensing the earth-shattering changes within him, Kou Hong stiffened, daring not to show any abnormality for fear of being discovered. In reality, his heart was already brimming with tears. The great and benevolent True Immortal of the Mortal World had not abandoned him!

"The United Association has been destroyed, and there are probably not many True Immortal believers left in the world now." "I am trapped in prison, yet the True Immortal has suddenly descended with a method of escape..." As he thought, Kou Hong's eyes lit up. He quickly lowered his head to conceal his inner excitement. "I understand. The Myriad Immortals Alliance destroyed the United Association, and this is an irreconcilable hatred!" "The so-called enemy of my enemy is my friend. All those imprisoned here are mortal enemies of the Myriad Immortals Alliance. If I were to release them all..."

"Furthermore, perhaps I can even convert them into believers of the Merciful True Immortal!"

Looking at the countless prisoners around him, groaning in agony under the array punishments, Kou Hong felt a pang of empathy. He mused, "However, this is a strictly guarded prison after all. To achieve this, I need to plan carefully."

Kou Hong's eyes flickered. He once again used the same enraged shouts to conceal his true feelings. This time, however, he deliberately made his voice weak and intermittent, as if he could barely hold on.

For the next period, Kou Hong used his outward appearance of complete submission to divert the guards' attention from himself. Meanwhile, he would spend his days frantically studying the detailed explanations of formations and secretly accumulating strength.

He had finally realized it now. The surge of warmth that inexplicably appeared within him, the boon from the Merciful True Immortal, was precisely the cultivation that cultivators dreamed of. In the conventional understanding, cultivation was only accumulated through day and night of arduous practice, serving as the driving force for advancing one's realm. But now, it was like water from an inexhaustible source, continuously nourishing his body. His strength was thus increasing at an unbelievably terrifying speed. In just half a month, he had directly broken through to the Golden Core Completion stage. This further solidified Kou Hong's belief that the incredible miracles happening to him were indeed the blessings of the Merciful True Immortal! After all, it had taken him over two hundred years to cultivate from a mortal to the Golden Core middle stage! Now, breaking through realms happened in the blink of an eye.

Originally, Kou Hong thought that the Golden Core Completion stage was his limit. But what happened next completely shattered his understanding, making him comprehend what True Immortal divine power truly was!

As is widely known, to break through from the Golden Core realm to the Nascent Soul realm, one needs to absorb the Heaven and Earth Grotto-Heavens of the Profound Yellow Realm. Currently, Kou Hong was still imprisoned in the Nether Prison, naturally unable to meet this condition.

However, three days later, something that made Kou Hong's heart tremble occurred. When he circulated his spiritual energy and examined himself, he discovered that within his Dantian, a phantom image of a Grotto-Heaven was faintly appearing! Upon closer introspection, Kou Hong confirmed that this illusion of a Grotto-Heaven was not a hallucination. It was real! A Grotto-Heaven was being born within his body!

Without a doubt, this was another blessing from the Merciful True Immortal. Kou Hong quickly accepted this, and with the help of this nascent Grotto-Heaven, he officially broke through to the Nascent Soul realm a month later! The various anomalies that occurred during his breakthrough were perfectly masked by the True Immortal power surging within him, preventing the Nether Prison guards from noticing. Kou Hong looked at his hands, feeling as if he were in a dream. The Nascent Soul realm, a realm he had only dared to dream of before, had been achieved so easily.

"Supreme Merciful True Immortal, I, Kou Hong, do not know what virtue or merit I possess to receive such great favor from you. I am bound to fulfill your instructions, even unto death."

From the shadows, Kou Hong gazed at the towering Nether Prison around him, his eyes gradually hardening. After newly entering the Nascent Soul realm, Kou Hong's strength continued to skyrocket daily. However, his primary focus had shifted to breaking formations and rescuing the prisoners within the Nether Prison.

"With my own strength, it is too difficult to accomplish this. But where can I find help within this prison?"

Kou Hong subtly observed his "neighbors," selecting suitable candidates for collaboration. Time passed, though he knew not how long.

One day, Li Fan looked at the message sent by Kou Hong and couldn't help but smile slightly. He merely pretended not to see it and gave no response. Kou Hong, unwilling to give up, tried a few more times before reluctantly choosing to desist.

"Did I misjudge?"

"That shouldn't be the case."

Just as Kou Hong found himself in a predicament, a newly arrived prisoner caught his attention. This person was not a member of the United Association; they were imprisoned here for violating the Immortals Alliance's laws. Given the crime they committed, they likely had no chance of ever leaving.

"Now, you maggots, you think you can just die to atone for your sins!"

"It's not that easy!"

"I want to make you wish for death, to rot and despair in this lightless Nether Prison for the rest of your life!" the Myriad Immortals Alliance cultivator escorting the prisoner said through gritted teeth.

The prisoner remained silent, but their gaze towards the other party was filled with disdain and killing intent. Soon, under the suppression of the cruel formations, it all turned into agonizing screams.

In extreme pain, a person's involuntary utterances are always closest to their true inner thoughts. After overhearing the new neighbor's words for several days, Kou Hong confirmed that this person was indeed a suitable collaborator. One day, after waiting for the prisoner to be tortured to the brink of death, Kou Hong quietly penetrated the formation and transmitted his message.

The prisoner's eyes snapped open, trying to locate Kou Hong's position, but it was clearly futile. After a period of exchange, Kou Hong learned his name: Zhang Fu. His crime wasn't particularly serious, merely embezzling one-third of the profits from the Mo Ling State's Pill Hall for a year. In the past, if such a thing were discovered, a bit of contribution points and some connections could have resolved the issue, allowing him to buy his way out of trouble. However, this time, unfortunately, one of his sworn enemies somehow found out about it and reported it directly to the Myriad Immortals Alliance headquarters. The headquarters' response this time was exceptionally swift. Before Zhang Fu could even grease any palms, an envoy from the headquarters arrived. After a brief investigation, the evidence was conclusive, and he was apprehended on the spot. He wasn't even subjected to the usual review process before being brought to the Nether Prison and suppressed.

It was then that Zhang Fu realized he had been set up. He initially thought he was doomed, but unexpectedly, a turning point had appeared.

"Help release the prisoners from the Nether Prison?"

"This is a capital offense. Although everyone can reincarnate now, I heard before I was imprisoned that the Myriad Immortals Alliance seemed to have reached some sort of agreement with that Rebirth Heavenly Venerate. Those who commit unforgivable sins in the Immortals Alliance will lose the opportunity to reincarnate. True death!"

"For instance, those members of the United Association, it seems they all met such a fate."

Unaware of Kou Hong's body trembling nearby, Zhang Fu continued speaking as if to himself, "Although I am imprisoned here with no chance of ever leaving, it is still better than truly perishing. Perhaps one day, the Myriad Immortals Alliance will issue a general amnesty."

Zhang Fu did not agree at first; he even secretly considered reporting this traitorous individual to redeem himself. But what the other party said next made him change his mind.

"Here, even death is a release."

"If you don't believe me, just look at the people around you."

Zhang Fu had long heard of the horrors of the Nether Prison.

And during the brutal torture he had just experienced, he had also deeply understood the awfulness of the punishments here.

Upon hearing Kou Hong’s words, and having personally witnessed several cultivators driven mad and disfigured by torture, he knew very clearly that he absolutely could not endure the cruelties of this place. Thus, he decisively agreed to Kou Hong.

“If things really don't work out, I can always go back on my word and sell this person out,” Zhang Fu thought to himself.

However, all his petty calculations vanished after he followed Kou Hong in reciting an oath.

“Merciful True Immortal?” At first, Zhang Fu paid no mind to this so-called True Immortal. But later, every time he entertained the thought of betrayal, an inexplicable sense of impending doom would arise.

Only then did Zhang Fu finally confirm that he had genuinely boarded a pirate ship.

Following this, Kou Hong and Zhang Fu slowly began their infiltration plan within the Nether Prison.

Every newly imprisoned convict, after enduring inhuman torture and with their consciousness on the verge of collapse, would be opportune contact by Kou Hong.

Under the divine power of the Merciful True Immortal, these convicts would clutch at this last straw, joining the joint escape organization without hesitation.

As for those who had been imprisoned for a long time but still maintained basic self-awareness, they became Kou Hong’s primary targets for united front work.

However, these cultivators had been imprisoned for so long that some were suspicious and unwilling to trust anyone. Each persuasion required a vast amount of time and effort.

Fortunately, the newly joined members also participated.

Therefore, the progress of infiltrating the Nether Prison was not too slow.

Three years later.

The wails echoing from within the Nether Prison were interspersed with the private communications of the escape organization members.

“Brother Kou, how much longer do we have to wait?”

“Yes, except for the deepest part of the Nether Prison, the other areas have basically been breached by our brothers. On the surface, this place still seems to be under the control of the Myriad Immortals Alliance. In reality, with just one command from Brother Kou, the Nether Prison will change hands instantly.”

“These years, with the divine power of the Merciful True Immortal as our protection, we have all recovered our strength. Some brothers have even advanced further. One Void Integration, sixteen Spirit Transformation, a hundred Nascent Soul… In comparison, the defense forces within the Nether Prison are utterly vulnerable.”

“Heh heh heh, it’s not just our cultivation that has been fully restored. With the help of the Merciful True Immortal’s divine power, we can even sneak in all sorts of resources from the outside world. I’ve been eating so much delicious food that I’ve almost gotten sick of it recently.”

…

The group chattered incessantly, but they all exuded confidence about a collective escape from the Nether Prison.

During these three years, having witnessed the divine power displayed by the Merciful True Immortal too many times, they had already become devout believers of the True Immortal.

After much discussion, Kou Hong finally spoke, “Starting the uprising is easy, but what’s more important is what happens after we get out. Once the Nether Prison is breached, the Myriad Immortals Alliance will definitely react immediately and mobilize a large army to search for us.”

“They won’t give us much time to react, so before we flee, we must plan our future arrangements.”

Upon hearing Kou Hong’s words, everyone was taken aback.

“Future arrangements?”

“Could it be a sacred decree from the Merciful True Immortal?”

Although they had joined the organization for three years, they only knew of the Merciful True Immortal’s existence.

They knew nothing of the organization’s true name or its ultimate purpose.

Thus, they all looked at Kou Hong with anticipation.

“Indeed, it is a test from the Merciful True Immortal. Only by completing the test can one truly become a believer of the True Immortal and a member of the organization,” Kou Hong’s tone was filled with a sense of sacred mission.

Then, he transmitted a rather grand formation and a map to everyone.

“Myriad Realms Grand Formation?” The hearts of the cultivators within the Nether Prison trembled slightly upon seeing the name of this formation.

According to the explanation, this formation possessed the ability to envelop heaven and earth and connect myriad realms.

Everyone then studied the map.

The map depicted the territories within the Myriad Immortals Alliance, but with over a hundred small dots marked on it.

As they focused their divine senses on these small points of light, everyone was horrified to discover that these represented small worlds.

Kou Hong also said at this time, “The True Immortal’s test is not difficult. It merely requires some time.”

“Go to each of the small worlds and set up this [Myriad Realms Grand Formation]. Once each formation is completed, they will automatically connect, forming a network. Therefore, as soon as one is completed, we will all know…”

Kou Hong explained meticulously.

At the same time, noticing the doubts of some cultivators in the organization, he explained, “Don’t worry. The chosen small worlds are all worlds inhabited only by mortals. With your strength, you are absolutely capable of suppressing them in a short period. The Merciful True Immortal has also bestowed the divine artifact [Primal Chaos Furnace] to help you transform the small worlds…”

“It can be said that the greatest test this time will be your perseverance and faith.”

Looking at the specific requirements of the test mission, all the cultivators fell into contemplation.

However, they had already been subtly influenced by the power of the Merciful True Immortal. Moreover, considering that once they broke out of the prison, they would inevitably face pursuit from the Myriad Immortals Alliance, hiding in mortal small worlds might not be a bad thing.

Thus, without hesitation, they quickly accepted and began to ponder the details of the plan.

After assigning their respective small worlds, they also discussed every minute detail about how to deal with any sudden situations after escaping the Nether Prison.

Three months later, when a prison guard from the Immortal Alliance escorted another escapee to this place and was about to cast him into a tall cage to suppress and torture him,

He was horrified to see that within the Nether Prison, thousands of pillars were shattering one after another.

Countless heinous prisoners, with ferocious glints in their eyes, locked onto him collectively.

Under the overwhelming oppressive aura, his soul was scattered on the spot.

Those who reacted and rushed to suppress them, the misty prison guards and Immortal Alliance cultivators, were instantly torn to shreds by them.

“Charge out, don’t linger!”

Kou Hong shouted in a low voice, and the group, like ferocious beasts released from their cages, rushed out of the Nether Prison.

All the defensive formations were like mere decorations.

The prisoners who saw the light of day again roared, venting their excitement. However, they did not stop there. After a simple bearing check, they all shot towards their designated small worlds.

In the blink of an eye, a dense group of vicious criminals had vanished without a trace.

Not long after, a special envoy from the Myriad Immortals Alliance was alarmed and led a team to investigate.

Seeing the defensive formations, which showed no signs of forced destruction, he wore an enraged expression.

Squads of black-clothed cultivators, following the footprints of the escaped criminals, set off in pursuit.

The Nether Prison, having experienced such a large-scale escape, was now merely a name.

After the remaining prisoners were transferred, even the entrance to the Nether Prison was no longer concealed.

It was abandoned from that point on.

Time slowly passed, and no one came here again, as if the world had forgotten it.

After an unknown amount of time, Li Fan's figure slowly appeared.

"Suppressed in the deepest part of the Nether Prison, unable to see their face clearly even by me."

"It required three Law Transmitters to personally come for the transfer..."

"Interesting."

Instead of escaping with the other escaped cultivators, Li Fan hid at the entrance. He wanted to thoroughly investigate the object imprisoned in the deepest part of the Nether Prison, which he couldn't approach for the past three years.

It wasn't that the formations in the deepest part were so profound that Li Fan couldn't break them, but rather that the jailers responsible for guarding it were three cultivators at the Tribulation Integration stage working together.

It seemed that solely to suppress that one prisoner, they remained indifferent and did not come out to stop the chaos even when the Nether Prison above was breached and countless villains escaped.

When the reception team from the Myriad Immortals Alliance arrived, during their transfer, Li Fan managed to get a glimpse of the prisoner.

He vaguely felt a sense of familiarity.

However, due to a secret technique obscuring them, he couldn't be completely certain.

"Before the Myriad Spirits Grand Formation is completed, it's still not advisable to stir up more trouble."

"I'll wait for the next life to investigate thoroughly."

"The only thing to do now is to wait for the opportune moment and watch the world turn upside down!"

Li Fan looked towards the distant horizon, seeming to see the Myriad Spirits Grand Formation lighting up in thousands of mortal worlds.

The Myriad Spirits Grand Formation displayed to the villains was not its complete name.

This formation was deduced by the Dissolution Disk within three years.

It represented the highest level of formation that the Dissolution Disk could deduce in its current state.

It was derived from the Heaven and Earth Myriad Spirits Grand Formation that once covered the Spiritual Wood Realm, the Empire, and the Beast Species Realm, and was further deduced to create an astonishing formation.

The full name of the formation is [Heaven and Earth Myriad Spirits, Refining Gods of All Beings].

The primary function of this formation, and the reason why Li Fan went to such lengths to free the prisoners of the Nether Prison and make them work for him, was the four characters: [Refining Gods of All Beings].

It was similar in principle to the Refining Gods of All Beings formation displayed by Song He Song in Ningyuan City when he fought against Senior Brother Zhang in the Immortal Slaying Illusion.

The killing power of both formations was derived from the thoughts and spirits of the myriad spirits and countless beings in heaven and earth.

However, Li Fan's modified version...

Was hundreds of billions of times stronger.

Because the materials consumed were hundreds of billions of times more.

Back then, Song He Song could almost push Senior Brother Zhang into a desperate situation with the power of a city's mortals, forcing him to reveal the secret of his Violet Core Immortality.

Li Fan, on the other hand, used the energy of thousands of small worlds and trillions of beings in the Profound Yellow Realm, solely to be able to block the Faceless True Immortal for a moment.

After the Spiritual Wood Realm was annihilated by the Myriad Immortals Alliance, Li Fan spent the past three years hiding in the Nether Prison, constantly contemplating and reviewing his world-ending plan.

After all, it was his first confrontation with the power of a True Immortal, and even borrowing power and watching from the sidelines meant endless risks.

These were true Immortals who had transcended the mundane, not mere Foundation Establishment cultivators.

If they could be easily tricked, how could they deserve the title of True Immortal?

Failure would mean eternal damnation.

Especially after experiencing the siege by the Myriad Immortals Alliance, displaying unexpected trump cards and directly annihilating the Spiritual Wood Realm, Li Fan had become unprecedentedly cautious about his world-ending plan.

He accounted for every possible scenario.

In doing so, he discovered a problem that he had previously taken for granted and overlooked. In Li Fan's original plan, he would first provoke the power of the Immortals from the Immortal Ruins, and then use this transcendent power to provoke a reaction from the Faceless True Immortal.

Indeed, living beings instinctively react to threats.

In the simulations, the Faceless True Immortal and the Immortals from the Immortal Ruins should have first noticed each other and engaged in battle.

And the instigator of all this, Li Fan, would be ignored.

But this was only under ideal circumstances.

What if, after ascending to Immortality, their thought processes were no longer the same as mortals?

Or what if they sensed the "Returning to Truth" existence within Li Fan?

Instead of immediately locking onto opponents of equal footing, what if they first targeted Li Fan?

If he made no preparations, being targeted by a True Immortal would leave him with no time to even escape to the Nether Realm and forcefully return to the truth.

The more he thought about it, the more restless Li Fan became.

Thus, he finally decided that he needed to find a way, at the very least, to buy himself a sliver of time.

And the [Heaven and Earth Myriad Spirits, Refining Gods of All Beings] formation was the final answer provided by the Dissolution Disk.

Although the gap between cultivators and mortals, and between True Immortals and cultivators, was like a chasm, when the quantity reached a certain level, a terrifying qualitative change could occur.

"Falling into the endless sea of the thoughts and spirits of trillions of beings, even a True Immortal would undoubtedly waver for a moment."

"This moment of daze is the only chance for my escape."

The power of a True Immortal could indeed destroy the Profound Yellow Realm in an instant.

However, if the situation developed as Li Fan predicted, after locking onto him, the True Immortal, in order to capture this ant secretly plotting, would not directly destroy the Profound Yellow Realm.

This would give Li Fan an opportunity.

"Heh heh, thousands of mortal worlds, countless living beings' thoughts and spirits."

"What an immense power. Yet, no matter how I deduce, I can only delay them for a moment."

"This gap in absolute strength..."

"It's truly something to aspire to."

Li Fan stood with his hands behind his back, silent.

With the restraint of the Faceless True Immortal's power, those heinous prisoners would obediently complete the construction of the grand formation.

Li Fan did not need to worry about this.

Once the formation was built, it would no longer be under their control.

"The day the Refining Gods formation is completed will be the day the Profound Yellow Realm is destroyed."

"Soon, within a year."

During this period, Li Fan only needed to wait patiently.

At this final moment of this life, Li Fan still had some loose ends to tie up.

He first arrived at Tianling Prefecture, at the original location of the Five Elements Great Grotto-Heaven.

Since Li Fan had devoured the Five Elements Grotto-Heaven that had been nurturing for who knows how many years, a new Five Elements Grotto-Heaven had begun to form in this formless void called the [Root of Heaven and Earth].

However, the process was extremely long, and it was only now that a nascent grotto-heaven was faintly appearing.

Li Fan strolled through the void, circulating his Heavenly Dao Transmutation divine ability, observing the principles of heaven and earth.

Sensing a rhythm like a beating heart, Li Fan's eyes narrowed as he carefully awaited a prompt from "Returning to Truth".

From this innate treasure of his, Li Fan vaguely sensed a hint of dissatisfaction.

The emotions of "Returning to Truth" were something Li Fan had sensed, more or less, in the past. The tremor when he first encountered an eternal relic, and the longing when facing the skull of Mr. Bai.

Now, after Li Fan attempted to "feed" Returning to Truth with the nascent five-elements grotto-heaven, it transmitted feedback once more.

"Not very satisfied. Meaning, it can barely accept it."

A cold glint flashed in Li Fan's eyes. Countless red threads flew out from his inner grotto-heaven, like billions of tentacles, piercing into the void of the [Root of Heaven and Earth]. From this mother body, he was snatching away the ownership of the newly born grotto-heaven.

The Root of Heaven and Earth was solely responsible for nurturing grotto-heavens. Therefore, as its creation, destined to break away from it, was slowly being stripped away by Li Fan, it did not provoke any violent resistance.

It was the nascent grotto-heaven itself that seemed to sense something. It exerted all its might, sending forth threads of resistance, attempting to prevent Li Fan's consumption. But how could a newborn infant compare to a robust adult brother?

There was no suspense. Amidst the continuous, faint rumbling, the nascent grotto-heaven was pulled into the illusory projection of the five-elements great grotto-heaven, which resembled a background painting. It was completely swallowed and disappeared.

"Buzz, buzz, buzz..." A sharp ringing filled Li Fan's ears, and the scene before his eyes seemed to dim for a moment. When everything returned to normal, Li Fan looked at his Returning to Truth panel.

"Current Anchor Points Available: 3"

"One more has been added. As expected, it was feasible. After devouring the Golden Core laws could no longer satisfy the appetite of Returning to Truth, the next best thing would be a higher-grade Nascent Soul grotto-heaven."

Having verified his guess and added an anchor point for Returning to Truth, Li Fan did not feel any particular joy. Instead, he kept replaying the emotion that Returning to Truth had just conveyed. It was "tasteless to eat, but a pity to discard." However, under Li Fan's insistent demand, Returning to Truth had ultimately swallowed the nascent grotto-heaven.

"Now it's a grotto-heaven, but what will it desire in the future? A small world, an immortal cultivation world? Or the subsequent changes in the new law system, the 'Heaven and Earth's Essence'?"

"However, no matter what, it's time to tease its appetite. Being a picky eater is not a good habit."

In the dark, void space, Li Fan stood alone. After pondering for a long time, he slowly departed.

Emerging from the [Root of Heaven and Earth], Li Fan then proceeded to the location of the bloody river. Thanks to the residual protection of the fishing pond, this place had still not been discovered by the Myriad Immortals Alliance. The surviving cultivators at this stronghold were the last remaining foundation of the United Federation of Ten Thousand Worlds. They were already aware of the complete annihilation of the Lingmu World headquarters. Despite their grief and anger, not a single one of them had wavered in their faith in the Merciful Immortal of Mortal Dust. Because they could still feel the omnipresent, great divine power of the Merciful Immortal through their meditation.

The cultivators Li Fan had dispatched to the bloody river to search for historical fragments were basically young people full of passion, with cultivation not exceeding the early stage of Golden Core. The Myriad Immortals Alliance was powerful. Although their desire for revenge was intense, they knew they were no match for them. Thus, they could only lie low for now, accumulating strength in secret. Without support from headquarters and having lost all their previous reliance, they could only place their hopes of revenge on that vast, bloody river. With firm belief, disregarding the erosion of their own lives, they threw themselves into it again and again, attempting to uncover its mysteries.

Three years passed. Out of the original hundred-plus individuals, only thirty-three survived. And all these survivors had suffered significant damage to their lifespan. Despite their youth, they had all become as white-haired as elderly individuals.

However, they had not been without gains. Li Fan studied the insights they had summarized.

"Compared to those driven purely by self-interest, those burdened by unforgettable hatred are better able to maintain clarity of mind during exploration of the bloody river."

"Projecting the bloody river seems to have a kind of sympathetic attraction. For example, we vengeful individuals are more likely to observe cultivators in history who also harbored immense hatred."

"Besides simply recording light and shadow, it might be possible to truly bring back things that once existed in history. It seems to be a manifestation of the [Bloody River]'s power. However, the trigger probability is extremely low. Since the creation of 'Seeking the Profound,' this phenomenon has only occurred once. Research is underway to determine the conditions required to achieve this goal..."

Li Fan meticulously recorded all this valuable research material. He also made note of the names of the cultivators diligently compiling and recording these results.

Chenchen.

"Not bad. Previously, among the crowd, this person did not stand out much. It was only now, in the desperate situation of the Federation's annihilation, that he finally displayed his leadership abilities."

"He is a promising individual. I can make better use of him in the next life. Hmm, let me see which small world he is from..."

Having achieved his goals at the bloody river, Li Fan did not reveal himself to disturb them. Instead, he allowed those people to continue their mission. After all, a year later, the outcome would be the same regardless.

Li Fan quietly departed and made trips to the Departure Realm, the Imperial Realm, the Nether Realm, and many other locations. He completed the harvesting of his achievements and repeatedly tested and verified his escape plan.

...

The river of time flowed forward. On this day, Li Fan, who was tinkering with a small Heavenly Profound Mirror, suddenly raised his head and looked into the distance.

The first Grand Array of Myriad Spirits of Heaven and Earth had been completed. Li Fan's gaze instantly penetrated layers of spatial barriers, arriving at the mortal world where the great array was located.

The cultivator responsible for the construction of this great array, feeling the reward of increased cultivation bestowed by the Merciful Immortal of Mortal Dust within his body, showed an excited expression. Guided by an unseen force, he immediately activated the great array.

The mortal world here was even larger in scale than Li Fan's hometown, Great Profound. However, as the Grand Array of Myriad Spirits of Heaven and Earth was activated, the originally clear blue sky was suddenly stained with a trace of eerie blood-red color. The blood-red hue spun back and forth in the sky, like a brushstroke, eventually transforming into a bizarre and terrifying colossal bloody eye. The giant eye gazed indifferently at the myriad beings below, like the eye of a god.

All living beings in heaven and earth suddenly felt an extreme sense of dread in their hearts. In their instinctive fear, their bodies trembled uncontrollably, collapsing to the ground. Even though nothing had happened yet, despair had already spread across the land.

Of course, there were beings who dared to resist this bloody giant eye. But all they could do was curse at the heavens, raging impotently.

The cultivator who had single-handedly built this world's Grand Array of Myriad Spirits of Heaven and Earth stared blankly at the bloody giant eye in the sky. He murmured to himself, "No, no, how could this happen?"

"The Grand Array of Myriad Spirits of Heaven and Earth was activated, how could such a strange change occur after the array was formed? Something must have gone wrong."

An extreme sense of unease surged in his heart, and the cultivator was about to shut down the magical array.

But...

It was already too late.

The array, for some unknown reason, suddenly operated on its own.

The bloody giant eye slowly opened, revealing a strange vertical pupil.

Boom!

The entire mortal world trembled violently.

Countless bloody beams of light rose from the Great Earth, like pillars of light, converging into the bloody giant eye in the sky.

After a moment of daze, upon understanding what had just happened, endless despair and fear surged onto the cultivator's face.

Because at the instant the vertical bloody pupil appeared, all living beings in this mortal world were instantly killed.

They turned into bloody light and were absorbed by the bloody pupil.

The cultivator's body trembled incessantly, and an endless chill enveloped his heart.

Although he had committed no small sins in the past, compared to the act of instantly killing all living beings in a realm, it was not on the same level.

"We were all deceived, what 'Benevolent True Immortal'..."

"This is clearly an incredibly terrifying evil god!"

The scenes of the past four years flashed through his mind, and an inexpressible fear gradually engulfed the cultivator.

But at this moment, the last shred of conscience in his heart suddenly awakened him from despair.

Hope flared in the cultivator's eyes, and he suddenly remembered something: "No, I can't let others repeat my mistakes like me. I must quickly go and notify them..."

As the cultivator was about to flee this place in a sorry state.

He found that the vertical bloody pupil in the sky had, at some unknown time, locked onto him.

And just as the cultivator's body grew cold, believing he would die under the blood-red giant eye.

It was as if a gentle breeze swept through heaven and earth, and then a phantom inexplicably materialized.

Instantly, it attracted the gaze of the blood-red vertical pupil in the sky.

Meanwhile, Li Fan, far away in the Xuanhuang Realm, narrowed his eyes.

He was not unfamiliar with the phantom.

"Mr. Bai?"

"Did the sudden outbreak of the Immortal-Mortal Miasma in a short period of time, caused by the simultaneous killing of too many beings, trigger a backlash?"

The phantom stood between heaven and earth. Although its facial expression could not be seen, one could feel boundless anger emanating from it.

The phantom's gaze swept across this world and then locked onto the sole survivor in this place.

Which was the cultivator who had set up the array.

The cultivator immediately felt that he could not move, and a sense of deathly crisis surged into his heart. He struggled to say something.

The phantom did not listen to his explanation at all.

A wave of power instantly crossed a thousand miles, descending from the phantom to the cultivator.

The cultivator's body stiffened abruptly.

Then, strands of hair turned from black to white, his skin wrinkled like dead wood...

In the blink of an eye, the cultivator transformed from a middle-aged appearance to an elder on the verge of his last breath.

And then, he completely turned into a skeleton.

He fell from the sky.

After completing this act of vengeance, Mr. Bai's phantom looked at the empty world where no other living beings existed.

A trace of sadness appeared on its face.

With a final, reluctant glance, it dissipated into the wind.

...

In the Xuanhuang Realm, Li Fan shook his head slightly.

"I didn't expect the Immortal-Mortal Miasma to have such a form."

"No wonder the cultivators in the Xuanhuang Realm quickly agreed to the proposal of mortal migration back then; they must have discovered this secret."

"Every debt has its debtor, and every grievance has its perpetrator. Whoever set up the array, go find them. It has nothing to do with me." Li Fan said with a cold smile.

"It just saves me the trouble of cleaning up."

The demise of one wicked individual did not attract the attention of the other villains.

As one Grand Array after another was established and integrated into the Spirit Refinement Network, Li Fan grew closer to his final goal in this lifetime.

He looked at the countless consciousnesses of living beings within the Spirit Refinement Array. Even as the mastermind behind this, having attained Veracity and deeming himself qualified to disregard everything in the world.

He still felt a chill run down his spine, unable to look directly at it for too long.

"The power of infinite beings is truly terrifying and awe-inspiring."

"I think even a True Immortal would pale in comparison within this sea of beings."

Li Fan's heart, as cold as ten thousand years of ice, actually wavered slightly at this moment.

But soon, his gaze turned firm once more.

"All of this is necessary."

"The immortal path is severed, and even figures like Master of Inheritance, King Xuanyuan, and Mr. Bai are trapped here for eternity."

"Only by finding the true method of liberation can everything be resolved in the end."

"Otherwise, even if I don't act, the Xuanhuang Realm will ultimately face destruction."

...

Li Fan's gaze became utterly indifferent again.

Under his command, the construction speed of the Grand Array of Myriad Spirits accelerated again.

Ultimately, this supreme Grand Array, covering numerous mortal worlds, was completely formed.

And at this moment, five paper figures from the Tribulation Crossing Sect reappeared beside Li Fan.

This time, they did not bother Li Fan.

Instead, they all looked towards the sky of the Xuanhuang Realm.

"How strange. How is it that in the time it took us to take a nap, the Xuanhuang Realm seems to have become somewhat out of control and accelerated?"

"Could it be that the suction of the Immortal Ruins has increased again?"

"This strange thing hasn't happened for so many years. The changes were limited, so we didn't notice it immediately..."

The five little figures chattered amongst themselves, completely ignoring Li Fan's presence.

After a careful observation, Li Fan realized that they were not the same ones who had occasionally advised him when they appeared before.

Instead, they were individuals who had never appeared before.

They seemed to hold a rather high position in the Tribulation Crossing Sect, in charge of monitoring the crisis of the Xuanhuang Realm.

Li Fan had no intention of communicating with them.

Instead, he directly activated the array and forcibly collected them back into the Book of Tribulation Crossing.

"Hmm?"

This sudden action quickly alerted the five little figures.

They stared at Li Fan, and the expressions on their faces slowly turned to fear.

"So you were always..."

"Not good!"

The Book of Tribulation Crossing trembled violently, its pages flipping and turning on their own, as if a large number of paper figures were about to emerge from it.

However, before they could achieve anything, under the constraint of an invisible force.

The five little figures were forcibly pulled into the Book of Tribulation Crossing.

The book then slowly closed.

However, it continued to vibrate and resist.

Li Fan's expression remained unchanged, and he continued to reinforce the sealing array.

Until the Book of Tribulation Crossing was completely still.

"Since you choose to be turtles hiding in their shells, then continue to be so."

"The Xuanhuang Realm does not need you to save it."

Li Fan said lightly and suppressed the Book of Tribulation Crossing in the deepest part of the Five Elements Cave Heaven.

The Grand Array of Myriad Spirits, Spirit Refinement of All Beings, had been completed.

Li Fan cast his final failsafe, and now, he would prepare to launch the ultimate plan.

"After observing for the past year, I have determined that Master of Inheritance is not in the Xuanhuang Realm."

"Just like before."

A good day today. Zhao Xian joyfully signed his name on the golden contract in front and laughed heartily as a wisp of golden light flew into his body, establishing the contract. The elders of the Five Elders Association in the shop also put away their contracts, their faces full of joy, and echoed his sentiments.

For the rest of the afternoon, Zhao Xian continued to negotiate more detailed trade agreements with the Five Elders Association. It wasn't until he had escorted them to a reception mansion in the city to rest that Zhao Xian finally let out a sigh of relief.

Instead of returning to his own residence, he turned back to the shop and entered the secret underground chamber.

Looking at the faceless stone statue hidden in the darkness, Zhao Xian's expression was complex, and his mind was filled with countless thoughts.

Ever since the Myriad Realms United Association was annihilated by the Myriad Immortals Alliance and listed as a target for perpetual pursuit, Zhao Xian, as a hidden operative of the association in Jiushan Prefecture, had been living in constant fear.

He was restless every day, often experiencing hallucinations of the Myriad Immortals Alliance showing up and arresting him.

Without the supplies provided by the United Association, the shop's inventory was also severely affected. The flow of customers declined daily, and it was almost unsustainable. In the end, he had to beg and borrow from everyone he knew, using up all the wealth he had accumulated over the years, just to barely rebuild the supply chain.

"Fortunately, it's all over," Zhao Xian said to himself.

The turmoil surrounding the United Association had subsided.

During the period when the Myriad Immortals Alliance's search was most intense, they had not discovered Zhao Xian's true identity. There should be no danger in the future.

After several years of diligent management, the shop's business had returned to normal. Recently, they had even reached a commercial agreement with a merchant caravan from the Five Elders Association. The fixed trade goods alone were worth tens of millions of contribution points annually.

"Although there are no true immortal rewards anymore, with the shop's profits alone, it's enough to support my cultivation all the way to the Nascent Soul realm."

"The United Association has been destroyed, and the profits do not need to be handed over, all of which I can keep for myself. I'm even living more comfortably than before..." Zhao Xian thought with some pride.

"Indeed, misfortune and fortune are intertwined, and the world is full of changes."

He cast one last glance at the faceless stone statue, and Zhao Xian had already decided to permanently seal off this underground secret chamber. From now on, his secret of once being a member of the Myriad Realms United Association would forever remain unknown.

"True Immortals are merciful; I believe they will not blame me." Zhao Xian performed one last respectful bow and then sealed the secret chamber.

With all this done, Zhao Xian felt as if a great burden had been lifted, as if he had been reborn.

However, on his way back to his residence, he looked up at the azure sky of the Xuanhuang Realm and, for some reason, a sense of unease suddenly surged within him.

Zhao Xian had always been confident in his intuition. He immediately stopped in his tracks.

He carefully recalled every detail of his recent life, pondering for a long time, but Zhao Xian could not find anything amiss.

"Strange..."

The chaotic feeling in his heart grew stronger. Zhao Xian suddenly had a feeling and looked around at the people nearby.

Upon seeing them, he instantly broke out in a cold sweat.

It turned out he wasn't the only one.

In the Free Trade City of Jiushan Prefecture, all the cultivators who were strolling on the streets at that moment seemed to vaguely sense something was wrong. Their minds were in disarray, and their expressions were tense.

Some even had cold sweat dripping from their foreheads and their steps were unsteady.

"This..." Zhao Xian's mind suddenly flashed with the image of ants moving collectively before a torrential downpour.

"Could a catastrophe of immense proportions be about to occur?"

Zhao Xian suddenly and inexplicably remembered the origin of Jiushan Trade Prefecture. Originally, it was a chaotic region with a mixture of people and nine standing mountains. Due to the war between the Myriad Immortals Alliance and the Five Elders Association, the mountains were flattened into plains by a glance from a Heavenly Venerate's Dharma Image. Only then did the current prosperous Jiushan Prefecture come into being.

"Could it be that what happened that day is about to happen again?" The thought surfaced in Zhao Xian's mind, and he couldn't help but shiver.

Although his reason told him that neither the Myriad Immortals Alliance nor the Five Elders Association would engage in war again in Jiushan Prefecture for their mutual interests, the current abnormality made him certain that a disaster was about to occur!

"Flee!"

After just a moment, Zhao Xian made his decision. Yes, he was greedy for wealth. He also wanted to become a great cultivator in the Nascent Soul realm and suppress an area. But the prerequisite for all this was to be able to save his own life. With the skills he had honed in Jiushan Prefecture over the years, even if he became penniless again, he could rise again in another place. Moreover, Zhao Xian had always kept the most valuable items in the shop on his person.

With this in mind, Zhao Xian immediately changed direction. Disregarding the city's ban, he sped towards the border of Jiushan Prefecture.

His abnormal behavior naturally attracted the attention of the cultivators in Jiushan City. As if triggering a chain reaction, for no reason, they also began to flee. It was like the instinctual struggle of wild beasts sensing a mortal danger.

As it turned out, these cultivators' premonitions were not wrong. They had not fled far before a terrifying fluctuation descended from behind them. The sky instantly turned dark. Countless cultivators were swallowed by an unknown terrifying existence before they could even let out a scream.

Feeling the thousands of auras disappearing behind him in an instant, extreme fear occupied his mind. At this moment, his thoughts also began to race at an unprecedented speed.

"A terrible disaster must have descended upon Jiushan Prefecture."

"My strength is clearly insufficient to survive this calamity."

"There is still a long distance to the border of Jiushan Prefecture. There isn't enough time to escape to a safe place."

"The reason Jiushan Prefecture has no teleportation array is because the spatial structure here is extremely unstable. If teleportation is used without authorization, not only will it fail to reach the destination, but one will be randomly teleported to other places, and may even get lost in the void..."

"But there is still hope of survival..." Zhao Xian's thoughts turned rapidly, and his body responded instinctively. He activated the random teleportation array diagram in his storage ring.

The surrounding scenery distorted and blurred. After a brief period of dizziness, Zhao Xian escaped Jiushan Prefecture and arrived in an unfamiliar place. However, the scene before him gave him no joy of escaping death. Instead, he felt as if he had fallen into an ice cellar, his mind blank.

It was as if he were floating in the high sky, looking down upon the Xuanhuang Realm. Thousands of black dots appeared densely on the ground. They were like dark abysses, swallowing everything around them. The entire world seemed to be torn apart by these black dots, forming curled pieces of paper. The cultivators on the ground, no matter how they struggled, could not last for even a moment in the black domains. They all turned into distorted streams of light and disappeared into the black dots.

"So the disaster is not just happening in Jiushan Prefecture?"

"What is this?"

"Is the apocalypse here? Is the world going to be destroyed?" Zhao Xian was stunned.

But soon, his attention was drawn to another wondrous scene that shone alongside this apocalyptic spectacle. Above the Xuanhuang Realm, which was instantly torn into thousands of distorted pieces of paper, a painting resembling countless colored inks splashed randomly suddenly appeared. In this ink painting, countless scenes rapidly changed with each passing moment. And before this bizarre painting, a figure stood with his hands behind his back.

As if sensing Zhao Xian's gaze from afar, the figure turned its head. Before he could even see the other person's face clearly, Zhao Xian's body and soul exploded into countless fragments from being unable to withstand the immense pressure. He died without a complete corpse.

"Hmm?"

A moment later, Li Fan already knew why this unlucky fellow had ended up here. Shaking his head slightly, he no longer paid attention to him and instead focused on the myriad changes in heaven and earth erupting from the Xuanhuang Realm before him.

Those countless black dots were naturally the immortal power of the Immortals that the bait puppets had drawn from the Immortal Ruins after he launched his world-ending plan. The power of the Immortals from the Immortal Ruins was transmitted to the Xuanhuang Realm along the connections of those puppets, causing boundless world-ending disaster.

As Li Fan had expected, the moment the Immortal power of the Immortal Ruins appeared, it triggered a spontaneous reaction from the faceless true immortal statues that Li Fan had placed beside the bait puppets. These faceless true immortal statues had no physical form. Instead, they were condensed by Li Fan from the pure essence of the faceless true immortal's origin power. When the world-ending power of the Immortal Ruins swept towards them, an inexpressible force surged inexplicably from the origin power essence. Like a butterfly breaking free from its cocoon, or a flower falling and bearing fruit. The origin power essence melted away like ice and snow, disappearing directly. Only a force that mortals could not understand took its place and collided with the Immortal power of the Immortal Ruins. It was like two giant waves crashing against each other, stirring up countless splashes. Instantly, the Xuanhuang Realm was torn into thousands of fragments. However, it was precisely because of the struggle between the two that the already scarred Xuanhuang Realm did not immediately shatter.

"It seems my worries were unnecessary."

"The Faceless True Immortal does not seem to have noticed my existence," Li Fan thought to himself.

"Extract the essence of heaven and earth to obtain its spirit." Reciting softly, he absorbed the bizarre ink painting before him into the phantom image of the Five Elements Great Cave Heaven behind him.

Before Li Fan's eyes, scenes of the Xuanhuang Realm's past, present, and future, following its original trajectory, played out like a revolving lantern. In addition, Li Fan also sensed an extremely strong desire to survive and refuse to be reconciled. The scenes spun rapidly like a vortex, as if something was about to be born from them. Upon careful examination, Li Fan actually perceived the Xuanhuang Realm's intent to cooperate.

"The world is dying, no different from living beings."

"Despite discovering that I was impersonating the Heavenly Dao, for a sliver of hope, not only did it not blame me, but it was even willing to cooperate with me..."

"This is something I hadn't expected before."

Li Fan let out a cold snort and did not agree to the Xuanhuang Realm's request. Nor did he directly refuse. Instead, he accelerated the speed of extracting the essence of heaven and earth. As countless impending changes merged into his body, the Five Elements Great Cave Heaven also underwent earth-shattering changes. In stark contrast to the dying Xuanhuang Realm, the Five Elements Great Cave Heaven was experiencing unprecedented prosperity. As the Five Elements circulated, they tended towards fusion. Gold, wood, water, fire, and earth united, and the originally distinct barriers within each cave heaven slowly disappeared. A new world full of infinite vitality was taking shape.

...

At this moment, Li Fan, who was about to successfully advance to the Nascent Soul realm, inexplicably felt a sense of danger. A beam of light arrived instantly from beyond the void.

"No!" After clearly seeing the current state of the Xuanhuang Realm, he let out a roar. Then, in an instant, it crossed the vast spatial distance and locked onto Li Fan. Their eyes met, and both showed a hint of surprise. Li Fan was surprised because he had originally thought it would be a transmission of cultivation technique. He had not expected that the figure appearing in this life... would be the Heavenly Physician. The Heavenly Physician, on the other hand, was surprised as to why Li Fan, the last descendant of the Heavenly Law Realm in name, would appear here. Moreover, he was ruthlessly extracting the essence of heaven and earth from the Xuanhuang Realm.

"He really came back fast," Li Fan sighed inwardly.

"Return to Truth." Li Fan, without any hesitation, silently chanted in his mind. Affected by the Immortal power of the Immortal Ruins, Li Fan's perception was that the bondage of the True Immortal Net on him had loosened. The Heavenly Physician had also discovered him. Therefore, no longer greedy, he directly activated "Return to Truth." The surrounding scenery suddenly became void. At this moment, Li Fan clearly saw the shock on the Heavenly Physician's face, and the light that suddenly erupted in his cloudy eyes.

"What has he discovered?" Li Fan's heart tightened. But the surrounding scenery had almost come to a standstill. Even for the powerful Heavenly Physician, his movements appeared incredibly slow in Li Fan's eyes. A thick mist enveloped all sights. All things in the world were about to turn from true to false, and from real to虛.

At this moment... a brilliant light erupted from the myriad black dots of the Xuanhuang Realm. The Immortal power of the Immortal Ruins, which could easily tear apart the Xuanhuang Realm, was actually suppressed at this moment. In all the static images, only this ray of light was least affected. Even in Li Fan's eyes, it still appeared in slow motion, but it still rushed towards Li Fan at an extremely fast speed.

"Faceless True Immortal!" Li Fan's heart felt as if it were being clutched tightly by a hand. The threat of the Heavenly Physician was instantly forgotten. "He finally discovered me..."

"All spirits of heaven and earth, refine the divine consciousness of all beings!" A bloody giant net spread out beside Li Fan. Layer upon layer, densely packed. It was clearly countless ferocious human faces. The red giant net originated from Li Fan and expanded outwards wildly. In the net lived beings, billions upon billions, simultaneously emitting their death cries. The brilliant light ignored the red giant net and moved towards Li Fan with unwavering determination. Li Fan had never felt that the activation of "Return to Truth" was so slow. Seeing the brilliant white light about to reach his eyes, his body became stiff and cold. Even his thoughts froze. Fortunately... the red giant net did provide a slight obstruction. The instant before the brilliant light locked onto Li Fan, Li Fan successfully activated "Return to Truth." All scenes became illusory. Only that ray of brilliant white light remained dazzling.

...

Anchored for one year. On the peak of Jie Li Mountain. Li Fan, having narrowly escaped death, was drenched in sweat, gasping for breath. "Is this the might of a True Immortal?" "The willpower of billions of living beings is so powerless before it." Just as Li Fan was thinking this, he suddenly felt something strange about his body. He was not seeing with his eyes at this moment, because... Li Fan reached out and touched his face, and his body trembled slightly. His face had disappeared.

Here's the translation of the provided chapter, adhering to your specifications:

Chapter 1127: Immortal Power Turns to Nothingness

[This simulation has ended]

[You can choose one of the following options to keep:

1. An item you possessed in this simulation.

2. Your cultivation realm in this simulation.

3. The simulated memories of a person closely related to you. This memory can be passed on to that person.

4. Give up the above choices and speed up the charging progress.]

…

The prompt truly appeared “before” Li Fan’s eyes, but he had no inclination to make a choice now.

Instead, he was feeling the changes happening to his body.

Just like the hunger he felt after being exposed to the Immortal Ruins’ immortal power, even after returning to truth, he still felt an intense hunger.

This time, Li Fan, who had returned to truth in a sorry state under the radiant immortal power of the Faceless True Immortal, was also unable to completely escape the erosion of True Immortal power with just one return to truth.

“The side effect brought by the Immortal Ruins’ immortals was a sense of hunger that wanted to devour everything around. As for the Faceless True Immortal…”

Li Fan carefully felt around his face.

It was as if a layer of skin had been plastered on, covering all his facial features.

Only the sense of touch remained.

Although his divine sense assisted in perception, it did not impede his normal actions and daily life.

However, it still made Li Fan feel a slight chill in his heart.

“Not only has my face disappeared, but also…”

Li Fan looked at his body with his divine sense.

It occasionally showed a faint, translucent quality, like a specter.

“My [existence] is also disappearing.”

He had just returned to the anchor point of one year, and the power of returning to truth was still being charged. If he died now, it would be truly over, with no chance to try again.

Facing such a desperate situation, Li Fan did not panic.

Instead, he calmly and rapidly thought.

His previous experience of diluting the effects of the Immortal Ruins’ immortal power through multiple returns to truth made him understand that the influence the Faceless True Immortal had imposed on him this time could likely also be resolved through multiple returns to truth.

This did not mean that the ability of [Return to Truth] was becoming strained when facing a True Immortal. It was simply that Li Fan himself was too weak.

But now, several critical issues lay before Li Fan.

“First, returning to truth requires charging. And before that, if I don’t do something, I’m afraid I won’t last that long.”

“Second, under the radiant immortal power of the Faceless True Immortal, I have become like this. Compared to when I was an envoy of a True Immortal in my previous life, her influence on me now is even deeper. This means…”

“From the very beginning of this life, I have fallen into the True Immortal’s net. Based on the experiences at the end of my previous life, even if I trigger changes in the myriad things of the Xuanhuang world, it might not attract the attention of the Faceless True Immortal. But once I activate Return to Truth, I will inevitably draw her in.”

…

Li Fan walked out of the wooden house on the mountain peak and came to the boundless sea of clouds.

Looking at the red sun rising in the sky, Li Fan felt no warmth as the sunlight shone down.

Instead, a chill uncontrollably crept into his heart.

Li Fan sat quietly on the edge of the cliff, thinking earnestly.

At the same time, he seemed to be waiting for something.

Until the sun reached its zenith, after a full half-day had passed, the Great Xuan Dissolution Mountain remained calm and peaceful. No accidents occurred.
