"The million strong Azure Profound Army, although I have strictly forbidden spreading it, the 'Immortal Heart Incantation' is likely to be leaked. Are you not worried, fellow Daoist?" Shang Shaojun looked at Li Fan with puzzlement.

He could not understand Li Fan's series of actions since arriving at the Eternal Immortal Fortress. It was neither for fame nor for profit.

"The cultivators of Xuanhuang treasure their own skills. Although it is influenced by the fact that one cannot cultivate multiple techniques concurrently, the inner cognition of cultivators has changed unconsciously. The grand scene of people sitting together to discuss the Dao and share with each other during the ancient cultivation era is no longer visible. I dislike this very much." The Holy Embryo Li Fan said indifferently. Coupled with his actions in front of outsiders, he indeed had an otherworldly and transcendent demeanor.

"So be it. As long as it aligns with my wishes, even if it's an immortal method, so what?" Shang Shaojun looked at Li Fan's figure, lost in thought. Such magnanimity was truly rare in the world. Being with someone like this, Shang Shaojun even felt himself becoming more heroic.

...

All matters in the Eternal Immortal Fortress had been handled, and there were no more concerns. Shang Shaojun and Li Fan stood outside the Eternal Immortal Fortress, looking at the vast white mist.

"Where do we go next?" Shang Shaojun felt a sense of confusion as he inexplicably took on the burden of "saving the Xuanhuang Realm" and was about to embark on the journey. However, things had come to this point, and he could not go back on his word. Shang Shaojun glanced at Li Fan beside him, quite certain that if he reneged now, the other party would definitely strike him down with a sword.

"The safety of Xuanhuang rests entirely on me. This feeling..." "It's not bad," Shang Shaojun mused inwardly. Li Fan, however, extended his hand, and a small sword, no longer than his palm, instantly appeared in his hand. It seemed to be sensing something and was constantly rotating. Finally, the tip of the sword pointed in one direction and stopped. Shang Shaojun looked in the direction indicated by the small sword.

"Everything that exists must leave a trace. Although that mysterious figure is incomparably powerful, as long as they appear in the Xuanhuang Realm, they will inevitably become entangled with reality. By chasing him, we can find more evidence," Li Fan said with shining eyes. Shang Shaojun felt that Li Fan's words made sense and readily agreed. However, he did not know that the direction pointed by Li Fan's small sword was not to track the mysterious figure at all. Instead, it pointed to one forbidden area after another that Li Fan had explored in his memory. Of course, their paths would eventually lead to the same destination. They were bound to find much evidence there that the Xuanhuang Realm was being modified.

...

Just as the Holy Embryo Li Fan was guiding Shang Shaojun to uncover the hidden truth of the Xuanhuang Realm, in the minor world of Da Qi, Yin Shangren's experimental base had been initially established. "The last time I saw Mr. Bai, he told me that after completing my Foundation Establishment technique, I might be able to achieve [Primordial Golden Core], [Physical Body Nascent Soul], or [Mind Manifestation Godhood]. You might want to use this concept as a reference for your derivations," the clone Li Ping said to Yin Shangren. Yin Shangren had just performed a bizarre act in front of Li Ping. His body split open, and another self struggled out from within. Then, he turned around and devoured his own flesh and blood with his mouth. The sound of flesh and bones being chewed echoed in the experimental base. Yin Shangren's face was covered in blood, but his expression was incredibly calm. As he ate himself, Yin Shangren's eyes were filled with focus, as if he were conducting research rather than eating. Even Li Ping, with countless past memories, felt a slight chill looking at Yin Shangren at this moment. It had nothing to do with courage; it was simply contrary to human nature. After slowly chewing and swallowing the other self completely, Li Ping noticed that Yin Shangren's apparent cultivation realm had dropped from the Foundation Establishment stage to the Qi Refining stage. At this point, Yin Shangren wiped his blood-covered hands on his clothes and explained, "To derive the subsequent cultivation methods, one must first walk on the correct path. My Foundation Establishment technique was only half successful, so I had to destroy the foundation and cultivate anew." He looked up at the sky and said, "It might cause some trouble, but leave it to me." As Yin Shangren spoke these words, Li Ping instantly felt something descending upon the capital city of Shengjing. Having cultivated the Heavenly Emperor's Qi Scripture, he had fused the entire dynasty's fortune into one. Li Ping, at this moment, represented the Da Qi Dynasty alone. Any external intrusion would naturally not escape his senses. It felt like cold worms slowly crawling on his skin, probing with their sharp stingers, trying to penetrate the minor world of Da Qi.

"Oh? This place seems to have formed its own system. Perhaps their retaliation will be weaker than expected," Yin Shangren said at this moment. Li Ping knew that "they" referred to the remnant souls of the old world. It seemed that Yin Shangren's forceful destruction and alteration of his own state had attracted the attention of his own kind. The sound of dripping rain began. However, no raindrops fell. Unbeknownst to him, a thick layer of dark clouds had formed above Li Ping's head, covering the experimental base. The hard Xuanwu stone ground, under the sound of dripping rain, suddenly became as muddy as soil. Pale arms, one after another, abruptly emerged from the ground. Li Ping frowned slightly, intending to float up and evade. However, in this peculiar space, which had been distorted and altered, he found himself unable to fly. Fortunately, the targets of these worldly spirits were not him. To him, those arms were merely illusory existences. Countless arms crawled on the ground, swarming towards Yin Shangren. Yin Shangren, however, revealed a sinister smile. He yanked out the nearest arm, put it into his mouth, and began to devour it with large bites.

I have to go to the hospital for another check-up at 7:30 tomorrow. Although the Golden Alliance is important, life is more important.

Chapter 1155: Burying the Past, Opening a New Path

The clone Li Ping clearly saw that the severed arms torn apart by Yin Shangren’s teeth did not bleed.

Instead, they were filled with black pus.

Within the pus, countless faces, resembling tiny tentacles, let out sharp, chilling wails. Yet, Yin Shangren ignored them, swallowing them whole.

*Puff…*

Yin Shangren’s skin seemed to be cut open by sharp blades, and the tentacles he had swallowed re-emerged from his body.

However, this time, all the faces had transformed to resemble Yin Shangren!

Li Ping hid in a corner of this mutated space, quietly observing the changes in the arena.

On the surface, it appeared to be Yin Shangren’s frenzied act of cannibalism.

In reality, it was the intermingling and collision of different fragmented world laws.

However, unlike the fusion of laws in the Abyssal Chasm, where carefully selected portions were intended for integration into the Xuanhuang Realm, here…

It was chaos, disorder, and destruction.

It was like being thrown into a garbage heap, desperately fighting to the death for a sliver of a chance at survival.

The struggle of the world’s spirits did not last long.

Perhaps because this world was not the Xuanhuang Realm itself, or perhaps due to the protective aura of the Great Qi Dynasty, the spirits that descended were much weaker than Yin Shangren.

After he devoured all the arms scattered on the ground.

The cracked surface of his body slowly began to heal.

“It’s been so long since I enjoyed such a delicacy. I truly missed it.”

Yin Shangren’s voice was no longer the strange dual tone from before but had returned to that of a normal person.

However, the aura he unintentionally exuded made Li Ping, who already possessed the battle prowess of a peak Nascent Soul cultivator, feel as if he were standing on a bed of needles, filled with dread.

Yin Shangren harbored no hostility. After resolving the threat of the spirits, he directly began to cultivate the [Foundation Building with My Own Being].

Li Ping narrowed his eyes. From his perspective, the fluctuations of laws around Yin Shangren were rapidly diminishing.

They were not disappearing mysteriously but were being slowly absorbed into Yin Shangren’s body.

Yin Shangren’s form flickered like a wisp of smoke, constantly shifting. Faces he had previously absorbed reappeared on the surface of his skin.

Fear surged as they struggled to break free from his body.

It looked as if hundreds of fleshy tumors had protruded from Yin Shangren’s body simultaneously, on the verge of bursting, a horrifying sight.

But Yin Shangren remained resolute.

He sat in meditation with absolute stillness, showing no panic.

Slowly, as if being pulled by some force, those faces retreated back into his body.

One by one, the tumors disappeared, and Yin Shangren’s appearance gradually returned to normal.

When the overflowing aura of laws that Li Ping sensed completely vanished, Yin Shangren abruptly opened his eyes.

His gaze was different from his usual madness and obsession; it was now like a deep pool, clear and serene.

“Foundation Building with My Own Being,” he looked at his hands, lost in thought.

“How does it feel?” Li Ping asked.

Yin Shangren did not reply. Instead, he pointed directly at Li Ping.

*Boom!*

Nine golden dragons suddenly appeared, roaring as they protected Li Ping.

Beneath Li Ping’s feet, a mud pit had appeared at some unknown time.

Li Ping was silently being swallowed by the mud pit.

And in Li Ping’s perception, the overall destiny of the Great Qi Dynasty was now like a small hole had been punctured in it, constantly leaking away.

Although the rate of destiny loss was slow, there was no way to stop it for the moment. The golden dragons circled, emitting a protective light, shielding Li Ping above the mud pit.

He did not counterattack but instead clicked his tongue in admiration. “Mister’s methods are extraordinary.”

Yin Shangren waved his hand, and the mud pit beneath Li Ping vanished instantly. “This is the most venomous curse and resentment of a world on the brink of death.”

“In the past, for me to manifest such a curse, my own being would be significantly affected. I would at least be mentally unclear for over half a year. But now…”

Yin Shangren held his finger up to his eyes.

At his fingertip, the mud pit reappeared.

It was firmly bound, swirling within the range of his index finger.

“Everything within my being is the foundation for cultivation.”

“I can do as I please, reaching it with a mere thought,” Yin Shangren murmured.

Next, Yin Shangren explained in detail to Li Ping his feelings after undergoing Foundation Building with My Own Being and his understanding of the path of the “New New Law.”

“The new law of the Heavenly Venerable of Transmitting Dharma, in essence, is like inexplicably placing a shackle on everyone in the world, built upon the existing cultivation system. As long as one cultivates, this shackle becomes a part of you. And all the obstacles on the path of cultivation ahead have had holes of specific shapes dug out.”

“Only by wearing the shackle and fitting the specific shape can one pass through.”

As Yin Shangren spoke, characters appeared out of thin air before him, spontaneously gathering and recording.

“And the new path of Foundation Building with My Own Being is to integrate this shackle imposed upon oneself!”

“When facing obstacles, you can transform and adapt to any difficulty…”

Yin Shangren painted a very detailed picture, and Li Ping listened very attentively.

“For example, if you also wished to cultivate [Foundation Building with My Own Being], you would likely have to refine and absorb this entire dynasty into your body…” he suddenly said.

Li Ping pondered for a moment, as if enlightened. “If that were the case, then my Heavenly Emperor Qi Codex and the billions of subjects of the Great Qi would likely remain frozen at the moment of my absorption.”

“Foundation Building with My Own Being, burying all one’s past to achieve a future of infinite possibilities…”

Yin Shangren clapped his hands in praise. “Precisely!”

The characters before him finally solidified, forming a thin booklet. Yin Shangren held this booklet of insights, his face filled with joy.

Even though he had summarized the insights himself and was intimately familiar with them, Yin Shangren still flipped through it several times with great delight.

However, as he looked at the blank pages that followed, a look of difficulty appeared on his face.

“Primordial Golden Core. What is Primordial?”

…

Myriad Immortals Alliance, Alliance Headquarters.

Since Yan Huan’s departure, no other outsiders had entered the Dharma Derivation Space.

Clearly, the impact of the previous curse attack had not yet subsided, and Yan Huan had only been granted special permission that time.

Five hundred years of guarding was not easily endured.

Therefore, the two Elder Guardians, Zhang Xu and Hua Yueye, each had their unique techniques for passing the time.

Zhang Xu, within his sea of consciousness, manifested a mortal world.

He then sealed his sensory perception with a wisp of his consciousness and plunged into it, experiencing all sorts of wonderful lives in reincarnation.

Hua Yueye, on the other hand, differentiated into another self.

The "two" sat and debated, sparring with each other.

No one understood oneself better than oneself, thus their hearts were in perfect harmony, and they enjoyed themselves immensely.

As for Li Fan, he did not play with such elaborate tricks.

He was studying the latest array derivation results of the Ultimate Dissolution Disc while simultaneously monitoring the experiences around the Holy Embryo and his clone.

So when Li Fan heard Elder Yin's insights on Foundation Establishment, Li Fan's true body instantly knew at the same time.

"Burying all of one's past to establish an infinite path to the future?"

Li Fan pondered in silence.

He suddenly thought of his "Returning to Truth" treasure. From his previous successful act of establishing a new path foundation with a portion of "Returning to Truth" through "Hundred Lifetimes Establish True Foundation," it seemed "Returning to Truth" had already merged with him.

"Meaning, if I want to complete 'Establish Foundation with Myself,' I must encompass the entirety of 'Returning to Truth'..."

As this thought arose, Li Fan found it rather absurd. When "Returning to Truth" is activated, everything in the world instantly turns from reality to虚, returning to the anchor point of records. Even True Immortals are no exception.

"After Elder Yin established his foundation with himself, he could freely apply the laws of the residual souls of his world. By the same reasoning, if I were to succeed in establishing my foundation..."

"I would no longer need to rely on 'Returning to Truth.' Limitations like anchor points and energy replenishment could be ignored. Worlds would be created and destroyed with a thought, and I could return to any desired time node at any moment..."

"This ability."

"There probably isn't a stronger Foundation Establishment stage than this, right?" Li Fan shook his head inwardly.

"This creates a paradox."

"If I already possessed such an ability, what would be the point of pursuing new paths? Punching out the Dharma Transmitters and trampling the Faceless would be as easy as lifting a hand."

"Without a special method to help me understand and analyze the essence of 'Returning to Truth' in advance, this would be a dead end for me."

"Sometimes, having too strong a foundation isn't necessarily a good thing."

Li Fan inadvertently glanced towards the Hall of Natural History. Earlier, when discussing with Elder Yin, the elder had proposed a feasible method to steal Mr. Bai's skull.

Lure the Tiger away from the Mountain, luring Di Sanmo out of the Immortal Alliance Headquarters. Then, replace the original with a counterfeit skull.

"Mr. Bai sacrificed his own life to reverse heaven and earth, and all the spiritual essence on his person dissipated, rendering him no different from the bones of an ordinary mortal."

"Well... except for being a bit harder in texture."

"So, as long as we can replicate an identical skull and swap it without damaging the restrictions, it might be possible to retrieve Mr. Bai's skull without anyone noticing."

"Although this is the theory, putting it into practice..." Elder Yin shook his head and never mentioned it again.

But Li Fan had never forgotten. He was also very sure that Mr. Bai's remains showed no abnormalities. Not only could the phantom souls in Elder Yin's world not detect anything unusual, but even the Celestial Xuan Mirror, after appraising Mr. Bai's ribs, had only given a minimum price of 1 Contribution Point.

"But the skull is an exception."

"With Mr. Bai's eternal residual thought, it is bound to be extraordinary."

"During the use of the eternal residual thought, 'Returning to Truth' is impossible. The eternal residual thought cannot be brought back for use in the next life. Therefore..."

A faint gleam flashed in Li Fan's eyes.

"The best method is the same as when I stole the Primordial Yellow Embryo in the previous life: create a relatively safe environment that others cannot attend to."

"Regarding the 'Lure the Tiger away from the Mountain' method, what Di Sanmo truly cares about might hold the answer within the Fallen Immortal Realm."

"And a theft at the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance Headquarters, where they would be unable to attend to other matters..."

"The conspiracy of Dharma Transmission is exposed, forcing its appearance into the world, drawing the attention of the entire Primordial Yellow Realm."

A rough outline of a conspiracy instantly took shape within the original plan.

"To force him to appear and explain, using the world-suppressing, mysterious power of Dharma Transmission, it would be unrealistic to rely solely on strength. Only by threatening the Primordial Yellow Realm, which he cares about, can we achieve it..."

"It's just that this time, I won't be the villain." In the chessboard, all the pieces were in place, waiting for Li Fan to make his move.

...

Just as Li Fan was hiding in dark corners, making all sorts of unspeakable plans, the sliver of divine consciousness he had split off and attached to Wu Ninglu discovered something quite interesting.

This Wu Ninglu was actually pregnant!

During her moments of focused cultivation, Li Fan's divine consciousness meticulously examined the fetus in her womb, confirming that it was indeed the offspring of Sun Ang, the identity Li Fan currently occupied.

"However, it has been sealed by a secret art, halting its growth."

"This woman is also quite interesting." After observing for a period, Li Fan found that Wu Ninglu was not as simple-minded as Sun Ang appeared. Her marriage into the Sun family seemed to have another purpose. The previous accidental leakage of news about Sun Ang's breakthrough to the Dao Integration realm, which led to Sun Ang being forced to participate in guarding the Dharma Derivation Jade for five hundred years, was precisely to keep Sun Ang away. And all the benefits Sun Ang gained by sacrificing himself were enjoyed by this woman. She used these precious resources to cultivate with all her might. Her cultivation progress in one month was higher than in the past three years. Li Fan's divine consciousness even vaguely sensed that she would soon break through to the peak of the Soul Transformation stage.

And on this day, Wu Ninglu, who had been in seclusion at home, finally showed her hand. As if she had transformed into someone else, Wu Ninglu walked towards the mirror in the room, her slender fingers caressing her face. Her eyes were distant, yet occasionally flashed with a hint of malevolence.

"Elder sister is living quite well, isn't she? Her cultivation speed is even faster than mine..."

Wu Ninglu's expression changed again, her smile disappearing: "Wu Ningjiu, are you crazy! Possessing me at this time, aren't you afraid of being discovered by the Sun family!" She tried to lower her voice, but her trembling body indicated her current anger.

Wu Ningjiu regained control of the body, still smiling broadly: "Elder sister, I'm not as idle as you think. Without the elders' instructions, how would I dare to contact you so easily?"

"Listen carefully, we've received the latest news: within three months, that treasure will return to the Sun family. At that time, you need to ascertain the treasure's hiding place." Wu Ningjiu's voice grew quieter, eventually becoming inaudible.

The restored Wu Ninglu's expression was uncertain. Finally, she stomped her foot fiercely, as if making a decision.

Li Fan's divine consciousness, having observed the entire scene from beginning to end, became instantly interested.

"The Sun family's treasure? I haven't heard of any remarkable items in the Sun family." The divine consciousness transformed into a wisp and infiltrated Wu Ninglu's sea of consciousness. Although she had been trained and had strong defenses against divine sense intrusions, how could she escape Li Fan's deliberate attack?

Before long, Li Fan had found the answer he was looking for. This made him, who was originally bored and slightly interested, become somewhat serious.

"Could it be, like the Kun Gan Bone Hand, a suspected existence derived from an Immortal Artifact?"

"Quite interesting." This treasure of the Sun family also possessed the supreme might unique to legendary immortal artifacts.

Chapter 1157: A Different Kind of Profound Sky Artifact

Regarding the Sun family's treasured artifact, Wu Ninglu did not know its specific name or form.

However, based on the history of the Sun family's rise, it was very likely that the artifact's abilities were related to deduction and foresight!

About a thousand years ago, the Sun family was merely an ordinary small cultivation family.

The strongest person in the clan was merely at the Nascent Soul stage.

But from a certain day forward, the Sun family seemed to suddenly strike it rich. Not only did they break through several Deity Transformation stages consecutively, but by chance, they also saved a heavily injured Dao Integration cultivator.

Under the protection of this Dao Integration grand cultivator, the Sun family soared to unprecedented heights.

The Sun family's sudden rise naturally attracted the attention of many forces. On the surface, it seemed to be purely based on luck.

But not everyone thought so.

Especially the forces behind the scenes who designed and ambushed the Dao Integration cultivator saved by the Sun family.

It was precisely these forces that instructed Wu Ninglu to risk her chastity and infiltrate the Sun family.

The Chen family, one of the largest families in Tianquan Prefecture. Many of its members were skilled in alchemy and held numerous important positions in the Pill Hall of the Myriad Immortal Alliance.

At that time, it was merely due to an old grudge that they plotted to kill the Dao Integration cultivator. However, a plan that should have been foolproof was disrupted by a mere Nascent Soul cultivator!

After eliminating possibilities, they confirmed there was no leak. Furthermore, the Sun family's Nascent Soul cultivator, on the day of the incident, suddenly used a teleportation array to cross several prefectures and waited on the path where the heavily injured Dao Integration cultivator was fleeing.

It was as if he had known this would happen!

All of this was too illogical. From then on, the Chen family set their sights on the Sun family.

Under the system of the Immortal Alliance, although the two families had vastly different strengths, the Chen family did not dare to directly kill for treasure. Especially after the heavily injured Dao Integration cultivator recovered and vaguely suspected the Chen family's involvement.

When the Chen family had dealt with all their troubles and recovered their senses.

The Sun family had already established connections with important figures in the Immortal Alliance headquarters, relocated from another prefecture to Tianquan Prefecture, and even had a Dao Integration cultivator born within their family.

The Sun family's rise was too rapid. The coincidences along their path to prosperity further convinced the Chen family that the Sun family must be hiding some extraordinary treasure.

However, the Sun family acted with great caution. Since their foundation became stable, they rarely used that treasure.

Although the Chen family coveted it, they could not find a suitable opportunity to act.

Even within the clan, this matter was gradually forgotten.

It was not until fifty years ago, when the Sun family once again made a splash in the Myriad Immortal Alliance, that their buried memories were reawakened.

On the way to the Law Enforcement Hall of the Immortal Alliance headquarters, merely by brushing past, the Sun family patriarch recognized the identity of a spy from the Five Elders Society who had infiltrated.

He directly made his move, engaging in a fight with the other party.

This matter naturally alerted the higher-ups of the Immortal Alliance, who apprehended them both. After an investigation, it was discovered that the Sun family patriarch's identification was indeed true!

The spy from the Five Elders Society, possessing a Law Summoning Jade Token, had been ordered to attack the Law Derivation Jade with a "vile curse."

Fortunately, it was detected in time, thus averting a disaster!

After this incident, the Sun family further advanced, gaining influence within the Law Enforcement Hall.

The Chen family, on the other hand, refocused their attention on the Sun family.

After investigating past events, the spy from the Five Elders Society had been well-hidden all along. Even his close friends and family had never suspected his identity.

But such a seemingly perfect spy was recognized by the Sun family patriarch at a glance!

Although during the subsequent interrogation, the Sun family patriarch insisted it was his intuition, and the Myriad Immortal Alliance's thorough investigation ruled out the possibility of the Five Elders Society staging it, the incident left many bewildered.

In the end, it had to be attributed to the Sun family's "good luck."

However, the elders of the Chen family who still remembered the events of that year immediately recalled their suspicions from that time.

Following this, a conspiracy surrounding the Sun family's treasured artifact slowly unfolded.

After decades of probing, the Chen family had grasped several important clues. First, the artifact might not be complete; the Sun family had been secretly searching for something over the years. Second, each time the artifact displayed its abilities, it seemed to require some form of replenishment. After each astonishing performance by the Sun family, the Sun family patriarch would mysteriously disappear for a period. Third, the activation of the artifact seemed to come at the cost of consuming the Sun family's bloodline. Over the years, several Sun family scions had vanished without a trace, their whereabouts unknown, their deaths unconfirmed.

Despite possessing much information, the Chen family had long hesitated to seize it. This was naturally due to the artifact's suspected ability of "foresight." If they were unsuccessful, they would expose themselves and perhaps lose the chance to obtain this treasured artifact forever.

It was not until recently that the Chen family, who had been patiently waiting, finally welcomed their optimal opportunity.

Their informants discovered the whereabouts of the Sun family patriarch. It seemed he had sustained some injuries while helping to replenish the artifact. To prevent any unforeseen circumstances, he would likely cease his outdoor activities and return home as soon as possible to recuperate.

The artifact was still in its cooldown period, and the Sun family's strongest member, the patriarch, was severely injured.

This was simply a godsend!

Therefore, the Chen family, risking discovery, ordered the contact with Wu Ninglu to constantly monitor the Sun family patriarch's movements.

...

"I never expected the animosity between the two families to continue for nearly a thousand years."

Having understood the entire sequence of events, Li Fan's interest in the so-called Sun family treasured artifact grew even more.

It was none other than the fact that the Sun family patriarch's several performances bore too many similarities to Li Fan's own past actions.

Li Fan achieved foresight by reversing reality.

What would be the ability of the Sun family's treasured artifact?

Li Fan did not have to wait long.

More than ten days later, Li Fan's divine sense keenly detected a somewhat scattered Dao Integration aura returning to the Sun family.

Leaving Wu Ninglu's body, Li Fan locked onto the other party's location and stealthily approached him.

Despite the Sun family patriarch's extreme caution, the formations and restrictions he had set up were like nothing before Li Fan.

He did not realize that a wisp of divine consciousness had followed him and entered the secret chamber.

"Cough, cough."

The Sun family patriarch, Sun Luyuan, a Dao Integration cultivator, coughed up a few wisps of blood.

However, he disregarded his injuries, his eyes filled with heartache as he took out an object and carefully placed it back in its position.

Then, he cut open a wound on his wrist and used his blood for refinement.

And when Li Fan saw this object, the main body and the clone, thousands of miles away, both trembled slightly at the same time.

"This is..."

"The Profound Sky Mirror?"

The object Sun Luyuan was irrigating with his blood bore a striking resemblance to the Profound Sky Mirror.

However, in previous encounters, the light representing the Profound Sky Mirror's power was mostly green.

But now, the small mirror in the secret chamber emitted a strange black radiance.

There might be one more chapter around 1:30 AM. Don't wait up.

The divine sense of Li Fan stared intently at the strange mirror not far away.

"Not only does the appearance resemble it, but even the aura..."

With the origin of a Heaven Profound Mirror by his side, Li Fan was very familiar with the Heaven Profound Mirror.

But the strange little mirror at this moment gave him the feeling it was like a twin brother of the Heaven Profound Mirror!

Li Fan's mind trembled, his thoughts racing.

"The Heaven Profound Mirror was formerly known as the Profound Sky Mirror. During the Profound Sky Sect era, the King of Profound Sky obtained it from the ascension channel. It is an artifact left from the Immortal Realm."

"Then what is this one before me?"

Li Fan, at this moment, couldn't help but have the urge to step forward and investigate.

However, after contemplating for a moment, he ultimately stopped.

This black Heaven Profound Mirror always gave him a sense of inexplicable unease.

Li Fan decided to first observe the situation.

Drip, drip, drip, the blood falling onto the mirror continued. Sun Luyuan's complexion was already somewhat pale, but he still had no intention of stopping.

Li Fan could even see fear in his eyes, and his arm tremble slightly as he tried to withdraw it, yet he was somehow unable to control his actions.

It wasn't until the mirror surface erupted with a strange fluctuation, and the black light receded, that Sun Luyuan collapsed onto the ground as if exhausted.

He took out several pills and swallowed them. After a period of adjustment, his complexion returned to normal.

Sun Luyuan looked at the small mirror emitting wisps of faint light before him, his eyes flashing with a mixture of greed and fear.

It was unknown what he was thinking.

After a long while, his stiff body began to move again.

From his embrace, he took out another small mirror.

He adjusted the angle of the mirror surface, facing the black small mirror.

This newly taken out one was, naturally, the small Heaven Profound Mirror.

Li Fan clearly saw wisps of green light being absorbed from the surface of the Heaven Profound Mirror and then flowing into the black small mirror.

And after absorbing from the small Heaven Profound Mirror, the black mirror seemed to become even more like the Heaven Profound Mirror.

Sun Luyuan seemed to be calculating the time.

After a while, as the black mirror was still devouring, his expression slightly changed, and he quickly formed a hand seal to retrieve the Heaven Profound Mirror.

But how could the black mirror, which was ravenously feasting, let go?

A wisp of black mist suddenly emerged from the mirror surface, transforming into a human figure, roaring at Sun Luyuan, "It's not enough!"

"I want to eat more!"

A powerful fluctuation emanated from the human figure of the black mirror, sweeping through the entire secret chamber like a storm.

Sun Luyuan gritted his teeth, persisting in retrieving the Heaven Profound Mirror.

At the same time, he said to the human figure of the black mirror, "‘Little Brother’, control your true heart! Swallowing too quickly at once will alert the Heaven Profound Mirror, and then all our efforts will be in vain!"

Upon hearing Sun Luyuan's words, the human figure of the black mirror seemed to regain a shred of rationality.

Its form flickered continuously, as if resisting itself.

After a period of struggle, it finally suppressed its inner desires.

"Brother, I am in too much pain..."

"Brother, I can't hold on anymore."

"Brother, quickly let me out!"

Crying, pleading, hatred...

Various emotions appeared on the figure of the black mirror in succession.

But no matter what its attitude, every sentence began with the word "Brother."

And Sun Luyuan also seemed to be suffering immensely from these calls.

In the end, he could only close his eyes and once again use his own vital blood to irrigate it, calming the resentment of the human figure of the black mirror.

Having received the vital blood, the black mirror returned to a state of calmness.

Sun Luyuan, as if relieved of a heavy burden, collapsed to the ground, showing none of the demeanor of a Integration cultivator.

It took him nearly half a day to recover.

He stood before the black mirror again, chanting silently.

As Sun Luyuan manipulated it, a beam of light erupted from the black mirror.

Within it, countless characters and images flashed rapidly.

Sun Luyuan, as if parched, watched intently, afraid of missing even the slightest detail.

Only when the brightness of the images gradually dimmed and finally disappeared did Sun Luyuan reluctantly look away.

"The harvest this time is enough for our Sun family to overcome this difficulty."

"When Lu'er emerges from the Law Enforcement Hall and takes an important position in the Immortal Alliance, with four Integration cultivators in our family, only then can the Sun family truly establish a firm foothold."

Sun Luyuan muttered to himself.

Meanwhile, Li Fan's divine sense, which had witnessed the entire process from the side, saw through some of the tricks.

"It's not an immortal artifact of the same grade? Instead, it's based on a human soul, using some secret technique to erode the Heaven Profound Mirror? Thus obtaining a large amount of information that cannot be acquired through normal means?"

"Even if it's not an immortal artifact, being able to infiltrate the Heaven Profound Mirror is already extraordinary."

Li Fan looked at Sun Luyuan, who seemed to have suffered significant damage.

While recuperating, Sun Luyuan seemed to be digesting the information he had just obtained from the black mirror with his eyes closed.

"With just a single divine sense of mine, to control it..."

"I don't have absolute confidence. Especially with that strange black mirror by his side."

After much deliberation, Li Fan's divine sense chose not to act immediately.

Instead, he decided to lie low for the time being.

He would make his move slowly after Sun Luyuan and the black mirror separated.

Another seven days passed.

When Sun Luyuan opened his eyes, the first thing he did was repeatedly form hand seals, temporarily sealing the black mirror in the secret chamber.

Sensing Sun Luyuan's actions, the misty human figure within the black mirror struggled to emerge again.

But it was tightly sealed within the mirror surface and unable to get out.

After all turmoil subsided, Sun Luyuan breathed a sigh of relief.

He opened the heavy restrictions and left the secret chamber.

A moment later.

Li Fan's divine sense quietly flew to the side of the black mirror.

"The material of this mirror body..."

"It doesn't seem to be a creation of the Xuanhuang Realm."

"It seems the guess of it being an immortal artifact is not entirely wrong."

"It's just that the origin power of the immortal path has gone astray, leaving only an empty shell, occupied by that human figure."

With Li Fan's current knowledge, after a careful observation, he made some discoveries.

To verify his guess, the divine sense began to study the seal left by Sun Luyuan.

"Hmm? It has some semblance of an immortal-grade formation. But it's too crude."

The main body invoked the End Dissolution Disc for support, and soon, it was deciphered.

Then, Li Fan's divine sense did not directly destroy the seal but slowly modified it based on its foundation.

"Brother, why are you back so soon this time?"

"Did you encounter any difficulties again? Hahaha..."

The slightly deranged voice of the black shadow came from within the mirror.

Li Fan did not reply at all, continuing to modify the formation seal.

The black shadow babbled to itself for a while before finally sensing something was wrong.

"You're not Brother?"

"Who are you?"

Its voice was filled with anger and panic.

"Disgusting thing, stay away from me!"

The black shadow shrieked, and the black mirror vibrated violently.

"Noisy!" Li Fan snorted coldly.

A silver thunderbolt materialized from the void and struck the black mirror fiercely.

The mirror body, forged from what unknown material, actually showed a slight scorch mark.

The black shadow's shrieks were interrupted by a pained cry.

After a moment of silence, the black shadow seemed to recover.

"You..."

It was about to lash out again when it was met by another thunderbolt.

Silver light, like heavenly lightning bolts, fell one after another.

Under the majestic divine power, the humanoid figure hidden within the black mirror transformed from curses to wails, and then to pleas.

However, Li Fan's spiritual body had no intention of showing mercy from the beginning.

A spiritual body, unlike a clone, can draw spiritual energy from heaven and earth to recover. The accumulated power is depleted with each use, so it is imperative to ensure success.

The silver thunderbolts acted like a giant grinding wheel, processing the humanoid black mist.

Meanwhile, Li Fan's spiritual body seized the opportunity, repeatedly forming hand seals, using the method of "Array Refinement" to attempt to gain control of the black mirror.

The black mirror was not an object with an owner, but it had been nourished by the bloodline of Sun family disciples at regular intervals, establishing a mysterious and subtle connection with the Sun clan.

Under normal circumstances, only a member of the Sun family could use, or even refine, it.

However, Li Fan's array formations, empowered by the accumulation of countless generations of the "Terminus Dissolution Disc," had reached a level that was unfathomable to gods and ghosts.

With layers upon layers of arrays superimposed, he could ignore such rules.

Even when Li Fan's spiritual body was refining the black mirror at this moment, Sun Luyuan, who had a special spiritual connection with it, could not detect anything.

As time slowly flowed by, without anyone noticing, the black mirror had silently changed hands.

Li Fan's spiritual body materialized, and he tossed the black mirror in his hand.

He could feel the humanoid black mist, the "artifact spirit" of the black mirror, cowering inside the mirror.

It was filled with fear and apprehension towards Li Fan.

Li Fan did not care about its thoughts. His eyes narrowed, and in an instant, he understood the origin of this treasured artifact of the Sun family.

Over a thousand years ago, brothers Sun Luyuan and Sun Luyao, during an exploration of ruins, accidentally discovered a somewhat damaged bronze mirror.

Initially, the two brothers thought the bronze mirror was just an ordinary antique and did not pay much attention to it. However, when they brought it back to the Heavenly Profound Mirror to sell, something incredulous happened.

The Heavenly Profound Mirror seemed to be blind to the bronze mirror, or rather, it completely ignored its existence! Although it was within the space of the Heavenly Profound Mirror, it simply could not appear on the list of items for sale.

After repeated verification, the two brothers knew they had stumbled upon a treasure.

Subsequently, they made various attempts to find the correct way to use this magical bronze mirror. But at that time, they were only cultivators at the Golden Core stage, and their strength and knowledge were insufficient to accomplish this.

This continued for a hundred years.

The elder brother, Sun Luyuan, found a miniature grotto-heaven, intending to use it to advance to the Nascent Soul stage.

Sun Luyao guarded his elder brother to protect him during his breakthrough. Although they were extremely cautious, fate was unpredictable, and they alerted another cultivator at the peak of the Golden Core stage who happened to pass by.

Golden Core and Nascent Soul—a realm apart, a world of difference.

With the opportunity to break through right before his eyes, the Golden Core cultivator naturally would not let it pass.

And Sun Luyao, to ensure his elder brother's successful advancement, used his life to hold back the enemy's attacks.

When Sun Luyuan successfully broke through to the Nascent Soul stage and angrily slew the Golden Core cultivator, Sun Luyao was on the verge of death due to severe injuries and could not be saved.

Just as Sun Luyuan was in despair, he suddenly discovered that the bronze mirror he had been carrying finally reacted!

On the brink of death, Sun Luyao's divine soul escaped into the bronze mirror, thus preserving itself.

Although he could never come out of the bronze mirror again, it was better than being separated by death.

His divine soul merged with the bronze mirror, and Sun Luyao thus gained knowledge about the mirror's various properties.

The bronze mirror's original name was [Immeasurable], the treasured artifact bestowed by the Immortal Realm upon the "Immeasurable Sect" in ancient times.

However, as time passed, this immortal artifact inexplicably became damaged and incomplete, losing most of its former power.

Even its artifact spirit was nowhere to be found, leaving only its vessel in the mortal world.

But after all, it was once an existence above the mortal realm.

After merging with new divine souls, it still displayed some incredible abilities.

For example... When it entered the Heavenly Profound Mirror, it could steal all sorts of information from the Heavenly Profound Mirror.

Another example, after accumulating energy for a period, the Immeasurable Mirror could release some light and shadow.

What this light and shadow depicted astonishingly were events that might happen in the future!

Although the principle behind it was unclear, this discovery sent the Sun brothers into a frenzy of joy.

With the help of the Immeasurable Mirror, the Sun brothers began their legendary rise.

But slowly, they also discovered the eerie aspects of the mirror.

Due to its previous damage, the mirror's incompleteness also affected Sun Luyao within it. His divine soul gradually eroded, and no matter what methods Sun Luyuan used, he could not stop it.

Finally, by chance, he used his own vital blood to delay the dissipation of his brother's divine soul.

If it were only this.

After achieving the Nascent Soul stage, new cultivation methods allowed cultivators to embody their grotto-heavens and become immortal and indestructible. Vital blood could be squeezed out after all.

The true trouble with the Immeasurable Mirror was its tendency towards self-destruction.

As if it had suffered an unimaginable calamity, the scenes of the "Immeasurable Light" that depicted future scenarios would always end with the same outcome after a few repetitions.

Endless darkness, great destruction, and utter void.

It was as if it were the destiny of the entire world, and no matter how the Immeasurable Mirror depicted it, it could not escape this ending.

And each time it awoke from the destruction and the Immeasurable Light deduced again, the Immeasurable Mirror seemed to become stained with the black destruction from the prophecy, becoming a shade darker.

For a thousand years, although the Sun family used the abilities of the Immeasurable Mirror to develop from an inconspicuous, humble family into a behemoth with four cultivators at the Dao Integration stage, and Sun Luyuan also progressed from a Nascent Soul cultivator to a great cultivator at the Dao Integration stage, they were still powerless to stop the Immeasurable Mirror from moving towards destruction.

The only solution he could find was to locate the missing fragments of the Immeasurable Mirror and help it complete itself.

Over the years, by relying on the spiritual connection between his main body and the fragment, he had indeed found another piece of the Immeasurable Mirror.

However, this only slowed down the speed of destruction, without fundamentally solving the problem.

The abilities displayed by the Sun family during their rise had long attracted the attention of those with ulterior motives.

Setting aside the many individuals with ill intentions outside, the greatest benefactor for the Sun family's rise was one of the highest centers of power in the Myriad Immortal Alliance: the Mirror Keepers.

One of them, named Fu, learned of the existence of the Immeasurable Mirror.

However, he did not seize it. Instead, he even funded the Sun family's rise.

This was because he valued the Immeasurable Mirror's ability to infiltrate the Heavenly Profound Mirror.

"A damaged immortal artifact, although it cannot compare to a true Heavenly Profound artifact, still has its merits."

"Find a way to maximize its restoration. Perhaps one day, we Mirror Keepers will find it useful."

Sun Luyuan knew this was a poisoned chalice, but he had no choice but to swallow it.

According to his original plan, the Sun family should have developed with as much low-profiled discretion as possible.

But things did not go as planned.

Chapter 1160: The Mind-Reading Heavenly Profound Mirror

According to [Fu], the Sun family could only gain sufficient justification for a promotion if they rendered enough meritorious service.

"The Myriad Immortal Alliance is not a place where one person's word is law. Even among us Mirror Keepers, not everyone is of the same mind."

"Therefore, I'm not afraid of you causing a stir, but I am afraid of you failing to do so."

It was also at Fu's suggestion that Sun Luyuan had previously acted high-profile and fortunately apprehended spies from the Five Elders Society.

Anyone with discerning eyes could see that there was something fishy about the whole affair.

However, those with backgrounds, after investigating and discovering that the Mirror Keeper [Fu] was backing the Sun family, all quietly ceased their probing.

As for those who lacked the ability to even find this out...

Sun Luyuan couldn't be bothered.

After all, even a dog fights only when it sees its master threatened.

The Sun family didn't even need to lift a finger; the moment those individuals showed any hostility, they would be silently torn apart by the countless families eager to curry favor with Mirror Keeper Fu.

However...

It was likely that Sun Luyuan could never have imagined that he would encounter a monster like Li Fan, who could not be understood by common logic.

With just a mere divine sense, he had deciphered the Sun family's millennia-old blood sacrifice.

And claimed the immortal artifact, the Immeasurable Mirror, as his own.

Even a damaged, near-annihilation immortal artifact held immeasurable value.

Moreover, in Li Fan's hands, this immortal artifact might not be beyond repair.

At this moment, in the Sun family's secret chamber, Li Fan, ignoring Sun Luyao's pleas, forced him to activate the Immeasurable Mirror's deduction function.

From the pitch-black mirror surface, a beam of light suddenly erupted.

The beam condensed in mid-air, forming a white light screen.

Soon, scenes began to change rapidly on the screen.

As Li Fan clearly saw the images within, his heart gave a slight jolt.

Myriad Sky Patrol Arrows whistled through the air, flying towards various parts of the Myriad Immortal Alliance.

Countless cultivators were engaged in fierce battles. One side, naturally, was the Myriad Immortal Alliance.

The other side was led by a peculiar puppet.

"This is... the future United Council of All Realms?"

In the rapidly flashing images, Li Fan saw familiar figures like Tian Yang and Sun Erlang.

According to the plan for this life, after Da Qi had annexed numerous smaller worlds, friction with the Myriad Immortal Alliance was inevitable.

But at this point in time, none of that had happened yet.

This Immeasurable Mirror could indeed deduce future events!

The light beam did not last long.

The images played faster and faster, to the point where even Li Fan couldn't discern the changes.

Finally, the light beam retracted in an instant.

Returning to a state of utter pitch-black void.

From this annihilation, Li Fan felt an instinctual sense of crisis.

The deduction concluded, and the darkness returned to the Immeasurable Mirror.

Sun Luyao then let out a terrified, mad wail.

As if he had personally witnessed something extremely terrifying.

But Li Fan, as the master of the Immeasurable Mirror, could not perceive anything from Sun Luyao.

Li Fan had no intention of using his essence blood to alleviate Sun Luyao's pain.

He simply let Sun Luyao suffer, while Li Fan pondered in his mind.

"The aura of that deduction beam... it feels so familiar?"

"It's..."

Two names instantly surfaced in Li Fan's mind. Xuanji, Myriad Spirits Return to Numbers. Huangluo, Void Chamber Blooms Flowers.

"Same origin, part of the same great formation."

"Immeasurable, ..."

Li Fan found it difficult to discern the remaining names of the formation.

However, this similarity was enough to inspire him.

"The increasing decrepitude of the Immeasurable Mirror may be influenced by the deduction of the desolate future. But a larger reason is that its damaged immortal artifact body is simply insufficient to drive immortal-grade formations."

"The consequence of forced activation is the continuous consumption of its immortal artifact body. The more it is used, the faster it perishes."

"This Sun family, truly a bunch of fools, a complete waste of treasure. If they hadn't so frequently activated it without repairing it, it wouldn't have ended up in my hands in such a damaged state."

Thinking this, Li Fan gently touched the completely blackened mirror surface with some heartache.

"Hmm, to mend it, my abilities might be somewhat insufficient. I will still need to find a skilled craftsman..."

Li Fan wasn't particularly concerned about the Immeasurable Mirror's deduction ability.

What was the point of deducing a future that might not happen, compared to a future he had personally experienced and knew to be real?

But the title of the first immortal artifact he obtained was enough for Li Fan to take it seriously.

"Perhaps, in the process of repairing it, I can find a way for the [Terminal Dissolution Disc] to truly transform and ascend."

"The birth of immortal artifacts in the Profound Yellow Realm. Although the power of the laws may have become part of the Profound Yellow Heavenly Dao, it cannot be ruled out that, like the Immeasurable Mirror, its immortal artifact body still exists."

"Perhaps I should pay attention to collecting them."

...

For the next period of time, Li Fan's divine sense did not leave the secret chamber.

He merely dwelled within the Immeasurable Mirror, studying the other uses of this damaged immortal artifact.

At the same time, he sorted and categorized the information previously obtained by the Immeasurable Mirror's infiltration of the Heavenly Profound Mirror.

Having a source of the Heavenly Profound Mirror and having previously spied on its secrets extensively, Li Fan soon discovered the differences between these two forms of "peeking."

Undoubtedly, the Heavenly Profound Mirror also possessed self-awareness.

What was seen through its source was all the data generated by the Heavenly Profound Mirror in managing the daily affairs of the Myriad Immortal Alliance, as well as records of cultivators' activities and conversations.

However, what the Immeasurable Mirror spied on...

It was more akin to the "thoughts" and "conclusions" of the Heavenly Profound Mirror itself.

For example, based on the aggregation of vast amounts of information, the Heavenly Profound Mirror determined that a certain item in the Myriad Immortal Alliance's trading market showed signs of decreased production.

Therefore, even though the event hadn't occurred yet, the Heavenly Profound Mirror, having grasped sufficient intelligence, had already made the judgment that the price of this item was about to skyrocket.

But as a foundation of the Immortal Alliance, bound by its transmitted laws, the Heavenly Profound Mirror could not take any autonomous action.

It had to wait for the event to actually happen and cause certain consequences, be jointly deliberated and decided by the high-level figures of the Immortal Alliance, namely the transmitters and Mirror Keepers, before any adjustments could be made.

Although it lacked autonomy, this did not prevent the Heavenly Profound Mirror from pre-emptively simulating and judging the countless events that occurred within its scope of control on a daily basis.

These "thoughts" of the Heavenly Profound Mirror did not have any impact on the actual operations.

They merely appeared and then settled in the deepest recesses of the Heavenly Profound Mirror.

"No wonder the Mirror Keepers value it so highly."

"Isn't this equivalent to a mind-reading technique specifically for the Heavenly Profound Mirror?"

"Even if, due to its damage, it can only read a mere fragment, any single piece of information is worth a fortune!"

The Heavenly Profound Mirror, as a genuine immortal artifact and the cornerstone of the Myriad Immortal Alliance's operation, possessed a superior perspective.

Its judgments were undoubtedly correct and far ahead of the cultivators within it.

Li Fan recalled how, in his previous life, the Heavenly Profound Mirror, in league with Mo Rubin, had set several traps for him.

A dangerous glint flickered in his eyes.

After suffering such a great loss at the hands of Mo Rubin and the Heavenly Profound Mirror, it was impossible for Li Fan to have no thoughts of revenge.

However, Mo Rubin was one of the Dharma Kings of the Profound Heaven Cult, and his abilities were too profound. He could infiltrate the Myriad Immortal Alliance headquarters as if it were an uninhabited land.

Although he later died in the Nether Realm under unclear circumstances, Li Fan did not have a 100% certainty of subduing him at the moment.

Without a fundamental conflict of interest, Li Fan had no intention of provoking him for the time being in this lifetime.

"Perhaps I can secretly learn how the Myriad Immortal Alliance dealt with this Dharma King of the Profound Heaven Cult."

According to the normal historical trajectory, Mo Rubin would have been discovered by the Myriad Immortal Alliance without waking up.

Perhaps the Myriad Immortal Alliance also harbored some special methods for dealing with members of the Profound Heaven Cult. With preemptive action, Mo Rubin might have indeed lost the power to resist.

At that time, Li Fan could simply follow suit and deal with Mo Rubin in the same way in future lives.

But if Mo Rubin, like in the 119th life, only pretended to be subdued while secretly infiltrating...

Then, until he found a definite method to deal with him, Li Fan would not actively make an enemy of Mo Rubin.

As for the Heavenly Profound Mirror.

Carrying a trace of the Heavenly Profound Mirror's origin, he was already in an invincible position.

Now that he had mastered a method to peer into its interior...

If Heaven bestows something and one does not accept it, they will face misfortune!

Li Fan's mind raced.

"The Myriad Immortal Alliance is searching for Mo Rubin in the ruins of various sects to push forward the discovery of the ultimate method to restrain the Heavenly Profound Mirror. This should be secretly driven by the lineage of the Mirror Keepers."

"Cang, Fu, hehe. Neither of these two are easy to deal with."

"However, they also represent my opportunity."

As his thoughts churned, Li Fan transformed into a streak of ethereal light once more, entering the Boundless Mirror.

Within it, he continued to construct formations to solidify his control.

While waiting for Sun Luyuan to return to the secret chamber, he also took the opportunity to study the remnants of the immortal-grade grand formations within the Boundless Mirror.

...

Great Qi, Sacred Capital.

During this period, as Wang Xuanba tirelessly traveled throughout the Xuanhuang Realm.

Besides Master Yin, Ou Daozi and his son, and Ximen Yu, who were chosen as "Stars of Xuanhuang" by Li Ping, were all lured to the Sacred Dynasty Great Qi by Wang Xuanba using the rhetoric taught by the Sacred Emperor.

Of course, not everyone on this list was persuaded. Not only did some refuse the invitation, but some even killed Wang Xuanba's clone.

Wang Xuanba was not angered, merely noting down their names and reporting them to the Sacred Emperor.

Then, he bypassed them and invited the next person.

Upon arriving in Great Qi, the Stars of Xuanhuang were personally received by Li Ping. Like Master Yin, they all settled down permanently in the Sacred Dynasty.

They each found their own pursuits.

For example, Ximen Yu was promised by Li Ping that he would help him delve deeper into the research of terrestrial energy. He also revealed some important information about the ancient terrestrial trees.

For example, Ou Daozi would be responsible for the construction of the new Sacred Capital of Great Qi. Furthermore, for every small world conquered by the Sacred Dynasty in the future, Ou Daozi would serve as the chief planning designer for its overall transformation.

More importantly, Li Ping recognized that Ou Shangtian possessed two wondrous items, the Kun Gan Bone Hand and the Myriad Death Record. He then took Ou Shangtian as his personal disciple.

Ou Shangtian felt no ill will from Li Ping.

Moreover, the interesting secrets of the cultivation world and the profound principles of the Great Dao that the Sacred Emperor spoke of deeply attracted the young Ou Shangtian.

Therefore, he willingly became a disciple.

A person's life is but a pursuit of fame, profit, and inner peace.

And Li Ping, the Sacred Emperor, could satisfy all these for them.

As for those who were summoned but did not come...

Their fates had already been decided in Li Ping's heart.

Beneath the Sacred Emperor's seat.

Deeper than Master Yin's underground secret chamber.

A secret intelligence agency of the Sacred Dynasty called the Sky Monitoring Department had been gradually established.

As the central node of the Grand Formation of Myriad Spirits, everything within the small world covered by the formation could be seen at a glance.

When the Sacred Dynasty embarks on its path of conquest in the future and incorporates other small worlds into its territory, they too will be strictly monitored by the Sky Monitoring Department.

Not only that.

In Li Ping's vision, the name "Sky Monitoring" was not just directed at those small worlds.

Even the Xuanhuang Realm itself was to be included.

With the Paper Person of the Tribulation Crossing Sect and the Heavenly Profound Mirror as a foundation, building a comprehensive intelligence system was not difficult.

The secret agents of the Sky Monitoring Department would be personally selected by Li Ping.

The celestial phenomenon of "Heaven opens its favor, myriad stars descend to the world" has already begun to show its initial effects on the small world of Great Qi. Among the infants born in the Sacred Dynasty recently, there are not a few who were born with manifest special abilities.

Sacred medical clinics are spread across various regions, and Li Ping can immediately perceive the constitution of every infant at birth.

From a young age, they will undergo personal training from Li Ping. Upon growing up, they may either go to the Sky Monitoring Department or participate in Master Yin's new cultivation method derivation plan...

Making the best use of everything.

The growth of talent, or an empire, requires time.

The Sacred Dynasty Great Qi is developing at an extraordinary speed, but at present, the most attention within the Sacred Dynasty is focused on a grand competition.

A fishing competition.

Organized by imperial decree from the Sacred Emperor himself, anyone in the nation interested could participate, regardless of prior fishing experience.

Winners would first be decided in each region, and then proceed to the Sacred Capital for the final competition.

The Sacred Emperor would also appear at that time, enjoying the festivities with the people.

The top one hundred participants in the grand competition would receive generous rewards, enough to provide for an ordinary family for a lifetime.

And those who performed exceptionally well in the competition would reportedly receive an additional unique reward from the Sacred Emperor.

The announcement has been out for half a month, and countless people have responded.

If it weren't for the assistance of Immortal Masters of the Sacred Dynasty in various regions, the fish in all the rivers and streams might have been caught, leading to an awkward situation where there were no fish to catch.

Besides ordinary citizens, the Sacred Emperor's disciples would also be participating.

This undoubtedly further stimulated people's enthusiasm.

As is widely known, the Sacred Emperor has publicly stated more than once that he has no heirs and will not have any in the future.

The Sacred Emperor has no offspring.

His disciples are, without a doubt, the successors to the Sacred Dynasty.

If one could catch the Sacred Emperor's eye in the fishing competition and be accepted as a true disciple...

The chance to leap over the dragon gate would be today!

Motivated by various rumors, the current common people of Great Qi have become somewhat fanatical about "fishing."

It is even considered more important than studying or cultivating.

And Li Ping naturally sees all of this.

The reason he allowed it, and even fanned the flames, was naturally for the supreme treasure, the Fishing Pond.

This immortal artifact even surpasses the existence of the Xuanhuang Realm.

It holds countless opportunities.

Perhaps it contains the method for him to break free from his predicament.

He would naturally not let go of an opportunity to acquire a large number of divine items at no cost.

Any secret treasure casually fished out from it could significantly increase the Sacred Dynasty's combat power.

The probability of fishing up treasures from the Fishing Pond is unrelated to one’s cultivation level.

It is more about sincerity in fishing and understanding of the Way of Fishing.

In fact, the more one desires something, the less likely they are to catch their intended target.

In short, it is mysterious and profound, much like ordinary fishing.

The winners of the Sacred Dynasty’s fishing competition will be arranged to fish in the Fishing Pond.

Most of these individuals are only at the Qi Refining stage, with the highest reaching the Nascent Soul realm.

Given their limited knowledge and understanding, they would never imagine that this small, unassuming pond is an immortal artifact, capable of producing world-class treasures.

Whatever they gain, they will naturally attribute it to the great Sacred Emperor’s bestowal.

Furthermore, there is no need to worry about anyone here, like Senior Stone Slab from the 119th generation, foolishly trying to comprehend the Way of Fishing through the Fishing Pond, thus provoking a reaction from the nameless true immortal behind it, and being fished away themselves.

Besides a very few exceptions that Li Ping might be interested in, any treasures fished up from the Fishing Pond will be given to the fishermen themselves for their use. He might even focus on cultivating them.

“This lifetime, let me see if the treasures within the Fishing Pond are truly endless. And…”

“Can the creations of all the heavens overpower the Xuanhuang Realm!”

His gaze fell upon the tens of thousands of fishermen in Sacred Capital, each holding different fishing rods, eager to cast their lines. Li Ping seemed to see countless treasures of the starry sky flying into the Sacred Dynasty.

As the Sacred Dynasty fishing competition was meticulously being held,

On a desolate small mountain in the northwest border of Yongyun Prefecture,

In a dilapidated temple on the mountaintop, Zhong Shentong, who had cast his line and returned with nothing, suddenly felt a wave of fatigue.

Just as he was about to call for his young attendant, Liu Li, he found that she too had fallen into a deep sleep.

Zhong Shentong chuckled. After checking the temple’s protective formation to ensure there were no issues,

He lazily lay down on the lounge chair for a nap.

After an unknown amount of time…

When he inexplicably awoke, he found himself in a dark, unknown space!

He instinctively reached for his most prized protective treasure from his storage ring, only to discover that he had been stripped bare, completely naked, at some unknown time!

Zhong Shentong’s face twitched. He knew he was completely finished this time. His opponent was too ruthless, giving him no chance at all.

“However, I am still alive, which means the other party does not intend to take my life. On the surface, I am merely a Qi Refining cultivator nearing the end of my lifespan, facing poverty. Dealing with me would be unnecessary trouble. So, it must be about the Fishing Pond?”

Zhong Shentong’s thoughts raced. He instantly understood. But no matter how hard he rack his brain, he couldn’t figure out how the news of this supreme treasure had leaked.

There was no warning at all!

“Right, where is Liu Li?”

He had personally fished Liu Li out of the Fishing Pond, a little doll who had taken human form. He now considered her almost his only family. With himself imprisoned, she was likely in grave danger…

Just as Zhong Shentong was in turmoil, an extremely cold voice suddenly echoed in the dark space.

“Within seven days, break through to the Foundation Establishment stage.”

“Otherwise, die!”

There was no intention of conversing with Zhong Shentong. After speaking these two sentences, there was silence.

However, the palpable, bone-chilling killing intent that permeated the surroundings made Zhong Shentong realize this was no mere test.

If he failed to break through, he would truly be killed!

“I have been stagnant at the late stage of Qi Refining for a full fifty years. On the surface, I appear old and with no hope of breakthrough. Any normal person would not make such a demand of me. Unless…”

“He guessed that I practice the [Life and Death Profound Art]!”

The more he thought about it, the more unfathomable Zhong Shentong found the mastermind behind this. They had never met before, yet this person seemed to know everything about him.

…

Just as Zhong Shentong was engulfed in endless dread.

In another dark space, the attendant Liu Li seemed oblivious to the approaching crisis, still sleeping soundly.

Li Ping suddenly appeared before her, quietly observing.

After a long moment, Li Ping said faintly, “Fellow Daoist Baihua, please reveal yourself.”

Silence. There was no response.

Li Ping narrowed his eyes. “Must I say it a third time? Sect Master of the Heavenly Lotus Sect, from the Wansheng Realm!”

His tone was light, but to certain ears, it was no less than a thunderclap.

Finally ceasing to hide, a golden light flashed, and a figure emerged from Liu Li.

Daoist Baihua stared intently at Li Ping. “Who exactly are you?”

Of course, Baihua had never seen the person before him. Yet, this person could accurately state her identity…

In an instant, countless figures flashed through Daoist Baihua’s mind, but none matched.

“We are merely fellow wanderers of the starry sea, having lost our homelands. The past is gone; why must you dwell on it, fellow Daoist?”

This statement caused Daoist Baihua to speculate even further, bringing her back to the terrifying moments of consecutive world-ending calamities.

“More importantly, it is the future.” The next sentence from the other party completely captured Daoist Baihua’s attention.

“The future?”

“Now, in the vast sea of stars, only this place remains as a pure land. But the Xuanhuang Realm of today is no longer the Xuanhuang Realm of the past. Over these many years, through the constant piecing together and merging of fragments from various realms. This new Xuanhuang Realm has long since transcended the scope of ordinary immortal cultivation realms,” Li Ping’s voice was melancholic.

“If you search carefully, fellow Daoist, you might even find fragments of your former Wansheng Realm.”

Daoist Baihua’s expression changed. “What exactly do you want to say?”

“Since the Xuanhuang Realm has absorbed fragments from various realms… then the new Xuanhuang Realm should also have a place for us. If they do not permit it, then we must fight for it ourselves,” Li Ping said proudly.

“The indigenous forces of the Xuanhuang Realm are too powerful. Only by uniting can we retrieve what is rightfully ours.”

“Besides the Wansheng Realm, I have also found fellow Daoists from the Heavenly Mechanism Realm…”

Li Ping spoke eloquently.

Daoist Baihua was clearly somewhat moved.

“If the Xuanhuang Realm has indeed absorbed fragments of our world to resist the Immortal Ruins, then this place can indeed be considered my new home.”

A surge of emotion suddenly welled up in Daoist Baihua’s heart. It was the unrestrainable feeling of finding a new place to belong after years of drifting without a home.

“But… the cultivators of the Xuanhuang Realm are not easy to deal with.” After pondering, Daoist Baihua still hesitated. She vaguely recalled how that lone Loose Immortal had blocked them, the survivors from various realms, from entering back then.

Although time had passed and that Loose Immortal had disappeared, the Xuanhuang Realm had produced a new Transmission Heaven Venerable…

Could they, these outsiders, truly fare well under His power?

Li Ping seemed to see through Daoist Baihua's concerns and said in a deep voice, "The Myriad Immortals Alliance's Five Elders Council is indeed powerful, but we are not the only ones in the Xuanhuang Realm who are dissatisfied with its rule."

"Not to mention the various factions hidden in different small worlds, there are countless individuals within the Myriad Immortals Alliance who harbor ulterior motives."

Li Ping waved his hand, and a vast network of relationships unfolded before Daoist Baihua.

Daoist Baihua gazed closely, and the faces displayed were all members of the Myriad Immortals Alliance's various organizations!

Not only their names and appearances, but also their life stories, personalities, the possibility of them being swayed, and predictions of their future actions were all meticulously detailed.

Those who were specially marked were the unstable elements within the Myriad Immortals Alliance, individuals who were easily instigated.

Looking at these words and images, the Myriad Immortals Alliance transformed in Daoist Baihua's mind from a mere empty phrase into a vivid and tangible entity.

The more Daoist Baihua read, the more astonished she became. "No wonder this person dares to make such bold claims and is confident in competing with the Myriad Immortals Alliance. Such detailed information must have taken an immense amount of time to gather. It's not just a matter of time; some of this confidential information could likely only be obtained with the help of high-ranking insiders."

Daoist Baihua did not believe this was fabricated by Li Ping. The information was too detailed to be faked.

As she was about to examine it further, Li Ping waved his hand again, and the light screen changed.

This time, the information shifted from the Myriad Immortals Alliance to the various small worlds of the Xuanhuang Realm. There were those with powerful strengths capable of cooperation, those who were not as strong but possessed abundant resources and could be conquered and used as production bases, and even those that were extremely dangerous and not recommended for contact.

A hidden scroll of the Xuanhuang Realm slowly unfurled before Daoist Baihua.

While Daoist Baihua was shocked, a sense of helplessness also welled up within her. Having been forced to witness so many of the Sacred Dynasty's secrets, she felt she had no choice but to join.

As for tearing up their relationship and fighting him...

Even though Daoist Baihua was a Longevity realm expert in her original world, facing this Faceless Sacred Emperor, she felt no complete certainty of victory. In fact, whenever she entertained thoughts of opposing him, an instinctual premonition of irreparable doom would arise.

This had never happened before. She hadn't even experienced such a sense of crisis when she was captured by the fishing pond.

Therefore, when Li Ping calmly extended an invitation for her to join the Sacred Dynasty, Daoist Baihua accepted without any hesitation.

Li Ping burst into laughter, "Excellent, excellent! With Daoist Baihua's assistance, our chances of victory increase by another point."

"There is a matter at hand that requires Daoist's help." Li Ping, having just welcomed her, immediately began assigning her a task.

A miniature map of the area zoomed out, eventually focusing on one of the small worlds, comprised of five interlocked rings.

"I intend to make this Five Elements Great Grotto-Heaven the grand prize for this fishing competition. However, it is currently located within the Heavenly Spirit Province of the Immortal Alliance. The border area is prone to attracting the attention of the Myriad Immortals Alliance and the Five Elders Council. Therefore..."

Li Ping's tone was sincere, "I must trouble Daoist to relocate it to the void near my Great Qi."

Initially, Daoist Baihua thought it was a common grotto-heaven and paid it little mind. But when Li Ping transmitted the specific information about the Five Elements Great Grotto-Heaven, her golden body involuntarily trembled.

These five interconnected grotto-heavens were enormous! With her strength, she could indeed manage to move them, but afterward, she would be severely depleted.

Would he take advantage of her weakened state to harbor ill intentions?

At this, Li Ping smiled, "It is truly because I am unable to leave that I must trouble Daoist." "If I truly wished to deal with Daoist, I would not need any schemes or tricks..."

Li Ping's tone was devoid of emotion, as if stating a simple fact.

As Li Ping spoke, several stone puppets silently appeared in the void, subtly surrounding Daoist Baihua.

These puppets themselves were not very powerful, but the fluctuations they emitted made Daoist Baihua feel both familiar and terrified.

A flash of light illuminated Daoist Baihua's mind, and she instantly recalled the source of this familiarity. It was the terrifying disasters that had wreaked havoc and annihilated countless immortal cultivation worlds long ago!

"You're insane?!" Daoist Baihua couldn't help but scream. Her body instinctively recoiled, moving rapidly away from the stone puppets.

"You are playing with fire! How can we control the power of world-ending calamities? If you're not careful, even this last refuge of ours, the Xuanhuang Realm, could be destroyed by you!" Daoist Baihua trembled, a mixture of shock and anger.

She never imagined that this so-called fellow traveler would be a complete lunatic. No wonder she had felt an indescribable sense of crisis emanating from him earlier.

Despite Daoist Baihua's accusations, Li Ping remained unfazed.

He let out a cold snort and said, "World-ending calamities have only temporarily disappeared. Who can guarantee they won't reappear in the future? Even if we are fortunate enough to escape the Immortal Ruins, what will we do if we encounter other disasters in the future?"

"Constant evasion will ultimately lead to destruction. Only by actively researching and mastering their power can we achieve true freedom!" Li Ping's voice was resolute, even bordering on fanatical.

He waved his hand again, and three incredibly complex, yet divinely imbued, twisted symbols appeared beside him.

They spun around Li Ping.

They contained no power within them; merely their shapes caused the Longevity realm expert, Daoist Baihua, to tremble.

And the Faceless Sacred Emperor Li Ping, surrounded by these three mystical symbols, exuded an aura of both holiness and malevolence.

One dared not look directly at him.

"Hehehe, these three True Immortal seal characters were painstakingly gathered by me from the void. Would Daoist care to examine them?" Li Ping's voice boomed, echoing through the dark space.

Daoist Baihua sensed that the young attendant, Liuli, was showing signs of waking up and quickly cast a spell to make him fall asleep again.

As for herself, she truly dared not look directly at the three True Immortal seal characters!

Indeed, True Immortal seal characters contained infinite power, but was that transcendent power something that cultivators who had not ascended the immortal path could truly control?

She had personally witnessed countless cultivators turn to dust under such power, without any ability to resist, including many who, like herself, were considered Longevity realm experts.

In her opinion, studying True Immortal seal characters was like a child holding a world-ending weapon.

A slight misstep would not only lead to her instantaneous demise but could also drag the entire world down with her!

She still had many years to live; why would she engage in such extreme actions!

Chapter 1164: Heaven and Earth Turned Upside Down with a Single Hand

Daoist Baihua turned her head away, trembling and not daring to respond.

Li Ping waited for a long time, but still did not get Daoist Baihua to change her mind. He then sighed lightly and put away the three True Immortal seal characters by his side.
