"Enough, if you are unwilling, I will not force you."

"After all, not everyone has the courage to use the power of True Immortals like this..."

"Regarding the matter of moving the Five Elements Great Grotto-Heaven, are there any difficulties, fellow Daoist?" Li Ping returned to the main topic and asked.

Sensing that the terrifying aura of power around them had disappeared, Daoist Baihua briefly recovered from her panic.

The tone of Saint Emperor Li Ping's inquiry was subtly different from before. Daoist Baihua knew that if she refused again, she might truly anger this madman. She could only respond with difficulty.

"Please set off as soon as possible, fellow Daoist. By the way, you will be unfamiliar with the place. For the sake of insurance, I will send a disciple to accompany you." Li Ping said intentionally or unintentionally.

When Daoist Baihua saw the disciple Li Ping mentioned, her scalp tingled and her body trembled again.

"This is..."

Even though Daoist Baihua had extraordinary knowledge and had witnessed the destruction of worlds, she found it difficult to accept at this moment: the body, which appeared identical to an ordinary human, was in reality composed of billions of wriggling, unknown small insects. Each of these insects was an individual with its own thoughts, yet they collectively formed a "human" community.

Daoist Baihua's scalp tingled, not because she was frightened by the endless swarm of ugly insects. It was a primal reaction of her body.

Those insects seemed to have some innate restraint over bodies purely composed of energy.

Even though she was in the Longevity realm, and even though there was still some distance between her and these insects, Daoist Baihua still felt a sudden surge of restlessness and unease within her, constantly warning her to stay away from this insect-person.

"You can call him Dao Yi," Li Ping replied out of context.

"Don't worry, although Dao Yi's strength is a bit lacking, he has some peculiar abilities. With his assistance, moving the Five Elements Great Grotto-Heaven should be much easier for you."

Seeing this, Daoist Baihua had no choice but to steel herself and nod slightly. Led by Dao Yi, she headed straight for Tianling Prefecture.

Li Ping watched their departing figures, not feeling much joy at having subdued a Longevity realm expert in a few words.

"My own strength is still not enough. I can only rely on external means to intimidate. If I could unleash pure origin power, it wouldn't be so troublesome."

Dao Yi was a special variant of the Dao Yi insects preserved in the Myriad Beast Condensing Crystal.

No matter how much their numbers expanded, the swarm could always maintain a collective consciousness. More importantly, this Dao Yi insect did not just simply produce spiritual energy.

Instead, it could lodge itself within spiritual energy, use the spiritual energy to reproduce, and then gradually transform itself into a form of spiritual energy.

Given sufficient external conditions for proliferation, Dao Yi would only need about a year to replace the spiritual energy of an entire small world with "itself."

The entire process would be silent, and would not even affect the various creatures in the world that depended on spiritual energy for survival.

Even cultivators with weaker strength would not be able to detect it.

Only by reaching the Nascent Soul realm and forming their own grotto-heaven within their bodies could they sense this mutated spiritual energy.

Li Ping sent the Dao Yi, cultivated with a wisp of his consciousness, to the Five Elements Great Grotto-Heaven to achieve a leap in evolution there.

By utilizing the immense spiritual energy of the Five Elements Great Grotto-Heaven, he aimed to cultivate a large amount of mutated spiritual energy that could shake the entire Xuanhuang Realm.

Under normal circumstances, Dao Yi would not have been able to develop in the Xuanhuang Realm.

Once the mutation of spiritual energy exceeded a certain scale, it would inevitably alert cultivators and be reported to the Immortal Alliance.

Although it would be a bit troublesome to deal with, eliminating these insects was not a difficult task for the Myriad Immortal Alliance.

However, from discovery to governance, it required a certain amount of reaction time.

If there was a large enough base number, the spiritual energy of the Xuanhuang Realm could be completely replaced before the cultivators of the Xuanhuang Realm could react.

This move, to cut off the roots from beneath the cauldron, was a trump card that Li Ping had prepared for the counterattack against the Xuanhuang Realm.

When spiritual energy possessed self-awareness and could distinguish between friend and foe, the cultivators of the Ten Thousand Realms United Federation would likely have a significant advantage in their battles against the cultivators of the Myriad Immortal Alliance.

"Dare to have the sun and moon replaced with a new sky." "The aura of this Xuanhuang Realm is too effete; it's time to teach them a harsh lesson."

As a clone of Li Fan, Saint Emperor Li Ping had his memories of Huan Zhen removed.

In his core self-awareness, he was the consciousness of the Xuanhuang Realm seeking salvation during an apocalyptic crisis, a product of opportune encounters.

Known as the Saint of Destiny.

He was intimately familiar with the secrets of the Xuanhuang Realm.

He had even foreseen countless futures of his own destruction.

His ultimate pursuit was to revolutionize the world and liberate the Xuanhuang Realm from the corrupt rule of the Myriad Immortal Alliance.

Saint Emperor Li Ping firmly believed that he was not far from achieving this goal.

...

The finals of the Great Qi's First Fishing Competition officially commenced.

A total of ten outstanding individuals would personally showcase their fishing skills before the Saint Emperor.

Although all three of the Saint Emperor's disciples were initially in the competition, only the simple-minded Wang Xuanba managed to advance to the final round.

This undoubtedly further demonstrated the fairness of the competition.

Passing through a circular portal, after a bout of dizziness, the ten contestants arrived in what appeared to be a very ordinary garden.

The great Faceless Saint Emperor was sitting by a small pond not far away, fishing with his eyes closed.

The vast majority of the ten people were seeing the Saint Emperor's visage for the first time, and they dared not disturb him, bowing their heads and waiting nervously.

After a long while, the Saint Emperor abruptly reeled in his line.

To their surprise, what was pulled from the pond was not a fish.

It was a white ball of light.

Casually putting the ball of light away, the Saint Emperor looked at the ten outstanding fishermen and explained the rules of the competition.

"In this pond, I have placed countless treasures."

"One person, one rod, one chance."

"The higher the quality of the treasure fished out, the better the result."

His words made everyone extremely excited.

This was because the Saint Emperor had promised that regardless of their ranking, any treasures they fished out would belong to them!

As everyone was eager to try, Wang Xuanba, the Saint Emperor's disciple, made the first move.

Wang Xuanba had also never been to the fishing pond before.

He sat down and remained in a daze for a long time before reeling in his line.

Ultimately, there was nothing in his hand.

An empty rod!

This made Wang Xuanba incredibly dejected.

The others, upon seeing this, were all deeply shaken, realizing that the Saint Emperor's fishing trial was far from ordinary fishing. They became nervous and focused.

As they sequentially approached the fishing pond, a total of one purple, three blue, and five white balls of light were fished out.

There is one more chapter to come around 12:30 AM.

"One person, one rod, one chance."

"The higher the quality of the treasure fished out, the better the result."

His words made everyone extremely excited.

This was because the Saint Emperor had promised that regardless of their ranking, any treasures they fished out would belong to them!

As everyone was eager to try, Wang Xuanba, the Saint Emperor's disciple, made the first move.

Wang Xuanba had also never been to the fishing pond before.

He sat down and remained in a daze for a long time before reeling in his line.

Ultimately, there was nothing in his hand.

An empty rod!

This made Wang Xuanba incredibly dejected.

The others, upon seeing this, were all deeply shaken, realizing that the Saint Emperor's fishing trial was far from ordinary fishing. They became nervous and focused.

As they sequentially approached the fishing pond, a total of one purple, three blue, and five white balls of light were fished out.

Chapter 1165: The Madman Sharpens His Knife at Night

After a thorough examination, Li Ping determined that these balls of light were of no great use to him.

He then solemnly returned the balls of light to the anglers who had been selected through multiple rounds of competition.

Li Ping did not mind that their first attempt yielded no significant harvest.

This fishing competition had been organized rather hastily, leaving the people of Da Qi with little time to prepare. These winners were all seasoned veterans who had dedicated themselves to the art of fishing for a long time; their success was more a testament to their experience rather than their comprehension or talent.

"With them as role models, it will greatly inspire the people's enthusiasm. I expect the second and third fishing competitions will bring me some pleasant surprises."

Li Ping nodded slightly as he watched the winners carefully examining the balls of light they held. His figure then seemed to shatter, and he vanished.

After all, he was not fighting on his home turf in the Xuanhuang Realm. Without the continuous support of the Saint Dynasty's destiny, Li Ping would likely not even be a match for an ordinary Harmonizer.

It was best to return as soon as possible.

If not for the fact that the Supreme Treasure Fishing Pond could not be moved, he would not have personally risked coming here.

"I still don't have enough manpower."

"There are simply too few subordinates whom I can trust and who possess sufficient strength."

Li Ping sighed softly, then secretly contemplated solutions.

...

Tianquan Prefecture.

Sun Family's secret chamber.

More than a month had passed since Sun Luyuan's departure.

According to his usual habit, Sun Luyuan should have returned by now to feed the Boundless Mirror with his blood.

However, for some unknown reason, Sun Luyuan had not returned for an unusually long time.

On this day, Li Fan's divine sense, which was engrossed in researching the residual formations of the Boundless Mirror, suddenly detected signs of the secret chamber's defenses being disturbed.

Upon inspection, he couldn't help but chuckle.

It turned out that Wu Ninglu, through some unknown means, had actually discovered the entrance to the underground secret chamber.

She was currently attempting to infiltrate the chamber.

Although she had used a secret technique to alter and conceal her aura, she could not escape Li Fan's discerning eyes.

His divine sense quietly flew out of the Boundless Mirror, and with a gentle flick of his finger, the secret chamber's defensive formation instantly changed.

Struck by the suddenly strengthened formation, Wu Ninglu's expression shifted, and she knew she had been exposed.

Without the slightest hesitation, she transformed into a black streak of light and fled.

Li Fan watched intently as Wu Ninglu circled around and, in a secluded spot, removed her disguise.

She then brazenly returned to her own room.

She was still harboring a glimmer of hope and did not immediately flee the Sun Family.

"Heh heh, is she truly that foolish, or is she acting with impunity because she carries the Sun family's bloodline?"

"However, it has nothing to do with me. I expect that once Sun Luyuan returns, I will be able to control the Boundless Mirror and meet with that Mirror Master, Fu."

Li Fan's prediction was not wrong.

Seven days later, Sun Luyuan arrived at the underground secret chamber with a solemn expression.

He also discovered traces of an outsider having infiltrated the defensive formation, causing his face to change.

His expression was grim and uncertain. Ultimately, Sun Luyuan decided not to make a public announcement.

Instead, he first placed a ball of vital blood before the black mirror.

Li Fan felt a trace of uncontrollable desire from Sun Luoyao, the spirit of the mirror.

With a cold snort, he forcefully extinguished its primal urges. The Boundless Mirror had already been refined by him. The offering of Sun family blood would only destabilize his control over the Boundless Mirror. How could he let them have their way?

However, to avoid revealing any flaws, he still had Sun Luoyao put on an act.

After "consuming" the vital blood, Sun Luoyao slowly appeared.

"Brother, I am much better," he said against his will.

Sun Luoyao felt immense guilt for deceiving his elder brother. But as a spirit of the artifact, he was not in control. He could not even alert Sun Luyuan.

He could only watch helplessly as his elder brother walked step by step into the trap of this terrifying existence.

"That old man's demands are becoming increasingly excessive. We only provided him with important information not long ago, yet he is still not satisfied," Sun Luyuan said, looking at Sun Luoyao's faint figure. A hint of tenderness flashed in his eyes, followed by hatred.

"The demands this time are even more preposterous: to spy on information about the human avatar of the Heavenly Profound Mirror? Merely an unrealistic guess, and yet we are forced to constantly try at the cost of our blood..."

"Old thief!"

Sun Luyuan slammed his fist hard against the ground.

In the eyes of outsiders, he was the infinitely glorious patriarch of the Sun family, holding an important position in the Dharma Protector Hall, with great power and authority.

But before the true powerholders of the Myriad Immortal Alliance, he was less than a dog!

For the survival of the entire Sun family, he was subservient and without dignity.

"Why are the Law Transmitters and Mirror Masters always so high and mighty? And no matter how hard we try, we can only be their dogs!"

"Is there no hope of ever turning the tables?!"

A surge of pent-up frustration, unable to be vented, fueled Sun Luyuan's anger. A thought he had never dared to entertain before suddenly arose in his mind.

But he quickly came to his senses.

He was shocked by his own thought and hastily suppressed it deep within his mind, not daring to reveal it even to his closest brother who had become an artifact spirit.

Because he understood their methods too well; if the powerholders of the Immortal Alliance discovered his thoughts, then by the next day, the Myriad Immortal Alliance would no longer be able to find any evidence of the Sun family's existence. They would have completely vanished from the world!

However, he seemed to have underestimated the effect of brotherly connection.

"Brother, when I was spying on the Heavenly Profound Mirror last time, I actually discovered some interesting things," Sun Luoyao suddenly said.

"Hmm?" Sun Luyuan was slightly taken aback and looked at his brother's very serious expression.

"The Heavenly Profound Mirror, through various clues, has found traces of a force in the Xuanhuang Realm that is currently in hiding and may rebel in the future," Sun Luoyao whispered.

"Rebellion?" Sun Luyuan shook his head. He did not believe that anything in the vast Xuanhuang Realm could shake the rule of the Myriad Immortal Alliance.

But what his brother Sun Luoyao said next made his heart skip a beat: "According to the Heavenly Profound Mirror's prediction, this force could cause significant damage to the Myriad Immortal Alliance."

"Is this true?"

Sun Luyuan's spirit lifted. The first thought that popped into his mind was to immediately report this significant piece of news to the Mirror Master Fu, in exchange for merit.

However, just as he finished carefully reading the various information sent by his brother and was inwardly startled...

Sun Luoyao's faint voice echoed in his ears.

"Brother, I am truly suffering."

"If this continues, I won't be able to hold on for much longer and will be obliterated, body and soul."

"Being a dog for a lifetime is still being a dog."

"Even mortals dare to shout 'The emperor's turn to be,' you know..."

His brother's soft murmurs, like soul-capturing incantations, circled Sun Luyuan's ears.

The thought he had previously suppressed, influenced by his brother's words, resurfaced uncontrollably.

"Saint Dynasty Da Qi..."

Sun Luyuan narrowed his eyes and re-examined the information in his hands.

It's getting colder, everyone please stay warm and sleep early.

"A dynasty created by mortals banished to a lesser world. There might be unknown powerful figures intervening behind it, and its civilization's development speed is completely abnormal."

"Perhaps it's related to those who fled the Xuanhuang Realm from the Ten Immortal Sects before the Great Calamity descended."

"After preliminary judgment, it's not impossible that important members within the Immortal Alliance have already been infiltrated by them."

...

Sun Luyuan carefully read these fragments of text, his brows furrowed.

This Saint Dynasty Da Qi was extremely mysterious, and in which lesser world it was hidden was still unknown. The Sky Profound Mirror had only been able to infer its general strength by observing the activities of the people from the Saint Dynasty Da Qi within the Xuanhuang Realm.

"It's a pity that we couldn't capture the complete deduction basis of the Sky Profound Mirror, only scattered fragments of information."

Sun Luyuan couldn't help but feel a sense of regret.

However, Sun Luyuan still had great faith in the Sky Profound Mirror's judgment.

As the foundation of the Myriad Immortal Alliance's operation, the Sky Profound Mirror received an unimaginable amount of data every moment. If cultivators, even those in the Longevity Realm, tried to process so much data simultaneously, they would likely fall into a state of delay. Yet, the Sky Profound Mirror not only processed everything flawlessly but could even predict the future to a certain extent based on the information it possessed.

But regarding these "unhappened events," the Sky Profound Mirror could not offer any advice or take any action, other than for him to know.

Sun Luyuan was initially very puzzled by this.

It wasn't until a conversation with Mirror Master Fu that he understood the mystery behind it.

"The Myriad Immortal Alliance is governed by people, not by mirrors. No matter how miraculous it is, it is still just an artifact. If it could make all sorts of decisions without our consent, then what place would that leave for us? If this precedent is set, wouldn't the Myriad Immortal Alliance fall into chaos?"

"As for why even its judgments cannot be fully trusted..."

Mirror Master Fu remained silent for a long time and said faintly, "Great chaos cannot occur in the Xuanhuang Realm. No matter what happens, it cannot shake the positions of our group."

"The Sky Profound Mirror's judgments are purely rational deductions. A long time ago, we also tried to use more of the Sky Profound Mirror's abilities to better manage the Myriad Immortal Alliance. But..."

Mirror Master Fu paused, "Heh heh, it actually suggested things that concerned us."

"It's best to honestly remain an [artifact]."

Sun Luyuan understood that the group of people who were the actual rulers of the Immortal Alliance would never allow the Sky Profound Mirror to be above them. They wanted to always firmly grasp power in their own hands. Moreover, the Sky Profound Mirror was, after all, an artifact, and whether it could be fully trusted was still unknown.

After pondering for a long time, Sun Luyuan's initially restless heart calmed down.

"The Myriad Immortal Alliance has ruled for so many years, it is deeply entrenched. Its foundation is unimaginably profound. Furthermore, the Heavenly Venerable Preaching Elder is suppressing everything. How can it be so easily shaken?" Sun Luyuan thought, feeling incredulous about the idea that had just surfaced in his mind.

"However, nothing is absolute."

Recalling the various things he had witnessed in the Myriad Immortal Alliance's daily operations, his confidence was invisibly shaken.

"Let's wait and see. Saint Dynasty Da Qi..."

"If it truly has that momentum, then it won't be too late to make a decision."

After all, as the head of a family, every move he made concerned the lives and fortunes of hundreds of people, so he had to be extremely cautious.

He deeply suppressed the relevant information in his mind and then turned his attention back to his brother's situation.

His brother's pained expression just now had truly worried Sun Luyuan.

At this moment, Sun Luoyao seemed to have slowly recovered from the endless torment.

"Brother, I'm fine. For you, for the Sun family, I can still hold on for a while longer," Sun Luoyao said with a tragic smile.

Sun Luyuan's heart trembled, and though he had a thousand words to say, they all turned into silence as they reached his lips.

"Oh, right, Brother, you just said that Administrator Fu's mission this time is to find the human clone of the Sky Profound Mirror? What's going on?"

The underground secret room was silent for a long time before Sun Luoyao finally broke the silence. Sun Luyuan then began to explain, "Administrator Fu discovered that another Mirror Master, Cang, seems to be plotting something in secret. Among the Mirror Masters, Cang belongs to the radical faction and has always advocated for more stringent restrictive measures on the Sky Profound Mirror. But recently, his attitude has begun to waver."

"Administrator Fu judged that Cang's abnormality might be related to the clone of the Sky Profound Mirror."

Sun Luoyao seemed to have some difficulty understanding, "...How did you come to that conclusion?"

Sun Luyuan shook his head, "That I don't know. Perhaps Administrator Fu knows something else and didn't explain it clearly to me."

"Although it's just a groundless speculation, since he has already given the order, we have to complete it."

"Fortunately, he also knows that this matter is extremely difficult, so he hasn't been too demanding."

Sun Luyuan snorted coldly.

Then he looked at Sun Luoyao, "It will be hard on you again."

Sun Luoyao did not reply.

A moment later, he said quietly, "Then let's begin. While I'm still in good condition."

Sun Luyuan's expression was complicated, and he nodded. Then, he took out a small Sky Profound Mirror from his bosom.

Facing the Immeasurable Black Mirror from a distance.

An invisible force instantly descended upon the underground secret room. It was as if a passage had formed between the two mirrors. Countless shadows, mixed with strands of green light, were drawn into the Immeasurable Black Mirror through the passage.

Sun Luoyao's blurry figure began to become unstable.

His gaze towards the Sky Profound Mirror showed irresistible greed. However, in the next instant, he forcefully suppressed this greed.

As his expression flickered, more and more information was absorbed by the small Sky Profound Mirror.

Sun Luyuan nervously monitored the changes in the scene at all times.

Seeing that the time was about the same as before, he intended to put away the small Sky Profound Mirror.

"Brother, wait a little longer!"

Sun Luyuan hesitated.

This was because the longer the time spent peeking into the Sky Profound Mirror, the higher the possibility of being discovered by it. One long attempt was not as safe as multiple attempts.

But in the next moment, Sun Luoyao's words made his heart tremble.

"A human clone, this actually exists."

"Brother, give me some more time! I've found some clues!"

Sun Luyuan couldn't help but feel overjoyed that this time was so smooth.

However, he then thought if this was just an excuse his brother made up to devour more, as he had done so before.

"Believe me, Brother!"

The telepathic connection between the brothers prompted Sun Luoyao to speak proactively, dispelling Sun Luyuan's doubts.

Sun Luyuan gritted his teeth and ultimately did not put away the small Sky Profound Mirror.

There is another chapter in about twenty minutes.

Here's the translation of the new chapter, maintaining the prose and adhering to your rules:

Chapter 1167 The Primordial Spirit Creation Array

As the seconds ticked by, cold sweat dripped from Sun Luyuan's forehead. His brother, Sun Luoyao, seemed to be controlling his desires, quickly searching for information about the Sky Profound Mirror's clone.

"I can't anymore!"

Seeing that Sun Luoyao had no intention of stopping, a decisive glint flashed in Sun Luyuan's eyes. In an instant, he put away the small Sky Profound Mirror.

Suddenly losing the object he could devour, Sun Luoyao became violent, just like before.

"Not enough! I want more!"

"Brother, save me!"

It was only with Sun Luyuan's vital essence that his emotions slowly stabilized. Appearing as if he had suffered great trauma and resurrected from death, Sun Luoyao's phantom seemed even weaker than before.

He sighed feebly, "Brother, you were too rushed. It was just a little bit more..."

"Better to fail than to be exposed. Wait, what did you say..." Sun Luyuan was speaking when he suddenly realized the meaning behind his brother's words.

Sun Luoyao nodded and transmitted some images. "It really wasn't an excuse to devour more. This time, we were truly lucky to have captured possible information about the Sky Profound Mirror's clone. It's a shame that just as I was sensing the clone's specific location and identity, you broke the connection."

Sun Luoyao's words carried a hint of regret, but there was no blame. "To prove one's own Way and attain freedom. This Sky Profound Mirror actually split into a clone long ago, not only to escape the Immortal Alliance's control, but to achieve a different kind of transcendence?" Sun Luyuan felt a sense of disbelief.

Another piece of information displayed in the data made his spirit tremble and his composure shatter on the spot.

"Backlash against the Mirror Master, Mirror Slave?"

Recalling the abnormality of Mirror Master Cang that Elder Fu had mentioned earlier, and the unspoken parts of Elder Fu's words, Sun Luyuan suddenly understood.

"So, Elder Fu was also attempted to be controlled by the Sky Profound Mirror, but perhaps he escaped by chance and it didn't succeed. That's why he was suspicious of Cang, who is also a Mirror Master."

"The one supervising and controlling the Sky Profound Mirror actually carries the risk of being controlled in return. If this matter were leaked, the entire lineage of Mirror Masters would likely be purged. It might even cause tremors in the Immortal Alliance..."

Thinking of the potential consequences if this matter were exposed, Sun Luyuan felt a chill in his heart. At the same time, he made a decision: "No, I'd rather suffer Elder Fu's punishment than expose that I know about this. Otherwise, to maintain their ruling position, Elder Fu and all the other Mirror Masters would choose to silence me."

"That's enough. This matter ends here. What clone of the Sky Profound Mirror? It has nothing to do with our Sun family. Brother, you should rest for a while. I will fob off Elder Fu." Sun Luyuan's expression turned stern, and he spoke coldly.

"Brother? Such a good opportunity..." Sun Luoyao was somewhat taken aback and confused. But Sun Luyuan didn't explain, instead conveying his resolute attitude with his gaze.

In the Sun family brothers, the elder brother always made the decisions. Seeing this, Sun Luoyao could do nothing but comply. After comforting his brother for a while, Sun Luyuan, with a heavy heart, left the secret chamber.

A long silence followed.

"Sir, as you can see, you can't blame me for this." Sun Luoyao said apologetically to Li Fan, feeling uneasy.

"It's alright, your brother is indeed a remarkable person," Li Fan said calmly. Li Fan's words were not an exaggeration. To maintain calm thought and make the most correct decision under the influence of Li Fan's secret divine technique, the deliberate guidance of familial ties, and the temptation of great secrets. This Sun family patriarch was truly extraordinary.

When he was interacting with the small Sky Profound Mirror just now, peeking into its mysteries, he was not stealing information about the Sky Profound Mirror's clone. Li Fan already knew the location of the Sky Profound Mirror's clone. He merely revealed some superficial information to get by. He had originally intended to use this immense secret to directly create an opportunity to meet Elder Fu, the Mirror Master. But Sun Luyuan's decisiveness caused Li Fan's plan to be temporarily thwarted.

However, Li Fan was not bothered. "Today, I merely planted a seed. There will be a long future, and there will be plenty of opportunities later." "My objective for this time has already been achieved anyway."

Li Fan examined the true information he had just gleaned from the Immeasurable Mirror. "[The Primordial Spirit Creation Array], re-establishing the elements of fire, earth, water, and wind in the void, splitting the heavens and earth, and recreating the world..." "Such power is almost akin to the gods in mythology. Immortal arrays are truly something to aspire to."

That's right, this time Li Fan, controlling the Immeasurable Mirror, stole from the Sky Profound Mirror were fleeting thoughts about an immortal-grade array. These thoughts had appeared several times, including, but not limited to, when the Sky Profound Mirror was bound and unwilling, thinking of a solution to escape; when recalling glorious times in the immortal realm; or when contemplating how to resolve the crisis of the destruction of the Xuanhuang Realm. This array with world-creating power was constructed from a set of nine immortal-grade arrays. Even in the immortal realm of that era, it was extremely formidable, and few could complete its arrangement.

The [Gimbal, Myriad Spirits Return to Number] array, [Desolate Fall, Empty Chamber Blooms Flowers], and the source of power for the Immeasurable Mirror's ability to spy on the Sky Profound Mirror, [Immeasurable, Primordial Form], all were part of the Primordial Spirit Creation Array. The Gimbal, Myriad Spirits Return to Number array could digitize anything within its coverage, allowing for arbitrary transformation. The Desolate Fall, Empty Chamber Blooms Flowers array could create things from nothing in the void. And the Immeasurable, Primordial Form could self-analyze the secrets of the world within a small space, laying a solid foundation for the Primordial Spirit Creation Array's world creation.

Through the fleeting thoughts of the Sky Profound Mirror, Li Fan learned of a widespread understanding in the immortal realm: any constituent part of the world had an absolute similarity to the world itself. In other words, all secrets of the world could be analyzed and revealed through any item within the world. All divine abilities and cultivation methods could be comprehended from the most ordinary stone on the ground.

If someone had told Li Fan this before, he would have thought they were talking nonsense. But if it came from the memories of the Sky Profound Mirror, a consensus in the immortal realm, then Li Fan had to ponder deeply. However, understanding laws that surpassed the mundane was clearly not something he could grasp. After thinking for a long time, Li Fan could only shake his head slightly, firmly remembering it in his heart.

Snapping back to reality, based on the residual traces of the array in the Immeasurable Mirror and the vague fragmented memories of the Primordial Spirit Creation Array in the Sky Profound Mirror, he began to use the Final Dissolution Disc to deduce the Immeasurable, Primordial Form array.

"If the array were complete, this Immeasurable Mirror could do more than just spy on the Sky Profound Mirror. Perhaps all items in the Xuanhuang Realm would be unable to escape its analysis." "Even that immortal treasure, the fishing pond..."

After contemplating for a moment, Li Fan couldn't help but shake his head, snapping back to reality from his fantasies.

Even if he had the ability to analyze the fishing pond, Li Fan wouldn't have easily chosen to act. The horrifying scene of Senior Stone Slab being mysteriously fished away was still vivid in his mind, so how could Li Fan repeat the same mistake for temporary small gains?

With the lessons learned from 119 lifetimes, he would never provoke True Immortals again as long as he wasn't confident in confronting them head-on.

Besides, treasures in the fishing pond could be obtained through continuous fishing over time. It would just be slower, and he had plenty of time.

"If the [Immeasurable, Primordial Form] grand array is deduced, perhaps I can test the efficacy of the Law Deduction Talisman for the first time," the clone mused slightly after a brief check on the main body's situation.

Within the Law Deduction Talisman's space, time seemed to have lost its meaning.

Every day, the unchanging sight was the constant rotation of the law deduction light spheres. The little law deduction girl had somewhat gotten used to Li Fan's intimidation and was slowly becoming emboldened. If not for the presence of the other two Harmony Realm cultivators guarding the place, Li Fan would have definitely made her taste his methods.

However, it was not advisable to be too ostentatious at the moment, so he had to endure for a while.

"Friend Sun, calculating the time, the Method Preaching Elder should come to inspect in these few days. We need to be mindful then," Hua Yueye suddenly remembered something and transmitted a message while Li Fan was mostly focused on deducing the Immeasurable Array.

During his previous job assignment, he had been informed that the Method Preaching Elders would conduct regular inspections. So, Li Fan was not surprised and nodded in understanding.

"After the Method Preaching Elder completes the inspection, the use of the Law Petition Jade Talisman should be reopened. Things here should become a bit livelier then."

"Those who can come here and use the Law Deduction Talisman to deduce cultivation techniques are either from prominent families or possess immense luck, their future achievements are bound to be extraordinary. While doing our job well, it wouldn't hurt to build good relationships. Perhaps in a hundred years when we leave, we can leverage these connections," Hua Yueye kindly advised.

At this point, Elder Zhang Xu chimed in, "Precisely. Although the Law Deduction Talisman space remains unchanged over several hundred years, the outside world might have undergone drastic transformations. Having an extra path is always good."

Even though they were already Harmony Realm powerhouses, those who came to guard here for five hundred years were generally not the most core members of their families. Preparing for the future was only natural.

Half a month later, the Method Preaching Elder arrived as scheduled for the inspection.

Method Preaching Elder Lang, Li Fan had met him once before in the Method Preaching Assembly.

Ignoring the three guardians, Method Preaching Elder Lang smilingly approached the little law deduction girl.

The little girl rolled her eyes, then covered her ears with her hands, acting as if she couldn't hear anything he said.

Method Preaching Elder Lang seemed accustomed to this and did not get angry.

A row of silver needles appeared beside him.

Method Preaching Elder Lang picked up one of them and inserted it toward the Law Deduction Talisman's head.

The little girl's body trembled slightly, but it was as if some force was restraining her. She couldn't resist and could only let the silver needles land on different acupoints of her body one by one.

This seemingly cruel scene rendered Zhang Xu and Hua Yueye speechless.

However, Li Fan saw something in it, his eyes flashing.

This acupuncture technique used by Method Preaching Elder Lang was not one of coercion or control.

Instead, it was a top-tier healing method to regulate blood and Qi and clear the meridians. Indeed, after Method Preaching Elder Lang waited for half a day and withdrew the needles, the Law Deduction Talisman little girl's complexion looked much better.

Her little face was flushed red, as if she had just finished a strenuous workout.

"Not only is she healthier, but the human component has become active again."

Li Fan stared at the Law Deduction Talisman, observing closely, and noticed the anomaly.

During his time spent together with the Law Deduction Talisman, Li Fan had vaguely discovered that although the little girl occasionally displayed human temper, most of the time, she was like a pure machine, constantly deducing cultivation techniques.

The thought of wanting to "slack off and rest" was likely a natural consequence of working overtime, not something she was born with.

Moreover, as time passed, these purely materialized signs became more evident.

"No wonder the Method Preaching Elders need to inspect regularly; it's to maintain the Law Deduction Talisman's humanity."

"Perhaps compared to a purely miraculous object, the Law Deduction Talisman, guided by a simple little girl, can achieve better results."

As for Method Preaching Elder Lang, who had "helped" her, the Law Deduction Talisman showed no pleasant expression.

She glared at him fiercely with a puffed-out chest until he ambled away. Only then did the Law Deduction Talisman slam the table in frustration.

Then, she lay down on the long table and fell fast asleep.

The day after the inspection was a recovery period for the Law Deduction Talisman, allowing for free rest.

The little girl slept soundly, her snores shaking the heavens.

However, Li Fan noticed that the giant law deduction light sphere above her head seemed to be constantly changing at high speed, deducing something.

"Interesting," Li Fan mused thoughtfully.

As Hua Yueye had predicted, once the Law Deduction Talisman returned to its endless work, the restrictions of the Law Petition Jade Talisman were lifted.

In addition to her original deductive work, the little girl now had to take on the task of deducing customized cultivation techniques.

No wonder her attitude toward these law petitioners was so terrible.

Except for a very few cultivators with handsome appearances.

The duties of Li Fan and the other two Harmony Realm guardians also concurrently increased.

After all, they had to be constantly vigilant against malicious attacks from other forces among these law petitioners.

Fortunately, the probability of such an event was not particularly high.

With the joint supervision of three Harmony Realm cultivators, it was unlikely that any trouble would arise in the short term.

...

In the void outside the Small World of the Great Sacred Dynasty.

The Immortal Severing Grand Array, originally used to isolate mortals, had been transformed by Li Ping into part of the Heavenly Myriad Spirit Grand Array.

Li Ping had even specially tamed and cultivated a batch of void-splitting whales, creating an additional void around the Small World of the Great Sacred Dynasty to serve as a natural protective buffer.

At this moment, the darkness of the void, which should have been empty, hid a behemoth a hundred times larger than the Small World of the Great Sacred Dynasty.

It was the Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven!

Bai Hua Daoist lived up to expectations, at the cost of almost falling back into slumber, and managed to move it back quietly without alerting the Myriad Immortals Alliance.

After all, ancient cultivation of longevity surpassed ordinary Harmony Realm powerhouses in terms of strength.

Of course, the smooth completion of the task was also due to Li Ping's assistance in concealing it with formations.

Sacred Emperor Li Ping, looking at the Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven from afar and sensing the Dao One insects proliferating wildly within, remained expressionless.

There is one more chapter coming around 12:30 AM.

Chapter 1169: The Five Elements Heaven Turns into Insects

The abundant spiritual energy within the Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven was the perfect breeding ground for the Dao One insects to multiply infinitely.

A dramatic change in the world quietly unfolded within the five cave-heavens. Ordinary creatures might not have noticed the fundamental shift in spiritual energy, but the most evolved life forms within the cave-heavens reacted immediately.

The most conspicuous among them was the towering ancient tree in the wood attribute cave-heaven. Its branches and leaves moved without wind, as if trying to fight an unseen enemy. Verdant energy surged from within the giant tree, forming a barrier to prevent the invasion of the mutated spiritual energy.

However, it was unfortunate that this giant tree had not yet reached a state where it could sustain itself independently. The larger its form, the more nutrients it needed to draw from its surroundings every moment. The barrier did not last long before it was easily broken. The unseen mutated spiritual energy swarmed and devoured the giant tree in an instant.

Li Ping, from far beyond the cave-heaven, could clearly sense the entire process of the giant tree being mutated and consumed by the Dao One insects. If one looked closely, they could see countless traces of small insects crawling on the leaves of the giant tree in the wood attribute cave-heaven. On the trunk, wriggling under a few Dao One insects, a human face formed. It was ferocious and terrifying, its gaze locked onto Li Ping in the void.

"Good." Li Ping nodded slightly. After struggling for a moment, the human face on the tree trunk was slowly pulled back into the tree and disappeared. However, if viewed from a microscopic perspective, this giant tree had now completely transformed into a combination of countless Dao One insects!

It wasn't just this single giant tree. Everything within the Five Elements Cave-Heavens was undergoing the same transformation, unable to avoid it. Li Ping called this... "Insectification"!

If all the phenomena and changes brought about by the mutated Dao One insects so far were within Sacred Emperor Li Ping's expectations, then the next scene somewhat caught him off guard.

When the entire Five Elements Cave-Heaven had undergone more than a third of its insectification, a certain entity seemed to awaken. Unlike the pure heavenly dao consciousness of a cave-heaven or a small world, it was a consciousness hatched by the collective minds of billions of Dao One insects, utilizing the shell of the small world’s heavenly dao! Compared to the normal heavenly dao of a world, the newly born world consciousness of the Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven was, like the mutated Dao One insects, filled with aggressiveness and an infinite desire to devour!

Nine faint purple flying dragons suddenly appeared, protecting Li Ping. As the only Sacred Emperor with a small world surrounding the Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven, he felt a sense of being locked onto and a crisis emanating from this "insectified cave-heaven."

"A newborn calf dares to swallow a tiger," Li Ping snorted, showing no panic at all. Although the overall insectification of the Five Elements Cave-Heaven exceeded his expectations, he dared to have Daoist Bai Hua transport the Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven here because he had sufficient confidence to deal with any problems.

"The Great Sacred Dynasty's destiny transforms into dragons. Billions of citizens serve me!" Li Ping chanted, and behind him, the prosperous scene of countless citizens of the Great Sacred Dynasty living in peace and contentment emerged. Even though the scale of the Great Sacred Dynasty's small world was far inferior to the Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven, it was precisely because of the countless beings within it who held firm beliefs that it could stand its ground against a behemoth a hundred times its size!

The scene of the Sacred Dynasty was shrouded in a faint purple aura, which seemed substantial. Carrying the beliefs and popular fortune of billions of the Great Sacred Dynasty's inhabitants, Li Ping flickered and stepped above the insectified Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven. He stomped down fiercely!

In the void, sharp cries, like those of ancient primordial beasts, suddenly resounded, echoing endlessly. The vast Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven rumbled and trembled. The mutated spiritual energy within churned and surged, instantly manifesting various bizarre black mutated beasts. They rushed out of the cave-heaven world in extreme rage and fearlessness, attacking Li Ping. Their target was not just Li Ping, but the Great Sacred Dynasty behind him!

"The destiny of the Sacred Emperor benefits all ages!" The phantom image of the Sacred Dynasty behind him suddenly burst forth with infinite pale purple light, enveloping Li Ping completely. Under the illumination of the purple aura of destiny, Li Ping's body grew against the wind. In just a moment, he became larger than the entire Great Sacred Dynasty's small world. He truly appeared as a giant in myth, reaching the heavens and earth, standing before the countless beings of the Great Sacred Dynasty to fight the black insectified mutated beasts!

At this moment, on the sky screen of the Great Sacred Dynasty, Li Ping's colossal figure also appeared. Countless citizens subconsciously prostrated themselves, chanting their Sacred Emperor’s virtues. With this assistance, Li Ping’s body grew several times larger. The pale purple aura on his body gradually solidified, and Li Ping then swung it out like lightning, smashing it towards the mutated beasts.

Roaring sounds continuously echoed in the void. The mutated beasts evolving from insectification could not keep up with the speed at which Li Ping annihilated them. The destiny Sacred Emperor, with free hands, raised his fist and slammed it down hard onto the Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven. One punch, two punches! Although it was the most basic form of attack, with wisps of purple aura forcibly blasted into the cave-heaven, the ferocity of the insectified Five Elements Cave-Heaven was slowly suppressed.

The original Dao One insects that had been sent to infiltrate the cave-heaven earlier were cultivated with a strand of Li Ping's consciousness. In a sense, these countless mutated Dao One insects were his descendants. At this moment, after briefly suppressing their insectified instinctual consciousness, Li Ping gradually gained control of the insectified cave-heaven through this connection. The rebellious Five Elements Cave-Heaven slowly calmed down. The black mutated beasts that had previously bared their fangs and claws, intending to kill Li Ping, now flew affectionately to Li Ping's side, fawning over him.

Li Ping remained in his purple giant form, sensing the entirely different Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven. After being insectified and then tamed, the cave-heaven seemed to have become another body of his. He was not only aware of everything within the cave-heaven but could even manipulate the insectified cave-heaven for movement and attack!

"World Insectification..." Li Ping mused as he adapted to this new body. "If ordinary cave-heavens and small worlds are considered static existences like plants, then after insectification, they are imbued with beast-like abilities. Their aggressiveness greatly increases, and they can even hunt and feed spontaneously."

"But it's not all benefits..." Li Ping frowned slightly. "After insectification, the lifespan of the Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven has been greatly shortened. It might only last for less than a thousand years before it inevitably falls into decline."

The world naturally has an upper limit to its existence. Measured in billions of years, compared to mortals, it could almost be considered an eternal existence. But after insectification, its lifespan was shortened by an immeasurable amount.

"The disadvantages far outweigh the advantages." "Once is enough, never again." Li Ping, considering himself a person of destiny, made this judgment. However, the true body of Li Fan had a flicker of thought, a different idea forming in his mind.

—

There are two activities on Qidian recently.

One is the "Wish for an Extra Chapter," where if the goal is not met, the Qidian coins for rewards will be fully refunded, so don't worry, you can take the risk.

The other is a side story for "Filling the Plot Holes Festival." I wrote one for the Heavenly Doctor, and it will be released to everyone soon.

When it was the 119th generation, the Heavenly Doctor had told Li Fan, who was disguised as a descendant of Tian Jue, that after reaching the Dao Integration realm, methods of cultivation would no longer be as important.

What was more crucial was the comprehension of the world's essence and the workings of the Heavenly Dao.

However, without the extraordinary talent of Mr. Bai or the Dharma Transmission, how could an ordinary person like Li Fan easily comprehend such profound and abstruse Great Dao?

Even if Li Fan could indirectly understand these principles through continuous reincarnation, by borrowing the geniuses of the Xuanhuang Realm and various fortuitous encounters, the effect would still not be as good as his own direct and personal experience.

The discovery that worlds could also be "insectified" opened up a new line of thought for Li Fan.

"I can sense that after the Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven was insectified, my dominant consciousness within it was just like my previous mastery of the Spirit Wood Realm. To become the Heavenly Dao with my own body..."

"What could be easier than comprehending oneself by oneself."

"Although after insectification, the world's laws might deviate slightly, they can still serve as a reference. And with the aid of returning to truth, I can constantly restart and have plenty of opportunities for trial and error."

"Excellent."

The true body contemplated, slowly planning for the future.

The perspective returned to Saint Sovereign Li Ping.

After completely subduing the insectified Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven, Li Ping looked at the colossal entity beneath his feet and fell into deep thought.

His original plan was to use this cave-heaven as a breeding ground for mutated spiritual energy, and then release it all in a future battle against the Myriad Immortals Alliance, completely altering the battlefield and catching them off guard.

However, this insectified Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven now seemed to have other, greater uses.

A thought moved in Li Ping's mind. Outside the cave-heaven, mutated spiritual energy once again evolved into nine thick black tentacles, reaching towards the Great Qi Minor World.

Compared to the Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven, the Great Qi Minor World was like an ant beneath a giant's foot.

Under Li Ping's deliberate guidance, the Heaven and Earth Myriad Spirits Array and the Shengchao's Destiny collectively yielded their defenses, and the nine tentacles easily took deep root within the minor world.

Then, they wrapped around the outside of the world a few times.

"Ascend!"

The giant formed by the Shengchao's Destiny stood atop the insectified Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven and uttered a low cry.

The cave-heaven rumbled and, in an instant, it seemed to come alive, slowly moving into the depths of the void, far away from the Xuanhuang Realm.

The nine tentacles acted like iron chains, tethering the Great Qi Minor World and pulling it along slowly.

"Using the Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven as a reference point, moving through the void at this time is relatively slow. But from a cultivator's perspective, it is quite fast, even a bit quicker than a Nascent Soul cultivator flying at full speed."

Li Ping sensed the widening distance from the Xuanhuang Realm and nodded slightly.

Even though Li Ping had made the Great Qi Sheng Dynasty as impregnable as a golden fortress before, with numerous defenses like the Sky Patrol Arrow and the Heaven and Earth Myriad Spirits Array, there was one problem that could never be avoided.

That was that the Great Qi Minor World was too close to the Xuanhuang Realm.

There was no strategic depth. If its location were discovered by the Myriad Immortals Alliance, it could fall into a precarious situation of being trapped and surrounded under a surprise attack.

But what if it were hidden deeper...

For thousands of years, the Celestial Whale swarm had been continuously cleaving open the void.

It had created an excellent environment for concealment.

"The Myriad Immortals Alliance has relevant records concerning the minor worlds where mortals migrated in the past."

"However, when they lock onto the location and attempt to attack, they will find that the minor world of yesteryear has become an empty void. I imagine they will be quite stunned."

"Indeed. We could even set up numerous killing formations in the original location of the Great Qi Minor World and wait for the Myriad Immortals Alliance to walk into a trap. Hehehe..."

In an instant, countless schemes flooded Li Ping's mind.

The slow, overall movement of the minor world did not attract the attention of the citizens of the Great Qi Sheng Dynasty. Even the nine black tentacles deeply embedded in the world were only noticed by a select few, including Sun Erlang.

However, upon learning that it was the work of Saint Sovereign Li Ping, they could only marvel at their Saint Sovereign's divine power.

"Fellow Daoist, where are you planning to drag this world to..."

Outside the world, in the void.

Having received Li Ping's help and recovered somewhat, Daoist Bai Hua, noticing the world's movement, quickly flew out to investigate.

What she saw was the sight of the insectified Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven, with its nine tentacles pulling the minor world forward at high speed.

Even though she prided herself on her extensive knowledge, she was awe-struck by the scene before her.

"Why must there be a destination?"

Li Ping dispelled his giant avatar and returned to his normal form, saying calmly.

While the actions just taken had consumed a certain amount of the Dynasty's Destiny, with the Sheng Dynasty's peak prosperity and continuous improvement, it would be fully restored within half a year.

"Fellow Daoist, between a fixed checkpoint and a ship drifting aimlessly in a river, which do you think is harder to attack?" Li Ping asked, his voice echoing faintly.

Daoist Bai Hua instantly understood Li Ping's meaning and nodded, "Indeed. Constantly shifting its position in the void, making it impossible to even pinpoint its location, let alone launch a siege. Your move, Fellow Daoist, is truly brilliant."

Bai Hua praised profusely.

"However, there is still one drawback at the moment."

"What is it?"

"With only the Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven dragging it, the speed of its advance through the void is still too slow."

A premonition of disaster suddenly flashed through Daoist Bai Hua's mind.

"Therefore, I will have to trouble Fellow Daoist Bai Hua to make a few more trips."

Li Ping turned around and said sincerely.

"I have a few more suitable targets here. Although their scale is not comparable to the Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven, they are still barely usable. When Fellow Daoist has transported them all here, I will connect them with formations, and then the forward momentum will increase severalfold."

Recalling the tragic experience of transporting the Five Elements Cave-Heaven before, and looking at the detailed information of the more than ten cave-heavens provided by Li Ping, Daoist Bai Hua felt a wave of dizziness and saw a gloomy future.

"Heh heh, don't worry, Fellow Daoist. Since you have worked so diligently for the Sheng Dynasty, I will naturally not treat you poorly." Li Ping smiled and pointed with his finger in the air.

A golden, swimming dragon instantly appeared before Bai Hua.

"What is this? Myriad Spirit Jade Nectar?" Daoist Bai Hua exclaimed in surprise.

"No, that's not right. It's just condensed cultivation." After a moment, Bai Hua felt a slight sense of regret.

"Heh heh, the Essence of Origin Source, only True Immortals can condense it, how could I possibly possess it? However, this refined Origin Source should compensate for some of the damage you sustained while transporting the cave-heavens," Li Ping said indifferently.

The Origin Source that formed the golden dragon was naturally condensed by the citizens of Great Qi practicing the "Qizhi Lingyuan Art." It was a pure cultivation lacking attributes, one level below the Essence of Origin Source.

Daoist Bai Hua maintained her composure for a moment before finally opening her mouth and swallowing the golden dragon.

She instantly refined it, not only healing her old wounds but also making her dark golden glazed body even more solid.

"Many thanks for your help, Fellow Daoist."

There is still one more chapter coming around 12:30.

"However, the Origin Power that Fellow Daoist gave me seems to be..."

"More advanced?" Daoist Bai Hua carefully chose her words and asked slowly.

Li Ping naturally would not tell Bai Hua that the reason why the Origin Power's effect was far superior to ordinary cultivation was because he wanted to use the power of the beings' faith to elevate the Origin Power into Essence of Origin Source. However, all current attempts had ended in failure. After all, even a discarded existence by a True Immortal was beyond mortal power and not so easy to control.

"It's just your illusion. How is your recovery? If you're almost done, let's be on our way." Li Ping said indifferently.

Daoist Bai Hua smiled awkwardly. She had no other choice but to sigh and bid farewell, then set off on her journey.

"After ensuring the absolute safety of the main base, we can then consider conquering other small worlds."

"We know the specific location of each small world like the back of our hand. We can even infiltrate them first and move the entrances to the void near Great Qi."

"Spiritual wood, empire..."

"And the Netherworld."

Just as Sage Emperor Li Ping returned to his Sage Emperor's throne and sat contemplating the future direction of the Sacred Dynasty, his disciple Sun Erlang requested an audience.

"Uh, Master. That item I fished up from the fishing pond before..." Sun Erlang looked a bit uneasy.

"Speak your mind."

Then, Sun Erlang explained the whole story. It turned out that after the previous fishing competition ended, most of the anglers who received rewards were absorbed by various institutions of the Sacred Dynasty. Among them, a middle-aged man named Quan Ruochu was noticed by Sun Erlang and taken under his wing. What he had fished from the fishing pond was a white orb of light. At that time, Li Ping had personally inspected it and found it to be a common item called [Orchid Shadow Flower], so he didn't pay much attention to it.

However, according to Sun Erlang, this Orchid Shadow Flower, which on the surface was at most of the Nascent Soul level, had displayed completely unreasonable abilities after a period of careful cultivation by Quan Ruochu.

"Quan Ruochu, despite being middle-aged, has achieved nothing. His parents are deceased, and he has no wife or descendants. The only things he loved in his life were fishing and tending to flowers. He has a calm disposition and no ambitions. Therefore, after fishing up the white orb of light, he wasn't overly dejected. In fact, he was more fond of the Orchid Shadow Flower than other treasures."

"He initially thought that the Orchid Shadow Flower, like a normal flower, would grow in soil and be nourished by spiritual energy. However, after Quan Ruochu planted it, no matter how carefully he tended to it, it remained listless, as if on the verge of wilting. Out of his deep love for the flower, Quan Ruochu did something inconceivable to save the Orchid Shadow Flower." Sun Erlang bowed his head and whispered to the Sage Emperor.

"He actually planted the Orchid Shadow Flower on himself! Using his own body as soil, he nourished it with his vital blood..."

"In just a few days, he went from a relatively robust man to skin and bones, with a faint breath! But he still didn't give up, intending to use his last drops of blood as sustenance."

"When I went to find him after not seeing him for a few days, this was the scene I witnessed." Sun Erlang's voice was low. "I initially wanted to get rid of this demonic flower, but Quan Ruochu threatened me with his own life, saying that as the flower goes, so goes he..."

"And considering that it was a treasure bestowed by Master, I hesitated and didn't act. But seeing Quan Ruochu getting weaker and weaker, nearing death, I ultimately couldn't stand by and watch."

The moment Sun Erlang spoke, Li Ping had already pinpointed Quan Ruochu's location and was carefully examining his condition. After all, it was just a blue orb of light without any particularly profound properties, so he understood as soon as he looked.

After Sun Erlang finished speaking, Li Ping shook his head and said sternly, "Erlang, you have disappointed me greatly."

Sun Erlang's body trembled slightly, and he buried his head even lower. "A commander should lead the entire army and not be swayed by personal emotions, or even by tens or hundreds of individuals. This is the first time you have sought me out since becoming my disciple, and it is just for this matter?"

After a long silence, Sun Erlang said hoarsely, "Master, please see clearly. If he were to die instantly, I might have been indifferent. But to watch someone I know slowly have their life drained away and wither. My heart truly cannot remain calm."

"I request Master's punishment."

Li Ping's voice boomed, like divine thunder from the heavens, echoing in the Sage Emperor's throne. "The reason I am disappointed in you is not only your indecisiveness but also your lack of discernment between right and wrong. A demonic flower..."

"Go back and take a closer look!" Li Ping waved his hand, expelling Sun Erlang.

Sun Erlang's heart tightened at first, then, as if he understood something, he rushed to Quan Ruochu's residence with great joy. After his Master's guidance, Sun Erlang observed again and finally discovered the mystery of the Orchid Shadow Flower. Although it appeared that the Orchid Shadow Flower was constantly devouring Quan Ruochu's vital blood, it was simultaneously splitting off a wisp of magical power to maintain Quan Ruochu's flame of life.

In this state between life and death, the Orchid Shadow Flower grew vigorously. At the same time, Quan Ruochu was undergoing a complete transformation.

"His sliver of life is entirely tied to this Orchid Shadow Flower. If I had rashly cut it down, it would have resulted in the death of both the flower and the person. I almost made a grave mistake!" Sun Erlang couldn't help but feel a sense of lingering fear.

He sealed off the entrance, forbidding any outsiders from disturbing it, and simultaneously moved a miniature [Heaven and Earth Furnace] nearby to ensure the surrounding spiritual energy concentration. After doing all this, Sun Erlang finally breathed a sigh of relief.

"Thanks to Master's guidance," he said with some luck.

However, Sun Erlang was unaware that while the Orchid Shadow Flower did indeed protect a sliver of Quan Ruochu's life force, it was not out of gratitude for his planting. It was merely a survival instinct before finding a new host. And Quan Ruochu, with only Qi Refining cultivation, could not withstand the Orchid Shadow Flower's unbridled absorption. Death was inevitable. Without external assistance.

The reason he appeared to be getting better was purely because Sage Emperor Li Ping had lent a hand.

"Is it right or wrong, is it good or evil."

"No one can accurately judge until the final outcome is reached."

"Only by taking it step by step, reaching the end, can one justify oneself."

"The process... is not important."

Sage Emperor Li Ping sat on the Sage Emperor's throne, his thoughts slightly rippling in his mind.

...

In a domain of endless white mist.

"This... how many frozen corpses are there here?" Shang Shaojun, who was brought into the Reverse Life and Death Array by Sheng Tai Li Fan, exclaimed in shock at the horrifying scene before him.

--

I glanced and actually reached the reward goal for an extra chapter? Boss, you're confused!

Tomorrow, I can only shed tears and earn this money.

As the commander of the Azure Profound Army, Shang Shaojun had suppressed the Chizha Abyss for a hundred years. Even when faced with the terrifying wave of world-ending demonic music, he could remain calm and composed.

But now, he truly felt a bone-deep fear that he hadn't experienced in a long time.

There were simply too many cultivators frozen to death in this sea of ice.

Shang Shaojun could hardly imagine where all these cultivators had come from.

He suspected that the number of cultivators buried here was greater than that of the entire Xuanhuang Realm!

Sage Embryo Li Fan also feigned being frightened by the scene before him, his body trembling slightly, a look of horror on his face.

"Young Lord, do not act rashly. Be cautious," he said, seemingly recovering his senses after a while, comforting Shang Shaojun.

Shang Shaojun's expression remained grim, and he kept glancing around, as if some unknown enemy was hiding nearby.

"Something is wrong here... Did you hear anything?" Shang Shaojun transmitted, asking.

"A sound? What sound?" Sage Embryo Li Fan was a little taken aback, but this was not an act.

Shang Shaojun's face darkened. "Perhaps it's because I've stayed in the Chizha Abyss for too long, and I'm very sensitive to any sound. Ever since I arrived in this domain, I've been hearing a faint whisper. It comes and goes, can't you hear it?"

Sage Embryo Li Fan narrowed his eyes.

This was not his first time here.

He had even guided various cultivators to this place.

But no one was like Shang Shaojun, who could actually hear a strange sound in the dead silent sea of ice.

A different thought arose in his mind. Sage Embryo Li Fan said solemnly, "What do you think, Young Lord? This place must involve a great secret. But similarly, if we want to investigate further, it will surely involve great risks. Should we leave before we are discovered, or try to find out more?"

Shang Shaojun did not answer Li Fan immediately. Instead, his ears twitched slightly, as if he were discerning the sound he heard.

After a moment, he transmitted, "Brother Li, follow me. I have a feeling that tracing the source of this sound might unlock a part of the mystery of this place."

Sage Embryo Li Fan nodded slightly, drawing his sword shadow to protect them both.

"Be careful."

The two shuttled through the endless sea of ice.

Li Fan was actually already well aware of the overall structure of the Reverse Life and Death Array.

However, since he was pretending to be here for the first time, he did not expose Shang Shaojun even when Shang Shaojun led him in circles within the array.

He simply followed behind silently.

But as Shang Shaojun stubbornly pushed in a certain direction, Sage Embryo Li Fan also discovered subtle changes in their surroundings caused by this.

It had even eluded the analysis of the End Departure Disc, and he had overlooked it!

"There's still a hidden change in the great array? As expected of an array that can prove the path to eternal life," Li Fan was secretly astonished.

They continued to advance.

It was as if they were walking in place, but the ice coffins in the surrounding dead sea were spinning around them.

The deeper they went, the faster the surrounding scenery spun.

"Be careful, Brother Li. It seems the source of the sound is just ahead!" Shang Shaojun's voice was also a little nervous.

As if passing through a narrow tunnel of time and space, the surrounding scenes, due to the rapid speed, all turned into overlapping lines.

When they broke through the end of the tunnel, countless circles merged into a single point.

Then, they exploded in their vision.

It was suddenly open and bright.

However, the air around them became even colder.

It even made Sage Embryo Li Fan and the other person feel stiff all over from the biting cold.

"Hoo..."

They stimulated the spiritual energy within their bodies, trying to drive away the bone-chilling cold.

The two carefully observed their surroundings.

It seemed to be the inside of a silvery-white sphere of light. Apart from some blurry boundaries, there was nothing inside.

When they looked back in the direction they came from, their pupils suddenly contracted.

Like yin and yang fish, small spheres that rotated continuously, they floated quietly in the air.

From the dim part of it, Sage Embryo Li Fan could vaguely sense the aura of the dead, frozen sea from before.

And inside this white sphere of light, there were actually eight more such yin-yang spheres!

A total of nine, forming a special shape.

Shang Shaojun swallowed hard.

The number of dead inside just one yin-yang sphere was countless.

If this number were multiplied by nine...

The two looked at each other, and both saw the fear in each other's hearts.

They even became cautious when communicating through telepathy, for fear of disturbing the nine yin-yang spheres here.

"Young Lord, the sound you heard earlier..."

"It's gone. It stopped abruptly and mysteriously when we entered here. Wait..." Shang Shaojun suddenly froze and turned to look in the opposite direction of the yin-yang spheres.

Sage Embryo Li Fan followed his gaze but saw nothing.

"Careful."

Shang Shaojun only gave a cautious reminder and then stopped speaking.

His body stiffened and he no longer moved. His aura instantly became extremely weak.

It was only then that Sage Embryo Li Fan sensed that some invisible existence had descended upon this space.

Thump! Thump! Thump!

Although there was no distinct sound, the heavy footsteps unmistakably landed on Li Fan's heart.

They were getting closer.

Disregarding the two uninvited intruders, it went straight to the vicinity of the nine yin-yang beads.

Hoo...

A soft puff of air was heard.

The space near the yin-yang beads also showed waves of distortion.

As if being boiled in water, the yin and yang parts of the nine small spheres revolved around each other, becoming more distinct.

And Shang Shaojun and Li Fan clearly saw that as this unknown existence exhaled, wisps of frozen corpses entered the nine yin-yang beads.

The entire extremely bizarre process did not last long.

The oppressive footsteps gradually faded away, and the silver-white space slowly returned to normal.

The nine yin-yang beads also slowly settled down and became calm again.

After a long time, the two finally communicated through telepathy.

"What was that just now?"

"The sense of crisis was like needles pricking all over my body, and my spiritual sense warned me frantically. It felt as if disaster would strike at any moment... Such a feeling, perhaps even a Heavenly Venerate of Longevity could not bring it?"

After a few short sentences, the two fell into extreme silence.

"The sound I heard earlier must have been the echo of that unknown being's footsteps here," Shang Shaojun guessed. "Even though it has already left, the sound lingers."

"The countless frozen corpses in the yin-yang beads seem to be the work of that guy. But I still can't figure out where this guy got so many corpses from? And what lies outside this silver-white space?"

Sage Embryo Li Fan could not answer these questions either.

He had thought this was merely the dojo of the Heavenly Venerate of Rebirth, but he never expected that in this life, by chance, he would discover a deeper secret hidden behind it.

Previously, Li Fan had always been puzzled by the countless corpses in the Great Death and Life Reversal Formation.

There were too many inexplicable aspects. Firstly, the sheer quantity was overwhelming. Secondly, all the corpses were preserved in a relatively good state. They did not appear to be remnants of a world-ending catastrophe.

"I initially suspected that the Heavenly Venerate of Rebirth might also be a guise of the Heavenly Physician. Now it seems..."

Recalling the terrifying intangible monster from just now, Li Fan couldn't help but question his own judgment.

"What's the connection between that monster and the Heavenly Venerate of Rebirth?"

Li Fan had once encountered the Heavenly Venerate of Rebirth. In his 119th life, a white mist body suddenly appeared and instantly killed three Law Transmitters. However, the matter was later dropped with the Law Transmitter Heavenly Venerate's intervention.

"Transmission, Heavenly Physician, Rebirth. There must be some connection between these three."

"But that intangible monster from just now..."

In an instant, countless thoughts flashed through Sage Embryo Li Fan's mind.

"Brother Li, for safety's sake, let's leave here first," Shang Shaojun's words interrupted his reverie.

The two retraced their steps and returned to the Yin-Yang Bead. This time, they appeared directly on the Sea of Life, opposite the Sea of Deathly Stillness. Furthermore, the winds on the sea were all blowing towards the exit of the forbidden zone.

"Is this... a gesture of dismissal?"

The two looked at each other, startled again. However, they dared not linger any longer and hastily left through the exit.

"Phew." Leaving the Forbidden Zone of Life and Death and returning to the white mist, Shang Shaojun felt no sense of relief from surviving a disaster. Instead, he became somewhat dejected. "The Xuánhuáng Realm hides too many secrets."

"The intangible being we encountered this time is definitely no weaker than that mysterious person who reshaped the world. Even if the Heavenly Venerate himself returned, could he truly cleanse everything..."

Having witnessed too many things beyond his comprehension in a short period, Shang Shaojun became lost.

Sage Embryo Li Fan immediately changed the subject. "What do you think of that intangible being, Shaojun?"

"It doesn't seem like a cultivator. Otherwise, it wouldn't have ignored us. It's more like some kind of entity executing a fixed task..."

"Monster?" Shang Shaojun finally managed to utter the word after a long pause.

"But even as a monster, it's an insurmountable existence for us," he said self-deprecatingly. "To think that I, after guarding the Chichi Abyss for hundreds of years, achieving great success in my divine arts, and considering myself unrivaled in the Xuánhuáng Realm below Longevity, would only discover such terrifying existences within a year or so of accompanying Brother Li on his travels. I now realize how narrow-minded I was before."

Li Fan comforted him, "It's not that Shaojun isn't strong. It's just that these old monsters are too deeply hidden."

After a moment of contemplation, Sage Embryo Li Fan asked, "Do you feel disheartened, Shaojun?"

"Not at all, not at all. As the saying goes, when a nation is about to fall, it must have strange omens. The more chaotic the phenomena, the more it indicates that the Xuánhuáng Realm is gravely ill." Shang Shaojun's spirits lifted after a brief period of low mood.

"However, with the strength of just the two of us, it's difficult to change all this."

"We need help," Shang Shaojun said earnestly.

"I had the same intention originally. But finding someone trustworthy and capable... it's difficult," Sage Embryo Li Fan sighed.

Shang Shaojun's eyes shone as he looked beyond the white mist. "I do have some preferred candidates."

"Let's go. We'll head back first. Our travels during this period have at least provided us with some evidence. We have at least a seventy percent chance of convincing them."

As they flew through the white mist, Shang Shaojun began introducing people to Li Fan.

"The first is Ji Linglun. Have you heard of him, Brother Li?"

"Although his current cultivation is only at the Nascent Soul stage, his strength is by no means inferior to mine. He is proficient in all arts and all martial techniques, and is full of knowledge. He is truly a top-tier prodigy of the Xuánhuáng Realm. More importantly, he is absolutely loyal to the Myriad Immortals Alliance! If we can persuade him to join us, it might even bring other surprises."

"There's another person, named Ji Hongdao. He is a rare genius in formations in this era. If not for his weaker seniority and background, I don't think he would be unable to contend for the position of Chief of the Alliance's Strategy Hall! Besides formations, he is also skilled in the art of artifact refining..."

Shang Shaojun rattled off name after name, all familiar to Li Fan.

"Uh, actually, there's one more person who might be considered. However..." Shang Shaojun hesitated.

"However, this person's background is not simple. There are too many deep entanglements behind him. Bringing him in might not be a good thing."

Without drawing out the suspense, Shang Shaojun continued, "Although he appears to be just a mischievous child, he is terrifyingly strong in actual combat. Even I, at the Dao Integration stage, might not be able to force out his full strength. But his mind is not very clear. As soon as he sees someone, he insists on sparring..."

Li Fan instantly understood who Shang Shaojun was referring to. It was likely the reincarnated Martial Maniac, Senior Brother Zhang Qianmo.

Li Fan had once used the extremely high-level authority of the Heavenly Profound Mirror to search for information about the Martial Maniac. The Myriad Immortals Alliance internally judged him to be the 'Essence of Heaven and Earth, born into human form.' Although he possessed a human body, his behavior, habits, and way of thinking were not human. Instead, he was more like a materialized rule of the Essence of Heaven and Earth.

The Martial Maniac was not undefeated, but his learning ability was terrifyingly fast. Any move used against him in combat was immediately learned by him. The Alliance had even attempted to capture and study him carefully, but he repeatedly vanished into thin air under the watchful eyes of many and strict surveillance. He would reappear hundreds of miles away and have no recollection of being captured. The Alliance had even dispatched several Dao Integration experts to kill him. The Martial Maniac's bones turned to dust. However, he reappeared in the world not long after, alive and well, and had even learned some of the divine abilities of those Dao Integration experts.

Given his troublesome nature and the fact that he quietly sought sparring partners without causing any harm to the Alliance's safety, the Myriad Immortals Alliance headquarters decided to merely monitor him strictly and not interfere further.

Li Fan speculated that the Martial Maniac's extraordinary abilities might be related to Senior Brother Zhang's Grand Vow Dharma Body. The Grand Vow Dharma Body merged with heaven and earth, making it almost a part of the laws of heaven and earth. Mistaking him for the Essence of Heaven and Earth was not surprising. As for whether the Martial Maniac had any relation to Senior Brother Zhang... the two extremely similar faces already told the whole story.
