"Shao jun, you don't need to worry too much. We should welcome everyone who comes and be as inclusive as possible. After all, if what we intend to do fails..."

"It's likely that the Myriad Immortals Alliance will no longer have a place for us," Sage Embryo Li Fan said with a smile.

Shang Shaojun was slightly stunned for a moment, then nodded.

"Then let's visit them one by one!"

"Young Lord, is this First Stratagem a product of the 'Era'?"

On the way to Tianshu Prefecture of the Myriad Immortals Alliance, Sage Embryo Li Fan asked a question he had long suspected.

Shang Shaojun paused, seemingly unsurprised that Li Fan knew confidential information about the Alliance related to the 'Era'.

He replied in a low voice, "Yes and no."

"As far as I know, the Alliance did indeed use the 'Era' to cultivate a group of death warriors. However, those people were not born and raised in the Yellow Expanse naturally; they lacked that sliver of sentience."

"Although they all displayed astonishing talent during the 'Era' simulations, their actual performance upon arriving in the Yellow Expanse was significantly lacking. They were quite suitable as fearless cannon fodder, but not for important tasks," Shang Shaojun said with a slight shake of his head.

"However, later, the Alliance found a way to improve them. Brother Li, do you know that each Dharma Progenitor has their own exclusive small world?"

Sage Embryo Li Fan replied, "I have heard whispers of it."

"Each Dharma Progenitor divides a portion of their subordinate small worlds to jointly form a 'Primordial Great Realm'. It is said to be a truly brutal chaotic world where, every hundred years, the beings within are thoroughly purged. Only those who receive the collective praise of the Dharma Progenitors within that century can be spared."

"Brother Li, you must understand, the beings in the 'Primordial Great Realm' are either consciousnesses and souls meticulously selected from the 'Era', or peerless prodigies from the Dharma Progenitors' respective worlds. To stand out in such an environment… their capabilities can be imagined."

Shang Shaojun's tone was grave. "The origin of the First Stratagem is thus."

"From the 'Era' to the 'Primordial Great Realm'. The First Stratagem walked out step by step, eventually gaining the favor of the various Dharma Progenitors. Using a supreme treasure left by a Heavenly Venerable, his body was reshaped. Furthermore, due to their deep trust, he was specially permitted to retain his past experiences and memories. Even though he currently holds no specific position within the Alliance, no one dares to slight him."

"In that case, this First Stratagem is truly legendary," Sage Embryo Li Fan said with some emotion after hearing Shang Shaojun's explanation.

However, he then expressed some confusion. "For someone like this, we're just going to visit him... Young Lord, aren't you afraid he'll tie us up and hand us over to the Dharma Progenitors?"

Shang Shaojun laughed heartily. "Brother Li worries too much. Putting aside the fact that I adventured with the First Stratagem back in the day and we have a decent relationship; the reason he is so trusted by the Dharma Progenitors is that since his creation, his soul has forever been branded with loyalty to the Myriad Immortals Alliance. The more experiences he has, the stronger he becomes, and the deeper that brand becomes."

"He told me this himself. He doesn't care about it; rather, he sees it as a great honor. What we are doing, is it not all for the Myriad Immortals Alliance? If he knew that the Alliance harbored many hidden conspiracies, he certainly wouldn't stand by. Given his temperament, he would even personally investigate to verify our claims," Shang Shaojun said with full confidence.

However, things did not go as smoothly as anticipated.

"What? First Stratagem is not here?"

"We had an appointment!"

Outside the First Stratagem's manor, Shang Shaojun and Li Fan were stopped.

Shang Shaojun's expression turned grim, his aura as a Dao Integration cultivator surging.

The two guards at the gate, though pale, remained composed and explained, "Your pardon, sir. Our master suddenly received a secret order from the Alliance and departed in haste. The matter was urgent, so he didn't even have time to inform us..."

Shang Shaojun attempted to contact the First Stratagem again using a communication talisman. As expected, there was no response.

Exchanging a glance with Li Fan, knowing that forcing the issue was not an option, he could only let out a cold snort and give up.

"I believe it's not that First Stratagem is deliberately avoiding us, but rather that something important has come up," Li Fan whispered.

"Hmm. I know First Stratagem's character; he wouldn't feign refusal. I just don't know what has happened in the Alliance that such an urgent summons for First Stratagem was issued. This matter must be significant," Shang Shaojun murmured.

With their first target missed, the two decided to change course and find Ji Hongdao in Tianyu Prefecture.

However, they did not anticipate that Ji Hongdao had also been transferred by an appointment.

The two looked at each other, temporarily halting their plans to find people.

"Something is not right. Let me have someone inquire," Shang Shaojun said, his brow furrowed.

Meanwhile, Li Fan's divine sense, hidden within the Boundless Mirror, had already quietly set in motion.

Silently pilfering a Heavenly Profound Mirror from the Sun family, he activated the Boundless Mirror to probe the information within.

As expected, the Heavenly Profound Mirror was already aware of the Myriad Immortals Alliance's movements.

However, this outcome left Li Fan somewhat inexplicably surprised.

"A message from the Dharma Progenitor Heavenly Venerable: The Yellow Expanse may experience some minor disturbances recently, and the Alliance needs to make preparations in advance."

"This..."

"Since its creation, the Myriad Immortals Alliance has only received a few direct messages from the Dharma Progenitor Heavenly Venerable. The Dharma Progenitors attach great importance to this..."

Disconnecting the Boundless Mirror's probe and briefly comforting his divine sense, Li Fan fell into deep thought.

He was unsure if the event of a "Heavenly Venerable Message" had occurred in his previous reincarnations.

However, a minor disturbance in the Yellow Expanse had absolutely not occurred in any of the many lives he had experienced.

"The Dharma Progenitor Heavenly Venerable specifically sent a message to instruct them, indicating that the impending disturbance will not be small. If caught off guard and unprepared, it might cause widespread panic."

"But since the Dharma Progenitor only sent a message and did not return in person, it suggests that this disturbance will not cause a truly devastating blow to the Yellow Expanse..."

"The disturbance predicted by the Dharma Progenitor is expected in about a month. By then, we will know if this is an event unique to this life."

...

Meanwhile, Shang Shaojun also obtained some results from his inquiries.

It was naturally not as detailed as what was obtained from the Heavenly Profound Mirror, but it was roughly the same.

"The entire Myriad Immortals Alliance, from top to bottom, has been mobilized. It is likely that related orders will reach the Eternal Immortal Fortress soon..."

"Brother Li, what do you think?"

Sage Embryo Li Fan pondered for a moment and said, "What you and I intend to accomplish is not a task of a day or two. Since the entire Yellow Expanse is likely facing a crisis, we should first focus on preparing to deal with it."

"The Azure Profound Army cannot be leaderless, and the Roaring Abyss might have unusual movements again. Why don't you and I return to the Eternal Immortal Fortress first and wait and see?"

Li Fan's suggestion was approved by Shang Shaojun.

The two then hastily concluded their trip and returned to Broken Palm Immortal City.

Gazing at the tranquil, deep Roaring Abyss not far away, Sage Embryo Li Fan's mind conjured the figure that had appeared at the bottom of the Roaring Abyss before.

"Perhaps the peculiarity of this life is related to these small actions of mine?"

Li Fan frowned slightly, a hint of puzzlement in his eyes.

Perhaps the word "perhaps" could be removed.

If the Yellow Expanse realm truly experiences a general upheaval, then it is almost certain that it was caused by some action of Li Fan in this life.

"The source of the Yellow Expanse realm's shaking should come from the Immortal Ruins' suction."

"The key lies here. By what virtue can I influence the Immortal Ruins?"

The scenes experienced in this life flashed rapidly before Li Fan's eyes.

After excluding all impossible options, Li Fan was left with a few suspicious targets.

The mysterious figure in the Roaring Abyss who re-implanted world fragments.

The unseen entity in the Maze of Life and Death that collected cultivator corpses.

And...

The relocation and movement of the Five Elements Great Grotto-Heavens.

With Li Fan's own strength, whether it be his main body or his clones, he is currently unable to alter the Immortal Ruins in the slightest.

However, his actions can influence and change the destiny of those powerful beings that can shake the Immortal Ruins, thus causing deviations.

"It will only take a little over a month, so let's wait patiently."

Sage Embryo Li Fan remained silent.

While the Immortal Alliance was in a state of urgent preparation, the Sacred Dynasty Great Qi was also in the same situation.

Not long ago, an imperial decree was issued stating that the Sacred Emperor would be testing his divine abilities in the void outside of Great Qi. This might cause some minor tremors, which is a normal phenomenon and should not cause panic.

The citizens of Great Qi, their reverence for the Sacred Emperor had already reached a near fanatical level.

Naturally, whatever he said was taken as truth.

When the populace heard this, they were not only not nervous or fearful, but instead eagerly anticipated the power of the Sacred Emperor's divine abilities.

In the secret chamber beneath the Sacred Emperor's throne,

Elder Yin was facing Li Ping.

"The little ones you sent me last time are indeed very talented. Some are even smarter than I imagined. Two of them have already successfully laid their foundation with me. As for the others, it shouldn't be long."

"If one accepts from the beginning that [laying foundation with me] is the only and most correct method, it would indeed greatly aid in smooth cultivation."

Elder Yin first summarized the recent results, then changed the subject: "Lately, I've been feeling quite uneasy. I heard you're going to test some divine abilities? Please try to stay far away and don't destroy this small world."

"I'm quite fond of this place," Elder Yin said lightly.

Li Ping nodded in agreement, but his mind was churning: "Elder Yin is a spirit of the world, parasitic within the Yellow Expanse realm. Even he senses something vaguely. It seems the Yellow Expanse realm is truly about to encounter some calamity."

Time slowly passed amidst the anticipation of all.

And, without anyone knowing, hundreds of stone puppets quietly flew into the sky above the Yellow Expanse realm.

At the edge of the world, it was only a step away from falling into the void.

They were still within the scope of the Yellow Expanse realm and would not be sucked away by the Immortal Ruins' suction.

And yet, they could observe the overall macroscopic scene of the Yellow Expanse realm from a high vantage point.

These puppets were naturally created by Li Ping.

They had no particularly special purpose other than to observe and record this event of the Yellow Expanse realm's upheaval.

The puppets floated silently in the air, waiting for the target event to arrive.

The day of the predicted scripture transference was drawing nearer.

On this day, suddenly, Li Fan's main body in the Derivation Array space, Sage Embryo Li Fan outside the Roaring Abyss, Li Fan's divine consciousness in the Immeasurable Mirror, and the Sacred Emperor Li Ping in the Sacred Dynasty Great Qi.

All felt something in the same instant.

They all looked up at the sky.

In that lifetime of locking the Heavenly Profound with spirit, Ji Hongdao had once instantly killed cultivators in a province, using a mutual destruction method to force the Heaven's Will Celestial Venerable of the Longevity realm to retreat to the Five Elders Association.

At that time, because a large number of cultivators had suddenly been removed as anchors, the Yellow Expanse realm suddenly felt lighter.

It trembled and roared incessantly.

All living beings within it felt a premonition of impending doom, as if they were about to perish at any moment. Li Fan had personally experienced this feeling at that time.

And now, this feeling was more than a hundred times stronger.

*Boom!*

Without any warning, the Yellow Expanse realm began to shake violently.

It was as if a giant was fiercely tearing the entire world apart with its bare hands.

Cracks appeared from all corners of the earth and rapidly spread outwards. In an instant, the previously flat terrain became scarred and battered.

Countless mountain ranges split open, some even collapsing entirely and falling into the abysses that suddenly appeared in the ground.

If what happened on the surface was not enough to make the cultivators living in the floating cities feel fear,

Then the subsequent changes in the white mist barrier made all cultivators in the Yellow Expanse realm tremble uncontrollably.

The white mist barrier, which spanned across the heavens and earth and seemed eternally unchanging, actually began to bend and break.

The white mist overflowed from its original fixed area, spreading outwards.

Wherever it passed, it devoured the lifespan of all living beings.

The boundaries of the prefectures thus changed.

And through the eyes of the hundreds of puppets high in the sky, Li Fan could see even more clearly.

The energy-devouring white mist, as if attracted by something outside the Yellow Expanse realm, surged forth.

However, it seemed that due to some restraining force, the white mist could not leave the Yellow Expanse realm.

It was precisely the pulling between these two forces that caused the white mist barrier to break.

Heaven and earth underwent a drastic change, and the spiritual energy became turbulent.

Li Fan clearly saw that below in the Yellow Expanse realm, storms, flames, lightning, floods...

All sorts of calamities suddenly descended.

Fueled by the rampant spiritual energy, their power was a hundred, even a thousand times greater than usual.

And the shaking of the Yellow Expanse realm continued unabated.

This calamity seemed to be far more prolonged than imagined.

The cultivators of the Immortal Alliance finally took action.

They flew out from their various floating cities, calming the spiritual energy's turbulence while also attempting to repair the various anomalies caused by the violent shaking of the Yellow Expanse realm.

Amidst the shaking of heaven and earth, they struggled to take a step.

However, there was indeed no fatal danger.

It was just that the world's tremors would ultimately cause the beings within to feel an uncontrollable fear.

The vast majority of cultivators could only have their minds go blank, praying internally for the disaster to pass quickly.

Beyond that, they could do nothing else.

Li Fan had witnessed true world-ending spectacles before.

A mere tremor was nothing compared to the Immortal Ruins' Immortals casually destroying the Yellow Expanse realm.

Therefore, he was able to ignore the changes in heaven and earth and observe with great calmness.

"Strange..."

"The source of the suction that is causing the heaven and earth to shake..."

Li Fan suddenly felt a sense of disharmony in his heart.

With a thought, the hundred stone puppets at the edge of the world all floated away from the border and entered the endless void.

Without the protection of the Yellow Expanse realm, the puppets were affected by the strong suction and uncontrollably moved in a certain direction.

However, as they moved away from the Yellow Expanse realm faster and faster, Li Fan also confirmed his suspicion.

The suction that caused the great upheaval of the Yellow Expanse realm was not from the Immortal Ruins.

It was from the depths of the ultimate dark star sea!

The stone puppets, after floating away from the Yellow Expanse realm and heading into the depths of the starry sea, lost contact with Li Fan.

However, the shock caused by the facts they observed was far from over for Li Fan.

"How could it be from the depths of the ultimate dark star sea?"

"Could it be that there is another starved immortal there?!"

Li Fan was profoundly shocked.

His main body in the space of the Dharma Illusionary Cycle even needed to actively circulate the Yellow Expanse Immortal Heart Mantra to suppress his astonishment and prevent any abnormalities from showing.

For Li Fan, such an event had not happened in a very long time.

The tremors in the Yellow Expanse realm continued.

However, as time passed, it was clearly felt that the amplitude of the tremors was slowly decreasing.

This inexplicable disaster was passing.

But the storm of thoughts in Li Fan's mind had just begun.

"The suction from the Immortal Ruins was generated by that skeletal immortal comprehending the true immortal script of [Starvation]. His state of deep contemplation and selflessness caused a devastating impact on this star domain."

"However, true immortal scripts are not only comprehended by one person. The anomaly in the Origin Dao Province of the Yellow Expanse realm is suspected to be Grand Master Tiandu comprehending the secrets of the Starvation Script Technique."

"Regarding the current upheaval in the Yellow Expanse realm, there are now two possibilities. One is that the disaster was not related to the [Starvation] Script Technique, but merely the consequence of an existence of the same caliber. Only power at the true immortal level could cause such a violent impact on the Yellow Expanse realm."

"But this means that an unknown existence with true immortal power is still hidden in the ultimate dark star sea. This..."

Li Fan's heart grew a little cold.

"The second possibility is that a survivor in the star sea, possibly even a Dharma Transmitter, is also comprehending the Starvation Script Technique. They recently made a breakthrough, thus causing this disturbance. The Dharma Transmitter Heavenly Venerable was able to send back news in advance, so this possibility is quite high."

"But neither speculation can explain the most crucial point: why is this world undergoing this change?"

The Dao Transformation Stone flashed, replaying the experiences of this life over and over again.

Yet, it was impossible to determine what event had caused such a large deviation.

"Whether it is a true immortal or an existence that can comprehend the Starvation Script Technique, my actions in this life should not be enough to influence them."

"But all of this has happened."

Li Fan remained silent.

This was the consequence of reaching a certain level of power, where even an unintentional action could affect the outside world, even changing the fates of others. Variables gave rise to more variables, endlessly, ultimately leading to unforeseen changes.

"My main body has always remained in the space of the Dharma Illusionary Cycle, so it can be ruled out. My clone, Li Ping, only caused trouble in the Great Qi Minor World. Even if he moved the Five Elements Great Grand Heavens, it would absolutely not be enough to cause such a significant variable. It must be the travels of the Holy Embryo that have gone wrong."

After much deliberation, Li Fan finally pinpointed the source of the variable to the mysterious figure at the bottom of the Chizha Abyss and the formless existence in the Samsara Illusionary Domain.

"These two, one collects world fragments, and the other collects cultivator corpses. They should be active mostly in the ultimate dark star sea."

"Because of the Holy Embryo's disturbance, their activity trajectories have changed compared to previous cycles. This is why the Yellow Expanse tremors occurred..."

"What else is there in the ultimate dark star sea?"

At this moment, a trace of curiosity arose in Li Fan's heart again. Previously, he had thought that only the Yellow Expanse realm had survived in the ultimate dark star sea. Outside the Yellow Expanse realm, there were only drifting world fragments, a scene of utter desolation.

Now, it seemed, there were still unknown secrets hidden there.

"Indeed. I have always had a doubt: in what form do the fragments of the cultivation world in the ultimate dark star sea exist? Affected by the suction of the Immortal Ruins, even a complete cultivation world could not avoid falling towards the Immortal Ruins. These fragments should have been unable to resist and would have been swallowed by the Immortal Ruins long ago."

"But inferring from the constant patching of the Yellow Expanse realm and what Han Zhong saw in the eyes of the Tian Beast, there are still a large number of world fragments in the ultimate dark star sea. In a way I do not yet know..."

Feeling the intermittent tremors of the Yellow Expanse realm, a flash of inspiration suddenly struck Li Fan.

"That's right! Previously, due to the suction of the Immortal Ruins, I was unable to escape the Yellow Expanse realm to investigate in the ultimate dark star sea. But now, because of this inexplicable suction from the depths of the ultimate dark star sea, perhaps..."

"There's no time to delay. The tremors are about to disappear, and I don't have much time left."

In the Severed Palm Immortal City.

During the tremors of the Yellow Expanse realm, even the Chizha Abyss became much quieter, with no extraneous noises emanating from it.

The soldiers of the Azure Profound Army, who had suppressed the abyss for a hundred years and held their ground against terrifying waves of demonic sounds, turned pale and trembled in the face of this true world-ending terror.

If not for the Yellow Expanse Immortal Heart Mantra taught to them by the Holy Embryo Li Fan earlier, many of them would have had their pent-up negative emotions erupt simultaneously, losing their minds and becoming completely deranged.

Let alone the ordinary Azure Profound Army soldiers, even their leader, the Harmonious Dao General Shang Shaojun, who had been forewarned of the Yellow Expanse tremors, was somewhat dazed in the face of this great calamity.

"I never imagined that the vast Yellow Expanse realm could also be like a small boat on a river during a storm, constantly in danger of capsizing at any moment," Shang Shaojun said with a bitter tone.

However, the Holy Embryo Li Fan had no time to comfort him.

"Shao Jun, quickly help me with something."

"What?" Shang Shaojun couldn't react immediately, looking bewildered.

"Help me prepare these items, as quickly as possible." After transmitting a list of supplies to Shang Shaojun, the Holy Embryo Li Fan looked up at the sky of the Yellow Expanse realm with a serious expression.

"Gathering these supplies shouldn't be a problem. Most of them are in the Eternal Immortal Fortress. But Brother Li, what do you need these things for?" Shang Shaojun followed the Holy Embryo Li Fan's gaze.

"Such immense power, before which the entire world is as fragile as a toy. Shao Jun, aren't you curious?"

The Holy Embryo Li Fan's eyes were resolute, even showing a hint of madness.

"I wish to fly out of the Yellow Expanse realm, trace the source, and investigate!" he declared forcefully.

"Absolutely not! Outside the Yellow Expanse realm is..." Shang Shaojun's expression changed, and he repeatedly tried to dissuade him. He stopped midway, inexplicably.

"Hahaha, Shao Jun, you were going to say, the words Immortal Ruins?"

Shang Shaojun was utterly shocked and looked at the Holy Embryo Li Fan with disbelief.

Li Fan did not explain how he knew this ultimate secret. Instead, he waved his hand and said with a serious expression, "Precisely because the Immortal Ruins exist, now is a golden opportunity!"

"Brother Li, what exactly are you..." Shang Shaojun was filled with doubt.

"Do you think, Shaojun, that the culprit behind this catastrophe is the Immortal Ruins?" Li Fan countered.

"Completely wrong!" Before Shang Shaojun could answer, Saint Embryo Li Fan coldly refuted him.

"The source of this power is not nearby, but deep within the sea of stars!"

"Ah?"

Hearing Li Fan's words, Shang Shaojun was astonished.

"I know you don't believe me, Shaojun. But it's okay, when I successfully break free from the restraints of the Immortal Ruins and fly out of the Yellow Expanse realm, you will know I was right!"

"I beg Shaojun to lend me a hand!" Saint Embryo Li Fan actually bowed deeply with a solemn expression.

Shang Shaojun dared not accept Li Fan's bow and quickly stopped him.

"Brother Li, why go to such lengths? It's just a matter of some supplies. With our friendship, it's just a word."

"Yan Huan!" Shang Shaojun called his confidant over and ordered him to handle the matter.

"Don't worry, everything will be ready in three days at most."

"Too slow! A golden opportunity, missed and never to return. One day!" Saint Embryo Li Fan said unceremoniously.

Shang Shaojun pondered for a moment, then gritted his teeth: "Alright! One day it is!"

He then seemed to be transmitting a message, giving some instructions.

After finishing all this, he turned to look at Li Fan, wanting to speak but hesitating.

"Shao Jun, if you have anything to say, just say it!"

"Brother Li, are you really going to..." Shang Shaojun still seemed somewhat incredulous.

Saint Embryo Li Fan smiled slightly and explained his judgment: "The powerful force causing this upheaval in the Yellow Expanse comes from the depths of space. It is entirely different from the suction of the Immortal Ruins that has always attracted the Yellow Expanse realm."

"If it were in the past, rashly flying out of the Yellow Expanse realm without the world's protection, let alone Dao Integration cultivators like you and me, even ordinary Longevity Realm cultivators would likely only end in death. Perhaps only beings of Transmission Law Heavenly Venerate's strength could barely resist. But now it's different..."

In front of Li Fan, a pool of water suddenly appeared.

In the center of the water, a huge vortex spun rapidly, the water flowing turbulently and swallowing everything around it.

Saint Embryo Li Fan lightly pointed.

Outside this vortex, another vortex of the same scale appeared.

The forces of the two vortices interfered with each other, and the direction of the water flow became unstable.

Shang Shaojun instantly understood Li Fan's meaning.

"However, these are all your speculations, Brother Li, right? If you guess wrong..."

"If one can hear the Dao in the morning, one can die contentedly in the evening." Saint Embryo Li Fan said with a calm face, showing no fear.

"If I miss this rare opportunity, even if I survive, I will regret it for the rest of my life."

"So I must go." Li Fan's tone was resolute.

"I want to see what kind of existence can possess such power." His eyes shone with light.

Shang Shaojun remained silent.

The efficiency of the Azure Profound Army's work was trustworthy.

In one day, Li Fan's needed supplies were all prepared.

"Outside the sea of stars, dangers are everywhere. Aren't you preparing more, Brother Li? You plan to cross the starry sky with just these?" Shang Shaojun muttered to himself.

"If there were enough time, it would naturally be best to build a sturdy flying boat. But doesn't time not permit? I can only use the Immortal Alliance's Dust Crossing Boat as a temporary substitute."

The Dust Crossing Boat was the only designated flying artifact of the Immortal Alliance for traveling to and from the White Mist Maze. In the 114th life, Li Fan had traveled to the Chizha Abyss on this boat with Ji Hongdao.

The Dust Crossing Boat was forged from various rare materials and equipped with numerous defensive formations. The entire Eternal Immortal Fortress only possessed two such boats.

Being able to contribute one of them showed Shang Shaojun's true loyalty.

"However, as long as it can endure the point of most intense conflict between the two forces outside the Yellow Expanse realm, there should be no danger." Saint Embryo Li Fan, seizing the last moments, modified the Dust Crossing Boat.

Actually, there was one more point he hadn't explicitly stated. His greatest reliance for daring to cross the starry sky was not any external object, but his own Foundation Establishment rare item, the Black Sword of Heavens!

As a manifestation of laws, the Black Sword was far more indestructible than most things in the Yellow Expanse realm.

Furthermore, unlike ordinary protective materials that gradually wear out, the Black Sword could be continuously tempered by external forces, making itself more adaptable.

"It's also thanks to Transmission Law Heavenly Venerate's new method. Even if I abandon my physical body, as long as the sword law is not extinguished, I can survive in the void."

While full of confidence, Saint Embryo Li Fan also considered the potential accidents he might encounter after flying out of the Yellow Expanse realm.

For example...

The laws of the Black Sword of Heavens were a manifestation of the sword dao laws of the Yellow Expanse realm.

If it left the Yellow Expanse realm without the world's support, would its power immediately decline drastically? Become extremely weak?

Moreover, Heavenly Doctor once mentioned that outside the Yellow Expanse realm, in the void, one needed to worry about a certain "illness."

Li Fan had also seen this illness in Han Zhong.

Dark decay, infecting the soul.

Even the Infinite Yin-Yang Method, which repaired souls, had no effect on it.

Saint Embryo Li Fan did not expect to be immune to this illness, but only hoped to use a large amount of precious materials that nourished the soul to extend his time in the void.

Another day passed in a flash.

The tremors of the Yellow Expanse realm were already visibly slowing down.

The cultivators of the Yellow Expanse realm looked relieved, as if they had narrowly escaped a disaster. Many were still in fear, worried that this terrifying calamity might strike again.

Outside the Chizha Abyss, Saint Embryo Li Fan had made all preparations.

The Dust Crossing Boat was vastly different from its original appearance. Li Fan bade farewell to the members of the Azure Profound Army and slowly entered the flying boat.

Watching Li Fan's departing back, Shang Shaojun wanted to speak but stopped.

A sudden impulse surged in his heart to follow, to break out of the Yellow Expanse realm together and explore the secrets behind that vast power.

As cultivators, how could they not be curious about power of that level?

However...

He was not alone after all. He had too many things to consider.

Shang Shaojun suddenly felt a bit envious of the figure on the Dust Crossing Boat.

"Young Master, do you wish to risk your life with me at this moment?"

As if he could read minds, the other party suddenly transmitted a message before leaving.

Without waiting for Shang Shaojun to reply, Saint Embryo Li Fan said with a smile, "That won't do."

Shang Shaojun was slightly taken aback.

"Young Master, don't forget that there are still secret schemers in the Yellow Expanse realm."

"If both of us leave, wouldn't we be allowing those villains to succeed?"

"I thought you would have forgotten about this matter in the blink of an eye," Shang Shaojun muttered to himself.

The Dust Crossing Boat slowly ascended.

Saint Embryo Li Fan's voice echoed in Shang Shaojun's ear.

"The future of the Yellow Expanse realm and the Myriad Immortal Alliance rests on you, Young Master."

"If I am fortunate enough to survive this great calamity, I will definitely return to help you!"

Shang Shaojun followed the Dust Crossing Boat, leaving the white mist, and watched it disappear into the horizon.

He felt a sense of loss in his heart.

Although he had not known Li Fan for long, he was deeply impressed by Li Fan's strength and demeanor.

"Live well."

Shang Shaojun said to himself in his heart.

After finishing his act in front of Shang Shaojun, Saint Embryo Li Fan then turned his full attention to observing the changes outside the Dust Crossing Boat.

At this moment, the Dust Crossing Boat had flown to the boundary of the world. The entire Yellow Expanse realm lay below, visible in its entirety. Li Fan had once observed the Yellow Expanse realm from such a perspective. However, at that time, the Yellow Expanse realm, just as he had seen in the super-distance teleportation formation, was shrouded in a hazy yellow light, appearing like a large ball of light. The details of the world within, and the scenery on the ground, were completely indiscernible.

But now, influenced by the immense suction force from the depths of the star sea, a part of that faint yellow light had been peeled away, revealing the true appearance of the world hidden beneath. Saint Embryo Li Fan saw the distorted white mist barrier, and… "a monster stitched together from severed limbs and torn flesh." This phrase suddenly appeared in Li Fan's mind. Even from high up in the Nine Heavens, one could still discern the subtle differences between different regions. While beings within the states might not be able to distinguish it, from a vantage point outside the Yellow Expanse realm, this disharmony was immediately obvious.

Saint Embryo Li Fan quickly recovered from his momentary daze. The Dust Crossing Boat creaked and groaned, a sign of the intense pressure from the outside. Saint Embryo Li Fan was not afraid in the slightest. Disregarding the danger, he even accelerated the Dust Crossing Boat. After completely leaving the Yellow Expanse realm, he felt the surroundings suddenly darken. It was like twilight, with the sun instantly sinking below the horizon. Darkness, coldness, stillness… all sorts of feelings surged into Saint Embryo Li Fan's heart. The Yellow Expanse Immortal Heart Incantation automatically operated, shielding Li Fan from these negative emotions.

"What I know through images and puppets is indeed different from personal experience. Neither the puppet's synchronized senses nor the lingering influence from the Medicine King Cauldron are as real as this moment." As Saint Embryo Li Fan was thinking this, he suddenly turned his head. In that instant, he inexplicably felt a sense of insecurity, as if something would suddenly appear behind him and deliver a fatal blow. Even though his divine sense scanning clearly informed him that there was no danger behind him, the feeling in his heart constantly urged him to turn his head and see for himself. Only when he was finally certain that there was no imagined crisis did the strange feeling slowly subside.

At this moment, the Dust Crossing Boat's slight creaking had turned into loud groans. It was as if countless ancient ferocious beasts were constantly battering the hull, and cracks began to appear on the boat. The inscribed formations also began to show signs of fragmentation. Saint Embryo Li Fan was already prepared to abandon the boat and leave. The ninety-nine sword shadows around him suddenly appeared, circling and flying, cutting out a buffer zone of absolute space. Saint Embryo Li Fan's body also slowly withered, losing its flesh tone and taking on a strange metallic luster.

Although the immense power from the depths of the star sea had indeed had a certain impact on the suction force of the Immortal Ruins, as the Immortal Ruins were their home ground and some time had passed since the anomaly occurred, the unknown force from the star sea had significantly weakened. Therefore, the Dust Crossing Boat did not drift towards the depths of the star sea like the stone puppets that had been placed earlier. Instead, it inevitably began to fall towards the Immortal Ruins. However… both the curvature of its altered trajectory and the magnitude of its speed change were far from the time Li Fan actively piloted the Medicine King Cauldron into the Immortal Ruins.

"My guess was indeed correct! This is truly a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to leave the Yellow Expanse realm!" Seeing that the Dust Crossing Boat was about to shatter completely, Saint Embryo Li Fan no longer hesitated.

"Ten thousand swords as me!" The silhouettes of thousands of rusted swords from the Sword Tomb vaguely appeared behind him. Moments later, these sword shadows all merged into his body. The dark void surrounding the Dust Crossing Boat was illuminated. A dazzling white light erupted from Li Fan, completely engulfing his body. Man and sword became one. Then, as if opening up the heavens and earth, a brilliant sword light was instantly unleashed.

The Dust Crossing Boat was swallowed by the sword light and disappeared without a trace. The white sword light, however, departed from the Immortal Ruins and resolutely headed towards the depths of the star sea! This sword light was incredibly bright and dazzling. It even caused a white star, capable of rivaling the great sun in the sky, to appear in the sky of the Yellow Expanse realm below. At this moment, countless cultivators turned their gaze towards the location of Saint Embryo Li Fan. And Shang Shaojun was instantly lost in thought, a sense of loss filling his heart.

The sword light, peerless, advanced rapidly. Saint Embryo Li Fan felt the restrictions of the Immortal Ruins growing weaker. The reason for his smooth departure, besides transforming into the wondrous dark sword of heaven and unleashing the ultimate sword strike, was primarily the influence of that mysterious power from the depths of the star sea. Outside the Yellow Expanse realm, free from the interference of the world's various laws, he could more clearly feel the remaining power in the void. "Unlike the eternal suction of the Immortal Ruins, this star sea power is like a tide, intermittent and ebbing and flowing." Saint Embryo Li Fan felt surges of vast power, even experiencing the illusion of piloting a small boat on a stormy sea, floating and sinking with the waves.

"Hmm? Is that the stone puppet I placed earlier in front?" After traveling in the void for a short while, Saint Embryo Li Fan once again felt the connection that had been broken earlier. But what made Li Fan's heart jump was that not all the puppets were intact. At least one-third of the puppets had disappeared for unknown reasons! "It's possible they unfortunately couldn't escape the shackles of the Immortal Ruins. But it's also possible…"

Saint Embryo Li Fan was accelerating towards the location of the puppets. But suddenly, he subconsciously slowed down. Because just moments ago, one more puppet had inexplicably disappeared among the remaining seventy-four surviving puppets! And it disappeared right under his senses and surveillance! Vanished for no reason! Moreover, Li Fan had no idea how that puppet had disappeared! "Indeed, the Darkest Star Sea is full of dangers." A chill inexplicably surged into Saint Embryo Li Fan's heart. Controlling his flight speed, he let the remaining seventy-three puppets take the lead, while Li Fan followed far behind.

As time went on, the puppets that occasionally disappeared without warning revealed the treacherous nature of the void in the Darkest Star Sea. As more puppets disappeared, Li Fan gradually regained his composure. "These puppets don't seem to have been attacked by some mysterious entity. Instead, the places they passed through were problematic. There... even space itself no longer existed. Only pure emptiness remained. It's like on a flat road, there are dark, bottomless sinkholes one after another. Step into one carelessly, and there's no sign of life or death." As Li Fan was contemplating this, another puppet disappeared. Only sixty-one remained.

Li Fan didn't know what the consequences would be if he fell into these voids, nor could he discern their presence. He was forced to adopt a desperate measure: continuing to let the remaining stone puppets scout ahead, while he avoided the routes taken by the puppets that had mysteriously disappeared.

As the number of stone puppets dwindled, Li Fan's heart sank. At this rate of attrition, he would never reach the depths of the Star Sea in this lifetime. However, what Li Fan was worried about did not happen. When only thirty-three puppets remained, after flying through the void for a long time, there were no more sudden disappearances.

"It seems these voids are not widely distributed throughout the Darkest Star Sea, but are densely gathered in a certain area," Li Fan mused. "Outside the Xuanhuang Realm?" Saint Embryo Li Fan pondered.

With thirty-three puppets in the lead and Li Fan's sword light following behind, their speed increased as they ventured into the unknown darkness ahead. "This is going smoother than I anticipated," he thought. "I am now quite a distance from the Xuanhuang Realm, yet this sword avatar of mine, formed from the Xuanhuang Realm, does not feel any weakening of its power. This is rather interesting."

Under normal circumstances, without the support of the world's power, various laws adrift outside the world would inevitably be weakened to some extent. But this reduction was not occurring. In fact, the bottleneck in his sword dao, which had reached its limit in the Xuanhuang Realm and could not be further comprehended, had unexpectedly loosened after a period of time in the void. Even though the talent of this Saint Embryo was not particularly outstanding, he felt thoughts and insights flooding uncontrollably, as if he had instantly transformed into some peerless genius. Saint Embryo Li Fan even felt an urge to disregard everything and concentrate all his energy on comprehending the Dao, but Li Fan forcefully suppressed it by circulating the Immortal Heart Incantation.

This anomaly led Li Fan to have many speculations. "Does the entire Darkest Star Sea actually share a single system of laws? Is the sword dao of the Xuanhuang Realm merely a part of the common sword dao of the entire Star Sea? Outside the world, in the void, one encounters a broader realm, and the upper limit is invisibly expanded..." "As expected, this place is fraught with both danger and opportunity." "Perhaps Tianyi and Chuanfa frequently travel to the Darkest Star Sea for this very reason."

Thinking of Tianyi and Chuanfa, Li Fan's heart became even more solemn. He had only been here for a short while and had already gained such substantial benefits. It was difficult to imagine what realms those two, who had lived in the Star Sea for thousands of years, had already attained. Tianyi's advice was indeed golden. Even the "illness" in the void, which he had approached with great caution, had manifested in Saint Embryo Li Fan. It appeared without any prior warning.

Just as Li Fan was immersed in the joy of his impending breakthrough in sword dao comprehension, a sense of inexplicable weakness suddenly surged into his heart. Upon introspection, he indeed found a black spot in his soul. This black spot was eroding his soul, as if it were directly occupying it. All the treasures he had previously consumed to protect his soul were unable to stop its invasion, and his methods for nourishing his soul were also ineffective.

"The upper limit of soul strength has decreased, rather than the soul itself being damaged," Saint Embryo Li Fan stated gravely. Fortunately, the black spot was not spreading too quickly, allowing Li Fan time to take countermeasures. Within his soul, a sword shadow appeared. The sword light shone brightly, directly slicing off the portion of his soul occupied by the black spot! As his soul was divided, Saint Embryo Li Fan's sword body instantly split in two. The part not contaminated by the black spot suddenly accelerated, fleeing from its original position, while the infected half stopped moving.

He sat cross-legged in the void, concentrating on comprehending the mysterious black essence within his weakened soul. The pain of splitting his soul was indescribable. Even with the blessing of the Immortal Heart Incantation, Saint Embryo Li Fan felt his vision blacken, nearly fainting. A feeling of weakness, even more profound than that of being invaded by the black spot, immediately washed over him. Ignoring the pain and weakness, he quickly absorbed the essence of the soul-nourishing treasures he had refined earlier. Without the inhibition of the black spot, Li Fan's clean soul slowly began to strengthen again. "This is like scraping bone to heal a wound," Li Fan remarked with a sigh. It was only because of the new cultivation method's subtlety, the indestructible foundation of his cultivation, and his unblemished body, coupled with his foundation built upon the Xuanhuang sword dao, that he could afford to so recklessly section off his own soul without immediately becoming senile.

"Unfortunately, without the Five Elements Grand Cave Heaven and the Infinite Yin-Yang Method, relying on external means is not a long-term solution," he lamented. "With each cut, I become a little weaker than before..." "I can only hope to persist until the depths of the Star Sea," Li Fan closed his eyes, temporarily dispelling all distracting thoughts to heal his soul's trauma.

Meanwhile, the other half, which had been infected by the black spot and left behind in the void, had finally met its ultimate end. It was a more desperate and terrifying end than death from old age. Just like a mortal suffering from Alzheimer's, the infected half, which was supposed to be comprehending the black spot, found its thoughts slowing down. Its mind became duller, and even the things it wanted to do required long periods of recollection. Even synchronized consciousness from other parts of its body seemed to be blocked by layers of obstruction, making it impossible to understand. Eventually, it completely fell into a state of mental stillness, becoming a dead silence, just like its soul.

...

"It's like this Darkest Star Sea." In the Xuanhuang Realm, within the Yanfajue Space, Li Fan's main body received the visual information transmitted by his Saint Embryo and inwardly grew serious. What troubled him was not the intangible voids or the black spot plague in the Star Sea, but the time difference between his main body and his Saint Embryo. The Saint Embryo, having transformed into a sword and utilizing the power of the Star Sea, had already traveled a considerable distance from the Xuanhuang Realm. Therefore, Li Fan discovered the desynchronization of time flow between the Xuanhuang Realm and the depths of the Darkest Star Sea.

"It appears to be influenced by the Immortal Ruins," he mused. "Even if it's not as terrifying as the edges of the Immortal Ruins, where millennia pass in an instant, the time flow here is slower than in other parts of the Darkest Star Sea." "Currently, it's about a one-to-two ratio, and this proportion is still expanding as the Saint Embryo travels further away."

Li Fan couldn't help but think further. "The Darkest Star Sea within the high walls is unavoidably affected by the Immortal Ruins, to varying degrees." "Does this mean that the time flow inside and outside the high walls is also different?" "Is it possible that tens of thousands of years have passed since the calamity that severed the ancient immortal path in the Xuanhuang Realm, while outside the high walls, time has actually passed for an even longer period?" Thinking of this, Li Fan's eyes closed, concealing the faint glint within them.

Chapter 1180: Star Sea Wanderer

(The end of the previous chapter has been revised. Those who read it early should re-read it.)

Although the Myriad Immortals Alliance and the Five Elders Council were in confrontation, and their various technologies were not developing slowly, with endless new methods emerging, this period of high-speed development actually lasted for less than three thousand years. After the great calamity that severed the immortal path, for tens of thousands of years, the Xuanhuang Realm was in a state of constant fighting and struggle for the vast majority of the time. Civilization regressed instead of advancing.

"If my guess is true, then I can't even imagine what kind of gap would exist between civilizations inside and outside the high walls."

A closed civilization, considering itself the strongest nation in the world. Then, one day, the passage to the outside world is suddenly opened. Faced with the military might of enemies who are centuries ahead, it has no power to resist and is quickly conquered and destroyed. Such events are common in the history of civilization. Let alone before my transmigration, even now, there are still some small worlds that have lost contact with the Xuanhuang Realm and have forgotten the existence of cultivators. They have established prosperous mortal powers, and their achievements are extensively recorded by historians. In reality, just one Foundation Establishment cultivator can easily destroy a so-called "prosperous dynasty."

Li Fan's lifelong goal has been transcendence and longevity. For this, he has gone through countless reincarnations, simply to carve out a path in the perilous and crisis-ridden Xuanhuang Realm. Ultimately, he intends to leave this Darkest Star Sea and venture outside the high walls. However, at this moment, the speculation about the possible existence of civilization outside the high walls makes Li Fan inwardly tremble.

"If a cultivation civilization truly exists and has developed for so many years, it might even possess power comparable to True Immortals. It might even be able to influence the 'Still True' to some extent..." Li Fan's eyes flickered, his thoughts surging.

However, he did not feel fear. The 'Still True' is his greatest trump card. The ability to trace back repeatedly and bring memories and experiences back to a fixed anchor point means that even if the outside of the high walls is ten thousand years ahead, he can simply bridge the gap in a few reincarnations, instantly leveling the playing field.

"I just need to be careful. Before the situation is clarified, this main body will not venture out, nor will I deploy any clones or the Saint Embryo. Stability first in all matters!" "I'm not afraid of monsters existing outside the high walls, but I am afraid of nothing existing outside the high walls."

In the vast darkness, the Saint Embryo Li Fan, transformed into a beam of sword light, closely followed the twenty-nine puppets.

It has only been a little over half a year since he broke through the realm and left the Xuanhuang Realm. From the Saint Embryo Li Fan's perspective, he has already been away from the Xuanhuang Realm for a full ten years. The difference in time flow has further amplified as they delved deeper into the star sea. Not long ago, it reached its peak, a daunting fifty to one ratio. But as the Saint Embryo Li Fan continued to move forward, the time difference between his location and the Xuanhuang Realm slowly converged again. From fifty to one, it gradually decreased to ten to one. It was not much different from when he first left the Xuanhuang Realm.

Li Fan knew that this was because he was slowly approaching another colossal power source that distorted the flow of time. "The Star Sea is vast. Even with the help of this unknown mighty force, reaching speeds a hundred times the limit of flight in the Xuanhuang Realm, it has taken me this long to reach my destination," the Saint Embryo Li Fan sighed slightly.

In these ten years, he had severed his divine soul more than three hundred times. From his peak, where he was almost comparable to a Xuanhuang Dao Integration cultivator, he was now only as strong as a normal mortal. The pain he endured, even with Li Fan's resolute will, was something he never wanted to experience again. Fortunately, in the last few years, perhaps because his strength had diminished to a very weak level, the frequency of the black spots' infection significantly decreased. Furthermore, after over three hundred severances, the Saint Embryo Li Fan had gained some insights into dealing with this inexplicable plague.

"Although I still don't understand the principle of its occurrence, I can be sure that these black spots are related to the collapsed and vanished cultivation world in the Darkest Star Sea." If any one of the three hundred corrupted souls by the black spots alone were not enough for Li Fan to sense anything, then all these withered and dead souls, which he had left behind in the Darkest Star Sea along the way, allowed Li Fan to find their commonality.

After seeming to be completely dormant, they did not stay in place. Instead, they quietly flowed towards different parts of the Darkest Star Sea. Their movement was also quite mysterious, not a normal movement in space. It was more like water droplets naturally rolling from high to low, rapidly traversing the Darkest Star Sea. Upon reaching their destinations, they would then permanently disappear from Li Fan's senses, one by one.

"Those locations, between the depths of the star sea and the Xuanhuang Realm, seem to overlap with the 'voids' I have passed through." The Saint Embryo Li Fan looked back, silent. "It seems that the myriad incredible phenomena within the Darkest Star Sea might be interconnected." "Then what is the deal with this power of the star sea that can rival the Immortal Ruins? Why did I not sense it at all when I was in the Xuanhuang Realm, and it only suddenly erupted recently?" Filled with questions, the Saint Embryo Li Fan became increasingly curious about the unknown path ahead.

"Hmm?" Lost in thought, he suddenly became alert and looked forward. That sensation of being stared at, like something was watching him, reappeared. And this time, it was far more intense than anything he had experienced in the past ten years. It made the Saint Embryo Li Fan's scalp tingle and his heart pound wildly. It was as if something extremely terrifying existed in the darkness ahead!

With a thought, Li Fan first controlled a stone puppet and had it charge towards the source of the sensed danger. Immediately after, a beam of sword light was unleashed from afar. The stone puppet seemed to collide with something, emitting a dull thud. Immediately after, the puppet disappeared from Li Fan's senses. Affected by the reduction in his divine soul, the beam of sword light Li Fan unleashed was far less dazzling than when he first left the Xuanhuang Realm. However, it was still enough to illuminate the surrounding dark space.

A pair of enormous eyes suddenly appeared from the darkness, staring intently at Li Fan. And a withered, large hand, which had appeared stealthily before the Saint Embryo Li Fan, was about to grasp him!

"Damn it!" After sailing in the dark void for more than ten years, he had not encountered any other living beings besides himself. To suddenly encounter such a terrifying existence, Li Fan's heart leaped, and his scalp tingled. Instinctively, countless sword shadows flew out. Whether it was because his strength had become too weak or the monster was too strong, these sword shadows, which could split mountains and divide seas in the Xuanhuang Realm, caused no damage at all.

Seeing that he was about to fall completely into the monster's grasp, Li Fan was about to make a desperate effort. But soon, he noticed something was wrong. The huge, emaciated human form in front of him... had no trace of life. Its movements and expression remained unchanged.

Only one chapter today.

"Dead?" Li Fan, who had just recovered from his shock, breathed a sigh of relief.

However, the lingering sense of crisis in his heart told him that things were not that simple.

As expected, after several sword lights emitted by the Saint Embryo Li Fan touched the corpse in front of him, they instantly disappeared into the darkness like extinguished candles.

There was no booming sound of collision from beginning to end.

The huge, withered corpse, like a primeval beast hidden in the void, swallowed everything that tried to approach it.

A spell illuminated the surrounding space again.

This time, it could be seen more clearly.

The dried corpse looked much like an ordinary human on the outside, only its size was extraordinarily large.

It was more than thirty feet tall, and its palm alone was larger than Li Fan.

It seemed to have drifted in this void for a long time, and its clothes had all rotted.

However, after careful observation, what shocked the Saint Embryo Li Fan even more was that this dried corpse in front of him... seemed to be just a newborn baby.

Its hair was sparse, and it hadn't even grown any teeth.

It was wearing an accessory like a longevity lock around its neck and a rotten red string tied to its ankle.

Its terrified, outstretched posture was like it had been frightened and was desperately looking for its parents.

"A juvenile form is already so huge. I can hardly imagine its size when it's an adult."

Li Fan suddenly thought of the Eternal Immortal Fortress outside the Abyss.

That fortress in the white mist was also known as the Broken Palm Immortal City, because the entire fortress was built from the enormous ancient Heavenly Venerate's broken palm that floated out of the white mist.

"Perhaps there is some connection between the two," Li Fan mused to himself.

After all, he had never seen any records of such primordial behemoths in the Xuanhuang Realm.

Although the giant was dead, it still exuded an ominous and mysterious power that continued to drag everything around it down.

"This mysterious power should be the culprit that caused its death and the source of my extreme unease."

The Saint Embryo Li Fan pondered for a moment, a decisive look flashing in his eyes.

Even though he no longer wanted to try, he still swung a sword at his soul, severing a divine sense.

"Ah..."

After his soul became extremely weak, even his ability to endure pain greatly decreased. Li Fan could not bear it and let out a cry of pain.

His face turned deathly pale, and he gasped for breath repeatedly.

Without hesitation, he bypassed the giant dried corpse in front of him and continued to advance into the depths of the sea of stars.

The divine sense that remained at the spot, after recovering for a moment, actively floated forward and touched it.

As the saying goes, "Know yourself and your enemy, and you will never be defeated." It could be foreseen that for a considerable period to come, the Darkest Star Sea would be a place Li Fan needed to venture into. Therefore, instead of constantly avoiding the dangers in the Darkest Star Sea, it was better to take the initiative to explore their true nature.

In any case, his main body was far away in the Xuanhuang Realm, and he had the protection of the 'Hui Zhen'. He was not afraid of any unbearable consequences.

As the divine sense was severed and was still some distance away from the giant dried corpse, Li Fan's vision went black.

He completely lost all perception of the outside world.

His consciousness remained, but it was as if he had been locked in a cage, surrounded by absolute, eternal darkness.

There was no sound, no light, no passage of time.

It was as if he was the only one left in the world.

Even the connection to his Saint Embryo and main body was becoming increasingly distant and dim.

On the side of the Saint Embryo and the main body, the feeling was also very strange.

The divine sense was clearly a part of him, yet the sense of unfamiliarity grew stronger and stronger.

More importantly, the endless loneliness that enveloped the divine sense began to slowly erode him through the connection between the main body and the divine sense. It was only then that Li Fan realized that after being surrounded by darkness, the state of the divine sense seemed to be permanently fixed.

It was as if it had solidified, unable to do anything.

He couldn't even commit suicide.

The Saint Embryo Li Fan's expression changed slightly, and he sent several sword lights towards the location of the divine sense.

He wanted to sever the connection between the divine sense and himself.

But it was to no avail.

Just like when the sword lights touched the giant dried corpse before, all the attacks disappeared without a sound.

After several attempts, he had to give up.

Frowning slightly, he sensed the invasion of the endless sense of loneliness and felt a little relieved.

The distance in time and space still played a certain role in limiting this extremely mysterious existence.

The erosion of his main body was very slow.

Based on the current situation, it would not threaten his soul's safety within a hundred years.

As for the Saint Embryo, because it was too close, the situation was not optimistic.

It was estimated that it would only last for more than thirty days before falling.

The unit of time here was the absolute time experienced by each of them.

"However, as I continue to move away, the situation will gradually improve."

"Although it cannot be avoided, I can buy enough time. As long as I can see the true face of the great power that caused this Xuanhuang disturbance, I will not regret dying."

"Moreover, the main reason why the main body can sense the divine sense is through me. If I disappear, the main body will be safe."

With this thought, the Saint Embryo Li Fan no longer hesitated. He urged the remaining stone puppet to go all out and galloped towards the depths of the sea of stars.

While flying at high speed, he also pondered the mysterious power that had enveloped the giant dried corpse.

The mysterious power was invading Li Fan, and Li Fan was also using this opportunity to observe them.

"This feeling is not unfamiliar."

A flash of inspiration struck the Saint Embryo Li Fan, and he already had a guess.

"True Immortal Seal Script! Another True Immortal Seal Script!"

According to Bai Hua Daoist's account, the calamities encountered by the various realms in the Darkest Star Sea were different.

Some were [Annihilation], some were [Chaos], some were [Hunger]...

And what the Saint Embryo Li Fan encountered in the void now was another True Immortal Seal Script that caused a great disaster.

"Is it [Loneliness]? Or [Solitude]?"

Before seeing the actual entity of the True Immortal Seal Script, Li Fan had no way of knowing the truth.

He could only speculate based on the external manifestation of the True Immortal Seal Script's power.

"True Immortal Seal Scripts wreak havoc in all realms. Although it is likely not the true entity, but merely a copied existence by someone, it has still led countless cultivation worlds in this star sea to their doom."

"Among these True Immortal Seal Scripts, the character [Hunger] is even close to the path of the Immortal Ruins Immortal. He was inspired, sat in contemplation in the ruins of the immortal realm passage, and tried to comprehend the true meaning of the character [Hunger]."

"For him, it was probably just a momentary enlightenment, but it created the terrifying existence of the Immortal Ruins and caused the entire star sea to sink..."

"This is the power of [Immortals] above mortals."

The Saint Embryo's thoughts surged.

"And now, not far ahead, there is still an existence that can rival the power of the Immortal Ruins Immortal."

"What exactly is it?"

One more chapter before 12:30.

By comparing the flow of time in the Xuanhuang Realm, the Saint Embryo Li Fan could roughly judge the distance to his destination.

When the time flow ratio between the two gradually decreased to three to one, the Saint Embryo Li Fan knew that the unknown existence he was seeking was right in front of him.

On his way forward, besides the mummified giant, he also encountered other things from the ancient shattered cultivation world.

Including, but not limited to, the remains of cultivators and the ruins of buildings.

Li Fan even found some magical treasures once used by cultivators.

However, having floated in the void for too long, they had all lost their spiritual essence and were unusable.

But judging from the refining methods of the magical treasures and their external characteristics, they came from different cultivation worlds.

These "trash-like" miscellaneous items, due to a subtle balance between the two forces in the void, were not drawn towards the Immortal Ruins.

Nor were they pulled into the depths of the starry sea.

Instead, they remained quietly in this place, as if forgotten by the whole world.

The further he advanced, the more of these "trash" appeared in the void.

All were remnants of the past existence of different cultivation worlds.

Unsure if these miscellaneous items were still contaminated by the power of the True Immortal Seal Script, the Saint Embryo Li Fan dared not touch them.

He only controlled the puppet and sword body, constantly avoiding them.

As a result, his speed inevitably slowed down.

"Fortunately, my guess was correct. The closer I get to that power of the starry sea, the weaker the influence of the [Solitude] character on me becomes."

"I have temporarily escaped the danger of being devoured."

However…

The power of the True Immortal Seal Script, after all, was not to be underestimated.

Although not completely eroded, the Saint Embryo Li Fan could still feel various changes in his actions and thoughts.

For example, a thought of escaping from everything and seeking seclusion would arise in his mind for no reason.

Furthermore, the black sword Tian Zhi Qi, which was his cultivation foundation, actually produced a faint sense of estrangement within him.

From a worldly perspective, this was an unbelievable matter.

Knowing that after the Saint Embryo Li Fan devoured it and transformed it into his own foundation, they were already one existence.

One with the person, and the person with the sword.

But the power of the True Immortal Seal Script could forcibly restore this fusion.

"A complete loner?"

"Solitude?"

A different unease also faintly arose in the Saint Embryo Li Fan's heart.

Would this power of solitude affect his true body and [Return to Truth]?

Although [Return to Truth] had a high enough status, his true body's current strength was still unsatisfactory!

Even with just this possibility, Li Fan could not bear the risk.

The Saint Embryo Li Fan's heart gradually made a decision.

"Even if I waste this opportunity for exploration, I cannot let the power of solitude affect my true body."

"Before any signs appear, I will end my own life in advance."

Thinking this, the Saint Embryo Li Fan swallowed the last treasure that replenished his divine soul and then activated the Soul Burning Art.

His speed suddenly increased, and he rapidly shuttled through the gaps of the trash scattered across the void.

These relics from ancient cultivation worlds formed an endless ocean, seemingly without end.

The nourishing power within his body was almost depleted, yet he had still not managed to break out of the range of this great sea.

"These miscellaneous items can be preserved…"

"Then, will the fragments of past cultivation worlds also be preserved relatively intact?"

While drifting in this ocean of relics, the Saint Embryo Li Fan suddenly remembered the actions of the Heaven-Bestowing Sage and the Heavenly Doctor transporting world fragments from the starry sea and stitching together the Xuanhuang Realm.

"Who's there?" Just as he was lost in thought, Li Fan's heart suddenly tightened, because he actually felt a divine sense lock onto him in the void!

He shouted and looked towards the source of the lock.

The sense of being locked onto vanished instantly, and he saw only a blurry figure flickering rapidly and disappearing into the darkness.

The Saint Embryo Li Fan, with a grim face, arrived at the location where the figure had previously appeared.

"Not some mysterious and eerie existence, but a living person?"

"In this utter darkness of the starry sea, besides the Xuanhuang Realm, there are still other cultivation civilizations that have survived?"

The Saint Embryo Li Fan was greatly shaken.

Not only because he felt the aura of that figure, but also because the other party had voluntarily left a message.

To Li Fan, it was somewhat inexplicable, a divine sense memento that was clearly only usable by cultivators.

"Bing San, Seven Days Shu?"

"Jiu?"

Li Fan looked at these short sentences and fell into deep thought.

"It should be some kind of code. But with this common cultivation world script, it is definitely a surviving cultivator without a doubt."

Although he had not yet encountered the great power of the starry sea that caused the Xuanhuang Realm to shake, knowing that there were other sparks of civilization in the starry sea was already of great significance to Li Fan.

"For so many years, to survive in the utter darkness of the starry sea, besides the resources that can ensure survival, the most important thing is to be able to resist the suction of the Immortal Ruins. And this place, located at a subtle balance point between the two forces, has formed a safe zone."

"This also indicates…"

The Saint Embryo Li Fan's eyes flashed. He looked at the divine sense memento left by the unknown cultivator, very cautiously not responding.

"The great power of the starry sea that can contend with the Immortal Ruins did not suddenly appear recently."

"But due to some变故 (change/accident), it suddenly erupted with great intensity, which is why it was sensed by the Xuanhuang Realm, which is far outside the Immortal Ruins."

"…"

The figures of the Immortal Ruins and the Heaven-Bestowing Heavenly Lord reappeared before Li Fan's eyes.

These two had traveled in the utter darkness of the starry sea for a long time, and it was clear they could not be unaware of this.

"Interesting."

Because of the power of solitude, the Saint Embryo Li Fan's heart had become somewhat indifferent, but upon learning of the new spark of civilization, it re-animated with eagerness.

But it was forcibly suppressed by Li Fan.

"Even without contact, surviving in such a harsh environment is clearly not easy to get along with."

"Moreover, the laws in the utter darkness of the starry sea are more complete than those in Xuanhuang. The upper limit is higher, and these people have been here for so long…"

"Their strength should not be underestimated."

However, Li Fan did not worry about the Xuanhuang Realm.

The Xuanhuang Realm was filled with monsters, and with the blessing of the Heaven-Bestowing Heavenly Lord's new pháp (method/law), it was even stronger.

And this sea of ruins was poor in resources. If the two sides were to fight, it would definitely be a crushing victory for the Xuanhuang Realm.

"I was overthinking. The distance is so far. If it weren't for a chance encounter, even meeting would be a luxury."

Putting aside the idea of a cage match between the two surviving civilizations in the sea of ruins in the utter darkness of the starry sea, the immediate problem facing Li Fan was that his remaining time was running out.

Should he continue to advance deeper into the sea of ruins to find the source of the starry sea's great power?

Or should he try to make contact with the civilization here?

Without overthinking, after a brief contemplation, the Saint Embryo Li Fan made his decision.

He chose the latter.

"They have lived here for a long time and must have a greater understanding of that power of the starry sea."

"Rather than aimlessly rushing around like a headless fly, it is better to ask for directions."

The Saint Embryo Li Fan's eyes twinkled.

Chapter 1183: Mysteries Hidden in the Sea of Ruins

Though he had decided to seek information about the great power of the starry sea from this other surviving civilization, Saint Embryo Li Fan did not rush to confront them directly.

After all, he had traversed a significant portion of the utter darkness of the starry sea, constantly severing his soul to resist the erosion of the void's dark spot sickness, which had greatly weakened his strength. If he failed to gather information and was instead captured alive by them, wouldn't that be a colossal joke?

"Since a civilization can survive here, they must have methods to avoid the various strange erosions of the void. I will first stealthily infiltrate, slowly recover my strength, and then make my plans."

In a flash, Saint Embryo Li Fan had devised his strategy. He first tapped his brow, laying down a restriction within his already extremely frail soul. If anything went wrong, he could self-annul and instantly disperse his soul into nothingness.

Only then did Li Fan conceal his figure and begin to explore this ocean of ruins. He did not follow the furtive figure he had encountered earlier, fearing it might be a ruse to lure him deeper. Saint Embryo Li Fan chose another direction and turned to explore deeper.

"This void is fraught with danger. If there are hidden cultivators, they would surely need to protect themselves with formations, restrictions, and the like. I only need to find these traces and I can follow them. My understanding of formations is generations ahead of the Xuanhuang Realm, so I should be invincible here."

This was Li Fan's initial thought. However, after more than ten days of searching in the ocean of ruins, he found no trace of any formations or civilization. He didn't even sense a sliver of life. He even began to doubt if the phantom he had encountered earlier was merely an illusion. But he did not give up easily, like a patient hunter, he remained hidden in the shadows, waiting for the prey to appear.

Seventeen more days passed, and he finally reaped some reward. A small team of three cultivators, clad in strange armor, walked back-to-back, moving with extreme caution. Their method of appearance also surprised Li Fan. The silently floating, deathly still relics in the void shifted position, and a passage appeared out of thin air. After the three emerged, the deathly still relics returned to their original positions, closing the entrance to the passage. Li Fan narrowed his eyes, surveyed the surroundings, and took in all the cultivator relics nearby.

A moment later, he suddenly understood. "Brilliant! It's not isolated formations, but modifications made upon these naturally floating relics, almost completely blending them into the surrounding environment."

"More importantly..." Saint Embryo Li Fan slowly approached these floating relics. "These objects, originating from the shattered immortal cultivation world, have all been imbued, to varying degrees, with the power of true immortal runes. This forms a natural defense, capable of maximally shielding the spiritual sense of cultivators from perceiving them. This is why I searched so diligently before but still couldn't find their hiding place..." Li Fan instantly understood.

In reality, the exquisiteness of the formation was average. However, after incorporating and introducing the power of the true immortal runes that caused the destruction of all realms, its level had risen significantly. Even with Li Fan's current attainment in formations, he had no easy method of breaking it. Of course, if he were to disregard the potential side effects of the relics and forcefully break the formation, he could still do it. However, this would contradict his plan of stealthily gathering information.

Li Fan glanced at the entrance to the hidden passage and ultimately abandoned the idea of forcing his way in. Instead, he followed behind the three, observing them closely. Other than wearing strange armor, these three cultivators looked no different from the people of the Xuanhuang Realm. It seemed their expedition was to search for supplies in this ocean of ruins. However, the things they needed seemed peculiar to Li Fan. They appeared to have no commonality, ranging from fragments of magical treasures to sections of ruined buildings, and even some cultivator bones, all of which they collected. They didn't directly put them into storage rings but instead tied them together with a black rope, dragging them behind.

"This scene..." Li Fan was slightly stunned. It reminded him of the scene where Chuanfa transported world fragments in the void using golden chains. "Could there be a connection here?"

After about half a day, when the number of relics dragged behind them reached more than twenty, the three cultivators seemed to have a disagreement. However, under the leadership of the one in front, they abandoned their search. With the supplies, they turned and flew back towards the passage entrance.

Seeing this, Li Fan also quietly followed. The scope of their expedition seemed to have a boundary; they didn't venture too far from their hidden location. Soon, they arrived back at the hidden passage. Then, the armor of one of them began to flash rhythmically with waves of light. Li Fan sensed a peculiar rhythmic fluctuation emanating from the armor, as if it had triggered some mechanism. The surrounding deathly still relics rapidly shifted, and the circular entrance quietly appeared. The three cultivators, together, pulled the more than twenty items and flew into it.

Li Fan, still concealed, intended to follow them in. Unexpectedly, as he reached the entrance of the passage, a piercing alarm suddenly blared. Li Fan's heart leaped. He attached his pre-prepared divine sense clone to one of the items. His true body, however, rapidly retreated far away. Because of the presence of the divine sense clone, the alarm did not cease as Saint Embryo Li Fan retreated.

The three cultivators anxiously scanned their surroundings but, finding no sign of external intrusion, turned their attention to the items they had collected this time. After a brief discussion, they separated the items, attempting to put them in one by one. Finally, they found the one to which Li Fan's divine sense clone was attached. They chose not to destroy it but forcefully hurled it towards the depths of the ocean of ruins. With the source of the threat gone, the warning sound stopped. The three then turned and returned.

Not far away, watching the slowly closing passage entrance, Li Fan ultimately did not choose to force his way in. "Interesting, their warning system could detect me." His gaze flickered as he approached the relic that had been thrown away. "As expected, there's something peculiar. On the surface, the influence of the true immortal runes remains. But in reality, the power attached is extremely faint." "After such a long time, my frail divine sense clone has not suffered any harm..."

Retrieving his divine sense clone into his body, Li Fan casually picked up the relic and examined it again. It seemed to be a banner-type magical treasure, but the banner itself had decayed, leaving only a bare flagpole. All its spirituality was lost, and it could no longer exert its original abilities. "Why are they collecting these things?"

The material of this command banner magical treasure itself was also ordinary and common, and in this sea of relics, it did not have any special value that warranted selection.

"Could it be for the power of the True Immortal seal script on it, whose side effects have already faded?"

Li Fan's heart stirred, and he immediately understood.

Gently stroking the command banner, he sensed a familiar aura.

"The Art of Chaos..."
