"It's just that with the passage of time, even the power of True Immortal seal script will eventually reach its end."

The complete character "Chaos" instantly appeared in his mind. A moment later, the Saint Embryo Li Fan's hand holding the command banner stiffened slightly.

Because he discovered that just now, the last trace of power attached to the command banner had completely dissipated.

In its place, his comprehension of the "Art of Chaos" had subtly deepened!

This progress was extremely minute.

However, Li Fan's own understanding of the character "Chaos" was still stuck at the most basic level of imitation, so the change appeared relatively obvious and was instantly captured by Li Fan.

"It can actually be used as material for comprehending the Way?"

The Saint Embryo Li Fan couldn't help but be shaken. Looking at the countless floating relics around him, his gaze was entirely different.

"However, it is regrettable that it seems only relics with the power of True Immortal seal script on the verge of dissipation can be used as sustenance for comprehending the Way. Otherwise, there is a risk of being harmed. The method to distinguish them..."

The Saint Embryo Li Fan's gaze turned towards the hidden shelter.

For the next six months, Li Fan hid in the shadows. Each time a cultivator went out to collect relics, he would do the same.

He would send out a divine sense clone attached to the collected relics.

One purpose was to study the trigger method of the alarm, and the other was to coincidentally acquire all relics imbued with the power of True Immortal seal script for comprehending the Way.

In the Xuanhuang World, the End Dissolution Disc in the main body's sea of consciousness was working at full capacity, deciphering the unknown formation.

And through his research of the eight acquired relics, the Saint Embryo Li Fan became even more certain of his judgment.

The other surviving civilization in this Dark Star Sea was collecting these relics to study, and even utilize, the power of True Immortal seal script.

"To actually have a method to discern the degree of this power..."

"It seems their strength should not be underestimated."

Among these eight relics, three were from "Chaos," and two were from "Hunger."

As for the remaining two, they were influenced by other True Immortal seal script powers that were currently unknown.

Li Fan also discovered the differences between them.

He had personally seen the original forms of the True Immortal seal script characters "Chaos" and "Hunger." Even though they were imitations, he had gained a general understanding of their origin. Therefore, he could smoothly absorb the residual power on the relics for comprehending the Way, turning it into sustenance for his enlightenment.

The situation with the other two relics was vastly different.

Relying solely on the fading residual power, it was difficult to even sense their nature, let alone comprehend their essence.

The efficiency of their utilization was not even a ten-thousandth of that of "Chaos" and "Hunger"!

"This is the difference between going from top to bottom, and from bottom to top. Knowing the true origin and meaning of the True Immortal seal script, one can understand everything from a superior vantage point."

"But if one starts from ignorance, like a blind man touching an elephant, slowly exploring and researching on their own..."

"It's as difficult as ascending to heaven! With mortal power, one dares to explore the power of True Immortals..."

At the same time, Li Fan mused thoughtfully.

"Not all cultivators have enough opportunities to be fortunate enough to personally witness the true origin and meaning of True Immortal seal script."

"The Art of Chaos is hidden in the Deceptive Mirage Domain within the white mist; ordinary people would find it difficult to encounter in their entire lives. And the Art of Hunger is even carved on the Immortal Ruins! Seeing it means death. If I didn't have the help of Huan Zhen, I would never have been able to master it."

"And the character 'Nothingness' was also discovered by me coincidentally within a golden skull in a destroyed small world..."

Li Fan looked at the hidden unknown civilization, and a thought naturally arose. "What is termed 'scarce goods are highly valued,' the value of these true origins and meanings in this civilization might be even higher than I imagined."

...

After more than thirty days, the End Dissolution Disc finally broke through the method for triggering the warning.

As a precaution, the Saint Embryo Li Fan did not directly expose himself to danger.

He still used his divine sense clones to test.

Although he had severed many spiritual clones over the past half year, the area near the civilization's hiding place seemed to contain some strange power.

It could resist all sorts of bizarre intrusions from the void, so the Saint Embryo Li Fan's recovery speed was also very fast.

Severing spiritual clones caused him only a little pain now.

The End Dissolution Disc was indeed trustworthy.

This time, the relic attached to the divine sense clone successfully passed the detection and entered the passage.

The sensing became much weaker, but he could still vaguely perceive the situation inside the hiding place.

The three-person team that went out to collect relics continued to drag the items forward with black ropes. After passing through three layers of passage defenses, they finally entered the safe zone.

They couldn't wait to take off their armor, complaining incessantly.

"There are fewer and fewer useful relics near the Immortal Boat. We only found this much this time..."

"The next mission will likely take us outside the safe zone."

"Have we been here for a hundred years? I wonder why they haven't set off yet."

"It's said they originally planned to change their mooring location, but a while ago..."

"Shush, it's better to discuss less. Wu Xing was confined for ten years because of this matter."

The three wisely avoided the topic.

With their haul from this trip, they continued deeper into the hiding place.

"Immortal Boat?" Li Fan mused upon hearing their words.

After passing through a narrow, dark corridor, the view ahead suddenly opened up.

They had arrived in a picturesque valley.

Ahead, a white-haired old man, holding a strange artifact resembling a book, was waiting for the three of them.

"Let me see this time..." The old man's face was originally smiling, but upon seeing the number of relics behind the three, it immediately turned grim.

"Elder, please forgive us. Our luck was truly bad on this expedition," the oldest-looking cultivator among the three said with a wry smile.

The old man shook his head, sighed, and didn't say much in the end.

The book-like artifact in his hand emitted a beam of light that enveloped all the relics.

As the beam of light retracted, it seemed to have completed the inspection of the relics.

"Try to make up for it next time."

"You are aware of the situation with the Immortal Boat. If we are short one or two items each time, it's fine for a short period. But if it goes on for a long time, won't we all suffer?" the old man snorted.

The elder cultivator did not argue, but nodded repeatedly.

"Help me deliver these relics to the 'Broken Immortal Tower'," the old man then instructed.

The three cultivators were slightly stunned upon hearing the elder’s request.

“Elder Gou, this does not comply with the regulations…”

“Hmm?” The elder’s gaze turned cold as he sized them up.

The three could only swallow their words.

Circumstances dictated their actions. The elder cultivator cupped his fists and, with the relics tethered, they left the valley.

On the way.

“Brother Zhao, the Immortal Boat’s laws clearly state that after collecting relics from perished realms, they must be handed over to the [Immortal Pivot Department]. Violators will be charged with treason. Now he wants us to deliver them to the Broken Immortal Tower…”

“Exactly. Everyone on the Immortal Boat knows that the Broken Immortal Tower and the Immortal Pivot Department are at odds. That old geezer wants to curry favor with the Broken Immortal Tower, but he’s making us do his dirty work. If something goes wrong, we’ll surely be unable to escape responsibility.”

The elder cultivator, referred to as Brother Zhao by the other two, had an unfriendly expression but did not join in the complaints. Instead, he gestured for them to be quiet.

After an exchange of silent telepathic messages, the two finally calmed down.

The three did not fly, but walked out of the valley step by step along the small path.

The scenery ahead suddenly changed, as if they had returned to the void of the starry sea.

However, this void was not as cold and dead as the dark starry sea outside.

A gentle breeze blew from the void, carrying a sense of vitality.

In a trance, one could see faint, multi-colored star points occasionally flickering.

Contrasting this harmonious and warm scene was an extremely bizarre spectacle: a colossal giant, standing tall in the void.

Its eyes were tightly closed, its body withered, like a zombie that had long been dead.

Yet, its chest rose and fell continuously, its breaths creating warm winds that blew in all directions.

If it were merely a dying giant, it would be tolerable. What was horrifying, however, was a thick branch extending from the giant’s mouth.

It grew stubbornly upwards, forming a lush canopy.

Upon closer inspection, the giant’s body was pierced through by branches. The lower half of the giant had even transformed into dense, intertwined root-like strands.

They swayed with the wind from time to time, appearing almost alive.

This bizarre scene left one bewildered, as if unsure whether the tree was parasitizing the person or the person was transforming into a tree.

The three were already accustomed to this sight and merely sighed, “It seems the [Dao Chasing] giant is close to its end. I wonder what the Immortal Pivot Department will come up with next.”

“The Broken Immortal Tower talks a good game, promising to completely solve the Immortal Boat’s energy problems. They’ve been saying this for so long, yet there’s still no tangible result.”

“Let’s wait and see. It’s said that this time there has been a revolutionary breakthrough, otherwise that dog elder wouldn’t have shown such favor so suddenly.”

…

The few chatted idly, exchanging a few words here and there.

As they left the valley and flew into the void, a patch of green suddenly appeared beneath their feet, forming an airborne path leading elsewhere.

There was no need to fly; the green path itself moved rapidly.

Upon reaching the void, the overall appearance of the Immortal Boat came into view.

Floating continents, like the stars in the sky, were distributed everywhere.

Giants in the void, parasitized by strange trees.

From the giant trees, countless green, thread-like paths extended, appearing and disappearing, connecting various continents.

Li Fan’s divine sense, hidden within a relic from a perished realm, secretly observed all of this.

This form of cultivation civilization, so different from the Xuanhuang Realm, piqued his interest.

“Immortal Boat…”

“The ancestor of the Medicine King Sect, Sun Piaomiao, once roamed beyond the heavens and recorded information about eighteen immortal cultivation world beacons. Among them was a colossal flying ship that wandered through the void, trading between realms. It was a world of its own, named Xuan Shang.”

“I wonder if it has any connection to this Immortal Boat.”

Li Fan then looked at the giant, whose life force was continuously being extracted and radiated outwards: “The Dao Chasing clan?”

The green, intangible path moved extremely fast in the void. It didn’t take long for Zhao and his companions to reach the so-called Broken Immortal Tower.

A circular orb emitting a dark golden light.

Upon closer inspection, it was, surprisingly, built upon the skeletal remains of a giant.

However, this time it was not a complete body, but a single, massive skull.

To Li Fan’s shock, there was an eyeball in the center of the skull!

The eyeball had not lost its vitality with the death of the skull.

It was merely closed, still subtly rotating.

An inexplicable sense of danger arose in his heart. Li Fan’s divine sense immediately detached itself from the relic it was inhabiting and fled.

It remained in the void, not following the three into the Broken Immortal Tower.

His judgment was correct.

The giant eyeball suddenly opened and scanned its surroundings. Finding nothing unusual, it closed again.

Only then were the three cultivators, led by Zhao, able to enter the Broken Immortal Tower.

Li Fan’s divine sense no longer focused on the three-eyed skull, but patiently waited for them to return in the void outside the Broken Immortal Tower.

“Dark golden skull, three eyes.”

“It’s very similar to the one I found the ‘Mei’ character technique from. But this one in the Immortal Boat…”

“Seems to be weaker?”

Bigger did not necessarily mean stronger.

Li Fan had encountered that dark golden three-eyed skull before. Even though the third eye was gone and it had purely become a breeding ground for the gray mold spots of the ‘Mei’ character technique, it still gave Li Fan an extremely dangerous feeling, as if it could revive at any moment. Therefore, Li Fan had always sealed it with his seven-colored divine light, not daring to foolishly research it.

Although the three-eyed skull before him was much larger, and even its eyeball was alive, it gave Li Fan the feeling that it was completely dead and had no chance of reviving.

This was a profound and mysterious sensation.

“I have encountered few things from outside the Xuanhuang Realm during my reincarnations. I’ve been here for a short time and have encountered almost all of them.”

“It seems this Immortal Boat truly has some secrets.”

“Without complete world resources, one must obtain the necessities for survival from the dark starry sea, making full use of everything. It seems the foundation of this Immortal Boat may far exceed my imagination…”

Li Fan’s thoughts churned, his mind constantly strategizing where to find a breakthrough.

From the conversation of the three cultivators just now, he learned that the Immortal Boat seemed to be caught in a power struggle between the Immortal Pivot Department and the Broken Immortal Tower.

This situation was welcomed by Li Fan, an outsider.

“Only in troubled waters can one fish. I must find a way to stir up some chaos on this Immortal Boat.”

Not long after, the three cultivators, led by Zhao, emerged from the Broken Immortal Tower.

Contrary to their earlier indignation, they were now all beaming, their eyes unable to suppress their excitement.

Standing on the green, intangible path, they reached the center of the void before excitedly discussing.

“I never expected the Broken Immortal Tower to actually find a way to utilize the power of perished realms!”

“Relics are infinite in the void; we no longer have to worry about running out of energy!”

“Now we can sit back and watch the show!”

"Yes, the Celestial Pivot Department has always disagreed with the research on the power of perished realms, and for many years, they have fiercely suppressed it. Countless cultivators have become nourishment for the [Divine Tree] because of this. If they weren't truly unable to sustain themselves in recent years, I don't think they would have compromised."

"Thinking about it this way, the Broken Immortal Tower has made such great progress in just over five hundred years. The Celestial Pivot Department has been in power for nearly ten thousand years, yet has been utterly incompetent. This has caused the Immortal Boat to become worse and worse, deteriorating day by day. The Celestial Pivot Department truly deserves to die."

"The sky of the Immortal Boat is about to change. We brothers must make plans early. Perhaps we can take this opportunity to shed our status as culprits..."

The three looked at each other, seeing the ambition in each other's hearts.

However, their whispered conversations ceased in the deserted void.

When they returned to their original valley, they became taciturn and outwardly resentful again. After reporting to Elder Gou, they moved into the wooden houses in the valley and settled down.

A total of one hundred cultivators lived here. From time to time, some of them would venture out of the Immortal Boat to collect relics from perished realms. The inhabitants of the Immortal Boat seemed to be extremely fearful of the outer, pitch-black sea. Before each mission, they appeared uneasy.

The task of collecting relics indeed had a high mortality rate. It wasn't due to physical harm in the void outside the Immortal Boat, but rather, each excursion seemed to significantly reduce the lifespan of the Immortal Boat's inhabitants. After two such trips, the wrinkles on Zhao Tianjiang's face, the cultivator surnamed Zhao, were noticeably deeper.

"No wonder I don't see any young cultivators here; they're all middle-aged and elderly," Li Fan realized with a start.

The hundred or so people in the valley did not cultivate on a daily basis. Apart from the task of collecting relics from perished realms, they had no other duties. From their daily chats, Li Fan gathered a vast amount of information about the Immortal Boat.

This valley was called [Valley of Punishments] by them; it was a place of exile for cultivators who had violated the Immortal Boat's laws but whose crimes did not warrant death. Collecting relics from perished realms was a way to atone for their sins. Upon completing their good deeds, they could leave this place and return to a normal life. Through their hopeful conversations, Li Fan glimpsed the daily lives of the Immortal Boat's inhabitants.

All affairs of the Immortal Boat, big or small, were managed by the [Celestial Pivot Department]. Ordinary inhabitants of the Immortal Boat did not have to worry about survival; the Celestial Pivot Department provided a fixed amount of survival supplies annually. However, this was just enough to sustain life.

Within the Immortal Boat, there were strict controls on the total population and the number of cultivators. Not only did one need approval to have a child, but there were also fixed quotas for cultivation. Besides obtaining cultivation qualifications through a lottery, one could also earn them by making outstanding contributions to the Immortal Boat, such as retrieving relics from perished realms.

In this Valley of Punishments, most individuals were without cultivation. This was why they harbored such great fear of venturing outside. As mortals, they could move freely and remain immortal in the pitch-black sea because they wore specially made immortal armor from the Celestial Pivot Department when on missions. This armor not only ensured their safety but also identified which relics were suitable for redemption as merit points. As for what purpose the Celestial Pivot Department used these relics from perished realms for... these common folk of the Immortal Boat naturally had no idea.

"It seems this Immortal Boat is even more divided than the Xuanhuang Realm."

"The information I can gather by staying here is limited. I need to find a way to leave this place."

The power of his current divine sense was too weak and could not afford any depletion. It was nearly impossible for him to traverse the void of the Immortal Boat on his own. The green, intangible path in the void would only appear with permission; those who dared to approach it normally would be shattered and become nourishment for the Immortal Boat. Therefore, Li Fan's divine sense had been lurking, waiting for an opportunity.

However, what he did not expect was that instead of an opportunity, he encountered a disaster. The cause was that Zhao Tianjiang and the two other cultivators he was lurking near suddenly fell ill.

At first, Zhao Tianjiang thought he was just tired and stayed in bed for several days. Later, he couldn't sleep at all and began to feel itchy all over, unable to sit still. Zhao Tianjiang seemed to recall something, and his eyes filled with boundless fear. However, he did not tell the others about it. He even suppressed his discomfort, showed his face a few times in front of everyone, and proactively applied to go on another relic collection mission.

Later, as he couldn't stop coughing and black spots began to appear on his skin, Zhao Tianjiang hid in his room and refused to come out. Holding a jade token-like artifact, he was doing something unknown. Even more so, blood began to flow from his seven orifices, and the scent of blood spread, finally making the matter impossible to conceal.

"Alas. Time is running out; it's best to send him back soon to reunite with his family."

"Truly, fate is unpredictable. Old Zhao was the fittest among us, yet he still couldn't avoid contracting this void-borne strange illness."

"He even concealed his condition for a time, just to accumulate more merit for young Zhao before he died..."

Everyone sighed, showing a sense of shared misfortune. Elder Gou, however, showed no emotional reaction, merely handling the matter professionally and sending Zhao Tianjiang away. Soon, the Immortal Boat sent someone to the Valley of Punishments to fill Zhao Tianjiang's position.

After Zhao Tianjiang's death, the other two cultivators who had been with him also developed symptoms not long after and tragically perished. In the Valley of Punishments, everyone lamented their bad luck. However, only Li Fan knew that their successive deaths from the so-called void-borne strange illness were likely due to Li Fan's divine sense lingering nearby for an extended period.

"The bodies of these Immortal Boat inhabitants..."

"How fragile. They can't even withstand a trace of the void's aura carried by my divine sense. If my true self came here, wouldn't I be a destructive source of contagion?" Li Fan was speechless.

Taking the lives of the three was not intentional. It was because he had traversed more than half of the pitch-black sea and had stayed in the void for too long. His soul had likely become tainted with some mysterious power from the void. Although his soul was resilient and immune to these strange powers, these fragile Immortal Boat inhabitants were different.

In the Valley of Punishments, it was as if time stood still, year after year. The entire Immortal Boat seemed like a stagnant pool, devoid of any ripples. The opportunity Li Fan's divine sense was waiting for never arrived.

Until one day... Elder Gou, who was always stern, suddenly changed his demeanor. He summoned all the inhabitants of the Valley of Punishments and led them out of the valley, as if awaiting the arrival of some important figure. The people in the valley were uneasy, while Li Fan's divine sense sensed a powerful aura rapidly approaching from afar.

"Dao Integration stage?"

"More than that. But it doesn't have the oppressive feeling of the Longevity stage."

"Hmm? And it's mixed with a trace of the power of True Immortal seal script?"

Chapter 1187: Infiltrating the Immortal Boat Alone

"It's the character 'Hunger'..."

Li Fan's divine sense quickly identified the subtle fluctuation emanating from the Dao Integration cultivator on the Immortal Boat not far away. He didn't approach closely, instead observing from within the wooden house.

"Elder Yan..." Elder Gou, who usually had a stern face, was now bowing and acting extremely obsequious. The people in the valley grumbled inwardly but dared not show it, even lowering their heads, afraid to meet the eyes of this Dao Integration cultivator. After all, to mortals, Dao Integration cultivators were almost indistinguishable from legendary immortals.

"Gou Lang, I heard that five people died consecutively in the Valley of Punishments a while ago?" Elder Yan asked in a deep voice.

Gou Lang trembled and quickly replied, "Indeed, there was such a matter. However, it was just that those few sinners had bad luck. They only went out for work two or three times before their condition worsened and they passed away. The Valley of Punishments itself was not in any turmoil..."

"Hmph! What luck..." A cold glint flashed in Elder Yan's eyes, and he didn't explain further. His immense divine sense instantly enveloped the entire Valley of Punishments.

"As expected, this place has been contaminated." Elder Yan's expression immediately turned grim. A speck of starlight appeared at his fingertip, and he pointed it towards the residential area of the Valley of Punishments, where Li Fan's divine sense was located. Endless light and heat destroyed everything within the range.

...

Outside the Immortal Boat.

The embryonic Li Fan, who had been hiding and cultivating in seclusion, slightly raised his head. "As expected of a civilization that has survived for so long in the Utmost Dark Sea, they are so cautious. It seems that if I want to sneak in, I need to solve the problem of being a major source of contagion myself. Otherwise, no matter how well I hide, causing a large number of deaths among those around me will also expose me. My divine soul has been in the Utmost Dark Sea for too long. The accumulated damage is difficult to reverse. I must still split off a wisp of divine sense to infiltrate. With the previous experience, I can do this..."

For the next two full months, no one from the Immortal Boat ventured out to collect remnants of the world-ending catastrophe. However, with the virtually endless remnants in the outside world, they clearly couldn't give them up. Thus, Li Fan finally waited for a new collection team.

Following the previous experience, Li Fan's divine sense mixed in with the remnants and entered the Immortal Boat. This time, however, the Immortal Boat was clearly much more cautious in handling the remnants. When they were near the remnants, the Immortal Boat cultivators continuously wore their armor. After the remnants were moved into a sealed space, a blurry phantom of a talisman appeared above the space after they left.

"What is this..." The talisman emitted a faint glow, illuminating the more than ten remnants below. Although Li Fan's divine sense was also bathed in the light, he was not affected in the slightest. He merely watched as the power of the True Immortal seal script attached to the surrounding remnants, which was about to dissipate, was absorbed into the talisman phantom above through the dreamlike, illusory light. Li Fan's divine sense even felt that the various mysterious powers surrounding him were being drawn away by the talisman.

Before long, the power attached to the more than ten remnants here completely disappeared, turning them into worthless trash from the star sea. The talisman flashed with a faint light and left the space. "The extent to which the Immortal Boat utilizes the power of True Immortal seal script is slightly higher than I imagined."

The space was completely sealed, and Li Fan's divine sense couldn't escape. However, he wasn't worried. Someone would surely come to deal with the remaining "trash."

As Li Fan had predicted, two days later, two Qi Refining stage cultivators entered, led by a Foundation Establishment cultivator.

"Move these things onto the boat." "Be careful, everyone. Although the world-ending power of these things is gone, they are still genuine ancient relics. The fact that they could remain in the star sea for so long indicates that their materials are inherently extraordinary. Send them all to the 'Star Forging Workshop,' perhaps they can be repurposed." The Foundation Establishment cultivator instructed.

The two Qi Refining cultivators appeared to be about fifteen or sixteen years old, looking inexperienced. Li Fan's divine sense pondered for a moment and attached itself to one of them. He followed the three out of the sealed space and took a small flying boat to the so-called "Star Forging Workshop."

It was a sealed, ring-shaped building made of an unknown white metal. In the center of the ring was a blazing fireball. The terrifying heat waves constantly surging on the surface of the fireball spoke of the immense energy contained within. Faintly, one could see wisps of flames being drawn into a small opening in the ring-shaped building.

The person in charge of reception in the Star Forging Workshop was not a normal human. Instead, it was a strange being, half-human and half-beast, with a crimson body, two horns on its head, and a long tail trailing behind it. The three seemed very afraid of it. After setting down the items, they hastily piloted the flying boat away.

After some commotion, they finally returned to their living quarters, located in what was called the "Dao Proving Academy." It was also a separate continent floating in the void. The academy was towering, piercing the clouds. They went to the lower level of the academy to report back to their master. Their master was a Nascent Soul cultivator named Zhao Wuji, who was already white-haired. Seeing the three return, he put down the book-like artifact he was reading and asked with a face full of kindness, "Is everything settled?"

The three lowered their heads and replied, "Reporting to Master, everything has been handled properly."

"Do you know why I asked you to make this special trip?" Zhao Wuji asked again. The three were stunned, not knowing how to answer.

"Not long ago, the Valley of Punishments was razed to the ground. The survivors within the valley were all taken away and put under observation. It is said that the incident was caused by the improper collection of remnants by the Valley of Punishments, which led to the spread of the 'world-ending power.'"

"Heh heh..."

"This procedure was established by the Immortal Pivot Institute, and it has been this way for thousands of years. Even if there were occasional minor issues, they never caused major trouble. This time, the commotion is so great." Zhao Wuji's words suddenly stopped.

At this moment, the Foundation Establishment cultivator among the three suddenly realized, "Master, are you saying that the Immortal Severing Tower is using this as an opportunity to make trouble?"

"Precisely." Zhao Wuji showed a look of 'a promising student.' "Not just the Valley of Punishments. From now on, any area within the Immortal Boat that falls under the jurisdiction of the Immortal Pivot Institute will face the impact of the Immortal Severing Tower."

"The Immortal Pivot Institute has been in power for too long, and those who covet the leadership of the Immortal Boat have waited for too long." Zhao Wuji sighed slightly.

Zhao Wuji's three disciples' expressions differed upon hearing this. The Foundation Establishment disciple's eyes darted around, as if calculating something. One of the Qi Refining disciples lowered his head, earnestly contemplating his master's words. As for the other, the one in whom Li Fan's divine sense had attached itself, he seemed completely indifferent, his mind wandering as if in a daze.

"Zhao Xian!" Zhao Wuji snorted coldly upon seeing this.

Zhao Xian immediately snapped back to attention.

"You tell me, what is the connection between the dispute between the Immortal Severing Tower and the Immortal Pivot Institute, and our mission to send you on this task?" Zhao Wuji asked, narrowing his eyes.

"Master is stating his position and showing goodwill. This is the first time the Immortal Severing Tower is collecting relics after taking over the Valley of Punishments. Everyone is watching. They want to see how the Immortal Severing Tower's new methods compare to the Immortal Pivot Institute's long-standing traditions. Sending away useless relics for recycling… this was a trivial matter that Master insisted we handle personally. It's to show the Immortal Severing Tower your attitude, and also to explain to the outside forces that are observing…"

Zhao Xian said listlessly.

Zhao Wuji nodded repeatedly, very satisfied with Zhao Xian's analysis.

However, upon seeing his indifferent expression, he couldn't help but get angry.

Just as he was about to say something, Zhao Xian preempted him, "Master, I truly don't understand. The Immortal Boat is already in this state, why can't we unite instead of fighting each other to the death?"

Zhao Wuji's expression changed. He waved his hand to prevent his disciple's voice from leaking out.

"You unfilial disciple…"

"Is there something wrong with that?" Zhao Xian boldly retorted, showing no fear.

Zhao Wuji suddenly produced a ruler, raised it high, and was about to bring it down on Zhao Xian's head.

Yet, he ultimately did not strike him hard.

"Xian'er, you don't understand."

"This Profound Immortal Boat must have, and can only have, one helmsman. The tragedy from many years ago already illustrated the terrible consequences of a lack of unity in the highest decision-making body," Zhao Wuji sighed.

Zhao Xian sighed and his expression turned somber. He no longer argued.

"You may all leave now," Zhao Wuji suddenly lost interest.

"Do not go out for the time being. Cultivate diligently at the Academy. Since your Master has already chosen a side, we just need to wait for them to determine the victor. Even if the Immortal Severing Tower truly loses, the Immortal Pivot Institute wouldn't dare to do anything to our Dao Seeking Academy. At most, they'll reduce our material allocation."

The three disciples obeyed and left, returning to their respective residences.

The Dao Seeking Academy had a rather imposing name.

However, Zhao Xian's living quarters were far too simple.

It hardly looked like a place where an immortal cultivator would rest, just a single room barely large enough to live in.

The only commendable aspect was that the spiritual energy concentration in the room was significantly higher than in other areas of the Immortal Boat.

It was sufficient for cultivation below the Golden Core stage.

Closing the door, Zhao Xian skillfully sealed it with a restriction. A flicker of excitement flashed in his eyes as he retrieved a book-like magical artifact from under the bed.

Just as he was about to use it, he suddenly fell asleep.

Li Fan's divine sense slowly took form.

He took the book-like magical artifact.

"Hmm… it's similar to the Heavenly Profound Mirror, connecting to the Immortal Boat's information network. It can also be used to exchange contribution points from the Academy for corresponding resources. However, it's limited to the internal network of the Dao Seeking Academy and cannot connect to other areas of the Immortal Boat."

Li Fan shook his head and tossed aside the so-called [Myriad Knowledge Record].

Then, he transformed into a wisp of smoke and infiltrated Zhao Xian's consciousness.

How could a mere Qi Refining stage youth resist Li Fan's scrutiny?

Before long, all of Zhao Xian's secrets from childhood to adulthood were laid bare before Li Fan.

Although Zhao Xian shared the same surname Zhao as Zhao Wuji, they were not related by blood.

Zhao Wuji showed Zhao Xian particular favoritism entirely because of Zhao Xian's "cultivation talent."

In just one year since arriving at the Dao Seeking Academy, he had already reached the late Qi Refining stage.

Although this cultivation speed was insignificant in the Vast Yellow Realm, it was considered outstanding within the Immortal Boat.

The cultivation resources on the Immortal Boat were limited. Even the Dao Seeking Academy lived frugally, only able to prioritize disciples with exceptional talent.

Every three academic years, a system of elimination was implemented.

Those who fell behind in progress had to leave the Academy, either returning home to become lone cultivators or accepting appointments from the Immortal Pivot Institute to serve in various positions on the Immortal Boat.

It was precisely this cruel elimination system that allowed the Dao Seeking Academy to maintain its advantage and vitality.

It wasn't just the disciples who were eliminated; cultivators like Zhao Wuji, at the Nascent Soul stage, faced significant pressure.

If the disciples they taught performed poorly, it would indicate a lack of teaching talent.

Without strong backing and connections, they would be removed from their teaching positions and assigned to other, more dangerous duties.

This was also the reason for the oppressive atmosphere throughout the Dao Seeking Academy.

Everyone lived with the uncertainty of when they might be forced to leave.

However, Zhao Xian was an exception.

Perhaps by nature, he had no great attachment to remaining at the Dao Seeking Academy.

Even his enthusiasm for cultivation was not high.

Outsiders believed that reaching the late Qi Refining stage in a year was the result of his diligent cultivation.

Only he knew that this was merely the performance after his sporadic efforts, without investing much energy.

Zhao Xian's greatest interest was in searching the Myriad Knowledge Record for oddities and anecdotes.

He was full of curiosity about the origins of the Immortal Boat, everything about the ancient immortal cultivation world, and the endless sea of stars beyond the Immortal Boat…

Li Fan meticulously reviewed his findings from the past year.

These were not only from the [Myriad Knowledge Record] but also from inquiries made to elders in the Academy.

"In ancient times, the Immortal Boat was once intact. However, due to a sudden catastrophe from the Sea of Stars realm and internal strife, the Immortal Boat was shattered and divided into two halves."

"One was named [Xuan], and the other was named [Shang]."

"This vessel is the Xuan Immortal Boat."

"…"

After a pause, Li Fan continued reading.

"For a long time after the Immortal Boat's fragmentation, it drifted in the Sea of Stars, entering a chaotic era of complete loss of control."

"The population also plummeted during that period, with nearly nine-tenths dying. **"

"Until the Immortal Boat finally stabilized, it appeared in this sea of relics."

"And has never left since…"

"Although it can move within a small range, it is powerless to break free from the powerful force's restraint on the outer perimeter of the relic sea."

"…"

Reading the name given by the people of the Immortal Boat to the pulling force, Li Fan fell into deep thought.

"[Reverberating Star Force]?"

"What is the meaning of 'reverberating'?"

Zhao Xian, merely a Qi Refining cultivator, was able to know so much only because he pestered his seniors in the Academy day after day to glean this information.

The source of the Reverberating Star Force was indeed not something he could know.

Li Fan had to temporarily suppress his doubts.

He began to consider his next plan.

The strength of his divine sense was too weak. Only by bringing in the Holy Embryo could he have enough room to maneuver.

The only issue to resolve was the residual power of the True Immortal Seal script.

Li Fan's mind immediately turned to the talisman the Immortal Severing Tower had used previously.

"It has never left since..."

"Although it can move within a small range, it is powerless to break free from the powerful force's restraint on the outer perimeter of the relic sea."

"..."

Reading the name given by the people of the Immortal Boat to the pulling force, Li Fan fell into deep thought.

"[Reverberating Star Force]?"

"What is the meaning of 'reverberating'?"

Zhao Xian, merely a Qi Refining cultivator, was able to know so much only because he pestered his seniors in the Academy day after day to glean this information.

The source of the Reverberating Star Force was indeed not something he could know.

Li Fan had to temporarily suppress his doubts.

He began to consider his next plan.

The strength of his divine sense was too weak. Only by bringing in the Holy Embryo could he have enough room to maneuver.

The only issue to resolve was the residual power of the True Immortal Seal script.

Li Fan's mind immediately turned to the talisman the Immortal Severing Tower had used previously.

"That talisman seems to be able to absorb the power of the wandering True Immortal Seal script. It should be able to be used as a cover."

"However, this was a technique first revealed by the Immortal Severing Tower. Even in the [Dao Proving Academy], which is said to be the source of the Immortal Boat's dao techniques, there are no related records."

Li Fan's separated consciousness immediately fell upon the sleeping Zhao Xian.

"The Immortal Boat has a strict hierarchy. Many people have never even left their continent in their lifetime. A strong fortress must be broken from within."

His separated consciousness gently pointed a finger at Zhao Xian's forehead.

In a daze, Zhao Xian seemed to have had a long dream.

In the dream, the dispute between the Immortal Severing Tower and the Immortal Pivot Court was unresolved for a long time. The conflict grew fiercer, and their methods became increasingly extreme. Ultimately, it led to a devastating disaster. The Immortal Boat plunged into the depths of the Sea of Relics, vanishing into thin air. No one on the Immortal Boat survived, including Zhao Xian himself.

Awakening from the nightmare, the usually cheerful and optimistic Zhao Xian was unable to recover for a long time, his face ashen.

It was not for naught, as the dream had been too real. Zhao Xian could still remember some of the details in the dream with perfect clarity, giving him the illusion that he had returned to the past.

"In the dream, ten years later, the Immortal Boat salvage team found a supreme treasure called the [Law Derivation Jade] in the Sea of Relics. It could derive different cultivation methods every moment, and even derive them directionally based on conditions. Because of the ownership of the Law Derivation Jade, the Immortal Severing Tower and the Immortal Pivot Court fought fiercely. In the end, it was temporarily entrusted to our Dao Proving Academy for safekeeping. Although the Academy gained an unimaginable number of cultivation methods during this period, it also laid the groundwork for future calamities."

"As an elite disciple of the Academy, I had the fortune to study a portion of these cultivation methods in my dream."

"'Sea Calming Divine Sword'..."

Zhao Xian subconsciously circulated the contents of the cultivation method from his dream.

A moment later, his expression drastically changed.

"How is this possible?"

Zhao Xian recalled even more profound cultivation method content.

'Great Kang Geng Metal Sword Qi', 'Emperor of Heaven Qi Codex', 'Two Qi Illuminating Spirits All Heavens Annihilation Technique', 'Boundless Celestial Pivot Spirit Severing Technique'...

One peerless divine technique after another, which had shaken the world, appeared in his mind.

Every word, every sentence, was perfectly clear.

The circulation of vital energy brought about by silently reciting these cultivation method phrases also made Zhao Xian realize that these were not figments of his imagination. They were genuine supreme divine techniques!

"Let alone me, not a single person in the entire Dao Proving Academy could have derived these cultivation methods..."

Zhao Xian's heart pounded wildly.

"Could it be that I have truly returned from the future to the past?"

For a full half-day, Zhao Xian was unable to accept this reality. No matter how hard he racked his brain, he could not figure out why such a bizarre event had happened to him.

Since he couldn't figure it out, he stopped thinking about it.

Zhao Xian's thoughts quickly focused on the Immortal Boat's demise in his dream.

"If that were true..."

"I must change all of this." Zhao Xian subconsciously clenched his fists.

Having experienced so many cruel events in his dream, the young Zhao Xian had become much more composed. He did not habitually use his [Myriad Knowledge Record] to search for solutions, because he knew that every utterance and browsing record of his was under the surveillance of the Dao Proving Academy.

"The demise of the Immortal Boat is too terrible. I cannot speak of it to anyone, not even my master. I must absolutely not let the Dao Proving Academy, an organization that will be completely destroyed in future conflicts, know about it. Otherwise, no one can guarantee that they won't take even more extreme actions, or even cause the Immortal Boat to be destroyed prematurely."

Zhao Xian paced back and forth in his room, his mind racing. Ever since he had had that great dream, he seemed to feel that his thinking had become much more flexible.

"My master was right, the Immortal Boat must have, and can only have, one helmsman. But the conflict between the Immortal Severing Tower and the Immortal Pivot Court is irreconcilable. If we let them continue their internal strife, the destruction of the Immortal Boat is inevitable."

"The best method is to cut the Gordian knot and allow one side to gain an overwhelming advantage in a short period."

Zhao Xian's eyes flashed. "Although the memories of some people and events in the dream have become blurred, the memories of future cultivation methods and secret arts are very clear. With the advantage of decades of advanced information, I am confident in helping one side unify the Immortal Boat. As for who to help..."

After slowly recalling the actions of the two major organizations in his dream and their governing philosophies, Zhao Xian ultimately decided to choose the Immortal Severing Tower.

"The Immortal Severing Tower is just beginning to show its strength, and they are in great need of people. As long as I show a little talent, I can easily infiltrate it."

"My current strength is still too weak, and I need to improve as quickly as possible. Fortunately, I now have too many wondrous cultivation methods in my mind."

"As long as I have enough resources, breaking through two major realms within a year is not a problem."

Zhao Xian closed his eyes and meditated, ready to shock the Dao Proving Academy once he emerged from seclusion.

He did not notice that beside him, a faint, almost imperceptible figure was gazing at him.

This figure, of course, was Li Fan's separated consciousness.

"Without the restriction of not being able to cultivate multiple daos simultaneously, countless cultivation methods that I have seen in the past can exert their greatest value here."

"Compared to the perilous Xuanhuang Realm, this Immortal Boat is truly a paradise."

Constrained everywhere in the Xuanhuang Realm, Li Fan, now on the Profound Immortal Boat, was causing trouble, and conversely, he felt an exhilarating sense of being able to fully utilize his profound techniques.

...

After traversing more than half the starry sea, encountering the Profound Immortal Boat civilization hidden in the Sea of Relics, and finally finding a breakthrough and going undercover.

The entire process, from start to finish, took the Holy Embryo Li Fan about a year.

And due to the different flow of time in various regions of the starry sea, in the Xuanhuang Realm, less than half a year had actually passed.

In half a year, the Myriad Immortals Alliance had recovered from the great upheaval in the Xuanhuang Realm that day.

The distorted white mist barrier between heaven and earth had all returned to its original state.

The memories of the cultivators regarding that catastrophe were also gradually becoming blurred. Everything seemed to have returned to the starting point.

And in the affiliated minor world of the Xuanhuang Realm, the Holy Dynasty of Great Start, the changes over the past half-year could be described as changing with each passing day.

[Changing with each passing day] was not just an adjective. It was a true spectacle in the sky of the Holy Dynasty of Great Start, capable of rivaling the sun and moon.

Centered around five blurry halos, there were more and more shining stars.

They were clearly visible even during the day.

And at night, they completely overshadowed the original starlight of Great Start.

Folk legends said that the five circles symbolized the five personal disciples of His Majesty the Holy Emperor.

And the stars appearing around the circles represented the many brilliant talents emerging in Great Start.

This rumor was not without basis, but had sufficient grounds.

Just three days prior, all the citizens of Great Start witnessed a shining star near the celestial circle suddenly erupt with a light a thousand times brighter than usual.

It then transformed into a beam of light that shot straight towards the Holy Emperor's throne in the Sacred Capital.

The anomaly lasted for nearly half a day before the light pillar that pierced through heaven and earth finally dissipated.

After this, people were astonished to find that the star in the sky had also disappeared, descending to the mortal world. If the Holy Emperor's disciples could cause such a magnificent phenomenon, what about the Holy Emperor himself?

Following the Holy Emperor's martial arts display half a year prior, which had caused world upheaval, people once again engaged in discussions and speculations about the Holy Emperor's immense power. Of course, this was done in private.

Throughout the Holy Dynasty of Great Start, worship and trust in the Holy Emperor had reached a terrifying level of unanimity.

And at this moment, the seemingly peerless Holy Emperor in the hearts of the Great Start citizens was frowning, staring at a white-haired youth sitting cross-legged with his eyes closed before him.

Contrary to the folk legends, after the beam of light, said to be the manifestation of a general, descended from the heavens three days ago, Li Ping, the Holy Emperor, not only felt no joy.

Instead, due to his astonishment, he became angry and vigilant.

This was because he had immediately discovered the true nature of the light beam: an outer large cave-heaven, one of the five great cave-heavens, which had been painstakingly moved by Daoist Baihua outside the minor world of Great Start to drag the world through the void at high speed...

It had exploded.

And the culprit was within Great Start, within the Sacred Capital!

However, Li Ping had been completely unaware of this matter before! How could Li Ping, who considered himself the Holy Emperor by destiny, accept this?

In the past half-year, while the Myriad Immortals Alliance was busy quelling disasters and pacifying the people, Daoist Baihua had worked day and night without rest, moving a number of cave-heavens from the Xuanhuang Realm to this place.

Perhaps it was due to the shock of the starry sea's might on the Xuanhuang Realm that Daoist Baihua's work of moving these cave-heavens became much easier. Even so, working tirelessly for half a year had left Baihua nearly exhausted. Unable to persist, she had gone into seclusion in the Five Elements Cave-Heaven to recuperate.

Unexpectedly, the disaster of a cave-heaven being blown up had occurred.

Daoist Baihua's expression was extremely grim. Ignoring her injuries, she immediately rushed out of the Five Elements Cave-Heaven.

At this moment, Li Fan had also pinpointed the culprit.

Before he could make a move, a sentence from Senior Yin turned his shock into joy and completely dissolved his anger!

"Someone..."

"Has successfully cultivated the [Primordial Golden Core]!"

Even the Holy Emperor, at the moment he heard Senior Yin's words, could not help but be deeply shaken and momentarily lose his composure.

The Primordial Golden Core, as the realm after [My Foundation], was a part of the new new law and a crucial component of Li Ping's plan to subvert the Heavenly Venerate system.

This first step was particularly difficult to take. Once taken, it would inevitably bring about many unimaginable changes.

When Li Ping summoned Senior Yin to Great Start to research the new new law, he had not held high expectations in his heart. It was entirely a trial-and-error approach.

After all, the Heavenly Venerate's new law system had stood firm for millennia.

It was not so easy to destroy its foundation.

Li Ping had envisioned the derivation of the new new law to take at least ten or a hundred years.

He had not expected that in just over half a year, Senior Yin would give him such a great surprise.

At the same time, Li Fan's heart was filled with doubt and vigilance.

Without asking any questions, his gaze shifted from the black-haired youth to Senior Yin, awaiting his explanation.

Senior Yin ignored Li Ping and simply gazed at the black-haired youth who was cultivating with admiration.

"The aura of the world..."

Li Ping's gaze slightly furrowed.

The black-haired youth gave him a strange feeling.

He was indeed one of the several children who had cultivated based on "me," and he had indeed broken through his realm.

His erratic and elusive strength fluctuations made Li Ping find him somewhat difficult to fathom.

However, the youth's life force was too weak.

It was not at all like the vigorous vitality of someone who had broken through a realm, but rather like a candle flame in the wind, precarious.

It seemed as if his life would extinguish in the next second.

After a long while, seeing the look of pain on the black-haired youth's face, Senior Yin sighed, "To seize the creation of the world with one's own body..."

"How difficult it is! Although the Primordial Golden Core has been achieved, one suffers backlash. If one cannot withstand it, there is only the path of death and annihilation."

Li Ping automatically skipped the latter half of the sentence, focusing his attention on the first part of Senior Yin's words.

"To seize the creation of the world with one's own body? Is this the key to cultivating the Primordial Golden Core?" Li Ping asked.

Senior Yin was silent for a moment before replying, "You have seen the situation. It is indeed a breakthrough, but the risk involved is almost a certain death..."

"The new new law should not follow such a path."

Senior Yin recounted to Li Fan the process of comprehending the Primordial Golden Core through this fortuitous encounter.

"What is Primordial?"

"To build my foundation is to build a cultivation foundation with my complete self. When a person is in the world, if they wish to advance further, they must seek answers from the world and the heavens."

"To seize the creation of the world with one's own body is not to directly devour heaven and earth like the old new law..."

"Although the actual effect is almost the same." Senior Yin suddenly said, then abruptly stopped.

He looked up at the afterimage of the cave-heaven that had disappeared in the sky before continuing, "To achieve Primordial is not to seize specific matter or energy, but to seize the 'creation' of the world."

"There are fifty Great Daos, and the heavens derive forty-nine. Because of the one that escapes, the world has additional variables, and thus heaven and earth remain infinitely vital after countless years."

"But if that 'one' that escapes is taken away..."

"Those light beams in the world just now were their fate."

"Of course, part of it was also due to my intervention. If there had been no external interference, the changes would have taken nearly a century to manifest. I was trying to help this child. Otherwise, with the body of Foundation Establishment, attempting to covet heaven and earth, even if it were just a cave-heaven, one's consciousness would be lost in the struggle within the world of the cave-heaven." Senior Yin glanced at Li Ping, showing no intention of apologizing.

"To think of what I cannot think of, this child is truly remarkable."

...

From Senior Yin's words, Li Ping faintly understood the so-called [Primordial Golden Core].

As the lord of the Great Start world, and having observed and interacted with many minor worlds up close, he could better understand Senior Yin's meaning.

"The world is like a human body. This idea of seizing the creation of the world to achieve one's own Primordial Golden Core is indeed feasible."

"But..."

Li Ping pondered for a moment, then secretly shook his head and rejected it.

"This step is too ambitious!"

"To swallow the world with a human body. Even I might not be able to achieve it."

"The new new law should be a common path that everyone can cultivate."

While Li Ping was conversing with Senior Yin, the black-haired youth who had comprehended a path to the [Primordial Golden Core] experienced a rapid decline in his vital signs. Ultimately, he completely lost the aura of a living being.

Yet, he had not died.

The black-haired youth still sat there quietly, his physical and spiritual power circulating spontaneously.

Vast and mysterious.

"What a pity, he couldn't hold on and became completely assimilated with the consciousness of the cave-heaven, losing himself," Senior Yin sighed deeply, his face filled with regret.

"His original strength was too weak, and the target he chose wasn't quite appropriate. If he had chosen the slightly smaller cave-heaven next to it, he might have possibly survived."

Li Ping's gaze also fixed on the black-haired youth, not leaving for a long time.

"What is his name?"

"Qu Wentian."

"A good name. But I still have one thing I don't understand," Li Ping's voice echoed in the spacious, empty secret chamber. "With the Foundation Establishment realm, can one truly seize the creation of a cave-heaven? That vanished cave-heaven was named [Abyssal Desolation]. Although it doesn't look large from the perspective of the Great Start, the scale of the Abyssal Desolation is equivalent to almost half of the Great Start's minor worlds..."

"Perhaps this kid has extraordinary talent." After a long silence, Senior Yin couldn't come up with an explanation and could only reply this way.

"You must understand that people are different. Some things that seem impossible to us are merely trivial to others. Although Qu Wentian's path to the [Primordial Golden Core] is destined to be walked by only a very small number of people, it has given me inspiration."

Senior Yin looked at Li Ping, his expression turning solemn. "You are right. To completely dismantle the dominance of the transmitted law's new system, our newer system must not be a path for the few or a difficult one."

"Back then, the cultivation path of the transmitted law was able to spread like a prairie fire throughout the entire Xuanhuang in an instant. Even under the suppression of the Ten Sects, it continued to flourish and eventually replaced the old ways. Wasn't it precisely because it had almost no threshold? The fact that everyone could cultivate is the inherent characteristic that the newer system should possess."

"I've been thinking, Qu Wentian was able to break through realms based on [Foundation Establishment with My Own Body] because he seized the creation of the cave-heaven world. Conversely, the creation of the world should be the most critical factor for the [Primordial Golden Core]."

Senior Yin's speech became faster and faster, his expression becoming somewhat excited.

"Without external dependencies, achievable by everyone, and the creation of the world..."

"Integrating these three necessary conditions allows us to glimpse the true ideal state of the Primordial Golden Core!"

Senior Yin waved his hand, and illusory images of children's naive faces appeared before the two of them.

"Seizing the creation of the world is not for the sake of creation itself, but for the evolution of creation. The creation of the world, to ordinary people, is an unfathomably profound and difficult existence. They can only forcefully possess it through [devouring], transforming it into a part of themselves, and then comprehending it slowly."

"But if there were a supremely wise teacher, to guide them personally, meticulously explaining their understanding of the world's creation in an incredibly detailed manner..."

"I believe that even a naive child can comprehend its path!" Senior Yin stated with certainty.

Seeing Li Ping's somewhat disbelieving gaze, he said, "The method of [Foundation Establishment with My Own Body], how complicated and unimaginable it appears to outsiders! But to the children I teach, who have been exposed to it since childhood and in whose perception there is only this one method of cultivation in the world, it is not that difficult to learn. Especially after the first person successfully achieved [Foundation Establishment with My Own Body], it was as if a bottleneck was broken, and successful ones began to appear one after another."

"[Foundation Establishment with My Own Body] is like this, and so is [Primordial Golden Core]."

"Moreover, the newer system should vary from person to person. Emulating the transformation of the world within one's own body to achieve the Primordial Golden Core may not necessarily require the pursuit of the absolute extreme. After all, worlds vary in size, and cultivators' innate talents and potentials also differ. Fully unleashing one's own potential is already sufficient..."

"The only requirement is to find such a [Supremely Wise Teacher]. Not only must they have reached the pinnacle of understanding the world themselves, but they must also be willing to share their insights with others patiently and without reservation..."

As Senior Yin spoke, he looked at the destined Holy Emperor before him.

"Although I am willing to be a teacher to the world, alas..." Li Ping paused slightly.

"My own understanding of the Way of the World is insufficient, so how can I teach others?"

"I think in the entire Xuanhuang world, the only one qualified to be this teacher is probably the Transmitted Law Celestial Venerable himself! And you want the Transmitted Law to rebel against himself?"

"Your [Primordial Golden Core] path still requires careful consideration." Senior Yin was also unable to refute, a flicker of unwillingness and confusion flashing in his eyes.

Li Ping came with high spirits but left disheartened.

Leaving Senior Yin in his place, he returned alone.

He pacified the Hundred Flowers Daoist, who had rushed over, mistakenly believing the Xuanhuang world was under attack by the Myriad Immortals Alliance and was searching for enemies.

And he rewarded her with some [Golden Origin Energy] as a commendation.

As a crystallization of pure cultivation, Golden Origin Energy was a great tonic for the pure energy body of Hundred Flowers.

Hundred Flowers first expressed her gratitude, then solemnly absorbed it.

"Eh? The one you gave this time, Daoist..."

After consuming the Golden Origin Energy, before Hundred Flowers Daoist could finish a complete sentence, she exclaimed in disbelief.

"Why is it so dense?"

"It's even like..."

"Origin Essence?!"

Hundred Flowers Daoist looked at Li Ping with utter shock.

Her luminous body became even more radiant and solidified at a speed visible to the naked eye.

Years of hidden injuries were slowly healed. Even the imperceptible connection to the fishing pond, which had persisted even after her capture and escape, seemed to become negligible under the scouring of the Golden Origin Energy.

Correspondingly, Hundred Flowers Daoist looked at the faceless Holy Emperor before her; his unfathomably deep figure was slowly imprinted in her heart.

Li Ping did not explain anything, leaving Hundred Flowers with a trace of extreme mystery.

"He, has he already approached the True Immortal realm this closely?"

"How is that possible?"

Hundred Flowers was immensely horrified, but the Golden Origin Energy surging within her, far surpassing mortal power, seemed to be the best evidence for her conjecture.

...

As a clone, Li Ping's realm had naturally not surpassed that of his main body yet.

He was still at the Nascent Soul realm, and the vast majority of his combat power came from the destiny of the Holy Dynasty's Great Start. His own strength was pitifully weak.

The reason he could create Golden Origin Energy essence that was infinitely close to Origin Essence was precisely thanks to a group of special people.

Beneath the Holy Emperor's throne, deep underground.

It was dark, without a trace of sunlight.

Yet, here, a group of people lived unaffected.

Every day, besides their normal routines, their most important task was to pray before the stone statue of the Holy Emperor.

The sound of devout prayers echoed in the underground chamber, like ancient, mysterious songs. This group of people were, of course, the You clan. With the combined efforts of Li Ping's disciples, the vast majority of the You clan had been captured in the Great Start's minor world. Li Ping knew that the entity behind the Sea of Darkness did not mind its believers having other faiths. Thus, through a combination of threats, inducements, and finally, a demonstration of coexistence in front of the entire You clan, these You people quickly adapted to their new lives. In fact, some of their faith in the Holy Emperor became even firmer and more fervent than their faith in the Sea of Darkness. After all, the Sea of Darkness had not shown any divine miracles during their time of peril and near extinction. However, the Holy Emperor of Destiny truly distributed large amounts of resources to them periodically.

In the darkness, listening to the unified chanting of the You clan, Li Ping felt specks of golden Origin Energy being generated within his body. "Just a hundred You clan members, and the faith they condense is more than all the citizens of Great Start combined." "What secrets are hidden within the You clan..." Li Ping had already sent the corpses of some dissenting You clan members to Yin Shangren for research. "It just so happens that his research on the new law has hit a bottleneck. Changing the research topic might spark some unexpected inspirations." Of course, Li Ping wasn't particularly concerned about the true reason behind the You clan's special physique. The cause was irrelevant, as long as it could be used by him.

His body flickered, and Li Ping moved to another sealed area near this prayer space. "Xuanba, how is the research progressing? Can the transplanted flesh and blood promote the fertility of the You clan?" Wang Xuanba, who had been intently staring forward, quickly retracted his gaze upon hearing his master's arrival. He bowed respectfully and then reported, "After several experiments, I have found the optimal combination of exotic beast flesh and blood. I have named it the **Life Origin Embryo**. With sufficient male and female Origin Essences, it can cultivate a large number of younglings at an extremely terrifying rate. However..." "After all, these younglings are not gestated within a mother's body. They are born with inherent deficiencies, extremely weak, and their expected lifespan will likely not be long," Wang Xuanba stated cautiously.

Unlike his previous honest and strong youthful appearance, Wang Xuanba was now gaunt. Under Li Ping's careful tutelage, and after personally devouring vast amounts of exotic beast flesh and blood and mastering many exotic beast abilities, his understanding of exotic beasts now even surpassed Li Ping's. Upon learning that his master was troubled by the You clan's low fertility rate, he volunteered to alleviate his master's worries. Thus, he actually created such a stunning artifact as the **Life Origin Embryo**. It was entirely composed of pink, writhing exotic beast flesh and blood, with enclosed chambers inside. Countless tubes connected these chambers to the embryo's main body, supplying nutrients for the cultivated offspring while allowing the Life Origin Embryo to absorb the traits of the numerous offspring it cultivated. "This is a win-win process. Each new offspring cultivated makes it smarter and stronger. Although this progress is minuscule, it can be accumulated in quantity to achieve transformation within the expected timeframe. If my predictions are correct, the Life Origin Embryo may eventually be able to create life on its own without needing male and female Origin Essences, as long as it has sufficient energy."

When discussing exotic beasts, even in front of his own master, Wang Xuanba's tone was full of confidence. Li Ping's gaze pierced the darkness, looking at the distant, constantly pulsating, seemingly breathing giant "lump of flesh." "I only need a quantity that can work for me simultaneously. As for their lifespan..." "We can create more when they die," the Holy Emperor's words were filled with coldness, and Wang Xuanba felt no unusual emotions upon hearing them. After all, in his eyes, these headless You clan members were no different from those exotic beasts; they were not human at all.

"Everything here needs to be kept strictly confidential. Even from your senior and junior brothers," Li Ping said again. "Your disciple understands," Wang Xuanba replied solemnly. After Li Ping left, he resumed his research. Compared to the complexities of the outside world, he still preferred these pure and simple matters. In just a few years, the life trajectory of the once robust young man from below Mount Jie Li had changed so drastically. However, among Li Ping's disciples, Wang Xuanba's change was not the most significant. Wang Xuanba's actions still faintly echoed the shadow of his former self. Completely different, like a changed person, was Li Ping's fifth disciple, Ouyang Tian. After following his father to Great Start and being accepted as a personal disciple by Li Ping, he transformed from his previous taciturn, wary, and unconfident self into the spirited youth he was today. He acted decisively and looked down upon all things. Although he was the youngest among the disciples, in terms of true strength, he surpassed them all. In the entire Great Start, perhaps no one besides Li Ping could defeat him. Even if Li Ping were to intervene, it would not be easy to subdue Ouyang Tian without using some secret techniques or divine abilities.

In addition to the two rare treasures Ouyang Tian was born with, the Kun Gan Bone Hand and the Ten Thousand Deaths Ledger, not long ago, Ouyang Tian, guided by Li Ping, fished up the Seven-Colored Divine Light from the fishing pond. With the Seven-Colored Divine Light protecting him, along with the Kun Gan Bone Hand and the Ten Thousand Deaths Ledger's heaven-defying escape abilities, Ouyang Tian's survivability was even greater than most cultivators at the Dao Integration realm in the Xuanhuang Realm. After effortlessly suppressing several minor worlds in a few battles, this young man became increasingly arrogant. Fortunately, with his father and Li Ping keeping him in check, he didn't do anything out of line. Previously, when he worked with Wang Xuanba to capture the You clan, he became interested in Wang Xuanba's uncanny exotic beast abilities. He then requested the cultivation method for the **Creation Furnace Technique** from Li Ping and had been diligently cultivating it during this time.

Li Ping was not worried about Ouyang Tian losing control. Before any signs of him losing control appeared, he would decisively intervene. The golden Origin Energy condensed by the You clan had been silently injected into the bodies of various key figures in Great Start. This power, infinitely close to true immortal strength, was undetectable by these so-called geniuses. Only the ancient cultivator from the ancient cultivation world, Bai Hua, could understand its origins. "Since they have fallen into my net, they can only serve me to the death." "After all, every gift has already been priced." With the pure golden Origin Energy as his trump card, he could now begin to plan for the invasion of the Xuanhuang Realm.

Chapter 1192: A Thousand Years of Souls Returning Home

Even though the Holy Dynasty of Great Start's paper strength had expanded rapidly, it was still far from being able to contend with the Myriad Immortal Alliance or the Five Elders Society at this stage.

Therefore, the initial phase of the plan still focused on infiltration and erosion.

During the great upheaval in the Profound Yellow Realm over half a year ago, the Immortal Alliance had lost quite a few low-level cultivators. Thus, rumors had already begun to circulate through unofficial channels that the Immortal Alliance would be conducting a certain degree of expanded recruitment in the upcoming entry examination.

Li Ping had already selected a group of promising individuals, intending to use this opportunity to send them into the Myriad Immortal Alliance.

Although low-level cultivators appeared insignificant, they could slowly corrode the internal rule of the Immortal Alliance like woodworms. Moreover, as time passed and their cultivation and contributions grew, their positions would also rise, leading to greater harm and impact.

The investment cost was extremely low, yet the effect was exceptionally good. The more, the better.

"With the existence of the golden Origin Energy net, not only can they successfully infiltrate the Immortal Alliance, but they can also be firmly controlled from start to finish."

"Information and even supplies can be exchanged without meeting in reality."

"This method of contact offers far superior concealment and security compared to the Myriad Immortal Alliance and the Five Elders Society, making it extremely difficult for them to discover."

In addition to corrupting the Myriad Immortal Alliance from within, reducing its potential was also a necessary concurrent action.

"The top prodigies of cultivation in the Profound Yellow Realm for the next hundred years must all be brought under control. If they cannot be used by me, they should be eliminated as soon as possible."

"We can even stir up trouble and frame the Five Elders Society for assassination attempts."

"I will sit on the mountaintop and watch the tigers fight..."

While weakening the Myriad Immortal Alliance through various means, Li Ping certainly would not slow down the development of the Holy Dynasty of Great Start.

Once the number of You clan members reached a certain scale and sufficient pure golden Origin Energy was collected, Li Ping would use it to remodel the Grand Array of All Spirits of Heaven and Earth.

This would truly transform the small world of Great Start into an impregnable fortress, hidden and floating in the void.

"I can sense that since cultivators like Shangren Yin and Daoxi Ou, the proud talents of the Profound Yellow Realm, came to the small world of Great Start to serve me, the Holy Dynasty's aura, which had already entered a bottleneck, has unexpectedly ushered in the possibility of further breakthroughs."

"This is the principle of "one prospers, another declines." I have forcibly devoured the luck that originally belonged to the Myriad Immortal Alliance."

"However, it is still not enough to fully satisfy the conditions for promotion."

"Besides devouring luck from the outside, which requires time to accumulate, the very status of the small world itself is also a limiting factor. Perhaps it is time to consider upgrading the small world."

With a thought, Li Ping returned to the Holy Emperor's throne.

Before long, Sun Erlang, enveloped in an aura of killing intent, appeared before him.

The brave youth of yesteryear had grown into a terrifying killing god in the Holy Dynasty of Great Start, one that made people tremble.

He commanded the Holy Dynasty's imperial guards and campaigned in various realms. Over the years, countless beings from other small worlds had met their demise under Sun Erlang's blade.

"Greetings, Master!" Sun Erlang knelt on one knee.

"What is the progress of the construction of the Myriad Spirits Array of All Realms?" Li Ping asked.

"Eleven have been completed, and six are still under construction," Sun Erlang replied concisely, simultaneously transmitting the specific information via divine sense.

"For a period of time recently, halt your conquests. We have expanded too quickly and need to digest it properly. In those small worlds, anyone harboring thoughts of resistance shall be killed without mercy. I do not wish for the "backyard to catch fire" when we officially go to war with the Myriad Immortal Alliance."

The implication in Li Ping's words stirred Sun Erlang.

Even though he knew his master harbored grand ambitions, this was the first time he had clearly expressed his plan to conquer the Myriad Immortal Alliance.

This led Sun Erlang, who had found conquering those small worlds as easy as slicing vegetables and felt no pressure, even a sense of boredom, to become instantly excited.

Li Ping, of course, saw through Sun Erlang's thoughts at a glance.

"Seeing too many sheep, one might think the world is full of them. Not to mention the Myriad Immortal Alliance, even some of the hidden small worlds within the Profound Yellow Realm are not comparable to our current Holy Dynasty of Great Start," Li Ping said indifferently, then pointed towards Sun Erlang.

"You will go to this place. It is the hidden abode of the ancient Taiyan Sect. See if you can persuade them to join our alliance."

"Taiyan Sect..." Sun Erlang's gaze flickered. "Go. There is something special about that place, and you will know when you get there. Do not force it. My only goal is for you to temper your arrogance."

Unlike the cultivation strategy for Ou Shangtian, when Sun Erlang's path showed a slight deviation, Li Ping chose to actively guide him back.

Besides the deeper emotional bond with Sun Erlang, Li Ping also needed a powerful senior disciple to suppress all the other disciples.

Therefore, he inevitably had to put in more effort to nurture him.

"I hope this boy gains something from his visit to the Taiyan Sect."

Li Ping thought this as he sat on the Holy Emperor's throne.

Meanwhile, Sun Erlang followed the Holy Emperor's instructions and arrived at the tomb of Yi Xing.

After collecting Yi Xing's remains and the scattered white papers on the ground, Sun Erlang headed directly to his destination.

"I didn't expect there to be such an ancient cultivator's tomb within Great Start. I wonder what use these papers my teacher specifically asked me to collect are." On the way, Sun Erlang studied them carefully but could not discover any profound mysteries within.

Pushing aside his confusion, he soon arrived at his destination.

Taihua Prefecture, Taiyuan Mountain.

"Master said the entrance to the Taiyan Sect is hidden within this mountain?"

After searching around, he found no trace of a spatial portal.

Sun Erlang couldn't help but feel troubled.

If he used brute force, it wouldn't be impossible to carve a path through the mountain. However, he was here as a persuasive envoy, to convince them to join the Holy Dynasty's alliance. To rashly destroy someone's sect's residence...

After thinking about it, Sun Erlang decided against acting rashly.

On Taiyuan Mountain, he chose a place with good Feng Shui.

He dug a pit and then took out Yi Xing's skeletal remains.

Just as he was about to prepare to bury them...

A figure suddenly appeared behind Sun Erlang.

"They've indeed come!" Sun Erlang thought to himself.

However, he feigned a look of facing a formidable enemy: "Who's there?!"

The figure did not respond to Sun Erlang, merely gazing intently at Yi Xing's remains.

As if lost in some kind of memory, they remained motionless for a long time.

Sun Erlang was not a reckless brute and naturally did not disturb this figure who appeared to possess unfathomable strength.

He simply waited patiently.

"If Big Brother waited a few more years, perhaps everything would have been different."

After a long while, the figure sighed and waved a sleeve towards Yi Xing.

Yi Xing's skeletal remains instantly vanished. The figure then turned to look at Sun Erlang.

"Young sir, why have you come?"
