Sun Erlang looked at the face before him, which seemed to be around his own age. After a moment's hesitation, he truthfully explained his purpose.

There might be another chapter around 12:30 AM...

"Great Qi..."

The cultivator from the Taiyan Sect narrowed his eyes, as if images were flashing rapidly within them.

"Great Xuan?"

"Huh?"

He seemed to see something that made his tone turn surprised. He then looked at Sun Erlang, "Only a few years, and there's already such a big deviation? What's going on?"

Sun Erlang was confused, not understanding what the other person was talking about.

"Interesting, follow me," the Taiyan Sect cultivator said after examining Sun Erlang carefully.

With that, his figure instantly became transparent.

A phantom, silver road appeared beneath his feet, leading directly into the mountain.

Sun Erlang transformed into a beam of light and closely followed.

As they entered the mountain, the silver road vanished.

Even the pit that Sun Erlang had dug on Tai Xuan Mountain was silently restored.

"My name is Yi Shu. The skeleton you brought back was my clan brother."

As they walked, the Taiyan Sect disciple spoke to Sun Erlang.

"Back then, when dual cultivation of powers and the miasma between immortals and mortals struck, my clan brother made a wise retreat, hiding in a mortal world to escape disaster. Although he lost his chance at the immortal path, he still achieved the position of mortal emperor. You could say it was fate."

"We haven't seen each other for thousands of years. To meet again in such circumstances. Although we had already anticipated this when we parted, however..."

"What a twist of fate!"

"Simulated illusions are different from reality!"

Yi Shu sighed lightly and fell silent.

"Simulation? Reality?" Sun Erlang keenly caught the two keywords in Yi Shu's words.

"This Taiyan Sect was renowned throughout the world in ancient times for its divination techniques. What he called simulation and deviation, could it be the future they predicted?"

They continued to descend deep underground. When they saw scenery again, they were already high above the sky.

The azure sky was as clear as blue jade, with fertile farmland stretching for thousands of miles below.

Sun Erlang could clearly sense the presence of a large number of mortals.

Meanwhile, Yi Shu was flying forward through the air.

Sun Erlang quickly followed, a sudden doubt arising in his heart.

Because after entering this small world, Yi Shu seemed to have undergone some subtle changes.

However, Sun Erlang couldn't pinpoint the change for the moment.

"I don't sense any danger, and my master definitely wouldn't harm me..." Sun Erlang suppressed the strangeness in his heart and continued to follow.

Not long after, a floating city suddenly appeared in Sun Erlang's previously empty field of vision.

The city was enclosed by a layer of transparent crystal. It was precisely because of this crystal barrier that Sun Erlang hadn't noticed this celestial city before.

"They really have some skills. To completely isolate such a large city," Sun Erlang mused to himself.

Yi Shu finally spoke again, "The Tai Xuan Realm was borrowed by our Taiyan Sect. To separate immortals and mortals, and to avoid disturbing the mortals of this world, we built this crystal barrier."

Sun Erlang didn't quite agree with Yi Shu's statement about disturbing mortals.

However, he didn't voice his disagreement and merely nodded slightly.

Passing through the transparent crystal barrier, they officially entered the Taiyan Sect.

The moment his feet touched the ground, Sun Erlang suddenly felt as if countless pairs of eyes were staring at him.

Among them were the auras of powerful cultivators who had reached the Dao Integration stage.

Sun Erlang was inwardly alarmed, "The Taiyan Sect's strength is preserved incredibly well. There are so many cultivators here? How did they deal with the rule against dual cultivation of powers?"

Deeper within the floating city, Sun Erlang's strange feeling intensified.

"It's too quiet here. It doesn't feel like a normal, vibrant city at all."

"And..."

Sun Erlang paused.

He finally understood the source of the abnormality in his heart.

The cultivators of the Taiyan Sect here were like the tree people in the Spirit Wood Realm; though they had different faces, they all emitted the same aura.

It was as if they were countless bodies of the same person!

Sun Erlang was surprised but remained calm, not indulging in his own wild thoughts. He directly asked, "Senior Yi, your Taiyan Sect..."

Yi Shu seemed to have noticed Sun Erlang's confusion and smiled, "You'll know everything when you meet Senior Brother Chen later. However, young sir, please rest assured, our Taiyan Sect has always been clear about debts of gratitude and grudges. You returned the remains of our disciples, which is a merit to our sect."

"Although the alliance you spoke of may not be realized, your own safety is absolutely not a concern."

Sun Erlang remained noncommittal, swallowing the words he was about to say.

He followed Yi Shu to the center of the suspended city, into a transparent blue crystal building.

It felt as if he saw countless versions of himself entering simultaneously. When Sun Erlang came to his senses from the illusion, a handsome man with hair reaching his waist stood before him.

"Senior Brother Chen," Yi Shu cupped his fists.

"Yi Xing also went to the Great Xuan small world on a sect mission. Back then, due to his aptitude, he was unable to enter the inner sect for cultivation and always harbored resentment..."

"Now that times have changed, inner sect, outer sect, it's all a joke. Let Yi Xing return."

Senior Brother Chen, Chen Tianhai of the Taiyan Sect whom Li Fan had met before, said in a calm tone.

"Thank you, Senior Brother," Yi Shu bowed respectfully.

Then his body blurred, turning into blue starlight and dissipating.

Chen Tianhai then turned to look at Sun Erlang.

With earth-shattering words, he said, "According to the original trajectory, after repeatedly seeking immortality at Jie Li Mountain and failing, you, Sun Erlang, would have settled down, married, and had children. Seven years later, dissatisfied with the excessive demands of the new prefect, you would have senselessly killed someone. Then, you would have joined forces with Wang Xuan, occupied a mountain, and become a king, causing havoc in the region."

"You would have wreaked havoc for more than ten years, and finally would have been wiped out by the imperial army. You and Wang Xuan would have fought to the death and refused to surrender, ultimately being dismembered by a thousand blades."

Sun Erlang raised an eyebrow as he listened to the "destiny" the other person spoke of.

"But now, everything is different."

"Your future..."

Chen Tianhai's figure became blurred and azure.

However, after a moment, he returned to his original form.

"Marvelous! Beyond the variables!"

"Holy Dynasty Qi, is it..." A strange light flickered in Chen Tianhai's eyes.

"To cause such a large deviation in just a few years..."

He mumbled, as if discovering something incredibly exciting.

"Do you know the origin of your master?" Chen Tianhai asked.

Sun Erlang merely looked at Chen Tianhai.

"That's right, let alone you don't know. Even if you did, you probably wouldn't say it, or couldn't say it," Chen Tianhai gave a knowing smile.

Sun Erlang suddenly felt uncomfortable.

"Huh, wait, the cultivation technique you're practicing..." Chen Tianhai, who had been observing Sun Erlang, suddenly changed his tone, sounding surprised and uncertain.

"Is it the Divine Wood Sect's [Mountain Sitting Art]?"

"Perhaps your master was once a member of the Divine Wood Sect?" Chen Tianhai asked, sounding both surprised and uncertain.

"Mountain Sitting Art?" Hearing these three words, Sun Erlang's heart stirred slightly, and a sense of familiarity arose within him.

"No, no," Chen Tianhai shook his head himself before Sun Erlang could answer. "The aura is just somewhat similar."

"Moreover, it is said that the Mountain Sitting Art is a cultivation technique practiced by that divine wood of the Divine Wood Sect in the past, exchanging time for cultivation. For ordinary cultivators, it is extremely arduous and progresses very slowly. Young master, you have already reached the Nascent Soul stage at such a young age, which clearly doesn't match," Chen Tianhai said with a self-deprecating smile, looking at Sun Erlang, his curiosity growing even more intense.

"Junior indeed does not practice any so-called Mountain Sitting Art, but rather a profound technique personally passed down by my master. The main reason for my rapid cultivation is this profound technique," Sun Erlang said in a deep voice.

"Alright, then perhaps I was mistaken," Chen Tianhai no longer argued and let the matter drop.

"Senior, was this Divine Wood Sect one of the ten immortal sects of that era?" Although he had clarified the origin of his cultivation technique, Sun Erlang was still a little curious about the Mountain Sitting Art and thus directly asked.

Sun Erlang found that this Taiyan Sect was very different from the ancient immortal sects with their strict rules that he had imagined. There was almost no distinction between superiors and inferiors, and everyone affectionately called him "young master" despite his youth and being an outsider. While he didn't know the reason for such an atmosphere, it was undoubtedly a good thing for Sun Erlang, so he decided to follow suit.

Chen Tianhai answered all his questions and, after inviting Sun Erlang to sit, said, "The Divine Wood Sect is even older than our Ten Immortal Sects."

"Those from the same era as the Divine Wood Sect were the Desolate God Sect, the Samsara Sect, and other ancient immortal sects that have long since perished. Before the immortal path was severed, some of them had already completely disappeared for various reasons. The Divine Wood Sect is said to have gotten its name from a divine wood from outside the heavens within its sect. This divine wood was supposedly bestowed by the immortal realm. After taking root in the Profound Yellow Realm, it displayed all sorts of incredible divine abilities. However, it was precisely because of this divine wood that it incurred the displeasure of the [Geng Huan Heng Yuan]. This ultimately led to its downfall. Indeed, fortune and disaster are unpredictable."

"The meaning of these five characters [Geng Huan Heng Yuan] is [that which has existed since primordial times and will continue to exist eternally. Standing on the River of Life, it supports the heavens like a wall]. It is an ancient native tree that has coexisted with heaven and earth since the creation of the Profound Yellow Realm, and it even holds the key to eternal life."

"As the saying goes, one mountain cannot house two tigers. The growing power of this divine wood from outside the heavens was bound to pose a threat to it. Thus came the destruction of the Divine Wood Sect..."

Chen Tianhai casually recounted these ancient tales. Since embarking on his cultivation path, Sun Erlang had only been involved in cultivation and killing. This was the first time he had the good fortune to learn about these ancient secrets, and he listened with great interest.

"These Desolate God Sect and Divine Wood Sect, just from their names, seem different from other sects," Sun Erlang exclaimed.

Chen Tianhai chuckled, "Naturally. These are sects that were born since the creation of the Profound Yellow Realm and have had countless ties to the immortal realm. When the immortal realm existed, their status was naturally unshakeable. However, if the immortal realm experienced great changes and the immortal path was severed, they would naturally no longer flourish."

Sun Erlang nodded repeatedly as he listened.

"Young master, do you know the origin of our Taiyan Sect?" Chen Tianhai suddenly changed the subject and asked.

"Junior does not know," Sun Erlang replied honestly.

"Our Taiyan Sect is directly descended from true immortals, having received the [Nine Scrolls of Derivative Heaven] from the Great Grandmaster Tiandu. We can glimpse all possible changes in the future for a thousand years," Chen Tianhai said proudly.

"Unlike the second-rate sect Tianji Sect that pretends to be mystical, we do not rely on obscure sensing of heavenly energies but rather on our powerful calculation abilities to truly simulate the future."

Sun Erlang immediately thought of the word "simulate" that he had heard from Yi Shu before.

"Young master, please look!" Chen Tianhai waved his hand, and a small azure sphere suddenly appeared before Sun Erlang. Sun Erlang looked closely, and within this blue sphere, countless overlapping images seemed to present themselves simultaneously. The scenes were all of himself and Chen Tianhai conversing in this very spot. However, Sun Erlang keenly noticed that in each image, his expression and actions were different. There were even some scenes where he suddenly attacked and was then easily killed by Chen Tianhai.

"These are all the possible futures we deduced after your arrival. However, during my interaction with you, I have gained a clearer understanding of your temperament and strength. Therefore, some of these futures lost their meaning before their conclusions were deduced."

As Chen Tianhai spoke, about four-fifths of the images in the blue sphere suddenly dimmed. The remaining ones depicted scenes that were identical to what Sun Erlang was currently experiencing. Sun Erlang looked at this and seemed to understand something, but upon further thought, he felt confused and unable to grasp it.

Chen Tianhai continued, "While we were talking, based on the content of our conversation, the deduced results that aligned with the future trajectory became fewer and fewer."

"Eventually, after young master leaves, our deduction of this matter will reach its conclusion and merge with reality. New deductions will occur once more."

The blue sphere completely dimmed. After a moment of silence, it erupted in a brilliant blue light. The sphere disappeared, transforming into blue mist that floated before Sun Erlang. The blue mist showed countless possibilities for the future of the entire Profound Yellow Realm.

"The essence of calculating the future trajectory of the Profound Yellow Realm and calculating the minor matter of meeting you is the same. As long as we have enough information and adjust the deduction results in a timely manner, we can simulate a future Profound Yellow Realm."

"This allows us to see further on the River of Time than outsiders."

Chen Tianhai waved his hand, and these blue mists, which had derived various future scenes, retracted into his body in an instant. The originally extraordinary Chen Tianhai transformed into a dreamlike existence entirely composed of blue crystals. This sight stunned Sun Erlang slightly.

"For over a thousand years, there has been no significant error in our Taiyan Sect's calculations of the Profound Yellow Realm's future trajectory."

"But now..." Chen Tianhai stared directly at Sun Erlang.

"It's like a mysterious person suddenly appearing in this room where you and I are meeting, killing you, and then fleeing. This is completely outside the norm, something that would normally never happen..."

"We call this ['Beyond Variables']."

The blue light on Chen Tianhai's body gradually subsided, and he returned to his normal human appearance.

A strange glint flickered in Chen Tianhai’s eyes.

“My Taiyan Sect has lived in seclusion for millennia, with little exchange with the outside world. Your master actually knows our hiding place.”

“He must know something about us. Even so, he still took the initiative to send you to contact us…”

“This shows he is certain we will be interested in his [Beyond Variables].”

Sun Erlang was momentarily stunned. “Is, is that so?”

However, upon recalling his master’s mysterious background and seemingly omniscient divine abilities, he felt relieved.

“There are indeed profound variables in this world. Some have even profoundly influenced and changed the destiny of the Profound Yellow Realm.”

“Although our Nine Scrolls of Heaven’s Derivation are said to be able to calculate all things under the heavens, if visitors from beyond the sky or true immortals from the heavens arrive, matters that have already surpassed the heavens and earth themselves…”

“We would naturally be powerless.” Chen Tianhai stated frankly.

“However, our Taiyan Sect does not reject or fear such occurrences beyond variables.” His tone was languid, with unexpressed intentions in his words.

“Visitors from beyond the sky?” Sun Erlang mused.

But then, he suppressed this slight ripple in his heart.

Regardless of his master’s origins, his current identity was the sole Heavenly Mandated Saint Emperor of Great Qi, responsible for the rise and fall of countless beings.

As his master’s eldest disciple, he would forever stand firmly before his master.

“So, Senior, have you agreed to our request for an alliance?” After a moment of silence, Sun Erlang asked.

“If there is a chance of winning, why would we refuse?” Chen Tianhai smiled faintly, not answering directly.

“Then what does Senior mean?”

“When the simulation and calculation result in such a deviation, we naturally must make corrections. Since the Saint Dynasty Great Qi wishes to form an alliance with us, they naturally won’t refuse an inspection by their ally?” Chen Tianhai said calmly.

“This…”

The other party’s request was somewhat beyond Sun Erlang’s expectations.

When he came, his master had not given any specific instructions on how to handle this matter.

“Er Lang, you may make your own decisions regarding all matters. This Taiyan Sect is important…”

“And not important.”

Sun Erlang suddenly recalled the last words his master spoke to him before he left.

“If you are timid when facing a mere Taiyan Sect, how will you contend with the Myriad Immortal Alliance for the Profound Yellow Realm in the future?”

A surge of courage arose in his heart, and Sun Erlang blurted out, “The Saint Dynasty Great Qi has an open position. Taiyan Sect is welcome to visit at any time.”

A sudden blue light flashed in Chen Tianhai’s eyes.

There was no response, as if he were lost in thought.

“Since Young Master Erlang has said so, our Taiyan Sect will send an envoy to accompany you to Great Qi to investigate.”

After a long pause, Chen Tianhai finally spoke.

For some reason, Sun Erlang suddenly felt relieved, as if he had just narrowly escaped death.

“Then, Senior, when shall we depart?”

“No rush, guests are esteemed. It is not easy for Young Master Erlang to travel such a long distance to be here. Our Taiyan Sect has not received a visitor in thousands of years.”

“Moreover, you will also return Yi Xing’s remains.”

Chen Tianhai pondered for a moment and then asked, “Young Master Erlang, are you interested in our [Simulation]?”

“Naturally, I am curious.”

Chen Tianhai nodded, and the ground and decorations around them vanished in an instant. The two seemed to appear in the void, with a azure crystal emitting a captivating light before them.

“This is the [Dao Unification Stone Mother],” Chen Tianhai said with an inexplicable tone.

“Dao Unification Stone Mother?” Sun Erlang repeated the four words.

Looking at the mysterious crystal not far away, Sun Erlang was horrified to find that he could not discern the details on its surface. It seemed infinitely divisible, with countless tiny surfaces extending from each mirror-like facet. After merely peering for a moment, Sun Erlang felt dizzy and his vision blurred. He immediately averted his gaze.

“The Dao Unification Stone Mother is the foundation of our Taiyan Sect. Although the Great Master transmitted the Nine Scrolls of Heaven’s Derivation, the methods are profound and create celestial marvels, making them difficult for ordinary people to study. Even for those of exceptional talent, to cultivate the Nine Scrolls of Heaven’s Derivation to completion would exhaust their lifeblood and leave them near death.” Chen Tianhai flashed beside the massive azure crystal. His figure seemed to merge with the Dao Unification Stone Mother.

“If even geniuses find it so difficult to cultivate, let alone ordinary people. The nature of the Nine Scrolls of Heaven’s Derivation dictates that our Taiyan Sect can only have a few disciples per generation. A scarcity of talent makes it difficult for the sect to grow. Perhaps one day, we might not even be able to retain the title of one of the Ten Immortal Sects.”

“This was the projected outcome for our Taiyan Sect in our calculations.”

“If it were not for the Dao Unification Stone Mother.”

Chen Tianhai’s tone changed abruptly.

“Even a small fragment of the Stone Mother can instantly grant a mortal the calculation abilities comparable to a Harmony Realm expert. What a magnificent creation this is!”

“Young Master Erlang, those white papers that Yi Xing carried with him before his death, did you bring them?” Chen Tianhai asked Sun Erlang suddenly.

Sun Erlang then suddenly remembered and quickly took out those white papers.

“These white papers are called the Treasure Box of Reversed Tribulations. They are commonly used by past Taiyan Sect disciples to practice their calculation abilities.”

“There are a total of forty-nine thousand nine hundred and ninety-nine sheets. You only need to restore them to their original order to reveal the appearance of the treasure box.”

“Would you like to try, Young Master Erlang?” Chen Tianhai scattered the white papers into the air, letting them drift randomly. He then looked at Sun Erlang and asked with a smile.

“Restore them in order?”

Sun Erlang had studied those white papers before; they all looked identical, with no special markings.

“Is it all luck, with no special secret methods?” Sun Erlang asked tentatively.

Looking at Chen Tianhai’s expression, Sun Erlang subtly calculated and his face turned somewhat pale. He decisively refused.

“That’s precisely it. For ordinary people, this is a task that cannot be accomplished even if they exhaust their entire lives. But for the disciples of Taiyan Sect who possess the Dao Unification Stone…”

“It only takes an instant!”

Chen Tianhai lightly gestured, and the white papers scattered everywhere began to fly wildly. They arranged themselves one by one.

Finally, all the white papers returned to their places, and after a blinding light, the treasure box was opened.

A jade slip and a clear blue stone.

The appearance of the Dao Unification Stone in the treasure box seemed to resonate with the Dao Unification Stone Mother. Under the illumination of the Stone Mother’s light, the color of the Dao Unification Stone became even more profound.

Chen Tianhai first put away the jade slip, then stroked the blue gemstone. His expression was somewhat wistful, and then he looked at Sun Erlang and said, “Young Master Erlang, I shall bestow this Dao Unification Stone upon you.”

Only when the Dao Unification Stone landed in his hand did Sun Erlang snap back to reality.

“Ah?”

Sun Erlang truly didn't expect that after Elder Chen of Taiyan Sect had laid out so much about the power of the Dao Unification Stone, he would actually bestow this Dao Unification Stone, which had been lost outside for thousands of years in Yi Xing's tomb, upon him.

"Thank you, Elder!" However, Sun Erlang wasn't foolish. Fearing that the elder might go back on his word, he immediately accepted the treasure.

He held it in his hand, admiring it with delight for a long time. Sun Erlang's expression gradually shifted from surprise to awkwardness.

"Elder, this Dao Unification Stone... it doesn't seem to work?"

Chen Tianhai said, "To experience the profoundness of the Dao Unification Stone, you need to use it with our sect's **Dao Unification Divine One** secret technique!"

Sun Erlang immediately became wary, "Elder, I already have a master. I cannot join your Taiyan Sect..."

Chen Tianhai chuckled, "Young Master, you worry too much. We've already given you the Dao Unification Stone, why would we withhold this secret technique?"

With a mere flick of the elder's finger in the air, Sun Erlang, enveloped in a hazy blue light, felt the information of **Dao Unification Divine One** appear in his mind.

As he slowly circulated the secret technique, the blue gemstone in Sun Erlang's hand pulsed with streaks of light, being absorbed into his body.

Within his sea of consciousness, a brilliant crystal of the same shape slowly began to form.

Suddenly, Sun Erlang felt as if the entire world lit up.

In an instant, countless thoughts flashed through his mind. His thoughts surged like a storm, and memories from his childhood, even those he had almost forgotten, began to reappear.

Regarding his previous doubts – why did Elder Chen of Taiyan Sect give him such special attention? Sun Erlang, who had only had vague guesses before, now deduced several possibilities in his mind.

The overtures to the Holy Dynasty Kai and his master, his unique physique being beneficial to Taiyan Sect, and the possibility that Taiyan Sect could control something through the Dao Unification Stone, making this a part of a conspiracy…

Various possibilities were listed one after another.

At the same time, the deductions were constantly adjusted based on the information obtained from the outside world.

"Is this, Dao Unification Divine One?"

A long time later, Sun Erlang slowly recovered from his shock and couldn't help but sigh.

He couldn't help but look at the Dao Unification Stone Mother before him.

Just a small fragment possessed such powerful calculation abilities. Then, to what realm of power did the Dao Unification Stone Mother reach?

"Elder, you bestowed the Dao Unification Stone upon me. Is it related to the **Simulation** you just asked me about?"

Gazing at the Dao Unification Stone Mother, Sun Erlang suddenly asked, as if inspired, "Elder, you bestowed the Dao Unification Stone upon me. Is it related to the **Simulation** you just asked me about?"

Chen Tianhai nodded inexplicably, "Besides the future of the Xuanhuang Realm, the Dao Unification Stone Mother also contains many other fictional worlds."

"It is both to fully utilize the Stone Mother's abilities and for better correction of established reality."

"You can think of them as a form of rehearsal."

Sun Erlang nodded thoughtfully.

The moment he completely absorbed the Dao Unification Stone, images flashed through his mind: returning to his master, reporting this matter, and everything that would follow.

Unlike a simple thought in the past, this time, even the expressions and reactions of the people he would interact with in the future appeared in an instant.

"This is simulating the future. However, my calculation ability is insufficient, and I can only deduce parts that are strongly related to me."

"The Dao Unification Stone Mother, in addition to deducing the Xuanhuang Realm, even has spare capacity to simulate more."

As Sun Erlang pondered, Chen Tianhai continued, "These fictional worlds are mostly created based on the original materials of the Xuanhuang Realm. Therefore, you may encounter many seemingly familiar yet not quite right existences..."

"But rest assured, they are real enough. They can allow you to truly experience a complete life."

"Young Master, have you ever heard this saying? To govern a vast empire, the talent of a single county is sufficient. Although this principle circulates among mortals, it also applies to our cultivation world. The Xuan Tian Sect, which once dominated the world, had a core group of only twelve cultivators close to the Xuan Tian King."

"Xuan Tian Sect?" Sun Erlang heard this name for the first time and was somewhat curious.

However, Chen Tianhai did not intend to elaborate further. Instead, he continued his reasoning, "This world is not lacking in talent. What is lacking are the space and opportunities for them to grow."

"And in the simulated worlds of the Dao Unification Stone, we have built such a stage. It allows individuals like you, Young Master, to grow rapidly."

After all, he was still young. Hearing Chen Tianhai's high praise, Sun Erlang couldn't help but feel a little proud.

But then he frowned and asked, "How long will this simulation last? Will my master have to wait long?"

"A dream of a thousand years, a thousand years in an instant. Young Master, are you ready?" Chen Tianhai suddenly shouted loudly.

At the same time, a blue halo bloomed from the Dao Unification Stone Mother.

Within the halo, countless different world scenes could be vaguely seen. A figure enveloped in blue light flew out of Sun Erlang's sea of consciousness and directly into the halo of the Stone Mother.

When Chen Tianhai clearly saw where Sun Erlang ended up, a hint of surprise appeared on his face.

"Ancient Xuanhuang, a world where the immortal tribulation did not occur. Interesting..."

Chen Tianhai's words weren't entirely the truth.

Indeed, to govern the world, the talent of one county was sufficient.

But it was only sufficient.

Although there were many talented individuals in the world, some were always extraordinary.

They might be temporarily buried for some reason, but given the opportunity, they could rise against the odds, and their destinies would be completely changed.

The Dao Unification Stone Mother had simulated and iterated through countless worlds. Whenever such individuals appeared, they could profoundly influence and alter the course of world destinies.

"Countless futures have countless branches. The existence or disappearance of some beings has no impact on these possible branches. They are insignificant, ordinary members of the masses."

"But the disappearance of certain individuals can lead to major changes in the future, or even directly cause the disappearance of a large number of possibilities. Such individuals are **Focus Variables**."

"The Dao Unification Stone Mother has statistically analyzed and summarized a set of effective prediction methods based on the numerous focus variables that have appeared in its simulated worlds. This Sun Erlang fits certain characteristics of a focus variable."

Chen Tianhai's thoughts churned. This was also why he was so kind to Sun Erlang.

Since Taiyan Sect had been discovered, it could not avoid "entering the world" and becoming entangled in future variables.

Preparation was naturally needed.

He narrowed his eyes, as if trying to see everything happening in the world Sun Erlang was in.

"Just as I predicted, three years of dormancy, then one glorious rise. Once the momentum is established, no one can stop him."

"Fortunately, judging by his actions, order and rationality are still present."

"Not an **Extreme Variable**."

Giving Sun Erlang an opportunity to simulate was also giving Taiyan Sect an opportunity to understand Sun Erlang's true nature.

Chen Tianhai felt a little more at ease.

"Since they can teach such a disciple, I suppose that mysterious Holy Emperor is not too unpredictable in his actions."

An **Extreme Variable** is a special type of **Focus Variable**.

Once it appears, it will have a subversive impact on the existing world.

In an instant, it can completely overturn the future world deduced by the Dao Unification Stone Mother.

The Dharma Transmission Heavenly Venerate of that year belonged to an **Extreme Variable**.

Chen Tianhai's memory seemed to drift back to that time.

The Taiyan Sect Great Hall.

"I have already replied to the Great Dao Sect. A mere Dao Integration cultivator is not worth fearing," said the previous Sect Master of Taiyan Sect, Chen Tianhai's master, Daoist Xingji, in a deep voice.

Chen Tianhai's expression was somewhat anxious: "How can we make such a hasty conclusion? I feel that the one who transmits the Dharma is somewhat inexplicably strange. Why not observe further?"

Daoist Xingji was somewhat displeased: "The Dao Unification Stone Mother has already simulated over a hundred million times. What problems could there be?"

"Could it be that the combined efforts of so many Longevity Realm cultivators still can't subdue him?"

Chen Tianhai was momentarily speechless.

Between each major realm of cultivation, there was a chasm of strength, and the higher the realm, the more pronounced this gap became.

A Golden Core might be able to kill a Nascent Soul, but for a Dao Integration cultivator to slay a Longevity Realm expert...

This had been rare since the beginning of the Xuanhuang Realm.

Moreover, the action to apprehend the Dharma Transmission cultivator was personally led by Fang Dingge, the Sect Master of the Great Dao Sect.

It was said that a total of six Longevity Realm experts would be making a move simultaneously.

Sect Master Fang was extremely cautious. Even with such a vast disparity in strength between the two sides, he did not underestimate the enemy.

Not only was strict secrecy maintained, but within the Ten Immortal Sects, only the Sect Masters of each sect and a few direct disciples knew of this matter.

He had even sent a message to Taiyan Sect, hoping to use the Dao Unification Stone Mother to deduce potential variables in this operation.

Such prudence was difficult for Daoist Xingji to comprehend.

However, as the leader of the Great Dao Sect, it was not appropriate to refuse him outright. Daoist Xingji still used the Dao Unification Stone Mother to perform detailed deductions of all possibilities.

The results of over a hundred million simulations all ended with the Dharma Transmission cultivator being successfully captured.

Theoretically speaking, there was almost no possibility of failure for the Ten Immortal Sects in this operation.

But for some reason, Chen Tianhai still had a lingering sense of unease.

He had once disguised his identity and secretly approached the Dharma Transmission Immortal Venerate to observe him.

This was before the Myriad Immortal Alliance had attracted the attention of the Ten Great Immortal Sects.

The Dharma Transmission cultivator himself appeared to be a benevolent and kind old man.

He had opened up another unique path for those unable to cultivate in the world.

But after witnessing the fanaticism in the eyes of the new law cultivators surrounding the Dharma Transmission cultivator, Chen Tianhai felt a chill down his spine.

What made him tremble even more was that the Dharma Transmission cultivator seemed to have sensed his hidden observation and glanced slightly in his direction.

A simple, calm glance, yet it felt like a nightmare, reappearing in Chen Tianhai's mind again and again.

It was only after a long time that the negative emotions caused by that glance slowly subsided.

But this suddenly revealed plan had reawakened the nightmare.

As Taiyan Sect's foremost direct disciple, Chen Tianhai had already half-stepped into the Dao Integration realm at a young age. He couldn't believe that an ordinary Dao Integration cultivator could have such a terrifying effect on him.

Out of a sense of shame, Chen Tianhai did not explicitly tell his master about the abnormality he had experienced. However, he repeatedly emphasized the extraordinary nature of the Dharma Transmission Immortal Venerate to his master.

Yet, he was ultimately unable to change his master's attitude.

After leaving his master's presence, Chen Tianhai's unease intensified.

He suddenly had the urge to reactivate the Dao Unification Stone Mother and perform another deduction.

Chen Tianhai was startled by his own thought. The Dao Unification Stone Mother was a supreme treasure of Taiyan Sect, the foundation of the sect. It related to the paths of all Taiyan Sect cultivators, present and future. Only the Sect Master of Taiyan Sect had the right to use it.

Even as Chen Tianhai, the foremost direct disciple, he could only observe from afar and was not allowed to approach it without authorization.

Once the thought arose, it could no longer be suppressed.

It even made Chen Tianhai somewhat absent-minded.

Fortunately, he finally got an opportunity.

One of the Ten Sects, [Wuding Prison], seemed to have encountered some trouble and sent a distress signal to the other Immortal Sects.

The Supreme, Heavenly Sword, Imperial Beast, and other sects were unable to disengage because they were planning the capture of the Dharma Transmission cultivator.

Therefore, this matter was handed over to Daoist Xingji to handle.

From Daoist Xingji's expression before he left, it was clear that the changes in Wuding Prison were significant.

He entrusted the sect's affairs to Chen Tianhai and the elders.

This gave Chen Tianhai his chance.

After a fierce internal struggle, Chen Tianhai was ultimately unable to suppress the restlessness in his heart.

Under the cover of everyone's unawareness, he came before the Dao Unification Stone Mother.

All previous deduction records were preserved. Chen Tianhai accessed the results of the last deduction.

It was indeed as his master had said, and his master had even understated it.

He had performed ten billion deductions, and the results were all identical.

But for some reason, even after seeing the deduction results with his own eyes, Chen Tianhai was still a little unconvinced.

He activated the Dao Unification Stone Mother once more.

Azure light flashed continuously, and infinite possibilities unfolded.

...

"Ugh." A groan interrupted Chen Tianhai's thoughts.

The connection with the Dao Unification Stone Mother was broken, and Sun Erlang had returned to reality from the simulation.

His eyes were tightly closed, seemingly still adapting.

The aura emanating from him was changing at a speed visible to the naked eye.

As if transforming from a sharp-edged young man into a calm and collected master who had experienced countless tribulations in an instant.

"Thank you for your fulfillment, senior!"

After a long while, Sun Erlang opened his eyes.

His gaze was serene and profound.

"What did young master experience?" Chen Tianhai asked, feigning ignorance.

"During the era of the Ten Ancient Immortal Sects, before the calamity descended. I was originally a nobody from the countryside. By chance, I witnessed two Golden Core cultivators fighting to the death. I mustered my courage and collected the belongings from their bodies."

"It took three years to finally open the storage rings left behind by the two Golden Core cultivators. Thus, I officially embarked on the path of cultivation..." Sun Erlang said calmly.

Chen Tianhai knew that although Sun Erlang had only briefly mentioned it, the process of simply opening those two storage rings in the simulated world had been incredibly perilous.

The friends of the two Golden Core cultivators had come to search for the whereabouts of the inheritance.

Possessing a mountain of treasures, yet unable to access them. He had gambled everything, squandered his entire fortune, and finally obtained a rudimentary cultivation method. Stumbling along, he finally reached the Qi Refining realm, allowing him to use the resources within the storage rings.

Sun Erlang recounted his experiences in the simulated world, ultimately reaching the peak of Dao Integration and being unable to break through.

Although Chen Tianhai had already witnessed the other's experiences, he still listened with great interest.

"If it hadn't been for that moment of flawed judgment back then, perhaps the Xuanhuang Realm would still be the same as it is now."

Chen Tianhai thought to himself.

In a sense, he, Chen Tianhai, bears a significant portion of responsibility for the Xuanhuang Realm becoming what it is today.

It was he who, acting without authorization, activated the Dao Dissipation Stone Mother and conducted over ten billion derivations.

This allowed the Proclaiming Law to glimpse a single possibility of victory.

The downfall of the Ten Great Immortal Sects and the six Longevity cultivators—he, Chen Tianhai, is an undeniable sinner!

The numerous derivations by the Dao Dissipation Stone Mother could not, of course, be hidden. When his master, Daoist Xingji, returned and discovered all these terrible consequences, possibly caused by Chen Tianhai's treacherous actions, he was enraged. He intended to kill Chen Tianhai on the spot to appease the world.

However, after repeated consideration, Daoist Xingji still did not act.

Firstly, their deep master-disciple bond, akin to father and son, made Daoist Xingji's heart ultimately soften.

Secondly, if this news truly spread, it would inevitably make the Taiyan Sect a target of public outrage, and perhaps even lead to its erasure from the Xuanhuang Realm. After all, traitors are always more detestable than enemies.

But the tragic deaths of his old friends and his extreme self-condemnation made it impossible for Daoist Xingji to simply pretend nothing had happened.

Thus, he could only strip Chen Tianhai of his status as the first direct disciple, imprison him in the Taiyan Sect's dungeon, and suppress him for eternity. To the outside world, it was declared that Chen Tianhai had defected.

Chen Tianhai remained in the dark and sunless prison for an unknown duration.

By the time he was released, the tribulation had descended, and the Taiyan Sect faced a crisis of life and death.

The world was in chaos, and the once renowned Ten Great Immortal Sects were struggling to protect themselves.

The disciples of the Taiyan Sect, due to their ability to continuously run complex derivations using the Dao Dissipation Stones to suppress the killing intent of cultivating incompatible laws, had not fallen into extreme chaos like the other Immortal Sects.

However, they had reached their limit.

It wasn't just the Dao Dissipation Stones within each cultivator; even the Dao Dissipation Stone Mother, due to the sudden appearance of the "Extreme Variable," had overturned its past and begun rapid re-derivations. To seek a sliver of hope for the Taiyan Sect, its computational power was almost completely drained. His master, Daoist Xingji, released Chen Tianhai before his lamp of life sputtered out.

And he pointed out a path for him:

Abandon the physical body, but let information be eternal.

"Fortune and misfortune are intertwined. Although you made a grave mistake back then, you also calculated the Proclaiming Law's true nature because of it."

"Now, the Proclaiming Law has been lured away by our final means and has temporarily left the Xuanhuang Realm. This has also bought us a sliver of breathing room to preserve our strength."

"Otherwise, I fear all our Immortal Sect heritages would be lost!"

Before he could even finish his last words, Daoist Xingji had already perished.

And before the tribulation of incompatible laws completely enveloped the Taiyan Sect, Chen Tianhai finally completed the integration of the entire Taiyan Sect into the Dao Dissipation Stone Mother.

Fortunately, before his master died, he had already eliminated all dissenting forces within the sect for him.

Otherwise, Chen Tianhai would not have held on until that moment.

Once everyone in the sect could experience and utilize the near-infinite computational power of the Dao Dissipation Stone Mother, Chen Tianhai knew his master's decision was correct.

As the divided Dao Dissipation Stones were re-integrated into their bodies, and after being infused with the thoughts of over a thousand cultivators from the Taiyan Sect, the Dao Dissipation Stone Mother itself underwent a miraculous transformation.

It gained its own consciousness.

A collective consciousness belonging to the Taiyan Sect.

During the millennia of seclusion in the Taiyuan Realm, Chen Tianhai looked back on the past and re-evaluated his actions from that year.

At that time, he was repeatedly uneasy and had even suspected he was falling into a hidden trap set by the Proclaiming Law.

However, neither the sect's restrictive artifacts, nor his master, nor the Longevity cultivators from other sects like Grand Unity and Heavenly Sword could find any fault with him.

Chen Tianhai could only assume it was simply his own inner demons at play.

"The Proclaiming Law's methods are truly insidious and difficult to guard against." "It's a pity that his true nature, my master didn't explain before he passed away. And other knowledgeable individuals from the Immortal Sects have long since disappeared. However, after so many years, I have also deduced the general outline..."

Chen Tianhai's thoughts churned as he listened to Sun Erlang recount his simulated experiences.

"That's right, senior. The cultivation methods I learned in the simulated world..." Sun Erlang hesitated to speak.

"Naturally, they are real," Chen Tianhai said indifferently.

"But you'd best not learn to use them in reality. Otherwise, you might attract the pursuit of the Myriad Immortal Alliance's Protector Hall," Chen Tianhai added.

"Myriad Immortal Alliance's Protector Hall..." Sun Erlang murmured, but there was no fear in his eyes.

"Alright, since Young Master has gained much, please return. Don't keep your master waiting too long," Chen Tianhai issued a polite dismissal.

"Yi Shu will accompany you to the Great Qi Minor World."

Before his voice faded, Sun Erlang felt his vision blur.

When he came to his senses, he was outside the blue transparent building.

Yi Shu stood smiling beside him, as if he had been waiting for a long time.

"Oh?" Sun Erlang immediately sensed that Yi Shu was different from before.

Even different from all other cultivators within this Taiyan Sect.

Gone was the cold, uniform collective aura; instead, there was a vibrant, individual vitality.

"Thanks to Young Master, I temporarily have a physical body again and can go out and enjoy myself for a while." Yi Shu smiled and explained the current situation of the Taiyan Sect to Sun Erlang.

"Information is eternal..." After hundreds of years of training in the simulated world, Sun Erlang was clearly much calmer.

But he was still shocked by the Taiyan Sect's wildly imaginative concept.

"Young Master, there's no need to be surprised. If you truly experienced it like we have, you'll know there's not much difference between having a physical body or not. In fact, a physical body is an absolute burden." Yi Shu said with a chuckle.

"But it's not bad for occasional change of pace."

Yi Shu followed Sun Erlang out of the Taiyuan Realm and headed straight for the entrance to the Cloud Sea and the Great Qi Minor World.

Clearly, the Taiyan Sect was not unfamiliar with the location of the Great Qi Minor World.

However, after passing through the Immortal Severing Grand Array and seeing only a vast void with no minor worlds existing, Yi Shu finally showed a hint of surprise.

Sun Erlang was stunned for a moment, and then, as if memories from a hundred years ago finally resurfaced, he said awkwardly, "Please wait a moment, senior. My Sacred Dynasty of Great Qi is currently drifting in the void, wandering aimlessly. I don't know where it is now..."

"Let me ask."

A moment later, a golden light shot out from the darkness and instantly appeared before the two.

"Greetings, Senior Hundred Flowers!" Sun Erlang recognized the newcomer and bowed respectfully.

Hundred Flowers Daoist scanned Yi Shu, saying nothing more.

"Follow me."

A glazed golden light enveloped them, and the surrounding void seemed to twist, emitting an eerie glow.

When the golden light dissipated, they were back in the Sacred Dynasty of Great Qi.

"Senior Hundred Flowers, your cultivation seems to have advanced significantly again?"

With the experience of a hundred simulations, Sun Erlang was no longer the same person he was before. He could naturally discern the changes that had occurred to Daoist Hundred Flowers during his absence.

He couldn't help but feel a sense of awe.

Meanwhile, Yi Shu watched with great interest the five interconnected rings in the sky, and the six bright stars surrounding them.

"Senior Hundred Flowers has relocated two more grotto-heavens. It must have been exhausting. These new grotto-heavens seem to be even larger than the previous ones. No wonder I feel that Great Qi's speed through the void has increased significantly," Sun Erlang thought to himself.

"The Sacred Dynasty of Great Qi truly lives up to its name," Yi Shu said sincerely, sensing the various forces that constantly enveloped the minor world.

"I believe that in at most fifty years, such earth-shattering changes would occur in a mere mortal world. I am truly curious about your master, young sir."

Daoist Hundred Flowers looked at Yi Shu again inexplicably.

He did not speak, only let out a cold snort.

After bringing the two to the seat of the Sacred Emperor, he left directly.

Looking at the towering, mountain-like figure seated above, Sun Erlang's heart trembled.

He had originally thought that after experiencing so many realistic worlds in the simulation, and witnessing the most powerful eternal realm cultivators of the ten great immortal sects, he would be more at ease when facing his master.

But in this moment, Sun Erlang knew he was wrong.

When facing an eternal realm expert, Sun Erlang felt the pressure of a superior from a higher realm towards a weaker one.

But when facing his own master, the Faceless Sacred Emperor of Great Qi, the reason Sun Erlang's body, mind, and even soul trembled uncontrollably was due to the unfathomable mystery of the Faceless Sacred Emperor, and...

it was like the natural condescension of a higher being towards a lower one.

"Master, I have returned." Sun Erlang knelt on one knee, just as he always had.

Yi Shu, on the other hand, cupped his fists slightly.

"It's good that you've returned. It seems you have gained a great deal from this trip," the voice of Li Ping, the Faceless Sacred Emperor, echoed in the empty, towering hall of the Sacred Emperor's seat.

Sun Erlang recounted his experiences in detail.

After listening to Sun Erlang's report, Li Ping said to Yi Shu, "Since the Taiyan Sect is so polite, we cannot be neglectful. During this period, you shall lead him around the Sacred Dynasty."

"You are permitted to go anywhere. Take him wherever this esteemed guest wishes to see."

Sun Erlang was slightly stunned, then quickly said, "This disciple understands."

"Go forth."

There was no intention of conversing with Yi Shu.

Although Yi Shu was an embodiment of the collective consciousness of the Taiyan Sect, he also had his own temper and self-awareness.

He tilted his head slightly, looked at the Faceless Sacred Emperor seated above, and cupped his fists again.

Until he left the Sacred Emperor's seat, the Sacred Emperor did not utter another word.

"Seeing is believing. After you've experienced it, Senior, you will naturally have your answers," Sun Erlang quickly explained to prevent any awkwardness.

"Very well, then let me see what is so special about this place," Yi Shu responded with a smile.

However, his smile seemed different from before.

When Yi Shu saw that almost everyone in the Sacred Dynasty of Great Qi was cultivating the same technique, a hint of surprise flashed in his eyes.

When he saw the Immortal Spirit Towers placed randomly throughout the Sacred Dynasty, constantly releasing spiritual energy outwards, Yi Shu's smile slowly faded.

After observing the Grand Array of Heaven, Earth, and Myriad Spirits that connected the Sacred Dynasty of Great Qi with other minor worlds, Yi Shu's expression became filled with disbelief and uncertainty.

"Young sir, do you know..."

Yi Shu stopped himself before he could speak.

Sun Erlang, thinking the other party was simply astonished by the sights of the Sacred Dynasty, did not press further when he saw that Yi Shu had ultimately not voiced his question.

Subsequently, Sun Erlang took Yi Shu to visit some of the Sacred Dynasty's important sites. For example, Wang Xuanba's exotic beast breeding base and the site where the Heavenly Roaming Arrows were forged.

As they traveled, Yi Shu became increasingly silent.

Deep confusion and doubt also flashed across his brow from time to time.

Seeing his expression, Sun Erlang, who had been constantly shocked by the Taiyan Sect earlier, felt a sense of satisfaction and secret pride.

"Senior Yi, is there anything else you wish to see?"

Yi Shu did not respond immediately.

His gaze swept into the distance, as if he wanted to take in the entire magical minor world.

"If you hadn't mentioned wanting to counterattack the Xuanhuang Realm, I would have almost believed this was a hidden realm of the Myriad Immortals Alliance," Yi Shu suddenly said after a long pause.

"Except for the number of cultivators and the top-tier powerhouses, you indeed have the qualifications to contend with the Myriad Immortals Alliance."

"However, based on what I have seen so far, it is still not enough to form an alliance with our Taiyan Sect," Yi Shu concluded.

"Young sir, the depths of the Myriad Immortals Alliance are far greater than you perceive," Yi Shu implied.

Sun Erlang did not show any dissatisfaction with Yi Shu's reaction, but nodded thoughtfully.

After some thought, Sun Erlang finally led Yi Shu to the space beneath the Sacred Emperor's seat, where Monk Yin was located.

He did not meet Monk Yin himself.

However, just seeing the nearly a hundred young children, who had already reached the Foundation Establishment stage at such a tender age, cultivating there, Yi Shu showed the first signs of losing his composure.

"This..." With his discerning eye, he instantly recognized the peculiar nature of these Foundation Establishment children.

"How is this possible?"

At this very moment, in the Tai Xuan Realm, everyone in the Taiyan Sect cast their gazes towards the Great Qi minor world.

Even the Dao Transformation Stone Mother, which was constantly emitting a vast blue light, seemed to pause briefly.

"Not long ago, a young man, building upon the foundation of "Cultivating Foundation with Myself," took another step forward. He achieved the Primordial Golden Core." Sun Erlang said softly.

"Cultivating Foundation with Myself?!" Upon hearing these words, Yi Shu froze completely.

It was not a figurative expression, but a genuine stagnation of thought.

Sun Erlang, possessing the Dao Transformation Stone, could also see at a glance that this was the result of the Dao Transformation Stone's computing power operating at its absolute limit.

"Impossible!"

A long time later, Yi Shu blurted out.

At this, the children who were diligently pondering and cultivating here all looked towards Yi Shu.

Their gazes held a hint of displeasure.

Having been taught by Monk Yin, they had loathed the word "impossible" since childhood.

Yi Shu realized his loss of composure and cleared his throat to cover it.

He slowly walked up to a doll-like little girl with a delicate and pretty face and observed her closely.

The more he looked, the more astonished he became.

Sun Erlang saw that Yi Shu's hands were even clenching uncontrollably.

"Outside of variables? Outside of variables?"

"No, this is not outside of variables, this is..."

Yi Shu suddenly looked up, as if meeting the eyes of the Faceless Sacred Emperor seated on the throne.

"A Xuanhuang Deliverer?!"

Years ago, when the theory of the Tribulation Crossing Sect was first introduced, Yi Shu, like most cultivators of the Great Evolution Sect, dismissed it outright.

When tribulation strikes, instead of actively seeking a solution, they chose to hide like turtles, placing their hopes on some illusory destined savior. This was entirely unfounded and unpredictable.

However, as fellow members of the Ten Immortal Sects and inheriting the teachings of Grand Master Tiandu, the Tribulation Crossing Sect's lineage had existed since the primordial era. Its ability to endure for so many years proved there was indeed a special reason for it.

It was just that outsiders could not glimpse the profound mysteries of the Tribulation Crossing Sect.

Today, as Yi Shu arrived at the Great Commencement Sacred Dynasty, which seemed to have sprung from a crack in a stone, and witnessed technologies comparable to the peak level of the Myriad Immortal Alliance, along with a new cultivation method completely different from the current practices, one that could completely subvert the foundation of the Dharma Spreading Heavenly Venerate in the Xuanhuang Realm.

The words of the Tribulation Crossing Sect from years ago immediately resurfaced in Yi Shu's mind.

At that time, when the great tribulation first appeared, the core members of the Ten Immortal Sects gathered to discuss possible countermeasures.

Each sect aired their opinions, but only the Tribulation Crossing Sect maintained a passive stance.

"Esteemed sirs, it is said that one cannot escape tribulation. If it could be avoided through struggle, what would it be called tribulation?" the Sect Master of the Tribulation Crossing Sect, Lu Chengheng, said with his eyes on his nose and his nose on his chest, as if it were none of his business.

"Is this the reason your Tribulation Crossing Sect places the 'Divine Eye of Contemplation' everywhere?"

Xia Houyan, the Lord of the Unfixed Prison, known for his foul temper, countered with a displeased expression.

"Xia Hou, you do not understand. This is a necessary means to await the appearance of the 'Xuanhuang Tribulation Crosser'," Lu Chengheng said calmly.

"Bullshit Xuanhuang Tribulation Crosser! In the face of tribulation, all beings perish. If everyone is dead, where will this savior pop out from?" Xia Hou was almost driven to curse.

"Are you questioning the Grand Master's teachings?" Lu Chengheng's single sentence rendered Xia Houyan speechless.

"And are you not here?" Lu Chengheng smiled, then added meaningfully, "The Xuanhuang Realm is not so easily destroyed. If there is any immortal cultivation world in this sea of stars that can survive to the end, it must be our Xuanhuang."

The leaders of the Ten Sects heard this and none of them objected.

After a brief silence, perhaps to appease everyone, Lu Chengheng offered a brief explanation: "The concept of tribulation crossing is not baseless. Great tribulations and cycles of birth and death are part of the natural order of heaven and earth. Even the great tribulation in the Immortal Realm may not be beyond the foresight of the True Immortals."

"You are all living in constant dread, yet have you seen the Grand Master show any sign of distress? He is not bothered in the slightest. But we are not the same. Brother Lu, I will not stop you if you choose to seclude yourselves, but you cannot completely abstain from contributing to dealing with the tribulation."

Seeing the unified gaze of everyone, Lu Chengheng finally nodded and compromised.

However, Lu Chengheng's last sentence cast everyone present into silence once more.

"One day, you will all realize that our Tribulation Crossing Sect was right."

At this moment, thousands of years later, Yi Shu, in the body of the collective consciousness of the Great Evolution Sect, suddenly recalled Lu Chengheng's words from back then.

After a superficial understanding of the principle of "Building Foundation with Myself," the Dao Transformation Stone Mother incorporated this variable into its future projections for the Xuanhuang Realm.

The once clear future became blurry, as if caught in a chaotic storm.

Even with the Stone Mother's now divine computational power, it was momentarily lost.

The Great Evolution Sect had also attempted to extrapolate new cultivation methods that could subvert the existing system.

But…

Creating something from nothing and projecting the future based on existing data are two different things.

The Dao Transformation Stone Mother could only determine that such a possibility existed, but the probability was too small.

It was even smaller than the probability of the Dharma Spreader surviving the encirclement by the Longevity Realm back then.

Besides the sheer difficulty of creating the new method itself, there was also the more significant factor of the Dharma Spreader's pervasive influence on the Xuanhuang Realm.

It was like how cultivators would gradually forget about the calamities of the Xuanhuang Realm and ignore the geographical changes occurring over thousands of years.

Projecting a new method was not just the ultimate expression of one's own creativity.

It was also a struggle against the influence of the Dharma Spreader.

Therefore, in the deductions of the Dao Transformation Stone Mother, which was fully aware of the current strength of the Dharma Spreading Heavenly Venerate, the probability of the new method being born was infinitesimally close to zero.

But something that far exceeded the possibilities of extrapolation had happened.

In a corner of the void of the Xuanhuang Realm, unknown to anyone, within a recently established force.

The new method had not only quietly appeared but had even developed to the Golden Core stage!

This was truly earth-shattering, causing even the Dao Transformation Stone Mother's projections to falter slightly.

Because, based on all known factors, it could not find the reason why the new method could emerge at this particular time.

The only explanation was something outside the norm, a Xuanhuang Tribulation Crosser who was not part of the variables.

The Ten Sects had also discussed the Xuanhuang Tribulation Crosser privately.

They had reached a nearly unified conclusion: if such a Tribulation Crosser existed, they would either be from outside the Xuanhuang Realm or the reincarnation of a powerful expert.

A native cultivator who rose solely through their own efforts to avert a world-ending catastrophe…

It was simply impossible.

No matter how monstrous their talent, it was not enough.

The Xuanhuang Realm's environment had already ceased to cultivate the foundation soil capable of confronting the Dharma Spreading Heavenly Venerate.

"What is the origin of this Faceless Sacred Emperor of Great Commencement?"

At this moment, Yi Shu, or rather, the Great Evolution Sect mind, had completely shed its previous disdain.

Instead, they now regarded the Great Commencement Sacred Dynasty as an equal, or even superior, power.

And they were seriously considering the possibility of forming an alliance with the Great Commencement Sacred Dynasty.

As one of the former rulers of the Xuanhuang Realm, now compressed by the Myriad Immortal Alliance of the Dharma Spreading Heavenly Venerate to only inhabit the Great Profound Minor World, it was impossible for the Great Evolution Sect to harbor no resentment.

Even though they no longer needed territory or resources, the fact that what they once possessed had been stripped away left an indelible scar on the Great Evolution Sect's consciousness, like a recurring nightmare.

"The Grand Dao and Supreme Sects of the past, although outwardly resisting the Myriad Immortal Alliance, had in reality already colluded with them, becoming no different from the Dharma Spreader's lackeys."

"But, like us, they likely haven't fully submitted. All they lack is an opportunity."

The emergence of the Great Commencement Sacred Dynasty, especially the appearance of the new cultivation method, offered the Great Evolution Sect a glimmer of hope.

However, as a sect that had survived since antiquity's great calamities, they were extremely cautious in making any decisions that concerned their destiny.

Chapter 1201: The Future of Dao Transformation

Yi Shu gradually recovered from his shock but still did not choose to express his stance.

However, his specific actions had already changed.

He had originally planned to observe for a while and then return. Now, he requested Sun Erlang to allow him to stay for a long period of observation.

Sun Erlang seemed troubled, "I cannot make this decision on my own. I need to ask my master for instructions."

Yi Shu nodded, "I believe your master will agree."

As expected, the Faceless Sage Emperor agreed to Taiyan Sect's request to stay. However, there was a condition.

"Help the cultivators in the Great Commencement Sacred Dynasty grow rapidly using [Simulation]?"

Yi Shu hesitated for a moment.

"My master said that even if Taiyan Sect doesn't help with this, he has other methods, just that it would be a bit more troublesome. Taiyan Sect's core is still the deduction of Xuanhuang's future. Before the final outcome is determined, my master agrees to Taiyan Sect maintaining a certain neutrality. Consider it a form of transaction," Sun Erlang relayed Li Ping's exact words.

Yi Shu remained silent for a moment. After deliberation between Taiyan Sect and the Dao Transformation Stone Mother, they finally agreed.

For Taiyan Sect, running a few more simulations was merely making use of idle computing power.

It could open up another path for the future, which seemed like a worthwhile deal.

It was similar to how some cultivators in the sect chose to flee before the calamity struck. The Ten Immortal Sects never placed all their choices in one basket.

From then on, the Great Commencement Sacred Dynasty gained an observer.

Yi Shu could observe freely and without restriction, except for the areas where the Sage Emperor resided, where the You Clan members were located, and the fishing pond in the Xuanhuang Realm.

Li Ping was not worried about this.

With the Sacred Dynasty's Fortune supporting him, coupled with the increasingly perfect Grand Myriad Spirits Array, every move Yi Shu made was under his control.

Even the life and death of Yi Shu's current body were within his thoughts.

Meanwhile, in the distant Xuanhuang Realm, someone was already setting their sights on Taiyan Sect.

"Although I have no intention of harming others, I must leave behind some means."

"Taiyan Sect has abandoned their physical existence, collectively existing within the Dao Transformation Stone Mother. Their information is indeed indestructible. Even when Immortal Ruins Immortals could destroy worlds with a glance, they could escape that terrifying calamity. But..."

"As the saying goes, one should specialize!"

In the Yuanyuan Array Space, Li Fan appeared to be meditating with his eyes closed.

In reality, his mind was churning with thoughts.

Information being indestructible meant that physical means, and even ordinary immortal techniques, would have little effect. However, data corruption might have a miraculous effect.

As far as Li Fan knew, such a method did not yet exist among the orthodox legacies circulating in the Xuanhuang Realm. His idea originated from the mysterious and unfathomable [Prime Origin Spirit Grand Array].

The composite of nine immortal-grade grand arrays possessed unimaginable power. It could even re-establish the elements of earth, fire, water, and wind in the void, and create new worlds.

Fortunately, with the Ultimate Dissolution Disc and various fortuitous encounters, Li Fan had initially mastered three of them:

Xuanji, Myriad Spirits Convergence; Arrogant Fall, Empty Chamber Blooming Flowers; Boundless, Primordial Existence.

Among them, the Xuanji, Myriad Spirits Convergence Grand Array had the wondrous effect of digitalizing and freely transforming everything within its coverage.

"Although this is only theoretical and the materials required are fundamentally impossible for setting up the array, thankfully, Taiyan Sect does not have a physical form. Pure information, on the other hand, is more prone to revealing flaws."

"Primordial Existence, Myriad Spirits Convergence, if these two arrays cooperate..."

In his sea of consciousness, the Ultimate Dissolution Disc, powered by the computing power of the Dao Transformation Stone, was rapidly deducing a new form of grand array.

Over the past six months, Li Fan's clone had roughly completed the analysis of the Primordial Existence array within the Boundless Mirror.

After some repairs by the clone, the capabilities of the damaged Boundless Mirror had significantly improved. The corresponding price was that the clone had become even weaker.

However, Li Fan was not worried.

Sun Luyuan had been delaying the task assigned by the Mirror Master [Fu], and even his intentional perfunctory actions were seen by the other party. The pressure he was under was increasing, and perhaps soon he would be forced to succumb and once again use the Boundless Mirror to attempt to spy on the Heavenly Profound Mirror.

Sensing the news from his clone, Li Ping, Li Fan was now contemplating something else.

He was pondering the origin of the Dao Transformation Stone Mother.

When Taiyan Sect first inherited the Great Heavenly Master's teachings, they likely did not have the Dao Transformation Stone Mother.

It was only later, from an unknown source, that they found such a treasure, which directly transformed Taiyan Sect's cultivation technique from being suitable only for a select few to being cultivable by anyone. This completely solidified Taiyan Sect's position among the Ten Sects.

"There are many treasures in the Xuanhuang Realm that can deduce the future. Take the Boundless Mirror, for example. Although damaged, it can still predict some future events. However, the wonder of the Boundless Mirror, and even the Heavenly Profound Mirror, seems to be a result of immortal-grade power crafting. They are [Artifacts]."

"But the Dao Transformation Stone Mother is more like a pure [Thing]."

"A legendary heavenly material and earthly treasure... Although the Xuanhuang Realm is vast, it doesn't seem like such a divine object could be naturally conceived."

Li Fan suddenly recalled a lost anecdote he had heard from someone in the Durability Sect.

An alien star fell upon Xuanhuang, causing all spiritual energy in the Xuanhuang Realm to become ineffective.

"Could it be that this Dao Transformation Stone Mother also came from beyond the starry sky?"

Li Fan couldn't help but speculate.

But it was just speculation. Unless he could one day infiltrate the Dao Transformation Stone, he would never know the true answer.

"The Stone Mother deduces the future purely through its own powerful computing power. Even so, it has reached a certain extreme, which shows the strength of its computing power. If it were supplemented by external objects, optimizing its deduction methods again, who knows what level it could reach."

Take the Dao Transformation Stone in Li Fan's sea of consciousness, for example. Although it had been promoted to a high-grade item after several fusions, if it were to deduce arrays on its own, let alone immortal-grade arrays, even something like the [Life and Death Reversal Grand Array] would be very strenuous.

Similarly, if relying solely on the Dissolution Disc itself, it was still a mortal object, and deducing immortal-grade arrays would be somewhat difficult.

But when the two worked together, it was entirely different.

"Complementary and mutually beneficial."

Such a harmonious scene made Li Fan imagine what kind of spectacle it would be if the Dao Transformation Stone Mother were equipped with something like the Ultimate Dissolution Disc, and not just for arrays.

The cultivation techniques of the Yuanyuan Array, the future of the Boundless Mirror...

If these were combined with the terrifying computing power of the Dao Transformation Stone Mother, it would undergo a qualitative change.

It could even be infinitely superimposed on the already peak Dao Transformation Stone Mother through continuous cycles of each life.

Pushing it to an unimaginable level.

The help of the Ultimate Dissolution Disc in Li Fan's cycles of reincarnation was self-evident.

If other things were added...

It made Li Fan's heart pound with excitement.

"Perhaps the way to break the deadlock lies within this."

"A treasure lies before me, it all depends on how I plan for it."

Li Fan's eyes flickered.

The Dao Transformation Stone Mother could escape from a calamity like the extinction of the Profound Yellow Realm, so Li Fan wouldn't underestimate it.

"There's no need to rush for success. In this life, I'll be an absolutely reliable partner, gain the trust of the Taiyan Sect, and thus learn more of their secret information."

"As for myself, I'll first perfect this Data Pollution Array. If I have the chance, I'll do a small test to see the effect."

The Dharma Evolution Array space provided Li Fan with ample safe time, free from external disturbances. Apart from occasionally dealing with the little loli's tantrums, the rest of the time was quite leisurely. The three supervising elders communicated with each other less and less, each immersed in their own worlds.

However, one day, a special group of people arrived in the Dharma Evolution Array space. They didn't have a Dharma Jade Token but were specially approved by the Immortal Alliance and arrived here under the leadership of the Chief Elder of the Law Enforcement Hall.

Hua Yueye, who was usually a bit lazy, seemed somewhat nervous and greeted them repeatedly: "Greetings, Elder Xu."

Li Fan noticed that not only the other two supervisors, but even the usually boisterous and fearless little loli of the Dharma Evolution Array, had become more restrained. While bowing along, Li Fan looked at the white-haired old man in front of him, who seemed blind, and recalled the information about this Chief of the Law Enforcement Hall.

"Xu Yuanxian, has served as the Chief Elder of the Law Enforcement Hall for over three thousand years. Although he appears approachable on the surface, he is actually eccentric and rigid in his temper. He adheres to the Immortal Alliance's systems to a dogmatic degree, showing no mercy. He won't even allow a Dharma Transmitter who wishes to break the rules. He is valued by the Dharma Transmitter Jiang, and although other Dharma Transmitters dislike him, they can do nothing about him."

"Since he can serve as the Chief Elder of the Law Enforcement Hall, Xu Yuanxian's own strength is unfathomable, not comparable to ordinary Harmonization realm cultivators. The only record of the Myriad Immortal Alliance killing a Harmonization realm cultivator and retrieving leaked cultivation techniques was carried out by this person. It was clean and swift, without even giving onlookers time to react."

Xu Yuanxian explained the purpose of their visit: "The Immortal Alliance's grand examination just ended not long ago, and these young ones are the cream of the crop. The Council of Dharma Transmitters has specially approved them to use the Dharma Evolution Array to deduce a Harmonization realm-level cultivation technique."

"Huh?"

"How could this be?!"

The three supervisors and the little loli of the Dharma Evolution Array were all a bit surprised. The little loli pouted, about to complain. Seeing Xu Yuanxian's expression, she cautiously swallowed her words. Li Fan reacted the fastest, nodding and saying: "Please, Chief, present the council's imprint." His expression was serious, not perfunctory at all, despite the visitor being his superior. Xu Yuanxian cooperated fully, displaying an imprint. Feeling the aura of a Dharma Transmitter surrounding it, Li Fan carefully verified the information and finally nodded to signal that the inspection was passed.

Postponing the cultivators who were waiting for their technique deductions, Li Fan arranged for the Dharma Evolution Array to handle the tasks for these new recruits of the Immortal Alliance first. There were a total of sixteen people, with varying ages and cultivation realms. The giant Dharma Evolution light sphere continuously rotated, and the little loli, pouting, performed the deduction work.

While these people were queuing for their technique deductions, Li Fan, out of curiosity, transmitted a message to Xu Yuanxian: "Chief, forgive my poor eyesight, but these cultivators... don't seem to have particularly outstanding aptitude. Why is the Immortal Alliance treating them so favorably?" The transmission did not evade the other two supervisors, who also showed curious expressions. However, all they received in return was silence. Xu Yuanxian said nothing, as if he hadn't heard Li Fan's transmission at all. The two supervisors wisely retracted their gazes. Li Fan didn't press further, and a strange silence fell upon the ceremony.

It wasn't until all sixteen people had completed their technique deductions and were about to leave that Xu Yuanxian finally responded. "This question, I too would like to know." "However, there are too many unknowns in this world; there's no need to know everything. We just need to do our own jobs well." "Since the Council of Dharma Transmitters has decided this, they must have their reasons. We subordinates simply obey orders." The three supervisors bowed deeply, indicating their understanding.

Only after Xu Yuanxian had completely left the Dharma Evolution Array space did they dare to converse. "The Chief is truly as rigid as rumored." "Fellow Daoist Sun reacted very quickly this time. The Chief likes it when you handle things according to the rules. If you've set your mind to it, you might catch the Chief's eye, and when you emerge in five hundred years, he might choose you as his successor." Hua Yueye teased.

Li Fan ignored their joking and, according to regulations, first reported the special use of the Dharma Evolution Array. Then, he calmly said: "The position of Chief Elder of the Law Enforcement Hall is even more like being imprisoned than our current work. I have no interest in it." "I still have a beloved wife at home waiting for me to return." Half-truth, half-jest, it made the two supervisors laugh heartily.

This incident was merely a small interlude during their duties guarding the Dharma Evolution Array. Soon, the few of them cast the matter aside. Of course, except for Li Fan. Because... among those sixteen people, there was actually a spy from the Great Qi Dynasty embedded in the Myriad Immortal Alliance. His name was Yang Fei. Li Fan knew him, but Yang Fei didn't know Li Fan. But this did not diminish Li Fan's vigilance.

The Immortal Alliance never did things meaninglessly. These sixteen newly joined members of the Myriad Immortal Alliance receiving such preferential treatment made it difficult for Li Fan not to suspect that there was a conspiracy behind it. "Could it be like the previous 'Chosen Immortals,' sacrifices used to awaken the power within the statues of the Heavenly Honored Transmitters left in various places? No, if they were sacrifices, they were destined to die. There would be no need to waste the computational power of the Dharma Evolution Array..." Li Fan acutely sensed the abnormality behind this.

Meanwhile, in the underground secret chamber of the Sun family, his divine sense finally waited for the opportune moment. Sun Luyuan once again arrived at the secret chamber, his eyes red. He showed a conflicted expression, and finally took out a small Profound Sky Mirror. Then, using his own blood, he nourished Sun Luyao within the Boundless Mirror while explaining: "The pressure from above is too great. Forgive me, brother." "I originally thought I could refuse to comply even unto death. But looking at the faces of the Sun family..."

Sun Luyao transformed into a shadowy figure and appeared, comforting according to Li Fan's divine sense's instructions: "Brother, I understand. It's alright, leave it to me." Sun Luyuan trembled upon hearing this, clenching his fists so tightly that his fingernails almost pierced his flesh. At this moment, the information about the 'Great Qi Dynasty' he had previously found resurfaced in his mind. "Perhaps, I can try to contact them." "Being a dog for a lifetime also carries the risk of being beheaded at any moment. Perhaps this 'Great Qi' can indeed bring me some pleasant surprises?"
