The Boundless Mirror pretended to search within the Profound Sky Realm for information related to the Profound Sky Mirror's clones. In reality, it was probing the reason why those sixteen cultivators were treated so favorably.

It was clearly a top secret of the Myriad Immortals Alliance.

It was hidden very deeply, and even though a part of the Grand Primordial Square Formation had been repaired, the Boundless Mirror found it extremely difficult to search.

It also had to be careful to avoid being discovered by the Profound Sky Mirror. In the continuous search, the Boundless Mirror was gradually reaching its overload limit.

The mirror body began to shake violently, and faint cracks appeared on the mirror surface.

Sun Luyuan watched with red eyes, and several times he wanted to put away the Profound Sky Mirror.

However, the firm belief transmitted by Sun Luyao always stopped him.

"Brother, I can still hold on a little longer."

"I've already found clues, I can't give up now!"

"Brother, I can do it!"

Listening to Sun Luyao's almost unbearable pained voice, Sun Luyuan's previously formed idea gradually became resolute.

Time seemed to pass exceptionally slowly, and Sun Luyuan's heart felt like it was being cut by a knife, and he sat on pins and needles.

Besides worrying that his brother would not be able to hold on and everything would be lost, he was also worried about being discovered by the Profound Sky Mirror.

Finally, the Boundless Mirror voluntarily broke off the devouring black light.

That peculiar small mirror could no longer maintain its floating state and fell to the ground with a clang.

Sun Luyuan quickly took out his spare essence blood and infused it.

After a while, the Boundless Mirror trembled and recovered a little.

"How is it..." Sun Luyuan didn't even dare to ask.

"Brother, I have not failed in my mission."

Fortunately, his brother did not disappoint him, and the moment he heard these four words, Sun Luyuan felt relieved.

After checking the top-secret information his brother had gathered, his expression changed continuously.

"Fu's suspicion was correct, Cang has indeed been controlled in turn."

"Wei Du..."

"It seems that the internal affairs of the Mirror Holders are more complicated than we imagined," Sun Luyao's shadow said weakly. "Brother, our Sun family is still too weak. If we are not careful, we will be torn to pieces."

"Don't worry. Leave it to me next," Sun Luyuan said in a deep voice.

"By the way, brother. Can you leave the Profound Sky Mirror this time?" Just as he was about to leave, he suddenly heard Sun Luyao say this.

Sun Luyuan couldn't help but hesitate.

"Don't worry, brother. I haven't lost control. In fact, after the recent extreme explorations, I don't know why, but my control over the Boundless Mirror has deepened. I want to try a few more times when I have the extra capacity. It will be more skillful in the future..."

In the end, Sun Luyuan was persuaded by his brother's sincere words.

And the other party's condition was indeed much better than when he had lost control after a previous exploration.

Therefore, after repeatedly cautioning him, he still left the Profound Sky Mirror.

Not long after Sun Luyuan hurried away.

A phantom figure floated out of the Boundless Mirror and entered the Profound Sky Mirror.

A moment later, beams of light flickered, and a large amount of soul-nourishing materials were purchased.

Li Fan's clone greedily devoured them, and his originally weak condition quickly reversed.

With the origin of the Profound Sky Mirror, he could steal a large amount of resources through the small mirror without anyone noticing.

At this time, Sun Luyao's figure also floated out.

He looked at Li Fan with fear.

These soul-nourishing treasures were useless to him.

But the casual guidance from this adult allowed him to integrate with the Boundless Mirror more smoothly.

This was something that he and his brother had tried their best to achieve over hundreds of years.

The terrifying nature of this adult was unquestionable.

In Sun Luyao's eyes, he was much more terrifying than any Mirror Holder, and his surrender seemed natural.

"Brother, you can understand me, right?" Sun Luyao thought silently.

The feigned pain in front of Sun Luyuan was naturally an act.

Although there were some twists and turns, it was a close call.

It was just that the information that adult had worked so hard to find was puzzling to him.

"Sixteen cultivators, summoned by the Transmission of Dharma, leave Profound Yellow and go beyond the heavens."

To Sun Luyao, there was nothing particularly strange about this.

But in Li Fan's eyes, the meaning was completely different.

While his clone was slowly recovering, Li Fan was also pondering this matter.

"The Transmission of Dharma actually summoned cultivators to leave the Profound Yellow Realm for the first time?"

"What is going on?"

"With his strength, even if these sixteen people were cultivated into Dao Integration by the Immortal Alliance in a short period, they would still be like ants."

"They were not selected from the existing Dao Integration cultivators of the Immortal Alliance."

Li Fan recalled the spy he had arranged, Yang Fei.

There seemed to be nothing special about him.

Li Fan was not worried that Yang Fei would expose him if he really encountered the Transmission of Dharma, because he himself did not even know that he was a spy for the Great Qi Dynasty.

Because Yang Fei was indeed a cultivator of the Myriad Immortals Alliance, but before participating in the Immortal Alliance Grand Examination, he had met a pair of friends who were very knowledgeable about the Immortal Alliance Grand Examination and guessed some of the questions correctly.

"It can be confirmed that the Transmission of Dharma summoning these sixteen cultivators must be related to the 'Echoing Starlight' that is disturbing the Profound Yellow Realm."

"I just don't know what the Transmission of Dharma encountered that it needs these sixteen cultivators?"

"Moreover, the Echoing Starlight near the Immortal Ruins has now disappeared. I don't know how this group of people left the Profound Yellow Realm?"

This matter was too secret, and even the records in the Profound Sky Mirror were scarce.

"It's a pity that my Holy Embryo is on the other side of the Star Sea, otherwise I could have followed them and investigated."

As he thought of this, Li Fan's thoughts paused slightly.

He suddenly thought that the purpose of the Transmission of Dharma in the Dark Star Sea was to collect fragments from various immortal cultivation worlds.

And the location of the Holy Embryo was due to the mysterious Echoing Starlight, which attracted all the遗物 (relics) of cultivators in the Star Sea to gather there, forming a Sea of Relics.

"Since the relics have gathered, have the fragments of the immortal cultivation worlds also gathered?"

"Outside the Sea of Relics, does another Sea of Fragmented Realms exist?"

On the other side of the Star Sea, Li Fan's Holy Embryo, lurking and hidden outside the Profound Immortal Boat, suddenly opened his eyes.

His gaze seemed to pierce through the endless ruins and darkness, looking deep into the Sea of Relics.

"Could it be that I am very close to the Transmission of Dharma now?"

Li Fan could not help but think this way.

"If my guess is correct, then if I wait here, I might just wait for the sixteen cultivators of the Myriad Immortals Alliance."

"Thinking further, a being as powerful as the Transmission of Dharma, wandering in the Dark Star Sea for thousands of years, cannot be unaware of the Immortal Boat civilization hidden here. The two parties might have had contact long ago."

"It's just that the Immortal Boat might not know the true identity of the Transmission of Dharma."

Although based on the current information, the Immortal Boat civilization seems to be extremely weak, but being able to survive in the Dark Star Sea for tens of thousands of years, and even having some knowledge of the power of True Immortal Seal script...

The top power of the Immortal Boat is definitely not to be underestimated.

"Zhao Xian's strength is too low, and he knows very little about the past of the Immortal Boat."

"It seems that some 'pulling the seedlings to encourage growth' is needed."

Having drifted in the starry sea for ten thousand years, even without a civilization gap, the theoretical level of the Xuan Immortal Boat's cultivation methods has not progressed at all.

All the realms they saw were destroyed, and only various destructive residual True Immortal Seal script powers echoed in the starry sea. As they say, "one lives off the mountain near the mountain, and off the water near the water," the Xuan Immortal Boat thus pinned all its hopes on the research of this great power. As for other aspects...

Compared to the Xuanhuang Realm, which suffered greatly from calamities, it was more than a notch weaker.

At the very least, under the extreme environment where laws cannot be cultivated together, the various profound methods born in the Xuanhuang Realm were all breathtaking in the eyes of the Xuan Immortal Boat cultivators.

With the cultivation method library of the Myriad Immortals Alliance as its foundation, Li Fan's clone quickly found the most suitable cultivation method for Zhao Xian. Of course, in Zhao Xian's own view, this was part of the vast number of cultivation methods that the Academy of Law would deduce through the Law Derivation Jade in the future.

"Spirit God Unity Skill. A divine skill suitable for cultivators to cultivate even in extreme resource scarcity. It can achieve perfect coordination of divine sense and spiritual power, allowing either side to convert its strength to the weaker side."

"Within the Academy, the supply of spiritual power is extremely limited. It's already the limit for me to advance to the Golden Core. To go any further is impossible. However, I can use secret methods that increase divine sense power to drive the increase of spiritual power..."

"In the Academy's redemption list, the value of the items needed to perform secret methods is far less than that of spirit stones."

Zhao Xian, who was troubled by reaching a bottleneck, suddenly had an epiphany and recalled more from that strange dream of the future. In his excitement, he immediately spent all his accumulated contributions over the years to redeem the materials needed to temper his divine sense.

Black God Glue, Red Ancient Sap, Will-Nourishing Amber...

These common items in the Immortal Boat for calming the mind and spirit were forged and melted into crystal clear liquid by Zhao Xian using flames. Then, like a long whale sucking water, they continuously entered his sea of consciousness.

The scorching heat wave almost instantly burned Zhao Xian's divine sense to ashes.

After a brief blankness of consciousness, Zhao Xian found that he had adapted to this fiery heat. At the same time, the strength of his divine sense began to improve visibly.

"Truly a supreme profound method!" Zhao Xian marveled inwardly.

However, Zhao Xian did not know that the reason his fragile divine sense at the Qi Refining stage could be preserved during such intense smelting was entirely due to Li Fan's clone.

In fact, most of the effects of the liquid made from those treasures were absorbed and refined by Li Fan's clone. After all, Zhao Xian only had the cultivation of late Qi Refining, and even a sliver of diversion was enough to make his divine sense steadily improve.

When Zhao Xian awoke from his cultivation, he felt that the strength of his divine sense had almost quadrupled compared to before. It had reached the level of the middle Foundation Establishment stage.

Compared to this "vast" divine sense power, his spiritual power cultivation seemed somewhat weak.

It felt like a giant playing with a toy body.

Zhao Xian suppressed the ecstasy in his heart and quickly circulated the [Spirit God Unity Skill]. An invisible grinding wheel seemed to appear in his sea of consciousness, crushing the divine sense power and transforming it into pure energy to nourish Zhao Xian's body.

Without absorbing any spiritual energy, Zhao Xian's cultivation advanced madly at a terrifying speed.

Finally, after three days, Zhao Xian's divine sense and spiritual power balanced at the early stage of Foundation Establishment.

"I have successfully established my foundation?"

Zhao Xian, having recovered, looked at his hands with disbelief.

"The breakthrough was too easy, I didn't feel any inner demons or bottlenecks like my master and the seniors in the Academy spoke of."

"After establishing my foundation, my authority in the Academy has also increased significantly. I can redeem more resources. My cultivation will probably be faster than before..."

After all, he was just a young man, and he couldn't help but feel excited when fantasizing about the future.

Ultimately, the scene of the Immortal Boat's demise in the dream of the future brought him back to reality. "The road ahead is long, and I still have a long way to go. I cannot be arrogant."

Zhao Xian was contemplating how to better utilize his "foreknowledge" to achieve rapid status advancement.

Meanwhile, Li Fan's clone was savoring the scene of Zhao Xian's breakthrough.

Zhao Xian did not truly encounter no obstacles to his breakthrough; it was Li Fan who blocked him.

"That fluctuation that appeared out of nowhere and pierced directly into my heart."

"It's not True Immortal Seal script. It's the Heavenly Dao of the Starry Sea..."

At this moment, the Holy Fetus Li Fan outside the Xuan Immortal Boat suddenly sensed something.

His body came into direct contact with this space filled with a dead aura. During his journey across the Dark Star Sea, the Holy Fetus Li Fan had already understood that this Dark Star Sea actually shared a set of fundamental principles with the Xuanhuang Realm. In fact, its upper limit was even slightly higher than that of the Xuanhuang Realm.

His swordsmanship, which had reached its limit in the Xuanhuang Realm, had unknowingly broken through its original bottleneck and reached a new height during his journey across the starry sea.

And the bottleneck of [Heavenly Tribulation] that manifested in the Xuanhuang Realm had another form of existence in this Dark Star Sea.

"Tempting one to return to the Dao, all thoughts turn to dust. It was merely a breakthrough from late Qi Refining, yet it possessed such power. If not for my extensive experience and my exceptionally strong will..."

"I might have had to use the Immortal Heart Mantra to resolve it," the Holy Fetus Li Fan secretly warned himself.

In the illusions carried by that formless fluctuation, the Holy Fetus Li Fan seemed to see images of finally dying from various tribulations after a successful breakthrough through immense hardship.

No matter how hard he tried, he could not escape failure.

"It is better to return to the Dao, return to the Dao..."

The obsession echoed like a demonic chant in his sea of consciousness, urging him to give up cultivation.

"The Heavenly Dao of this Dark Star Sea is quite interesting. It bears some resemblance to the ancient inner demons recorded in the classics of the Xuanhuang Realm."

"By observing a leopard through a tube, one can see that although this star sea has been shattered by the power of True Immortal Seal script, its fundamental underlying operation is still intact."

The Holy Fetus Li Fan pondered, his vision suddenly opening, as if seeing a world with a broader heaven and earth, encompassing the world outside Xuanhuang.

Even though this world was already damaged and incomplete, it provided Li Fan with new ideas for comprehending the principles of the world.

He once again savored the contents of the Heavenly Doctor's [Heaven Mending Record].

"If the situation of the Xuanhuang Realm is like a stitched-together monster with a terminal illness, being resurrected by borrowing a corpse, then this Dark Star Sea is like one that has long since died, with most of its body crushed by immense force, leaving only a few residual limbs and fragments..."

"The Xuanhuang Realm can still be saved, but this Dark Star Sea is utterly beyond saving."

"Of course, this is from the perspective of the Heavenly Doctor when writing the [Heaven Mending Record]."

"The only thing that can be done is to dissect and analyze these world remnants, perhaps to infer and restore the state of the Dark Star Sea when it was alive."

"However, after all, it is an existence several levels higher than the ordinary Xuanhuang immortal cultivation world. Even a corpse can bring great benefits."

The aura of Holy Fetus Li Fan suddenly changed.

As if magma erupted, his cultivation, already at the peak of Nascent Soul Transformation, expanded several times in an instant.

It's a pity that the Holy Fetus still couldn't escape the restrictions between the clone and the main body.

It was as if an invisible shackle was firmly suppressing the surging aura.

Holy Fetus Li Fan grunted and even spat out a mouthful of blood.

Within the small world evolved by the black sword in his body, countless black fissures appeared, as if on the verge of destruction.

But Holy Fetus Li Fan's eyes were filled with excitement instead.

"Heaven and earth are incomplete, and the laws are weakened."

"As expected, in this Dark Star Sea, a clone can possibly surpass the main body in cultivation!"

Holy Fetus Li Fan savored the impact of the momentary expansion.

It was like a brutal force forcibly breaking the shackles of heaven and earth.

"I am still a little short of the driving force to break through. My path collapsed halfway, and I was counter-attacked."

"If I had accumulated a little more, I could have broken through that shackle in one go."

Li Fan suddenly remembered the scene when his clone cultivated the Heaven Swallowing Earth Devouring Great Law and finally forcefully broke through the bottleneck of "Heaven's Tribulation."

"This is called 'breaking the Dao with force.' In a normal great world, without being a True Immortal, one simply does not possess such immense power. But in the Dark Star Sea, heaven and earth are broken, and the requirements are greatly reduced."

"After my clone forcefully broke through the bottleneck of Heaven's Tribulation, it was counter-attacked by the Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao with that giant palm. In this Dark Star Sea, even such a backlash might not occur."

Holy Fetus Li Fan, like Zhao Xian just now, was filled with elation and a sudden realization.

"From one to ten thousand. Since this inherent law can be broken, can others also be achieved?"

"The fall of one whale gives life to all things. The death of the Star Sea, for the surviving cultivators, might be a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity."

"His strength, which far surpasses ordinary cultivators, not only relies on the new law cultivators of the entire Xuanhuang realm as his foundation, but perhaps it is also related to this."

"Having stayed in the Star Sea for ten thousand years, he is probably infinitely close to the legendary immortal."

...

The Holy Fetus's enlightenment in the Dark Star Sea also greatly impacted Li Fan's main body.

The discovery that the broken and incomplete Star Sea great world was beneficial to cultivators even caused his aura to be slightly disturbed.

This attracted the attention of the two Dao Integration elders, Hua Yueye and Zhang Xu.

"Friend Sun?"

"It's nothing, I just thought of my beloved wife at home and my mind wandered." Li Fan said somewhat ashamed.

The two guardians looked strange and nodded in understanding.

After stabilizing his mind, Li Fan's main body forcibly suppressed the urge to rush out of the Xuanhuang Realm immediately.

"Opportunities and crises have always coexisted."

"Although the current Dark Star Sea is a cultivation holy land for cultivators, there is no doubt that it is also fraught with danger."

"If it weren't for the Holy Fetus being a unique foundation built by Heaven, he would have likely perished halfway. Faced with the strange occurrences in the Star Sea, even the world evolved by my Five Elements Great Cave Heaven could not have supported it for long."

The invisible void in the dark abyss, and the deadly black plague...

Neither of them was something Li Fan could deal with currently.

"It's the same to use the Holy Fetus's enlightenment as a reference." Li Fan could only console himself.

"The sixteen Dao Integration cultivators of the Myriad Immortal Alliance, if they were to leave the Xuanhuang Realm, they should also be able to slowly discover this secret."

"It's just that I don't know if they can still return alive?"

Li Fan was pessimistic about the outcome for these sixteen people.

In Chuán Fǎ's eyes, Xuanhuang Realm cultivators were undoubtedly just tools.

This recruitment should not escape that fate.

"However, I can try to steal the method of flying out of the Xuanhuang Realm without using the reverberating star power."

"The appearance of reverberating star power in this life was purely accidental. There is no guarantee that it can be replicated in the future. And since I already know the importance of the Dark Star Sea, how can I miss it?"

"Even if it's top secret at this moment and cannot be investigated, after decades, or when the Great Dynasty begins to threaten the Myriad Immortal Alliance and war breaks out between the two sides, such secrets will be neglected and easy to inquire about."

...

Despite saying this, Li Fan was always paying attention to these sixteen people.

Through the Heavenly Profound Mirror, the divine sense remaining in the Sun family could stably maintain its form. With the recovery of the divine sense's strength, Sun Luyao in the Boundless Mirror also became increasingly powerful and his fusion with the Boundless Mirror became more evident.

One day, while spying through the Heavenly Profound Mirror, Sun Luyao suddenly mustered his courage and said to Li Fan, "Senior, I seem to have sensed the location of another fragment of the Boundless Mirror."

"Perhaps after absorbing it, the Boundless Mirror's abilities will be further enhanced."

Previously, the Sun brothers had searched almost the entire territory of the Myriad Immortal Alliance, and the fragment they found had indeed brought about a qualitative change to the Boundless Mirror. If it could recover more, it might even bring Li Fan a surprise.

However, Li Fan's divine sense pretended not to hear.

He patiently finished his observation through the Heavenly Profound Mirror, still unable to find information about the sixteen people summoned by Chuán Fǎ.

Only then did he coldly look at Sun Luyao and ask, "What location?"

Sun Luyao cautiously transmitted the information he had sensed.

"Oh?"

When Li Fan's divine sense saw the location pointed out by Sun Luyao, he couldn't help but feel a little surprised.

It was located in the Hundred Stone Cave Heaven, on the border of Shilin Prefecture.

The ruins of the Heavenly Mechanism Sect and the entrance to the Spirit Wood Realm were all in these underground, continuous cave systems.

"I know."

Li Fan's divine sense replied faintly, not showing any intention of going to search.

Sun Luyao did not dare to ask further.

Seven days later, Sun Luyuan came to the secret chamber again, and with Li Fan's permission, Sun Luyao excitedly repeated the matter.

In stark contrast to Li Fan's indifference, Sun Luyuan was immediately overjoyed.

"If you can find another fragment, you might not have to suffer so much!"

Sun Luyao nodded in agreement.

"By the way, brother, what was Fú's reaction when he found out about the human clone of the Heavenly Profound Mirror?" Sun Luyao asked again.

Sun Luyuan frowned upon hearing this. "The birth of a human clone from the Heavenly Profound Mirror is a matter of great importance, and must be handled with care. I can understand that he has no immediate reaction. However, what's strange is that I haven't been able to contact him since our last meeting."

"Can't contact him?"

"Not only Fú, but even the Myriad Immortal Alliance headquarters is temporarily inaccessible, as if something extremely important is happening."

Chapter 1206: The Boundless Ancient Mirror is Dusty

“This is truly strange, to actually put aside such an urgent matter as the Heavenly Profound Mirror potentially escaping as a human clone…”

“If I couldn’t still contact the outside, I would almost think the Immortal Alliance had already fallen,” Sun Luyuan said with a frown.

Sun Luyao feigned surprise, “Is that so? I couldn’t detect anything related to it within the Heavenly Profound Mirror?”

The two brothers exchanged a glance.

Sun Luyao said with some uncertainty, “I don’t know if my attempt to snoop failed, or if the Myriad Immortal Alliance and even the Heavenly Profound Mirror are concealing this matter?”

“The headquarters of the Immortal Alliance is an independent space within the Heavenly Profound Mirror. If they wanted to block the Heavenly Profound Mirror’s perception, it would likely require the combined efforts of the Council of Law Transmitters and the Mirror Master…” Sun Luyuan’s expression turned grave, as if recalling something.

“The headquarters of the Immortal Alliance is inside the Heavenly Profound Mirror?” Sun Luyao was unaware of this and was startled.

Sun Luyuan came back to his senses and nodded, but did not explain further.

“It’s a good thing Fú, that old fellow, is tied up. Let’s take this opportunity to find that fragment of the Boundless Mirror you sensed.”

“Okay, brother.” Sun Luyao naturally had no objections.

“I had originally wanted to take you to the Blood Essence Pool to nourish you during this rare break. We can only do it after you return,” Sun Luyuan said with a slight shake of his head.

The Blood Essence Pool was a secret place belonging to the Sun family, containing the blood essence donated by the direct descendants of the family.

Combined with secret arts for refinement, its effects were even better than the blood essence of a close relative like Sun Luyuan.

However, collecting the blood essence of family disciples could not be done too frequently, as it would surely arouse suspicion. Therefore, it took a considerable amount of time to accumulate enough for nourishment.

Sun Luyao had tasted it a few times before, and it did have some effect.

But…

“Compared to the methods of our ancestors, it is far inferior.”

Family blood essence nourishment, in the end, was about strengthening Sun Luyao’s residual soul.

The stronger his own power, the easier it would be to erode the Boundless Mirror.

As for Li Fan, he directly presented the method of controlling the Boundless Mirror before him.

Not only did he no longer need to use brute force to erode it, but even the damaged and disordered Boundless Mirror showed signs of slow recovery, making him no longer feel the same pain when facing it.

Although he thought this in his heart, he still had to maintain appearances.

So, he put on a look of slight regret.

Sun Luyuan saw this and comforted him, “Let’s see if this outing is smooth. If you return quickly, there will still be ample time.”

After saying this, Sun Luyuan returned and made some preparations.

When he reappeared in the secret chamber, he had already transformed into the appearance of a junior from the Sun family.

This was Sun Luyuan’s usual disguise.

“Let’s go.”

Putting the Boundless Mirror into his embrace, Sun Luyuan quietly left the Sun family and headed towards Shilin Prefecture.

Perhaps due to its damaged and unstable nature, the Boundless Mirror could not be used with teleportation arrays and could only be moved by physical flight.

Fortunately, this distance was not too far for a cultivator at the Dao Integration stage. They soon arrived at the entrance of the Hundred Stone Cave Heaven.

Following Sun Luyao’s senses, he continued to descend into the underground cavern.

When he encountered a dead end, he forcibly broke through, getting closer and closer to the destination.

“This damned place.” The deeper he went, the harder the walls of the cavern became, and Sun Luyuan was beginning to struggle.

“Brother, it’s close.” Sun Luyao sensed the familiar aura ahead and couldn’t help but feel excited.

Perhaps because he was too deep underground before, it affected his senses. Now that he had truly arrived here, he realized that this fragment might be larger than he had imagined.

“Hmm?! Someone behind us?”

Just as he was separated from the Boundless Mirror fragment by a single wall, Sun Luyuan’s expression suddenly changed, and he stopped.

“I’m being tracked.”

Sun Luyuan reacted quickly, immediately changed direction, and continued to move deeper into the cavern. With a sudden acceleration, his figure instantly vanished into the maze-like passages.

Two cultivators in blue robes then appeared, their expressions somewhat grim.

“Damn it, he discovered us.”

“It seems Sun Luyuan’s cultivation has advanced again.”

“It doesn’t matter, we have already sealed the entrance. He cannot escape.”

…

However, what these two did not know was that deeper in the cavern, Sun Luyuan had already seen all their actions through the Boundless Mirror.

“Tian Quan, the Chen family.”

Sun Luyuan snorted coldly.

He had long been aware of the subtle machinations of the Medicine Hall’s Chen family, who had always coveted the Boundless Mirror.

But after all, the other party still had some foundation, and without concrete action, there was no reason to attack.

“They actually came to my doorstep and gave me an opportunity.”

A plan dawned on Sun Luyuan instantly.

He revealed his aura, drawing the two members of the Chen family deeper underground.

Then he quietly hid himself and quickly returned to the location of the Boundless Mirror fragment.

*Boom!*

He opened a sealed cave and quickly located the fragment.

This seemed to be the ruins of an ancient sect. The Boundless Mirror fragment had been merged into another mirror-like magical treasure.

It was a pity that this sect had long since perished, and this mirror-like magical treasure had been covered in dust and buried underground for thousands of years.

Knowing that it was not a place to linger, Sun Luyuan did not have time to examine it carefully and put it away.

Then, he no longer bothered to hide. He even burned his blood essence, unleashing all his power in an instant.

In a flash, he had already reached the exit of the Hundred Stone Cave Heaven.

The two cultivators guarding the exit were caught off guard and could not resist. Sun Luyuan managed to rush out.

“Chen family! If I don’t avenge this, I am not human!”

Although he was not injured, Sun Luyuan suddenly spat out a mouthful of blood, and his aura rapidly weakened.

His voice boomed like thunder, echoing in the sky above Shilin Prefecture for a long time.

Then Sun Luyuan transformed into a streak of light and flew towards the center of the Immortal Alliance.

He left behind two somewhat bewildered Chen family cultivators.

When the two Dao Integration cultivators, who had been lured away, finally arrived from the depths of the cavern, they realized what had happened.

“This is bad.” The four exchanged glances, their expressions grim.

Since the matter had been exposed, they could no longer pursue him in broad daylight.

“This operation has failed. The Sun family will likely tear down all pretense of friendship. We should go back and discuss how to deal with this.”

“Hmph, at worst, we’ll give up on that immortal artifact and make this matter public. I don’t believe his small Sun family can still protect that immortal artifact, can they?”

The four members of the Chen family disappeared one after another.

In Shilin Prefecture, the loud roar Sun Luyuan had just uttered gradually became a topic of discussion among people.

A storm was slowly spreading.

At the same time, Sun Luyuan had already returned home.

He went straight to the underground secret chamber and took out the Boundless Mirror.

…

Just one chapter today. I’m too tired after returning from a business trip.

On the road, Sun Luyuan could clearly feel the Boundless Mirror in his embrace stirring restlessly, as well as the familiar uncontrollable roars of his younger brother, Sun Luyao. He forcefully suppressed it until they safely returned before releasing it.

"Brother, hurry and give it to me! I can't take it anymore!"

The mirror surface continuously shook violently, and Sun Luyao's smoky black shadow seemed to be constantly buffeted by a hurricane, twisting and indistinct.

"Calm down!"

Sun Luyuan let out a low shout, skillfully drawing a drop of his own vital blood to alleviate his brother's frenzy. Only then did he take out the mirror he had retrieved from the Hundred Stone Winter Ruins.

The aura of shared origin indicated that the main body of the mirror was a fragment of the Boundless Mirror. However, it had been reforged into a standalone magical treasure. Sun Luyuan carefully broke the remaining restrictions on the mirror before tossing it to his brother.

With the restraints gone, the darkness greedily floated above the mirror. Dark beams of light spewed from Sun Luyao's mouth, corroding the ancient treasure. As the mirror slowly disappeared into the black light, the somewhat old and dilapidated Boundless Mirror, where Sun Luyao's essence resided, began to change at a visible rate. The marks of time slowly vanished, the ancient feel gone, replaced by a sense of weathered vicissitude. The surface of the Boundless Mirror pulsed with a heart-palpitating luster from time to time, causing even Sun Luyuan to feel a slight tremor in his heart.

"Is this the power of a celestial artifact..." he mused inwardly, his anticipation for his brother's performance after awakening from his devouring growing even stronger.

Meanwhile, the true master of the Boundless Mirror, the divine consciousness of Li Fan hidden within, could witness the Boundless Mirror's transformation more directly. Or rather, its recovery. The initially incomplete Array of Boundlessness and Primordial Emptiness was gradually being filled. As if it had found its core, an indescribable and wondrous power flowed out from the array like a gentle stream, nourishing the old and worn body of the Boundless Mirror. This was also why, to outsiders, the celestial artifact looked brand new in the blink of an eye.

In addition, Li Fan's divine consciousness benefited from this as well. From a divine consciousness, it began to transform into a soul. Li Fan even had the feeling that if he continued to absorb the energy within the Boundless Mirror, given enough time, his divine consciousness could grow even stronger than his main soul! To think that the realm Li Fan had reached, built on solid foundations step by step, could be rivaled by the energy within this broken mirror! Even if it was only in terms of the soul, it greatly shocked Li Fan.

He echoed Sun Luyuan's sentiment: "Is this the power of a celestial artifact?"

The energy surging from the Boundless Mirror seemed to be order, it seemed to be vitality. However, just as Li Fan thought it would completely repair the Boundless Mirror, the mirror uncontrollably plummeted to the ground. The mirror surface projected a mass of light and shadow that enveloped the underground secret chamber. The images flashed by rapidly. The premonitory scenes sent both Sun Luyuan and Li Fan's hearts into a violent tremor.

The peaceful land of Xuanhuang was engulfed in war. Cultivators of the Myriad Immortal Alliance clashed with another unknown force. Arrows of light streaked across the sky, causing earth-shattering explosions wherever they struck. A golden, shining giant was locked in a fierce battle with a black-haired, bare-chested man. The white mist barrier of heaven and earth even distorted and fractured under the impact of their power. Even more unsettling was the presence of a figure in a black imperial robe, whose face was hidden, standing above everyone on the battlefield. Opposite him, another figure was equally unclear.

With a boom! As if pushed to its extreme, the projected image of the Boundless Mirror suddenly twisted into a single point, then erupted in a burst of intense white light. After the light disappeared, there was only a silent, deep darkness.

With a hiss! A crack reappeared on the surface of the Boundless Mirror, which had just begun to recover. Sun Luyao let out a scream as his black shadow was forcibly sucked back into the mirror.

"Brother!"

Sun Luyuan instantly snapped out of his shock, his expression changing as he reached for the Boundless Mirror. However, as his hand drew near, it felt as if it had been scalded by intense flames, and he recoiled sharply. Sun Luyuan looked at his outstretched right hand with grave seriousness. In such a short time, it appeared to have aged thousands of years, the skin shriveled and wrinkled. It wasn't just his physical body. Sun Luyuan felt that a part of his soul had truly experienced the passage of time and could no longer return to its original state. If a mere touch could have such an effect, let alone Li Fan's divine consciousness within the Boundless Mirror.

Earlier, upon seeing the Boundless Mirror spontaneously deducing the future of Xuanhuang, Li Fan, amidst his shock, wanted to examine it closely. But then a fatal sense of danger suddenly arose in his heart, making him unable to care about anything else. This eroding power, hidden in the deepest recesses of the Boundless Mirror, was not detected by Li Fan's divine consciousness, which had essentially mastered it, until it erupted. And it came so swiftly and explosively. As if it could even erode time, the Boundless Mirror, which had just regained some vitality after absorbing the fragment, instantly went through a million tribulations of wind and frost, becoming decrepit once more. The core of the Boundless Mirror, the Primordial Emptiness Array, was also like being swept by a strong wind; its somewhat complete structure became damaged again. Li Fan's divine consciousness naturally could not escape. It was already a wisp of residual spirit, quickly becoming like a candle in the wind, on the verge of complete dissipation. Fortunately, firstly, Li Fan had already refined the Boundless Mirror to a large extent using the formation refinement method, and by residing within the mirror, he gained some resistance with its power. Secondly, at the critical moment when he realized his divine consciousness was about to perish, Li Fan instinctively recited the Xuanhuang Immortal Heart Incantation. Although it couldn't recover what had been worn away, it greatly slowed down the dissipation of his divine consciousness in this storm.

After enduring for a long time, the terrifying calamity within the Boundless Mirror finally slowly subsided. Li Fan sensed that it hadn't disappeared, but had returned to the depths of the Boundless Mirror, lying in wait once more. It was then that Sun Luyuan's anxious voice slowly reached him.

"Brother, what's wrong?"

Sun Luyao, however, was too severely damaged to respond. Seeing this, Sun Luyuan reacted swiftly. He immediately took the Boundless Mirror into the Sun family's vital blood pool. Although called a vital blood pool, it did not smell of blood at all. Instead, it was filled with the fragrance of heavenly treasures. The pool water was not blood-red, but a dreamlike, seven-colored radiance, like flowing light from the heavens. Immersed within it, Li Fan's somewhat aged divine consciousness finally felt some relief.

"Why is the consumption so fast?" Sun Luyuan exclaimed in surprise at the speed at which the vital blood pool water changed color. However, he then gritted his teeth and left, clearly to gather more vital blood.

Li Fan, having survived the ordeal, began to recall the terrifying power within the Boundless Mirror.

"Is this the reason for the Boundless Mirror's damage?"

"It felt even more potent than those True Immortal inscription characters."

"Although everything I've seen so far has been replicas of True Immortal inscription characters, what's in the Boundless Mirror is merely residual aftershocks."

"Could the calamity in the Immortal Realm be related to this?"

Despite his myriad of curiosities, Li Fan had no immediate desire to probe further.

Anything capable of destroying the Immortal Realm was certainly beyond his current capabilities.

"It only left some traces within the Boundless Mirror. Even if induced to release, it could at most engulf a city."

"It might only be useful at critical junctures," Li Fan mused.

"It's no wonder such a dignified immortal artifact ended up occupied by the remnant soul of a Foundation Establishment cultivator. The erasure storm was truly terrifying."

"An immortal artifact that originally belonged to the Boundless Sect, located in the Xuanhuang Realm, has undergone such a transformation..."

"Doesn't that imply that this calamity occurred in the Xuanhuang Realm?"

"If residual waves could damage an immortal artifact, its occurrence would surely have left some traces."

Li Fan's thoughts halted. He suddenly thought of two major events that had altered the historical trajectory of the Xuanhuang Realm, which might be related to this.

The first was the inexplicable disappearance of King Xuantian, Xuanyuan Hong.

The second was the disappearance of the six top-tier Longevity Realm cultivators who had jointly besieged Falun, who was then only at the Dao Integration cultivation level.

"These individuals' cultivation levels were already at the pinnacle of their era."

"Ordinary things within the Xuanhuang Realm could not harm them. Unless..."

Li Fan's heart stirred.

"A power that transcends the mortal."

Li Fan also remembered the Grand Master Tiandu, who arrived in the Xuanhuang Realm after the great calamity. He had been residing in Daoyuan Prefecture ever since he was injured.

"Was his arrival truly a coincidence?"

At this moment, a strong sense of doubt arose in Li Fan's heart.

This matter also served as a wake-up call for Li Fan.

Even though his perspective could now extend beyond the Xuanhuang Realm to the other side of the sea of stars, there were still beings within the Xuanhuang Realm that he could not fathom or reach.

He had to be extremely cautious in everything he did.

As his thoughts churned, Sun Luyuan had already returned in a hurry.

He refined a large lump of vital blood and several other materials, adding them to the vital blood pool. The pool water, which had become somewhat dim, once again overflowed with radiant light. Li Fan also showed concern for the Boundless Mirror's condition. It had almost returned to its state before absorbing the fragments. However, it was now more complete, and Li Fan believed that once Sun Luyao woke up, his condition would improve to a certain extent.

Moreover, Li Fan had also briefly glimpsed a more complete Grand Primordial Square Array. While not perfectly restored, it was capable of some repairs.

Three days later, Sun Luyao, the spirit of the Boundless Mirror, finally briefly awakened from his comatose state.

"Brother, I need some things."

After informing him of the materials needed to repair the array, he fell unconscious again.

Sun Luyuan looked at the list of materials provided by his brother and hurried to gather them.

During this time, the Chen family of the Medicine Hall, fearing retaliation from Sun Luyuan if he became desperate, had been closely monitoring his movements. However, Sun Luyuan seemed to have forgotten about them. He went in and out, appearing to be busy with some urgent matter. This left the Chen family confused. Furthermore, their backer, Chan, the Transmitter from the Immortal Alliance headquarters, remained uncontactable. Therefore, the Chen family chose to wait and observe.

With Sun Luyuan's unreserved efforts in collecting the items, the necessary materials were soon procured. Although it appeared that Sun Luyao was absorbing them, it was actually Li Fan's divine sense intervening. As the fragmented core of the array was restored, the condition of the Boundless Mirror gradually stabilized.

Upon hearing about his brother's ordeal, Sun Luyuan's brow furrowed.

"Brother, do you remember the ancient ruin where we found this mirror?"

Sun Luyao paused slightly.

"I originally thought that ruin was merely an ancient site that had endured the passage of time. But now that you mention it..."

Sun Luyuan's expression turned grim. "It seems that place was destroyed by the erasure storm within the mirror..."

"Perhaps it was precisely because of the previous release that we brothers had an opportunity. Otherwise, with our cultivation at the time, how could we have subdued this mirror?"

Sun Luyao recalled the past scenes and slowly understood.

"That's possible. I remember that there was almost nothing of value to be found in the ruins. The only things recognized by the Heavenly Profound Mirror had very low contribution points for recycling..."

"Rest and recover. I will go back and investigate that ruin again in some time. The entrance is extremely secret, and since only ruins remain, not much should have changed over the years. Perhaps there will be some discoveries." Sun Luyuan said solemnly.

"Brother, be careful." Sun Luyao did not try to dissuade him but cautioned him.

"And what about the Chen family..." Sun Luyuan suddenly snorted. He recalled the scene inexplicably deduced by the Boundless Mirror earlier.

"That force, which is locked in a fierce battle with the Myriad Immortal Alliance, seems to be the Great Qi Dynasty that my brother investigated earlier."

"This suggests that the Heavenly Profound Mirror's prediction has some basis."

"Two miraculous artifacts have made such a prediction..."

"It seems it's time to try and make contact with them."

Sun Luyuan certainly wouldn't approach them directly at first. After all, the Great Qi Dynasty had not yet openly opposed the Myriad Immortal Alliance. He would send his confidant to gather information first before making any further decisions.

In comparison, the Boundless Mirror, which was initially thought to be a treasure but had now become a potential disaster waiting to erupt, caused Sun Luyuan more worry. His brother had become the spirit of the Boundless Mirror and could not possibly abandon it.

After making some preparations, Sun Luyuan planned to return to the ruin from that year. The encounter at Hundred Stone Grotto-Heaven had made Sun Luyuan aware that the Chen family was still monitoring him in secret. To avoid unnecessary trouble, Sun Luyuan directly contacted an old friend.

Ji Hongdao!

"Old Ji, I need your help with something..." Sun Luyuan contacted him via a spiritual talisman.

Soon, Ji Hongdao arrived at the Sun family's doorstep.

"Hahaha, Old Sun, the favor I owed you back then can finally be repaid," Ji Hongdao laughed heartily.

"I heard you had a conflict with the Chen family of the Medicine Hall recently?" Ji Hongdao suddenly lowered his voice after entering the house.

"Yes, the treasure that Luyao resides in was somehow known to the Chen family," Sun Luyuan replied truthfully.

Ji Hongdao understood.

"Don't worry. Although they have a Transmitter as their backer, you also have the Mirror Master supporting you."

"Now that their actions have been exposed, they won't dare to act rashly again in the short term."

Sun Luyuan said sternly, "The evildoer is at his end, but one cannot be too careful. I will need your help during this outing, my brother."

"Rest assured, with me here, these people wouldn't dare to act presumptuously again," Ji Hongdao said proudly. "Even the Chen family would hesitate to offend both the Formation Hall and the Dharma Protector Hall simultaneously."

"Thank you, Brother Ji," Sun Luyuan clasped his hands in thanks. "My destination for this trip is the Great Rift Valley in Fuguan State."

A hint of surprise flashed in Ji Hongdao's eyes upon hearing this. He then reminded Sun Luyuan, "This journey might encounter some complications."

Seeing Sun Luyuan's puzzled expression, Ji Hongdao paused. "What, you didn't know? Due to the previous great upheaval of heaven and earth, the Fuguan Great Rift Valley has been compressed and sealed shut."

"The terrain is completely unrecognizable. To enter the depths of the original rift valley…"

Sun Luyuan's brows furrowed. After a long moment, he sighed, "If that's the case, all we can do is our best and leave the rest to fate."

Sun Luyuan brought along the Immeasurable Mirror, which had slightly recovered its energy, and followed Ji Hongdao as they sped towards their destination. Their relationship was clearly not ordinary, and on the way to the Great Rift Valley, Sun Luyuan explained the reason for his trip in detail to Ji Hongdao. Of course, he downplayed and concealed the specific power of the tribulation wind that the Immeasurable Mirror had suddenly unleashed.

"You suspect that the ancient ruins where the Immeasurable Mirror was first discovered were actually caused by the Immeasurable Mirror itself?" Ji Hongdao, having not witnessed the terrifying calamity firsthand, didn't think much of it, merely considering it as something that could threaten cultivators at the Dao Integration stage.

"That's right. Since it's the origin of the Immeasurable Mirror, perhaps we can find a way to deal with the tribulation of annihilation that the Immeasurable Mirror brings. As long as we find some records, even failed attempts, they can serve as lessons learned…"

As they were talking, both of them suddenly changed their expressions. They had discovered a cultivator at the Dao Integration stage from the Chen family following them.

"It's Chen Ruoyu from the Chen family," Ji Hongdao transmitted to Sun Luyuan. "Don't get entangled with him, shake him off."

A white halo enveloped them, and with the enhancement of a formation, their speed suddenly surged, becoming several times faster in an instant. In the blink of an eye, they had disappeared over the horizon. Chen Ruoyu, seeing this, also accelerated to give chase.

A moment later.

"Brother Ji, your 'Golden Cicada Sheds Its Shell' trick is truly a masterful move."

"Hmph, it's no problem dealing with these fools who only know how to refine medicine," replied Ji Hongdao. Two silhouettes suddenly appeared out of thin air and then flew off in another direction.

After shaking off the Chen family's pursuit, they spent another half a day before finally arriving at the so-called Great Rift Valley in Fuguan State. Sun Luyuan looked at a long, undulating mountain range on the ground, and his face twitched involuntarily.

"Brother Sun, do you still remember the specific location from back then?" Ji Hongdao asked.

Sun Luyuan recalled carefully. "I can only pinpoint the general vicinity. From here on, it will depend on luck."

Just then, Sun Luyuan suddenly sensed a message from his brother. "Brother, get a little closer to the ground. I seem to have a faint sense."

Sun Luyuan was overjoyed. He flew around the mountain range close to the ground and quickly locked onto the source of the sense.

"Wait."

Just as Sun Luyuan was about to force his way underground, Ji Hongdao stopped him. He took out a flying ship and said, "Get inside."

"Dust Crossing Boat?!" Sun Luyuan was a little surprised, then unhesitatingly climbed inside. The Dust Crossing Boat turned into a yellow light and slowly sank into the ground, melting into the earth like ice.

Looking at the constantly changing soil layers around them, and the residual prohibition energies within the ruins, Sun Luyuan sighed, "Thank goodness for your treasure, Brother Ji, otherwise it would have taken considerable effort."

Ji Hongdao nodded. "It was also a gift from Chief Lu. She has been at the Immortal Alliance headquarters recently and couldn't get away. So, she ordered me to run some errands for her."

The Dust Crossing Boat traveled downwards, its hull repeatedly colliding with the buried objects in the earth. The surface of the boat emitted red and orange light, nullifying the impact. Ji Hongdao, meanwhile, occasionally chanted incantations to set up formations, increasing the protective power of the Dust Crossing Boat.

"I wonder what kind of place this rift valley was in ancient times, to have so many ruins buried beneath it." Not only were there architectural ruins, but as they went deeper, the two of them also saw large piles of bones. There were human bones, as well as those of unknown giant creatures, which caused even the well-traveled Ji Hongdao and Sun Luyuan to feel a sense of trepidation.

"Brother, it seems to be right here!" Sun Luoyao finally spoke when they had descended over three thousand feet underground. The Dust Crossing Boat suddenly stopped. The pressure here was already immense, and the red halo outside the boat continuously swirled, dissipating the external pressure. Sun Luyuan and Ji Hongdao looked around, but found no sign of the ruins.

"The changes are too great; there's no trace of the past. However, the depth is indeed about right," Sun Luyuan said.

Ji Hongdao also surveyed the area. "This place..."

"Seems peculiar!" A circular array plate flew out from his embrace and hovered overhead, casting white light around them. Under the white light, Sun Luyuan could faintly see some dark golden characters flash by.

"There are still formation remnants here," Sun Luyuan exclaimed in surprise. Although he wasn't proficient in formations, he understood some basic principles.

"Brother, it seems like we can enter here."

Just as Ji Hongdao was using his formation to scan the surroundings, trying to find an entrance, his brother Sun Luoyao found it first. Ji Hongdao immediately shone the array plate's white light to verify. Indeed, in a place that appeared to be solid rock, the golden characters appeared more frequently than before. Ji Hongdao closed his eyes and deduced. After the time it took for a cup of tea to steep, he let out a low cry and pointed forward.

As if a piece of paper was torn open, countless golden characters shattered and scattered. The Dust Crossing Boat seized the opportunity to fly in. The shattered characters then showed signs of rejoining.

"Don't worry, this is a hidden formation that can absorb subterranean energy and operate automatically." Ji Hongdao said proudly, "Judging by its structure, it's completely different from what we use now. It must be quite old. I have completely grasped its structure and can enter and exit at will."

Sun Luyuan repeatedly flattered him, "It was the right decision to ask Brother Ji for help this time! Otherwise, just this formation alone would have troubled me for who knows how long. But it's a bit strange, we brothers didn't encounter this formation when we came before..." Sun Luyuan suddenly became alert.

Within the Immeasurable Mirror, listening to his brother and Ji Hongdao's conversation, Sun Luoyao secretly glanced at the silhouette not far away, his heart filled with even greater reverence. Ji Hongdao took the time it takes for a cup of tea to break the formation. As for that senior... he found the entrance with just a glance.

That's right, he could sense this place not by any means of induction, but entirely by the senior's guidance. Feeling Sun Luoyao's mixture of awe and fear, Li Fan's divine sense paid no mind. While Sun Luyuan and Ji Hongdao were still cautiously exploring, he had already completed a full scan of this ancient ruin the moment he arrived, using the Immeasurable Mirror.

"Yi Shi Sect?" Li Fan's tone was inexplicably complex.

Yi Shi Sect, along with Heavenly Sword Sect and Great Dao Sect, was one of the Ten Great Immortal Sects of the past. However, its presence was relatively weak. Not only was there little contact with it in the Realm of Fallen Immortals, but in the current era, it was difficult to find any related records. It was as if they had suddenly evaporated from the world. Apart from learning from Elder Stone Slab that the Five Elements Grand Grotto-heaven, which he used to form his Nascent Soul, was a creation of Yi Shi Sect, Li Fan had not delved much deeper into their history. He never expected to find traces of Yi Shi Sect three thousand feet underground in this rift valley today.

However, these were merely traces. The entire ruin was empty. Except for a stone tablet with the characters "Yi Shi" faintly carved within a collapsed building in the center of the ruin, there was nothing left that indicated the grandeur of the ancient Ten Great Immortal Sects.

"It seems Yi Shi Sect didn't fare well."

After inquiring with Sun Luoyao, he learned that this was indeed the ruin where they had discovered the Immeasurable Mirror back then. However, they had only explored a small portion of it. Now, for some unknown reason, the formations separating different areas had disappeared, revealing the true appearance of Yi Shi Sect.

"Immeasurable Primordial Chaos, Observe One Realm!" Li Fan's clone softly chanted. Silently, the Immeasurable Mirror emitted a faint, imperceptible glow. In an instant, it enveloped the entire Yi Shi Sect ruin. Thus, a complete map of the ruin's structure, including areas with spiritual energy fluctuations, hidden secret chambers, and the danger levels of each location, was instantly synchronized and displayed within the Immeasurable Mirror. All of this was accomplished by the Immeasurable Mirror right under Ji Hongdao's nose, yet the formation master, who was among the top echelon of formation masters in the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance, had no inkling of it.

Li Fan's mind recalled the scene from the 114th life, when he traveled from Congyun Sea to Tianyu Continent to study formations, and Ji Hongdao personally lectured to thousands of aspiring formation masters in the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance. In his eyes then, let alone Ji Hongdao, even Huangfu Song's formation skills were beyond his reach. After only a dozen or so reincarnations, his formation skills had reached a level that Ji Hongdao couldn't comprehend.

"I have been progressing in every life, while they have remained stagnant… The gap will only widen in the future." Li Fan looked at Sun Luyuan and his brother, who were still cautiously exploring, and shook his head slightly. Having lost patience, he directly ordered Sun Luoyao to guide them to the only part of the current Yi Shi Sect that still held value.

"Brother Sun, be careful. The aura of the formations here is the most complete…" Ji Hongdao warned, leading the way. Sun Luyuan felt a bit speechless but couldn't expose himself. The two proceeded with extreme caution, passing through a wall concealed by formations and entering a secret chamber.

In the deepest part of the secret chamber, two statues, one large and one small, were placed. The larger one was seated on a cushion, holding a whisk. The smaller one stood behind it, with a smiling face. These peculiar statues instantly captured their attention. Without acting rashly, they observed them carefully.

"They seem to be just ordinary stone statues, with no hidden mechanisms," Ji Hongdao concluded after a long time. Sun Luyuan breathed a sigh of relief.

At the same time, within the Immeasurable Mirror, Li Fan glanced at the scene previously scanned and drawn by the Primordial Chaos Observing Square Array, then at the secret chamber. His heart sank. "Can you see those two statues?" Li Fan asked Sun Luoyao.

"Statues? What statues?" Sun Luoyao was stunned and bewildered.

"Tell your brother not to touch it." Li Fan did not explain but directly ordered. Receiving the reminder from Sun Luoyao, Sun Luyuan, out of trust in his brother, stopped Ji Hongdao, who was about to investigate.

"Brother, what danger is there in this thing?" However, he examined the stone statues for a long time without discerning any peculiarity.

"I have a similar record in ancient texts that I came across by chance before. They seem to be the origin of the inheritance of the Ten Sects, Grand Mage Tiandu…" Sun Luoyao relayed Li Fan's judgment.

"Grand Mage Tiandu?" Sun Luyuan and Ji Hongdao both took a step back simultaneously. They had heard of this legendary figure. It was said that he was at the realm of Half-step True Immortal. And anything related to True Immortals, no matter how tangential, would instill fear. The higher one's cultivation, the more they understood the gap between cultivators and True Immortals, and the more so.

Within the Immeasurable Mirror, Li Fan's clone's thoughts raced. He had suffered greatly at the hands of the faceless True Immortal statue before. It took him six lifetimes of reincarnation to eliminate the faceless True Immortal's influence on him. Although Grand Mage Tiandu was not on the same level as the faceless True Immortal, he had also left an imprint on him at that time. He had to be cautious.

"Yi Shi Sect's inheritance comes from Grand Mage Tiandu, and the sect houses a statue of the Grand Mage. It seems reasonable."

"But…"

"The other nine Immortal Sects do not seem to have statues of Grand Mage Tiandu."

"Moreover, even if they wanted to worship him, they should have placed it in the solemn main hall, not in a dark underground secret chamber." Li Fan's intuition told him that something was amiss.

"Yi Shi Sect doesn't seem like a good person who respects their teachers and teachings. According to Elder Stone Slab's description, as early as the initial signs of the Great Calamity in the Xuanhuang Realm, they had already made plans to cultivate the Five Elements Grand Grotto-heaven and directly devour Xuanhuang, creating a new immortal cultivation world. It was only later that they were stopped."

"The one who stopped Yi Shi Sect was undoubtedly Mr. Bai."

"Before the Xuanhuang Heaven and Earth completely opposed cultivators, cultivators still revered the Heavenly Dao. Heaven and Earth nurtured them, like the parents of cultivators. But Yi Shi Sect was utterly ruthless in extracting the essence of Heaven and Earth, no different from new law cultivators."

"Grand Mage Tiandu…" Li Fan once again scanned the statue of Grand Mage Tiandu with the Primordial Chaos Observing Square Array.

There was a large and a small statue. Legend had it that the seated one imparted countless cultivation techniques and secret arts to the Ten Sects. But an inexplicable intuition told Li Fan that the standing child might be even more extraordinary. Thus, the Primordial Chaos Observing Square Array focused its attention on the smiling child statue.

The immeasurable dim light swept over the area where the statues were located time and time again. With each scan, lines slowly began to appear in the image displayed in the Immeasurable Mirror. However, at the same time, these lines slowly disappeared as time passed. Li Fan squinted his eyes, accelerating the scanning speed of the Immeasurable Mirror. The lines slowly accumulated again.

"Brother. Help me." Unable to withstand the excessive usage, Sun Luoyao sought help from his brother. With the support of Sun Luyuan's vital blood, the Immeasurable Mirror finally managed to discern the true appearance of the statues in the secret chamber.

They were two bones. It was as if all the flesh and blood of some creature had been stripped away, leaving only these two bones.

Normally, if they were just ordinary remains, Li Fan shouldn't have sensed any life force from them.

But these two bones before him...

Made Li Fan's heart suddenly clench, as if he were being watched by some entity.

The stone statues formed by the bones seemed as if they could come alive at any moment, exuding strange auras.

Li Fan made a decisive move, ending his scrying with the Immeasurable Mirror without a second thought.

The scene before him abruptly changed.

The bones disappeared, and the two seemingly ordinary stone statues reappeared.

The sense of danger in Li Fan's heart slowly receded.

"Senior..." Sun Luoyao, startled by the recent event, was at a loss.

"Tell your brother to stay away from those two stone statues," Li Fan instructed calmly, though a tempest raged within him.

To whom did those two bones truly belong, if not Grand Master Tiandu?

Judging by their appearance, they were highly likely to be Grand Master Tiandu's.

But why would a half-immortal have two bones in the Primordial Chaos Sect?

"Could it be that he was so heavily injured that his own bones were snatched away by cultivators, and he was powerless to retrieve them?"

This thought flashed through Li Fan's mind.

But he quickly cast doubt upon it.

Was it possible?

The power that enveloped the entire Yuan Dao Prefecture, capable of devouring ten years of time, indicated that the Grand Master had not yet perished.

The might of a half-immortal, no matter how gravely injured, was not something cultivators below the immortal realm could contend with.

Not to mention, he was a cultivator of the ancient longevity path.

"Unless..."

"Immeasurable Mirror."

Li Fan looked at the timid Sun Luoyao, the new spirit of the Immeasurable Mirror.

When the Sun brothers found the damaged Immeasurable Mirror, its immortal artifact spirit had already vanished, allowing the two mortals to gain control.

From the recent cataclysmic wind disaster that erupted within the Immeasurable Mirror, it seemed that the artifact spirit had dissipated and the Immeasurable Mirror was damaged while resisting this calamity.

"The Immeasurable Mirror is an ancient artifact of profound mystery, bestowed upon the Immeasurable Sect by the immortal realm. Even if the immortal realm were to perish due to unspeakable tribulations, the Immeasurable Mirror should not have been affected. Yet, this cataclysmic wind disaster, which should not have appeared in the mortal realm, occurred within the Immeasurable Mirror..."

Li Fan suddenly recalled how, in the sea of stars, after the sacred embryo's divine sense infiltrated the Xuan Immortal Boat, it synchronistically brought the formless calamity from the dark sea of stars, causing the deaths of several cultivators.

"Propagation..."

"Beyond Xuanhuang..."

In the history of the Xuanhuang Realm, the only known individual to have had contact with the immortal realm and originated from beyond Xuanhuang was Grand Master Tiandu.

"It appears that both the Immeasurable Mirror and even the Primordial Chaos Sect may have been affected by the Grand Master."

The past events of this place were too complex, and the clues currently available were too few, for Li Fan to do anything more than speculate.

"However, if my speculation is close to the truth, then perhaps the troubles of the Immeasurable Mirror can be resolved." Li Fan's eyes gleamed.

Upon learning of the risks of this place, Ji Hongdao and Sun Luyuan wisely chose to temporarily leave the secret chamber.

However, they had a slight disagreement on what to do next.

"The remains of Grand Master Tiandu are no trivial matter. We should report this to the Immortal Alliance as soon as possible," Ji Hongdao said solemnly.

Sun Luyuan clearly objected: "Brother Ji, you are being foolish! Grand Master Tiandu is said to be the master of the Ten Sects of Immortality. If this information reaches the Five Elders Council, they will undoubtedly go to great lengths to retrieve them. A great war is inevitable, causing widespread suffering! Given the current state of the Myriad Immortal Alliance, dare you guarantee that this matter will not be leaked?" Ji Hongdao was speechless.

Sun Luyuan continued, "With the attitude of the Legacy Transmitters who only have reverence for the Heavenly Venerates..."

"Even the bones of a half-immortal would likely be treated without reverence. In the Immortal Alliance, the outcome would be either research or being displayed in the Museum of Divine Treasures for public viewing."

"Moreover, Grand Master Tiandu is a legendary half-immortal; it's uncertain whether he has truly perished. If we profane his remains today, we might face his retribution in the future." Sun Luyuan finished, his face filled with sincerity.

Ji Hongdao said with some helplessness, "Then what do you propose we do?"

"Leave them undisturbed," Sun Luyuan stated firmly.

"Brother Ji, think about it. Even if they are the bones of a half-immortal, what benefit do they offer us? With the new cultivation methods, even longevity is nearly unattainable, let alone becoming an immortal."

"Taking them might invite immense future calamity without any tangible benefits. Why bother?"

...

In the end, Ji Hongdao was persuaded.

The fundamental reason was that these were merely two bones.

And they were the bones of a half-immortal who had not yet ascended.

Sun Luyuan was right; they were of little use to cultivators at their Dao Integration stage.

Of course, if they were the remains of true immortals, the choice would have been different.

"Although we will not take them for now, we cannot let others take them. Brother Ji, your mastery of array formations is unparalleled; why not use them to completely seal off this ruin? Combined with the original defensive formations here, we can ensure absolute security," Sun Luyuan suggested again.

This was a way of showing his stance.

Sun Luyuan knew next to nothing about array formations. As long as Ji Hongdao set up an array here, he wouldn't be able to come back alone to steal the remains.

Ji Hongdao did not refuse and immediately began setting up the array.

As the ruins were sealed once more, on their way back, Sun Luyuan said with a sigh, "If either of us manages to attain longevity, we can then bring these remains out for research. Perhaps it will lead to further advancements."

Ji Hongdao smiled bitterly and shook his head, not taking it to heart.

If before their Dao Integration stage, in their youth, they had harbored ambitions and the ideal of attaining longevity, then now, at the Dao Integration realm, they had long since given up any hope of it.

Each of the four steps of Dao Integration was as difficult as scaling a mountain.

The more they understood, the more despair they felt.

The two fell into silence.

After a long while, Sun Luyuan sighed, "I truly wonder what kind of astonishing talent it takes to succeed in defying the natural order."

"In our Myriad Immortal Alliance for so many years, apart from the Heavenly Venerates, there has only been one such person, and they are now missing."

"If there were another, the situation of our Immortal Alliance would be vastly different."

"Why do you think the Five Elders Council has five Longevity cultivators? Are their talents truly superior to ours in the Myriad Immortal Alliance, allowing them to achieve what we cannot?"

This was also a question that countless cultivators in the Myriad Immortal Alliance could not reconcile.

Hearing Sun Luyuan's lament, as if recalling something, Ji Hongdao hesitated to speak.

"Can't we brothers say anything to each other?" Sun Luyuan teased.

"Actually..."

Ji Hongdao hesitated before transmitting his voice, "I only heard it by chance, and I don't know if it's true. Brother Sun, you can just take it as a joke. However, it's best not to spread this matter."

After making his disclaimer, he spoke with a hint of solemnity, "Actually, two of the five Heavenly Venerates of the Five Elders Council were originally members of our Myriad Immortal Alliance."

"But for some reason..." Ji Hongdao shrugged.

Sun Luyuan, hearing this rumor for the first time, was instantly shocked beyond measure.

He was about to ask further when he saw the other party make a gesture.

He wisely dropped the subject. After all, the matter was too unbelievable.

Lost in thought, the two of them had already quietly returned to the Sun family.

"This trip was in vain, and the problem of your brother possessing that mirror was not resolved. What do you plan to do?" Ji Hongdao asked.

"We'll take it one step at a time," Sun Luyuan said with some helplessness.

"However, as Brother Ji mentioned, the formation in that ruin is quite old. This indicates that my previous guess was likely wrong. After the calamity in the Boundless Mirror erupted, it might subside for a long time. At the very least, it seems my brother is safe for the time being."

Ji Hongdao nodded upon hearing this, "I still have official duties to attend to, so I'll be going now. If anything comes up, contact me anytime."

"Thank you, Brother Ji!" Sun Luyuan said gratefully.

"Hey, don't be so polite." Ji Hongdao waved his hand.

After a few more pleasantries, he turned into a streak of light and departed.

The expression on Sun Luyuan's face gradually calmed.

In fact, besides the reasons he had previously given, he also had his own plans for preventing Ji Hongdao from reporting the discovery of the Grand Master's remains.

"If the news of the Grand Master's remains being discovered by the Immortal Alliance really can trigger a large-scale war between the two sides..."

A dangerous glint flashed in Sun Luyuan's eyes.

"Perhaps this is an opportunity."

"In the deduction of the Boundless Mirror, that Holy Dynasty of Da Qi could still fight the Myriad Immortal Alliance on even terms when it was at its peak. If it were to encounter one that had just finished a war and suffered heavy losses..."

Sun Luyuan would never have imagined that he had actually thought of the same thing as someone else.

After his initial shock subsided, this strategy surfaced in Li Fan's mind.

However, after careful consideration, he still abandoned the idea of using the Grand Master's remains as a pawn.

Drawing this half-immortal into the game was simply too risky.

To achieve the same effect, Li Fan had many other substitutes at his disposal.

For example, the matter of Dong Ji being refined into a puppet.

For example, fabricating the rumor that the Myriad Immortal Alliance was hiding another Reincarnation Heavenly Venerate on the verge of enlightenment.

As long as Li Fan wished, he could instigate a war in the Xuanhuang Realm at any time.

However...

Recalling the rumor Ji Hongdao had mentioned on the Crossing Dust Boat just now, Li Fan frowned slightly.

"Two of the five Heavenly Venerates of the Five Elders Council were originally members of the Myriad Immortal Alliance?"

"And they stood on the opposite side of the Immortal Alliance..."

"Could it be because of Dong Ji's matter, a sense of shared misfortune?"

"Or perhaps because they knew that Dharma Transmission was dismembering and dividing the Xuanhuang Realm?"

The Myriad Immortal Alliance would naturally try its best to conceal such matters.

Apart from those who had personally experienced it back then, finding any written records would likely be extremely difficult. After all, Li Fan, having experienced so many reincarnations, knew nothing of this.

However, it was fortunate that once he knew, it would be much easier to inquire about it.

While Li Fan was contemplating, Sun Luyuan's conversation with Sun Luyao had already concluded.

"Brother, is this method really effective?"

"Brother, don't worry, it's highly likely. This also suddenly appeared in my mind after I saw the Grand Master of Tiandu. I suppose the Boundless Mirror has some connection with the Grand Master." Sun Luyao said with certainty.

"Alright, I'll think of a way. However, I've never heard of these You Clan people before. I assume they are also a top secret of the Immortal Alliance. It won't be easy to get them." Sun Luyuan frowned deeply.

"Don't worry, Brother. I should be able to hold on for a while longer." Sun Luyao comforted him with a smile.

Sun Luyuan sighed faintly and left the secret chamber directly.

That's right, the method Li Fan provided to resolve the erasure calamity of the Boundless Mirror was inspired by his previous conjecture.

Divert the disaster!

Use an immortal artifact, or something close to an immortal artifact, to lure away the calamity hidden within the Boundless Mirror.

Li Fan guessed that the erasure calamity, having transferred from Grand Master Tiandu to the Boundless Mirror, might indicate that it was particularly sensitive to beings at the [Immortal] level. Perhaps it would proactively attack upon sensing its aura. At that time, most of its power could be transferred out.

Li Fan naturally would not use a true half-immortal artifact as bait, but he could create some items that possessed an immortal aura. This would rely on the essence of condensed origin power provided by the You Clan.

"With the golden origin power essence and the assistance of the [Boundless Primordial Square], a barely immortal-level formation, it should be possible to create a half-immortal artifact."

"Even if it's just a hollow representation, it should be enough."

"It doesn't matter if it fails, it can be considered a test."

Besides the branch captured by the Holy Dynasty of Da Qi, the Myriad Immortal Alliance still controlled a large number of You Clan people. As long as they found a way, with the Sun family's status and connections, they should be able to obtain some.

However, what truly worried Li Fan now was the situation within the headquarters of the Myriad Immortal Alliance.

Ever since receiving the message from Dharma Transmission that sixteen Dao Integration cultivators were to go out of Xuanhuang, the Immortal Alliance headquarters had been in a state of lockdown, as if brewing something.

"With the Myriad Immortal Alliance's foundation, it's easy to force the cultivation of sixteen Dao Integration cultivators. There's no need to be sealed for so long."

"The only thing I can think of that is worthy of such caution and fear of leakage is..."

"The method to escape the Immortal Ruins and leave the Xuanhuang Realm!"

A sharp light flashed in Li Fan's eyes. The reason why the various forces in the Xuanhuang Realm were currently lying low was largely due to the existence of the Immortal Ruins. There was no way to escape. If they knew of a safe way to leave the Xuanhuang Realm, without knowing about the existence of the high wall, many of them would certainly do so. It would be exactly like what happened in the Xuanhuang Realm thousands of years ago. Every man for himself when disaster strikes!

"Even the Myriad Immortal Alliance itself has to consider whether someone within the alliance will seize the opportunity to escape."

"After all, they cannot possibly make the existence of the high wall public. Otherwise, chaos would erupt throughout the world."

Thinking this, Li Fan once again urged the Boundless Mirror to probe the Heavenly Profound Mirror.

He had initially expected, as before, to gain nothing. Unexpectedly, this time, he actually found some clues.

"Empty Bright Flowing Crystals, purchase them quickly. Do not do it overtly, use clandestine methods. Once obtained, destroy them."

"Empty Bright Flowing Crystals."

...

Three or four such messages, transmitted through the Heavenly Profound Mirror, spread from the headquarters of the Immortal Alliance.

"Empty Bright Flowing Crystals?"

Instantly, information related to them surfaced in Li Fan's mind.

Empty Bright Flowing Crystals were a silk-like solid crystal. They could float in the air, moving like flowing water, and emitted a dreamy, multi-colored radiance. They were often mixed in by female cultivators of the Xuanhuang Realm when forging spiritual artifacts, causing the artifacts to release dazzling and colorful light whether in their normal state or when activated.

But… apart from looking pretty, they seemed to have no other use. Thus, although their production wasn't high, their price remained at a moderate eight thousand contribution points per piece.
