The seven-colored brilliant light that faintly emanated from him evoked a sense of greed in Sun Lu Yuan, similar to what he felt when facing the Essence of Heaven and Earth.

Despite being so confident about this trip, Sun Lu Yuan's state of mind was already somewhat chaotic. After flying aimlessly in the void for a while, a magnificent scene, as if hidden beneath the surface of water, suddenly appeared ahead.

A giant ball of light, its details indiscernible within.

Numerous stars revolved around the ball of light, shining brilliantly.

Each star seemed to be a grotto-heaven world.

Even from a great distance, Sun Lu Yuan was shocked by the sight before him.

"This is the Da Qi minor world?"

"How can there be such a large minor world?!"

As Sun Lu Yuan was immensely shocked, he suddenly came to his senses.

The young man who had been leading the way had disappeared at some unknown time!

"Senior Bai Hua, I've captured a Dao Integration cultivator from the Myriad Immortal Alliance. He was acting suspiciously, clearly with ill intentions..."

He vaguely heard the young man's voice coming from somewhere.

"Wait!"

Sun Lu Yuan sensed something was amiss and was about to shout an explanation.

In the next instant, the scene before him changed abruptly.

The magnificent world and grotto-heavens from before vanished, and what suddenly appeared was a resplendent palace that resembled a spire.

His body had been shrunk dozens of times, like an ant.

Each step in front of the palace was like a mountain peak.

The immense grandeur filled his vision, causing Sun Lu Yuan to momentarily hold his breath.

What was even more incomprehensible to him was that all his cultivation had disappeared for some reason.

He was like a complete mortal.

"An illusion?"

Sun Lu Yuan held his breath, attempting to clear all distracting thoughts from his mind.

After a long while, his emotions calmed, and he opened his eyes again.

However, the scene before him was still the majestic palace, unchanged in the slightest.

Even...

Sun Lu Yuan discovered with horror that his body seemed to have shrunk even further.

"This is... a formation?"

The thought surfaced in Sun Lu Yuan's mind, and he quickly took out Ji Hongdao's formation-breaking disc again.

As expected, the formation-breaking disc emitted a strong white light.

It flashed incessantly, spontaneously deducing and breaking the formation before him.

Just as Sun Lu Yuan was waiting with anticipation, the formation-breaking disc flashed faster and faster.

Eventually, it seemed unable to bear it and reached its limit, with cracks appearing on its surface.

Then, it exploded with a bang, leaving no trace.

Sun Lu Yuan was somewhat stunned.

When he borrowed this formation-breaking disc, Ji Hongdao had not mentioned that something like this would happen.

However, Sun Lu Yuan quickly reacted. The formation was too complex, far exceeding the scope that the formation-breaking disc could handle.

"Since that is the case, I can only try to break the formation by brute force."

After waiting for a while longer, no other anomalies occurred within the formation except for him.

Sun Lu Yuan took a deep breath, and a dark red phantom floated out from above his head.

The strongest technique of a Dao Integration cultivator originated from the Essence of Heaven and Earth they refined.

The Essence of Heaven and Earth that Sun Lu Yuan had refined was named [Blood Shadow].

The moment the Blood Shadow appeared, Sun Lu Yuan's body seemed to melt into it, bizarrely dissolving until only a layer of skin remained.

Then, it completely merged into the blood-red color.

Like gurgling water, it surged against the direction of the steps, rapidly flowing upwards along the tall steps within the formation.

Where the blood flowed, the ground was corroded, emitting a hissing sound and leaving behind a scorched mark.

But soon, the steps of the palace were restored.

The speed of the blood water flowing increased, gradually transforming into a streak of crimson light. No longer needing to climb along the steps, it shot straight towards the highest point of the palace.

However, the palace itself underwent corresponding changes.

The steps inexplicably increased, extending outwards in both directions endlessly.

As the two were locked in a stalemate, the rapidly advancing crimson shadow suddenly exploded.

It transformed into a sky full of blood rain, using the dispersed force of the explosion to abandon its persistent climb and instead escape in different directions of this space.

Each drop of blood water was like intensely hot lava, capable of burning even space.

Wherever it scattered, holes appeared in the formation space.

The majestic palace scene trembled slightly.

The phantom gradually shattered, and the blood water, which Sun Lu Yuan had transformed into, slowly disappeared along these openings.

"I escaped!"

Sun Lu Yuan rejoiced inwardly.

His heart filled with killing intent, and he was about to find the wicked youth who had led him to settle the score, but the voice that reached his ears plunged him into an icy abyss.

"It was actually broken?"

"Now my master will punish me. I worked hard studying for over half a year, and I couldn't even trap a mere Dao Integration cultivator..."

The wicked youth's extremely vexed tone did not seem feigned.

"What do you mean? That terrifying formation just now, was it set up by that youth? Not the protective formation of this Sheng Chao Da Qi?"

Sun Lu Yuan highly suspected he had misheard.

"Studying for over half a year, what does that mean? Could it be that he's still a beginner? A formation that even the formation-breaking disc couldn't find a flaw in at its limit, is the result of his half-year of effort?"

Sun Lu Yuan was somewhat dumbfounded.

"Your formation is actually quite good. It's just that your strength is too low. With his Blood Fire fully unleashed, I estimate that even a Dao Integration cultivator from the Xuanhuang Realm couldn't resist it head-on. It's only natural that your formation couldn't withstand it."

"You should focus on cultivation. In the Xuanhuang Realm, realm is everything. Exotic beasts, special abilities, and formations are all just auxiliary."

A gentle female voice sounded beside the youth.

"Understood, Senior Bai Hua," the youth replied somewhat dejectedly.

Amidst the golden light, Sun Lu Yuan sensed he was being locked onto by a gaze.

And the aura emanating from the other party plunged Sun Lu Yuan into an icy abyss.

"This is..."

"A Longevity Mirror cultivator?"

Sun Lu Yuan's mind went blank.

He had never imagined that upon arriving at Sheng Chao Da Qi, he would immediately encounter a Longevity Heavenly Venerate.

"Bai Hua? What principle is this 'inverse' referring to? Why have I never heard of it?"

"Are you from the Myriad Immortal Alliance? What is your purpose in coming to our Sheng Chao?" Daoist Bai Hua asked calmly.

Invisible golden light had already enveloped Sun Lu Yuan.

With just a thought from her, she could turn this Myriad Immortal Alliance Dao Integration cultivator into glaze, crushing him with ease.

After all, all that primal energy essence was not obtained for free.

Facing Bai Hua’s questioning, Sun Lu Yuan was unable to reply.

Dark golden glass light surrounded him on both sides. The power surpassing Dao Integration made Sun Lu Yuan’s spiritual senses frantically warn him, yet he dared not make the slightest move.

"Junior, junior..."

Facing Bai Hua’s killing intent, the usually eloquent Sun Lu Yuan couldn’t even utter a complete sentence.

To cultivators of the Myriad Immortal Alliance, the realm of Longevity was simply too distant.

"Hmph, just as Little Tian said. Sneaky and obviously up to no good," a cold glint flashed in Daoist Bai Hua’s eyes.

The dark golden light that enveloped Sun Lu Yuan seemed to possess sentience and began to erode him.

"Don't worry, with my strength, even if this Da Qi is a dragon’s den, I can still retreat completely."

For some reason, Sun Lu Yuan suddenly recalled the boastful promise he had made to his younger brother before coming.

He couldn't help but feel an immense sense of absurdity.

"Could it be that I am going to die here?"

Just as Sun Lu Yuan was filled with despair and was waiting to die, a voice, like heavenly music, halted Daoist Bai Hua’s actions.

"Bring him to me."

Though the tone was calm, it contained infinite majesty.

The wicked-looking youth’s expression changed drastically upon hearing the voice. The amusement on his face vanished instantly, and he bowed respectfully from afar.

Daoist Bai Hua also reacted to the voice.

The glass light, which had been full of hostility, transformed into several ropes, firmly binding Sun Lu Yuan.

Following the two, Sun Lu Yuan was brought into the tallest spire palace within Da Qi’s small world.

Inside the great hall, it was spacious and solemn.

A figure sat upon the throne.

Mysterious light enveloped them, making it difficult for Sun Lu Yuan to discern their face.

"Kneel!"

The wicked-looking youth said coldly.

Sun Lu Yuan, a Dao Integration cultivator, held a significant position in the Law Enforcement Hall. Apart from beings like the Transmitters or Mirror Masters, he was already at the pinnacle of power in the Immortal Alliance.

But before the ruler of this small world, he did not hesitate in the slightest and knelt down decisively.

Even a Longevity realm cultivator could be commanded, so what was he, a mere Dao Integration cultivator?

"Greetings... Your Majesty the Sacred Emperor."

Prompted by the wicked-looking youth, Sun Lu Yuan said tremblingly.

"Sun Lu Yuan." The Sacred Emperor spoke his name with a single sentence.

Then, with a few brief words, he laid bare Sun Lu Yuan’s general background, causing Sun Lu Yuan to go cold all over and tremble.

However, the Sacred Emperor's next words dispelled the chill in his heart, filling him with immense joy: "I already know your intentions. The Sacred Dynasty does not oppose those in the Myriad Immortal Alliance who wish to surrender."

"It is always good to be able to reduce bloodshed."

The Sacred Emperor's voice, filled with immense authority, echoed throughout the palace.

"As the first person to pledge allegiance to the Sacred Dynasty, you certainly deserve some reward."

A cold, clear light appeared beside the Sacred Emperor and instantly flew towards Sun Lu Yuan, stopping steadily before him.

"Hiss..."

An intense coldness assaulted him, causing frost to form on Sun Lu Yuan's face.

He circulated his spiritual power rapidly, finally dispelling the icy aura.

Sun Lu Yuan looked closely and saw that it was a pale blue sword floating before him.

"This is the 'Ten Thousand Years Ice Seal Sword'. When the cold energy within is unleashed, it can instantly freeze an entire continent. Although you have the realm, your combat power is too weak. You might be able to escape, but if you were to truly fight someone to the death, you probably couldn't even defeat a few of my disciples," the Sacred Emperor commented.

Sun Lu Yuan dared not retort, only nodding in agreement.

"I shall give you this sword for self-defense." Only when the Sacred Emperor said this, and under the wicked-looking youth's displeased gaze, did Sun Lu Yuan, as if in a dream, refine and收 [shōu - accept/take in] the Ten Thousand Years Ice Seal Sword.

"Thank you for your grace, Sacred Emperor." Sun Lu Yuan was overjoyed.

"Since you have joined our Sacred Dynasty, you must not be two-hearted from now on. Tian'er, I entrust him to you."

The wicked-looking youth bowed his head. "This disciple understands."

"You may both go." The Sacred Emperor faintly issued the order to leave.

Bai Hua was the first to transform into a beam of light and fly away.

Sun Lu Yuan followed behind Ou Shang Tian, walking away slowly.

"You, come with me." Ou Shang Tian sized up Sun Lu Yuan and snorted coldly.

"How should I address you?" Having received benefits, Sun Lu Yuan didn't care about the other’s attitude and asked with a fawning smile.

"You may call me General Ou."

Ou Shang Tian didn't say much. He first took Sun Lu Yuan to the Sacred Capital City, to the [Sacred Heart Hall].

Slightly lower than the Sacred Emperor's throne, the hall was crowded with tens of thousands of people.

Old and young, all had devout expressions and prayed to a statue in the center of the hall.

The statue's features were unclear, but its form was identical to the Sacred Emperor Sun Lu Yuan had just seen.

The citizens of the Sacred Dynasty praying here all possessed cultivation.

However, even with Sun Lu Yuan’s Dao Integration aura, which he hadn’t yet bothered to deliberately conceal, it had no effect on these people.

They all gazed resolutely at the Sacred Emperor’s statue, completely absorbed.

Their minds seemed connected into a vast net, and mere Dao Integration might could not shake it in the slightest.

Ou Shang Tian led Sun Lu Yuan, proceeding into a secret chamber within the Sacred Heart Hall.

In the room, dozens of the Sacred Emperor’s followers were kneeling.

They all had achieved Golden Core realm cultivation, and compared to those outside, their faith in the Sacred Emperor was even more fervent.

In the secret chamber, the faceless statue of the Sacred Emperor still stood.

"You should also take an oath and pray." After transmitting a vow, Ou Shang Tian instructed.

Sun Lu Yuan naturally would not refuse.

He also knelt before the Sacred Emperor’s statue, imitating the other believers, and chanted the words in his mouth.

As Sun Lu Yuan did this, it was as if the Sacred Emperor’s majestic and divine form truly appeared before his eyes.

What further startled him was that an invisible force was born from the void, slowly attaching itself to him, connecting him to the Sacred Emperor.

Sun Lu Yuan felt as if he were an insect that had inadvertently fallen into a spider's web; though he wasn’t struggling, he was sinking deeper and deeper.

"What kind of technique is this?"

Sun Lu Yuan was horrified. Even the Mirror Masters needed secret methods to control their subordinates.

To achieve such a deep level of control with just a few simple words was unheard of.

But Sun Lu Yuan knew he could no longer turn back.

Once the oath was read, Ou Shang Tian’s attitude immediately improved considerably.

He tilted his head slightly, as if listening to something.

Then he said to Sun Lu Yuan, "You have a restriction left by the Myriad Immortal Alliance within your body. If you try to remove it, it might alert them. So, it will remain for now."

"But rest assured, with your master's power protecting you, this restriction cannot harm you."

Ou Shang Tian's words reassured Sun Lu Yuan considerably.

"Since you have joined our Sacred Dynasty, you cannot just take benefits without doing anything. Here is a list..."

Sun Lu Yuan took the list and was greatly shocked.

Besides the exceptionally talented disciples of the major families within the Myriad Immortal Alliance, there were also many cultivators holding positions in key areas of the Myriad Immortal Alliance.

Some were not unfamiliar to Sun Lu Yuan, but some held nominal positions in secret, and even he was not entirely clear about them.

"As for the people on this list, you should try to defect as many as possible."

"You don't need to strain yourself too much. Just find an excuse to trick them..."

"Just bring them over. Once they see the magnificent grandeur of our Sacred Dynasty, they will surely realize their mistake and return to the right path, just like you did!"

"Don't rush. Take your time and proceed gradually to avoid revealing any flaws," Ou Shang Tian said.

"Every successful defection will count as your merit. Our Sacred Dynasty's treasury is full of good things. Your Ice Sealed Ten Thousand Years Sword is not considered top-tier."

Ou Shang Tian's words made Sun Lu Yuan's heart flutter.

Within the Celestial Profound Mirror, although it was said that anything could be exchanged, everyone knew that truly valuable treasures could not be obtained with contribution points.

Either the requirement for contribution level was extremely high, or there were various strict conditions for exchange.

A divine sword like the one in his hand, capable of endangering an entire region, would only be held by core members of institutions like the Martial Arts Hall or the Garrison Office within the Myriad Immortal Alliance.

"Work hard," Ou Shang Tian said, patting Sun Lu Yuan's shoulder with an air of seniority.

"You must not let me lose face in front of my master," he added meaningfully.

Sun Lu Yuan nodded repeatedly.

He could not linger in the Sacred Dynasty for long and was soon dismissed.

Upon returning to the Profound Desolation Realm, Sun Lu Yuan felt as though he had experienced a bizarre dream.

Only the extremely cold sword within his dantian served as a reminder that this was not an illusion.

"Brother, you're back so soon? How did it go?"

In the Sun family's secret chamber, his younger brother, Sun Lu Yao, asked impatiently.

Sun Lu Yuan did not recount his humiliating experience. Instead, he simply took out the Ice Sealed Ten Thousand Years Sword.

"The foundation of that Great Qi Sacred Dynasty is even more powerful than we imagined. They even have cultivators of Longevity Realm stationed there. And the cultivation of their Sacred Emperor is unfathomable; I couldn't see through it at all."

"They just gave away such a treasure, just like that."

"Compared to them, the Myriad Immortal Alliance is really nothing."

...

As Sun Lu Yao listened to his brother's words, the voice of the senior from the phantom image echoed in his mind.

"How did I tell you? Heh heh."

"Brother, no matter what decision you make, I will always support you," Sun Lu Yao said, his expression complex as he declared his stance.

Sun Lu Yuan, however, mistook his brother's words as concern for an uncertain future and offered further comfort.

After Sun Lu Yuan left the secret chamber, Sun Lu Yao could no longer contain himself and asked, "Senior, how much do you know about this Great Qi Sacred Dynasty?"

This mysterious phantom image had accurately predicted Sun Lu Yuan's pilgrimage to the Sacred Dynasty, so it was clear that he absolutely understood the reality of the Sacred Dynasty.

Li Fan's spiritual clone feigned thoughtfulness and pondered for a moment.

Then, he said with a solemn tone, "Your family's decision is a wise one. That Great Qi Sacred Emperor's strength is no less than mine."

"Without the transmission of techniques within the Profound Desolation Realm, he is an invincible being."

The implication of these words made Sun Lu Yao's heart pound.

Even though he had already speculated about the strength of the mysterious phantom image, it was still incredibly shocking to hear it confirmed by him directly.

"Do you know that the Heavenly Dao of the Profound Desolation Realm, like cultivators, has its own desires?"

"This Sacred Emperor might very well be the embodiment of the Profound Desolation Realm's good intentions, aiming to correct the world that has been distorted by the alteration of the transmitted techniques."

Hearing this, Sun Lu Yao was once again shaken. The embodiment of the Profound Desolation Realm's Heavenly Dao?

Such an origin was truly astonishing.

His thoughts descended into a brief chaos. After a while, as if remembering something, Sun Lu Yao asked again, "The embodiment of good intentions? Do you mean that the Profound Desolation Realm also has an embodiment of evil intentions?"

Li Fan's spiritual clone remained silent, offering no reply.

...

At the far end of the starry sea.

Deep within the vast sea of ruins, aboard the Profound Merchant Boat.

Relying on the Spirit Harmony Convergence Technique, Zhao Xian's cultivation speed surged at an astonishing rate, breaking through the constraints of the Foundation Establishment stage.

He had successfully condensed his Golden Core.

The commotion caused by his breakthrough to the Golden Core stage finally disturbed Zhao Xian's master, Zhao Wuji.

Upon discovering Zhao Xian's terrifyingly rapid progress, Zhao Wuji was not pleased but instead alarmed.

"Master, why?" Zhao Xian asked indignantly.

Zhao Wuji had not reported Zhao Xian's successful breakthrough to the academy. He had even actively suppressed and concealed it.

This naturally displeased Zhao Xian, and in a moment of impulsiveness, he almost revealed everything he had seen in his dreams.

However, having experienced many things in his dreams, he knew that his master was trustworthy.

Taking a deep breath, he suppressed his anger and asked in a low voice, "Too fast, Xian'er. You are cultivating far too quickly. If it were just the late stage of Foundation Establishment, it would be fine, but to directly jump to the Golden Core stage..." Zhao Wuji's face was full of distress.

Under Zhao Xian's repeated questioning, Zhao Wuji finally revealed the truth.

"There have been true prodigies like you in our academy before, though very few. In my day, I had a senior sister."

"She was also incredibly gifted. She cultivated even faster than you, without any process of accumulation. In just three years, she went from Qi Refining straight to the perfected Golden Core stage."

"Naturally, this caused a sensation in the academy, and then..."

Upon hearing this, Zhao Xian's expression also became serious.

He had never heard of such a person existing in the academy before.

"My senior sister was conscripted. Since then, there has been no news of her, and her life or death is unknown," Zhao Wuji sighed.

"Conscripted? Conscripted where?" Zhao Xian was slightly taken aback.

The Immortal Boat had not seen any real battles for a long time.

He could not comprehend the term "conscripted" that his master used.

Zhao Wuji hesitated to speak.

Finally, under Zhao Xian's probing gaze, he first set up a restriction to seal the area.

Then, he transmitted his voice, saying, "Xian'er, do you know why our Proving Dao Academy holds such a supreme position? Even the Immortal Pivot Court dares not offend us excessively?"

Zhao Xian replied according to what he had learned previously, "Naturally, it is because our Proving Dao Academy is the source of the Immortal Boat's Daoist principles."

"Then, why is the academy called the source of Daoist principles?"

This question from Zhao Wuji stumped Zhao Xian.

"Because our academy provides the most crucial theoretical support for the survival of the Immortal Boat after the great calamity," Zhao Wuji said sternly.

"The power of the true immortals that caused the boundless catastrophe in the past is something that ordinary cultivators cannot comprehend without absolute talent. Our academy..."

"Possesses scholars with the most outstanding talent in the entire Immortal Boat."

"Talent is a very important resource on the Immortal Boat. Regardless of whether these geniuses are willing or not, as soon as they show it, they will be firmly controlled."

"They might even be stripped of it, no longer belonging to themselves."

Zhao Wuji's words sent a chill down Zhao Xian's spine.
